choices: Jack Dale Jr - The 20 something Super-Nerd
Samantha Peters - The Single 55 year old divorcee.
Erica Shaffer - The Fiery Red-Headed Rising Star.
1.content:
Welcome!

Let's get started!

Choose Your Character!

1. Jack Dale Jr. - Jack, is your average 20-something, living with his parents, while taking a year off from college. His parents, Amanda Dale and Jack Dale Sr, who are in their mid to late 50's, are more than happy to have their only child staying with them for a while. Jack is a bit of a super nerd, slightly overweight, obsessed with comic books, movies, video games, the works.

2. Samantha Peters - Single & approaching 55, Samantha is the almost stereotypical definition of "old maid". While her looks may be fading, and her blonde hair turning white, she still has a positive attitude. While Samantha, never wanted children, in fact, secretly despising them, she went through a loveless marriage to man named Thomas, who always wanted a large family, but left her when she refused to have one. She's always regretted her decision.

3. Erica Shaffer - The up-and-coming actress whose making quite the name for herself. Young, in her twenties, with looks that could kill, this fiery red-head is going to be a huge star. She comes from a single parent household, but has stopped in town to visit her parent, and reconnect with old friends from High School .

4. Sister Mary Ruth - An Older Nun

5. More Choices! More Characters!
1.title: Choose Your Character!

choices: He looks at his father, in the driver's seat.
He looks at his mother, in the passenger seat.
He catches sight of himself in the window.
He sees someone else out of the window of the car.
11.content:
Argh! This so boring! Jack though to himself, walking up and down the tables of the indoor Flea Market.
I know Mom and Dad wanted to spend more time with me, since I took this year off from College. But I was hoping we could do something more... not sucky he thinks to himself, digging through the various boxes and tables of various knickknacks, oddities and used items that litter the dozens if not hundreds of tables in the Flea Market.

At least, I had hoped that would have something that interested me. Old video games, comic books, toys, ANYTHING, I mean, what am I going to do with a old stained tea cozy? He thinks to himself picking up a stained tea cozy that a nice old lady was selling for a mere five cents on the table in front of him.

He put it back, and then quietly walked away from the table, and off into the massive Flea Market his parents has suggested they come to. Jack Dale Jr, 24 years old, often wondered how different his life would be if he had any brothers or sisters. While, he did enjoy being an only child at times, (he was spoiled nearly rotten as a kid), he often worried about his parents getting older without someone to care of, or to take care of them, reversely.

They're lonely he though to himself.

His father Jack Dale Sr, and his mother Amanda Dale, were hard workers. His father was a high-level manager at his company, while his mother worked at one of the biggest banks in the nation. Of course, they didn't start like that, working their way up from the bottom. They always wanted a large family, but their plans of providing Dale with brothers and sister came to a grounding halt as their jobs gave them more and more responsibilities, and eventually, it just never happened.

"Best laid plans of Mice and Men" they always say. Still, Jack did feel a little sorry for their loneliness. as he continued to walk through the flee market.
Eventually, a bizarre table caught his attention out of the corner of his eye, covered with burning candles, skulls, and black velvet.

LAVERN'S LAIR OF THE OCCULT was sprawled on the table, while heavy-metal music blasted through the speakers attached to an MP3 player. A 20-something dressed in all black, covered in make-up and mascara, his face full of piercings, looks at you, while banging his head to the heavy-metal coming form the speakers.

"Welcome! Seeker Of The Dark and Unknown! Welcome To Laverns' Lair Of The Occult!" he says. Jack tried his best not to roll his eyes.

He never tried to be cruel and condescending to anyone, a high-school career of being picked on and bullied will see to that, but he sometimes couldn't help but wonder what some people were thinking.

I mean, I'm sure the "Goth" thing makes him happy, but man.. Seriously? Jack thinks to himself.

"Are you interested in any of my authentically cursed, haunted, or otherwise evil items acquired from the deepest darkest regions of the world?" Lavern says.

"From the deepest, darkest regions of the world huh?" Jack says.

"Well, deepest, darkest regions of the internet, where I bought most of them." Lavern says, his get-up clearly failing him right now.

Monkey paws, spell-books, hearts in jars, strange looking dolls, and other horror movie cliche looking items are strewn haphazardly across the table.

Half of these things look like there were stolen out of the prop warehouse of some D-Level Horror Movie Studio Jack thinks to himself.

"Is any of this stuff real?" Jack asks.

"Probably not. I just buy this stuff off of people desperate to get rid of it for some reason or another. Then I turn it around and sell it at places like these all across the nation for a nice profit." Lavern says.

"So all this is a get-up to sell second hand junk?" Jack asks Lavern.

"Pretty much. Now see anything you like? I'll give you a good deal. I don't really want to pack most of this stuff back up." Lavern informs, completely dropping the "Gothic Metal-Head" angel.

Jack keeps searching, and then a gleam of silver catches his attention out of the corner of his eye. Following it, he lays his eyes upon a coin, approximately the size of a quarter sitting on the table. Full of scratches, the strange coin appears to have the image of a pregnant woman, and a...

Is that a pregnant man on this coin? Can't be. Impossible He thinks to himself, studying the coin some more.

What appears to be a pregnant man and a pregnant woman are on the head of the coin, a happy look on their face, while on the tail end of the coin, are the same pregnant man and pregnant woman, a look of panic and fear on their face.

This is the strangest thing I've ever seen. I don't think they make coins like this.. anywhere Jack thinks to himself.

Suddenly, a new thought races through his head, alien to his own thoughts.

Buy Me Jack.

"How much for this coin?" Jack asks, without even thinking about it.

"Wow, I don't remember getting that. Huh. What a strange coin. Uh, I don't know. A Dollar?" Lavern says looking at the coin.

Pay For It Jack. The alien thought races through his head again.

"I'll take it!" Jack says, taking a dollar out of his pocket and slamming it on the table.

He walks away from Lavern and his strange table, lost in thought, staring at this strange coin.

"Jack! Over here kiddo!" Jack is snapped back to reality by the voice of his father, waving to him across the flea market. His father, Jack Dale Sr, while pushing 52,s in fantastic shape for someone who sits at a desk all day and does business stuff. He must workout Jack thinks, but he can't really imagine him lifting dumbbells while working on big deals.

Jack rejoins his father, still looking at the strange coin he holds in his hand.
"What do you got there sweetie?" Jack knows that voice. The sweet soothing voice of his mother, Amanda. Amanda, nearly 55, brushes a long strand of her slowly greying dark hair aside, with one hand, holding onto to some kind of lamp with another.

"I got this coin from one of the tables. Weird isn't it?" Jack says, showing the coin to his parents.
"Wow, never seen a coin like that before son. Might be worth money. Better hang on it" his father says, scratching at his salt-and-pepper beard.

"So ready to go?" His mother says sweetly, holding the lamp.
"Yeah. You guys want to go out and eat?" Jack says.
"That's a great idea! How about our favorite diner!" His father says.

So, the family Dale head off out of the Flea Market and to the little four-door sedan that was Jack Dale Sr's car. His mother puts the lamp into the trunk, and gets into the passenger seat, while his father get's in the driver's seat.

No one ever drives Dad's car except for him you say with a smile, getting in the back seat.

The car engine roars to life, and heads off towards the Dale families favorite restaurant, and John continues to study the strange coin he just purchased. He runs his fingers all along the surface, feeling some kind of strange connection with the coin, like there was part of him now that never wanted the coin to leave his side.

Flip Me Join. Heads Or Tails. the alien thought races through his head again.

Without thinking, he places the coin on his thumb, and flicks it into the air, catching it in his now closed fist.

Look at someone Jack. Look the thought races through his head.

His eyes fall upon...
11.title: Jack Dale Jr - The 20 something Super-Nerd

choices: Heads: Reality Change For Jack's Dad!
Tails: No Reality Change For Jack's Dad!
111.content:
His eyes go from the coin, closed tightly in his hands, to his father driving the car.

His father was the best man he ever knew. He was hard-working, kind yet stern when he needed to be. Jack never wanted for anything, to a degree, and he had his father and mother to thank for that, his father moreso. Whenever his mother said no, his father always said yes.

Even now, at his age, his father couldn't help but still spoil him on occasions.

The benefits of being an only child Jack thought.

Although, looking at him know, time was beginning to catch up to his father. While he was still in fantastic shape, His short hair started to turn grey, giving him salt-and-paper, same along with his beard.

Liver spots and other old-age related blemishes started popping up on his skin, and he started getting tired easier then before. During his childhood, Jack and his father would stay up all night together, playing games, telling stories, any and everything he wanted to do. Now his father started getting tired at 8 and was in bed by 9.

Damn, he's getting old Jack thought, sadness washing over him slightly. He didn't want to think about the day when his parents weren't around anymore. When it would just be him, alone, with no one else.

Reveal It Jack the thought raced through his head. It was not his own.

Without taking his eyes of his father, driving too the restaurant, talking to his mother in the passenger seat, Jack opened his hand to reveal the coin.

It had landed on...
111.title: He looks at his father, in the driver's seat.

choices: Fast Pregnancy - Jack's father makes an important announcement to his family.
Pregnant Expansion - Jack's father belly seems to be larger and get larger!
1111.content:
Heads. The strange coin landed on heads, the smiling faces of the two pregnant figures visible to Jack.


Heads! Reality Change! the alien voice echoed through his head.

As Jack stared at his father, he could have sworn that the air around him was shimmering, like a haze. It enveloped him, and the surrounding area in the mysterious shimmer, the air in the car feeling thick, like a soup.
1111.title: Heads: Reality Change For Jack's Dad!

choices: Darkness envelops Jack. He passes out.
Panic envelops Jack. He runs out of the house looking for help.
11112.content:
The shimmering air around his father seemed to dissipate as quickly as it came, returning to it's unknown origins.
His father seemed to let out a shudder, as Jack turned his attention away from his father, back out the car window.
Everything felt different all of sudden, out of place.

Jack felt like a stranger in his own skin, everything just feeling...off.
It made him uncomfortable.

Or maybe it was the fact, that his knees were suddenly pressed into the back of the driver's seat, which was currently occupied by his father.
His father was a slim man, so him needing this much space was more that unusual.
"Hey Dad, what's with the sudden need for all the extra space all of the sudden? Could you move the seat up? You're killing my knees here!" Jack says.

"Son, you know I need every inch I can get right now. I told you not to sit behind me, but you didn't listen to me." His father says.
As the car comes to a stop at a traffic light, Jack notices his father look his head down at something and say
"I know, he's silly isn't he? I hope you'll listen to me more than he does sometimes."

His mother looks over with a smile on her face, reaching her hand over to Jack's father, and appears to give a rubbing motion on him.
"Oh he's not so bad. Don't listen to your father".

Jack is more than a little confused by his father's and mothers sudden bizarre behavior, but ignores it.
His parents have always been a little odd.

A few moments later, Jack notices that they passed the restaurant where they were going to eat.
"Ah, hey Dad. You passed the restaurant." Jack says, looking out the rear-view window.
"I know, but I have got to get home. My back is killing me, my feet are swollen like you wouldn't believe, and I have to lay down. I'm so bloody tired too."
His father looks over at his mother.
"This isn't as easy as I thought it was going to be. I'm sorry for all those comments I made years ago when you went through this" his father says.

"What goes around, comes around eh fatso?" His mother says with a devilish smile.
"I think you're doing an amazing job. It'll all be over in another six weeks." She reaches out and places her hand on what Jack thinks is his fathers leg.
"OH! That was strong one!" She says.
"I know, I felt it!" His father says.

Jack had never been more confused in his entire life. Something strange was going on, but he couldn't quite figure it out, looking at the back of his father's head.

Just don't worry about it. Jack thought.

Soon, several minutes later, Jack and his family pull into the driveway of their house. Without wasting a second, Jack undoes his seatbelt, unlocks the front door, and heads inside.

"Leave the front door open for us Jack! It takes your father so much more time ever - - -" His mother calls after him, her voice becoming inaudible after a distance.

Inside the house, Jack took off his jacket, throwing it over a chair next to the island, where the mail was scattered all over the counter.
Home Sweet Home he thinks, heading off to his room.

He moved back home for a year, taking the time off of college, although, he can't really remember why. He thought it was because his parents wanted to spend more time with their only child before he fell away from them forever, but suddenly, that strange feeling came over him, his memories suddenly becoming cloudy.

It was like someone tried to tape two tv shows at the same time on the same VHS, and only bits and pieces of both shows came through. He shrugged off the feeling, walking back to his room. Opening the door, and kicking off his shoes, he booted his video game console, getting ready for another marathon session.

This year off is great. I had next to no time to game back in school, so I've spent few months getting caught up. To think I have almost another four months to go! He thinks, digging through his game collection to find the latest game he wanted to play.

His room was the same as he left it, dozens of action figures (still in their original boxes) on his numerous shelves filled with comic books, role-playing books, and other pieces of nerdy accessories. Signed pictures of his favorite female sci-fi stars hung around his room, along with posters for some of his favorite movies. Everything was just the same, even the framed picture of a sonogram he had on his nightstand next to his fantasy book he had been reading.

Wait?! WHAT?!

His attention that something was wrong was finally brought to his attention as he looked over at the framed picture of the sonogram. The dark blob read "The best little sister ever! Can't wait to meet you! Big Brother Jack!" It was dated last month, and had the handwriting was his.

"What in the hell?" Jack asks staring at the photo. It was real, not some kind of bizarre hallucination.
He gets up off his bed, holding the photo, and leaves his room, staring at the photo.
"Hey Mom, Dad?" He shouts from upstairs, hoping to get their attention.
"What is it?" His mother asks.
"Can you guys come up here for a moment?" He asks, his eyes never leaving the picture.
"No. Come down here, you know you're father has trouble with stairs!" His mother says, soundly slightly annoyed.
"Yeah whatever." He says, carefully taking the stairs as quickly as he could.

If Jack was not so engrossed in the picture he was holding, he would have noticed that the bedroom directly right to the stairs, was no longer just a room for various uses, but was in fact, painted completely pink, filled with small stuffed animals, a crib, a changing table, diapers, and the words "Baby Veronica's Room" was engraved on a plaque on the partially ajar door, which was painted pink, covered with little wooden ducks, hammered into the door.

Jack turned into the kitchen, holding the photo. "What the hell is with this?" He asks, holding the sonogram.
"With what?" His mother asks, preparing a lunch.
"This!" He finally looks away from the photo and upon his parents.

The photo drops from his hands to the floor in a clash of glass as his eyes fall upon his parents. His mother had no visible changes what-so-ever, but his father, well, his father was a different story altogether. The sensible button up shirt his father was wearing an hour earlier had been replaced by a heavy grey zip-up hoodie, which was stretched tightly across the massive mound that was his father's gut.

His father stood in the kitchen, hands pressed into his lower back, which caused his massive gut to stick out that much farther in front of him.
The top half of his hooded sweatshirt hunged tightly to his pecs, well, what would have been his pecs, if not for the fact, that his pecs were larger and rounder, almost having the appearance of a pair of B-Sized women's breasts.

"Oh Jack. Look what you did! Go get some glass and clean that up!" His mother commands, not seemingly to notice that massive, almost pregnant looking gut suddenly attached to her husband.

It does have a pregnant look to it. 8 months pregnant Jack thought, looking at his father's very round midsection.
But that's impossible he thought.

"Jack, did you hear me? Go get a broom and clean that up!" His mother asked him.
She turned her attention to her oversized husband.
"Honey, why don't you take that hoodie off now that we're in doors and relax a little? Go lay down on the couch and I'll bring in your lunch to you." She says to her husband with a smile.

His father unzips his hoody, revealing the mammoth 8 month pregnant belly that was barely hiding underneath.
Under the hoodie his father was wearing a plain white t-shirt, which was tight against his body, the hemline barely reaching the very top of his belly button which was popped out, staring at Jack like a third eye.

A long dark line ran vertically on his father's belly, from the very top of it, to the underside.
Dark red stretch marks very visible along the sides of his taught pregnant belly skin.
His firm man boobs were visible under the white t-search, his nipples sticking out like little hats against the upper fabric.

"Uh, I'm so big" His father complains, cupping his pregnancy in his hands.
"Hey, hey, hey. Don't say that. You're beautiful. You're absolutely amazing looking." His mother says, walking over to her expectant husband, and placing her hands on top of his which were resting on his pregnant belly.
"I feel like I'm going to be pregnant forever!" His father complains, rubbing his belly.
"It's almost over baby. Another six weeks, and then our little girl will be with us!" His mother says with a smile on her face.
"Now, why don't you go lay down on the couch, stop worrying about how big you're getting, and watch some TV. I'll bring you in your sandwich in a moment."
"Okay, I could probably write a few more chapters in my pregnancy journal" he says, rubbing his hands over the vast expanse of his pregnant midsection.

As he tries to waddle away, his mother stops her husband.
"Uh-uh-uh. You know the rules! Three kisses!" She says gleefully, kissing her husband on the lips.
"One for you!" She says, and then lifts up her husbands white T-shirt, kissing his mammoth pregnant belly twice in two different sections"
"And two for our little girl! Mommy and Daddy love you Veronica!" She says, giving her pregnant husband's belly a pat.
"Now go lay down! I'll be right there!" She orders her husband.

Jack's father waddles past him, heading off into the living room.
Jack stands in complete shock over the scene he just witnessed.
His mind is blank.

His mother turns to him.
"Hey, are you going to pick up that broken glass or what?!" She nags.
11112.title: Pregnant Expansion (RC) - A New Family Member.

111121.content:
Jack just stood there for a few moments stammering like an idiot at the incredibly imposssible situation before him. His dad heavily pregnant, and his mom acting like nothing was wrong. Everything about this was wrong, yet at the same time there was a feeling in the back of Jack's head telling him everything was okay too. The two feelings argued back and forth while his mom just stared at him.

"I'm sorry Jack did I start that scentence with 'if it please your highness'?"

"Mom, dad is, is I don't, I I can't."

"Son are you okay, you're looking pale?" Asked Jack Sr. from his spot on the couch.

Jack looked over at his dad his eyes going right to his big belly, that was the absolute last straw, the mental strain was too much, and Jack passed out, the last thing he heard before the sweet embrace of unconsiousness being his parents calling his name.

Some time later Jack was coming too, hearing his mom gently calling his name.

"Jack, Jack sweetie are you okay?"

Jack recognized where he was, on his bed, in his room, there sitting on the foot of the bed was his mom, and sitting in a chair nearby was his still very pregnant father.

"You took quite a spill there chief, even your sister here is worried about you." Comments his dad, as he rubs his clearly shifting belly.

Jack would have panicked, but the breif period of unconsiousness allowed the strange new memories to, sort themselves out, Jack remembered, though he wasn't sure how, that day months ago when his parents visited him on campus with some unusual news, about how they were suffering from empty nest syndrome and how they have been talking about having another kid, how had singed up for an unusual medical experiment, since mom was getting to old to carry children safely they talked to someone about seeing if Jack Sr. could carry a baby to term. He remembered meeting Dr. Milne and her showing the family pictures of earlier voulenteers, a few college kids Jack's age, and some guys in their 30s. How Jack's dad was now the oldest man to go through the procedure, and how this was supposed to be an unusual alternative to allow married couples to have their own children without rellying on strangers to be surrogates. How Jack voulenteered to take some time off from college to help his mom and dad during the pregnancy and those intense first few months postpartum.

He remembered visiting Dr.Milne with dad to see the progression of the pregnancy, he even remembered the day where he got that ultrasound photo that used to be framed on his bedside table.

"Jack honey, are you okay?"

Jack looks over at his mom, not entirely sure what to say.

(Side note, the character Dr. Milne and her project are borrowed from the delightful Mpreg story: The Study, from mpreg central, http://mpregcentral.net/forums/showthrea... check the domain here if you want to take a look, warning NSFW)
111121.title: errror, error emergency reboot

1111211.content:
"Um, yeah I'm fine, sorry about that I just got really dizzy for a moment there."

Jack's mom gives him a comforting smile and hands him a glass of water that he drinks tentatively.

"Well just take it easy for a while there honey, just to make sure, if you feel anything else is wrong let us know."

"Yeah, son just because we're having this baby it doesn't mean we won't stop worring about you." Comments Jack Sr. from his spot, rubbing his stomach all the while.

'Yeah, somethings wrong, dad's pregnant, niether of you seem to think it's abig deal, and now I've got a bunch of memories I didn't have a couple of hours ago.' Is what Jack wanted to say, but he knew better than to upset his parents, especially, no matter how impossible it may seem, since his dad was pregnant.

"Now if you need anything we'll be downstairs, do you need help up dear?"

"If you wouldn't mind."

With a slight heave Jack's mom helps his dad up from his seat, and starts helping the pregnant man back downstairs. Leaving Jack alone with his thoughts.

'How could this have happend, I mean I know how it happend, but at the same time I knew it didn't happen, ugh, all of this is giving me a headache.'

Jack places his glass of water on his bedside table and flops back down in bed, just letting his thoughts run through his head until dinner.

---later that night----
Dinner itself was an uneventful affair, true Jack Sr. ate a lot more than usual, and not long afterwards started to complain about heartburn, and in a bizarre reversal of roles the two parents took to the couch after dinner with Jack's mom rubbing his dad's feet while all the while making comments about how proud she was of him, and how big and strong their daughter-to-be was getting, reminding Jack about the stories his parents often shared with him aobut what Jack Sr. would do for his mom when she was pregnant.

After spending some time with his parents watching TV, and trying not to have a total breakdown, Jack excused himself back to his room. Now he was seated on his bed roling the coin that, unbeknownst to him, started all this in one hand, and in his other the photo of the snonogram now in need of a new picture frame, Jack just stared at the photo maybe hoping he could make it dissapear while at the same time admireing it. Even before these new memories flodded Jack's brain he did remeber that there was a time when he was little when he asked his parents for a little brother or sister to play his games with him, not that it ever came true, until now that is. Maybe this was the chance to be the big brother he wanted to be, and at the same time it was completely bizzare, why his dad, why not his mom, where did all those new memories come from.

Rather then dwel on it to much and drive himself crazy Jack decided to just get some sleep and hopefully things would be clearer in the morning.
1111211.title: Stay calm for now

choices: Jack was surprisingly refreshed by the dream
Jack was understandibly freaked out by the dream
11112112.content:
That night, despite everything that happened to him, Jack was able to find sleep fairly easily the exhaustion of the day outweighing everything else. But while Jack slept he was unaware that the coin, which he set on his bed side table started to glow a faint silver light.

~~~~~Jack's dream~~~~~~
Today was the day, it was graduation day, Jack sat patiently waiting for the dean to call his name and receive his diploma.

"Jackson Dale Jr."

Jack slowly made his way up to the stage receiving his deploma from the dean and listening to the polite aplause from the other members of the audience. Sometime later after all the pomp and curcumstance, Jack was searching for his family, the suddenly.

"Jackie!" Cheered a young voice, just in time for Jack to turn around and almost get bowled over by a pink blur.

Jack looked down and there latched on to his leg was a three maybe four year old little girl, wearing a little pink dress, her curly hair done up in a simple bun.

"Hey there, Vicki." Giving his little sister a loving pat on her head.

"There you are son." Jack looked up and saw three other people approaching him, two clearly his parents, a little older but pretty much the same. The other a woman around Jack's age with long blond hair and well tanned skin, also wearing a cap and gown.

Jack Sr. gave the two women an aside glance. "See what did I tell you two? If we let her go, she'd track her brother down in an instant, I'd swear she was part bloodhound, if I didn't give birth to her myself."

Jack's mom rolls her eyes with a sarcastic yet loving sigh of 'yes, yes you gave birth to her we know', while the other woman starts saunturing her way up to Jack Jr.

"Hey babe." Jack says cheerfully at this woman.

"Hey lover!" She responds.

"Woah, woah, not in front of the kid okay." Jack whispers back before gesturing down to his sister still latched onto his leg, but looking up at them both with big innocent eyes.

"Are you a big sister..... talking about grown up stuff again?" Asked little Victoria, the womans name garbeled and hard to hear for some reason.

"Hey there now, she's not your sister yet." Comment's Jack's mom as she manages to pry Victoria off her brother's leg.

"Not yet, but soon right.......?" Replied Jack Jr.

"Oh, yes, and who knows maybe when we get married you and I will have to take turns being pregnant eh babe?"

The mistery woman then places her hand on Jack Jrs stomach which suddenly bloated out to 8 months in size. Then the dream ends when Jack's alarm starts going off.
11112112.title: dream a little dream

111121121.content:
The alarm quickly ended Jack's unusual dream, he then reached over and turned the alarm off, taking a moment to take his dream in. Despite the unusual subject Jack actually felt refreshed, and surprisingly calm and at eased, like how he usually felt after a particularly pleasent or interesting dream, and this dream definatly would fall, somewhat in the interesting category.

"That dream, was that really my little sister? And who was that woman, and what happened to me?" Jack's hand drifting to his flat stomach, his mind lingering on those last few seconds, until he heard his mom call from downstairs.

"Jack, sweetie, breakfast is ready."

"I'll be right down mom." Jack calls back, deciding it best to push all that aside for now Jack picked himself up out of bed and started to make his way to the kitchen.

As usual his mom was able to make a tasty looking yet quickly prepaired breakfast, toast, eggs and juice for Jack, and toast, yogurt and coffee for her.

"Morning sweetie, have a good nights sleep?"

"Um, yeah mom, thanks."

"Feeling better then? You weren't quite yourself last night."

"Much better mom don't worry. Um, where's dad?"

"Oh, he's still in bed, it takes a lot of energy to make a new life ya know?" Replied his mom with a knowing smile on her face.

"Um, yeah sure right." Replies Jack before going back to gingerly eating his breakfast. The two eat in comfortable silence, for a while until they finish and start working on cleaning the plates.

"Now Jack, I need you to do me a big favor today."

"What's that?"

"Well unfortunately a small emergency has occured at the office and I need to see to it, so I was hoping that you could please take your father to...."
111121121.title: good morning

choices: follow along on the awkward morning ritual and car ride
1111211212.content:
"Well unfortunately a small emergency has occured at the office and I need to see to it, so I was hoping that you could please take your father to his doctor appointment?"

Jack almost chokes on his toast at that little bomb shell.

"What!?"

"I know it's not your favorite thing to do but Dr. Milne knows who you are, so it shouldn't be much trouble for you to get in with your father, besides we're in the home streatch here, and your father needs to see Dr. Milne at least once a week until our little girl is ready to be born."

Jack was ratther concerned at first, but then it hits him, who better to ask questions about what's going on than the doctor who supposedly started all of this.

"Alright fine I'll do it."

His mother leans over and gives Jack a loving kiss on the cheek.

"Thank you sweetie, if your father isn't up in 20 minutes go get him, his breakfast is keeping warm in the stove, and make sure he drinks a tall glass of milk, we need to make sure little Veronica has nice strong bones when she's born."

"RIght, got it."

"Thank you again Jack, I should be back by 3, take care of your father."

At that Jack's mom is out the door, leaving the younger Jack alone for now. Sometime later Jack knew he had to go into his parents room and wake up his pregnant father, so with an understandible amount of trepidation, Jack makes his way upstairs, and opens the door.

"Dad, dad are you awake?"

There lying in bed alseep for now was Jack Sr. in a pile of pillows and snarled up sheets, wearing wife beater that seemed a little to tight and a very stretchy pair of boxers. His pregnant belly pushed high into the air. Jack Jr. stood there silently for a few moments, just drinking in the sight before him, then on pure instinct alone Jack Jr. slowly approaches his sleeping father and places his had on the pregnant belly, right then and there the baby, his little sister, gave a nice harty kick, making Jack Jr. jump back a bit in surprise, and thankfully the kick seemed to be enough to wake his dad.

Electricity seemed to be in the air that day in Jack Dale Sr's four door sedan that day, as Jack Dale Jr stared at his mother Amanda from the back seat, the strange coin the palm of his hand showing "Tails".

Suddenly, a shiver seemed to pulse through his mother, causing her whole body to jolt.

And with that, the funny feeling in the air just seemed to vanish.

"Something that matter honey" Jack's father looking over at his wife.

"I don't know. I just feel funny all of sudden." She says, squirming in her seat.

"You gonna be okay?" Jack says to his mother, his brain finally coming back to reality.

"Yeah, I think so. I feel a little nauseous all of a sudden though" she says, placing her hand on her stomach.

"Do you not want to go to the restaurant?" Jack's father asks.

"No, no, no" she says, rubbing her stomach. "It's funny. As nauseous as I feel right now, I'm starving. I could eat a horse" she says.

"You ever wonder where that phrase comes from?" Jack asks, trying to change the subject.

"Probably from when starving people had to eat horses to survive" Jack's father says to him.

"Oh yeah, that makes sense" Jack replies.

The car ride continued on, uneventful for a few more minutes, until eventually pulling into the parking lot of the diner.

They all pile out of the car, before Jack's mother places her hand over her stomach again, and begins to take some deep breathes.

"Mom, are you going to be okay?" Jack asks.

"Yeah, I think I'm going to be fine I just - - - - HMMMPPHH!" she stops what she's saying as her hand goes over her mouth and she takes off running into the diner.

"Dad, I think she's going to be sick." Jack says, pointing out the obvious.

"Yeah, I hope she makes to the bathroom for their sake. I would NOT want to be the busboy who has to clean that up" he says with a smile.

You share a laugh, and then head into the diner together.

The aroma of hundred different dishes strikes you, just as the sound of two dozen different families and parties eating and talking at their tables does.

This place is always busy Jack thinks to himself.

"How many?" The cute twenty-something blonde behind the register says to them. She has her hair up in a ponytail, wearing the dark green work uniform of the dinner, holding a stack of menus.

"Three" your father says 'And did - - - -"

"The lady running towards the bathroom? Yeah, she made it. Man, I hope for Ricky's sake she makes it into the bowl. I hate to have to clean that up" she says.

"That's what I said!" Jack says, trying to act cool in front of the pretty blonde in front of him. It didn't work.

The blonde leads them to all a table, where they take their seat, and begin looking through the menus.

"I'll be right back in a few." The blonde says, walking off.

A few moments later, Jack's mother finds him and his father, as she sits down at the table, dabbing a wet paper towel at the corners of her mouth.

"You gonna be okay?" Jack's father asks.

"Strangely, yes. After I threw up, I feel fantastic, and starving!" She says, picking up the menu.

A few moments later, the blonde comes back, with her notepad, ready to take the families order.

"Everyone ready to order?" She asks.

112212222112.content:
As Jack looked at Lynette Marks, he could have sworn that the air around her was shimmering, like a road on a hot day.
Soon the shimmer seemed to envelope the whole room, as Jack was snapped back to attention by his parents.

"Jack! The lady would like to know what you wanted to order! So maybe you want to put your coin away and order something?" his father said in a stern tone.

His eyes went back to the pretty blonde waitress, staring at him, waiting for his order. He looked at the coin, and then back to her, suddenly aware that he just flipped his strange coin in the middle of a packed restaurant, with his parents and a pretty blonde waitress staring at him.

"Oh yeah sorry. Cheeseburger, please" Jack said, trying to regain his senses.
"And do you want the fries for you or your mom?" The waitress says, finally writing down his order on her pad.
"Whatever" was all he could say.

"Couldn't figure out what you wanted so had to flip a coin huh? I've done that" His father says, acknowledging what just happened.
"Yeah, I guess." Jack said, his mind in a daze.

Something felt wrong. Seriously, seriously wrong.
Like he had been displaced from reality. He felt like an alien in his own normal world, a stranger in his own skin.

His eyes absent-mindidly wandered back to that "private" party room, unaware of the subtle but major changes that occurred while he wasn't looking.
The multicolored balloons that were once there to celebrate a 60th birthday had changed. The reds, the yellows, the greens, and oranges balloons changed into bright blue and pink balloons, the weights that were holding them down changing from heavy pieces of plastic, to small packages of pacifiers or small brightly colored stuff animals.

The small amount of gifts on the table that had previously been there had quadrupled in number, the plain standard birthday wrapping paper on them being replaced with hues of bright pink or blue, with little pictures of storks on them. Dozens of boxes of diapers stood stacked in two corners of the room, like giant pillars, little cards taped on the boxes, clearly full of money.

The birthday cake, once glowing bright with 60 candles, was instead replaced by a large cake in the shape of a very pregnant belly wearing a blue dress, almost similar to the one Lynette was wearing. The 60 candles had been replaced by a two smaller candles that read "60" that rested on the very top of the pregnant belly cake.

The demeanor and number of guests had changed too. Where once they're were only a few guests, now the room was overflowing with people, many young and old, cheering. These people were not here a second ago.

Stranger still, the demeanor of the people that Jack figured were her family had changed drastically. Joy and happiness which had been there moments earlier, had been replaced with looks of disbelief, anger, and confusion, espically from the ones that Jack thought were her children.

They looked angry and pissed; like they didn't want to be there. They weren't like that moments ago Jack thought.
The glass of wine that Lynette was drinking was replaced by a large glass of milk, while Lynette's hair had appear to grown longer, almost flowing down to her shoulders.

Her once sagging breasts were larger and firmer, pushing out against the constrains of her blue dress, dark wet spots visible.
Her skin was more youthful looking, and she had a smile on her face a mile wide.

Her breasts are bigger! Jack thought, his eyes going to the two now supple and firm breasts hugging the top of her dress.
They looked like they belonged to a woman half her age.

"Come on Lynette! Give a speech!" One of her older friends shouted at her, raising a glass of wine.
"No! She doesn't need to give a speech! She should just sit down. Don't make her get up!" Her son said, defensively.
"Oh stop! I'm fine!" Lynette said, slapping her son in the arm. She gave a smile, took a drink from her glass of milk, and put her hands on the armrests of her chair, trying to get up awkwardly.

Why is she having so much trouble getting up? Jack thinks watching her.
Moments later, he had his answer.

As she hoisted herself out her chair, her belly became visible.
Her very pregnant belly.

She let out a groan, as she finally got to her feet, putting her hands into the small of her back, her 8 months pregnant belly wrapped tightly in the blue dress she was wearing, causing the fabric to bunch up in the sides. Her popped out navel was visible through the fabric, resting on-top of her mammoth blue mound like a little hat.

Her belly was massive, jutting out in front of her like she swallowed an oversized globe. With the tight blue dress on, it did look like a small planet covered completely in water.

"I want to thank everyone for coming today!" Lynette beamed, her hands in the small of her back, causing her massive pregnant belly to jut out further.
"Somebody once asked me when I turned 59 last year, "60's coming up, What do you have to look forward too?" And I didn't have an answer to that back then. But now today, on my 60th Birthday, I have two!" She said smiling, the wrinkles of the side of her face visible, patting her belly for emphasis, before returning her hands to the small of her back.

The banner which once read Happy 60th Birthday Lynette, now reads:
Babies & Birthday Cake! Lynette's 60th Birthday & Baby Shower!
One foot in the grave! Two babies in the belly!

She was having twins! Lynette suddenly let out a gasp, taking one hand from her back and rubbing a spot on her belly.
"Oh my, these two are active today!" She smiles rubbing her belly in front of her guests.
"Now, I now some people might say having twins at my age is crazy, or impossible. Maybe their right, but while those people are sleeping soundly at 9PM, I'll have a hot date with a breast pump!" She jokes, the room erupting in laughter from everyone except her children.
She jiggles her ample bosom for effect, before resting her hands on top of her pregnant belly.

"I'm still not quite sure HOW I got pregnant. My husband passed away two years ago, and my doctor told me years ago that my childbearing days were over, but as I sit here, with little Matthew and little Sarah bumping away in side of me, I don't really care. I have the loving support of my two older children, their spouses, and my four wonderful grandchildren, whom I'm sure will love to help out when I give birth in a month."

"It won't be easy. There are long days, and long nights ahead of me, but I will be the best mother I still humanly can be at my age, making sure these two new babies have everything they could ever want, and a happy home filled with love, laughter, and joy.So thanks again for coming to what I hope will be my last baby shower, because, well" Lynette says, pausing.

She turns showing her massive 60 year old pregnant profile to her guests, putting her hands into the small of her back, and giving a comical face.
"I'm too old for this!" A smattering of applause is heard, as Lynette smiles, places her hands on her belly and gives it a rub.

She then turns her attention to the massive amount of gifts on the table, opening them up slowly, as her son begrudingly video tapes his pregnant mother opening her gifts, laughing as she holds a tiny pair of baby clothes over her belly that reads "That's not my grandma, that my mommy!"

She continues opening gifts, and eats a big slice of her pregnancy-themed cake, as Jack continues to stare on in amazement.

What the hell is going on? How is she pregnant! She can't be pregnant! She wasn't pregnant moments ago! Jack thinks, watching the 60 year old pregnant woman play with her grandchild, who is enamored with her pregnant belly.

"What's you staring at Jack?" His father asks, turning around, staring at the now Baby Shower/60th Birthday Party.

"Oh wow. Look at her" Jack father's says. "She must be crazy having kids at her age."

His mother turns and looks at the much older pregnant woman.

"No kidding. I can't even imagine being pregnant at my age, let alone hers, and she's only a few years older than me. I think I would freak out" she says.
"Although, I think it would be just a little bit nice" Amanda pauses for a second, a smile coming over her.

"I think I might go over there and congratulate her" his mother says.

"What?!" Jack says, confused as to why his parents seem to be accepting the 60 year old pregnant woman who wasn't pregnant moments before, far too well.

"I just want to feel her belly and talk to her a little bit." Amanda says.
"I don't know honey.." Jack's father says.
"Oh it'll be fine" Amanda says .

"But Mom! She wasn't pregnant when we got here!" Jack says, trying to explain the situation.
"Jack, don't talk crazy like that so loud. She might hear you!" His father says in a stern tone.

"It's not crazy!"

11221222211211.content:
The trip home for the Dale family was a relatively quite affair but towards the end, “Uuuggh,” said Amanda leaning back in seat clutching her stomach, “maybe I had too much.”
“Well you did eat quite a lot dear,” said her husband,
This was true over the course of the meal Amanda Dale had eaten the fries from the rest of her family, fries from her own burger meal something else that she ate, a large slice of peanut butter chocolate cake and even a slice of Lynette Marks baby shower cake after a leftover slice was sent over in thanks for Amanda sympathetic words, all in all she ate more than her husband and son combined. Jack Jr was not really thinking about this as he was more concerned with Lynette Marks’ sudden pregnancy, later on when the situation had ‘grown’ somewhat he would look back a realized what was going on then but at the time he was too busy examining the coin. Jack Sr on the other hand did seemed concerned about his wife’s sudden appetite increase.
“Maybe you shouldn’t of had so much to eat,” he said.
“I know I shouldn’t of,” said Amanda, “It’s just that I fe…” She stifled something half way between a burp and a hiccup, then her eye bulged and she said, “Pull over I need t- - - - HMMMPPHH” She clamped a hand over her mouth.

Fortunately they had just arrived home as it was. Amanda was out of the car before it had fully stopped and rushing to the house. ‘I sure hope she makes it,’ thought Jack as he hopped out of the Sedan, ‘otherwise I’m possibly going to be the one who has to clean it up’.
Fortunately though there were no puddles of half digested…fortunately she made it. Jack went up to his room, he got in contact with some friends he hadn’t seen in a while and made plans to meet up over the next few days. Jack toyed with the idea of researching the coin on the internet but it was getting late and decided he would do it tomorrow.
‘After all,’ he thought to himself ‘how bad can it be.’
11221222211211.title: They leave the restaurant and go home.

112212222112111.content:
The next day Jack Jr made his way down to the kitchen for breakfast only to find that there was no food in the kitchen. It was strange his parents knew he was coming to visit and the left the kitchen so under stocked he couldn’t even make himself a decent breakfast. He couldn’t ask them about it at the moment though as they both had gone off to work, Jack Sr dropping Amanda off at the bank, where she worked, on the way to the company where he worked. ‘Looks like I’m going to have to get some food from somewhere else,’ Jack thought to himself. As he made his way up to his room to get ready to go out, Jack failed to notice the bin was practically over flowing with empty food packets.

Amanda Dale sat behind her desk in her office, working and trying to ignore the gnawing hunger in her stomach. As the empty food packets strewn around the office indicated she had already failed this several times already. She couldn’t understand why she had been eating so much in the past day. First the was the restaurant yesterday and then several times last night she went to the kitchen for a snack…or two, this morning her breakfast had cleaned out what was left in the kitchen and she had gone to the corner shop several time today, she had been sick again when she woke up but it wasn’t as bad as yesterday and she hadn’t felt sick at all since then, all that was left was the hunger, she had to stop eating. Already her stomach had gone from ironing board flat to rounded potbelly. She nearly had to call in sick because her work clothes wouldn’t fit, but she managed to get on a dark grey knee business skirt, and do up the buttons on a shirt and business jacket but it had been a close thing, even now she had to undo the lower few buttons of her jacket, whilst the buttons on her shirt creaked ominously. She had to stop eating so much, that’s what she told herself after going to the corner shop for the fourth time today, it was also what she told herself the time before that, the owner was starting to make humorless jokes whilst wearing a cheesy grin his face each time she came in. Another wave of hunger went through, she place her pen on the desk and looked at the clock, it was nearly eleven she told herself, she could go get lunch now and no more trips for food.

She had just stood up when one of the cashiers came in, “uh Mrs Dale, Ms Sommer is here, and she wants to talk to someone about her inheritance.” Amanda sighed, Emilie Sommer was in her late twenties but still acted as though she was a teenager, she was the sole child of Hans Sommer the successful Bavarian jeweler who left everything to his second wife (his first dying in a car crash several years after Emilie was born) when he died, his second wife, Penelope was a decent woman, in Amanda’s point of view and did leave everything to her stepdaughter (having no children of her own) on the proviso that Emilie must spend a year doing a job so that she learnt the value of money. 11311.content:
Jack grimaced as he felt a wave of nausea flood through him. He reached down to rub the side of his stomach, hoping that would help to soothe the sickness away. Was it something that he ate? He hadn't been carsick since he was a little boy, and it seemed strange that it would start again out of no-where. His headache throbbed behind his temples, and Jack sank back against the car seat. He felt tired all of a sudden, as if his recent run of late-night gaming sessions had finally caught up to him, and he tilted his head to rest his forehead against the blissfully cool car window.

"Jack?" Jack's mother caught his eye in the rear view mirror, concern entering her expression, "Are you alright? You've gone ever so quiet." She turned in her seat to take a closer look at her son, her eyes looking him up and down in motherly concern. "Sweetie? You've gone pale."

"Feels like I'm gonna throw up," Jack tilted his head further against the cold glass, "Guess I ate something dodgy. Or something like that."

"Bet it was that hot dog you snarfed down from the guy outside of the flea market," Jack Sr declared with a self approving nod, "You can't trust guys like that. Most of them don't even have a license to be there, you know. You don't even know what meat went into that 'dog, kiddo. Could be anything. Cat. Raccoon. Actual dog."

"I don't think you're helping, dear," Jack's mother responded exasperatedly, "Do you want us to drop you off at home, sweetie? You could go upstairs and get some rest." She looked as if she were going to say something else, but instead decided not to. Jack was grateful for it, and nodded as he rubbed a hand over his churning stomach once again. The thought of having something to eat both disgusted him and appealed to him at the same time.

On one hand, he was feeling sick.The idea of heading home and going to bed was an appealing one, he could put Netflix on and just allow himself to doze in and out of sleep between episodes. He could maybe see about delving into his stash of snacks if he was feeling better later on.

On the other? He loved the diner they were heading towards. And he had a sudden craving for his all time favourite triple cheeseburger with strips of bacon inserted between each patty. Jack's mouth almost watered at the thought, he could even have curly fries with that. Thick, curled fries with a dusting of spice to give them a little bit of a kick.

"Well son, your mom and I have something to tell you. We're going to visit your mom's brother We're going to be gone for three weeks so we're leaving you some money and food so you don't starve." Jacks smiles, happy for them. Maybe this strange sickness would go away by the time they came back.

"Alright." His parents finish the rest of the food in silence. Once they're done, his dad calls for the receipt. He pays and they leave. They get in the car and go home. Once there, Jack goes to his room, changing into something more comfortable. As he's taking his shirt off, he notices something odd. He's always been a bit chubby but it looked like he ate a bit more then he usually does. He thinks nothing of it and heads to bed. He gets under the covers and close his eyes.

1131111.content:
The next morning he wakes up with a yawn, rubbing his eyes. He pulls the covers of the bed off of him and heads down to the living room.

"Mom? Dad?" He calls out, realizing that the house was quiet. He goes to the kitchen and sees a note with some bills next to it. They must have left already, he thought. Jack takes the bills, counting a large sum of money. It was enough to last him a few months. He then decides to read the note. Jack, it says, sorry for leaving you without a goodbye. Your mother got a call saying that your uncle got hurt and his wife can't help him since she's pregnant.

Wait, Aunt Cassidy and Uncle Frank are having a kid?, he reads on.

Cassidy's having a girl by the way, so congratulate them when you have the chance. I'm not sure when we'll be back so use that money wisely. Try to eat in. See you around, Dad.

He places the note back. He stares at nothing for a while. That's when it hit him. With a feeling of dread, he realizes that the nausea from yesterday was coming back. He sprints to the bathroom in time to throw up the contents of his stomach. After what it seemed like forever, Jack rises up from the toilet bowl, flushes and goes to the sink. He wipes his mouth clean and washes his hands. As he's drying them, that's when he notices it.

In the bathroom mirror was Jack, there was something off though. It could be a trick of the light but was his belly bigger? Through his shirt, it seemed more round. He wraps his arms around it and is surprised at how firm it felt to the touch. There was a nagging feeling at the back of his mind, he had felt this before on another person. It was much larger back then though. He remembered one of his older cousins being heavily pregnant with her son, as he was stubborn to come out. Jack had felt how hard her belly was and that was the feeling he was getting from touching his stomach.

I'm not-I couldn't be- his hands tremble. If there was a baby in him, what was he going to do? Well, he would go through the pregnancy and raise the kid as well.
