"That's not the way I though you would sound," he father said. "I thought you two were dating?"
"Taking it slow," Jack said.

The sickly feeling wasn't going away. Jack Jr. tried his best to hold it back as they ate dinner, but it was apparent. His parents were kind and perceptive, however, and they hurried things along. The drive back home was uneventful, although Jack continued to toy with the coin in his hand as he looked at his reflection. There was no need to flip a coin and pretend to be a comical villain, but he couldn't help but feel the impulse. He didn't want to look stupid in front of his parents, though, and he ultimately didn't flip the coin again.

His nausea dissipated when they arrived home, and he quickly went to his room. He had a journal that he would reflect on his goals in every now and then, sitting at his desk. Jack's year off school hadn't quite given him a direction he wanted to discover. Jenny was much more driven; she wanted to be a game designer. He was going to need to rest up early. He liked Jenny, but she had a tendency to linger whenever she shopped. They would probably be out together the whole day. As laid in bed at ten p.m., but sleep didn't come.

He tried his best to be still, but he felt strangely uncomfortable. Eventually, he got up, drank a glass of water, and stretched. Around midnight, he went to the bathroom. As he peed, he felt a strange feeling in his abdomen: a kind of pressure, which he passed off as his full bladder. He washed up and looked at himself once in the mirror.

"You're going to sleep," he declared. But his stomach rebelled, and the sickness returned. Jack wound up vomiting into the toilet, exhausting himself. Afterwards, he brushed his teeth once more an then stumbled into bed, collapsed, and fell asleep.
11321.title: Fast Pregnancy - Jack's Journey Into Fatherhood...

choices: Jack flips the coin into the water, seeing his reflection
Jack flips the coin, then looks at Jenny or someone else
Jack doesn't flip the coin, and the two buy a movie to watch at Jenny's place.
113212.content:
As the morning began, the sun was hidden beyond a gloomy overcast sky. The thick, swollen clouds blanketed the town in preparation of rain. A thunderstorm warning was immediately in effect, which is what woke Jack Jr. up from his sleep. Similarly to everyone else that morning, he felt dismayed looking out the window. He forced himself up and cleaned himself, feeling heavy and sluggish.

He heard a text message, and saw a note from Jenny. "You up?" it said simply.

Jenny had been organizing breakfast occasionally over the past few weeks, trying out different cafés around town. Jack was happy that she wanted to spend time with him, but they were already going to spend plenty of money today at the mall.

"Come over to my house for breakfast. I'll make omelets," he texted.
"Is that okay?" Jenny asked.
"Yeah. When you're ready." Jack put his phone away and went to the kitchen. His mother was eating toast.

"Do you want and omelet, Mom?" Jack asked.
"No, thank you." Amanda peered at her son when he wasn't looking. There was something slightly different about him today that she couldn't place. Had he gained weight. His stomach was a touch rounder. Still at home and getting a "Freshman fifteen," she thought.

Jack Jr. was fond of cooking. Perhaps he had simply picked it up from watching anime characters expound on the glory of food for many years, but it was a natural interest for him. He liked to experiment with different tastes. As he finished the omelets, his phone buzzed again.

"Hey, sorry. Something came up, so I can't make it in time for breakfast. I'll see you at the mall, though, so don't worry."

"Hmm." Jack muttered. He looked longingly at the omelets that he had prepared, but decided against eating them both. He had a sneaking suspicion that she was uncomfortable seeing his parents. He asked his mother where the styrofoam boxes were, and packed both delicious morsels away. His stomach roared in protest.

"Won't they get cold?" his mother asked.
"They'll still be good," he replied. Especially since he was the one who made it.

Jack drove to the mall and met Jenny at the front.
"Hey, sorry. You didn't have to bring any breakfast."
"It's my treat." he said simply. They found a bench and ate, savoring each other's company. Jenny only ate half of hers, but she seemed happy. Politely, she asked Jack to finish her leftovers, which he gladly did.

She was trying not to think about his belly.

The two waltzed over to the computer store, hoping to find some nice parts to build a gaming pc. Jack had recommended the task to Jenny to help with her game design. It would be good to get hands on experience building a computer herself. She agreed. While they browsed for parts, an odd sensation began to bother Jack. He felt something hot in his pocket. When he felt around, he found the coin again.

I don't remember taking this.

flip me

Jack's insides churned as he looked at the thing. He put the coin away, and went back to shopping.

When they had finished shopping for parts, after much deliberation, Jack and Jenny shared a buttered pretzel in the center of the mall. They were right outside of a maternity clothing store, "Belles and Bellies." Jack thought it was a stupid name, but it wasn't really on his mind. He was more concerned with what they were going to do after the mall.

"Let's get some clothes," Jenny said.
"What?"
"I feel like shopping for clothes."
"I though we were going to, you know, get a movie," said Jack. She gave him a smile.
"Come on. There's not a lot of people here today, so it'll be real quick. We'll get a movie afterward. Besides, you could use another shirt," she teased. She tugged at the hem of his t shirt.
"Huh," he said. He somehow hadn't noticed that it was hugging his body firmly. "Alright, we'll flip it. Heads: we get a movie first. Tails: we get clothes first."

Flip me

As he caught the coin, Jack looked at the result, and then ahead at the maternity clothing store. "Heads."

He blinked. He was watching an employee leave the maternity store, only for her to expand before his very eyes. It was an instant, but no one else seemed to notice or respond. Not even the woman.

"Let's get the movie, then," Jenny said
"No, let's get the clothes," Jack replied.
"You won the coin toss."
"Well, it can wait," he said.
"Thank you."

It had occurred to Jack that shopping was really Jenny's idea, and that she probably intended to get clothes in the first place. He got himself a pack of larger shirts in the meantime, troubled. He had been doing a good job of losing weight recently, so it was unpleasant to think that it was going away.

Jenny was a gorgeous woman. Jack liked the way she looked in a dress, although it was not common for her to wear. He complimented her on everything she chose, and thankfully never had to lie.

When they finished, they passed by a wishing fountain. It was a nostalgic place for Jack. He watched his reflection shimmer in the rippling water. He pulled out the coin, compulsively.

Flip me
113212.title: Day 2: Jack, clearly showing, goes on his date ...

choices: Jack and Jenny go to her place, with or without sex. (go to Day 3)
Jack calls it a day with Jenny; they agree to meet tomorrow. (Day 3)
Jack pulls out a quarter to decide, only to discover the enchanted coin.
1132122.content:
On a whim, Jack flipped the coin into the wishing well. His eyes flitted over to a vendor selling cheap jewelry, as he considered whether Jenny might want to browse them. A pretty blonde woman was in the middle of trying to get the attention of passerby's.

"Hey, Jack. What are you looking at?" Jenny asked. Jack turned to her, unaware of how lucky he had been.
"Oh. Did you want to look for some earrings or something?"

They turned back to the vendor, where a scene was taking place.The seller was making an awful lot of panicked noise. Her attention, which before had been on selling jewelry, was exclusively on getting someone to take her to the hospital. As she stepped out from behind the stall, the shape of her belly caught Jack's attention. She was apparently in labor.

"Let's get out of here," whispered Jenny hurriedly.
"Hold on," said Jack. "Let's make sure she has some help."
Jenny hesitated to respond, but she nodded.

Jack hurried over as well as he could to the panicking saleswoman. Her outfit had somehow burst several buttons; she looked horribly disheveled.

"Do you need help, ma'am?"

"Yes, I need help, you little shit! Oh!" the woman cried. Another set of contractions overwhelmed her, and she lowered herself onto the ground. Jack couldn't believe that this was happening.

"Hey!" he yelled at another vendor. "Is there anyone that can get her to the hospital?" Another saleswoman hurried over to the scene.

"What? But she wasn't...how did---what?"
"Hey," Jack repeated. "You need to get her to the hospital." But it was no use. The blond woman's co-worker was in some kind of bewildered terror.

Jack sighed. This was supposed to be a pleasant day. "Jenny, let's drive her over."
"What?" she whispered.
"Now, Jenny," Jack asserted. He grabbed the blonde woman's hand and pulled her to her feet. "We'll get you to the hospital, Miss." She accepted, albeit begrudgingly.

It was probably the tensest half hour of Jack and Jenny's lives to that point. The hospital was thankfully close, but while getting to Jack's car they half expected the woman to give birth right then.

There wasn't any need to stay with the woman at the hospital. All they could do was hope that things went well. So Jack drove Jenny back to her car at the mall, where they recuperated. There wasn't anything that they really had in mind to say. It was all a little strange. Jenny, especially, was affected. She seemed oddly flushed and didn't have much to say. Finally, she held Jack's hand.
"You were really cool," she murmured.
Jack wondered at that. "Not really. If it had gotten any more serious, I wouldn't have been better than any doctor or anything like that." Jenny shushed him. She kissed him on the lips. It was a different kiss than he was used to from her, but passionate nonetheless. When she separated, she buried her face into his chest, concealing it.

What was going on, he wondered? A greedy part of him thought maybe this was a chance for fireworks that night. Then again, Jenny was acting overwhelmed, and she didn't seem in the right state of mind. He thought of his options. On the one hand, he and his girlfriend could spend the night together. On the other hand, she would probably respect him more in the long run if he didn't push it.
1132122.title: D2: Jack flips the coin and looks at someone else

choices: (FP, Day 3) Jenny is suddenly ill; Jack takes care of her all day.
(FP, Day 3) Jenny seems upset, and asks to be left alone.
(FP, Day 3) Jenny is curiously excited, and wants to be intimate
11321221.content:
"Let's get that movie," Jack said. Jenny agreed, and the two made their preparations for movie night.

Jenny's apartment was well kept. She put her purchases away while Jack set up the movie. They had chosen a cheesy comedy so that they could poke fun at it while they watched. It was something that they liked to do together. Sometimes they cared more for talking about the movie than actually watching it. Jack Jr. sat in the couch, feeling oddly exhausted. Eventually, Jenny snuggled up against him. While they laughed and relaxed, they eventually re-positioned. Jack laid down on the couch, and Jenny rested on top of him.

Their commentary of the movie died out as their attention was on each other, wondering what would happen next. Jack was feeling exhausted, but he wanted to stay awake. Jenny's head was on his chest, as she listened to his heart. She crawled up and kissed him on the lips, and...

He fell asleep.

Jack's dreams were restless, but he was paralyzed. He woke up briefly at midnight, feeling odd. He thought he could make out Jenny's silhouette, as he felt her head against his stomach. He drifted back to sleep.

Morning came rudely. Jack snapped awake, absolutely dumbfounded with himself for not getting anywhere the previous night. His lambasting was quickly halted, as he noticed something distinctly different. His stomach was swollen outward.

"The...what?" He muttered. His abdomen had a distinctly round protrusion, and not like a beer belly. It was too perfect a curve. He uneasily placed a hand against his gut, testing how firm it was. His insides were uneasy as he did this. His was still wearing his old shirt from yesterday, which was uncomfortably tight, and had ridden up.

Forcing his mind off of it, Jack got up and took a deep breath. He went and got himself breakfast, feeling famished. Jenny wasn't anywhere to be seen, but he assumed that she was in the bathroom. While he ate, Jack began to feel uneasy. Jenny had been acting oddly since yesterday.

He decided to check in with her, and so he headed to the restroom. Sure enough, she was inside.
11321221.title: (FP: Day 2) Jack and Jenny go to her place

choices: (FP, Day 4) "I used to own that coin," Jenny confesses
(FP, Day 4) "This was my roommate's.  You noticed she isn't here?"
(FP, Day 4) "I think I need to go," Jack says.
113212211.content:
There was a terrible sound coming from the restroom. Jenny was retching between whimpers into the toilet. She wasn't going to like him intruding, but Jack wasn't going to do nothing while she was clearly sick. He opened the door and attended to his girlfriend. Jenny was pale as a sheet, though she tried to hide her face.

"Don't look at me," she whimpered.

"Well, I can't help that," he offered. He got a wash cloth and wiped the sweat off her face, and massaged her back. She seemed miserable, and though he stayed with her, she wouldn't look at him..

"I'll make you some soup."

"I don't have any."

"Well, I'll grab a can from home," he said, heading for his coat. "You going to be okay?"

She nodded. Before he walked out of the apartment, he heard her call just audibly, "Thank you, Jack."

He checked the cabinets at home, and found the can he needed. He also grabbed some fresh ingredients so that he could make some fresh onion soup. Jack left a note on the counter for his parents. He was going to stay at Jenny's another night.

His sudden weight gain was no longer on the front of his mind, but he did grab some extra clothes, and drove back.

When he returned, Jack found Jenny curled up on the couch.

"I'm back," he called, enthusiastically. As he set the items down in the kitchen, she whispered back.

"I'm sorry. I'm feeling better now," she lied. Her voice was hoarse.

"Don't worry about it. Just relax. I'll make you some soup, and you'll get better in no time."

"You don't feel sick?" she asked.

"Nope."

"Lucky." She wrapped herself in a blanket and laid out on the couch.

It was a long day, with not so much talking. There was much soup had, and jello, and the local news. Jenny looked like she had something on her mind, but she couldn't communicate it properly.

"You got fat," she deliriously stated once.

"And you're beautiful," he said.

The day ended, and night swiftly followed. Jenny was put to bed, where she promptly fell asleep. Her comment about his weight hadn't felt important, but Jack couldn't help but feel more uncomfortable as more time passed. His back and stomach were mildly aching as he laid himself back onto the couch. He'd consumed most of the soup that he made, and many other snacks. He hoped that Jenny would feel better tomorrow, and that his new gut would go away. His insides squirmed as he fell asleep.

Day 4

His belly was rounder in the morning. It was actually disconcerting to look at it, Jack thought. But he couldn't dwell on that. He went to check on Jenny. She was extremely nauseous, and she had vomited during the night into a pot he put beside the bed. While he was washing the pot, she emerged from the bedroom. She was weak, but oddly cheery.

"I'm feeling a lot better today," she said. She gave jack a hug, then backed up and looked at his stomach. She had the strangest look on her face. "You're pregnant," she whispered.

"Ha, ha," Jack replied. "I think we should go to a doctor and make sure that you're alright. You getting sick just came out of the blue." His stomach was having spasms while he said this.

"I'm sorry," she said again. "I really am feeling better." Again, there was something heavy on her mind. "Jack."

"Yes?"

"That coin that you flipped into the wishing well the other day. Was it a half dollar?" She sounded nervous.

"What made you think of that?" Jack wondered. "It was some weird gimmicky antique that I bought for a buck. I decided that I didn't need it." He said this nonchalantly, but a look of terror flashed across Jenny's face. She hurried into the bathroom, and came back with a box.

"I need you to use one," she said. Jack looked at the box. His tone changed, his stomach twitching.

"Why do you have an open box of pregnancy tests, if we've never had sex?"

Jack and Jenny looked into each other's eyes.

"It's not what you think," she said.
113212211.title: (FP, Day 3) Jenny is suddenly ill; Jack takes c...

choices: (FP, Day 4) Jenny catches the coin mid-flip, and they escape safely.
(FP, Day 4) The Guard flips the coin, looking at Jenny.
(FP, Day 4) The Officer flips the coin, looking at Jack.
1132122111.content:
"I used to own that coin," Jenny blurted out. "The one that you threw away." She was beginning to sob.

"The coin." Jack repeated simply. "The one I bought from the flea market?"

"Yes. That's where I tried to get rid of it. I slipped it into this guy's pocket."

"You're being weird," said Jack. His discomfort was rising.

Jenny fumbled around for something to say. "You remember that woman we helped at the mall? She wasn't pregnant earlier that day."

"What do you mean?"

"I mean you knocked her up when you flipped that coin into the wishing well!" Jenny cried. "I was hoping that would be the end of it, but look at you." She placed her hands on his firm stomach, but he stepped away from her.

"Don't do that," he said.

"You know how my roommate isn't here? The same thing happened to her. I flipped the coin, and she ballooned right in front of me. She didn't even realize that she had changed. Now she's gone to stay with her family."

Jack started wandering to the door.

"I can prove it," Jenny said. "Just let me prove it."

Reluctantly, Jack agreed.

The return to the mall was silent between them. When they arrived, the place was strangely less populated. When Jack asked a passerby where everyone was, the response was hushed.

"Weird shit's been going on," said the man.

Jenny hurried to the wishing well, while Jack went to buy a stethoscope. There was a simple way of proving that she was being crazy, so he decided to go with it. When he rejoined Jenny, she was ankle deep in the wishing well.

"Jenny! You don't just jump into the wishing well in front of everyone," he hissed. She seemed distraught.

"It's not there."

Jack grabbed her hand and prepared to guide her out of the store, but before he could go, a female security guard approached to scold them. She was pregnant as well.

"I'm going to have to ask you to leave," said the guard. She was thumbing the coin in her hand, as if ready to flip.
1132122111.title: (FP, Day 4) "I used to own that coin," ...

choices: (FP, Day 4+5) Jack controls himself, sets the coin down.  They plan.
(FP, Day 4+5) Jack flips the coin, looking at himself or Jenny
(FP, Day 4+5) Jack flips the coin, but Jenny covers his eyes before he can look.
11321221111.content:
The coin flipped perilously into the air as the guard glared at both of them. In the instant that she saw it fly, Jenny panicked. She swiped at the coin and swiftly caught it during its decent, looking at the guard. As she did so, the guard's face contorted with discomfort. Her hands flung to her belly as she was forced to sit herself down beside the fountain.

Jenny grabbed Jack's hand and yanked him away. The guard shouted at them from behind, but they paid her no mind. With the coin retrieved, Jenny and Jack returned to her apartment.

It was still tense. Jack was glad they managed to get lucky and escape before more attention was drawn to them, while Jenny was horrified at what she had done.

"You saw what happened, right?" she asked him.

"No? She got sick."

"Jack, she flipped the coin. When I caught it..." She couldn't finish the thought.

"Yeah?"

"Nevermind." Jenny prayed silently for the security guard

"Look," Jack said. "I bought a stethoscope." He put it in his ears and held up the resonator. I'll prove it to you. I would hear a heartbeat if I was having a baby, okay?"

She looked at his belly, biting her thumb. "Maybe you should sit down first."

"Alright, I'll sit down. Join me," he said. The two traveled to the couch and sat next to each other.

"Let me listen first," said Jenny. She had an odd expression.

"Okay." He handed her the stethoscope. When Jenny held the stethoscope's resonator to Jack's swollen stomach, she froze. She started exploring his belly, inching over it with mad intent, until Jack had enough.

"Alright, Jenny. You're being weird. Give it back."

"Jack, wait. There's um--there's more than one heartbeat."

"More than one heart beat?" He asked, disbelieving.

"Yes. A...a lot more than one."

Jack snatched the stethoscope from her and listened for himself. The cacophony of beating sounds flooded his ears. Try as he could, he couldn't count how many hearts there were, but she was right. Jenny had been telling the truth. As he listened, he noticed the squirming sensation again, and a mild tapping from within. The realization made him sick, and he rushed to the bathroom.

When he finished, he made it to the doorway before he looked in horror at his girlfriend.

"What is this?" he asked. "Is this a joke?" Jenny sobbed a bit in reply, unsure of what to say. Jack hurried over to the coin where is lay and brandished it about. "What the fuck is this thing?"

"Jack, set that down," Jenny warned.

"I'm going to set it on fire," he fumed.

"No, Jack, you don't understand. That thing makes you want to flip it. You need to set it down."

"Makes you want to flip it?" Jack scoffed. Again, Jenny was right. He could feel a sudden urge coursing through him, as if a voice was whispering in his ear, guiding his hand.

He held the coin in his hand.
11321221111.title: (FP, Day 4) Jenny catches the coin mid-flip, an...

choices: (FP, Day 6) The Doctor gives Jack the wrong diagnosis (sonogram reveal)
(FP, Day 6) Jack decides to tell his parents.
(FP, Night 5/Day 6) Jack and Jenny share an intimate night.
113212211113.content:
He couldn't help it. The compulsion this time was too much, and Jack flipped the coin. Just as she did at the mall, Jenny leapt into action. With one hand, she tried to swipe the coin in the air, but she missed. As it fell towards the ground, she placed her other hand over Jack's eyes, forcing the lids closed. The coin fell to the ground, but she didn't dare look at it.

They were still for a moment, until it was clear that nothing had happened.

"Sorry," Jack said, uncomfortable. Jenny grabbed him with her other arm, still blocking his vision, and pulled him toward her bedroom.

"Give me a minute. I have a plan," she said. They wobbled their way towards her dresser, where she pulled out a sash that she normally used for cosplay. Jack was using his hands to make sure that hers never left his eyes. Jenny then wrapped the sash around his head, and slipped her hand out. Before he could open his eyes, it was already pitch black.

"We're screwed," he grumbled. "Help me sit down." They got him onto the bed, where they continued to mull over the situation. The whole thing sat heavy with Jack. There was no telling how he would get the unborn children out (and they still had no idea how many there were), so they would have to schedule a doctor's appointment.

"The bill would go to my parents' insurance. I'll have to pay up front," Jack surmised, intent on keeping the whole thing secret. The expense would be serious, though.

"I've been trying to call my roommate," Jenny said. "I wanted to see if getting rid of the coin would help her."

"How was that supposed to help, again?"

"I don't know. I thought the evil juju would be appeased, or something."

"This isn't The Ring." They were quiet again.

"I'll make dinner. Stay there, and don't get up without my help."

"Can't do much blind," he said.

The rest of the day went swiftly by. Jenny scheduled a checkup for two days ahead. Jack's other senses became more acute in his blindness, and the reality of his body became all too real. They even discussed the darker possibilities: finding a back alley, where the unspeakable is committed. It was an exhausting conversation, but Jack ultimately rejected the idea. The day finally ended.

Day Five.

Jack woke up feeling distinctly different. His belly had grown significantly this time, and destroyed his center of balance. Jenny helped him to the bathroom to pee, where he had to sit down.

"How do I look?"

"Um. Like you're nine months along?" She tried to say gently.

"Christ." His hands explored the protrusion. He froze. Jenny had started applying a cream to the bottom half of his abdomen without telling him. "What are you doing?"

"I'm shaving you."

"Must look pretty gross," he guessed. "I don't suppose this is some weird turn-on for you?"

"No."

When she finished shaving him, she thought he looked a little better.

"If it makes you feel any better, you look just like any other fat guy," she said.

"It doesn't."

Jenny lead him to the couch and plopped him down. His hands rushed to his stomach, and it was clear why. Jenny placed her hand on top of his and hugged him tight. They were clearly kicking.

Jack felt no maternal instinct, and no awe. His feelings were overridden by discomfort. The rest of the day went by without much to do, until Jenny came up with a crazy plan.

Jack heard a meowing in front of him. "What are we doing?"

"It's the neighbor's cat," Jenny whispered. "When I take off the sash, look directly at it." Jack did so. The world seemed to shimmer in front of him, and he noticed the cat change in from on him.

"I didn't see a change," Jenny said from behind him.

"I did," Jack replied.

"Good." They turned to each other.

"Thank you," Jack said, holding her tightly.
113212211113.title: (FP, Day 4+5) Jack flips the coin, but Jenny co...

choices: (FP, Day 6/7) J&J hunt down Lavern, the Occult salesman from the flea market
(FP, Day 6/7) J&J visit Jack's (partially?) body-swapped parents...
(FP, Day 6/7) J&J visit Alice, Jenny's former roommate.
1132122111131.content:
There was no hiding the condition that Jack Jr. was in. In the morning he was shocked to observe the difference. The occasional movements of his children were utterly surreal as the changed his shape. His skin was taut and uncomfortable.

Jenny and he went to the hospital for their scheduled appointment, but the doctor that they were supposed to meet was running late. It took a long time to actually get a room, and a longer time before anyone showed up to talk to them. They started getting restless, so Jack started thinking uncomfortable thoughts.

"Jenny. Do you want to be a mom?"

She looked at him, confused. He continued.

"I mean, with me. Did you want to have kids with me?"

She sat next to him and placed her hand on his. "I thought it was on the table, but I hadn't thought too much about it."

"Are we really going to be parents?" he asked. "How are we going to raise them? You're still trying to be a game designer, and I was on a gap year."

"You could get your parents' to help out?"

"Yeah, they might like that. But they won't look at me the same way again. It'll be like I'm not a son to them. I shouldn't be like this." He was almost crying.

Jenny leaned her head against his, one hand placed onto his stomach. "If I could take them, I would," she said.

Jack's phone buzzed. His parents were probably concerned about him being gone for nearly a whole week. The message, however, didn't make sense.

"Don't come home yet," Jack read aloud.

"Is something wrong?"

"Let me see." After a minute, another confusing text arrived. "Fumigating? No way that's true."

The door opened for a different doctor to arrive than they expected. He was a young man with gelled back hair and a twirly mustache

"Mr. Dale? I'm Dr. Koff; I'll be substituting for your regular Doctor, Dr. Chin. It seems he's tied up with an emergency. What seems to be the problem?"

"I'm pregnant," Jack said bluntly. The physician was unmoved.

"Interesting. Can you describe your symptoms for me?" Dr. Koff began to write notes on his clipboard as he talked.

"Doctor," Jenny interrupted. "This is going to seem really strange. My boyfriend's stomach has been growing a lot recently, and it he's been moody and nauseous."

"Hm. Mr. Dale, I'm going to list off a series of symptoms. Just tell me if they fit with your situation."

"Okay."

"First question: Do you have any history of mental disorders in your family?"

The question segment went on far longer than Jack was comfortable. He was then given very basic tests, observing his heart rate, his walking pattern, and whether he could reach his toes. The last one was particularly humiliating. Finally, the doctor excused himself to get a sonogram machine.

"He's weird," Jenny said. Her phone chimed. "It's Alice!" Her roommate. "She gave birth yesterday."

"Gave birth?" Jack worried. "Where is she?"

"I told you, she's with her parents."

"Speaking of which..." Jack said. He got his phone and called his dad. He was normally quick to answer his phone, but this time took several rings.

"Hello, Junior," said his mother's voice.

"Mom? I have to talk to you about something."

"Son, I can't talk now. Did you get your mo...I mean, did you get my message?"

"Yes. What's going on?" Jack needed to know.

"Listen, it's unsafe at home. You remember that lamp your mother bought? There's something wrong with it."

Jack stared at his phone.

"What do you mean, Mom?" There was a sigh on the other end.

"Look, son. Frankly, I'm not your Mom, and I can't talk right now." The phone hung up.

Doctor Koff returned with the sonogram machine. Jack was stunned by his conversation, but he was forced to lie back. The setup was quick, and the gel was applied to his belly. Everything felt wrong to Jack as he listened again to the many heartbeats play on the speakers.

"Can you turn the sound off?" Jenny asked, observing his discomfort. Dr. Koff did so, but paid more attention to the screen.

"I won't lie to you, Mr. Dale. There are certainly large foreign masses in your abdomen."

"How many?" Jack asked. The doctor shushed him. After some time, the doctor appeared to have gotten an accurate count.

"Congratulations, Mr. Dale. You're a quintuplet."

"A quintuplet?"

"Yes. If you allow me, I can show you each of the four masses. They are quite larger than usual in this case, and much more developed, but I believe we have an advanced case of multiple fetus in fetu."

"Why congratulations?" Jack asked.

"Because you're alive," said Dr. Koff.

The doctor was a quack, Jack decided.
1132122111131.title: (FP, Day 6) The Doctor gives Jack the wrong dia...

choices: FP (Day 7) Jack and Jenny take the lamp and read the tome.
FP (Day 7) Jack and Jenny stay to console the Dale parents
FP (Day 7) Before they can act, the coin and lamp react to each other.
11321221111311.content:
Four babies. And they were well developed. As Jack and Jenny guessed it would only be a few more days before they fully matured, and the prospect terrified Jack. How would they even get out? The situation demanded surgery, but would doctors even know what to do? The thought of four children being dependent on him was also overwhelming.

They left the hospital as quickly as possible after finding out. The bill was steep, and Jack decided to use his parents' insurance anyway. They had enough going on, apparently, that his problems would be a footnote. The doctor said that they could only schedule surgery in another couple of weeks, but there was no waiting that long.

"I need to see mom and dad," Jack told his girlfriend.

"Wait. What if we make things worse by going? They said not to."

"I can't just do nothing," Jack affirmed.

"Yes, but we have enough problems." Jenny unzipped her purse and lifted up the coin briefly, attached to the end of a long magnet. It was an attempt to keep it from being flipped. "I would like to check on my friend and make sure she's okay, but I wouldn't forgive myself if I flipped this within her general vicinity."

"Okay," said Jack. "Then we need to get rid of that thing, and we need to see if there's any way to undo this and the magic lamp. If I find that Lavern guy, I swear I'm going to hurt him."

"Who's Lavern?" Jenny asked. Jack informed her of the occult salesman. "Isn't today the last day of the swap meet?

"We better get going, then."

They raced to the location of the flea market, the sun having long since receded. When they arrived, they saw many booths and tables cleaning up. Jack hauled himself as well as he could out of the car and waddled over to where he had last seen Lavern. Thankfully, the young man was still there.

"Did you grow a tumor?" asked Lavern.

"Did you sell my parents a lamp?" Jack asked.

"Uh, I dunno. I had a lamp..."

Jack grabbed him by the collar.

"My mother nearly died because of that lamp. You better make amends."

"Woah, there, Willy. I can give you your money back if you want."

"I don't want the money," Jack hissed. "I want something I can use."

"What's that supposed to mean?" asked the terrified Lavern.

"Do you have a book on the occult things that you sold? Anything like that?"

"Huh? Yeah, I do, I do. Let me get it out." Lavern hastily found a rustic tome and handed it over. "Free of charge. We good?"

"We'll see," said Jenny.

Jack tried his best to read the tome as they drove to his parents' house. There were all kinds of items referenced in the pages: amulets, lamps, and even beverage concoctions. On one of the later pages, he found the coin.

"We're here," Jenny said. It was dark out, but Jack saw the porch light of his home. On the mat was the innocuous lamp that his mother had bought.

"What's going on?" He thought. He and Jenny walked up to the porch. The simple object seemed foreboding now. Jenny pulled a pair of gloves from her tongs from her purse.

"Why do you have those?" he asked.

"In case I dropped the coin," she whispered.

There were footfalls just inside the door.

"Is that you, Junior?" called his mother's voice.

"Yeah, mom, it's me. What's going on? Why's the lamp on the porch?"

"Well, your mother didn't want it in the house, you see," answered the same voice. "I told her it only works when it's plugged in, but she wouldn't feel comfortable if she wasn't far away."

Jack and Jenny glanced at each other. "Dad, do you have mom's voice?"

"Well, uh....sport? Right now, the only thing of mine I have is my pinky toe, and she's got the rest. Every time we used the lamp, it kind of...activated or something."

There was a silence. His father didn't seem to want to go on.

"I can't let you see me like this, son. I'm sorry. Come back tomorrow."

"Dad..." Jack muttered.
11321221111311.title: (FP, Day 6/7) J&J hunt down Lavern, the Occult ...

choices: Jenny agrees, but swapping babies requires a special ceremony.
Jenny hesitates.  She's afraid of being pregnant.
Something (The cat? The coin?) interrupts their discussion.
113212211113111.content:
"What do you want to do, Jack?" Jenny asked. They stood awkwardly on the porch for a minute. Everything was so messed up, Jack couldn't think straight. He didn't want to leave his parents alone, but he didn't want them to see him like this.

He grabbed the lamp.

"I'll be back soon, Dad." he called.

"Bye, son."

As they walked back to the car, Jenny comforted him as best she could. The lamp was thrown into the back of the car, and they returned to the apartment.

Just outside, they found the cat from the previous day, glowering at them. It was held in remaining lap of its owner, who was relaxing on a community bench.

"Hello, Ms. Barton," called Jenny.

"Good evening, Jenny. Taking care of yourself?" Sierra Barton was nice woman, and Jenny liked to be respectful to her.

"Yes," Jenny said, as Jack continued walking past. "How about you?"

"Oh, I'm wonderful. Do you see anything different about me?" she asked. Jenny had never been asked this by her before.

"Did you get new earrings?" There was a pause.

"Yes, they're quite beautiful. You should get a set for yourself at Louise's shop."

Jenny excused herself and returned to her home. While she did, Sierra Barton returned to caressing her tiny belly.

They were both exhausted, and decided to go to bed. Jack lay uncomfortably on his side, facing his girlfriend. Instinctively, they cuddled together, and Jenny's hand lightly caressed his stomach.

Day 7
--------

Jack's bump had grown yet again. It was, frankly, enormous and taut. He was almost worried that the doctor had miscounted the number of children.

Jenny put the lamp and the coin in the closet, hoping to stay far away from them. As she did, though, she could almost hear a voice calling out to her. Out of fear, she ran away from it. They got to reading the book about the items for any knowledge that they could gain.

The accounts were lengthy, and the background information was hard to understand.

"So I have two days left," said Jack, the prospect grim.

"Then, what, you give birth at midnight on the ninth day?"

"It doesn't specify." Jack sighed and leaned back into the couch. Every part of him ached. Jenny cuddled up against him and continued to read. Only, she did this by placing the book on his stomach, which was annoying.

"I don't understand this part about "remaking the world." As in, rewrites reality? How does that work?" Jenny asked.

"No idea. What's that bit about the heads side? Does it make the subject accept the change, or does it fool them into thinking they were always pregnant?" Jack was not amused.

"So if I flip the coin and get heads, I could make you enjoy this?" Jenny teased.

"Don't. You would also turn me into a beached whale."

The reading for the lamp also a long process.

"So it swaps people's body parts that are close together." Jenny surmised.

"This was Mom's reading lamp."

"I hope they're okay."

"Yeah. They're probably freaked out."

They day began to wind down without much progress. The book was hard to understand. Jack and Jenny were both distracted. Jack by the unborn, and Jenny by a vague sound at the edge of hearing. She thought she heard a voice calling to her.

It was approaching midnight, when Jack suddenly had an idea. But whether it would be accepted was another issue altogether. The tome mentioned something about the items within being compatible

"Jenny."

"Jack?" Jenny asked, ready to fall asleep.

"Do you love me?" That got her attention.

"Of course I do."

"Would you be willing to try something for me?"

"Oh, God, you want to have sex, don't you?"

"W-what? I'm serious." Jack said.

Jenny blushed. Jack summoned up his courage

"Jenny, would you give birth to these children for me?" Jack finally asked.
113212211113111.title: FP (Day 7) Jack and Jenny take the lamp and rea...

choices: (FP, Day 8) Jack and Jenny experiment with the coin and lamp.
(FP, Day 8) After an intimate rest, the coin's magic seeps out.
1132122111131112.content:
Jenny froze. She couldn't believe what she had heard. She looked at her boyfriend. He was impossible. She loved him dearly, and she could see how much strain his circumstances were causing him. The weight, in a very literal sense, was also exhausting him. She remembered the panic that she had gone through when the same thing happened to her roommate. All the while she considered his request, the voice of the coin was tempting her inside her mind.

She couldn't do it. The agitation was becoming overwhelming. Jack heaved himself over to her, and held her hands.

"Please do this for me," he asked.

"I..."

He saw the stress on her face. Something terrible was bothering her. She squeezed his hands and wouldn't let go.

"I can't," she whispered.

"Why not? Jenny, I don't exactly know how I'm supposed to get these out."

"I know I should. I just can't go through that again."

Jack considered what she had said. "Again?" Jenny took a deep breath, tears in her eyes.

"It was a long time ago. Before we met. I was only eighteen. It was at some party. I got pregnant." She started to sob.

"You have a child?" Jack asked.

"No," Jenny wailed.

Jack waited for her to recover.

"I lost her," was all that Jenny said. She leaned into Jack and cried. She could feel the unborn moving within him, but she didn't know how to feel. It should have been the other way around. Jack held her for a while until she finished crying.

"Why don't you get some rest?" he suggested. "I'll keep working."

The clock struck midnight, and the eight day began with them holding each other in their arms. Jack's stomach, already an impressive boulder, began to grow further and push the two ever so slightly apart. In the shock of the sudden growth, they let go.

"Like I said, I'll stay up and keep working."

Jenny shook her head. "We should get some sleep."

As they considered, the thrum of the coin seemed to grow stronger.
1132122111131112.title: (7) Jenny hesitates. She's afraid of being pre...

choices: One-third of the people in Jenny's building was pregnant. (Reality Change)
Half of the people in Jenny's building was pregnant.  (Reality Change)
Three-fourths of the people in Jenny's building was pregnant. (Reality Change)
11321221111311122.content:
"I don't need sleep, we need to figure this out!" Jack shouted, pointing at his enormous pregnant belly for emphasis.

"You're not going to do yourself any favors if you're tired. I know your scared, but some rest will do you good. It'll do the babies good" She said placing a hand on his pregnant belly.

"Please don't talk about it.." Jack said looking away.

"THEM, Jack. If we can't figure this out, we have to talk about.. our babies.." Jenny said.

"Our babies?" Jack answered, resting his hands atop his pregnant stomach,

"We need to talk about a Plan B. I'm sorry I can't take them from you..." Jenny said, exploring the vastness of Jack's pregnant self.
"But I can be there for you. It might not be exactly what we had planned for the future, but... every child needs a mother" Jenny said, kneeling down and kissing his pregnant belly.

"Don't - - You don't know what you're committing to" placing a hand on her shoulder.

"Yes I do. But it may not even come to that. Let's get some sleep and we can figure out what's going on in the morning. We still have some time before..." Jenny said, giving Jack's belly another kiss.

"Before?" Jack said accepting his possible fatherhood fate.

"Before we need to buy diapers and cribs. Or I do at least. I'm not sure hauling you out to the mall is the best idea right now. Come to bed. I'll massage your back and feet. Every preggo loves that" She smiled grabbing Jack hand and leading him to the bedroom.

"Stttttoooopppp" Jack whined, waddling behind Jenny. "I really hate it when you do that" Jenny kiss him on the lips with a wicked smile. "Then you'll love what comes after the teasing preggo. Sit on the bed and let's see how we can make this work..." She said shutting the door.

As Jack and Jenny become closer, both emotionally and physically, two cosmic forces of mischief were about to collide.

As the coin laid on the table, seemingly harmless, it began. The thruming noise increased, almost a dull hum, like the subtle hum of office lights.

The coin glowed, seem to grow larger as the lamp magical mystical mischievous energy amplified the coin aura. The hum grew louder as suddenly a slight POP! emerged as the energy emerged in an near invisible shockwave explosion. Lights flickered, a small tremor shook the building, cars alarms began to go off.

Behind the door, the squeaking spring symphony momentarily paused.
From behind the door, the voices of Jack and Jenny engaged in a brief conversation.
"What the hell was that?" Jack asked, clearly panting.
"Earthquake or something. Who knows. Stay focus and grab me this way. This is the only way it will work." Jenny said panting.
"I'm not sure I'm still that flexible you know?" Jack answered.
"Shut up and kiss me. We can probably still do this" Jenny answered back.

Moments later the sound of squeaking bedsprings could be heard again.

The sun rose several hours later as Jenny emerged from the bedroom with a satisfied look on her face.
All things considered, last night was pretty good for the both of them. Though the day would bring new challenges, Jenny believes that last nights "activities" would help them focus their minds.

Jenny moved over to the coffee pot and began to make a new pot. She made just a small pot, as Jenny was trying to keep Jack on a strictly healthy pregnancy diet. No coffee for Jack. She smiled to herself at that prospect and began to see what she could make for breakfast. She was thinking something simple yet healthy, as she took several pieces of fruit from the bowl.

Fruit, eggs, toast, milk. Just what a preggo needs She thought to herself. It wasn't Jack's level of cooking, but it would do.
She would need to if she was going to be... Mom. Jenny shook her head and pushed the thought out of her mind.

Not yet. We still have a chance to fix this Jenny thought. She looked at the clock. 8:34 AM. Later then they usually started, but Jack needed all the rest he could. It was good for him, physically and emotionally.

The slight thrum began again. Thrum thrum thrum It was stronger this time. It made her teeth tingle slightly every now and then.

The coin was building up for another large burst sometime later today... But Jenny was unaware. Unaware of what had transpired during their eventful rest.

THUD!

That was the sound of the newspaper hitting the door. Right on time Jenny thought.

She poured herself a cup of coffee and went to the door.

Stepping out into her apartment hallway, she bent down to grab the paper. She began to read some of the early morning headlines when she heard the two next door neighbors on her left and right open.

"Hey Jenny!" A male voice said. It was Mr. Henry Patterson, an older divorcee who just recently moved into the building. For a guy in his late 40's, Jenny thought he was pretty attractive... if she was into older guys.

Turning her head to meet Mr. Patterson and wish him good morning, her eyes went wide and the coffee cup tumbled from her hand.

It CRASHED onto the hallway rug spilling the contents onto the floor as it shattered into several pieces.

Mr. Patterson wasn't wearing his usual suit-and-tie he usually wore for work. Quite the opposite. He was dressed in sweatpants and white T-shirt that clung to him like a glove. On his middle was a very large, very pregnant belly. He looked ready to pop!

His shirt rode up exposing the vast pregnant midsection as it hung low, exposing his popped out belly button.

"What's the matter?" He asked, placing one hand into the small of his back, and streching, causing his pregnant belly to stick out even farther.

"You're--- you're--- you're" Jenny stammered.

"On paternity leave? Yeah. I can't wait for these two to be born." He said with a smile behind his salt-and-pepper beard. "Be honest, do chicks dig single dads? I read that somewhere. The dad bod they said. I hope so, because God, I don't think I'm ever going to lose the baby weight" He said giving his belly an firm slap.

"Just another two weeks. Man, I can't believe this is really happening. I still don't and look at me" He said turning to expose Jenny to more angles of his pregnancy. "Gone from top manager at the firm to a beach pregnant whale sitting on his couch, reading pregnancy books. I think I read everyone of them twice. Although, they didn't really have anything that helped me out... But I guess being pregnant is being pregnant right? I mean, look at Seirra over there." Henry said, wrapping his hands around his pregnancy.

Slowly, and with the greatest fear in her heart, she turned to meet her next door neighbor, the crazy cat lady, Seirra Barton.
She stood at the door, her pregnant belly hanging out of her cat shirt. She wore a pair of gym shorts covered in cats. She looked just as pregnant as Henry!

"Oof you two!" She said, giving her belly a slap. "Treat Mommy better or I'll drop you two off at the pound!" She said with a smirk at her own joke.

Seirra Barton, the crazy cat lady of 3B in her early 50's was pregnant. Very pregnant, and nobody seemed to notice that she wasn't yesterday.

"Hello Henry! Looking large!" Seirra said waving, as she put out her cat to go exploring. She gave her own pregnant belly a good pat for emphasis.

"Thanks Seirra! Just what I wanted to hear. How you feelin' over there?" Henry shot back. "Like a walking house on swollen legs. I had no idea being pregnant was this hard! God, none of my cat shirts fit! I hope these two know what they're doing to their poor mother!" Seirra answered back pressing her hands into her back.

"Yeah, but it's worth it right? That's what everyone else has been saying at the pregnancy group." Henry smiled.

"Preg-preg-pregnancy group?" Jenny stammered. WHAT WAS HAPPENING?

"Yeah, you know. The building pregnancy group. It's been a life-saver for Seirra and myself. Everything we wanted to know about pregnancy, birth and child-rearing. I understand why you haven't come but you must have seen the fliers for months!"

"Months?" Jenny stammered.

"Yeah. We OOF. That was a big one" Henry said giving his belly a pat.

"I gotta go. I gotta go now" Jenny said stepping back into her apartment and slamming the door.

The thruming continued.

"Jack! JACK!" She screamed running to the bedroom....
11321221111311122.title: (FP, Day 8) After an intimate rest, the coin...

choices: As Jack and Jenny experiment with the items, his parents call...(reserved)
As they experiment during the barbecue, the coin seems to weaken and melt
The experiment goes awry, and the coin's power explodes.
113212211113111222.content:
"What is it," Jack grumbled. He heaved himself up into a sitting position as Jenny rushed into the room. She was briefly taken aback by his naked body, but continued.

"We have a problem. I was just outside, and the neighbors--they're pregnant too."

"What?!"

"Yeah. Ms. Barton and Mr. Patterson both. I just saw them." Jenny put her hands on her head, panicking. The thrum of the coin persisted in the background.

"There's another pregnant guy? What did he say?" Jack asked.

"He wasn't even confused," Jenny breathed. The previous conversation had her reeling. Jack made for his clothes, but the only things that still fit were a hoodie and a pair of sweats. Even then, the hoodie was tight. He waddled over and grabbed his girlfriend by the hand.

"Let's check it out."

They saw a poster outside for a barbecue being held by the pregnancy group. The organizer of the group was a woman named Charmaigne Atley. She was in the apartment adjacent to Jenny's, and by the description she was pregnant too.

"How many apartments are in this building again?"

"Eight."

"So that's, what, nearly half the tenants that are pregnant now? What could have done that?"

"Oh God, what if using the coin on the cat made it infectious?" Jenny blurted. Jack tried his best to calm her down.

"What? Don't be ridiculous. No way that could happen." He despondently felt his own swollen belly. "Maybe we should attend the barbecue and get some info."

"You should!" chimed in a stranger from behind. They turned to spot Charmaigne Atley. She was a short, petite black woman with long dreadlocks. In her center was a large pregnant belly, jutting out from her tiny frame. Her eyes grew big when looking at Jack. "The group has been a great way for all of us help each other out. What's your name?"

"Jack." He was a little hesitant to to talk with her. He felt exposed. "I'm Jenny's--"

"--Friend from college. He's just visiting," Jenny hurriedly said. "I would like to attend, though. I want to congratulate everyone properly. Will everyone else in the building be there?"

"That's right," Charmaigne said. "I'm so glad that I got Dylan to promise to bring her cornbread. This little one has been craving it for all week."

The plans were made, and Jack and Jenny returned to the apartment.

Jack wondered. "Did we just teleport to a parallel universe or something?"

"I don't know. I'll see what I can find out at the barbecue." The barbecue scheduled for noon.

Jack got the paper pad where they had been writing notes from the tome. They knew that the items could be used together, and that their effects might change. Both items worked in a similar way. They affected the next person that was looked at by the user. Jack took the two artifacts and placed them on the table by the window.

They formed a plan, and waited for the barbecue to begin. Everyone from the building was attending. Jack stayed in the room, while Jenny went out to talk. At regular intervals, Jenny was going to walk out of sight, while Jack tried to use the lamp on the attendants. When he held the coin in one hand, and the lamp’s pull chain in the other, he felt a current pass through him. He took this to mean that the objects were reacting to each other.

For all they knew, there was no method of reversing the effects of the coin by itself. The only option that they saw was to try to add something new to the environment. For now, he intended only to pull the chain of the lamp, and not to flip the coin.

The party began...
113212211113111222.title: Half of the people in Jenny's building were ...

choices: Jack sees his reflection in Jenny's eyes, which undoes the coin's magic.
Jack opens his eyes to see Jenny, which causes...
They use the cat again, and either keep trying or settle on parenthood.
1132122111131112221.content:
"How do you feel about having twins, Ms. Barton?" Jenny asked.

"Oh, dear, didn't I tell you, Jenny? I'm having triplets," Ms. Barton said

The experiment was going cleanly. Everyone from the building was outside, helping to prepare the party for all of the tenants. Ms. Barton, Ms. Atley, and Mr. Patterson had been the Jack's focus. He sat uncomfortably by the window, peering at the gathering. As he held the coin in his left hand, and the lamp's chain in his right, he focused his attention on the three as best as he could. Unfortunately, the other tenants would sometimes get in the way. The result was that the babies would movie between tenants for each pull of the chain. No one seemed to notice that changes.

He was careful to keep Jenny out of his sight. He was terrified of making their situation worse. In truth, he wasn't sure how whether this experiment would fix anything for them. It was an extremely dangerous thing to do, considering what had been happening to his parents, but Jack had not been affected by the artifacts as of yet.

The coin was growing hot inside of his hand, and a thrum of power was resounding in his ears. It was growing more intense over time. The voice that tempted him to flip it had vanished, but he wasn't sure what to make of that.

His phone rang. It was his father. Jack worriedly put the phone on speaker.

"How are you doing, dad?"

"We're doing okay, son," said his mother's voice.

"Mom?"

"No, it's your father. I wanted to make sure that you were okay."

Jack thought about that. Jenny had been incredibly supportive during this ordeal. He didn't know what he was going to do about being a father, though. He hadn't even properly chose a career for himself. How was he supposed to support four children and Jenny?

"Nevermind about me, Dad. What about you and Mom?"

Jack Sr.'s voice began to change tone. "Well, that's part of why I wanted to call. See, I hope you're not playing with that magical doo-hickie."

Jack Jr. pulled the chain a couple more times as he looked at the barbecue. "Nope," he said.

"Well, if you had been, I wanted to let you know that the affects seem to be wearing off. I'm mostly the same again. I just wish my voice would get back to normal."

Jack paused. The lamp's power wore off over time? "You're doing better?"

"Yes, it seems over the past hour we've been getting back to normal pretty quickly."

The prep for the barbecue, and their experiment, had started about the same time. He may have been undoing the curse on his parents. Jack started pulling more frequently on the chain as he looked at the party.

"That's good to hear, Dad," Jack said.

"Yes, I'm glad it's going away," his father said, finally sounding normal. "There was something else that I wanted to talk with you about. I looked the peep hole when you visited, and um..."

Jack made a final pull of the chain. There was no getting around this conversation. "Um, dad? Do you remember that cheap coin that I bought?"

"Not really, son."

"Well, uh, the point is that Jenny and I are..." He had to force it out. "We're pregnant."

There was silence.

"Ah," his father finally said. "What are you going to do?"

"What can I do?" Jack mumbled. The experiment on the barbecue didn't seem to be undoing the affects of the coin, but if it had spare his parents, that was still something. The coin was becoming hotter in his hand.

"Well, son, there are things a man has to do for his family."

"I feel more like the mother in this situation."

"Yes, well, about that, Junior. There comes a point where a man has to, well, man up. And some responsibilities can't be dodged, or ignored. I was happy to let you figure out what you want to do with your life, but if life is calling you to something--then that's what you need to focus on."

Jack was having a hard time speaking. He looked down at the heavy mass of his abdomen, where four children resided. "I think this might be too much for me."

"Junior. You know your mother and I will always be there for you. Quite frankly, she'll be over the moon to hear the news. She was so excited when she found out that you would have a brother, and here I am ready to parent again as well. I didn't expect to experience what your mother went through, but that's that."

Jack froze. "No. No. No." He turned back to the part to the party and began to pull rapidly on the chain. The bellies of the tenants shrank and grew at alarming rates. Each time he pulled the chain, the coin became hotter in his hand. It was starting to burn.

"You okay, son?" asked his father after the silence.

The coin burned hot, and Jack yelped in pain. He dropped it. The coin, glowing red, bounced off of the wooden floor and flipped many times. Jack dropped as best as he could to try and catch it, but he only found himself staring at the result. Tails. As he fell, he had pulled the chain one final time and let go.

If he saw anyone, it would be a disaster gain. Jack Jr. forced his eyes shut, but the magic of the lamp was still in effect. He had looked at the inside of his own eyelids, and for the lamp that was enough.

He felt a current run through him, and his body grow hot. As he sank against the wall, eyes shut, Jack grabbed his phone and hung up. He would have to wait for Jenny. Pressure mounted inside his belly, and he felt the mound of flesh with his hands. To his horror, the skin stretched, and his belly swelled outward. It was slow, but constant. His breath labored, and his body grew heavy. He was on the verge of tears.

He sat there, immobile for a time, keeping his eyes shut. His belly was broad, and had grown out to the length of his knees. Every child that the coin had created, that had not been born, had been transferred into him.

"Jack! It worked!" screamed Jenny as she ran into the apartment. She was shocked when she entered her room and saw her boyfriend in his condition. "Oh, Jack."

She ran to his side and held his head in her arms. She placed her forehead against his, and whispered, "It will be alright." Jack tried hard to keep his eyes shut as he cried.
1132122111131112221.title: As Jack and Jenny experiment with the items, hi...

choices: (Epilogue) Jack and Jenny's life together, a few months later.
(Continue) Time passes.  Is the curse still somehow in play?
(Continue) Whatever happened to Sierra Barton's suspicious cat?
11321221111311122211.content:
Jack and Jenny held each other close. There was no thinking about how much trouble they were in. There was only the two of them together, for all that they were concerned. Jenny didn't know how he had turned out this way, but it didn't matter. She wiped the tears from his cheeks with her hands. On the floor, the coin was red hot and shaking, it's magic unstable.

Jack couldn't help from opening his eyes and looking into Jenny's. He saw his own reflection as he peered into them.

In that moment, the coin was overtaxed, and it came across a contradiction. It couldn't focus on either Jack or Jenny, could not prioritize between the two. The stress of the magic caused the coin to crack and spark. They turned to see the artifact sputter and flip itself again and again, until it broke into pieces on the floor.

In the very instant, it's magic was undone. Jack's figure was restored to normal in a flash, as if nothing had happened. He and Jenny were ecstatic, and they embraced each other.

"I can't believe it," Jack whispered.

They turned to look outside at the ongoing barbecue. The signs had changed to that of a generic birthday party, and no on attending was expecting any longer.

Jack called his parents back. They were fine. It was an awkward conversation, but everything was back to normal, and that was all that mattered.

They threw both the fragments of the coin and the whole of the lamp into the garbage, and disposed of them.

Jack and Jenny returned to college. Jenny's life continued more or less ordinarily, but her roommate decided to move out to raise her new children. Jack moved in. The experience had shaken Jack into thinking more about his future, and he took on life in a more determined fashion. They were closer for their experience, and more firmly looking forward to their lives together.

The End
11321221111311122211.title: Jack sees his reflection in Jenny's eyes (end)

choices: Ms. Barton’s order from the baby store was arriving. Wait what?!
The coins magic was amplified by the lamp and began to seep out inthe building
A knock on the door. Somebody order a pizza?
1132122111131113.content:
Before Jenny could respond, there arose such a clatter, Jenny sprang from her chair to see what the hell was the matter...

It was..
1132122111131113.title: Who  interrupts them?

choices: The curse bleeds from the cat to Jack, making him more pregnant (not with kits!)
The curse bleeds from the cat to Jenny, impregnating her.
11321221111311131.content:

"How're you doing, Sierra? What's all of the commotion?"

Ms. Barton cupped her face in her hands and sighed.

"I'm just getting some supplies brought in. Unexpected deliveries coming up." She rubbed her bump for emphasis.

"Well, um, congratulations," Jenny replied. "I didn't know you were seeing anyone."

"Oh, I wasn't, dear. Best not to think about it. It's just..."

"Everything okay?"

"I'm afraid I won't be able to take care of my poor cat with these two coming along. She's expecting kittens as well. I'm going to be swimming in little babies soon."

"Congratulations again."

"I don't suppose you have any need for kittens?"

"Me? No, I've never been good with cats."

"Well, I'm sure you could get used to it. It would help me out an awful lot."

Jenny was beginning to suspect something.

"You know what, Sierra, why don't I take care of Sapphire while you get everything unpacked."

"Oh, you're a blessing, Jenny. Really you are."

Jenny brought the cat into her apartment. Jack was twiddling his thumbs on the couch as he was brought up to speed. He glanced at the cat that Jenny had brought in. The one that they had turned into an experiment. She was glaring at him. Accusing. "I know what you did," it seemed to say.

1132122111132.content:
"Well that's settled" Jenny said with a smile. One small problem down, another HUGE one to deal with.

"So what now?" Jack asked rubbing his pregnant stomach.

"Well..." Jenny trailed off thinking to herself.

"I don't like the sound of that well..." Jack answered back.

"I was thinking about the bill.. for the doctor's appointment. It's going to go to your parents..Which means they're going to find out... So..."

Another swift KICK from his occupants caused Jack to grimace.

"We tell your parents" Jenny finally rushed out under her breath.

"I'm sorry what?!" Jack answered back sharply his voice raising a few levels as he hefted his pregnant form of the couch.

"Jack, please you should sit.." Jenny said meekly. She knew this would happen.

"You want to tell my parents that... I'm.. I'm" Jack couldn't finish the sentence.

"Pregnant. Yes. Look I love you, and I love having you here, but you're going to have to go home sometimes.. Either with a belly or a baby. They're going to ask question, especially when the bill arrives" Jenny made logical sense.

"And how are we going to convince them that.." Jack said, lifting up his shirt to reveal the belly.

"You know?! This isn't how this is supposed to go" Jack motioned to his pregnancy.

"Yeah I was thinking about it.. And..." Jenny looked to the coin.

"WHAT?!" Jack nearly toppled over from the shock, catching himself on the corner of a bookshelf.

"It's not what you think. We, or should I say you, saw what happened with the cat. We take the coin and find a dog or cat or goldfish and demonstrate it's power on it. It's perfect." Jenny said meekly.

One hand rubbing his head, the other rubbing his pregnant belly, Jack let out a sigh.

"Do.. do we have too?" Jack said softly. He put both hands on his pregnant belly and rubbed.

"You're parents are going to find out one way or another. This time it's on your own terms. You can control the message." Jenny said, walking over to him, placing a hand on his belly.

"Yeah, the message. Hi Mom and Dad, sorry I haven't been around for the past few days. Turns out that coin I bought at the swap meet was magical and I'm pregnant. But hey, good news, you're going to be grandparents!" Jack said sarcastically.

"Look if we tell them, they can help us... do something. I mean if we can't figure out something to do with these ones.." Jenny said slowly moving her hand across Jack's belly "They could at least buy us some cribs and diapers" Jenny said with a laugh that covered the worry.

"Great" Jack said with a huff. He hated to admit it, she was right. If they didn't think of something, Jack was going to need a backup plan.

His stomach gurgled with hunger. "I'm hungry" Jack said.

Jenny smiled. "I bet you are. What are you craving?"

"Don't sound craving. It makes me sound.." Jack hesitated.

"Pregnant?" Jenny said with a wicked smile, patting his belly.

"I could go for some Mac & Cheese. Like the yellow powder box kind... And a lot of it... With some chocolate milk.... And some pickles.." Jack said sheepishly.

"Preggo" Jenny said with a light pack on Jack's belly. "Get to the table, and I'll see what I have."

- - - - Meanwhile - - - -

The cat mewed softly as it returned back to it's owner apartment. Sierra Barton was the cat's owner, a lonely yet pretty woman on the verge of 50. She loved her cat, she was a cat woman. Just looking at her apartment would tell you that. Everything was cats. Cat shirts, cat clocks, cat pictures, cat figurines, cats cats cats. It had more cats then the movie CATS and that was saying something.

She was sitting on the couch, watching some trashy talk show, as she usually did on her day off, sighing to herself. Her cat jumped up onto her lap and perched herself right on her stomach.

"MEOW!" The cat said loudly and sternly. "What's the matter Ms. Whiskers? No luck in love prowling the city? I know the feeling".

Another distressed meow emerged from the cat before the air around the cat began to shimmer.

"What the - - - " Sierra said softly before the cat leap on her stomach. Suddenly, she felt a great pressure in her stomach as it slowly began to expand - - - -

- - Day 6 - - -

Jack stood in front of the door of his house, a hand in the small of his back to maintain his balance.

There was no mistaking it now. He was pregnant. VERY pregnant.

"You ready?" Jenny said softly, rubbing his back.

"Oh yeah, every man dreams of the day he tells his parents he's pregnant" He said sarcastically.

"I'm going to chalk that up to the hormones" Jenny slapped slapping his arms.

Jack rang the bell..
