And she had to admit she was feeling a bit... warm in certain places.
Maybe it's the coin?
He put his weight on her, which nearly knocked her over at first.
Then he did as she said. She pulled the shorts up his legs.
Careful with your hands, she thought. Don't want to...
The shorts reached his waist, with a stretch. Now his bottom was covered, and his torso was... partially covered.
His belly was still well out, though.
She could actually see movement still.
"Not giving you a break, are they?" she asked.
He put his hands on his belly, and rubbed circles on it.
"No, I don't think they've stopped yet." He looked down, then up at her.
"You're going to have to use the computer. No way I can sit there right now."

She sat in the chair and slid it to the desk.

"Ok, so let's look at the coin. Are there any marks on it? Like a language?"
She pulled it from her pocket.
Flip me
She looked puzzled for a moment. She flipped the coin over and stared at it.
"No, just pregnant people on one side, and pregnant people on the other. One side they seem happy, the other worried."
Jack let out a sigh.
"Yeah, I thought maybe I missed something. Nothing on the edge either?"
Come on. Flip me.
Holly felt puzzled again, then rolled the coin onto it's edge.
"No... just... wait. There's a number. 12?"
"Well, that's not helpful."
"OK. Well, we have an old coin. Don't know what the metal is. Makes men pregnant."
Jack made an unhappy noise.
"Has pictures of pregnant people, and the number twelve."
Jack let out a sigh, then said "Well I guess it's a start, at least."
"Do you remember where you got it?"
"At the fleamarket."
"Yeah, but who did you buy it from?"
He paused.
"I don't remember."
"You don't remember?"
"I dunno. I just sort of picked it up and then... I'm not sure."
"Did you steal it?"
"No. Yeah, I bought it. From some... goth guy? I don't know, it's fuzzy."
"Weird."
He motioned to his belly, where it rippled a few times. She also noticed his chest.
"OK, ok. Fair."
She thought for a moment.
"OK, first we'll see what we can find online. If we don't find anything, then we'll go to the Fleamarket and snoop."
"But it won't be open again until Friday! That's five days! I can't go around like this!"
"Lets just..."
"What if I have to... I mean. They... they come out?"
"Well... I mean for one, if you are having twins, you still have a lot of growing to do."
Jack paled.
"I'll get bigger?" he whimpered.
She nodded.
"Oh. Great." he said, a bit breathlessly.
"But what about people and work?"
"What do you do?"
"Ok I work from home. So that's ok. I can do the coding here."
She nodded.
He relaxed a little.
"But still, this could just keep growing like it has been." He looked down.
"Then we'll deal with that," she said, grabbing his hand.
"OK." he squeezed her hand. Having a framework of a plan helped. As did having Holly nearby.
She turned back to the computer.
"Alright, let's get started."
113222112112.title: No time for silliness. Research before somebody...

1132221121121.content: So they find something, but is it helpful, or not very helpful?
1132221121121.title: They find something

11322211211212.content: They found they would continue to expand forever.
11322211211212.title: Not very helpful

114.title: He sees someone else out of the window of the c...

choices: Faye is put in a Month of Pregnancy
1141.content:
Jack looked out the window and spotted someone walking down the street. It was their neighbor, Faye Jones. She and her husband had been your parent's neighbors for decades. When they first moved in when you were just a kid, they were a young and happy couple. But they didn't stay that way for too long. The one thing that she and her husband wanted more than anything was to start a family. For years they tried to get pregnant. When they got tested for fertility, it was discovered that Faye had a rare genetic disorder, PCOS. (Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome) She would grow cancerous cysts in her ovaries - meaning that the chances of her getting pregnant were slim to none. While chances to increase her fertility were possible, they had very unsatisfying results. After a while, they gave up.

Now she was in her early forties. Tension began to rise between her and her husband and they slowly drifted apart. She had the look of a woman who hadn't been touched in years. Jack wondered if they considered adoption - but judging by how forlorn she always looked, he could assume they hadn't. He didn't know why, but he began to feel the alien voice in his head wanted him to specifically look at her.

He opened his hand and looked down at the coin. It was what Jack was considering Tails. It was hard to tell with this coin - the only difference between the two sides was that one side had the couple smiling, and the other had them frowning. In Jack's palm was the latter side. He wondered why they were so different, but he probably figured that the pregnancy on this side was an accident. Quite frankly, he was surprised the man wasn't frowning on both sides.

While he was focused on the coin, he didn't even realize that the car had driven up to the house. His dad parked and they all stepped out. Jack slipped the coin into his pocket. Something drew his eyes back toward Faye Jones - watching her as she solemnly strolled down the street. He knew that it wouldn't be long before the midlife crisis struck and her husband left her...How sad.

He continued into the house and went up to his room.

What happens next?
1141.title: Faye Jones

11411.content:
The next day, Jack had just finished showering. He was drinking a cup of coffee while putting on his work uniform. He had at most two hours before work, so he decided to sit down to read a comic book. While he was reading, he looked at his desk and saw the coin he'd bought yesterday. There was something so weird about the coin. As he stared at it, he took noticed of his own heartbeat - he heard it much louder and clearer now, almost like it was a base drum. For a few more moments continuing to stare at it, he heard what was tantamount to a dog whistle. He snapped out of it when he heard that. He shook his head for a moment and no longer heard anything. He figured it was just his imagination. He returned to his comic.

He suddenly heard the doorbell ringing downstairs. He could hear someone go to the door. He could just faintly hear the mumbling of a conversation, but couldn't tell what was being said. But soon he heard his mom cheering and his dad began to laugh. He heard what sounded like clapping. Jack was intrigued. He went downstairs and saw his mom sitting on one of the couches in the living room in front of the coffee table. She was happy. He looked to the opposing couch and saw Faye Jones and her husband, Charles sitting there. They were smiling as well. He then saw his dad return with two coffee mugs - but he noticed that only one had coffee; the other had milk.

His mom suddenly spotted him standing there. "Oh Honey," she said. "Come-in, come-in. Faye and Charlie have got some wonderful news."

Jack did as he was told and smiled when he greeted them. "Hi Mr. and Mrs. Jones - so, what's the big news?"

The couple looked at each other and held each others hands tightly. Faye was giggling as she turned back towards him and said, "I'm pregnant!"

"We're gonna have a baby!" Charles added.

Jack was taken aback by this. It was very exciting news. After all these years, they were finally going to be parents.

"Finally got one of your boys through, eh Chuck!" Jack heard his dad say.

"None too soon," Charles answered.

"Wow - this is incredibly good news!" Jack finally said. He extended his hand toward Charles and said, "Well, congratulations are in order. How did you find out?"

Charles shook his hand as Faye answered his question. "Well, it was the strangest thing. When I woke up this morning, I felt absolutely dreadful. I started throwing up at an alarming rate. Charles got worried so he took me to the doctors. The doctor told me that it was probably morning sickness. As good as it was we just couldn't believe him. He was almost positive, but just to be sure, he asked to take a blood sample to test. But for our confirmation, he recommended that we take some at-home pregnancy tests. So we picked some up and went home immediately. And it turned blue! I mean - I know we shouldn't be getting ahead of ourselves and wait for the results. But right now, we're both too excited."

"Well it did turn Blue," your mom chimed in. "I think you two are justified in your expectations. You're going to have a baby!"

Jack was just taking all of this in. This was really strange. The woman sitting in front of him barely resembled the one he'd looked at on the street yesterday. The solemn expression she had clearly showed that things weren't going well with her husband. But now, they were as happy as could be; they were pregnant. But how could that be? According to their story, all of this seemed to happen overnight. And judging from the look of her yesterday, it was a safe bet that it had. The previous day, she was the withering shell of a woman, starved for attention. Now she was so vibrant and full of life - no pun intended.

Jack suddenly had a disturbing thought; was all of this something to do with the coin he'd bought? How ironic was it that he had a coin with pregnant people on it, he looked at Faye when he flipped the coin...and now she was pregnant. Had the coin given her what she wanted? No way - that was just too bizarre.

Jack suddenly remembered that he had to get to work, and wanted to stop for a late breakfast on the way. So he looked at his watch and began to politely excuse himself.

"That is such great news you two," he said. "I'm sorry I can't stay for more, but I've actually gotta get to work. But, congratulations again, and good luck with everything."

"Thank you, Jack," Faye said. So Jack left the room and went back upstairs to get the rest of his stuff. He grabbed his wallet, keys and cellphone. But before he walked out of the room, he looked back at the desk and saw the coin there again. He was a bit confused about what to think. It seemed like an extraordinary coincidence that he'd bought that coin, and then Faye became pregnant the very next day. It was impossible - not only was she over 40 years old, but she also had PCOS. It truly was some kind of miracle.
And that's what made Jack a bit nervous. He didn't believe in the Occult...but what if? Just what if the coin could somehow affect her fertility? Ever since he'd bought the coin, he'd been hearing some strange thoughts in his head; it told him to flip the coin and then look at someone. He looked at Faye, and now she was pregnant. And if the coin had nothing to do with it - then why did it happen now? He knew that Charles and Faye had long since given up trying. So why did it happen now?

He pushed the thought out of his head, he was just confusing himself. He was about to leave again, when suddenly he felt something in his mind. Something told him not to leave it behind. He didn't think much of it. He just reached over and grabbed the coin and dropped it into his pocket. He left the house and went out to his car. He drove off...

Where does the story go?
11411.title: Good News at Last!

114111.content:
Jack had got a sausage biscuit from the McDonald's drive through. He couldn't have gotten out of there faster. He was happy for Faye, but frankly their personal lives didn't rank too high on his priorities. But more importantly, he was freaked out because of the coin. What if it had been the cause?

He didn't think about it too much because he soon arrived at work. He finished the last of his biscuit and threw the rapper away. He worked at an electronics store - it was convenient for him, because the store was right next to a comic book store. Today he filled various positions. Occasionally he had to sweep, stock shelves, or manage the cash register.

After a few hours, he was allowed to go on break. He went next door to pick up a new comic book. He took it back to his store and read it behind the counter. Soon he noticed an old high school friend enter the store; a girl named Jessica. The two used to hang out a lot. Jack always thought she was cute, but he knew asking her out would ruin their friendship. After graduation, he went to one school, she another...and that was it. They saw each other occasionally, but they lost what they once had.

"Hi Jack," she said. "It's been a long time. How have you been?"

"I guess I've been alright," he said, with a slight fatigue. "I'm taking a year off from college in order to make some money. How about you?"

"I'm on break from college," she said. "So relieved for the break too, I was going crazy. But I'm here because my laptop's hard drive crashed. I need a new one. Think you can help me?"

"Well - I'm on my break right now," he said. "But, I can help you out." Jack stepped out from behind the counter and lead her over to the shelves where they kept electronics matching her laptop type. He handed her a box with a new hard drive in it. "Tell ya what - I'll even give you my employee discount."

"Aw Jack, that's so nice," she said. "Why are you always so nice to me?"

"Sorry," Jack said sarcastically. "We're friends - being nice is an accidental byproduct of our relationship."

She giggled at that comment. They went back to the counter. Jack paid for it to use the discount, and Jessica paid him back.

"Thanks a lot, Jack," she said. "It was really good to see you."

"It was good to see you too, Jess," he said. "Break's over - gotta get back to work. I guess I'll see you around."

"Maybe sooner than you think," she said. "I'm in town for the next two weeks...Would you like to hang out, catch a movie, get a drink or...something?"

Jack was taken aback by this...it sounded like she was asking him out. He didn't know what to say.

"Sure - it'll be just like old times," Jack said. "When?"

"I don't know - I'm basically free all week," she said. "What day is good for you?"

"Well...I can take at least one day off this week," he said. He got an idea. He reached into his pocket. "Tell you what; I'll flip for it."

"Hm - just like back in high school," Jess commented. "Why did you always let a coin make your decisions for you?"

"The flip of a coin is the only real justice in this universe," Jack replied. "50/50 - it's all left up to Chance...Unbiased, unprejudiced...Fair." He took out the first coin he found in his pocket. He suddenly heard an alien thought dance across his head.

Flip me, Jack. Flip me! it said.

He looked down and saw that it was the strange coin he'd bought yesterday. He looked back up at Jess and said, "Heads - we wait till later this week. Tails - I take the day off tomorrow." He winked at her.

Don't look away, Jack. the alien thought said again.

Jack flipped the coin off his thumb and caught it in his hand. He looked down at it. He saw the frowning faces on the figures in the coin.
"Tails," he said. "I guess I'll see you tomorrow."

"Sure," she said. "You can call me and set up the details. See you then." She left the store with a wink. Jack noticed a certain sway in her hips as she left. This was weird. It was like she was asking him out on a date. Did Jess want them to be more than just friends? Jack thought better of it afterward. He was probably reading too much into it. It was just two old friends hanging out for old times sake. He at least had tomorrow to look forward to.

A few hours later, Jack finished his shift and left for home. He wondered what he and Jess would do tomorrow. He was certainly looking forward to it. But little did he know, that this day was only the beginning of what would amount to be the strangest and worst nine days of his life.
114111.title: The Friend

1141111.content:
Getting home, Jack felt more exhausted than usual from work. He parked the car and walked into his house. He could hear his mother vomiting in the bathroom but ignored it for now, sure his father was already helping her. Jack walked up the stairs to his own room, took off his clothes, and collapsed onto the bed.

Dream

Jack was lying in a big bed, as Jessica walked toward him on all fours. They smiled at each other erotically and Jack reached out to feel Jessica's swollen pregnant belly.

"Our kids such are growing quickly in there," she said, placing her hand on top of his. He smiled and kissed her passionately on the lips.

"She's not the only one," Faye said, rolling over in the bed, taking one of Jack's hands and placing them on her belly. Jack smiled and kissed her as well, holding his pregnant brides close to his body. They cooed and nuzzled against him, their bellies rubbing against his sides. From nowhere, there was the sound of a knock on a door.

"Jack? I need you to give me a ride," his mother's voice said.

"What?" Jack said sleepily. Suddenly his mother appeared in front of him, a gargantuan pregnant belly in front of her, sweat running down her face.

"I said I need you to give me a ride to the hospital! Your brothers and sisters are comiiiiiNNNNNNGGG!"

End of Dream

Jack jumped out of bed, panting. Suddenly, there was a knock on his bedroom door.

"Jack, c'mon, I need you to drive me to work. Your father's gone and I still feel a little groggy," his mother said from behind the door.

Weird... Jack thought, getting up. "Do I have time to shower and stuff?"

"Yes, you do, don't worry," his mother said semi-sarcastically. "Just get a move on." Jack slowly got out of bed and grabbed a towel and a fresh pair of clothes and trudged along to the bathroom. As he took off his underwear and stepped into the shower, Jack looked down in shock and saw that in his sleep, he'd come himself.

Dreaming about pregnant women made me do that? he thought, confused. What's the matter with me?

After he got dressed, Jack walked downstairs to see his mother standing in front of the door, looking a little anxious. She had a thick sweater wrapped around her.

"Feeling any better?"

"Yeah, a little. Let's go," his mother said quickly. Jack shrugged and walked out to the car and pulled out of the driveway with his mother in tow. Out on the lawn, Faye was getting the mail, wearing a pajama top and sweat pants. She waved to them with a big smile, and Jack could swear that she looked...rounded. It was easier to tell that she was pregnant now and her breasts had certainly gotten bigger. An image of Faye heavily pregnant and close to Jack flashed into his mind from last night's dream and he turned away, blushing slightly as he drove his mother to work.

Dropping her off, Jack headed back home, walking inside to grab some breakfast. His shift was a little bit earlier in the day today, then he had class. Fridays were always a little grueling, but at least tonight he had Jessica's company to look forward to. As he chewed on his cereal, Jack reached into his pocket for his phone when he felt something else in his pocket. Fishing it out, Jack saw that the weird coin from yesterday was still with him. He studied it, especially paying attention to the smiling pregnant woman on it.

Geez, pregnancy around me everywhere today... Jack thought, shoving the coin back into his pocket, finishing his breakfast and washing out his bowl in the sink. Driving his mom to work messed up his normal work schedule, so it was already time to go to work. Putting on his uniform, which amounted to just a grey collared shirt with the store's logo on it, Jack hopped back in his car and headed for work. As he left, he took one last stare at Faye, who was now sitting on her porch, one hand on her belly while the other was pursing her shirt's collar and checking out her new bosom with a perplexed but impressed look.

Jack yawned as he walked into the back of the store and up to the counter. No one else was there, Friday morning being typically being a pretty slow time for the store. Peeking at the schedule that was taped to the back of the counter, Jack saw that it would just be him and the manager today. Speaking of which-

"Hey Jack," his manager, April said. She was a tall, beautiful girl, in her mid-20s, with bright red lipstick, short red hair, and cute chipmunk cheeks. All in all, April was a pretty cool boss and didn't bark orders at Jack. Her only drawback was that she liked to tease Jack plenty, which got embarrassing sometimes. "You look a little more tired than usual, what's up?"

"Oh, nothing, I just had to wake up a little earlier today," Jack said, resting his face in his hand, leaning against the counter. "My mom got a little sick so she needed me to drive her to work."

"Hope she feels better soon," April said with an empathetic face. "Got any plans for later today?"

"Not really," Jack said, seeing a new box under the counter that needed unloading. He leaned down to pick it up when he heard April giggle.

"You sure?"

Jack stood up slowly, giving April an accusatory look. "What...what do you mean?"

She giggled again. "Well, I just heard you were a little chummy with a customer that came in yesterday and you talked about spending some time together."

"April!"

"Aww, come on, it's cute. I've never heard of you going on any dates," April said with a smile, walking close to Jack.

"It's not a date!" Connor said, his face blushing. "We're old friends and we're catching up, that's it!"

"Okay, okay" she said again, her smile still on her face. "C'mon, let's start unpacking some of these new shipments and getting them on the shelves." As she walked toward the back, Jack felt a tickle in his brain

Take me out of your pocket

Unconsciously, Jack reached into his pocket and pulled out the coin. What?

Flip me

Jack cocked his head? Is the coin-

Flip me!

Scared, Jack gave the coin a quick flick of the thumb and caught it on the back of his hand and looked up at April as she walked into the back
1141111.title: The Next Day

11411111.content:
"Jack, could you give me a hand back here, please?" April's voice said from the back. Jack shook his head out of his haze and put the coin back in his pocket. As he walked toward the back, he saw April coming out. Well, not April exactly, but part of her. A globe of round, pregnant flesh drifted out of the doorway, the rest of April following. She stroked it gently, her work shirt only covering about half of her new-found maternity. "It's a little hard with...this in the way."

"Y-you're pregnant," Jack said with a stunned expression.

"Yes, Jack, that is correct, I am pregnant," April said with a mockingly staccato voice like Jack's. She laughed and patted her belly and moved to the side. "Let me get out of your way so you can reach the inventory."

Dazed, Jack walked past her and gazed at her belly. It looked real, as far as he could tell, but he couldn't figure out what was going on. To keep his mind off things, he went about his work, opening boxes and stacking cables and printers and all kinds of other computer hardware. Every time he saw April and her new round tummy, his face would blush a little bit more and he would work more quickly. In the end, Jack had done about an hour's worth of stacking in half the time.

"Nicely done," April said, putting some of the smaller things - memory cards, iPod cables, etc. - onto the metal hooks that lined the walls close to the register. "I thought you were tired."

"I-I dunno," Jack muttered, standing behind the counter. April finished and came and stood next to him, still smiling at him.

"Hey, don't forget to be careful on your not-date tonight. I'd hate for your 'old friend' to end up like me," she said with a little laugh, bumping Jack with her belly. He shuffled away from her, his face now totally red.

"April, knock it off. You aren't even really pregnant! I saw you when I walked in! You were totally normal!" Jack said excitedly. April raised one eyebrow and turned to face him, giving him a full-frontal view of her belly.

"Jack, what are you talking about? I mean, I know you weren't here when I first got pregnant, but I'm almost nine months at this point. Geez, you're acting weird today."

Jack's mind was racing, trying to piece together the day. First Faye's pregnant, and now April? This is a weird coincidence.

Then, April's face turned to a grin. "Hey...could it be that you have a thing for pregnant women?"

"What? You're crazy."

"Am I?" she said, motioning to Jack's pants. He looked down and saw a clearly visible erection. He tucked it behind his pants in a huff as April walked closer to him. "Hey, it's okay, I'm not offended. I don't blame you, I don't think I've ever looked better. That's why I didn't bother getting a work shirt that fit all the way over. I like showing off the bump. Wanna feel?"

Jack didn't know why, but he agreed, and started running his hands over her belly. It felt...much nicer than he expected.

"It's...tight," Jack said, looking down at her belly, his embarrassed, confused expression fading some.

"Yeah, it is," April said gently.
11411111.title: Heads: Reality Shift

choices: Heads - Reality Shift and go to class
Tails - No Reality Shift and no school!
114111111.content:
Jack heard the door open and looked up, keeping his hand glued to April's round womb. Jessica walked in the door and looked around before turning to Jack and...April. A strong sense of guilt filled him and Jack dropped his hand quickly from April's belly. April just laughed lightly without moving her lips and looked at Jessica, then Jack, then back at Jessica before smiling and walking into the back.

"H-hi," Jack said, his face turning red as Jessica walked up to the counter, also looking a little embarrassed.

"Hi," she smiled, looking over at Jack. "I just came in to pick up an iPhone case as a cheap gift for a cousin, but I didn't know you'd be here." She looked down and smiled to herself. "But I...kind of hoped you would be."

"Yeah?" Jack said, shaking a little. As she was bent down, Jack had a good view of the shape of her breasts. They were...very full and incredibly sexy. Definitely bigger than he remembered yesterday. He didn't think much of it, just thinking he hadn't had a chance to ogle her from this angle yesterday. While he thought about her chest, Jessica nodded and looked back up at him, biting her lip. "W-well, let me help you pick one out." Jack walked from behind the counter to the rack of cases, some of which April had just stacked. "Anything in mind?"

"Well, I just want it to look a little different so he'll think I really tried," Jessica said with a guilty smile. "He's nice and all, but we don't hang out ever. But my parents are pushing me to get him something since we live so close to him and my aunt, sooooo..." She looked back and Jack and laughed.

"How about this?" Jack said, unhooking a case that was sturdy and looked like it had wood paneling. "It looks kind of vintage and it's unique."

"Wow, this would actually work perfectly. He's into that kind of retro look," Jessica said, taking the case from Jack's hands. "Thanks," she said quietly, with a little smile.

"Anything I can do to help," he said with a small smile back. He walked back to the register and rang the iPhone case up. "I'll throw in the employee discount again."

"Great, this is such a relief to be done already," Jessica said with a sigh and a grin, handing her credit card over. "Ever since last night, I've been feeling a little...I dunno, my stomach's been feeling weird and I felt a little tired. I'm better now, but it was really weird."

Jack smiled and handed Jessica her case and card back. "Well, I hope you get better soon. My mom was feeling a little nauseous too, so there might be a bug going around." Then, an upsetting thought crossed his mind. "So, can you still hang out tonight?"

She smiled and looked at Jack with a pleased expression. "Yes, I'll be fine tonight. It might be good to hang out and have some fun tonight, get into a positive mood. That'll make the recovery process faster." April walked back into the room and looked over at Jessica again, her bright red lips in a curious smile. Jessica looked over at April, her eyes slowly drifting down to her exposed belly, which April's fingertips were gingerly stroking. "W-well, see you tonight!"

With that, Jessica nervously left the store and Jack turned to face April just in time for her to slink up next to him, her belly pressed against him.

"She's cute," April said with a giggle.

"April, please, cut it out," Jack said, walking away, his body shaking a little, sorting some more inventory. April threw her hands up and smiled again.

"Alright, alright, I'm not trying to make you feel bad. I just want to wish you good luck tonight...but I don't think you need it. She likes you."

"April!" he yelled back. She just laughed softly before gripping her belly. "Oh, a-are you okay?"

"Yeah, I'm fine," she purred, looking down at her roundness. "Just some excited kicking going on in there. Mind if I sit down in the back to try and calm the little one down?"

"You're the boss," Jack shrugged, gazing at April's hands drifting over her belly maternally as she bounced her belly in her grasp. She disappeared into the back and Jack went back to work, trying to regain his calm and get his mind off of...pregnancy. Maybe he did have a thing for pregnant women...

You do a familiar voice whispered in his head. Jack shook his head and ignored it, not even bothering to try and figure out where it came from.

Work was predictably slow, and after a few hours of sitting around and ignoring April's teasing and occasional invitations to belly rubs, which Jack started to vehemently reject, Jack clocked out and headed back home to change before he went to his classes. On the drive over, Jack flipped on the radio and listened to some music to try and get his mind off of things. It worked out well, until the block of songs ended.

"-and that was that new French Montana track we know you all wanted to here. And remember! Later this week is the annual 101.9 Pregnant Bikini Contest down at Dino's Bar and Grill! Make sure you come out and watch these soon-to-be moms strut their stuff. And folks there is a minimum belly size requirement, so all these ladies are going to be big, big, big!"

Jack punched a random button on the dashboard and changed to a random station that was playing classical music. It wasn't Jack thing, but at least it helped turn off...whatever that was. What is going on? Jack thought to himself.

Once he got home, Jack piled out of the car and walked back inside, marching up the stairs to his room.

"Jack? That you?" he heard his mother's voice and walked back downstairs to see her come up to the foot of the staircase. "I'm sorry, I had your father drive me back home. I was just feeling too unwell. But...I also forgot some of my things at the office. Would you mind taking me back?" she smiled weakly, really trying to get Jack to agree to it.

"...yeah, alright," he whined. "Let me just get changed first." In a few quick moments, Jack had his work shirt off and was in jeans and a t-shirt. "Okay, let's go."

As they walked to the car, Jack realized that if he drove his mom to work and back, he'd probably miss the first ten minutes of his Friday class at least. Thinking about it, Jack was getting increasingly uninterested in going to class. He was already plenty close to getting his master's and this was just a filler class to get enough credits to push him over the line. He was doing fine in it and it didn't matter if he went or not. Hell, he could just flip a coin to see if he should even bother going or not.

Flip me the voice from before came back into his head.

Good idea Jack thought robotically, getting into the car and reaching his hand into his pocket to fish out the coin that seemed to find its way into his casual pants. Heads I go, Tails I don't. As he flipped it, his mother got into the seat next to him in the car.

"Oh, that's that weird coin from the flea market, isn't it? I actually saw it while I was looking around. I even gave it a flip while I was checking out this antique mirror that pierced man had for sale."

"Wh-" Jack said, looking over as he caught the coin on the back of his hand. As he looked over, his neighbor Faye also came up to the window of the car, waving at both of them. As Jack looked at both of them, he looked and saw what the coin had landed on
114111111.title: Jessica walks in

choices: He went into his mom's work.
He stayed in the car and hIs cellphone went off.
1141111112.content:
Tails. The coin landed on tails as Jack continued to stare at Faye and his 50 something mother.
We'll on the bright side, no school today. Jack thought to himself. He could spend more time focusing on his date with Jessica.
It's not a date. It's just two old friends getting back together

Suddenly, a massive shiver went through both Faye and his mother, their bodies shaking as the chill went down their spin.
"Brr, did it just get cold in here all of sudden?" His mother asked, rolling down the window to speak to Faye, unaware of the gravid consequences of her son's actions.
"Good evening Amanda, Jack." Faye said with a smile on her face a mile wide. She was taking to her newly pregnant state quite well.
"Good evening Faye. Wow, your positively glowing. Pregnancy agreeing with you I take it?" Jack's mom Amanda said with a smile on her face.
"Very much so. Although...." Faye said her face slowly changing to a worried look on her face.
"Although what Faye? You can tell me anything." Amanda said.

Jack banged his head against the back of the headrest of his seat. While the coin decided that he wasn't going to class tonight, (even if he didn't really need to. He was only taking the classes to get the extra credits he needed while he was visiting his parents for this year he was taking off), he still wanted to see Jessica. Jessica was everything to him. A good friend, someone he could tell anything to. She was the one who got away.

Stop thinking like that Jack thought to himself. Jessica wasn't his girlfriend or anything. Not some childhood crush that he secretly yearned for, she was just Jessica. That was it.

"Well, Amanda, when you were pregnant with Jack. Did anything... strange happen?" Faye asked.
"Strange? What do you mean?" Amanda asked.
"Well, my morning sickness cleared up almost instantly. I mean I've only had it for two days of the three months I've been pregnant" Faye said.
This particular piece of information snapped Jack back to the current course of conversation.

"You've been pregnant for three months?" Jack asked, staring straight ahead, fighting back images of Faye from his dream.
"Yeah, I think." Faye said.
"You think?" Jack asked, thinking back to only a day or two ago when she first told their family the news. I mean, she was pushing 40 and had PCOS, and now she couldn't even remember how long she had been pregnant.
"Jack, don't be rude!" His mother snapped him. There was still times that despite being in his 20's, Jack's mom still had to treat him like a child sometimes.
"Sorry Mrs. Jones" Jack said.
"Please call me Faye" Faye said with a smile.
"Uh-okay. Faye" Jack said, his eyes going back to road as images from his dream came rushing back to him.

"Well, I've been puking for two days which is when we found out we were pregnant, and now my morning sickness is gone. Not only that, I think - - - I think I'm getting bigger" Faye said, stepping back revealing a small sizable bulge visible between where her sweatpants and her pajama top met. She put her hands on it, rubbing it slowly.
"Oh Faye. Your just worried, pregnancy is different for every woman. Everything is going to be fine." Jack's mom said with a smile.
"You're right. I guess. It's weird. I feel like I'm getting bigger every second" Faye said.
"It'll pass." Jack's mom said.
"Well, thanks for putting my mind at ease. I guess I've just wanted this for so long" Faye says, wrapping her hands around her pregnant belly "That I'm just worried. Well take care guys, I think it's going to be chilly tonight, I had a shiver go down my spine a few moments ago" Faye finished.
"You felt cold as well?" Amanda said. "Must be something in the air".

"Come on Mom, can we go? I've got plans later." Jack said, trying to get out of this awkward situation.
"Oh like what?" Jack's mom asked, raising an eyebrow.
"I'm going to hang out with Jessica later" Jack said timidly.
A smile slowly came across his mom's face, while Faye made a noise that sounded very close to "Awww"
"Look at little Jack going on a date" Faye said with a smile.
"IT'S NOT A DATE! WE'RE JUST HANGING OUT! SHE'S MY FRIEND!" Jack said defensively.
"Faye, enjoy your children. They grow up so fast" Jack's Mom said, messing with her son's hair.
"Come on Mom, stop!" Jack said getting embarrassed.

"Shame you never had anymore huh Amanda?" Faye said.
"Maybe back then, but if I was pregnant today, I would probably lose my mind" Jack's mom said with a laugh.
"Good thing you're not" Faye said with a smile, unaware of Amanda's current condition.
"Come on!" Jack said.


"Alright, alright, Sorry Faye, we don't want this little Lothario to be late for his date" Jack's mom said with a smile.
"See you later" Faye said, leaving. "Sweep her off her feet kid".
Jack turned over the engine, and drove off taking his mom to her office.

The trip was uneventful and short, since his mom's work wasn't far from the house. Pulling into the parking spot, he parked in the spot.
"Alright we're here" Jack said.
"Okay sweetie, give me a few moments" His mom said, unbuckling her seatbelt. Jack noticed that his mom seemed.. different. He couldn't quite place it, but his mom looked different somehow.

She got out of the car and walked into her office.
Does she have a bulge in her stomach? Jack thought to himself watching his mom leave. HIs mind flashed back to the image of his mom massively pregnant in his dream. He shrugged the image off , and stared out the window.

Time seemed to pass slowly, and Jack grew tired of waiting. He decided to...
1141111112.title: No School, But Unintended Consequences

choices: Jack takes her up on it
11411111122.content:
Jack wasn't sure what exactly to do, so he tried flipping the radio on again, hoping he'd have better luck this time. The music was pleasant enough and Jack leaned back in his seat to relax when his cellphone started buzzing. Turning down the radio, he brought his phone to his ear. "Hello?"

"Oh, Jack, great! I was worried I'd miss you going into class," Jessica's voice said. Jack nervously adjusted the phone in his hands and switched to his other ear.

"Y-yeah, hey! What's up," he said, trying and failing to sound casual.

"Oh, nothing. I just wanted to know when you get out of class so we can get a jump on catching up," she said. Jack could tell that she was laughing slightly at his unnatural voice fluctuation.

"Well, actually, I'm helping my mom out right now so I just decided not to go to class today," he said, starting to shift in his seat. I'll get to see Jessica even sooner than I thought! he thought excitedly to himself. Maybe she'll be able to get all this pregnancy weirdness out of my head...

"Excellent! Call me when you're ready?" Jessica said. Jack couldn't help but feel elated hearing the clear happiness in her voice and nodded. "Jack?" he nodded again. "Jack?!" he snapped out of his daze and realized she couldn't see him.

"Yes, definitely!" he said, a little too excitedly. Jessica giggled and thanked him, hanging up. Jack laid his head back against the seat and took a long sigh. It's not a date, it's not a date, it's not a date he repeated in his head. But...I wish it was.

Irritated by his thoughts, which had been giving him grief all day anyway, Jack hoped out of the car and walked into his mom's office. It was a small set-up: just one big room with a conference room, a manager's office, and obviously some bathrooms. As he walked in, Jack looked around and didn't see any sign of his mother. There weren't actually very many employees there today, just a few women at their desks, typing away or looking over forms, and a pretty woman sitting at a bigger desk near the door. She looked like she was almost Jack's age.

"Hi, did Amanda Dale come in? I'm her son, Jack." Jack reached out to shake her hand, which she obliged.

"Hello Jack, I'm Tara," she responded, smiling. Jack noticed that the nameplate on the desk said "Greg."

"Are you replacing the other receptionist?" he asked, pointing at the name tag. Tara leaned back and smiled slightly, showing a slight irritation.

"No, Greg is the receptionist. I'm a senior partner who's just helping out on my day off because Greg broke his ankle," Tara said, raising her eyebrows up and down.

Damn, she's cool and kind of feisty Jack thought to himself. "Oh, sorry."

She grinned. "It's no problem, I'm just picking on you a little bit. Anyway, your mom came in but she's just in the bathroom now. Seems like she might have some kind of stomach bug." Tara leaned closer to Jack. "It's part of the reason why she left the office today, I think. She doesn't want it to spread to any of us. Your mom's a really nice lady."

Jack laughed. "Yeah? I wish she would be that way at home." Tara laughed softly, showing a little bit of pearly teeth. She had long, straight, jet black hair and dark brown eyes that she hid behind small, frameless glasses.

She walked out behind the desk to the vending machine next to Jack. "Hmm...I really feel like a Vanilla Coke," Tara said absently to herself, before turning to Jack. "Can you believe that they still stock Vanilla Coke to this machine?"

Jack noticed it in there and raised one eyebrow. "Yeah, that is surprising...I haven't had one of those in a long time and I'm pretty thirsty too." He fished a dollar out of his pocket, punching the right numbers into the machine. "Oh, but look, there's only one left."

j̵̴̷̩̜̝̰ͩ̒͆̿& #785;ͧ

Jack looked around, confused. The familiar voice in his head was calling out, but there wasn't anything specific it was saying. He just felt like something was coming.

"One left, huh?" Tara said, turning to Jack with a grin across her face. "Flip you for it."

Hypnotically, Jack reached into his pocket and fished out the coin.

Flip me

"Heads you get it, tails I get it?"

"Sure," Jack muttered, flipping the coin, the happy, smiling side up. "Heads," he managed to squeak out before Tara's midriff began inflating like a party balloon. Her belly pushed her polo to the limits, a popped out belly button clearly visible underneath the fabric. As Jack's eyes traced up her growing body, he couldn't help but notice her breasts also nearly double in size, snapping off one of her collar's buttons. As the swelling came to a stop, she had about a foot and a half of new, round belly growing out of her.

Tara just grinned and started rubbing her new-found womb. "Damn, I've got really bad cravings now. Best two out of three?"
11411111122.title: He stayed in the car and hIs cellphone went off.

114111111221.content:
"Uh, your, um, your bel-"

Flip me!

This time, the voice in his head was much louder and angrier, but Jack was still perplexed by the sight he just saw. Come to think of it, it was the second time today he saw a woman go from barren one second and pregnant, heavily pregnant, the next. Was he going crazy? Was Faye's newfound pregnancy having some kind of abnormal psychological affect on him?

Maybe I really do find pregnant women attractive and this is my mind's way of opening me up to it Jack thought, eyeing Tara's new, maternal body. She was pretty cute before, but now, something else came over him and she had a certain undefinable charm and attractiveness.

"C'mon, best two out of three!" she giggled, one hand rubbing what was now her pregnant belly.

Flip me!

The voice was practically screaming in his head, but now Jack was more aware of it and could feel himself resisting, slightly. Wait, is this the coin talking to me? I know I bought it in a creepy kind of place, but that doesn't mean it's magical or cursed or something, does it?

"What are you, chicken?" Tara said with a sweet laugh, smacking Jack on the arm playfully. "It's just for fun, Jack. Flip it!"

Jack did as he was told, only realizing at the last second that her voice had changed to that of the voice in his head. Did the voice just make her say that? Jack was now getting a little scared. Catching the coin on the back of his hand, they both saw the verdict.

"H-heads," Jack said, looking back at Tara, who smiled with glee.

"Great, just one mo-oof," she said, suddenly bending down and gripping her belly, which started expanding. Her shirt was no longer able to contain her new size and slid up her skin, revealing her bare skin and popped out belly button, which even Jack, in his transitory state of denial, immediately admitted was cute. "Huh, my sister was right. The growth spurts really pop whenever they feel like it," she said, patting her belly.

"Do you need some help?" Jack said, nervously eyeing her swollen belly, trying to keep his mind of the erection he could feel brewing in his pants. It just happened again...but this time she seems concerned about it. Jack's eyes turned back to the coin in his hand. And it happened right after I flipped the coin, just like before.

Now Jack's mind was really starting to buzz. He remembered flipping the coin at the store before April was suddenly pregnant. That's it, the coin is somehow doing this. It's crazy but it's the only explanation right now. I need to get home and really think about this.

"Well?" Tara said, a weak smile on her face as she gripped her belly. "One heads, one tails. This last one decides who gets the soda."

Flip it!

Jack's hand tossed the coin like it was going to burn a hole through his flesh. It was like he wasn't even in control of his own body. Now, fearing the power he hypothesized the coin carried, Jack watched the coin tumble to the ground in horror, his eyes meeting Tara's as it felt to the ground as a possibility struck him.

If someone gets pregnant whenever I flip the coin, then...Jessica!

"Oh!" Tara said excitedly, having to bend over with her massive belly to see the where the coin landed. "It's-

1141111112211.content:
"HeadsUMPH" Tara said, and grabbed her belly as it grew again, making the buttons on here shirt fly out as they simply couldn't hold the massive baby bump back anymore. She now looked like she could pop any moment, and with her ripped shirt Jack had to admit that she was the sexiest girl he had ever seen. Too bad she's not my girlfriend, so I could have some "fun" with her, he thought and felt his erection growing to a point of nearly popping his jeans-button. Oh man, I can't hide this. She just got to have noticed it by now.

"Ooh, it looks like I'm not the only one who's excited about being this big and round", Tara said gleefully. "You know, I have never before felt so womanly, so...full-filled, so sexy. Obviously you think I am too, which makes me very happy. Beacose, you know, I don't even care about wining the soda anymore. I'm not craving it anymore" she, continued, biting her lip playfully. W-what's going on? Is she coming on to me? Jack thought, not quite being able to wrap his head around all of this."

"I'm craving something else now. You know they say that pregnant woman get hornier then usual? Well, it's certainly true. I'm very horny now, and I'm craving that wonderful, handsome, stallion-in-bed-like hunk that made me this way" Tara said, while moving as seductively as her big bump allowed around Jack before suddenly grasping his crotch.
"And I can see, and certainly feel" She said, winking to him "That he is more than ready to take me to the backroom and ravish me like he did when he knocked me up!"

WOW, does she thinks I'M her boyfriend - and the father of her baby, or - judging by the size, maybe even babies? Jack thought stunned.

"Well, what are you waiting for? Don't act like you don't want me, your "little friend" down here tells me otherwise - and he's not that small, by the way. No wonder you got me pregnant, with the size of that thing your swimmers barely needed to swim at all to reach my poor, little defenseless egg. Ahh, you're really going to make me say it, aren't you? I don't understand why you like that old movie so much anyway. But I must admit, the line is pretty seductive. Alright, here it goes:
Hey Goose, you big stud! Take me to bed or lose me forever!"

Jack had no idea what was going on, all he knew was that his "other head" was about to take over the control over his actions. Here, almost wrapped around him, stood a girl he had always felt an attraction towards giving him the go-ahead-signal, and that big bump of hers made her even attractive. And since she already thought he was her boyfriend and baby daddy, she wouldn't hold it against him afterward.
Still, this was wrong, wasn't it. It wasn't her taking and acting .- it was the mind tricks the coin somehow had placed on her making her acting this way. This wasn't what the real Tara would've wanted, and therefore he would, if he went on with it, in a way still take advantage of her against her will. His conscience really wouldn't feel good about that. Jack needed to think about this for a bit.

"Hey, I might willing and ready right now, but I could just take matters into my own hands, you know!" Tara said lightly annoyed. "So, what's is going to be? Take me to bed or lose me forever?"
1141111112211.title: Heads - Reality Shift

choices: Faye asks Jack to give her a hand at her house
1141111112212.content:
"Tails!" Tara said with glee. "I win?" The trail end of her voice turned into a question as Tara bent down to grasp her belly again, which had begun to swell again. It was already massive after Jack had flipped the coin the second time, so now it was approaching an almost unbelievable size. "Wh-what's-" Tara panted nervously, holding her ballooning womb.

"Oh my god," Jack said, bending down to try and help her. Jack didn't have any medical expertise, real or imagined, but a pregnant woman's belly spontaneously growing twice in the course of a few minutes was outside the realm of conventional biology, so his help was just as good as anyone else's. Jack put one hand on her wrist and one on her shoulder, holding her in a semi-close fashion, and locked eyes with her as she gazed at her own swelling stomach. "We should get you to a hospital."

Right on time, Jack's mother walked out of the bathroom and, seeing Jack and Tara, ran through the office to get to both of them. "Jack, Tara, oh...oh! What's going on?"

"Mom, we need to get her to the hospital," Jack said, throwing one arm over Tara's shoulder and walking her to the elevator on the building. For someone as big as Tara, they made good time thanks to Jack's speed. Jack's mom followed them closely, looking extremely concerned. Understandable, since Tara's belly had grown three times since she'd been in the bathroom.

In the elevator, Tara was still breathing a bit nervously, but she was standing on her own and didn't seem to be in any physical distress. "It's okay," she said, patting Jack on the arm, "I'm not in any pain and the swelling's stopped. Other than a bigger belly, I feel fine."

"Well, we should still get you to a hospital and make sure everything's okay," Jack said. Seeing how Tara was doing better, he started to move his arm off of her shoulders, but Tara's friendly pat on the arm now turned into a gentle grasp that kept it on her. She turned to Jack and smiled sweetly.

"I think that's a good idea," she breathed, giving him another gaze before turning back to her incredible bump. As she rubbed it slowly, Jack's mom spoke up.

"Does everything still feel alright? Can you feel the baby move?"

Tara nodded. "I don't feel kicks or anything, but there is still movement. Actually, there's almost more movement than before but that might just be because there's-" Tara paused and sighed, looking at her new, massive size, "More room to move in."

Jack looked at his mother confused. She's just accepting that she's pregnant? The fact that you walked out and she was suddenly pregnant doesn't surprise you at all? As the elevator door opened and the three of them walked to the car, Jack started to think about the situation again. Wait, she seemed to think she had already been pregnant too...same with April. Jack could only come to one conclusion: the coin. So, the coin makes some people think they're pregnant, but maybe it wares off after the first use. I did flip it three times for this poor girl, after all.

The three of them loaded up into the car, Jack in the driver's seat, his mom and Tara in back seat. Jack drove quickly, peeking up in the rear view mirror to see if Tara was doing alright every minute or so. And, in fact, she seemed to be doing just fine. No more heavy breathing, no sign of pain at all, just a look of light concern. She was running her hands over her belly very gingerly, obviously worried about her baby growing inside her. It may not have been there an hour ago, but Jack could tell that there was a look of genuine love in her eyes. What Jack didn't notice was his own mother gazing at her belly, a mixture between nostalgia and concern in her eyes.

At the hospital, Tara insisted that they not go to the emergency room, telling Jack and his mother that she wasn't feeling that much distress and was sure that she was alright. "I just want a little check-up to find out what's going on," she said calmly. Acquiescing, they took her to special pre-natal part of the hospital, one that had been added a few years back to try and give pregnant women more targeted and personal care. Tara seemed to have been here before, as the doctor who took care of her was familiar with her and was shocked when she saw Tara's new size.

Jack and his mom followed Tara into the doctor's room, where she was already sitting back on a soft plastic cot, her doctor rubbing ultrasound gel on a wand.

"Alright, let's have a look," the doctor, who's name tag said that she was Dr. Kristen Harper, M.D., said. She rubbed the small ultrasound wand around a contained area on Tara's belly, who looked at the blurry screen with a nervous gaze. Her hands were on the base of her shirt, holding it up, even though the size of her huge belly more than assured that the non-maternity polo wouldn't get in the way.

"Well?" Tara finally said, anxiously.

"Huh...I'm surprised we didn't find this on any of your past ultrasounds, but you're carrying triplets!" Dr. Harper said. Tara and Connor's mom's jaws dropped. For Jack, this was all so new that it almost didn't surprise him anymore. Almost.

"Triplets?" Tara said, a small smile starting to spread across her lips. "But they're all healthy, aren't they?"

"Yes. Actually, they're doing surprisingly well, considering how far into your pregnancy you're carrying them." Dr. Harper said, smiling at Tara before turning back to the screen. "It's really strange that we hadn't found these extra fetuses before. This would make for an amazing journal article..."

As her voice trailed off, Tara turned back to Jack and his mom. "Triplets! Can you believe it?"

"Yeah, that's incredible," Jack said quietly, now calmed down enough to admire Tara's enormous, round belly.

"Jack? If you'd like, I can stay with Tara while she finishes up her tests and paperwork. I'll call you or your father when we're ready to leave," his mom said.

"Are you sure?" Jack asked, looking between Tara and his mom. They both nodded, Tara adding a little smile.

"I'll be fine," Tara said. "You've already taken good care of me."

"Okay, well...congratulations," Jack said, waving to them as he headed out of the hospital.

-----

As Tara sat on the doctor's table, wiping the gel off of her enormous belly with paper towels, Amanda Dale took Dr. Harper quietly aside to talk to her. With the surface area that Tara had to deal with, she would be occupied for a while.

"W-would you mind giving me a quick pregnancy test?" Amanda, Jack's mother, asked. Dr. Harper moved Amanda to her personal office.

"Are you sure? I'm sure you know that at your age, pregnancy is unlikely."

"I-I know, but I've felt some odd symptoms lately, and seeing Tara made me think about when I was pregnant with my son and it feels...the same," Amanda said, looking at Dr. Harper with intent. Then, she opened up her thick sweater and revealed her newly-perky breasts and her slightly rounded tummy. "I know my body."

Dr. Harper looked at her silently for a moment before nodding. "Alright. Sit down and I'll give you a quick ultrasound. It's a lot faster than any pregnancy pee test."

Amanda leaned back and rolled up her shirt, allowing Dr. Harper to repeat the process she had just performed with Tara. Exhaling a deep breath, Dr. Harper looked and the screen and turned back to Amanda.

"You're pregnant, Mrs. Dale..."

"...and?" Amanda asked, sensing Dr. Harper had something to add.

"...and there are four heartbeats. You're carrying quadruplets."

-----

Jack driving quickly back to his house, blasting the radio to an almost painfully high volume. After the experiences with April and especially with Tara, he needed to get his mind off of pregnancy and pregnant women. After meeting with April, his shortly approaching hangout with Jessica would be able to put him in a good mood, but if his suspicions about the coin were right, then Jessica was pregnant as well.

Calm down, Jack. You don't know anything for sure. Remember, there's no way a coin could get someone pregnant. he thought, parking at home and walking out of the car. But at least I left the coin at Mom's office so it can't bother me anymore.

As he stuffed the car keys in his pocket, he felt metal clink with metal. Curious, he reached back into his pocket and pulled out...the coin.

"How?..."
1141111112212.title: Tails - No Reality Shift
