11411111122121.content:
Jack was putting his key into the door when his cellphone went off, chiming away the theme to one of his favorite movies.
Picking up his phone with one hand, he slide the "slide to unlock" to unlock, and put the phone to his ear.
"Hello?" Jack asked.
"Hey-a Jack. It's Jessica". Her voice sounded sultry on the other end of the phone. It was so alarming that it caused him to bobble his keys, dropping to the ground with a clink.
"Hey Jessica. You-uh, sure sound different." Jack thought trying to get his head out of the gutter and back into reality.
She's just a friend. This is just a get together between two friends nothing else Jack thought to himself bending down to pick up his keys.
"I'm just thinking about tonight." Jessica says to Jack in a sultry voice.
"Uh, yeah. It uh, it should be fun to catch up" Jack said to himself, putting his key back in the door, opening it, and letting himself in.
"So where were you going to take me?" Jessica asked.

"Well - uh. I thought the usual, just dinner out someplace nice. You know, typical" Jack said, quickly becoming alarmed at the course this conversation seemed to be taking. She seemed so different from when he saw her earlier today.
"You sure know how to make a girl feel real special Jack" Jessica said with a come-hither giggle.
Oh my glob, this not date is going to turn into a date Jack thought to himself in a panic. He wasn't ready for this kind of commitment! I mean, yes he wanted Jessica, he wanted her ever since High School, but that was just a fantasy, this was turning into reality.
"Uh----" was all Jack could sputter out as his brain went dead.
Jessica giggled. "Oh relax you big dork. I'm just screwing with you" Jessica said, her voice turning back to it's normal non-sultry self.
All feeling slowly returned to Jack as his brain processed the information that just came to him.
"Oh" Jack said both relieved and disappointed.
"I take it your parents are taking our little "get together" as a date?" Jessica asked.
"Yeah something like that" Jack said, going back to his task of putting things away, straightening up around the house, and other such things.
"I swear, it's the 21st Century. 2013! People can't seem to handle that a guy and a girl can hang out as friends and not have it be a thing" Jessica said, strain in her voice "Unnngh"
"Yeah, I know right. All I heard from my parents and neighbors were "Wak Wak Wak, Jack's got a date!" Jack said sounding more like a bird than an imitation.
"Seriously.. UNG" Jessica said, straining again.
"Something wrong Jess?" Jack asked.
"I'm just trying to get into my favorite pair of ultra-small skinny jeans, but THEY JUST DON'T WANT TO FIT FOR SOME REASON!" She said, straining to close her jeans.
For a few moments, Jack listened as Jessica struggled to close the pants but with no success.
"Listen here jeans, I wore you last week and the week before that and that week before that. Nothing's changed. Now I command you to fit OR I WILL DESTROY YOU!" Jessica commanded her pants, the sounds of strain being heard once again.
"Let 'em Jess. Better to have worn those pants and loss then to have never worn them at all" Jack said.
"I don't get it. They fit last week. They didn't shrink in the dryer. I mean, I feel a little bloated today, but even then they usually fit" Jessica said, disappointment in her voice.
"Just wear something else" Jack said.
"Fine. Anyways, I'm just wondering what were going to do?" Jessica asked.

"I was thinking maybe a nice bite to eat and a movie or something? I don't know" Jack said. He really didn't know WHAT he was going to do during this "not date" date.
"Dude, you know what's cool? Laser tag. We should have a grown-up dinner and then play laser tag." Jessica said.
"I don't know Jessica. Laser Tag? Are we a little old?" Jack asked.
"Your never too old for Laser Tag" Jessica said, smirking at the other end.
"Okay, maybe if there's time. I'm really tired today. I have had the weirdest day in history" Jack said.
"Are you sure about that?" Jessica asked.
"If it wasn't, it had to be in the top 5 of all time" Jack replied.
"Well you can tell me all about it when you pick me up. Since you blew off class, I thought we could get this whole "date" thing done with" Jessica said,
"Hey it's not a date" Jack replied.
"Yeah, it's just Dinner and Laser Tag" Jessica said.
"MAYBE Laser Tag" Jack corrected.
"Okay Romeo. Just pick me up in twenty minutes. I'm starving. I feel like I could eat a whole buffet" Jessica said.
"See you in twenty" Jack said, hanging up his phone, grabbing his keys and heading back out the door.

= = = = = = = = == =

Back at the hospital, Amanda slowly picked up the phone in Dr. Harper's office, who was going over the test results and the sonogram.
"Wow, at your age. 1, 2, 3, 4 - Four healthy fetuses. I tell you Mrs. Dale, between Tara hidden two babies, and your middle-aged quadruplet pregnancy, I may just have enough to write a whole new paper!" Dr Harper said, her eyes darting between the test results and the sonograms.
Amanda wasn't looking, she just held the phone up to her ear, staring down at her stomach.

"Hi Honey. How's work going?" Amanda asked her husband.
"Oh that's good. That's good. I'm glad to hear that" Amanda responded.
She had no idea how to tell her early 50's husband that his early 50's wife was pregnant - -- with quadruplets!
"Um, I'm here at the hospital" Amanda started to say before being cut off.
"No, no, no. Everything's fine. We'll kind of. " Amanda informed.
"Jack's fine, I'm - - - " Amanda ran her hand over her small bulge in her midsection.
"It was Tera. Yes, that new pregnant girl from work. Seems something happened so Jack and I rushed her here. No, no, she's fine. Yeah, turns out she's having triplets! I know. She just really kind of popped out all of a sudden." Amanda continued.

Dr, Harper slowly lifted her head up from her stack of papers to Amanda, she knew what was coming next. She had a grin on her fact about it.
Dr. Harper always loved this part of the job. No, not the everyday 20 and 30 something that were starting families or expanding them, she loved the rare occurrences like these were older couples were blessed with an unexpected visit from the stork. In Mrs. Dale's case, he had been working over time.

"Jack went home. Nah, I sent him home. I wanted to stay behind for Tera, and - - - " Amanda paused.
"Well, I think it's better if you could come down here.... Kind of immediately. It's important" Amanda continued.
"It's pretty big. And I think you'll want to see for yourself. Is it good or bad?" Amanda paused.
"Depends on your point of view. Let's just say a Doctor here found something." Amanda said.
"Look, I really need to show you because otherwise... Just get down here" Amanda said.
"Just ask for Doctor Harper's office. Floor 3.

She hung up the phone and looked down at her midsection then sighed.
"Couldn't tell him could you?" Dr Harper asked with a grin on her face.
"I don't think he would believe it over the phone. I still don't believe it myself" She said.

= = = = = = =

Twenty mintues passed and Jack pulled up to Jessica's doorstep right on time. She was wearing a pair of black jeans and a red shirt. Oddly, she seemed slightly.. rounder than Jack remember her to be. Her breasts (something Jack noticed on her often) were differently much bigger and fuller looking.

As Jessica trotted up to the car, Jack took his eyes off her chest and onto the road, hoping that Jessica didn't see him looking.
"Hey-a Jack. So ready for this Not-Date Date?" Jessica asked, getting into the car and putting on her seatbelt.
"I'm at your service M'Lady" Jack said nobly.
"Very well then. Driver, I hunger. Take me some place so I may dine." Jessica said, putting a hand to her head in a comical swoon.
"As you wish M'Lady" Jack said with a smile, driving off to their destination.
11411111122121.title: Jessica calls, Jack dates, and "big" family news

choices: They FINALLY get to go on their date
114111111221212.content:
Not one second after Jack's foot hit the gas pedal, his phone started going off again. Jessica covered her mouth and laughed quietly at Jack's ringtone. Jack gave an embarrassed grin and slowed the car down so he could get a look at his phone's screen.

"Hopefully it's just someone from school calling about me missing class," Jack said, leaning over. He had a pal, Chuck, who sat next to him in the class he was skipping today. Chuck was a nice guy and he and Jack talked a lot, but he was a little nosy and eager. "Whoever it is, I'd rather just ignore them and get going." Then, Jack's eyes bugged a little and he pulled the car back into Jessica's driveway and powered down.

"Someone important?" Jessica asked as Jack quickly scooped up the phone and brought it to his ear.

"Yeah, it's my mom. Sorry-" Jack said, his voice switching from its nervous, faux-cool tone with Jessica to his more natural cadence. "Hi Mom, what's up?"

"Hello Jack," Tara's voice said.

"Tara?" Jack croaked, his nervous tone back, "Wh-how are you feeling?" Jessica looked over at Jack curiously, only hearing his side of the conversation.

"Fine, everything feels fine. I'm just a little bigger is all," Tara said matter-of-factly. "Your mom left her cell phone in her purse after she left the doctor's room. I think she may be going over paperwork with Dr. Harper and it's taking a really long time. I've got everything squared away, so would you mind driving me to my home?" Her voice sounded tiny and sweet.

"Um," Jack said, looking over at Jessica before turning back away from her. This only made Jessica only more puzzled. "My mom just left you there?"

Tara laughed. "Well, I don't mean it to sound that harsh, but I think she just got preoccupied and I'm all set to go. It's fine if you can't; I don't want to trouble you." Jack knew she didn't mean to, but he felt incredibly guilty hearing that. Here was a heavily pregnant woman whose condition, if Jack's hypothesis about the coin was right, was his fault, and he was preventing her from getting home because he was going to play laser tag with a girl he liked. He couldn't say no.

"No, it's fine," he said haggardly. "I'll be right there." His thumb switched the phone off and he cranked the car key to power the car back up. "Um, we need to make a bit of a detour," Jack said to Jessica, his face apologetic.

"What kind of detour?" Jessica asked, crossing her arms as unthreateningly as she could.

"A co-worker of my mom is stranded at the hospital and needs someone to get her home. My mom can't do it, it seems, and she's...not really in a good position to ask anyone else other than me."

"What do you mean?" Jessica asked, any hint of frustration now turned to curiosity.

Jack sighed. "Well, she's pregnant. Really pregnant. But the thing is...she wasn't pregnant when the day started. She just sort of, boom, became that way."

Jessica's face turned to a confused smile. "Well, how do you know she wasn't pregnant? What, she took a pregnancy test at the hospital and that's some huge surprise?"

"N-not exactly. See, when I walked into my mom's work, she was there and she was just like you or me," Jack said, pausing slightly. Although, if I'm right about this coin, she's might not be so different from you, Jack worried in his head. "B-but anyway, suddenly, her belly just became all big and pregnant-y and everyone acted like it had always been that way."

"That's...a little hard to believe," Jessica said slowly.

"Well, then it happened again: her belly got bigger. And bigger. But this time, people noticed and my mom and I took her to the hospital," Jack said, taking the exit to the hospital. "But even at the hospital, the doctor had records of her being pregnant, just not as pregnant as she ended up being after the weird swellings."

"Swellings," Jessica said with a giggle. "What a nice way to talk about the nurturing of human life."

Jack felt himself blush slightly as he pulled up to the hospital. "Anyway, that's part of why my day has been so weird. But after we drop her off, I promise you a fun, normal night. No giant pregnant bellies or anything."

Jessica rolled her eyes and chuckled. "Jack, c'mon, don't be a jerk. I'm sure she's not GIGANT-" As Jessica rolled her eyes, she spotted Tara standing outside the doors of the hospital, waving over to Jack's familiar car. "Okay, maybe you have a point." They both got out of the car and walked over to Tara, whose original, fun personality had come back since her sudden growth spurt.

"Thank you so much, Jack," Tara said happily, rubbing one hand on her belly as she turned to Jessica. "And hello to you too."

"Hi, I'm Jessica," she said, reaching a hand out to shake Tara's as Jack felt himself sweating nervously under his shirt. "You must be Tara."

"Yeah, but I'm sure it wasn't hard to point me out," Tara laughed, smacking both hands to her belly. It made a loud, almost drum-like sound as she rubbed in small circles. Jessica laughed too and Jack joined in, but his laugh was far more phony. The three of them walked back to the car, Tara insisting to both Jack and Jessica that she didn't need any help walking.

"Go ahead and plug your directions into the GPS," Jack said, handing his phone to Tara in the backseat. With her belly as big as it was, she wouldn't have fit into the front too easily. A course now programmed for them, Jack rolled back out onto the streets as Tara adjusted herself in her seat so she could lean forward and talk to himself and Jessica.

"So, you're a friend of Jack's?" she asked innocently. Jessica smiled and nodded, turning around in her seat to talk with Tara.

"Yeah, we were going to hang out and play a little laser tag," Jessica said with a grin, knowing how much it annoyed Jack when she insisted on the laser tag that she KNEW she was going to get.

"Oh, I'm so sorry," Tara said, realization dawning on her. "I had no idea I would be interrupting your date."

"It's not a date!" Jack and Jessica said, although Jack a little more eagerly. He turned back toward his side as his face turned red. Jessica looked back at Tara and smiled softly, biting her bottom lip and raising her eyebrows. Tara smiled back and nodded knowingly.

"So, did everything turn out okay at the hospital?" Jessica asked Tara, getting the topic changed for Jack's sake.

"Yep," Tara said with a smile. "Turned out there were two more babies hiding inside here, although the doctor didn't know why it would cause such a sudden growth spurt," she said curiously, rubbing her belly. Jessica leaned out of her seat a little more.

"W-would it be okay if I felt?" Jessica asked nervously. Tara smiled and stuck out her stomach.

"Please, go ahead!" she said. Jessica reached her hand out and ran her hands across Tara's taunt belly.

"Wow...there's so much movement, too. So you're carrying triplets?"

"Yeah, I can hardly believe it. Not many women get to go through this," Tara said with pride, before turning back to her belly lovingly. "Although, today was a total surprise, so who knows? There might be more hiding in here."

At that, Jack had just pulled up in front of Tara's apartment complex. With Jack's help, she got out of the car and waddled over to her unit, smiling and waving at both of them. Back in the car, Jessica was still a little in awe of her first rub of a pregnant belly (to her knowledge).

"So she was totally flat-stomached when you met her today?"

"Yep. And that's not even the first time that's happened to me today," Jack added, pulling back out. "But we can talk about that any 'ol time. Let's eat!"
114111111221212.title: On the way there, Jack gets a very important ca...

choices: Jack takes Jessica to her home
Jack takes Jessica to his home
1141111112212121.content:
At the mention of food, Jessica's eyes lit up. "I'm starving," she whined playfully, grinning as Jack pulled out of Tara's driveway and headed for the restaurant he'd planned out earlier in the day. It was an Italian place, family-owned, but also busy enough that they could hide out in the back somewhere without people noticing them.

They were seated quickly, just as Jack had planned, in a booth in a back corner. The light was low and Jessica smiled flirtatiously across the table at him, the soft light given off by the lamp above them accentuating her quiet beauty. Jack grinned back weakly, glad to finally be on the not-date that was waiting for him at the end of the day, like a carrot on the end of a long, bizarre stick.

When the waiter came, they both put in their orders, but Jessica caught the waitress just before she left.

"And, actually, could we get an appetizer too, please? The bruschetta?" The waitress smiled and nodded, writing down the order before leaving. Jessica smiled at Jack, hiding her lips inside her mouth. "Sorry, I'm just soooo hungry. You probably think I'm a pig."

"No! No," Jack said with a reassuring smile. "It's fine, eat whatever you want. You're great the way you are." At this, Jessica smiled brightly and preened.

"I'm great, huh?"

Jack laughed nervously. "Y-yeah, you are."

"So," Jessica said, leaning forward, "You say the whole 'sudden pregnancy' thing happened more than once today?"

"Yeah, twice," Jack said, taking a long sip of water. "Remember when you came into my work and my manager was pregnant?"

Jessica thought back and remembered seeing April's big, round belly. "Oh yeah! So she wasn't pregnant when you came in?"

"No. The same thing happened with Tara. Weird, huh?"

"Yeah, that is weird," Jessica said, crossing her arms in contemplation. "Unless you're just imagining things or...something. Do you have any theories?"

Jack took a noter nervous swig of water. "W-well, I do, kinda. The only thing that was the same with both of them was right before they became pregnant, I remember flipping this coin." Jack pulled the infamous coin out of his pocket and put it on the table for Jessica to see. She took it in her hand and inspected it in silence.

"I've never seen anything like it," she said. "But...it looks like there's a pregnant woman on both sides of these. That seems like a pretty big coincidence."

"Yeah," Jack agreed, nodding. He'd forgotten all about the actual designs on the coin. "But it seems weird, right? I mean, how could flipping a coin make someone pregnant?"

Jessica spied the waitress walking toward them with the bruschetta and she gave Jack a tiny grin. "Let's see if it works, shall we?"

"I-I don't think that's a good idea, Jess."

She giggled and placed it over her thumb. "Oh, c'mon Jack. It's not like a coin can really make someone pregnant. Let's just see, huh?" And with that, Jessica gave the coin a quick flip and caught it. Heads.

"Here you go," the waitress said, placing the food on the table. Jessica looked at her, looked at the coin, then back to Jack, shrugging.

"Thank you," Jessica said with a smile, grabbing a piece of bread and springing tomato and cheese on it as soon as the waitress turned around. "I guess it doesn't do anything after all."

"I guess," Jack said with a relieved sigh. Good, so I was wrong about the coin, he thought. So nothing happened to Jessica when I flipped the coin yesterday.

Little did they know, back in the kitchen, the waitress reached into her purse under the counter and fished out her bottle of pre-natal pills for controlling nausea and washed it down with some water.
-----

Back at the hospital, Jack Dale Sr. had just walked into Dr. Harper's office, where the good doctor and Amanda Dale were sitting. Amanda smiled weakly at her husband.

"Hi, honey," she said. Jack Sr. looked anxious, so she held his hand as he sat down. "Don't worry, it's okay...Dr. Harper, would you mind?"

Dr. Harper nodded and smiled. "Mr. Dale, your wife is pregnant."

His jaw dropped. "Pregnant? I...are you sure?"

Amanda and Dr. Harper both nodded. "Positively," Dr. Harper said. "And she doesn't show any signs of distress or any risky medical signs we see with pregnant women of her age." Dr. Harper turned to Amanda. "Well, let's be honest, our age. I never want to discriminate against older pregnant women and I'll take good care of you, I promise."

Jack Sr. sighed and turned to give his wife a big kiss, which caught her by surprise. "Well, I can't say I was expecting being a father again," he said with a laugh, "But to be honest, I'm feeling pretty happy right now. I love you so much, dear." He went back to kissing Amanda on the cheek, who smiled sheepishly again as she moved Jack back a bit to talk to him.

"There's more," she said, taking a big breath. "It's...more than one baby. It's four."

Dr. Harper handed him a print-out of the ultrasound as his eyes bugged out. Jack Sr. couldn't say anything other than, "well...huh."

----

Her fork fell to her plate with a clang as Jessica leaned back in her seat, hand on her stomach. "Whoo! I am stuffed," she said. "That was great. I don't know why I was so hungry when I'm already bloated like crazy. Thanks for putting up with my rabid feeding, Jack," she laughed.

"It was an honor to watch you work," Jack joked, bowing playfully. Jessica threw her napkin at him with a giggling scowl as he finished his last bites.

"So, laser tag now?"

"I thought you were stuffed?" Jack asked.

"Yeah, but I'm still hungry. Hungry for laser tag," she said in a deadpan manner, putting her fists on the table. "C'mon, please?"

"Oh, alright," he said, rolling his eyes with a smile. To be honest, he had partly picked the restaurant because it wasn't far from the laser tag place in town, expecting that this would be the outcome of the night. Jessica squealed with pleasure as the waitress brought their check.

Over at the Fun Zone, Jack and Jessica were putting on their vests and having the rules explained to them by a monotone teenager. While they listened to the rules, Jessica put down her gun and asked Jack for some help.

"My vest isn't going on too well. It's...pressing against my boobs and it hurts a lot," she complained trying to pull the vest closed. Jack gave her a hand, blushing at her admission that her breasts had gotten larger since the last time he saw her.

They'd been put on opposite teams, at Jessica's insistence, because, quote, "she wanted to kick his ass."And, as they went out into the dark battleground, she did just that. She found him out pretty quickly and camped close to him, blasting him away every chance she got, laughing and whooping maniacally as she did.

"This is fun for you?" Jack laughed after she zapped him the 10th time.

"It isn't for you?" she grinned back, sticking her tongue out. As soon as Jack's blaster turned back on, he zapped her back, hitting her squarely on the shoulder and freezing her. Jessica's mouth hung open, shocked. "Oh, you'll pay for that."

After about half an hour of gameplay, they both walked out, sweaty and laughing. Looking up at the game board, it was pretty clear that while the two of them were fooling around and trying to shoot one another, the others involved in the laser tag were actually racking up points. They both shrugged and laughed, heading back out to the car.

"Oh my god, that was so fun," Jessica said, before turning quickly to Jack. "Ooh, ice cream?"

"Sure," he smiled, pulling into a little outdoor place so the two of them could grab a cone. Then, they walked around in a nearby park, just talking, chatting, genuinely catching up. Time passed rapidly, and eventually is was close to midnight and the two of them were sitting on a bench together.

"I'm so glad we did this," Jessica said, wiping the last traces of ice cream from her lips and tossing the napkin into a nearby napkin. "I missed spending time with you."

"Yeah, me too," Jack smiled, scooting a little closer to Jessica. "B-but, you know..."

"Yeah?" Jessica said, moving closer as well, her voice getting quieter.

"I know we both said this wasn't a date, but if it had been a date, i-it would have been one of the best I've ever been on." Jack was almost trembling at this point. Jessica smiled and brought her face closer to his.

"Well put," she giggled. "But...I feel the same way." Their eyes met and each one looked at one another's lips. Soon, they were moving in for a kiss, their eyes slowly closing.

Then, the clock struck midnight and Jessica stopped just millimeters short of Jack's lips. "Ugh, I feel..." she clutched her stomach. "Whoa," she moaned, her belly now expanding slowly. It wasn't dramatic, but they could both see her abdomen rounding out, creating a visible bulge.

"Jessica?" Jack said worriedly, holding onto her arms.

"Jack?" Jessica asked, looking down and feeling her belly, which was now firm in the middle. "What's happening to me?"
1141111112212121.title: They FINALLY get to go on their date

choices: Jack goes to the library to research the coin
11411111122121211.content:
Jack helped Jessica into the passenger seat of his car. She wasn't feeling weak or sick, but the shock of the sudden expansion definitely left her in a somewhat stunned state. As they walked together, her hands were still on her now curved belly, studying it with her palms, saying nothing.

It wasn't much different in the car. Jack drove quickly, his eyes looking out to watch the red lights of other cars and the white stripes of the road that were both illuminated in the dark. His whole face was pale and he could feel nervous droplets of sweat starting on the back of his neck. Even in this stunned state, Jack could still make sense of what was happening. After all, he'd already done something similar earlier in the day with Tara, who's pregnant belly suddenly grew and grew. So, Jack's worse fears had come true.

Jessica was pregnant.

But this doesn't make sense, Jack thought to himself, looking over at Jessica's adorable little bump. With Tara and all the others, I flipped that coin first. I didn't do anything this time and her belly didn't even grow that much, compared to everyone else.

Jessica rolled up her shirt to look more at her new middle. Her belly button looked like it was on the verge of popping out but there was still plenty of room to go. Jessica traced its rim with her fingertips before going back to stroking her stomach.

"It's really firm..." Jessica said, pressing her palm against her waist before trying to pinch her belly skin. "It's tight too. So at least this isn't fat," Jessica giggled to herself before sighing again. "But then...what it is? It just feels like I'm swollen in here."

"Maybe you should see a doctor in the morning," Jack said, trying to think of something to comfort Jessica, or at least try to make sense of the situation. "How do you feel?"

"It...it feels fine, I guess," Jessica said, looking back down at her tummy. "But, you know what it really looks like? Like I'm pregn-"

"Don't," Jack said, as the car stopped quickly at a red light, rubbing his temples nervously. "Don't...say that. That doesn't make any sense. None of this makes any sense. You, April, Tara, Faye."

Jessica put one hand on Jack's arm. "Jack, look, I'm sure everything's okay. I said I feel fine, right? Just...let me get some rest when I get home and I'll figure things out in the morning."

Jack sighed heavily and nodded, driving off as the light turned green. "You're right. I'm sorry for getting upset." They drove for about 10 more minutes in silence until Jack pulled in front of Jessica's house. "Well...let me know if you find anything out or if you, you know," Jack hesitated and looked down, "want to hang out again."

Jessica grinned and unbuckled her seat. "Don't worry, I will. And Jack?"

He looked up just as Jessica leaned over and kissed him on the cheek.

"Overall, it was a great date." Jessica hopped out of the car and walked up to her door, one hand still over her newly found bulge. Jack couldn't shake the shocked expression from his face the entire time he drove back home. It wasn't until he lay down in bed and stroked the slightly-damp spot on his cheek that he smiled to himself.

----Faye and Amanda: Day 4 / Jessica: Day 3----

Walking downstairs the next morning, Jack yawned loudly, scratching his head. He felt like there was something very important to remember or think about, but it escaped him. I'm sure it'll come to me, Jack thought, sitting down at the kitchen table, pouring himself a bowl of cereal.

As he did, his mother and father walked in from the living room, both of them with an anxious expression. "Jack?" his mother said, wearing a heavy robe. "Can we talk to you for a minute?"

"Sure," Jack said, looking back and forth at his mom and dad to try and figure out what they were asking about. They both looked at each other before his mom sighed and gave a tiny smile.

"I'm...pregnant," she said.

Ah, right,Jack thought, his heart sinking as the events of the past day replaying themselves in his mind. That's what I was trying to remember.

"Are you okay, pal?" his dad said, putting his arm around Amanda's shoulders. Jack nodded, swallowing a big bite of cereal.

"Yeah, I guess so. I mean, if you're both happy, then I'm happy," he said. "Did you find out when you were with Tara?"

His mom nodded. "Yes, and there was...something else. You're not just going to have a little brother or sister. You're going to have...four."

Jack looked at her with a shocked look, still trying to subconsciously reel in his expression. "F-four?"

"Yep, quadruplets," his father said with a nervous laugh. "But the doctor said everything looks healthy, so that's one less thing to worry about."

Jack felt himself shake nervously as he quickly finished his cereal. "W-well, um, congratulations Mom, I guess. I've got to g-go right now, but I guess we can talk more about this later?"

"Yes, sure," his mom said, her hand unconsciously going to her waist, rubbing it gingerly. Jack put his bowl away and headed out the door.

Out of ear range, Amanda turned to Jack Sr. "There's another problem we didn't tell him about, you know." Opening her robe, she revealed a pronounced bulge in her middle, the size of a 30 week pregnant belly. "I know it's four, but the doctor said I was only three months pregnant. This looks...a little big, wouldn't you say?"

Jack Sr. was speechless, looking at his over-50 wife's pregnant belly. "I...whatever you say, dear."

-----

As he got into the car, Jack let out a long sigh as he quickly dug his coin out, staring at it. "This is all your fault," he said. "I don't know how, but it is."

Jack the coin said softly. Jack scrunched his face up. The coin knew he was talking about it.

"Well, whatever. Let's try and think about this," Jack said, talking out loud. "Alright, so when I flip you and look at someone, they get pregnant. That much is clear now. And sometimes it's a lot and sometimes it's a little. And...sometimes they're fine with it and sometimes it surprises them."

Jack turned the coin over in his hands a few times, studying the designs on them.

"Two sides to a coin, so...two different results. Maybe heads is a full pregnancy and one is just a little one...or one makes them fine with it and one surprises them. But which is it? And what happens if I flipped it and looked at a guy?" Jack looked at the design on the coin of what looked like a pregnant man and shuddered. I'll have to try not to do that, he thought to himself, pocketing the coin again and turning on the ignition.
11411111122121211.title: Jack takes Jessica to her home

114111111221212111.content: Where does he go shopping?
114111111221212111.title: Jack goes shopping

choices: He tells Ian everything. This is his best friend!
He holds back. I mean, it's crazy right?
1141111112212121111.content:
Jack drove, and drove, and drove some more. He practically drove until he almost ran out of road. Then he turn around and drove some more, just driving around with no particular place to go.

He needed to clear his head after everything that has happened; April, Tara, Faye, Jessica... His mother.

Oh god, Mom. Jack thought, thinking back to his encounter with his parents. His mother was pregnant. His 50-something mother was PREGNANT. And not just with one baby, but with FOUR.

Four little brother and sisters he was going to have. Four little brothers and sisters he would have to look out for and help raise. Oh god, he wasn't going to be an only child anymore. He was going to be a brother, big brother Jack!

This isn't just about you anymore Jack. Think about Mom He thought. Four! She was going to be huge! Absolutely massive! Jack thought back to the dream he had... Was it dream? Or a vision of the future? All the images came rushing back to him... Jessica, Faye.. His mother.

He shook his head trying to take his mind off of everything that seemed to happening.

Jack the voice in the back of his head called to him.

Was this coin really talking to him? Was this coin the cause of all of it? Faye, April, Tara, Jessica... His mother? He thought back to the conversation he had with himself just moments earlier.. Crazy as it may be, could this coin really cause a pregnancy?

BZZT! BZZT!

Jack was snapped back to reality by the ringing of his cellphone. Without looking he snapped it up, answered it, and put it to his ear.

"Jessica? Are you okay? Did you go to the Doctor? What did the Doctor say? Are you - - - " Jack just let out, without thinking.
"Jessica? What are you talking about bro? It's me Ian, your best friend. Your best friend since Junior High. Your best friend that you've been hanging out with all summer? The best friend that's calling to remind you that we had a very important appointment at the mall?" Ian, Jack's best friend (not of the female variety) said.
"Ian?" Jack said confused. His mind was racing, he almost had no idea where he was or what he was doing.
"Yeah, Ian. Thin as a rail, tall, lanky, wears glasses, the second half of the dynamic duo known as Stick Man and Blubber Boy, as we were so
often called in Junior High and High School." Ian reminded him.
"Hey, I wasn't that fat in High School" Jack corrected.
"Tell that to your backside" Ian reminded him.
"The size of my backside in High School aside, what were you talking about? What appointment at the mall?" Jack asked, the events of the past few days weighing heavily on his memory of something very important.

"Don't tell me you forgot." Ian said.
"Let's say I did. Want to cut to the chase?" Jack said, getting slightly annoyed.
"Three words and a number - Zombie Massacre Mania 2! Or did you forget that the biggest video games of the year came out TODAY, and we have two deluxe editions waiting for us at GameWorld?" Ian said, almost sounding almost offended that his best friend forgot this truly historic occasion.
"Oh man, Zombie Massacre Mania 2! I totally forgot!" Jack said, slapping his forehead with his hand.
"You forgot? How do you forget ZMM2? That's like forgetting to breath!" Ian responded back to him smartly.
"I've had a lot of mind. It's been.. a weird couple of days. " Jack says.
"You see, this is what happens when you don't hang out with your best friend for a week. Everything goes to hell for you. But don't worry, Dr. Ian Carter has the cure! Zombie Massacring. I recommend an all marathon session." Ian replies.
"You're not a Doctor Ian. You manage a coffee shop." Jack replied.
"Yeah, but I manage it" Ian reinforced. "Now, are you coming or not?" Ian finished.
"Be there soon bro. We shall soon be knee deep in the undead!" Jack replied, almost all of his cares seemingly pushed aside by the promise of ultra violence against the undead.

Jack turned his vehicle around and headed off to the mall. Upon arriving some time later, he managed to find a decent parking spot in the garage, which was lucky since the mall seemed particularly packed today. He got out of the car and walked inside, the cares of the world and the weirdness of the days before seemingly melting away with every step he took. However, Jack didn't know that the weirdness that seemed to be following him around like a chain these past few days was only about to get worse and more crazy.

Jack strolled through the mall, past the clothing stores, book stores, furniture stores, and dozens of other stores, taking in the sights, sounds, and smells. Giant pretzels were baking in a restaurant, a live band seemed to be blaring away in the center pavilion, and shoppers seemed to be talking amongst themselves, hauling around their packages. Jack even noticed a few very attractive looking girls his own age walking past him, talking on the cellphones or texting. Jack stopped and checked them out, admiring them, remembering that sometimes, he really really loved the mall.

However, as he passed "Buns In The Oven" all of the memories of the pass few days came rushing back as he watched pregnant women of all shapes, sizes, and ethnicities waddled into the trendy maternity store. He thought of April. He thought of Faye. He thought of Faye, and Jessica, and his mother.

He lowered his head and kept walking, trying to keep his eyes off the new Maternity Lingerie display in the window.

After a few more stores, Jack finally reached his destination of GameWorld, the game superstore, where a long line of eager gamers awaited to get their hands of the second installment of the world's most popular zombie killing RPG.

"Finally, you made it! I thought you got lost or something! What took you so long!" Ian said, walking over to his friend, and putting his arm around his shoulder. Ian was taller than Jack, always has been since they were kids.

Ian was an odd one, while he was tall, he always seemed so thing, giving off the appearance of a walking stick with eyeglasses. Ian had short dark hair, glasses, and almost no facial hair, which many people thought was also odd. For whatever reason, Ian couldn't seem to grow a mustache or a bear, despite being the exact same age as Jack.

"I uh, had a lot on my mind" Jack said, removing Ian's arm from around his shoulder and giving his friend a playful push.
"Well at least something is on your mind." Ian replied.
"Oh ha, ha, ha. So, you ready for this?" Jack responded, trying to desperately get his mind off of... maternal things.
"You know it. I took the next two days off so we can play co-op both in person and online. I swear man, it's going to be just like when we were kids and had the marathon weekend sessions." Ian said with a smile, remembering the good times.
"Two days off? I guess being manager has it perks?" Jack replied.
"Set the schedule, more pay, and slide off all responsibility to my assistant manager? Hell yeah." Ian smiled.

As the line for the zombie killing goodness grew shorter as more and more people picked up their game, Jack slowly grew more and more depressed. Not because he was sad about finally picking up the game he had been waiting three years for, but for whatever reason, the mall was slowly becoming crowded with more and more pregnant women, which only seemed to remind Jack of his situation.

Finally, after picking up their pre-ordered deluxe edition of their game, Jack and Ian sat a table at the food court. Ian was going on and on about all the new features of the games, the new quests, the new abilities, the new epic life or death choices a player was forced to make, but it was all going in one ear and out the other as he watched a pregnant woman sit down across from them and order a big lunch.

"Hey, Earth to Jack! What's going on, you've been like a zombie all day! Do I have to be the chainsaw of undead justice down upon you or something?" Ian said, referencing one of the new weapons in the game.

"Ian, you're my friend and I can tell you anything right?" Jack said, starting.
"Of course man. You know it." Ian said.
"Look, something.. Something weird has been going on lately." Jack said.
"Well, spit it out! Come on man, what's going on?" Ian asked.

Jack hesitated. Does he tell his best friend everything? About the coin? About Faye? Tera? April? Jessica? His mother? He would sound crazy. But.. It's Ian.
1141111112212121111.title: Hanging Out At The Mall.

choices: Try it out on me. It won't work, you'll feel better" Ian says.
"Get rid of the coin. It's driving you crazy " Ian says.
11411111122121211111.content:
"Okay, you want to know what's going on?" Jack asked, looking at his friend.
"No, I want to sit here and have this conversation continue to go in circles." Ian said sarcastically.

"Okay, here it goes. A few days ago, I go with my parents to this rummage sale or something like it right? I'm looking around at all this junk right? And I come across this coin - - - " Jack said as he reached into his pocket, pulling out the coin, and placing it on the table.

"And I buy it right? It's just a coin I think right? So, on the return trip home, I end up flipping it while looking out the window, and I see Faye Jones. You know Faye right?" Jack asks.

"Yeah, she had some disease or something that made it hard for her to get pregnant or something. ' Ian responses.

"Yeah. Well the next day, she comes over and she announces that she's pregnant. And I'm all like, well that's great. I mean, I think nothing of it right? But you know what I think? I think this coin - - - " Jack says, tapping the coin.

"I think this coin did it." Jack says, nodding his head for emphasis.

"Uh-- huh." Ian says, giving his friend a "Bro, you've gone insane" look.

"I know right. And that's not all right. So, I'm at work, and I go on break to the comic book store, and guess who comes in? Jessica." Jack says.

"Jessica as in "I've loved her since forever and won't admit it and still just say she's a friend even though it's obvious I want to be much more than friends with her" Jessica?" Ian asks, already knowing the answer.

"Maybe not in some many words but yes. Also shut up about Jessica" Jack said, continuing his story.
"Anyways, she comes in and we talk a while. I mean, it's been a while since I've seen her since High School, so I ask her if she wants to hang out, and I flip the coin, and we agree to go out." Jack continued.

"Wait, you had a date with Jessica?" Ian asked his eyes going wide. "Dude, you gotta tell everything that happened with that man. Tell me bro, did you hit it?" Ian says, asking for all the juicy details.
"Dude, shut up and let me finish!" Jack said. "Now where was I? Oh yeah. So, the next day right, I go to work, and April's there right. And I feel the coin calling to me, almost begging me to flip it right? So I do, and I look at April, next thing I know right - BOOM PREGNANT" Jack says, his voice going loud as his emphasis on the boom and the pregnant, causing a few people to look over their table.

"April? Dude, she's been pregnant since you worked there. You were telling me about how during the job interview her belly kept hitting things around the store as she asked you questions and you had to pick up everything. " Ian says, very matter-of-factly.

"Ian? What are you talking about! That never happened! I'm telling you, I flipped this coin and she became pregnant and acted like it was always that way!" Jack said, his voice slowly getting louder.

"Okay, okay. I believe you. Is that all?" Ian said, trying to calm his friend down.
"No!" Jack said. "So April's all like "I've been this way forever" and I'm like "No way" and she's like "Whatever". So I go home, and my mom needs me to take her to her office to pick up some stuff since she's been so sick lately. So I take her there, and after a while I go inside because, hey I'm bored right? So I go inside and there's this woman there named Tara, and we both want a soda, so we flip a coin - - THIS COIN " Jack says, once again tapping this coin, his voice getting loud "And then BOOM! PREGNANT! And she's all like "I've always been pregnant, and she's like "I'm pregnant so I really want that soda, let's go again, and I flip again - She becomes MORE PREGNANT" Jack says, his voice so loud people in the food court are listening to him.

"And now she's all like, my twins really want the soda, let's go one more time, so I flip again, and now she's having triplets, but here's the thing, she only remembers having twins right? But I tell she's wasn't pregnant when she came in, and my mom comes back, and she's like not at all phased by this. So because I just watched her belly expand and become pregnant we loud her up into the car and take her to the hospital. Once we get there it's all like "My doctor is here" and we take her there and it's like she's been pregnant this whole time and the doctor's like "Wow, how did we miss this third baby? And I'm thinking "BECAUSE SHE JUST BECAME PREGNANT!" Jack is practically shouting now as he gives his explanation, and a couple people in the food courts are starting to leave the surrounding tables , clearly to get away from the crazy person.

"Jack, I really think you need to see someone about this dude. This doesn't sound healthy to be imagining all this!" Ian says, actually getting concerned for his friends mental health.
"I'm not imagining this! This all really happened! Just ask Jessica! She's pregnant too! And it's all this coins' fault!" Jack shouts.
"Jessica's pregnant? Wow, wonder who the father is? Last I heard, she hasn't been seeing anyone for months." Ian wonders.
"THERE IS NO FATHER! OR MAYBE THERE IS! I THINK IT'S THIS COIN!" Jack shouts.

"Shut up over there you crazy freak!" Someone yells from across the food court.
"You shut up!" Jack yells back.
"Jack, bro. I think you're beginning to lose it". Ian responds back to his friend.

"I'm not losing it Ian! Jessica's pregnant! I watched her grow pregnant at midnight! Call her if you don't believe me! It's not just man! MY MOM IS PREGNANT! WITH QUADRUPLETS! FOUR!" Jack is shouting.
"Whoa, whoa whoa. Dude. Your mom is pregnant? Seriously?" Ian asks, amazed.
"Yes dude! She's over 50! And she's pregnant! With four! And it's this coins fault!" Jack says, grabbing the coin off the table and holding it in front of Ian's face for dramatic effect.

"Dude, I can't believe your mom is pregnant! That's crazy! I'm, she's kid of old, but hey, you get some brothers and sisters right? I mean, that's cool right?" Ian asks, trying to remain positive.
"No it's not!" Jack says back, slamming his head on the table, and keeping it there.

"Okay, look man. I understand that finding out your mom is pregnant at her age is quite stressful, but I don't think it's causing all this nonsense you've been describing to me. You and I both took Health Class, we know where babies come from, and it sure as hell isn't from some coin. I think you're in some weird, messed up kind of denial about - - - something I don't know.

Look at it like this okay? You come back from college to hang out with your parents right? And then you find out your mom is pregnant, at her age, with four babies right? Suddenly your whole life is thrown upside down, and to top it all off, you start dating a pregnant chick right? So your brain comes up with this whole thing okay? This is just your bizarre way of dealing with stress. " Ian explains.

"But look at the coin dude. It has pregnant people on there! Not just a woman, but a man! I think this thing could work on man!" Jack explains to his friend showing him the coin. "Man, you gotta take some pills or something for this. Men don't have babies. Women have babies, and apparently a lot of the women in your life are having them and it's causing you to go loopy." Ian says.

"You don't believe me." Jack says, shaking his head.
"I believe that you believe it. But to make you feel better - - - "

Ian turned and pointed to a large fountain, “just chuck it in there,” he said.
“In the fountain?” asked Jack.
“yeah, you could also make a wish,” said Ian with a grin.
“I know what I would wish for,” said Jack despondently.

They made their way to the edge of the large fountain, well the pool of water the surrounded it, the actual fountain itself was several meters away.
Jack took the coin out and held it in a close fist over the water, “go on drop it,” Ian urged. Jack’s entire body shook as his tried open his fingers, it was like some invisible force was forcing his fingers to stay closed over the coin. “Come on Frodo it’s not the One Ring,” said Ian.
With a great effort Jack opened his hand, the coin without changing in any physical way seemed to try and hold on, before falling into the water with a ‘plonk’.

“Why didn’t you throw it?” asked Ian.
“It was hard enough to let go as it was,” said Jack staring right ahead of his gaze at the fountain without quite taking it in. It was a stone woman in the Greco-Roman style of sculpting, it was wearing a toga and was carrying an urn both also carved from a white marble (or more likely a fake substitute) from the urn water gushed out into the pool surrounding the fountain. Jack felt as though he had lost an arm or a friend, he hand an urge to jump into the water and get the coin, and found his hands on the ledge and his legs tensed to jump. His pulled himself together and straightened up, and felt strangely better, but this feeling wasn’t to continue.

“What a waste,” stated Ian looking around at the pool surrounding area, “I mean you’re not allowed to swim in there.”
“The water is only knee deep,” Jack pointed out.
“but that not the point it’s a piece of prime mall land with enough room to fit a shop and some left over for that fountain and small pool around it, but instead they go this large ‘pond’ which no one is allowed to enter,” Ian continued turning around and walking towards the exit, Jack followed suit. By the time they reached the exit the coin had vanished from the fountain, and Jack hadn’t notice the statue of the fountain had change.

Jack decided to go...

11411111122121211111212.content:
At that point Jacks phone beeped as he received a text from Jessica which simply said,
‘Come and meet me at the hospital in two hours’
That didn’t give Jack much time to play Zombie Massacre Mania 2, it was one of those games which required a lot of time to play as you fought you way through waves of zombies. But it did leave him enough time to go home and have a shower, letting the coin go was felt like lifting a heavy weight and made him sweat accordingly, not to mention summer was getting into gear and Jack was the kind of guy who could perspire in winter. A quick rinse and a change of clothes would be good, he said goodbye to Ian who was grinning mockingly after Jack said why he had to go.

Jack raced home and quickly found a clean change of clothes before going to the shower, he made sure not to bump into his mother, part of Jack thought that disposing of the coin would make things go back to normal and he didn’t want to evidence that said otherwise for as long as possible, after all Jessica might be calling him to the hospital to tell him she wasn’t really pregnant that it was just gas or a food baby or something. He went for a quick rinse, no shampoo or conditioner just a rinse to get rid of any smells or dirt.

It was whilst washing himself did Jack hear the rattling noise in the shower head, ‘something must of came loose again’ he thought that his parents were going to update the bathroom after he left home, they mustn’t of had time yet. Jack turned off the water and unscrewed part of the shower head and shook it, instead of the washer or random piece of plumbing that Jack knew nothing about (his only plumbing skills were limited to collecting coins, eating mushrooms and rescuing princesses), what dropped into his hand was the coin.

He was so shocked he nearly slipped over, Jack stepped out of the shower and started to dry himself off with a towel held in one hand whilst holding the coin in the other. He tried to stay calm and think of the logical ways the coin could of ended up in the shower head, short of someone putting it in there he could see none as the pipe leading up to the shower head was way too thin for the coin to fit through.
“Just stay calm,” he said to himself. After all he could dispose of it again, it might not come back a second time or he could hide somewhere in his room, where no one, himself included, could use it.

Jack decided to…
11411111122121211111212.title: Check up on Jessica.
