He gets a text from Jessica: MEN. WOMEN. BELLIES. TURN ON THE NEWS. NOW.
114111111221212111112221112.content:
- - - Now: At The House - - -

Jack Dale Jr had only one thought going through his head at this exact moment: Zombie Massacre Mania 2.
He needed to kill digital undead. His soul yearned and his body ached to be a washed in the 1080P glory of green zombie blood as he slaughtered the horrid abominations of Dr. Zomtox that he has unleashed upon the world once again.

Charging up the stairs, he threw his dirty duffle bag aside, fired up his GameBox, carefully removed his copy of Zombie Massacre Mania 2 from it's oversized collector's edition box, put the disc in the tray, closed it, and fired up the installation process.

Knowing the installing the game would take a few minutes, Jack decided that now would be a good time for a shower after that... workout session with Amber. Probably a cold one; a very long, very cold shower.

Jack left the room, throwing his dirty gym clothes into his overflowing hamper, he went into the bathroom to take his shower. However, as he was off, signing along badly to a popular rock song on the radio during his shower, he didn't notice the coin, very similar to the one to the one that he gave his friend Ian, and identical to the one that was currently resting in the tray in his car that his mother was currently driving, appeared on his dresser again with a laugh.

Exactly 15 minutes and 24 seconds later, Jack entered back into his room, fully refreshed, dressed to lounge, and ready for some full on Zombie Massacre Mania 2. As he picked up his controller, which was laying on his dresser, he didn't notice that the coin had appeared again on the dresser, as he was too engrossed by the opening CGI video depicting several busty blondes and redheads blasting away at zombies, while another muscle bound hero, chopping away the hordes of the undead with a circular saw that had been grafted on his body in place of a left hand. This particular character was hacking with one hand, and shooting at zombies with an UZI with his other, shouting "Funky" all the time.

Sitting down into his big comfy gaming chair, he pressed the start button, and looked for his friend Ian online. It only took a matter of moments before a little pop-up bubble told him that XX_IAN_DA_KING_OF_ALL_XX wanted to start a new game. With a smile of his face, Jack accepted that request , and a mere seconds later, would wish that he hadn't.

"Where the hell have you been?! I have been waiting for over an hour! We get one of what's certain to be the greatest games of all time, and I'm all ready to go slaughter some undead hellions while staring at the very fine and shapely curves of my female zombie slayer that I created, whom I'm lovingly and jokingly calling "Future Ex-Wife #3", and you're just doing what - - - " Ian asks, chastising his friend over the gaming headphone.

"I was - - - uh" Jack tried to choose his next words carefully, knowing that Ian, while being his best friend, could sometimes have a screw or two come loose upstairs when it comes to certain things, delaying of video game playing of hot new release games on release day being one of them. "I was at the gym"

Ian let out a huge sigh. "Man is this about the fat thing I said earlier? Man I was just kidding, there's no need" Ian was interrupted by Jack.
"It's not like that. I'm on my way home from seeing Jessica" Jack explained, creating his hero on the character creation screen, creating an overly buff, action-movie hero version of himself, whom he dubbed "Jack Slayer".

"Whoa, whoa. You went to see Jessica? Man, what did I tell you? You don't mess around with a chick whose going to have kid. Next thing you know she's going to try to pin that thing on you. She's just some chick who could keep her - - - BANG" Ian was cut off by a loud gun going off in the game, followed by the words "PLAYER JACK SLAYER HAS BETRAYED MS. FOXXXY. MS. FOXXXY IS BLEEDING OUT"

"WHAT THE HELL MAN?" Ian was screaming on the other end of the head-set. "I told you, DON'T TALK ABOUT JESSICA LIKE THAT" Jack said sternly. "She's going through some seriously heavy stuff right now, and it's all my fault. So now you apologize, or so help me, I'll let your character bleed out, and you'll have to wait 48 hours until you can make a new character" Jack wagered with his friend, citing the new "Permadeath Lock-Out" feature that was enabled whenever a player chose to play the game on "Zombie Apocalypse" difficulty, which, like true gaming gods, Ian and Jack did.

"Oh come on.." Ian complained, watching Ms. FOXXXY life bar slowly drain as she bled out on the sidewalk of the starting area.
"Do it Ian. So help me.." Jack insisted. "Alright fine. I'm an ass, and I take back everything I said about Jessica. There happy?" Ian said, almost not even meaning it. "No, but it's close enough of an apology I'm going to get from you. Let me heal you up" Jack said, pressing a button on his controller to use a med-kit on his friend.

"Waste of a perfectly good med kit. Anyways, why were you at the gym?" Ian asked, watch his character get healed.
"Amber texted me, turns out she needed a lamaze partner and - - - " Jack was stopped by an burst of nearly hysterical laughter.
"It's not funny. So help me, I'll shoot you again" Jack said, readying his fire button finger.
"Sorry, sorry. Please continue" Ian said, his character getting back up from the ground, and the two digital avatars of Ian and Jack start the game proper and begin their quest to save the world from Dr. Zomtox.

Jack continued his story, going into every conceivable detail about what happened between him and Jessica, him and his mother, and what happened at the gym.

- - - Now: At The Mall - - -

As Amanda pulled into the parking space (with some great difficulty, her pregnant belly was making driving more difficult than she remembered), she stopped her pregnancy related gab-session with Faye as she noticed a fleet of ambulances parked outside of the west entrance of the mall. The paramedics were examining what appeared to be several different pregnant women of various ages and race, each woman having a very worried look on their faces, and, stranger still, to Amanda at least, what appeared to be several very overweight men, stethoscopes being run across the large midsections of said men, fear and terror in the men's faces, confusion and disbelief on the faces of the EMT's.

"What do you think happened here" Amanda asked, heaving herself and her four occupants out of the car, holding onto the door frame, which made her thrust her belly forward, making her appear even larger than before, if that was even possible.
"People probably got sick from that terrible food they serve at Chicken Shack. I ate their once, was sick for nearly two weeks. I swear, you hire sixteen year old to cook fast food, and they can't even do that right sometimes." Faye says, heaving herself out of the car, just like Amanda did.

"Think we should go see what's up?" Amanda says, craning her neck over the crowd of people who have gathered to check out this most.. unusual scene. "Nah, I gotta pee like a pregnant woman" Faye says, a smile on her face, bemused by her own cleverness.

"Yeah, the bathroom sounds like a great idea." Amanda says, rubbing her midsection. They close and lock the car, and then waddle off towards the south entrance, unaware of the several local news trucks that were pulling up to report of the incidents that just happened an hour earlier.

= = = A Short Time Later: The House = = =

"And then I found the coin in my pocket dude!" Jack said, laying down the law on some undead hordes with Killamtronic 9000 in the game, scoring over 10,000 EXP. "Oh not this coin thing again dude!" Ian sighs on the other end of his headset.
"Yes! I tell you man! I think this coin has somehow found it's way back to me dude. I used it again, and Amber and several other woman became more pregnant!" Jack said, killing zombies.
"I hate repeating myself, so I'm just going to say this: Your story is a lie and you're a liar for lying. I have the coin you gave me, right now. There is no possible way in the universe that you can have it - - - OH YEAH, ULTIMATE ZOMBIE KILLSTREAK! BRING IN THE AC-130!" Ian screams into his headset.

"But I.." Jack says trying to explain. "No butts dude. I'm telling you, I'm looking at right now. Unless your "pregnancy coin" as you claim it to be, can magically duplicate itself, your imagining things again, probably to cover up your feeling about women in Amber's... condition; and if I can be frank dude, that's weird" Ian says, the echoes of his AC-130 zombie killing power-up echoing over his words.

"I don't have a thing for women in that.... condition" Jack says defensively. "Hey man, whatever floats your boat. I'm not one to judge about things like that" Ian says. "But what I can judge you on is that your cuckoo banana crazy insane man imagining a magic coin that gets people pregnant. I can judge you on that" Ian says smugly. "Whoa, look out bud, Goliath Zombie right behind you! Get down!" Ian yells into his headset.

"Hit it with the flamethrower!" Jack yells, jamming the buttons and twisting the sticks on his controller.
"Way ahead of you. EAT FIREY FLAMLY TOASTY DEATH ZOMBIE SCUM!" Ian yells.
114111111221212111112221112.title: Game Time & Girl Time.

choices: Amanda and Faye commence their day
1141111112212121111122211122.content:
Jack's eyes were distracted from the screen as his phone buzzed beside him. Jessica's name popped up. Oh God, Jack thought. What's happening to her now? He wanted to talk to her now but he'd learned better by this point not to tell Ian the intimate details of his new, crazy life.

"Hey Ian, pause for a minute," Jack said, hitting the controller's START button to freeze the game. "I've got to take a piss."

"Alright, I might as well do the same," Ian said. Their headsets went mute as Jack quickly picked up the phone.

"Jessica! Are you okay? Is everything-"

"Turn on the news," Jessica said in a dead voice. Jack walked downstairs to the living room and flipped on the TV, switching to the local channel. A big BREAKING NEWS banner was emblazoned across the bottom, reading "Mysterious Disease Break-Out at Southlyne Mall." He turned it on just as the anchor, the beautiful and busty Mia Vasquez, was describing the situation.

<-Mall, as dozens of women have reported either sudden nausea or severe abdominal swelling. But what's even more bizarre is that, by these women own conclusion and according to some of the medical personnel who have treated these women, they appear to have become suddenly pregnant.>

The camera cut to one woman, sitting by an ambulance, a perfectly round pregnant belly in her lap. She was struggling to cover it with her shirt, which was clearly not meant to be used as a maternity blouse.

<I was just walking, feeling fine, and then boom, I got this big belly and I start feeling kicking inside me. The medics estimated that I'm eight months pregnant! I haven't even had sex in a year!>

The TV started showing B-roll of pregnant women walking around the mall, looking concerned or confused as Mia's voice continued.

<Medics do not yet have any explanation, but the local hospital has sent over its mobile pre-natal center to try and help the situation. What we've also noticed is that there were already an abnormally high number of pregnant women at the mall when this occurred.>

The camera cut to another woman who had an enormous belly, again, clearly not wearing maternity clothes. Part of her fabric and pants were actually torn, but she seemed content, rubbing her belly absentmindedly.

<No, I've been carrying these twins inside me for about seven months now. But I was walking past the food court when I started noticing all of these pregnant women freaking out and grabbing their bellies. And then I saw one woman's belly suddenly pop out and scream! I love being pregnant, but I can imagine how scary it must be for it to suddenly happen.>

Back to Mia.

<One additional strange thing is that men, although in smaller numbers, appear to have been affected by the same affliction as these women who became suddenly pregnant. Some men reported sudden nausea, while others reported got swollen abdomens and were treated by medics. While we have heard confirmation from some medics that at least one man is confirmed pregnant, none of these men would speak with reporters.>

Jack, flip me!

His eyes glued to the TV, Jack didn't even think to stop himself from fishing the coin from his pocket, where it suddenly transported itself. Flipping it, it landed on heads, and Mia Vasquez's black, professional dress got a little tighter, as the clear impression of a pregnant belly began to swell forward. The fabric of the dress was thin and silky, so a dimpled belly button was visible against the fabric. Her already ample and visible cleavage swelled some more, mushing up through her dress.

"Oh my God, did you see that?" Jessica asked on the other end. Jack saw the coin in his hand and freaked out, tossing it onto the coffee table. It landed on heads, and Mia's belly and breasts grew yet again. "You were right, people are just suddenly becoming pregnant."

"Yeah..." Jack said, waiting to tell her about how the reporter on screen got to where she is. "This is bad."

"Well, I'm more willing to hear about that magic coin theory of yours," Jessica said. "Were you at the mall with it today?"

"I...I was at the mall today," Jack said absently. "But I didn't flip it at all when I was there. In fact, that's where I gave it away to one of my friends. He said he'd get rid of it." Jack paused. "But...I still found it in my pocket later in the day. And, believe me, it was still working."

"You got more people pregnant with the coin?" Jessica said, a kind of pity in her voice.

"It...it has a kind of power over me, I don't know how to explain it. It makes me flip it. L-like just now, it made me flip it for this reporter on TV."

Jessica paused. "Okay, so...if you made that happen, and they haven't said anything about new pregnancies breaking out, then...what happened there already happened. Maybe something happened while you were there with the coin?"

Jack was slightly distracted by Mia rubbing her own belly and talking with the anchors back in the studio. They were remarking how it was ironic that they sent their pregnant reporter to cover this story. "Um, no, all I did was give it to my friend and then leave." Then Jack sighed and rubbed his temples. "But, Ian's kind of a moron, so I wouldn't put it past him to just flip the coin a bunch of times after I told him not to."

"Okay, well, try and get that coin back from him," Jessica said. "I'm starting to believe it can do what you said. I mean, I'm living proof of that, huh?" Jack swallowed nervously. "But I'd rather someone who knows the bad stuff the coin can do have it instead of someone who doesn't."

"Yeah, you're right," Jack said. "Wow, you're pretty quick to figure these situations out. We make a pretty good team." He smiled to himself before adding. "A-are you okay, by the way?"

Jessica laughed and snorted. "Yes, for the last time, I'm fine. I think I can manage being three months pregnant until we figure this whole thing out. Talk to you later." Jessica hung up on the phone and Jack continued to watch the TV screen, image after image of pregnant bellies waddling in front of his face. After a while, he remember that he had Ian on hold and stood up to leave, his erection pressing painfully against his pants as he got up. Jack decided not to think more about this for now.

"Ian, you there?" Jack said, his headset back on.

"Yeah, I'm here. Geez, how much did you have to drink? You were gone for a while," Ian said back as they unpaused the game and watched the digital zombies slowly burn.

"I had to help my dad out with a...shelf," Jack said, tapping the keys quickly. "By the way, you said you still have that coin, right?"

"You know I do," Ian said, his sexy avatar throwing a grenade at a mutated, hulking zombie.

"Well, I'm going to need it back," Jack said. "It turns out it belonged to my great-grandpa, so it's an heirloom."

"Oh no, dude. You told me not to give it back to you and as crazy as you are, believing it's magic or whatever, I don't think it's a good idea for the two of you to be together. Besides, that was a shitty lieDUDE, SHOOT SHOOT SHOOT!" The hulking zombie from before tackled Jack's macho man, killing him. Ms. Foxxxy was preoccupied by a swarm of zombies slowly closing around her, until-

"PLAYER MS. FOXXXY IS DOWN. PLAYER JACK SAVAGE IS DOWN. GAME OVER"

"Ugh," Ian said. "Damn, this game is tough, but it's fun. Want to go again?"

"Sure," Jack said, restarting. "Oh, it's showing the 'create a character' page again, what's happening?"

"I'm trying to find one with better healing stats," Ian said. "This one's fast, but your's has enough firepower that I'd rather balance it out with healing." Ian scrolled through avatar's until he started laughing on the other end. "Oh, dude, I think I found the perfect one."

Ian selected the "Pregnant Survivor" character, a chiseled, sexy woman with a swollen pregnant belly, not at all covered by her frayed camouflage tank-top.

"Ian, c'mon man, that's not funny," Jack said, starting to shake a little nervously.

"What are you talking about, Jack," Ian said in an exaggerated voice. "Look at how good this one's medic stats are. It would be wrong for me not to choose this one." A green frame wrapped around the character and Ian typed his "Ms. Foxxxy" name into her slot. "Alright, now we can start."

"I hate you," Jack said.

--- Amanda Dale ---

Amanda and Faye strolled through the mall, noticing all of the pregnant women, both worried and not. They even passed by the now-pregnant Mia Vasquez, her cameraman following behind her.

"Looks like we came on the right day," Faye joked, bumping her belly against Amanda's. Amanda smiled politely and rubbed her own belly. She couldn't help but think about the women outside. They were saying they had suddenly and mysteriously become pregnant. Well, wasn't it the same for her? It's just been a little more gradual.

"So, where did you want to go?" Amanda said.

Faye smiled back. "Oh, don't worry. I've got a whole day planned."
1141111112212121111122211122.title: He gets a text from Jessica: MEN. WOMEN. BELLIE...

choices: Amanda and Faye, power shoppers! They continue to shop, things get weird.
Meh. What else is on? <Switch Back To Jack. He's justing playing Video Games>
11411111122121211111222111221.content:
- - - Now: At The House - - -

Ms. Foxxxy waddled as fast as she could behind Jack Savage, firing into the ever-growing crowds of the undead.
"Dude, keep me healed!" Jack screamed into his microphone.
"I'm on it dude! Just keep staring at Ms. Foxxxy's luscious curves, I know you want to" Ian said jokingly.
"I'm going to come to your house and kick your face into jelly if you don't cut the crap Ian" Jack said defensively, desperately trying to get the subject away from women who happened to be, as the said in the old days "in the family way".
"Dude, chillax man. Your denials are really starting to get weird. You know Bill Shakesman once wrote "The lady doth protest to much" Ian said, trying to sound intelligent but failing miserably.
"That was William Shakespeare, moron" Jack said, laying down covering fire, trying to evacuate a group of survivors from the waves of zombies quickly approaching them.
"Whatever" Ian said on the other end of the microphone.

- - - - Now: At The Mall - - - -

"The whole day planned? So what's first?" Amanda asked, putting her hands on the sides of her gravid life dome.
“Well, I don’t mean to be katty, but you need new clothes. badly” Faye said, looking at Amanda’s Dale “maternity” apparel.

Amanda was wearing a plan blue ladies t-shirt, that given her current condition, was a size or three too small. It tightly hugged every single one of her many maternal curves, showing that this clearly over 50 woman was pregnant. A generous helping of belly hung out from the hemline of her shirt, while a pair of white pants hung the underside of her belly.

While not high fashion, it had high function for the time being as Amanda Dale continued on her journey towards motherhood for a second time.

“What’s wrong with what I’m wearing?” Amanda asked, looking at her “maternity” clothes as though they had some kind of stain on them or something. “I mean, it’s the best I can do for right now before my husband can take me back to the storage shed where I have all my old maternity clothes.” Amanda said, resting her hands ontop of her belly.

Faye snickered. “Wow, really? You have all your old maternity clothes? You didn’t
throw them out when you realized the 1980’s weren’t coming back?”

“Hey!” Amanda said almost defensively. “Look, Amanda, it’s the 21st Century. We have phones that allow us to surf the internet in the middle of the desert while playing any of the 10,000 songs we load onto it. We have hybrid cars, HDTV’s, and cloud computing, I don’t think now is the time to go back to your oversized… I’m going to be generous and say “Poison” T-Shirt. “ Faye said.

“It wasn’t ‘POISION’ Faye… It was REO Speedwagon” Amanda said, almost ashamed to correct her.

Faye let out another snicker. “The point is Amanda, we’re in age now with designer maternity wear; clothes that are meant to emphasis our growing bodies, flaunt it even. We don’t have to hide behind oversized dresses and large coats, now we can dress provocatively as we want, because the truth it… men love it. “ Faye said as a smile crossed her face.

“Are you sure about all this Faye? I don’t mean to sound like a total.. you know what..” Amanda said, trying to cover up her own language. “But, you don’t really have the most experience with all of.. this” Amanda said, circling her belly her hand for emphasis.

“Cruel but fair. But alas, when you were as desperate as I was to get pregnant” Faye said, covering her midsection with her hands, almost afraid that someone was going to try to take it away from her “I followed every maternity trend, every parenting tip, everything and anything related to pregnancy and child-raising just in case, just in case, this was the one time” Faye said, a slight tear, thinking about all the times that all of her could be’s would become shan’t be’s and how this last chance for her became a will be, four times over.

“Hey, hey, hey” Amanda said, comforting her pregnant friend and neighbor, “Don’t think about the past. Think about the future, your four little ones”

Faye dried her eye, and with a smile “And yours, as well”.
“Yeah” Amanda said, looking down at her maternal midsection, the words of the pregnant reporter echoing through her head “mysteriously pregnant”.

“Well, are we going to stand her all day, or are we going to do some shopping” Faye asks.

“You’re the boss Faye. Apparently you’ve done the research, I’m just the 50-plus pregnant woman along for the ride” Amanda said, following her friend as they walked deeper into the mall, heading to the maternity store.

A few moments later, Faye and Amanda walked (through almost a waddle by now) into L'aspirant à la mode, a hip modern store for the expectant mother. The store blared all of the latest pop music songs, while bizarre modern art hung on the walls or played on the TV.

Amanda took in the scene, and wondered if she made a huge mistake. “Uh, Faye?” She asked.

“Yes?” Faye asked, already beginning to look at all of the very modern, very hip, and very provocative maternity clothes hanging on the racks.

“Uh, I think I might be a little too old to be shopping here” Amanda said, picking up a very provocative piece of maternity wear off the rack and holding it up, looking at it.

“Nonsense. If you can still get pregnant, you can still shop here. Now, start grabbing clothes and trying them on, or so help me, I’ll pick what you’re going to wear for the next few months” Faye said, almost threateningly, looking a pair of shorts and a shirt that would do little to cover certain portions of her body.

“I don’t know…” Amanda said, looking at a pair of trendy hip hugging jeans, and a tight shirt that read “I DID THE DEED” written across the middle.

“Come on Amanda, this is probably going to be your last pregnancy. Dress a little daring, act a little daring. Have fun being pregnant” Faye said, picking out another outfit.

“I’ll try,” She said, picking up several outfits.

Time passed, as Faye and Amanda picked out several maternity outfits, Faye going for more and more provocative, while Amanda tried to pick out the most conservative outfits she could find.

Unfortunately, in a store like L'aspirant à la mode, that was a little tough, especially with Faye watching Amanda’s every move and choice. As Amanda found something that she may have liked, Faye would throw down three especially sexy looking outfits on top of the one she just liked.

It was almost like something out a movie. A younger woman (although not by much) showing an older woman how to be “hip”, “trendy”, and “sexy”; all it needed was a catchy pop song playing over the time it took as Faye watched Amanda try on outfit after outfit, each becoming more and more hip until Faye finally approved of something Amanda picked out.

Eventually, time passed and Amanda quickly found herself with several bags full of clothes attached to her arms. Bra’s, underwear, pajamas, shirts, pants, everything a growing woman might need.

“Whew. I can’t believe I bought all that” Amanda said, looking through all her bags. The clothes she bough where more provocative then she would have liked, but as Faye constantly told her “If you’ve got it flaunt it”.

“Two more things you’ll need Amanda” Faye said with a devious smile on her face, and her hands behind her back.

“Oh no. Now what?” Amanda said, slightly annoyed, almost afraid of what need madness her friend Faye will visit onto her.

With her devious smile firmly glued onto her face, Faye slowly revealed what was behind her back; a pair of very sexy lingerie and a black-and-hot pink two-piece swimsuit.

The lingerie was a two-piece set of blue garters, which were attached to a skimpy blue lower half, which were then attached by blue straps to the bra, which was lacy.

“No. No. No. No. No” was all Amanda could say, pointing at Faye’s sick attempt at humor. “Oh come on Amanda, lighten up. You’re pregnant, not dead.” Faye said, putting the two items onto the check-out counter.

“I’m not wearing those… things. It’s bad enough what you convinced me to get now.. but those two things? No way.” Amanda said, crossing her arms like a stubborn child.

“Look, if I told you once, I told you a hundred times today, if you’ve got it, flaunt it. Amanda, you’re a beautiful woman, and you’re even more beautiful now, stop being so afraid of what everything will think. So your over the hill and have a bun or four in the oven? What’s it to them? Why should you have to hide because of what they think? Take charge, and show them. Show them that at over 50 your still so crafty you can make people. Take this - - - “ Faye said, jamming the lingerie in Amanda’s almost already full arms.

“And tonight, remind your husband how you got pregnant in the first place. Enjoy your next few months of intimacy by wearing this almost every night and go wild! You’re a woman who has needs! Fulfill them!” Faye said, firing up Amanda.

“And take this” Faye said, holding up the two-piece bikini “And get some sun. The gym has this great pregnancy swimming class! You and I are going to go together. And you know what? Take your family out to the beach or to a water park or something, and rock this thing girl. Make women jealous and men lustful. Take your husband and your son and spend some time together as a family of three before you guys become a family of seven.” Faye commanded.

“You’re right” Amanda said, slamming the lingerie and the bikini on the check-out counter, pulling out her credit card, and saying “Two more things”.
11411111122121211111222111221.title: Mall Madness!

114111111221212111112221112211.content:
A Short Time Later - - - At The House

Jack continued to play his video game, ensuring that he would accomplish almost next to nothing for the rest of the day, which to him was okay, but he was pretty sure that he’s done MORE than enough for the day.

A Short Time Later - - - At The Mall

Amanda and Faye walked through the mall, giggling to themselves as they looked over their purchases for the store. Amanda was feeling more relieved and relaxed, not just because she found some trendy if not provocative.

“Ah, here we are” Faye said, stopping outside the massive, massive two-level store known as Baby Universe.

“I hope everything isn’t sold out.. I mean, you heard that new reporter when we came in” Amanda said, looking at a surprising number of pregnant women who seemed to making Baby Universe their temporary home.

“Oh, don’t tell me you believe all that nonsense?” Faye said, rubbing her belly whilst looking at her friend. “Amanda, you and I both know, from experience that women only get pregnant ONE WAY. Not from any kind of mysterious outbreak the news media can cook up in order to drive up viewers.” Faye said as she walked towards the store, passing a giant stand that read “SIGN UP FOR THE 101.9 Pregnant Bikini Contest, hosted by Sandwich and Oven in the Mornings! Big Bellies, Big Prizes!”

Amanda followed, continuing the conversation. “What on Earth are you talking about Faye?” They entered the store, and began to look around, making their way the crowded store, bumping into shelves and bellies, trying to get everything they might need for the new additions to their families.

“It’s the internet. People can get access to news 24/7 now on their phone or tablets, so the news media make up these stories to scare people into watching so they can make money off of ad revenue” Faye said, picking up some baby related objects, fawning over them, before putting it back.

“I mean think about how ridicules that story sounded Amanda? It breaks all the laws of known reality. I mean, did you even hear that reporter? She said they confirmed a MAN to be pregnant. Men don’t have babies Amanda, if they did, trust me, I would have made sure my husband did all the work if you know what I mean”.

“I guess your right” Amanda said, putting some baby items into her basket. This was the second time today that Faye had managed to convince her that Faye’s opinion was correct, however, in this instance, Faye was unaware of how wrong she was.

Time seemed to fly as Amanda and Faye scoured the store, picking up almost everything they could ever need. Diapers, boxes of them, adorable pieces of baby clothes, although Amanda thought that she should find out what she was having, as she thought it was wasteful to buy four of every color. Amanda filled up one shopping cart, and then another, and then another, lost in a daze of maternal shopping bliss, "Awwing" at every tiny piece of clothing, every tiny little soft toy, every little thing.

To her, it had been so very long since she had last done this. Now, her she was, when most women would be retiring and spoiling their grandchildren, she was planning on welcoming four new members into her family.

Holding up a little blue onesie that read "Mommy's Little Brat", she looked at it closely for a few minutes, wondering if she should add it, when something caught her eye. Well, it wasn’t something, but rather someone, which happened to be, at least according to Amanda, a severely overweight man holding small pink clothes.

As Amanda watched the man for a few moments, the man was constantly trying to decide between the pink one in his left hand, and the pink one in his right, while occasionally rubbing his very vast midsection, muttering something under his breath.

Staring at his stomach, Amanda could have sword she say it move, but it was hidden away behind a large oversized black shirt that hugged that man’s midsection, making it appear firm and round, not fat and flabby. It was almost like he was preg…

Amanda shook her head, and turned around, drawing her attention away from the man, who looked out Amanda, and then turned away to find some privacy.

“Everything okay Amanda?” Faye asked, staring at Amanda who looked like she’s just seen a ghost. “Yeah, I thought I saw something, must have been the light playing tricks on me” Amanda answered; trying to push away what she knew was impossible.

She turned her attention back to shopping, and loaded up another cart. After what seemed like hours of shopping, Amanda was exhausted, and her carts were full. She made her way to the check-out counter, ready to pay for the mountains of baby products.

“Your husband is probably going to kill you” Faye said, as she helped Amanda unload all of her carts. “Don’t worry, I have something for him tonight that will calm him down if you know what I mean” Amanda said, rattling the bag of lingerie, with a knowing smile.

“Is all of this going to fit in the car?” Faye asked. Looking over her purchases of maternity wear and baby supplies, Amanda might have to admit that she may a went a way bit to far.

“Well that’s okay, whatever doesn’t fit in your car, you can have delivered to the house with the cribs” The young pretty (and slightly) pregnant clerk behind the counter said.

“Really?” Amanda asked. “Yeah, it’s part of the deal. We’re offering discounted delivery on all purchases over a certain amount, which, you’ve clearly exceeded by generous amount” The clerk said, tapping the price total of the register, and almost giving Amanda a heart attack looking at the price.

A whistle could be heard somewhere back in the line, which just caused Amanda to look down to her midsection and said “It’s a good thing you’re coming when Mommy and Daddy have all the money for all this stuff.” She gave her belly a pat and finished her transaction.

After filling out all the forms, and loading up all the bags of maternity clothes and what bags of baby stuff she thinks she could fit in the car, she and Faye, (who chose to have everything delivered as opposed to try and fight for space in the car) made their way out of the store and back to the parking lot.

“Well, same to you too! Nice mouth for a woman who’s going to be a mom!” A young thirty something man with short hair, a goatee, and a slim build said, holding up a sign that read “101.9 THE EDGE Pregnant Bikini Contest Sign-Ups”

He turns his attention away from the woman he was talking too, and turns his attention to Faye and Amanda.
“Well hello there ladies, my name is Ryan “Oven” Marsters. Prehaps you’ve heard of me? I’m the co-host of the Morning Madness with Sandwich & Oven in the morning. Maybe you’ve heard of us?” The man called Oven said, raising an eyebrow.

“Uh not really” Amanda said, trying not to offend the man named “Oven”, “But you listen to The Edge right? The leading rock and alt station? We’ve got The Edge over the competition” Oven said, trying to sell the station in his usual DJ voice.

“I know my son listens to your station” Amanda said, trying to get out of this conversation as soon as it starts.

“Well hey, your kid’s got great taste, but I’m not hear about that. I’m hear to talk to you about 101.9 The Edge special event: Miss Stork’s Pregnant Bikini Contest at Dino’s Bar and Grill, and we’re looking for contestants to enter, grand prize winner gets a cash prize of $9,000 dollars.” Oven says holding out a sign up form.

“Uh, no thanks” Faye says, about to leave when Amanda takes the form.
“So tell me all about this” Amanda says looking over the form.
“Amanda? What?” Faye says shocked.
“You’re the one telling me to be adventurous and free during my pregnancy. This looks like just the thing I need. If you’ve got it, flaunt it, right” Amanda says, turning her words back onto Faye.

“Great. So the contest is 5 days from now at Dino’s Bar and Grill. There’s three sections to the contest: The standard bikini phase, where you introduce yourself and we get a look at you, you walk down the cat walk that kind of thing. Section two is the talent portion, show off some kind of awesome talent you can do while pregnant, and section three is the dance off, best pregnant dancer wins; you can do any type of dance you want, twerk, standard, pole..” Oven continues explaining.

“Pole dancing?” Amanda asks, raising an eyebrow.
“Yup. After that, we tally up the scores and the best pregnant woman wins, $9,000 dollars cash money, and a private photo session with the best photographer in town to be the new model for 101.9’s colander next year, all while pregnant of course.” Oven says.

“Any why are you doing this?” Faye asks, looking over the form herself.
“These kind of things get huge ratings, I have no idea why.” Oven states.
“That’s it ratings?” Amanda says.
“If it makes you feel better, you can say we do to support all forms of beauty.” Oven says sarcastically. “So are you going to sign up or not?”

Amanda looked at the form, looked at her clothing bag, and then looked at Faye.
114111111221212111112221112211.title: Mall Madness II: The Shopping.

choices: The coin calls to Faye. WAIT, FAYE?
Amanda and Faye leave, satisfied with their decision.
1141111112212121111122211122111.content:
"Oh what the heck" Amanda said, putting down her package, taking the pen off the clipboard, and filling out all of her information.
"Fantastic. How about you Ma'am? Want to join your friend?" Oven says, pointing the form towards her.
"Eh, why not?" Faye says, filling out the form as well.

After a few moments of exchanging all the information necessary, the sign ups were completed, Amanda Dale was contestant 50, and Faye was contestant 51 in the 101.9 Miss Stork's Pregnant Bikini Contest.

"That's fantastic ladies, just one more piece of information ladies. Can I have your ages please?" Oven said, looking over the forms.
"Our?"
"Ages?" Amanda and Faye said, finishing each other thoughts.
"Look, I know it's a thing most women don't want to share. Tell you what. Just give me your general age range" Oven said, picking up his pen.

"Well uh" Faye said hesitantly before answering "40's"
"Impressive. You look fantastic for your age." Oven said filling out the age section.
"And you ma'am?" Oven asked.
"50's" Amanda said, rather proud.
"Wow. Seriously?" Oven said, almost in disbelief.
"Yes." Amanda answered back.
"Whoa, that's huh. Uh, congratulations." Oven said, writing down the information and completing the forms.

"We will email you all of the information sometime in the next two days. Come to Dino's Bar and Grill, in bikini, at time listed on your email, and present your printed out ticket to get into the contestant area. Free food and drinks will be provided for the contestants." Oven said almost readying everything off the page in a dull monotone.

Amanda and Faye smiled, can't believing they were about to go through with this.
1141111112212121111122211122111.title: Sign Me Up! And her too!

11411111122121211111222111221111.content:
As Amanda listend to "Oven" as he liked to be called drone on and on about the rules of the contest, the prize money, and so on and so forth, she didn't notice Faye's eyes almost glaze over, pulling out a small metal coin from her purse.

"Any contests reserve the right to photographed and video taped by 101.9 Staff, or by viewers in the audience. The 101.9 Pregnant Bikini Contest will aired live on 101.9 Late Night Party Block and streamed online at 101.9 The Edge's website. 101.9 The Edge and it's parent company the right to" Oven continued on and on reading the whole legal mumbo jumbo which sounded like a another language to Amanda.

As Oven droned on, Faye put the coin on the edge of her thumb, and with a mighty FLICK, sent the coin high into the air. In her trance, Faye snatched the coin from mid-air, while Amanda watched in confusion, and Oven watched continuing to read his prepared legal statement.

Gripping the coin tight in her hand, Faye slowly craned her neck up to look at...
11411111122121211111222111221111.title: Jack shouldn't leave things laying around.

114111111221212111112221112211111.content:
Faye looked dead ahead at the morning radio host known as "Oven" as he continued to read the closing statements of the bidding legalese that Amanda and Faye agreed to by signing up for the contest.

Slowly, Amanda watched as Faye slowly opened her hand to reveal that coin had landed on.
114111111221212111112221112211111.title: Faye looks at "Oven"

choices: Jack joins his family for dinner. Mom wears something new, and the family talks.
1141111112212121111122211122111112.content:
Amanda craned her neck to see that the coin had landed on "Tails", and Faye was staring straight ahead at "Oven".

"Uh very nice. Might want to try that at the talent show or maybe. It's impressive" Oven said, before a sudden went up his spine, shaking his whole body all of the sudden.

"You okay?" Amanda asked.
"Yeah, I'm fine. Just felt a little weird there for a second. Anyways, I think we're done here. See you guys in five days, and be sure to listen to us every morning on 101.9 The Edge! You never know what might happen!" Oven said, finishing his pitch.


Amanda turns around to look at Faye who is still completely zoned out, before Amanda gives her a good shake.
"Faye, you okay?" Faye suddenly snaps to, closing her hand around the coin.
"Yeah, what happened there? I kind of zoned out for a moment" Faye said, picking up her bags, and walking with Amanda towards the car.
"You apparently decided to demonstrate your talent show idea of very impressive coin flipping and catching" Amanda said, walking towards the parking lot.

They didn't seem to notice the man named "Oven" put down the clip-board and run towards the men's bathroom, looking like he was going to be sick.
"Wait, I did what?" Faye asked.
"You took some coin out of your pocket and flipped it high into the air before catching it. It was pretty impressive to watch, I didn't even know you could do that" Amanda said.
"Uh.. neither could I" Faye replied looking at the coin.

"Look at this coin, it's so weird looking." Faye said, looking at it in her hand.
Amanda took one good look at it and recognized it almost immediately. "Hey, my son has a coin just like that. Bought it at that sale a few days ago. How did you get it Faye?" Amanda asked.
"I don't know. I must have picked it up by accident when I put my house keys in the coin tray in your son's car." Faye said looking at it.
"Huh, that's weird, because I swore he had one just like it on the dresser in his room. I went in their earlier to take care of a few things, when he was out. Must have bough two" Amanda rationalized.

"Want me to give it back?" Faye said looking at the coin in her hands.
"Nah. He's got another one. Keep it. It'll be a memory of our time together today." Amanda said sarcastically.
Faye laughed, knowing full well they had plenty of souvenirs from today's shopping trip.

Amanda and Faye walked right out of the mall, past the growing number of reporters whom seemed to be gathering outside of the mall, making whatever incident that happened here today, the main story of the night. Mia was back out there, reporting the story again, talking with a paramedic who seemed to be reporting on his findings. Several pregnant women, and one severely overweight man, similar to the one she saw early in the store, were either waiting to be interviewed or being checked out by paramedics or the mobile pre-natal division that were deployed there.

Amanda and Faye loaded their (mostly Amanda's) packages into the car, and drove off back towards their homes, after spending several hours in the mall shopping.

- - - - Much Later: The House - - - -

"I think this is a good saving spot" Jack said, trying to get the crick out of his neck. He always knew he should never game of as long as he does, but he needed several hours of mindless zombie violence right now. He had.. a lot on his mind.
"Oh come on. Wrapping up already? We've only been playing for... wow, that long?" Ian said on the other end of the microphone.
"Yeah. It's getting close to dinner time. My Mom and Dad will be home soon. They're really big into these family dinners, since I've been gone for so long" Jack said.
"Yeah, well. I think the family dinner is going to continue after your gone Jack. I mean your mom is " Ian said over the headset.

"Don't say it. It's bad enough I had to stare at your damn character all day, I don't need any more reminders right now" Jack said.
"Look man, I'm not saying anything. Just go to a shrink and get your head examined. Magic coins, expanding bellies, that stuff isn't good for the old brain apartment. " Ian says before logging off.

XX_IAN_DA_KING_XX is offline, his game console told him as saved his game and powered down. Jack can get back to zombie slaying some later time, right now he had a decision to make.

He could stay for dinner with his family, which he always looked forward to, until recent events made the situation weird... Or he could do something else, ditch dinner with his family.

He couldn't avoid his family forever could he?
1141111112212121111122211122111112.title: A Bun In "Oven's" Oven/Heading Home/Back To Jack.

11411111122121211111222111221111121.content:
Jack walked downstairs to the family dining room. His father was setting the table, looking over at Jack as he put the plates down.

"Can you help your mother bring the food in from the kitchen?" Jack's father asked, placing the utensils out one-by-one. Jack swallowed and walked into the kitchen in the next room, his mother turned to the stove, putting the finishing touches on each of the meals cooking in the pots.

"Here, take this, please," his mother said, turning around and handing Jack a pot. As she did, her belly brushed against Jack's hip. It was covered by a bulky apron, so it didn't give off any real sense of size, but it was certainly big enough that she had trouble easily controlling it. "Whoops," Jack's mom chuckled, putting one hand over her belly. "I guess that'll take some getting used to."

"Y-yeah," Jack said, taking the food back into the dining room, taking his time before going back in. Each time Jack went back inside, he was careful to avoid his mother's new pregnant bulge, and he would hurry back with the food. Finally, he and his father were done and Jack sat down just as Amanda Dale walked in and removed her apron.

Faye's influence on Amanda was profound, as Jack's mother was wearing a form-fitting maternity blouse. Her full belly size, which made her look about 30 weeks pregnant with just one baby, was pronounced largely and her chest, while fully covered, was also shown off nicely. Jack immediately felt his legs shake beneath the table. His sudden...strange feelings toward pregnant women made his first real sight of his pregnant mother a bizarre sensation. It made him wonder how much bigger she would get, especially with quadruplets, and made him think about Amber, Tara, Faye, Trisha, the pregnant news reporter, and of course, Jessica. Jack also couldn't help but notice that his mother now looked decades younger. She never looked bad, but hell, it was a little hard to recognize her now.

Amanda ate with a restrained gusto, talking with Jack Sr. as our hero tried to keep his eyes glued to his plate. Eventually, however, he couldn't help but pick up on something interesting in the conversation.

"-and since Faye's carrying quads too, we could get the same sized clothes."

"Faye's carrying quadruplets too?" Jack said with loud surprise. His parents stopped and stared at him before his mother responded.

"Yep," she said, with a little grin. "Weird, huh?"

"Yeah..." Jack said, going back to his food.

"You know, Jack, we both want you to know that the babies coming isn't going to have any impact on you moving out. We don't want you to feel pressured to stay and help," his father said. Jack had been planning to move out for months now, when his classes end. Jack nodded and went back to eating.

"But it was just like they said on the news," his mother continued. "Pregnant women everywhere, a lot of them freaking out about how big they'd gotten."

"But isn't that kind of like y-" Jack's father said before his mother cut him off and shushed him silently, nodding toward Jack. Jack wasn't paying attention but they both nodded and went back to their conversation. As the meal wore on, Jack finished quickly and excused himself, going back to his room and looking around. He didn't feel like playing any more video games and he wanted to get out of the house. He grabbed the keys and headed out the door, yelling across the house to his parents that he was heading out and he'd call when he's coming back.

They both nodded, finished eating as well and relaxing on the couch. As the door closes, Amanda smiled and sat closer to her husband.

"You know, I didn't just buy clothes at the mall," she said, pulling her blouse down a little to reveal the lace on her lingerie, as well as an ample eyeful of her swelling breasts. Jack Sr. gulped and looked into his wife's eyes.

"You...you want to? Even like this?"

Amanda laughed and moved her lips closer to his. "Oh, dear, I feel perfectly fine. After...talking with Faye, I'm much more comfortable with this whole pregnancy. And besides, I think I look pretty good pregnant. Better than I've looked in years, wouldn't you say?"

"Yeah," Jack Sr. said with a grin, looking his wife up and down. She groaned and grinned, slapping his arm.

"You could have agreed in a better way than that," she said, looking out the door to see Jack's car leave before she slipped her blouse off, revealing her bare belly and breasts, held in sexy, tiny red lingerie. "Ready, Jack baby?"

"Right here on the couch?" he replied, starting to take his shirt off.

"Yes, I'm too big to be moving around," Amanda laughed, throwing herself into her husband's arms.

--- Jack Jr. ---

Jack pulled up to Jessica's house, texting her as he stepped out of the car. She texted him back, saying to come on up. Heading upstairs, Jack found Jessica sitting on her bed with a smile, inviting him to come sit next to her.

"So, crazy day?"

"A little," Jack said, sighing and sitting down. He told her about the mall, about the coin still coming back, and about finding out about Faye's quadruplet pregnancy.

"How does she look?" Jessica asked with a grin. "All young and plastic surgery'd up like your mom suddenly was?"

"Yeah," Jack nodded. "Although, she was always kind of...cougary."

Jessica fell back on the bed laughing, stopping to look at Jack, then continue laughing. "Okay, well, that's a nice way of putting it. Any luck getting the other coin back?"

"Nope," Jack said, pausing as he thought about leaving it in the car earlier. He definitely left it there, but...he flipped it during the news broadcast. "There might actually be a...third coin now."

"Wait, really?" Jessica asked. "Who's got that one?"

Jack thought about the only people who would have been in the car. "Either Faye or...my mom."

Jessica made a nervous face. "That's not good. Well, if your mom's got it, that'll probably be easier to get back."

"Yeah..." Jack said, sighing and turning back to Jessica. As their eyes met, Jessica kept smiling, as if trying to encourage Jack to cheer up. He smiled back. "How have you been?"

"Good, I guess," Jessica said, looking down at her own small bump. "I haven't really been freaking out about...this, at least not yet. I dunno, I've just been thinking about other things, doing other stuff. I watched a movie."

"What movie?" Jack asked. From there, they drifted off into a long conversation about any number of different, non-pregnancy related topics. Hours drifted away easily, the two of them already great friends. Eventually, Jack realized that it was almost 11:30. "Damn, I've got to go back, sorry. I promised my parents I'd let them know when I'd be coming home and they're probably freaking out."

"O-kay," Jessica said in a goofy pout, standing up and opening her arms for a hug. Jack enthusiastically hugged her back, the two of them smiling brightly.

"I'll let you know if any more developments come up," Jack said as he left. Jessica nodded, and when he left, she went over to her computer and plugged in a recording camera. She waiting until it was almost midnight, then she hit *Record*

"Hi Jack," she said, rolling up her shirt to the camera, trying to show as much of her barely-pregnant belly as she could. "I wanted to make you a little video to show you that...or if...it's still happening." Midnight hit, and Jessica gasped, her belly rounding out more now. She was now clearly pregnant, even if it wasn't very far along. "Whoo..." she breathed. "It happened again. I just keep getting bigger. Or, rather...the baby's getting bigger." Jessica put down her shirt and turned to the camera. "I don't think I look bad...pregnant, though. I feel good." Jessica bit her lip, her cheeks getting redder. "If I'm being honest, I know why I didn't freak out when I found out I was pregnant. I've always thought pregnancy was really...beautiful and amazing and maybe even a little sexy. So the idea of being pregnant myself and getting to see my belly sudden expand like this is maybe a little exciting." Jessica was bright red now, looking directly into her camera. "I'm hoping you think it's exciting to because I...I like you." A pause. "I don't even know if I'm going to send this video to you. Maybe this was a mistake."

Jack pulled into his driveway. The whole drive back, he was thinking about how he left out his class with Amber when he told Jessica about his day. Was he trying to hide it? Was there a reason to hide it? He was wrought with guilt and headed straight for bed, his parents long asleep after a long evening enjoying Amanda's changing body.

--- Amanda and Faye: Day 5 || Jessica: Day 4 ---

Jack woke up pretty late in the morning, groggily showering and checking his computer as he got changed. Amber had e-mailed all of the tech store's employees their schedules for the next week. Jack was curious to see what great times Amber had given him, since she promised it in exchange for him being her lamaze partner. Opening the Excel file, he saw...long, midday hours. And every day he was signed up, it was just him and Amber.

"What the..."
11411111122121211111222111221111121.title: Jack joins his family for dinner. Mom wears som...

choices: While Jack listens to the radio, and listens to Oven, we follow Amanda at work.
Stay with Jack as he does his mind numbingly drone task.
114111111221212111112221112211111212.content:
Jack stared blankly at his schedule before him, and sighed to himself.
No good deed goes unpunished Jack thought to himself, copying his schedule into his phone.
As Jack got up from his desk to get ready to go to work, he spied the coin staring back at him from his dresser.

Take Me Jack. he could hear it talking to him in his head. He couldn't take it. He couldn't risk the possibility of being enveloped by it's power again, using it on someone, ruining their life. It was bad enough what happened to Amber, (twice, he thought to himself) what if next time and he's not as lucky and it lands him in an even worse problem than he was in now...

I doubt it could get much worse, but I really shouldn't risk it Jack thought to himself, picking up the coin, twirling it around in his fingers.
He looked at the images on the coin, the happy pregnant woman and man, the unhappy pregnant woman and man.
On the news they said that a man was confirmed pregnant. I mean, that has to be wrong right? Men can't get pregnant, that's impossible. But after all, so was everything else that seemed to be happening lately Jack thought to himself looking at the coin.

"All right here... Coin, whatever the hell you are. I don't know what you are or how you work, but listen to me. You're staying here. You're not causing anymore trouble. You're not going to appear in my pocket, you're not going to copy yourself, you're just going to sit here until I can figure out what to do about all of... this stuff you've been doing." Jack chastised the coin, almost expecting it answer him, but it didn't.

It just sat in his hands as he placed it back down on the dresser, walking away, and closing the door to his room behind him.

And there it sat for the rest of the day.

Jack walked past the door to his parents bedroom like a monster was after him, hoping to avoid another run-in with his mother like last night. However, as he walked past he heard something he didn't expect.

"Are you sure you're up to this?" His father asked, as Jack pressed his ear to the door. "They need me Jack, I have to work. We have five kids to support. Look, I'm pregnant not dead. I have maternity clothes, I have a car. I can spend some time at the bank today doing some work. I took a personal day yesterday, but I have no excuse today. Besides, I kind of want to bask in the congratulations of my co-workers." His mother said with a smile.

"Just be careful okay? Things are.. odd right now. Especially about.." Jack's father was interrupted. "I know, I know" Jack's mother said hesitantly.

Jack walked away from the door, not wanting to listen in to the rest of the conversation, which is a shame, because he would have learned so much about what was coming, but alas.

Jack overslept which prevented him from getting a good breakfast, opting out instead of getting drive-thru. He ate his breakfast sandwich hastily, while blaring loud music from his speakers, as he pulled into the parking space for work. Cleaning up his mess, he threw away everything in the outside trash bin, straightened his uniform and with a sigh, entered into the store.

"Hey there Strong Hands" Amber said, waddling in with her twin-filled belly leading the way. She wore a maternity version of the store uniform, which in retrospect did little to actually completely cover her belly, but it did more than her last outfit did.

"Oh-uh, hey Amber" Jack said, trying to not look directly at her belly. "So, like the schedule for next week?" She asked with a giggle and a wink "Uh, yeah. Thanks for all the shifts, I could really use the money right now" he said, looking at everything else but Amber.

"Jack, my face is right here. You can look at it and not my midsection, even though I know you love it" she said with a sassy giggle.

"I don't..." Jack protested looking Amber straight in the face.
"Oh calm down Strong Hands" Amber said with a smile. "I'm just messing with you. I want to thank you for yesterday. I know it was a little awkward... to say the least, but you really helped me out." Amber said putting her hands into the small of her back and pushing, making her belly jut out farther ahead, making more of her maternity shirt lift up.

"I know I give you a hard time lately Jack, but you're a good guy. Dumb but sweet. You're going to make some lady very happy some day." Amber said, giving her belly a pat. "I - uh" Jack was flabbergasted.

"Hey now. We're not getting paid to stand around here and talk . I'm giving you a choice. Rick's running late but should be here a little after the store opens. If you want you can run the till until he gets in, or you can work in the back while I handle the front. I'd much rather have you in the back. We've got a lot of new product that needs to be out today. The regional manager is stopping by today to inspect the store and he wants everything out and ready to go." Amber says, switching from friend to boss in an instant.

"I'll uh - - - " Jack thought about it for a moment. "I'll work in the back. I need to exercise off that breakfast burger I just had" He says jokingly.
"Alright, get back there and get unloading. The display set-ups and daily inventory sheet is back there. You know what to do." Amber says, walking over to register.

"Uh, right" Jack says, walking towards the back.

After closing the door to the back store-rooms, he let out a sigh of relief. Back here he could hide, and work, and try, try, TRY, to get his mind off all things pregnancy related. Flicking on the radio, he rolled up his sleeves and got to work opening and stacking boxes.

"You're listening to 101.9 THE EDGE. Now it's back to Sandwich and Oven with the MORNING MADNESS. So here they are, the masters of morning madness, Sandwich and Oven!" The radio blared as the morning talk show went on and Jack worked.
114111111221212111112221112211111212.title: Work, Work, Work. It's always work.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121.content:
"-and finally, a dance competition, where each big-bellied babe will show us their best moves. Anything they want: tango, break dancing, even pole dancing if they want!"

"Pole dancing pregnant women? Wow, this contest will have EVERYTHING!" Sandwich said, in an overly enthusiastic, radio DJ voice. "And remember, Miss Stork's Pregnant Bikini Contest is only four days away! Make sure you come out for drinks, dancing, and diapers!"

"WA-WA-WA-ONE OH ONE NINE THE EDGE"

Jack let out a nervous sigh as the radio hosts finally stopped talking about their pregnant bikini contest. He wanted to get his mind off of pregnancy, but sure enough, it followed him wherever he went. And it certainly didn't help that the contest's description had given him a persistent erection.

"A pregnant bikini contest, huh?" Amber said, leaning in the doorway, one hand on her round belly. "I'll bet you'll get a front row seat."

"Haha," Jack said flatly, trying to keep his back to his boss.

"Anyway, looks like you're making good progress. I'm going to go get an early lunch. Hold the fort while I'm gone?"

"No problem," Jack responded. Amber turned out and headed to her car, stopping to rub her belly intently.

A pregnant bikini contest, huh? she thought to herself.

--- Amanda Dale ---

Amanda walked into work as casually as she could, trying not to draw any more attention to her midsection. Although, there wasn't too much she could do to make it more clear. The maternity clothes Amanda picked out with Faye may have been trendy and looked great on her, but they did little to hide her pregnancy. Especially now.

She felt vacant stares on her, including one from one of her closest friends at the office, Rick.

"Amanda..." Rick said, his eyes staring right at her belly.

"Hi Rick," Amanda said with a sigh and a smile, turning her eyes to the rest of the office. "Hi everyone. So, I guess now's a good time to announce it: I'm pregnant."

"Congratulations!" Rick said with a cautious smile. "But you, um, weren't this big a few days ago."

"Well, it's more than one, so I'm growing a little faster than usual," Amanda said. It was half-true, but Amanda knew there was something more to it than that. Yesterday, Amanda looked like she was about 30 weeks pregnant with one baby. Now, you would expect her to have gone into labor at the drop of a pin. Her belly was enormous: perfectly round, sticking out a little over a foot from the rest of her body. Amanda figured carrying four babies would make things different from when she was pregnant with Jack Jr., but...even so...

"More than one?" Rick said, his eyebrows raising. "Twins?"

Amanda smiled. "We can talk more later," she said quietly, walking over to her seat. It took some adjusting to get to a position where she could reach her keyboard over her belly, but when she was settled, Amanda got right to work, just like always.

After a few hours of work, Amanda got a text from none other than Tara.

<hi Amanda. just heard the big news. want to get lunch?>

<sure!> Amanda sent back. She was a little annoyed that someone told Tara without her getting a chance, but she was good friends with Tara and it would be nice to talk to someone else who knew what it felt like to have their pregnancy sneak up on them a little. Imagine getting so close to delivery and then finding out there were another two babies in there!

Amanda smiled to herself a little as she thought how it might be nice to meet a pregnant woman who's belly is actually bigger than hers. Although, at this rate, and with one more baby inside her than Tara...maybe that won't last long.

Noon rolled around and Amanda headed out to meet Tara where they agreed to get lunch: the mall's food court. When Amanda walked in the door, she saw Tara sitting in on one of the benches arraigned in a circle around the potted trees in the mall. She waved enthusiastically, wearing her usual dark clothing, her raven hair tied in a knotted ponytail.

"Amanda, oh my god!" Tara said happily, the two of them waddling together and hugging as best they could. "Look at you! It's true!"

"Yep," Amanda chuckled with a grin, rubbing her own big belly. "I just found out a few days ago, but I'm doing plenty of growing."

"Wow. May I?" Tara asked, reaching her hand to Amanda's belly. Amanda nodded and Tara felt all around her stretched out tummy. "I can't believe it's grown this fast, though. How many months are you?"

"Thr-" Amanda was about to respond, but she stopped herself. In retrospect...there was no way she was just three months pregnant. That didn't make any sense. "The doctor says I'd have to go in again to really pin it down. But, they did tell me that it's quadruplets."

"Quadruplets?" Tara said with a smile and a raised eyebrow. "And I thought I had a big bundle on my hands." Tara began cradling and rubbing her own belly. "Ooh, okay, calm down," she giggled. "Speaking of which, they're starting to kick up a storm. They must really want lunch. Shall we?"

"Absolutely," Amanda said, rubbing her own belly, trying to match Tara's movements. She wondered what it would feel like to have four babies kicking inside her simultaneously. The thought scared and excited her at the same time.

Both of the heavily pregnant women waddled to the food court, drawing plenty of looks. Grabbing plenty to eat, they both sat down at a big table that could accommodate their bellies and began eating and talking.

"Amanda, I don't mean to sound rude, but you really look amazing," Tara said, swallowing a big bite of her caesar wrap. "Are you doing anything new, or is it all...the pregnancy?"

"Must just be the pregnancy," Amanda responded, shrugging. "Although, I'm always in a better mood the day after I've...you know." Amanda winked at Tara, who started laughing.

"Amanda! You sly fox," Tara said with a huge smile. “Even while you’re pregnant?”

“What can I say? I’ve gotten very comfortable with my new body,” Amanda said, taking another bite with a smile. “Although I have to give a lot of credit to my friend. And the maternity lingerie she helped me pick out.”

“Maternity lingerie?” Tara said skeptically.

“Oh yeah, there’s a great place that sells it right in this mall, actually,” Amanda said, pointing in the vague direction where she and Faye had shopped yesterday. Tara nodded contemplatively and continued to eat.

“Wow, I can’t even imagine what it would be like to have sex while I’m pregnant.” Tara gave a weak smile. “Oops. I guess I gave you a little too much of a window into my life.”

“Oh Tara, I’m in my 50s and I’m pregnant with quadruplets. Believe me: I envy you in a lot of ways.”

“Thanks,” Tara said with a smile, taking her last bite of food. “Well, this has been great, but it’s probably about time for you get back, huh?”

“Yeah, unfortunately,” Amanda said, putting both hands on the table to help herself up. Tara did the same, taking a little more time. Her belly was nearly twice as big as Amanda’s and her shirt didn’t even cover it completely.

As Amanda headed back to her car, Tara walked toward Baby Universe to browse around. On the way, there was a big table with 101.9’s logo emblazoned above it and a sign-up sheet for the pregnant bikini contest.

“Why not,” Tara said to herself, reaching for the pen.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121.title: While Jack listens to the radio, and listens to...

choices: Thrown into a van with a bag on his head. I'm sure he'll be fine. Someone Else.
11411111122121211111222111221111121211.content:
Time seemed to pass quickly as Jack worked on his mindless task, unboxing items and filling out paperwork as the radio blared on.

"And this has been Sandwich and Oven in the morning. Be sure to listen to us everyday and remember, in just four days prepare yourself for the Miss Stork Pregnant Bikini Contest!" Sandwich said over the radio.

"That's right. And join us tomorrow morning when we'll have some of the expectant contestants here in the studio with us!" Oven said.
"Hey Oven..." Sandwich says over the radio.
"Yeah Sandwich?" Oven replies.
"You know what we should do? Since we've caught the Pregnant Bikini Contest Fever, I'm thinking you, me, our lovely on-air co-host Ms. Sexy Lisa Smith, and our lovely expectant contestants all take pregnancy tests on-air tomorrow morning as a joke. It'll be funny!" Sandwich says, fighting back laughter.
"That's a great idea! What do you think Ms. Sexy Lisa Smith?" Oven asks his female co-host.
"Oh yeah. I'm down. Besides, you might need to take one because of all the hurling you did this morning Oven" Sexy Lisa Smith says over the radio.
"Baby please. I was only puking because I have to look at Sandwich's ugly mug all morning!" Oven shouts into his mike playfully, playing a sound effect of someone puking.
"Oh, and that's another Oven Zinger! Remember folks, write down what time Oven does his zingers, send them in, and win a free Sandwich and Oven in the morning T-Shirt! So long this morning everyone, up next we got 101 minutes of non-stop rock, right here on The Edge!" Sandwich says finishing up his stick.

Jack checked his watch, noticing that Amber still wasn't back from her early lunch yet.
"What is taking her so long? My lunch hour is coming up, and if I don't go on it soon, I'm going to get another violation. That's the last thing I need right now" Jack said, tapping his foot.

He put aside his work and went out front looking for Amber, and yet, still did not find her.
"Oh for crying out loud" Jack said to himself. With everything that had been going on in his life lately, the last thing he needed was trouble with his job.
"Hey, I'm going on lunch. Can you tell Amber when she gets back?" Jack asked grabbing another employee.
"Are you sure? I'm sure she'll be back soon. Can't you wait? I don't want to get trouble raining down on me if she comes back and you're gone" the employee said.

"It'll be fine. Just tell her I did it to avoid another lunch violation. She'll understand" Jack said.
"Whatever you say man" The employee said, walking off to do his job.

Jack went into the back, logged himself out for his lunch break, and walked out the employee back entrance to his car.

The sun was out and it was a very beautiful day as Jack made his way to his car. His mind wondered back to everything that had been happening lately, wondering how he got into this mess. He was hoping that something would come and just take him away from all of this...

And Jack was about to get his wish...

"You Jack Dale?" said a beautiful, busty red-head, waiting for him by his car.
"Uh---" Jack said, his eyes being drawn to her ample cleavage, on display for the whole world.
"My eyes are up here" she said flatly.
"I uh, yeah sorry I" Jack said, trying to regain his composure.
"So you're Jack Dale Jr?" She asked, nodding her head slowly.
"Yeah. And you are?" Jack asked, his "I'M IN DANGER" sense not tingling because of the beautiful distraction in front of him.
"You purchased this coin a few days ago didn't you?" The busty red-head said, holding up a photo of the coin. An exact photo, 100 accurate in every detail.
"Uh, how do you - - " Jack was starting to say before he was grabbed from behind, had a black sack shoved over his head and was drug off into a large black van that anyone would have probably noticed was parked where it shouldn't have been parked if Jack was paying more attention to his surroundings.

"OH COME ON! YOU'VE GOT TO BE KIDDING ME!" Jack shouted behind the black sack shoved over his head, before WHAM! He was punched in the back of the head, and sweet darkness over took him.
11411111122121211111222111221111121211.title: It gets worse.

choices: Jack makes a run for it.
114111111221212111112221112211111212111.content:
Jack awoken to darkness and voices.

"Was that really necessary? I'm sure he would have come with us if we just asked" the voice belonged to the busty red-head.
"I panicked" said a large older male voice.
"So kidnapping was Plan B?" the busty red-head asked.
"Is it really kidnapping if he's over 18? I mean he's not a kid. I mean, why do then even call it kidnapping if - - -" said another voice, further away from Jack.
"JUST SHUT UP MR. QUICK" said the older male voice.
"And another thing. Can we pick better code names? This whole Mr/Ms thing is really cliched. I want to go by Artemis Snake" said the voice that was identified as "Mr. Quick"
"This is what happens when you get your help from people on the internet" said another female voice behind Jack.
"Hey I think he's awake" said another male voice before - - -

WOOSH! Jack closed his eyes as they adjusted to the bright light shining in his eyes.
"Uhhh" was all Jack could say before - - - WHAM!

He was punched in the face by a large mustached man with a short haircut.
"WHY DID YOU PUNCH HIM AGAIN?!" The busty red-head asked the large mustached man.
"Uh- - - Isn't that what the do in movies?" The large mustached man said
"Go sit down Mr. Ox" said the busty red-head, holding the ridge of her nose.

Jack watched as the man called "Mr. Ox" took a seat in a chair some distance away.
"Uh, sorry about that bro" was all Mr. Ox could say to Jack as he walked by.
Jack appeared to be in some kind of empty office building, the only light he could see was a large standing one used for outdoor construction.

"WHERE AM I? WHO ARE YOU PEOPLE?!" Jack asked, afraid of his life. Today, was turning out to not be his day.
"Sorry about that Jack. My associate over there is uh..." The busty read-head said before being interrupted by Mr, Quick
"He's an idiot"
"I heard that Mr. Quick!" Mr. Ox bellowed from his seat.
"Enough both of you. We're here to help Jack, not - - - do whatever the hell it is we're doing now" A long raven-haired women with dark caramel skin said from behind Jack, walking over towards him and untying him.

"Look Jack, before you say anything. I want you to hear me out. We really really really didn't mean to kidnap you" The busty red-head said.
"In fact, we're here to help you with your current predicaments" the caramel skinned woman said "You can call me Ms. Smart and the busty red-head over there is Ms. Apple"

Jack wanted to get up and run but his legs were too weak, so he sat there, trying to get his strength up.

"Look, we know everything about the coin. And if you can get past our very, very awful introduction" Ms Apple said, projecting her voice towards Mr. Ox "I think we can help you" She said with a smile.
114111111221212111112221112211111212111.title: Uh.. sorry about that.
