1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack was a smart guy. Well, smart enough. He got good grades in school, always considered himself to be "street smart". However, when your kidnapped, thrown into a van, awake in an abandoned office building surrounded by people calling themselves "Mr this or Ms. That" and had a chance to escape, most people who were considered smart would take the chance to escape.

But Jack chose to listen, which some people would claim to make Jack the dumbest man alive right now.

"Who are you people? What the hell is going on?" Jack asked, more than a little pissed off.

"We represent a group of people who's lives have been ruined by this particular item" Ms. Apple said, holding up the photo of the coin.
"And these particular group of people think that by helping you they can help themselves" Ms. Smart continued.

"Particular group of people?! What the hell are you talking about? Why are you talking like you're some sort of special government agents" Jack asked.

"I told them that approach was cliched." Mr Quick said, getting up and walking over to Jack. "Look, Jack. I'm going to cut the double speak crap.
We're a support group" Mr Quick answered.

"Support group?" Jack questioned.
"A support group for people affected by that damn coin. Each one of us have been affected by the coin in some way. Family members, friends, co-workers, and in some cases.. ourselves" Mr Quick said, his eyes not trying to give away which one of these people were affected by the coin.

"So what you want me to join? Come to the meeting every Tuesday night and say, Hi my name is Jack, and my life was ruined by a coin I bought from a guy at a rummage sale? Sorry, not interested" Jack said.

"We're here to help Jack. We think we can stop whatever it is that's happening around you.. Unless of course you want four new siblings" Mr. Ox says standing up.

"How the hell do know about that?" Jack asked, turning his attention over to Mr. Ox, really really really hoping he doesn't punch him in the face again.
"We've been following you these past few days. We were actually in town to retrieve the coin at the rummage sale before it managed to find someone new to.. bond to" Ms. Smart said.

"Bond? Can you guys pretend I'm stupid and tell me what the hell is going on?" Jack asked, wanting answers.
"How about a story? A long, long, time ago, there was this coin." Mr. Quick says, tapping on the picture of the coin. "And nobody knows where it comes from. Some people say it fell from the stars, some people say it's the last artifact from a time where actual magic ruled the world. Either way, this coin has one very special power: It can get anyone pregnant. ANYONE Jack. Men, women, young, old. It doesn't matter to the coin. Why? Because it's all food to it?" Ms. Apple explained.

"Food?" Jack asked.
"You see Jack. Along the course of everyone's life, we go from Point A to Point B, changing the route every so often either in big ways or small ways depending on our choices in life." Ms. Apple continues.
"Where we go to school, what career we choose, who we fall in love with, so on and so forth. Each decision a small or major fork in the road that all eventually leads to the same place: Point B" Mr. Quick continues.
"We call it our Destiny-nation, you know instead of destination" Mr. Ox says.

"We don't call it that. It's just a name we're using for it right now" Mr. Quick responds back, rolling his eyes.
"The point is, everyone ends up where they're supposed to end up. It's how the world works.. But this coin.. changes all of that.. for everyone. Uh.. how do I explain this easily..." Ms. Smart said scratching her head. "Wait, I've got it" She said snapping her finger.

She pulled over a white board from somewhere in the office, wrote "Point A" on one side "Point B" on the other, and up at the top she wrote "Amanda Dale".

"This is your mom right? All the paths in her life all lead to Point B, but along the way she took different routes to get there. Met your dad, had you, so on and so forth. But this coin right? It changed all that. Ever since that coin was used on her she became pregnant, and BIG TIME" Ms Apple explains as Ms. Smart writes on the white-board.

"Having a child is one of the biggest changes a person makes in their life, and as such, it's one of the biggest route changes on the way to the Destiny-nation" Ms Apple continues, as Mr. Ox gives a beam of pride of the use of the term.
"Now that your mom is pregnant, her destination is no longer Point B." Ms Apple explains.
"The Destiny path of your mom up until a few days ago was Point B, whatever Point B may have been to her. But now, her Destination is in chaos. She's over 50, pregnant with quads, and will have to work many more years to support them along with your father. Point B is no longer an option, she's headed to Point C, or Point D, of Point E.." Ms Smart takes over.
"The coin, causing that pregnancy, created new destinations for her, and is feeding on the chaos that creates. It alters people's destiny by creating a pregnancy, and uses that to feed itself. Create, feed, hunger, create, feed, hunger. It's all the coin does."

"And it's just not her Point B that changes, it changes for everyone. Let's say one of your sibling grows up and marries a nice girl, we'll call her Mary Sue. Mary Sue and your Sibling get married and have a kid together, while that may sound nice, Mary Sue was destined to marry someone else and have kid who would grow up and become president, thus changing everyone's Point B's, and giving the coin more chaos to feed." Ms. Apple continues.

"This coin creates pregnancies, in both men and women, to create chaos to feed itself on the chaos created by a change in a person's destiny" Mr. Quick summarizes.

"I - - don't believe any of this" Jack said, taking in all of the mind-blowing information.
"Well you better believe it fast, because the clock is ticking" Mr. Ox says.
"What - what do you mean" Jack asks looking confused.

"Smooth Ox" Ms. Apple says, flustered.
"He needs to know sooner rather than later." Mr Ox says.
"KNOW WHAT?" Jack asks, getting angry.

"The coin's - - -magic, if you want to call it that, can be reversed, but it needs to be done quickly before the effects become permanent." Ms. Smart says.
"How?" Jack asked not skipping a beat, trying to undo everything he's done.

"We'll get to that. But there's something you need to know: The coin has chosen you Jack. It's bonded to you, and that's why we're here to help you" Ms. Apple informs.
"Bonded?" Jack asks.
"Whenever the coin needs to work it's magic to feed, it bonds to someone to use them as it's puppet so to speak." Mr. Quick answers.
"You mean like all those times the coin wants me to flip it" Jack says getting it.
"Bingo. It uses you to do it's dirty work. But bonding is tricky Jack. You see, by using you as it's puppet, it also gives you the chance to stop it. You caused it, your bonded to the coin, you can stop it. But not for long, when those kids are born in a few days, the "circuit" if you want to call it that, linking the two of you together will be complete and it will be too late to stop it" Ms. Apple informs.

"I see what you're saying and - - - WAIT, A FEW DAYS?!" Jack asked, the words in the sentence hitting him like a ton of bricks.
"The coin's magic works it's way fast, each month of pregnancy lasting about a day, maybe a little less or a little more depending. The coin uses this as a defense mechanism" Mr Quick starts again.
"9 months would make it too easy to figure out a way linking the magic between the coin and the person bonded to it. So the pregnancies are accelerated to a month a day. By the time the person or persons involved figured it out, it would be too late to stop it." Ms Apple continues.

"Once ANY one of the kids are born, the circuit is completed and it's too late to reverse it, no matter what" Mr. Ox finishes.
"But if each pregnancy is 9 days, then why do some women act like they've been pregnant for months?" Jack asks, wanting clarification.
"It's the inverse of the magic Jack. The ying-to-the yang if you will. For every accelerated pregnancy created by the ring, sometimes a pregnancy is just created in a specific month of pregnancy, and the person will either believe they were always pregnant, or react like someone who just witnessed their belly grow large with child. It all depends on" Ms. Apple says.

"Depends on what?" Jack asks.
"Heads or Tails Jack". Ms. Smart answers.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Revelations. I know, real original title right?

choices: Jack goes back home, has dinner with Mom & Dad, then takes the book over to Jess
Jack just ignores all of this and goes to a movie or something.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"So how do I stop all this?" Jack asked as the time flew by as he got an answer for each-and-every one of his questions.
"With this" Mr. Ox said, dropping a heavy book on his lap with a thud.
"Ow!" Jack said, looking at the book in his lap. It was old, older than old, yet looked brand new. It looked like something out of horror movie, where some kids in a cabin find a book and nothing good happens.

Rusted hinges held the book together, while a thick, almost metal like cover, covered the front. The pages were old and yellowed along the side, some pages even falling out of their binding.

"The hell is this thing? Because honestly it looks like something that if I messed around with it could bring the dead back to life" Jack says looking at the book.

"It's the answer to your problems" Mr. Ox says.
"At least we think so" Mr Quick corrected.

"What?" Jack asked.
"This books contains everything, everything people have gathered about the coin over time. Accounts, encounters, attempts to destroy it, that kind of thing" Ms. Apple says.
"Somewhere in the massive volume, MAY, be the answer. But we've only recently gotten ahold of it, came from a private collector who had come across it in the rare-book market. He got it after he encountered the coin and by then it was too late for him" Ms. Smart says, trailing off a little bit.
"Hope the poor guy can loose all that pregnancy-weight. But his daughter is the cutest little thing you ever saw" Mr. Ox said.

"He gave the book to us, hoping that we could have it translated for when the coin came to someone next, but shipping delays caused that to not be so, we just got it the day we came here for the coin, and found you" Ms. Apple informs.

"If you translate this book, you might find someway to destroy the coin while it's still bonded to you, before one of the children are born and it's too late." Mr. Quick states.
"And if not, you'll really help out the poor schmo how the coin comes to after you, while your on diaper duty" Mr. Ox says.

Jack rubbed his head with the palm of his hand. This was all too much.. Much to much..

"My head hurts. I taste purple" Jack said rubbing his head.
"We're going to drop you off back at your house. You should really get translating right away. Clock's ticking" Ms. Smart said.
"While this has been a super great experience and everything, I'm going to go back to work and try to repress this whole thing" Jack said.
"Don't worry about going back to work. We managed to convince your manager Amber that you had an emergency you needed to deal with at home. She gave you the rest of the day off, with pay I might add" Mr. Quick said.
"But she said you now owe her a favor, and then she called you "Strong Hands" for whatever reason" Mr. Ox said.
"So ready to begin?" Ms. Apple said.

"Uh, isn't there something else I can do?" Jack asked.
"Not really" Mr. Ox said, putting the black sack over Jack's head.
"Oh come on again with the bag" Jack said behind the shroud.
"Support group my ass." Jack said.

"Look man, we're just a bunch of people who met on the internet and came here to help you. We're not professionals." Mr. Ox said before WHAM! Hitting Jack in the back of the head again.

- - - - Later - - -

Jack awoke in his car in a parking lot not far from his house. The book was in the passenger seat, staring back at him.
Jack looked at it, and it looked back at him.

"I should have just bought those old coloring books at that damn sale" Jack said, turning the key in the ignition and driving back towards home.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Revelations Part Two: Oh hey, ticking clock.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Back home, Jack peeked around the house, looking to see if his parents were home so he could hide the book. No such luck, as his mom was lying back on the couch, her shirt rolled up, her hands meticulously rubbing her full belly. Jack could tell that is was obviously bigger than the day before, and not just because it was now totally bare. She looked like she was 41 weeks pregnant with just one baby. Her belly was gleaming as she was using some kind of oil or cream, Jack couldn't tell. But the sight made him feel...things he was embarrassed to feel.

"Hi Jack," his mother said, not taking her eyes off her belly. Jack nervously walked into the room, also watching his mother rub her belly. The group from earlier had explained it partially to him, but now that he saw his mother's belly, Jack fully understood: she really was getting closer to delivery with each passing day. "It's crazy, huh?"

"What?" Jack said, snapping out of his experience just a few hours ago.

"How big I look," his mom said, looking over at her son, a little smile across her face. "When I was this big before, I was being driven to the hospital by your father. But the doctor says I still have some more months left." She sighed and stroked her full size again. "God only knows how big I'll be by then..."

Jack's face turned red and he turned back to hurry up the stairs to his room. Closing the door behind him, Jack dropped the mysterious book on his desk and turned it open. The first page was full of tiny, almost calligraphic writing. He strained the read the words, making out lines like "with child" and "sudden." He flipped a few more pages, seeing that the book was not organized in any way he could tell. It was more like a scrapbook, with different writings and observations. One page had a series of Polaroids of a pregnant woman who got bigger with each photograph, with pictures labeled "Day 4," "Day 5," etc.

Turning the page again, he found a small section that he could understand. It looked like he turned to be right in the middle of a journal entry.

"The coin's voice, it has to be the coin's voice, is getting louder. It's saying more than just simple things like flip and look. Today it told me not to turn the corner. Like there was something it didn't like or something it couldn't stand. It's strange. I wish I could find out whatever it was, then I could be rid of this damned coin." That was certainly interesting, but it wasn't all that helpful to Jack. There was something that could be used against the coin, but no word on what it is or how to use it.

After looking through the book some more and spending a lot of time absently staring at the pictures of pregnant women, Jack slammed the book closed and rubbed his eyes. This was going to be even harder than he thought.

"Dinner, Jack," his father called. Jack looked over at the clock. He had spent hours and hours looking through the book.

"Wow, I didn't even notice..." Jack said to himself, putting the book away someplace secret. "Hopefully some of it sunk in."

At the dinner table, his mother was already sitting there with a smile, her belly now covered up. They all ate, his mother taking food in with gusto.

"Oh, Jack, I saw Tara today. She was put on maternity leave after she found out that she's got triplets, especially this close to her due date, but she was fine," his mother said.

"That's good," Jack said, glad she wasn't hurt too badly by the coin's chaotic magic. Then, he remembered what the "support group" had told him. If they give birth, it's all over. "Do you know how far she is from her, um, due date?"

"Not exactly, but I'd guess a few weeks, especially the way she looks," his mom said, raising her eyebrows to emphasize her point. "I don't even know of any women who are pregnant with triplets for this long. It's been more than eight months, for sure."

Good, Jack thought. She isn't going to give birth too soon. I've still got the same amount of time to fix this.

As they were finishing up, Jack's mom took another big bite and then paused, putting her hand to her belly.

"Ooh..." she said curiously. "Oh! Oh, Jack, they're kicking!" She grabbed Jack's dad's arm, who reached over to his wife's big belly and began rubbing with a surprised look on his face.

"Amanda, that's incredible," he breathed. Amanda turned over to face her son.

"Jack, here, come feel!" she said, beaming.

"Oh, uh, I dunno," Jack said hesitantly.

"Come on!" she said, taking a deep breath as she got a particularly hard kick. "Wow, it's so strange feeling so many bodies kicking inside there." Nervously, Jack reached out his hand, which his mother grabbed and rubbed against her belly. "There, your big brother is feeling you now. Will you calm down a little?"

Jack blushed and brought his hand away. "I'm going to go hang out with my friends," he said as he ran upstairs. Amanda frowned a little and started to rub her own belly, moving her hand where she felt bumps.

"He just needs to get used to it, Amanda," his dad said, putting his hand over Amanda's. "It took you a while to get used to it too, remember?"

"Yeah..." Amanda said, looking down at her belly. "I'm still not completely used to it. At this rate, who knows how big I'll be tomorrow?"

"You'll still be gorgeous," Jack Sr. said, planting a kiss on his wife's cheek.

Upstairs, Jack dumped the book into his backpack and headed out the door, grabbing his keys and all. There was only one place he could think to go: Jessica's house. Now that there was a way to get rid of the coin's magic, he had to tell her. Besides, having another pair of eyes might make it easier to figure something out from the book.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack gets to work on the book

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
--- Ian ---

It was a slow, Sunday night and Ian was hanging out with some of his other friends at the local bar. They were joking, drinking, having a great time. He felt increasingly groggy and figured he would probably have to slow it down some. Turning around on his stool, he surveyed the rest of the bar. It was a big place, with a restaurant there and everything. There was a stage off on the side being set up, with some big signs for a radio station being hung up. A beautiful blonde woman was giving orders, showing where speakers and lights should be set up.

"C'mon guys, if we get it up now, we can see how things will look for the actual competition in a few days," she said.

"Sure thing, Lisa," one guy said as he threw some cables up into the rafters to get them out of the way.

"Hey, Ian?" One of his friends said. "Some of us are going to grab a cab back, want to come?"

"Mmmidunno," Ian said, pulling a coin out of his pocket. "Heads I stay, tailsigo?"

"Uh, yeah, sure, whatever."

"Whooop," Ian said, tossing his coin lazily and catching it. "Tails. Llllezgo!"

Ian's friends helped him to the door and none of them noticed the scream of surprise as Lisa Smith's uterus gained a few full-term occupants.
--- Jack ---

"And then they took the bag off my head and I was back home," Jack said. Jessica was flipping through the book, listening and reading.

"Interesting," she said, stopping at the same page Jack had focused on before with the polaroids. "Wait...these are all just days?"

"Yep, that's the other thing," Jack said, his voice getting more serious. "They said the pregnancies accelerate by the day, so nine days is like nine months."

Jessica looked down at her own belly, which Jack had noticed was bigger than before. It now looked like a real pregnant belly, even if it wasn't as big as...well, everyone else's. "How many days do you figure it's been for me?"

"I'm not sure," Jack said, trying to think about when he must have first flipped the coin. "Maybe...four?"

"So five days left for me," she said, rubbing her hands over her belly. "But I guess the bigger issue is just four days left for your mom."

"Right, so we've got to figure something out soon," Jack said, leaning down to look at the book with Jessica. His hair brushed her cheek and she looked over at him and gave a little smile. He didn't notice so she bit her lip and looked back down.

They spent hours going over the book, discussing ideas, trying to find patterns. It got later and later and the two of them bumped into each other, which led to nervous giggles. It happened enough times that when Jack's hand brushed against Jessica's inflated breasts, she slowly closed the book.

"M-maybe it's too late to keep trying this," she said.

"Yeah, maybe," Jack said, sighing. He liked spending time with Jessica and trying to find a solution, but it looked like she was calling a night a night.

"Want to just, you know, sit and talk?" Jessica asked, moving to sit on her bed. Jack happily joined her. They didn't say anything, though. They just looked into each other's eyes as their eyelids got heavier and their faces got closer. They weakly kissed, their lips just barely touching.

"Would you like to feel my belly?" Jessica whispered. Jack moved his hand to her abdomen and Jessica rolled up her shirt. "Is this the first time you've felt a pregnant belly?"

"My mom beat you there by a few hours," Jack chuckled a little. Jessica giggled.

"Poor baby," she said softly, kissing Jack on the neck. They lay back in the bed, cuddling together. Jessica moved her hand up Jack's shirt.

"D-do you want me to take it off?"

Jessica nodded, biting her lip. They both undressed, still just holding each other and kissing every now and then.

"Have you ever...you know?" Jack said shyly.

"I don't think anyone's ever asked a pregnant woman that question before," Jessica chuckled, kissing Jack on the chest and moving her hand to his erection.

Jack smiled and turned around, moving his hand around one of her supple breasts. "Well, w-would you like to do it?"

"Yes," Jessica said with a smile, positing Jack to enter her. "Absolutely."

Jack penetrated her labia, struggling to pump against her and kiss against her body. "Y-you're belly's in the way," he gasped, trying to talk while his erection was being stimulated by her insides.

Jessica giggle and sat up, riding Jack from on top. "Better?" she asked, her face bright red.

"Better," Jack managed to get out, now vigorously moving in motion with Jessica's hips. "But now I can't reach your breasts."

Jessica laughed and started to massage her own chest. "Like this?"

"Oh yeah," Jack moaned, reaching his hands around her tight ass.

"Yeah, I knew you'd like this big, pregnant tits," Jessica said. She was starting to lose herself in the dirty talk, but she loved this side of her too.

"Jess," Jack managed to squeak out.

"Yeah, and you love my round, pregnant belly. You can't wait to see it grow and grow."

"Jess, wait," Jack said, starting to struggle.

"Big, huge, more babies in it than your mom's. I'll smother you with my full womb and then you'll bend me over and fuck me in my wet, pregnant-"

Jessica was cut off by Jack coming too soon, his face contorted with embarrassment and pleasure.

"Hmm, that really turned you on, huh," Jessica said to herself, a little surprised.

"It's...complicated," Jack moaned, collapsed on Jessica's bed.

--- Faye ---

Unknown to Jack, Jessica, and everyone else, the coin felt threatened. It could sense that the One It Was Bonded To was looking for ways to sever that bond and undo what it had done. The One didn't realize it, but he had gotten a step closer to figuring it out and ruining the feast of chaos it had before it.

But the coin's power was not to be underestimated. It had a plan.

As Faye rolled around in her bed, by herself, she grabbed the coin in her palm in her sleep. She was alone in bed because her husband refused to share the bed with such a pregnant woman and it broke her heart, as happy as she was that she was pregnant.

You love being pregnant, don't you Faye? the coin called to her.

Faye opened her eyes. She was in another room, mysterious and unknown. She looked down and saw that her belly was...huge! It was bigger than any pregnant belly she had ever seen before. And what's more she could feel so much movement inside her. Faye happily rubbed her belly.

"Yes, I've waited so long to be pregnant. I didn't think the day would ever come!" she said.

A figure stood before her, any details about him obscured somehow. "Well, I'm glad you like it. But do you remember when you first found out you were pregnant?"

"Yes, of course! It was the happiest day of my life!" Faye said. "It was...um...it was..."

"Yes, your pregnancy just came one day," the figure said. "And it can go just as easily as it came."

Faye looked down and saw that her belly was gone. What's more, she looked and felt even older and weaker. "No..." she said. "What...what happened?"

"The boy across the street wants to take that away from you," the figure said, getting closer. "But you can stop him. Just do...exactly what I say."

Back in her bed, Faye curled up, a smile across her face as she rubbed her belly. "Mmm...just tell me what to do."

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Amanda: Day 6|Faye: Day 6|Jessica: Day 5| "Oven": Day 3

Jack Jr awoke in a bed that wasn't his. As he rubbed the sleep from his eyes, he noticed the delicate curve of the lifted sheets next to him.

One of Jessica's hand was wrapped around her now 5-month pregnant belly, which was covered by blue bedsheets. Her hand rested upon it like she was worried like someone was going to snatch it away from her. Her other delicate hand was covering the spot where Jack was sleeping moments before.

Jack stopped what he was doing and looked at the scene before him. Jessica looked... so happy. She looked like a happily married woman who was starting a family with the man she loved, not a single 20-something in a dead-end job, mysteriously pregnant because of a coin.

Jack felt a pang of guilt as he watched this scene. Not just because he's felt he ruined Jessica's life, but because of what happened the night before. As the memories of the beautiful lovemaking they spent the whole night doing (Jack was rather proud that he beat his personal best record by two additional times) rushed back to him, he wondered what would become of their friendship.

Sex between friends is always weird, but add into the whole "Hey female best friend, you're pregnant with a rapid pregnancy caused by a coin whose feeding off the chaos caused by said pregnancy" in the mix, and it just cranks the weird-o-meter up to 11.

Jessica stirred softly in her sleep, her hand rubbing her new larger midsection, a smile creeping on the sides of her face as she dream of... what? Jack wondered where he fit into the grand scheme of things in Jessica's life now, because, well dammit, he loved her.

It was the first time that Jack ever admitted to it, either in his head or aloud, but he knew it was right. Watching Jessica sleep, he LOVED her.
She drove him crazy, and he wanted to be with her the rest of his days. They've been friends forever, and as time passed he watched grow from a dorky young girl into the beautiful young maternal woman in front of him.

Jack always knew that there was something between them, but Jack could never risk the chance that he was wrong and risk a friendship for mixed signals. He stood next to her as they struggled through high school and the awkwardness that came with it. The long hot summers, just him and her at the beach, hoping that chance for the kiss, the kiss that would change everything.

And after last night, he wondered what came next. You just can't back a night like last night, and he'd never want to. But still he could - - -

BZZT! BZZT! BZZT!

Jack pulls his cellphone out his pants (which took him a few minutes to find as the clothes in Jessica's room where strewn about in the fit of passion last night) and looked at it. It was a text from Amber.

Great. Jack thinks as he checks the message:

Morning Strong Hands. Hope I didn't pull you away from anything important, but I need you to come in early today. I know you had to leave yesterday, but the work that needed to be done yesterday wasn't done, and now it's raining hellfire down on all of us. I need you in here before your noon shift, and it's going to be probably an all-day shift, so hey, lot's of overtime, but it needs to be done. I'd do it myself, but... well you know Strong Hands the text message ended with a winking emoticon.

"Fantastic" Jack muttered to himself looking over to the book. He barely made a scratch to the hefty tomb that may hold the answer to reversing all of this... and now he has to go into work all day "Mmm, what was that?" Jessica asked, leaning forward on the bed, causing her pregnant belly to jut forward, and she put two hands behind on the bed,.

"Oh uh.. Good morning Jessica" Jack said, starting to get flustered at the beautiful sight before him.
"Good morning lover. Why don't you come back to bed?" Jessica said with come-hither voice and devilish look on her face.
"Uh, lover? J-j-j-j-ess about last night, we uh, we - we - we" Jack stammered, his brain shutting down.

Jessica started laughing, as she heaved herself (with some difficulty) out of bed, wrapping the sheet around her like a toga. Her 5-month belly and it's curve visible through the bed sheets.

"Relax you big dork, I'm just messing with you" She said, giving him a kiss on the check.
"But then what what what what" Jack said, even more confused than before.
"Than what was all this?" She motions to the room, implying about last night.
"It was just some fun... between friends. I mean, I'm awash in hormones Jack, I needed a.. release" Jessica said, in an obvious lie that anyone who wasn't Jack could have picked up on
"But all that.. dirty talk. You said some.." Jack said
"It was all just.. part of the fun of the moment. Heh, you didn't think I actually meant any of that did you?" Jessica said, another obvious lie.

"No, no, no. Of course not" Jack said, in an obvious lie that Jessica didn't pick up on. An awkward pregnant pause fell between them.
"So uh - - -" Jack said without thinking. "Well uh" Jessica said, one of her hands resting on her belly.

"I uh, better get going. i gotta get to work soon" Jack said, looking down at the ground and rubbing the back of his neck.
"Don't you want to shower first?" Jessica asked.
"Are you asking me if - - - " Jack said, his mind jumping to conclusions
"You want to use my shower? It's down the hall to the right. Just be careful my parents don't see you, they probably haven't left for work yet" Jessica said, her face turning red, knowing what Jack really meant to say.
"Uh yeah, right." Jack said, covering, before leaving to go take a shower.
"Don't you need a change of clothes or something?" Jessica asked, following after Jack.

"Nah, I always keep a change in my car just in case of emergencies. Same thing with my work uniform, I mean you never know right?" Jack asked, before slipping out of Jessica's room. "Yeah, you never know" Jessica said to herself quietly.

She walked (almost now a full-on waddle) over to her full length mirror, and dropped the sheets covering her pregnant form. Turning her body to see her very pregnant profile, she put one hand into the small arch in her back and used the other to explore the quickly growing curves of her maternal form.

"Oh Jessica. Look at you" She said, exploring her curve with a sense of bemusement. "Oh boy... Or are you a girl?" She looked down at her midsection, talking to it.

She had some time while Jack showered, and so she grabbed her camera and began to take pictures of her pregnant form.
Sometime later, Jack entered, dressed in his clothes from last night, while Jessica sat dressed in a blue bath-robe, which was tight around the middle, looking at her digital camera with a smile on her face.

"What's up?" Jack asked.
"Nothing" Jessica said, hiding the camera.
"Well thanks for letting me use your shower. I better go before I end up being late for being early" Jack said with a dopey smile.
"Yeah." Jessica said, another awkward pause falling between them.
"Well last night was uh. Nice. Thanks for uh" Jack said, not quite sure how to finish this conversation.
"Yeah uh" Jessica said, putting her hands into her back, making her belly jut out some more.
"Well, talk to you later" Jack said, heading for the front door.
"Wait, where are you going?" Jessica asked.
"I'm leaving" Jack said.
"Not out the front door! Use the window!" Jessica said.
"The window?" Jack asked.
"My parents are still out there, and if they see you leave and me.. like this, they're going to start asking questions the two of us don't have answers for" Jessica said.
"That makes some sense" Jack said, heading for the window.

He opened it softly and put one leg through it, looking back at Jessica.
"Oh wait the book!" Jack said, remembering. "How am I going to work on it while I'm stuck at work all day"
"Don't worry about it. I'll handle it" Jessica said, looking over at the book.
"You will?" Jack asked.
"Yeah, I have a shift today at BooksBooksBooks, and it's probably going to be pretty quite today, so I can spend some time translating it with the other books at the book store" Jessica said.
Jack looked over to Jessica's BooksBooksBooks uniform.. There was no way people weren't going to know she was pregnant when she wore that thing.
"Are you sure about going out in that today? I mean, your going to be hanging out all over" Jack said politely.
"Yeah well I gotta work. I'm trying to save some money to finish up school when I can go back" Jessica said.
"Okay" Jack said, his leg still hanging out the window.

"Let me know how it goes." Jack says, getting ready to leave.
"Hey one more thing" Jessica asks.
"Yeah?" Jack answers.
"Just in case we can't find some way to.. stop all of this" Jessica says, point to her belly "Do you want to go with me to the mall later tonight to go shopping?" She asks.
"Shopping? What?" Jack says confused again.

"I'm going to need things for myself and the baby if you can't reverse this" Jessica says
"Jessica, I'll find some way to stop all of this. I promise you" Jack said sternly.
"Don't make a promise your bank account can't keep. Baby stuff is expensive" Jessica said with a flirty smile.

She walked over and gave Jack a kiss on the head, which caused him to fall out the window in shock.
"Are you okay?" Jessica calls out to Jack.
"Yeah, I'm fine. A little pain. But I'm fine" He answers back.

Jessica closes her window with a soft laugh, patting her belly after she's done. She looks over to her BooksBooksBooks uniform and lets out a sigh.
"Well kid. I think it's time we finally told some people about you"
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The Morning After: Awkward Love.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Shimming down the side of Jessica's house and down into his car, Jack drove off to work, the car riding a little joltily as he felt his hands shake. He couldn't believe it: he had really had sex with Jessica. Something he'd only dreamed of since high school. And somehow, it was even better than he could remember. As he drove on, he faded back into his memory, remembering the heavy-eyelids and moist smile of Jessica as they felt each other's touch and he caressed her big, round belly.

She's too big for it just to be one baby, Jack thought. I'll bet its at least twins. Maybe it's more and she'll get as bigger with each day and I'll wrap my hands around those fertile curves-

Something snapped in Jack's head and he saw the red light ahead of him. Pumping the brake, he felt the whole car shake and heave forward as he stopped suddenly, looking around to see how far out into the intersection he'd gone. Jack started sweating nervously, realizing he'd been daydreaming and it could have gotten him into a car accident. More than that, he hadn't just been daydreaming about sex, he was daydreaming about pregnancy.

Jack flipped on the radio and waited for the light to switch back to green.

"W-well gang," Sandwich said over the air, "like we promised, all three of your morning hosts are going to take an on-air pregnancy test. B-but, before we start, our own station fox Lisa Smith has an...announcement she'd like to make.

"Yeah," Lisa said in an obviously nervous tone. "Well, I'd kept this pretty secret from everyone, but...I'm pregnant."

"I'll say," Oven could barely be heard saying over the air.

"You certainly kept it a secret from us," Sandwich said. "How, um, how far along are you? You look like you're pretty well...cooked."

"I-I'm not sure exactly how far along I am, but the reason I'm as...big as I am is, according to the doctors, I'm carrying triplets."

Oven burst out laughing. "Wow Liz, you're sure going to have your hands full. I never pictured you as a mother."

"You're telling me," Lisa said quietly. "Well, we might as well make it on-air official, huh?"

"I guess so," Sandwich said. "We each drank a ton of water and just peed into a few cups and we've got our pregnancy tests ready to dip in. Ms. Smith?"

A small *bloop* sound of the test being dipped into the urine cup. "Positive," Lisa said, her voice stilly shaky. "I-I told you."

"I guess you're not messing with us," Sandwich said. "Alright, now before I go, some of our Twitter followers told us that if a guy gets a positive pregnancy test, it's a possible sign of testicular cancer, so let's see how everything is down there." Another *bloop*. "Clean bill of health for Sandwich," he said with a laugh.

"Well I guess only one of us is going to be changing diapers, pal," Oven said with a laugh as he dipped his test. "And it's..."

"Uh, let's go to commercial," Sandwich said, the station's promo playing as Jack pulled into work.

In the back, sure enough, Amber was standing by a rack of electronics, one hand stroking her bare belly as the other hand looked at items, then put them back and scribbled on a clipboard.

"Good to see you here, Strong Hands," she grinned, turning around. From the side, the full curve of her belly was accentuated. Jack's mind drifted back to his daydream and he tensed up. Amber had always been an incredibly attractive woman and he'd be lying if she'd never snuck into his fantasies and dreams before, but over the course of her sudden pregnancy, something else about her was picking away at his subconscious. And now, seeing her before him, he was consumed with an incredible lust for you. Every tease she ever through him hit him at once and made him want to explode.

"G-glad to be here," Jack said, his face starting to blush. He knew today of all days, he couldn't handle her flirting and jokes. "What needs moving?"

"Ooh, you're eager to start, aren't you?" she said, picking up the clipboard and giving a few looks over.

"I just...it helps me keep my mind off of things."

"Jack, always so mysterious," Amber said in a mocking tone. "Alright, there's lots of new shipment boxes that came in over there," she said, pointing to a small mountain of cardboard. "Use the codes on the top to sort them, okay? Be good and I might give you a little reward."

Amber laughed through closed lips and drifted to the front of the store. Jack sighed and slipped on a pair of gloves and got to work. "At least she's gone," he muttered to himself, not knowing Amber heard him just next to the doorway.


At BooksBooksBooks, Jessica was moving from shelf to shelf, stacking books and hiding so she could try to pull her shirt over her massive belly.

"Oh, I don't want to show you off this much," she whined. With another quick step, she felt herself bump into something big and firm, knocking her a few steps back.

"I'm so sorry! I didn't see you th...Jessica?"

Jessica looked up to see that she had run into a giant mass of belly. "Mrs. Dale?"

Amanda Dale was standing in front of Jessica, one hand rubbing her enormous belly where Jessica had bumped into her. "It's good to see you," she said, eyeing Jessica's own belly. "H-how are...doing?"

"I'm fine," Jessica said, seeing Jack's mother's line of sight pointed right at her own pregnant belly. "Oh, yeah, right. No, it's alright." You should talk, Jessica said, her eyes hungrily gazing at Amanda Dale's own pregnant belly. Jack, you really undersold your mother's belly. It's...amazing.

"I'm sorry, that was rude of me," Amanda said, a tiny smile breaking across her lips. "You've been seeing a lot of Jack lately?"

"Yeah," Jessica said with a pleasant smile, her mind drifting off. "I mean, he's been helping me out with...things. He stayed with me last night to help out. It's not always easy, you know?" Jessica was a pretty masterful liar and figured she needed to cover Jack's tracks, especially after she'd kept him out all night.

"That's good, I figured he was just out a friend's house," Amanda said with a smile, rubbing the other side of her belly where she felt a few of her young moving around. "But I'm not too surprised he's helping you out. Ever since he was little, he had such a fascination with pregnant women, "Amanda giggled.

"Really?" Jessica said with a raised eyebrow. Interesting...

"Oh yeah, but, well, I don't want to get into too much detail, but it got him into a little bit of trouble. I think he's tried to block some of it out," Amanda said with a sigh. "I think that's why he's not talking to me too much about how he's going to be a big brother pretty soon," she said, patting her big belly. It was the size of an overly ripe watermelon. Luckily, the maternity clothes she and Faye picked out covered all of her smooth skin, but it was still pretty tight and her popped out belly button was visible through the fabric, as were her ample breasts.

"Huh," Jessica thought, still gazing and admiring at Amanda's maternal body. Then, Jessica felt something odd and clutched her belly. "Wha?"

"Jessica, what's wrong?" Amanda said, waddling over to feel Jessica's belly, her own pregnant tummy pressing against her.

"I dunno, I just feel...something," Jessica said.

Amanda beamed as she rubbed Jessica's belly. "Oh, Jessica, you don't know what that is? That's your baby kicking!"

Jessica looked at her in disbelief, before looking down at her own belly, rolling up her shirt some. "Really?" she said quietly, before adding. "...I had no idea it would like this much."

Amanda moved her hands some more, before giggled. "Sweetie, I think that's because there's more than one."

Jessica's eyes practically popped out of her head. "M-more than..."

Amanda nodded. "That's what it feels like to me. Maybe it's time for another ultrasound."

"Maybe," Jessica whispered. "Well, it was really nice to meet you again, Mrs. Dale, but I should probably finish stacking these books."

"Of course, of course," Amanda said, giving Jessica a clumsy hug that mostly consisted of her belly and breasts smushing against Jessica. "Well, congratulations. We'll have to talk again soon."

"Yeah, we should," Jessica said, the sight of Jack's mom's big belly dancing through her mind. As soon as Amanda left, Jessica hurried back to stacking books as another employee walked up to her.

"Jess, you're, um, untucked," Mariah, a tan, tall girl with super short, wavy bleach blond hair, said. She was Jessica's best and only friend at work and one of the smartest people she knew. She was given a weak explanation of Jessica's sudden...motherhood and figured that she shouldn't ask any questions.

Jessica pulled her shirt over her belly again. "Thanks."

"And, I looked through that book, like you said. Weird stuff," Mariah said, turning Jessica to face her. "But I think I found something you might be looking for."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack heads to work, listens to the radio about ...

choices: Back to the present: Faye takes the book, Jessica eats lunch, jack is working..
This isn't really choice but fine.. Something else.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Really?" Jessica asked, resting her hands on her belly.
"It's not much, but I found this" Mariah said, as she turned the book towards Jessica, pointing her finger at a passage.

The text she was trying to read was old, faded, and written in some kind of handwriting that made it nearly to impossible to see, let alone translate, if that's what Mariah did.

"I can't even see that, let alone - - - " Jessica started to say, when Mariah let out a sigh and read it off to her.

"It says - - -" Mariah said, clearing his voice to read the passage to Jessica.

It's greatest strength is also it's greatest weakness. I understand that know. It's not indestructible, at least not to me. The voice, it speaks to me, louder and clearer now, it's calling me... I try to fight it, yet it always win. It's trying to keep me away from something, and now I think I know what - - Itself. It's greatest strength is it's greatest weakness, only then can it be undone. But time is short, the children grow quickly in both my wife and my mother. Soon they shall be here.

"What does that mean?" Jessica asks, rubbing her belly where she just felt a very powerful kick.
"Don't ask me, I'm not the author." Mariah says, flipping through the pages of the very large tomb. "Where did you say you got this again?" She asks, raising an eyebrow towards Jessica.

"Uh - - - a friend" Jessica asks, telling a half-truth.
"Well, wherever he got it from, tell him that author of this thing is one freaky mamba-jamba" Mariah says, examining the pages.
"I mean, this is some Paranormal Activity or Blair Witch style shit in book form. Hell, I'm almost convinced that this "Magic Coin" almost exists. I mean, look at this entry from someone who talks about their brother's pregnancy. I mean, photos and everything, it's almost like it was real!" Mariah said with chuckle looking over the book.

"Yes. Almost real" Jessica said to herself, slowly wrapping her hands around her expanded midsection, a decent amount of firm, belly flesh hanging out from the hemline of her shirt.

"Well, I'll look over more of it later. I mean, it seems like an interesting book, and the fact that's it written in so many languages, make it seem that much more real. But, if you want my opinion, I think the author needs to include a page of translations or something, because no-one will be able follow this difficult storyline without them" Mariah said, closing the book.

"I'll tell him that" Jessica said, her hands still wrapped around her belly. "You must be starving Jessica, why don't you take a long lunch or something? Get that kid something to eat" Mariah said with a smile.
"Are you sure about that?" Jessica asked.
"Yeah, go on. Go eat something." Mariah said.

"Okay, you want anything?" Jessica asked, getting her purse from behind the counter.
"Nah. I'm good. I'm not the pregnant one" Mariah said, teasing her expectant friend.
Jessica responded with something equally catty, before waddling off to find her, and her unborn children something to eat.

As Mariah watched her pregnant leave, her smile turned into a frown.
"Jessica, how did managed to hide your pregnancy for so long? You weren't that big a few days ago. Why didn't you tell me earlier? You have my support" Mariah said, as she turned back to her work.

A few minutes later, BING-BONG, filled BooksBooksBooks as Mariah turned towards the customer who just walked in.
"How can I help you ma'am? Looking for books on pregnancy and child-raising? Because it certainly looks like you're going to need some if you don't mind me saying so" Mariah said, with a pleasant smile.

A tense pause filled the air.
"Yeah, I'm looking for book similar to that. A friend of mine brought it in" the 40-year old pregnant woman said, a devious smile on her face, a blank stare in her eyes, and a gleaming coin, in her hands, just ready to continue it's work.

- - - - Sometime Earlier - - - -

Faye stood in her bra-and-underwear, admiring her expectant curves in the mirror, rubbing oils and creams all over her body. She had a smile on her face as she explored every curve of her body, taking it all in. Finally, after years of trying to get pregnant, to finally have the baby she knew she deserved, she was blessed four times over.

She was a good person, and finally something happened to a good person. She was kind, loving, helping others before herself, and yet it seemed like she would never have a little version of herself to hold in her arms, to tell her that it loved her, to take care of her when she got older. But now she would have four, and she was beyond happy.

She could barely believe just how pregnant she actually was as she delicately slide her hand over pregnant belly, admiring at how huge it was, and how far it stuck out in front of her.

She was happy, and nothing could ever take that away from her.

Don't be so sure the voice called to her in her head. She looked around confused, and when she looked back into the mirror, she wasn't pregnant. She was flat as a board, her unborn children missing, and she was looking older than she ever thought possible.
The boy. The boy is close. The girl. She is with him. I can feel them through her. They have something Faye. Something that will take it all away from you. Keep the boy and the girl away from it. The bookstore. It's at the bookstore. Get it. Hide it. The voice was not longer soothing or alien.

It was down right terrifying. Something dark, otherworldly, and hungry sounding. But it's words pierced her head, making her mind go almost completely blank. But it was right, Jack and his girlfriend had to be stopped. They were going to take her family away from her. She couldn't allow it.

Snapping back to reality, she had the sudden desire to go to the bookstore. Humming to herself absentmindedly, she got dressed into her sexy maternity clothes, and headed out to her kitchen, where her husband was sitting to himself, a very serious look on his face.

"Hello Charles. How is daddy doing today?" Faye said with a smile, wrapping her arms around her sitting husband, her massive belly pressing into his back. "Faye we need to talk" Charles said sternly, taking his wife's arm off of him.
Faye happy mood changed instantly. "What's wrong?"She said.
"I cheated on you Faye." Charles said, plainly.

Faye could have been punched in the face by a heavyweight boxer and it would have hurt less than Charles words.
"Wha - - What do you mean?" Faye asked, hurt and anger seething up from inside of her.
"Right before you got pregnant. I cheated on you with a girl at a shop. I think her name was April or Amber or something." Charles said plainly.
"Wh-wh-wh-wh-" Faye said, fighting back tears.
"Why? Because it wasn't working between us for a long time Faye. We've been trying for some many years, and for so many years we were denied. I just - - - I just couldn't take it anymore. I was getting older, you were getting older, it was- - it was starting to show. So late one night I went out for a few drinks, and there she was. She just got off work, she was in this sexy little uniform. I bought her a few drinks, we had some laughs, and we - - - " Charles said, the shame piling on top of him.
"You son of a - - - " Faye nearly shouted at the top of her lungs.
"There's more" Charles said, closing his eyes.
Faye stood quiet and angry and very pregnant.

"She's pregnant. Almost ready to pop. And she tracked me down one day at lunch. I don't know how. Probably those damn social networking sites. But she gave me this" Charles said, handing a note over to Faye.
Faye read it to herself, fighting back tears, mouthing along the words.
"She wants to what?!" Faye said.
"She wants to move in with us. She's willing to forgo suing me for child support if she can move in with us, raise our children together" Charles said, slamming his head against the table.
"How did she I find out I was pregnant?" Faye asked.
"Those damn social networking sites I guess. If we say no, she'll drag us to court after the babies - - "
"BABIES?" Faye shouted.
"Yes, she's pregnant with twins" Charles said to himself. "She'll drag us to court after the babies are born and sue me for child-support. Faye.. We can't afford that." Charles said.
"So you're going to allow this? Some strange woman - - your little.. whore move in with us!" Faye shouted at the top of her lungs.
"If she takes us to court, she'll win, and with the lawyer fees and child-support fees, not to mention the babies.. We'll be bankrupt Faye. But, if we let her move in.. We can pool all our money. Take care of all these children properly..." Charles said, rubbing his head.

Somewhere, heard only to Faye, the coin laughed as it feasted on the spreading chaos it was deftly spreading with it's magics. It had the power to rewrite reality, and it did it's job well, at least to those whose reality had been re-written. Yet, as it feasted, it hungered for more.
Faye felt like the bottom of the world has been dropped out beneath her. Some strange woman, some.. skank, who slept with her husband was out-there, carrying the half-brothers or half-sisters of her children, and now she dared to try to force her way and her bastard children into their perfect little lives. She wanted to strangle her husband, after all, it was his fault, but she would deal with later.

She needed to get that book. It was knowing thought at the back of her head, driving her even more crazy than this situation allowed. Without thinking, she reached into the pocket and pulled out the coin.
"Faye, what are you doing?"
"Heads, we take our chances. Tails, we let her move in." Faye said, as she flipped the coin, and stared straight at her husband.

A few moments later, she caught in her hand, looking at her husband, opening her hand to reveal... Tails.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: A Clue, A Problem, AND WHAT A TWIST!

choices: Follow one of the other million plot strings
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Faye smiled sweetly as Mariah looked between her and the massive tome behind the counter of the service desk.

"Another book like this? I'm not sure I've ever seen any others. I'm not even sure if this is published," Mariah said. As she talked, she tried to peer over the desk's edge to see just how big Faye's belly was. She'd better buy some baby books quick, because she looks like she's about a month overdue, Mariah thought.

"Yes, well, like I said, a friend of mine brought it in for me," Faye repeated, sloping her hand across her roundness as one of her quads gave her a particularly sharp kick.

Mariah tried to put the pieces together. "A friend from a lamaze class? Another pregnant girl?"

Faye's eyes lit up. This girl was believing her lie. "Yes, that's the one." So, Jack's girlfriend got knocked up too. Didn't think the kid had it in him. "So, if I could just-" Faye reached over the desk for the book but Mariah slowly placed her hand over its cover.

"I dunno, Jess never said she wanted me to look it over. She's on lunch now, but she should be back pretty soon. Is it okay if you just wait until she gets back?"

Faye was certainly not okay with it. She had the hormones of four pregnancies raging inside her and she just found out that her husband was having an affair and his mistress was moving in with them. She was in no position to be turned away from what she wanted. But, instead she just smiled and beamed her motherly glow.

"No problem at all! Thank you very much for your time," she said, turning and waddling away. Mariah continued to watch her, both with caution and with curiosity. Faye walked between some shelves and watched Mariah from her hidden spot. Then, she flipped the Coin in her hands as it landed on Tails.

Suddenly, Mariah's belly swelled out to huge proportions, making any onlooker assume she was just about near the end of her pregnancy. Mariah looked down at her belly, feeling her now-exposed skin with a cautious hand, a terrified look on her face. She walked as quickly as she could to the back of the store, trying to hold her belly for support. Faye preened as she walked casually over to the desk and picked up the book herself.

As Faye left the store, she saw a familiar face and a familiar belly: Amanda Dale. "Hi Faye," Amanda said happily as Faye slipped the book into her purse.

"Hi Amanda," Faye said, struggling to give the equally pregnant woman a hug. "How have you been?"

"Oh, alright, I suppose," Amanda said, resting one hand on her huge belly. "When I was pregnant with Jack, there wasn't much in the way of baby books, so I figured I would try to find something here. There must be at least one book on how to raise multiple babies at once, right?" Amanda laughed softly. "How about you?"

"Well, I've got just about every baby book you can name," Faye chuckled, "but I like coming down here. The quiet sounds of the bookstore put the little ones at ease." Faye rubbed both hands across her belly for emphasis. "Say, when Jack gets back home, would you mind sending him over to my house? I need some help with some chores. Charles is...unavailable and I'm, well..." Faye lightly bumped her belly against Amanda's. "You understand."

---Jack---

Back at work, Jack was just finishing up stacking the rest of the boxes. The front of the shop wasn't too busy but he couldn't seem to find Amber anywhere. Looking around the place, Jack heard some noise coming from the supply closet in the back.

"Amber?" Jack asked, opening the door. Inside, he found Amber sitting on the floor, hands around her belly, tears streaming down her face. "H-hey, are you okay?"

"Oh, what do you care?" Amber choked, wiping her nose with a handkerchief.

Jack sat down next to his manager, keeping the door closed behind them. "I care plenty. What's wrong?"

Amber lazily lifted her hand to show that she was holding her cell phone. "I got what I wanted. The guy who knocked me up is letting me move in with him and his equally pregnant wife."

Jack got nervous. This was a lot more drama that he was anticipating. "O-oh, well, if that's what you wanted-"

"But I don't want that, Jack! I never wanted my life to turn out like this. I mean, sure, it seemed like the best way out when I asked him to move in, but it's still a shitty situation. And now that it's actually staring me in the face, I just..." Amber started crying against, clutching her belly more tightly. Jack cautiously wrapped one arm around her shoulder. "Sorry. Hormones, I guess," Amber sniffed.

"It's okay, you have a right to be upset. It would be scary for anyone," Jack said, Ms. Smart's word ringing in his head. Feeding on the chaos.

"Thanks, Strong Hands," Amber managed to joke, resting her head on his shoulder. "There is one other solution, though. There's a pregnant bikini contest and there's a pretty nice cash prize involved. If I win that, I might have a chance to keep my head above water."

"Well, I think you have a good shot at winning," Jack said, his body shaking nervously. "Y-you're really pretty."

"Yeah?" Amber said, lifting her head, looking into Jack's eyes. "Even pregnant?"

Jack gulped. "E-especially pregnant." Amber's eyelids were heavy and she brought her face closer to Jack's.

---Jessica---

Jessica was sitting at the mall, by herself, eating a caesar wrap with an enormous pregnant belly in her lap. All in all, a pretty depressing sight. She looked around the maternity clothing store a bit before she went to eat, but she didn't buy anything. For one, she didn't have the time on her lunch break, but she was also anxious to try things on...with Jack.

"Okay, I understand ma'am. Thank you for your time!" An overly cheerful voice said behind Jessica. A chubby guy walked up next to her table, holding a clipboard. "Christ, you don't have to be such an asshole about it," the voice's owner grunted. He turned to see Jessica and gave a little smile. "Sorry about that."

"It's okay," Jessica smiled. "I used to have to do survey work at my school, so I know how rude people can be. Want to take a load off?"

"Sure," the man said, sitting down in the oversized mall bench next to Jessica. "I'm Oven from-"

"Oh, Sandwich and Oven. Yeah, I've heard you before. My friend listens to your station a lot," Jessica said. Oven's smile relaxed.

"Great, we love the support," he said. "I'm actually signing people up for our big pregnant bikini contest this week. After all of the pregnant people who showed up here a few days ago, I figured I get a lot more people to sign up, but...no luck, I suppose." As he turned from his clipboard to Jessica, he noticed her baby bump. "Say...you're probably a bit smaller than our other contests, belly-wise, but would you think about signing up? The crowds at these sorts of things usually like someone who's less pregnant anyway."

Jessica was hesitant. "Um, I dunno. What would I have to do?"

A crafty smile went across Oven's face. He'd been working in marketing for his station before he became an on-air personality. Time to work his magic.

"Oh, not much. Wear a bikini, parade around with other pregnant women, maybe dance a little. And you've got a good shot to win the cash prizes."

Jessica's ears perked up. "Cash prize?"

"Nine grand," he said. Jessica's hand moved to her belly. If she and Jack didn't figure things out with this coin, she would definitely need the money to support her baby...or babies.

"Sure, this sounds like fun," Jessica said, signing the clipboard enthusiastically. Oven grinned and he decided to push his luck.

"And actually, one of the women we had planned as one of the helpers in the event is changing her mind and is entering the event herself," Oven said, not adding that Liza had looked perfectly barren the day before and now was ready to birth a litter any second. "So, do you know anyone who might want to go in her place?"

Jessica was about to say no, but then a funny idea crossed her mind. "Sure, I can think of someone," she said, signing Jack's name and e-mail onto the list.

"Great!" Oven said, happy with his day's spoils. "See you again in a few days!"

As Oven thanked her and walked away, two heavily pregnant women were watching Jessica.

"So she's the one?" Ms. Quick asked, caressing her massive belly as it strained her non-maternity dress.

"Yep. We need to talk to her too," Ms. Apple said, her breasts and belly straining the buttons on her white, collared shirt. "And then we need to track down whatever idiot has another version of the coin and is flipping it around at random."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Back to the present: Faye takes the book, Jessi...

choices: Ian's awesome lunch adventure, hot goth girl bands, coin flipping, and more!
Can we just go back to the present now?
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
- - - - - Earlier That Day - - - - -- - -

The Offices of Titan International Bank.

Ian sat at his desk, looking out the window, chewing on the cap of his pen, absentmindedly flipping the coin, thinking to himself, not aware of the Massive consequences that would follow each flip, the changed lives and expanded (or soon-to-be expanded) waistlines of each man and woman he looked at.

You see, Ian was a very special kind of idiot. If one had to classify on a scale over one to ten, the amount of idiocy that came from Ian, well, good person, it would be over 9000. (Author's note: I'm sorry, but not really).

Ian didn't real manage a coffee shop, that was just a convenient lie he told to his best friend Jack, because well, Ian was embarrassed. Ian felt like he sold out, given into the man, hung up the idea of changing the world for a safe and well paying 9-to-5. Ian always wanted to do something that would change the world, and little did Ian actually know, as he sat there, watching men and women go by, flipping the coin, chewing on his pen, that he REALLY was changing the world.

As Ian watched a beautiful woman, (easily a solid 9 in Ian's book) drag along her boyfriend (some douchebag who dressed like a douchebag, or at least that's what he was to Ian. Any guy who has a seriously hot girlfriend that Ian wanted, was a douchebag in Ian's book) along the street, he flipped the coin, it landing "Heads" side up as he chewed on his pen, his attention was turned away from the window (where he would might have seen the consequences of his actions, and might have stopped everything before it spiral further out of control) by the barking voice of his boss, Ryan.

"IAN!" He shouted at the top of his lungs, causing Ian to spin his chair around and face his boss. "Ah, hey boss. What's going on?" Ian said, putting the coin on the desk, and trying his best (and failing) to make it look like he was busy.
"Where are those reports I asked for?" Ryan asked, veins popping out the side of his neck. Ryan Martin was your average 40ish something manager. His hair was salt-and-peppered as the pigment in his hair went, he had a goatee, and was slightly paunchy as, well he tried to work out as often as he good, in the last desperate throws to save what was left of his good looks.

"Uh, reports?" Ian said, trying to think of a lie fast.
"Didn't you get my several emails I sent you?" Ryan said, the vein in the his neck almost trying to escape his fleshy prison.
"No man, I've been.. uh.. busy" Ian said, shuffling papers on his desk, completly distracted as the very pretty woman that he just spied moments earlier came waddling behind the window, one hand in the small of her back, the other gripping the hand of her equally pregnant boyfriend, the other hand resting on his expectant midsection.

"Well make yourself un-busy!" Ryan shouted at Ian, his attention not focused on the pregnant man and his pregnant girlfriend who just waddled by the window. "We're swamped today, and this place is a damn ghost-town today! Greg's still out with his broken leg, both Tara and Amanda are out on maternity leave - - -" Ryan said, listing off everything that seemed to be going wrong all at once.

"We have an Amanda who works here? How come I've never met her?" Ian asked, looking at his boss. "And Rick's dealing with some "emergency" family situation... He said something about a wife, or a sister, or an aunt or someone suddenly becoming pregnant or something. I don't know, sounds like a bunch of crap, but legally I can't argue against "personal emergency" days ever since we got sued three years ago." Ryan says, not even batting an eye at Ian's question.

"So we're down FOUR people, and today I just found out that we're taking part in some local contest that some rock station is putting on." Ryan said, rubbing his temples. "Contest? What contest?" Ian asked. "Something about a bikini contest or something. I don't know just - - - " Ryan said before being cut off by Ian.

"Sir, I'd like to help out in anyway I can to make sure that this bikini contest that we're sponsoring goes off without a hitch. Matter of fact sir, I'd like to volunteer my services to - - -" Ian said with a smile, not aware of what was really about to go on.
"Well, I'm glad you're taking initiative, for a change, but that won't be necessary, as you're already doing it" Ryan said.
"Oh - - " Ian said, trying to mask his excitement. All those beautiful fly honeys in those sexy bikinis.. ah man. I've hit the jackpot! Ian thought to himself, imaging himself being drowned by eye-candy.

"If you checked my email, you'll see all the reports I need done by the contest in a few days. Nothing to complex, just something you can show to the people outside the contest to get them to sign up with our bank. Also, see if you can get the contestants as well, really sell to these ladies the importance of saving for their future of their children" Ryan said.

"Uh---- okay" Ian said, mildly confused. Anyone else would have remembered the "special" bikini contest being held by 101.9 THE EDGE, and would have put Ryan's comments together, but alas, Ian was a special kind of idiot.

"Good, have something for me by the end of tomorrow. This is basic level work Ian, any idiot can do it, SO DON'T LET ME DOWN AND PROVE TO ME YOU AREN'T WHAT I THINK YOU ARE" Ryan said, pointing his finger at him.

"Yeah, yeah" Ian said, picking up his coin as his boss left. Man, I really, really hate that guy. He's such a jerk, always insulting me and shit. I should report him or something. I'm sick of this.

"Hmm. Heads I let it go, Tails I tell that sonofabitch of" Ian thought to himself, flipping the coin, watching his boss as he left. The coin landed in his hands, "Heads" side up as he watched his boss walk away. "You got lucky this time" Ian said to himself, taking his eyes of his boss and firing up his work computer.

Ian worked to himself for a few minutes, planning out the reports and whatnot he would need for this bikini contest they were sending him too, as Ryan went from desk to desk, cubicle to cubicle checking up on his underlings.

Ian half-listend into a conversation between Ryan and an older co-worker Yolanda as he typed away.
"Why, boss. How are we feeling today?" Yolanda said in such a sugary sweet tone that it could rot your teeth.
"Just waiting for all of this to be over." Ryan said, exhaustion present in his voice.

Ian continued to tap away on the keys, slowly killing the time to lunch and killing more time till he can go home. Maybe all of this was a mistake. I should have just gone back to the Coffee Shop and continued trying to sell my screenplay Ian thought to himself.
"How's the wife taking it?" Yolanda asked.
"Going baby crazy. Already painted the room twice, said she wanted something gender neutral. I honestly never thought we would ever have kids let alone " Ryan said before being interrupted by Yolanda.
"That' you'd be doing most of the work?" Yolanda said, a laughter at the tip of her tongue.
"Yeah. My back is killing me, my feet are swollen, my chest is killing me. Honestly, I can't believe women go through all the time." Ryan said.
"Well, men in your.. condition are slowly becoming more common. God knows what's causing it, but you heard the news report from the mall the other day, and all the interviews from other men who became..... well look at you" Yolanda said.

It wasn't a bad screenplay Ian thought. It just needed some refinement.. But refinement didn't pay the bills, and ever since his roommate moved out (okay, fine dumped him) he needed something more.. stable. He never really had much interests in banks, but somehow he applied and was hired. It took care of everything he needed, but still, he felt like some part of him died whenever he clocked in here.

Although maybe, this bikini contest might just inspire him to do better in this husk of a corporate job. At least, Ian hoped.
"At least I've Tara to help me through the.. changes I've been going through" Ryan said.
"And not to mention Amanda. Did you see her the other day? Big as a house! At her age!" Yolanda said.
"I saw her, but didn't get a chance to talk to her. I was busy with other things" Ryan answered.
"What did the doctor say?" Yolanda asked.
"Healthy, but I need to keep my stress and anger down. It's not good for me" Ryan answered.
"The BOTH of you" Yolanda corrected.
"How could I forget? So, Tara's gone, Amanda's been placed on maternity leave, I'm going on my leave soon.." Ryan said.
"It's like it's spreading around the office!" Yolanda said with a laugh.
"How knows Yolanda, you might catch it next" Ryan joked.
"At my age?" Yolanda asked.
"Stranger things have happened. I mean, look at me.

A few minutes later, his work somewhere between somewhat started and somewhat finished, Ian got up from his chair, grabbed his coin, and walked out of Titan Bank, on his way to his lunch hour, punching out in the process.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: A fool and his Coin are soon.. causing trouble.

choices: NOW:  Jessica finds Mariah, book gone, Amanda practices her "dance", Jack works
Meh, what else is on? (Switch to another character in story)
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
It was a beautiful day. The sun was shining, it was not to hot, the birds were singing. Ian, bobbing his head along to the music blaring from the headphones from his MP3 player, strutted down the street, a sub sandwich in one hand, an ice cold refreshing bottle of water in the other.

Jack strutted down the boulevard, taking in the sights of the downtown city walk. Stores, tourist attractions, everything anybody could ever want was on this long stretch of street, and Jack was (in his mind) the king of it all right now.

Finishing his sandwich and downing the water, he threw away the trash, and started his next favorite activity aside from eating, sleeping, gaming, drinking and.... lady "relations" having.... people watching.

As he walked past the street artists, shops, kiosks, fountains, he reached into his pocket, fishing out his coin.

"I love Jack like a brother, but man, I think he's honestly losing it" Ian said. "I mean, he made this big deal about you, and so far, you done exactly squat. Hmm. Look at me, talking to you like you're going to answer me. Maybe I'm going to be the crazy one?" Ian asked the coin, not expecting a response.

I like you an alien voice buzzed through Ian's head.

"I like myself too" Ian said to himself.

Ian was a special kind of idiot.

Loud angry rock filled the air, catching Ian's attention. Following the sweet gothic rock sound, he was lead to a very special discovery: The Lady Machine. The Lady Machine as it was, was an all gothic rock band made up of four girls who at this very moment, was preforming to a very small and very unamused crowd in the middle of the plaza. The women, dressed in all black, with face piercings, dyed hair with bright neon tips, white face makeup, ripped up t-shirts, combat boots, were rocking it.

Ian drank them in, each one of their womanly features being absorbed into his mind's eye. He was in love with every girl in the band.

This is the end! No more no less! The lead singer screamed out, carrying out the spirit of goth rock onto the quickly vanishing crowd, obviously not impressed with what they were hearing. THE LADY MACHINE, CD'S 5 DOLLARS.

Ian stood there for the longest time, falling in and out of love with each member of the band, before realizing that he was going to be late back to work. Man, if he was late again from lunch... He had no idea what his boss would do to him.

Reaching into his pocket, he pulled out a few bucks and some change and tossed into the little box set up in front of the band. As he chucked the last of the money in the bin, he didn't notice a scratched silver coin end up into the box, "Heads" side up.

Turning around from the the goth rock band, he suddenly was face to face with an almost smothering crowd.

Where did they come from? There was hardly anyone here a second ago Ian thought to himself as he tried to push his way through the crowd.

"Excuse me.. Sorry. Sorry. Excuse me" Ian said, breaking through the crowd. As he went through the crowd, he noticed a few of the people there had T-Shirts with the name "Mommy Kills Best" written on it.

Hmm. Must be some kind of new brand of clothing or something Ian thought to himself as he continued to push through the crowd.
After what seemed like minutes, Ian finally made it out through the gathered mass of people, and started making his way back to the office.
"Man, what a massive group of people. I can't even see that band anymore. What was there name again? Lady Machines or something?" Ian said, trying to look back at the band, but seeing nothing but a sea of onlookers.

"Whatever. I'll search for it later or something. They were pretty good, and damn fine looking" Ian said to himself, walking back to the office.
Back on stage, The Lady Machines were no more. Oh, it wasn't because like all great bands they broke up, it was because you see, The Lady Machines never existed.

Rocking out on stage right now was the viral internet sensation "Mommy Kills Best", made up of entirely the same girls who were once The Lady Machines, but were now all rocking out on stage in skimpy outfits, and very, very, pregnant. The sign next to them, no longer a crappy sign written on cardboard, was an official sign advertising "Mommy Kills Best" headlining 101.9 The Edge's Pregnant Bikini Contest.

Look at what you made!
Look at what you gave me!
Look at how I killed you!
Born to die!
Born to die!

The very expectant main singer, followed by her very pregnant drummer, her very pregnant bassist and her very pregnant guitarist, joined their signer for the chorus of their hit song "Born To Die" from their upcoming hit album "And The Cradle Will Fall".

Dressed in a pair of black lingerie, a dog collar, and several piercings on her face, stomach, and nose, the lead signer continued to belt the closing refrain of the song, while the crowd breathed in their performance.

"F--- you very much everyone! We're "Mommy Kills Best", the world's only pregnant goth metal band, buy our cds, buy our t-shirts, buy our new maternity wear, just buy our stuff, we're going to have kids to feed, and continue to rock the f--- on. Don't miss us tomorrow on the news, and be sure to see us live at the pregnant bikini contest coming up from 101.9 The Edge! Good afternoon! Our backs are killing us!" The lead signer shouted into her microphone, throwing up some middle fingers, and waddling off the stage with the rest of her band, and making their way to the back as the crowd screamed for more.

- - - - Just a little bit later - - - -

Ian was almost there, almost back to work on time.
"Are you sure we have to find her?" the woman asked.
"Yes. She knows where Jack is. He's running out of time. We have to make sure that she keeps him on track"
Ian was about to pull his ID to open the employee entrance when he felt.. it in his pocket.
The coin. Crazy Jack's crazy coin.
"Didn't I give you to that awesome band The Lady Machine?" He asked the coin.
Don't worry about it the coin answered back to him.
"Meh. I'm sure I just gave them some extra change. Probably a good thing too. It would be a real dick move to just give a nothing band just a worthless coin.
"Well, what do you think? Heads I finish all the work today, or Tails I just do half the work and just screw around.

Admiring a pair of two very beautiful women who seemed to be having a very important conversation close to him, he flipped his coin, caught it, and saw that it landed on "Tails".

"Alright, half work time, half time to screw around on the internet" Ian said to himself, going through the employee entrance, the loud KA-CHUNK of the automatic door blocking out the screams from the two women across the street.

"Are we - - - -" one of them said, grabbing her newly pregnant belly.
"I think we are" the other said.
"We need to find Jack, and quick" one of them said.
"Yes. But first, I'm starving, and suddenly have to pee" the other said.

And inside, Ian blissfully worked away for a few minutes, then screwed around on the internet for another chunk of time, switching between work and screwing around for the rest of his work day.

Ian was a special kind of idiot.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Lunch time! Ian's good at lunch. (Not much else..)

choices: Hey, we haven't heard from Tara in a while. How's she?
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
---Present Day---
