Ian was scrolling through IGN forums, trying to find some fun moves to try out when he went back to playing Zombie Massacre Mania 2. It looked like the North part of the city the game took place in had some nice building layouts so he could corral hoards of zombies into an enclosed space and take them all out quickly.

Then, his e-mail pinned and Ian groaned, moving his mouse back to look at the messages. It was from Lisa Smith, one of the event's organizers from the radio station. "Blah blah blah...very interested...open to more diversity of prizes, okay," Ian mumbled to himself. He e-mailed Lisa as soon as he got back from lunch, figuring it would be at least one easy step that he could tell his boss he took. But now he had to look and find a way for the bank to get more prizes. "More phone calls..." he grumbled again, making a note of it on a sheet of paper in front of him. Then, another part of the e-mail caught Ian's eyes. "Blah blah...won't be able to help with the contestants because I'll be competing as well?...need you to take my place with the contestants?"

Ian sat up excitedly in his seat. He wasn't just organizing this dumb PR stunt for the bank - he'd get to interact with these bikinied beauties too. A happy grin crawled across Ian's face. Suddenly, he had an incentive to get as many people to this thing as possible. Ian quickly googled pictures of Lisa Smith, ogling her "pre-pregnancy" body, thinking about what she must look like in a bikini...

---At the Mall---

"Let's talk to her," Ms. Quick said, starting to move toward Jessica, who was just finishing her meal. Every step she took was interrupted by Ms. Apple's new, pregnant belly bumping against Ms. Quick's own. "Watch it, will you?"

"Sorry, I've only had this belly for about an hour. I'm not used to being pregnant like you," Ms. Apple sarcastically replied, adjusting her steps to try and waddle forward. By the feel of things, she was carrying more than one baby and every occupant of her womb was incredibly active, which didn't help the recent mom-to-be maneuver herself very quickly. In the past, the coin made Ms. Apple the sudden and unexpected child of her mother while her father was overseas in Desert Storm. He was not thrilled to find that his wife had a baby while he was deployed for well-over nine months.

Ms. Quick, on the other hand, had been a high school senior and a promising candidate for any university she wanted. Then the coin rolled into her life and interrupted that all a bit. She ended up giving her resulting twins up for adoption but she was never able to get quite back into the prestigious future she had worked for, especially after her family disowned her as soon as they found out about the pregnancy.

As the two, now pregnant again thanks to Ian's reckless coin-flipping, made their awkward way over to Jessica, they were cut off by a grinning man with a clipboard. "Hello ladies, my name is Oven from-"

"Get out of the way!" Ms. Apple panted. She could see Jessica throw her food in the trash and start to get up.

"I just wanted to tell you about the pregnant bikini contest 101.9 is throwing-"

"Yes, fine, whatever!" Ms. Quick yelled, grabbing the pen and messily signing her name on the clipboard. As they turned to try and find Jessica, Oven stopped Ms. Apple as well.

"And you? There are prizes available!"

"Oh my god!" Ms. Apple screamed, signing her name as well and shoving Oven out of the way as the pair looked for Jessica. "We don't have time for this! If you don't want to end up like one of those pregnant men on the news, leave us alone!" Ms. Apple and Ms. Quick slowly waddled off, looking for Jessica, who by this point had gotten a long head start.

"Yeah right," Oven said under his breath, looking at their names on his board. "A pregnant man. Like that'll happen."

---Jessica---

Jessica returned to Books Books Books, rubbing her belly gently as she felt the little one, or little ones, inside her stir just a bit as she digested their meal. Little moments like that made Jessica a bit happy to be pregnant, but she still hoped that Mariah had made some headway with translating the book. Being pregnant was one thing, raising babies were another.

As she looked over to the counter, she couldn't find the book anywhere. Jessica picked up papers, looked under every surface she could, but no sign of the book.

"Anyone see Mariah?" Jessica asked an employee walking by. She was pointed toward the back offices, where she quickly waddled to. "Hey Mariah?" Jessica piped up, seeing her friend's short haircut over a shelf. Then, as she got closer, she saw Mariah clutching her massive belly, looking at it with awe. "Oh...oh no."

"Jess?" Mariah said, turning to face her. "Is...is this what happened to you?"

Jessica nodded and sat next to her friend, wrapping her arm over Mariah's shoulder. "Sorta."

Mariah turned back to look at her belly, full-term with twins. "I can feel them...moving...inside me. This is real," she said, before anxiously looking back at Jessica. "I can't raise a family now!"

"Hey, hey," Jessica said, rubbing Mariah's back to comfort her. "You know that book I had you look over? It's got the answer to undo all of this, and if anyone can figure it out, it's you." Mariah smiled and looked back at Jessica with a smile, wiping a stray tear from her eye. "Now, where is it?"

Mariah shrugged. "Back at the counter, I guess. I didn't take it with me." Her eyebrow turned up in concern. "You mean it's...not there?" Jessica's face sunk as she shook her head. "I don't...wait, there was a woman here who wanted it. She was the biggest pregnant woman I've ever seen."

"Oh, did she have sort of shoulder-length brown hair?" Jessica said, trying to describe Jack's mom as best she could. If you were talking about gigantic pregnant bellies, the only person that came to mind to Jessica was Amanda Dale.

"Not really," Mariah said, starting to get worried. "But trust me: with a belly that big, she'll be hard to miss. You and I can canvas all of the maternity events that seem to be popping up around town lately." Mariah paused and thought a second. "These can't all be separate...something's going on beyond just you and me, isn't it?"

"Sorta," Jessica said with a weak grin. "I'll explain it to you as we walk...or waddle."

Jessica and Mariah went to the epicenter of the massive pregnancy outbreak - the mall - to see what kind of clues lay there. While the incident that made the news had long since past, there were plenty of pregnant women (and men with bulging middles) walking around, some happily rubbing their baby-filled tummies, other nervously feeling their swollen flesh. The first place they tried was the maternity clothing store, where they both made some headway.

"Yes, there was a woman with hair like you described, but there was another one with her," the store's owner said. "She was just as big. I told corporate they were crazy when they wanted us to stock sizes that big, but I guess it paid off in the end."

"And they were shopping together?" Jessica asked, getting another nod from the store's owner. "Then Jack's mom must at least know her," Jessica said to Mariah. "I know where we've got to go next."

"While you're here, why don't you ladies pick out some new outfits?" the owner said, motioning to Jessica and Mariah's pregnant bulges, both of which were exposed by their non-maternity shirts. "I know exposed pregnant bellies are the 'hip look' now, but we've got clothes that can accentuate that look right here in store!"

"Maybe some other time," Jessica said with an apologetic face. "But if we come back, we'll probably pick up some baby clothes too." But hopefully, Jessica thought, it won't come to that.

As the two left, Oven spotted Jessica's familiar face and walked over. "Hey, I see you brought a friend!" he said, holding out his clipboard suggestively. "So, would you like to sign up too?"

"Sorry, but did any, like, HUGELY pregnant women sign up for this?" Jessica asked, hoping he might have a lead. Oven chuckled and rolled his eyes a little.

"Quite a few, way beyond anything I'm used to." Mariah and Jessica turned to each other with a worried expression.

"If there lots of women, we'll need another set of eyes at this pregnant bikini contest to find the woman who took the book," Mariah said. "Yes, I'd like to sign up."

Oven handed her the clipboard with another big smile on his face. Four signatures in about half as many hours. "So you've heard about our contest, then?"

Mariah blushed as she filled out the form. "W-well, I just heard about it on the radio. In passing, you know." Oven and Jessica both looked at her with a curious glance as Oven took back the form.

"Well, looking forward to seeing both of you there. Good luck," he said, walking off to find someone else, stopping briefly to rub his swollen ankles.

"Next, we should talk to Jack's mom," Jessica said. "That woman she was with at the clothing store might be the same one who took the book."

"Show me the way," Mariah said.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: NOW:  Jessica finds Mariah, book gone, Amanda p...

choices: Into the Belly of the Beast - Jack goes to Faye's
Jessica and Mariah meet with Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
(Author Note: I keep writing Ms. Smart as Ms. Quick and I don't know why. In the past chapter, please read Ms. Quick as Ms. Smart)

---Amanda Dale---

Amanda reached down and pressed play on her little boom box. The CD whirred inside and soon the piano and bass begin to trickle out. Taking a deep breath, Amanda took the first step in her routine, swinging her hips to move her quadruplet-filled belly along with her in tandem. Each step flowed into the next, and soon Amanda was moving through the room in a graceful dance, running her hands across her belly at each major movement. She may have already had experience moving around while pregnant, but carrying four babies as opposed to just carrying Jack was quite a bit different. Still, Amanda was helped by the contest's format, as she only had on a maternity bikini she'd smartly picked out when she went shopping with Faye. No step felt hindered by the occasional bagginess of maternity clothing and the bikini gave her growing bosom ample support.

After about half an hour of this practice, Amanda took a break, running a cloth across her huge belly and between her breasts to sop up all of the sweat. Moving with this much new weight was quite the workout, but she was also filled with an incredible new energy that helped her power through and dance to her heart's content. And it was important to practice, because if the past days had taught Amanda anything, it's that her belly is going to keep growing by surprising amounts.

She went over the routine again in her head, listening to the music as she leaned back and rubbed her belly. It was a somewhat vanilla routine, especially compared to the options the man at the mall had given her, like pole-dancing and twerking.

"No matter how I may look now, a woman in her 50s should not be twerking," Amanda said to herself. Still, she wasn't too concerned. This was going to be a very polished routine, and if nothing else, belly size should account for something.

Amanda looked at herself in the mirror, stroking the sides of her big belly. Even when being pregnant was reasonable and she imagined what she might look like when she found out she was pregnant with Jack 25 years ago, she never imagined she would be this big. "And I'm not even done..." Amanda sighed.

There was a knock at the door. Amanda slipped on some quick clothing to cover her current lewd dress and waddled to the door. Much to her surprise, two other pregnant women were waiting for her, one with brilliant red hair and the other with lush dark hair. "Is this the Dale residence?" the dark haired woman asked.

"Yes, it is," Amanda said, running her hand under her own belly as she looked at both of theirs. "Can I help you with anything?"

"Actually, we're looking for Jack Dale Jr., but...I think we have some important information for you too," the red-haired woman said, looking at Amanda's belly with surprise. "May we come in?"

Amanda thought about it and agreed. Of course it wasn't typically a good idea to let strangers into the house, but the shared pregnancy among them made Amanda feel a kind of shared kinship with the women. After awkwardly getting stuck trying to walk into the doorway at the same time in their heavy pregnant states, both women made it inside and sat on the couch across from Amanda, who took the sitting opportunity to open up her sweat pants and give her belly some room.

"My name's Ms. Smart, and this is Ms. Apple," the red-haired woman said, before the dark-haired woman whispered in her ear ("this is why I didn't want codenames"). "I mean, other way around. We're working on a study of families where one member is having children at a later age. According to our information, your current pregnancy came about as a bit of a surprise?"

"Well...yes, I suppose you could say that," Amanda chuckled nervously, holding her belly a little closer, not sure just how much information to give away. I've only known I was pregnant for a few days now."

"Do you know how many days?" Ms. Smart asked directly.

"E-excuse me?" Amanda said, surprised by the question.

"Do you know exactly how many days you know that you've been pregnant?" Ms. Smart said again, resting a hand against her own belly as her newly added children began kicking.

"Well...I guess it was about three days now. But I got suspicious before then, but only for a few days or so." Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple turned to one another, whispering "six days?"

"And we've already talked to your son and we saw that he had an interesting coin with him. You wouldn't know anyone else who has a similar coin, do you?" Ms. Apple asked.

"I thought this was a survey about me being a pregnant old lady," Amanda grumbled, still annoyed by their first question.

"She's doing a study on that. I'm studying rare artifacts," Ms. Apple said. The two of them were pretty lousy liars.

"Well...I haven't seen another coin like that, but he left it in our car a few days ago and I think my neighbor Faye took it. She's not as old as me, but she's just as pregnant," Amanda snipped.

Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart looked at each other and slowly got up. "Well, thank you very much for your time, Mrs. Dale. Hopefully we'll see you again," Ms. Apple said, adjusting her shirt to keep her heavy breasts covered, both of them taking on additional size thanks to her sudden pregnancy.

"Give me some warning next time," Amanda said with a fake smile, leading the two women out the door.

---Jack Dale Jr.---

"Amber," Jack said softly as his manager moved her lips close to his. His head was swimming with emotions. Ever since high school he'd dreamed of being with Jessica and now he was. But Amber was just as beautiful and Jessica told him that last night didn't mean anything anyway. Maybe...he could just-

Jack's phone aggressively buzzed in his pocket and Amber paused, looking down to the source of the small noise. Jack brought the phone to his ear while Amber gazed at him with a 1000-yard stare.

"Jack! It's Jessica. Look, big problem: the book's gone."

"Gone?" Jack said, looking over at Amber and blushing profoundly, a terrible guilt rocking his body.

"Yes, but we think we have a lead. It might have been a friend of your mom's. A pregnant friend," Jessica said. Jack rolled his eyes. That could be practically anybody nowadays. "We're headed over to your place to ask her. Do you get off work soon?"

"Pretty soon," Jack said. Amber was breathing heavily, biting her bottom lip with just the edge of one of her front teeth. "I can help you figure things out...we?"

"One of my co-workers and I. She was translating the book but she ended up, well, like me and the book probably got stolen by some huge pregnant lady," Jessica said in a fury. "I've got to hang up the light's turning green butwe'lltalkokaybye!"

The phone clicked off and Jack turned back to Amber. She could tell that it would be a no from him and she started to shake her head, putting on her usual, sarcastic face.

"Problems?" Amber purred.

"I...I have to go a little early today," he said, "But trust me, it's in your interest to let me go too, not just mine." Amber was a taken aback by this.

"Just go, Strong Hands," she said, resting herself against the wall and heaving her fertile body up. "I can still do plenty over here with the other employees I've got."

"Thanks, Amber," Jack said, walking toward the door. "Good luck with, um, everything."

Amber let out a deep sigh, her volatile emotions she was trying to keep at bay starting to surge back a bit. "Don't worry about me, Strong Hands, just go do what you need to do."

Jack headed for his car and went home, unable to believe how close he came to kissing Amber. It hadn't even been 24 hours since he had sex with Jessica. His life was getting more and more hectic as the days went by.

Flip me the coin beckoned to him for good measure.

There was no point in resisting anymore. Jack gave the coin a toss and looked up as the light changed and the coin landed on heads. And just his luck, he saw local newswoman Mia Vasquez reporting on the street corner. She was already carrying two babies thanks to the coin and now a third one was added to the mix.

Great, Jack thought, a bit sarcastically, although a piece of him was thoroughly aroused by the gorgeous reporter growing even wider with child.

To his surprise, Jack appeared to have beaten Jessica and Mariah to his home, unaware that they had gotten massively side-tracked by two other pregnant women, Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple, but that's a story for another chapter. "Mom?"

"Oh, Jack," his mom called from her bedroom, still practicing her dance routine. "You're home earlier than you said."

"Yeah, well the schedule wasn't exactly set in stone," Jack said, looking around.

Before he could ask about the book, his mother waddled out of her bedroom, still in her bikini. The sight of his massively pregnant mother dressed like that sent shivers down Jack's spine, filling him with conflicting emotions. "By the way, Faye said to go over to her place for some errands. Could you do that quickly, please?"

"Faye's?" Jack said, figuring that she's probably the only other truly "huge" pregnant woman besides his own mother that Jessica could be talking about.

"Yes, don't worry Jack," his mother said with a giggle. "She won't bite."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Back with the Dale family

choices: Follow someone else's action. There are a lot of characters, people.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
--- Jessica ---

As Jack was walking into his parent's house, Jessica and Mariah were working their way onto the bus to try and get within walking distance of Jack's house. Jessica wasn't in much shape to drive and she'd managed to get to work by borrowing a ride from Mariah. Well, as of a few hours ago, Mariah wasn't exactly able to drive either. Perhaps even more so than Jessica. While the coin had Jessica nicely at five months pregnant with an as-of-yet determined number of fetuses, it cut out the middleman with Mariah. She was abundantly pregnant, nine months in, with what she had determined to be twins. Jessica may not have been able to cover up her pregnancy any more, but compared to Mariah, she was a feather weight. And neither of them were wearing clothes that exactly concealed their current condition.

Walking onto the bus took a bit longer than they thought. There was a line to get on and every other person was pregnant. When Jessica and Mariah squeezed their bellies past and waddled onto the bus, they could see a sea of bellies, some covered, some not. Normally it would be an odd sight to see a pregnant woman standing on a bus, but all of the seats were filled with mothers-to-be, all of who were no doubt a result of the coin.

Jess and Mariah pushed in as much as they could, wombs bumping against wombs. As they moved past, Mariah clutched her own belly, the commotion causing her young to kick and move inside her - a feeling she was still not used to.

"Hey, buddy, let me have a seat. I'm pregnant!" one woman yelled at a man sitting down next to her.

"So am I!" he barked back, holding his hands around his swollen middle.

"Bullshit, don't use those practical jokes about pregnant men on the news to fool me."

"Here, feel for yourself! They're kicking!"

The whole bus was filled with similar commotion. Some women cooing over their pregnancy, calling it a miracle, others angry that their husbands cheated on them and got the neighbor pregnant too, men in total disbelief of their situation. Jess and Mariah looked at one another.

"So it's not just us?" Mariah asked with a grimace.

"Oh no," Jessica said, looking around the bus. "That thing about the mall on the news was all real. And Jack says he knows a lot more people personally that this has happened to, like..." Jessica leaned in to whisper to Mariah. "His mom."

"Yikes," Mariah said. "So, how does Jack feel about...you know?"

"Why would Jack care?" Jessica said, turning her head slightly.

Mariah squinted her eyes in confusion before blushing. "Oh, I'm so sorry. I thought you two were going out."

Now it was Jessica's time to blush. "Oh...no, we're not." Jessica turned and watched out the window, not wanting to let her friend see her embarrassed face. She thought we were going out...

From outside, Jessica caught a glimpse of a news van, where Mia Vasquez, now expecting triplets, was reporting on the scene.

"I'm here outside the First Regional Hospital, where doctors are still unsure what has caused the recent rash of what is being referred to as 'sudden pregnancy.' I'm joined with Kristen Harper, an obstetrician here who has seen some of these unusual pregnancies herself. Dr. Harper, hello."

"Hello, and congratulations on your own pregnancy," Dr. Harper said with a smile, motioning to Mia's belly.

Mia giggled. "Yes, these are certainly not sudden. I've been dealing with these three for over nine months now," she said. "But, Dr. Harper, what are your observations as of now?

"Well, all of the women-"

"-and some men," Mia interrupted.

"And some men, yes, who have complained of 'sudden pregnancy' do check out, so far. These people are truly pregnant. So far, we believe that there has been some failure of birth control in this city. Shipping routes are being traced, but that seems like the most likely explanation. When people don't realize they're pregnant, sometimes it creeps up on them."

"But what is your explanation for pregnancy seen in men, Dr. Harper?"

Dr. Harper took a deep breath, "Well-"

At this time, Ian happened to be watching the report, hoping the bottom of the screen would cut out Mia Vasquez's pregnant belly and just show off her ample "weather fronts," as he called them. That Mia Vasquez did not work as a weather reporter, and had never worked as a weather reporter, seemed to be of little concern to him. He flipped the coin and it landed on Tails.

On screen, Dr. Harper was about to finish her sentence when she felt a sudden lurking in her stomach. Holding her middle, she watched in silent amazement as her belly swelled out until she looked ripely pregnant.

"Um..." was all Dr. Harper could get out as camera crews flocked around her, the first 'sudden pregnancy' caught on film.

Back on the bus, Jessica and Mariah were back to talking, trying to keep their minds off of the awkward exchange and their own occupied uteruses. The bus rolled to its next stop, and two particularly tired-looking pregnant women walked on: Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart.

"haa...haa...you, please get off the bus. We need to talk to you," Ms. Apple gasped, pointing at Jessica. Jessica and Mariah looked at each other with confusion, not doing anything. "Oh good lord..."

Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart pushed past the gauntlet of pregnant men and women, belly smacking against belly, until the four women were face-to-face.

"It's about the coin," Ms. Smart said, leaning her hips forward so her belly pressed against Jessica's. Mariah looked at Jessica and shrugged, giving Jessica a look that said maybe we should go with them.

Another arduous trip later, the four women were on a bench, all of them taking deep breaths after working past another long line of bellies and the crabby men and women attached to them. They briefly explained their work, their society, their talks with Jack.

"There's...haa...haa...all of this is happening because there's more than one coin now," Ms. Apple said. "Your friend, Jack, has one of them, but someone has another one. That's what's causing all of these pregnancies. It can't all be Jack."

"Is that how I got pregnant without him being around?" Mariah said, resting her hand on her belly.

"Where were you when it happened?"

"The store Jess and I work at, BooksBooksBooks," Mariah said. Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart swore under their breaths.

"There wasn't any other reported pregnancies around that area. There must be a third coin," Ms. Smart said, resting her head in her hand.

"And after that...someone stole the book. The one Jack gave me," Jessica said. Another swear. "B-but, we have a lead on who might have it. That's where we were going now."

Ms. Smart looked up. "Well, that could be good then. If you're right, then we not only get the book, we get one of the coins too. And with two coins, combined with Jack's special traits, we might be able to find the third one with little trouble."

"What 'special trait?'" Jessica asked.

"Well, the coin always binds itself to one person in each round it travels, but it seems to have stayed with him for much longer. It has a kind of connection with him. On some deep level, it makes sense that the coin would go to Jack," Ms. Apple explained. "Our other two members have been following the coin on foot for many years now and they haven't seen a connection like this in their time and we've only seen something like it in the book once or twice."

Jessica and Mariah looked at each other in disbelief. "Why would that be? I mean, Jack's great and all..." Jessica said, pausing for a moment. "But, it's not like he's magic."

"Well, as far as we can tell, the coin has made this connection with him because...he likes pregnancy."

"...what?" Jessica said.

"You know..." Ms. Smart said, rubbing her belly up and down slowly. "He likes pregnancy."

Jessica's face was stuck between a blush so red it looked like she had hives and a pale so bloodless she could have been sucked dry by a vampire, so Mariah decided to take the reigns. "So, if we get the other 'coin,' he might be able to...work something out with them? Use its power for his advantage?"

"That's the theory," Ms. Smart said, "But you're a part of that solution too..."

"...Jessica."

"You're part of that solution too, Jessica," Ms. Smart continued. "You were one of the first people the coin got pregnant when Jack had it. You hold some power too."

"How do you people know all of this?" Jessica asked a bit angrily. "Why didn't you stop it before it got lost or whatever."

"Hey, we're trying to help you!" Ms. Apple said, turning around quickly, her belly jiggling a bit. "We had some pretty bad things happen in our life thanks to that coin and we don't want the same things to happen to you. Besides, it's not as if we're being left unscathed by this whole thing," she said, gripping and rubbing her belly obviously.

Mariah put her hand over Jessica's, inadvertently touching her friend's belly. "Sorry, we didn't mean to...be rude. Thank you very much for your help. Will you help us look for the book?"

"No, we have to go talk things over with the co-members of our organization. They may have found the other coin - the one that's causing all of this trouble," Ms. Smart said, pointing to her belly. "Good luck to both of you. We'll be in touch."

Jessica and Mariah went back on their way, not too far from Jack's house.

"You'd think they'd ask for our phone numbers..." Jessica said after a while.

"They're very bad at being a secret society," Mariah said, shaking her head. "And what dumb code names."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jessica and Mariah meet with Ms. Smart and Ms. ...

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
- - - - Jack Dale Jr - - - -

Jack gulped a deep gulp as he knocked on the door of his neighbors, Faye and Charles.

KNOCK. KNOCK. KNOCK.

Jack thought back to how it all started, how it all started with Faye. He saw her out the car window when he first bought the coin, and how everything quickly unraveled from there. He knew for years that Faye and Charles were struggling to conceive, and he thought about what "undoing" all of this might mean...

Did he have the right to deny someone something they so wanted desperately for his own selfish reasons?

The door opened and Faye stood there, in her stylish maternity wear, in her full pregnant glory.

"Hello Jack. How are you doing today?" Faye asked with a smile, one hand hypnotically rubbing her belly, the other bracing herself against the door.

"Uh, I'm fine.. Mrs. Jones" Jack said, trying to keep his eyes off Faye's ample barely covered pregnant stomach or her ample cleavage that she had on display thanks to her maternity wear.

"Oh Jackie" Faye said, in a sultry tone that alarmed Jack as much as it excited him "Call me Faye. Your a man, not a child anymore"

"Uh" Jack said, his brain screaming at him that something was wrong. "Okay Mrs. J - - I mean Faye, and it's uh Jack by the way." Jack said, inviting himself in, squeezing by Faye's massive pregnant belly, his eyes trying to avoid contact at all costs.

"So, where's the work you wanted me to do? My mom said something about it?" Jack asked looking around the house. A dirty plate filled with food, and a half drunk glass of milk lay on the table, along with what appeared to be a basket of laundry; Faye's maternity clothing mixed in with Charles' clothes, Jack spotting Charles' favorite shirt resting on-top, although to Jack it seemed.. larger, almost stretched out.

"Oh, I have few things I need help with. Charles is... working on something else right now, so he's unavailable. I'd do it myself but.." Faye said with a giggle, lightly slapping her belly for emphasis. "It's nothing too crazy, I just need help painting the last section of the babies rooms and some other things. The delivery truck from Baby Universe is finally coming tomorrow, so I need to make sure everything is ready for when they arrive. I'm going to need them to put everything together after all." Faye said, letting something slip out.

"Why?" Jack asked, still trying to avoid eye contact with any part of Faye. "Wouldn't Mr. Jones do all of that for you?"
"Charles is... busy, like I said" Faye said, adjust the edges of her maternity clothes, smoothing out the wrinkles and pull it tight over her curves. "I don't think he'll be able to do much for a little while" Faye said, carefully choosing her words.
"But what's so important about what he's doing that he can't help out his pregnant wi---" Jack was beginning to say before being interrupted.

"What is this? A million questions time? He's busy Jack. Now don't worry about him, don't you want your forty dollars?" Faye said slightly annoyed, trying to change the line of questioning.
"Oh Mrs. J - - - Faye, you don't have to pay me at all. I earn my own money now, I'm not a little kid" Jack said.
"Nonsense, I'm paying you for a job. It shouldn't even take you that long. Charles had most of the painting done before he got - - - " Faye said, thinking about her next words "busy. Should only take you an hour or two" Faye said. "Now follow me"

Jack followed Faye upstairs, the stairs creaking and groaning under her weight. A few mere moments later, Faye flicked on the light to what would be the nursery, half-painted. "Everything you need to finish is over there. It shouldn't take too long, Charles finished all the top and lower portions of the walls. Just fill in the middle" Faye said, giggling and rubbing her belly as she said "fill in the middle".

Jack couldn't help but think that Faye was flirting with him somehow, but shook it off.
Focus Jack. You've got to ask her about the book. Jack thought to himself as opened up a can of green paint and got to work.

Time passed as it always did, Jack painting as quickly and as carefully as he could. He needed to be done with this and ask about the book, but if he did a bad job, he'd only have to do it again. Time is ticking he kept telling himself, thinking back to his mother in her bikini..

"Jack, do you want to watch some TV or something while you work?" Faye asked, carrying a small TV in her hands, propping it up against her massive belly like a shelf.
"Mrs. Jon- - - Faye, you really shouldn't lift stuff like that. It's not good for you!" Jack said, rushing over to Faye and taking the small TV from her.
"Nonsense, a little heavy lifting hasn't killed a pregnant person yet" Faye said with a smile.
"You mean a pregnant woman" Jack said, correcting her.
"Right. That's what I meant to say" as she looked down that hall at... something.

"Sure, I'd like to watch TV" Jack said, trying to be nice. He hooked up the small TV and turned it on.
"If you need anything else, I'll be in my room. Just knock before you come in okay?" Faye said with a sultry smile and a pair of come-hither eyes.
"Uh.. okay" Jack said, turning it to the news and watching Faye leave.

- - - - Faye - - - -

Closing the door behind her, Faye reached into her pocket and pulled out the coin.
"Do I really need to do this?" Faye asked herself.
Yes. He's going to take it all away from you. THEY'RE going to take it all away from you. It's the only way. She's getting closer now. I can feel her through her friend. They think you have the book. Hide it. I cannot be stopped now the voice talked to Faye in her head. It was no longer soft. It was cold, harsh and vile sounding. It sounded like a disgusting abomination bathing and feasting in it's own vile juices.

It scared Faye to death, but she headed it's every word.

"But my husband.." Faye said.

Cheated on you with some tramp. Knocked her up. He's the villain here, not you. He broke the trust. Besides, your husband is busy making your dreams of a large family come true. He needs his rest. A little extra martial activity won't hurt anyone. Sleep with Jack Faye. It will destroy Jack's relationship with the girl, and then.. Then you can finally become a mother. It's what you always wanted. The vile thing in the coin convinced her, not telling her the truth of how everything was falling into it's cruel design.

The vile thing would not be denied. It was days away from it's triumph. The amount of chaos sewn here would never be able to be fixed, no matter how hard Destiny tried. The world would be forever changed, and it would feast. Feast forever... Or at least until it hungered again

"You're right" Faye said, putting the coin on her dresser next to the book. Opening her closet door, she buried the book deep, under some old baby clothes and old pregnancy books that dated back several years ago. Slamming the door shut, Charles groaned in his sleep, turning softly, the bed creaking under his increased weight.

Faye began to disrobe, and grabbed her pair of maternity lingerie that she was saving for a special occasion. Now was a good as time as ever, seeing as Charles wasn't in any condition to fulfill her womanly needs. Pulling out the hottest shade of lipstick she could find, she prepared herself for what was going to come next....
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The Belly Of The Beast

choices: Faye makes her move on Jack as Jessica, Mariah, and Amber arrive. BUSTED!
Hey, maybe we should follow that Mia chick for a while.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
- - - - - Jack - - - - -

Sometime passed as Jack continued to paint. He painted, and painted, and painted so more, all as the TV blared in the background.

"Returning now to our top story: The pregnancy epidemic that was swept through our town. Mia Vasquez continues her story from earlier." The anchor on the TV said.

Jack was only half-paying attention, trying to work up the courage to sneak around the house looking for the book.
"Oh Jack, you don't even have proof that she has the book" Jack talked to himself, painting.

"Mia Vasquez here, standing outside First Regional Hospital, as the sudden, for the lack of a better word, "Baby Boom' continues to affect our town, leaving women, and even more stranger still, men mysteriously pregnant. Some time ago, I was talking with Dr. Kristen Harper, when, she suddenly, "grew pregnant" right her in front of us." Mia continued on her report, showing the footage from earlier.

"I mean, even if she did have the book. That doesn't mean anything does it?" Jack asked himself.

"After being rushed into the hospital, we received reports that Dr. Harper is in fact, about 8 1/2 months pregnant with a single child, a boy, that according to staff is completely healthy, given Dr. Harper's older age and the fact that she was not pregnant this morning. I'm standing with Dr. Thomas Mott, senior obstetrician here at the hospital who has decided to say a few words about the strange incidents these past couple days. Thomas?" Mia asked, turning the microphone over to him.

"But why would she have the book if she didn't know what it did?" Jack debated with himself.

"Thank you Mia. First off, I would like to report that Dr. Harper is okay, resting comfortably. She's still in shock about everything that's has happened to her, but physically she's just like any normal pregnant woman. Now, as for the matters regarding the pregnancies in this town, all I can say is this: We're working hard with outside investigators to locate the source of all these mysterious pregnancies. If anyone, male or female, is pregnant or believes themselves to be pregnant, they need to come down here for a check-up." Dr. Mott said.

"Yes. Explain how men are getting pregnant. This should be scientifically impossible" Mia said.
"Impossible? No. Extremely improbable? Yes. But I urge all men who are pregnant, think they might be pregnant, or are having pregnancy symptoms to come down right away. We're not going to grill you with a thousand questions, or turn you over to the government to study in some lab. All we want to make sure is that they have a healthy pregnancy. There's no reason to hide or be ashamed. It's perfectly natural if not slightly unusual, but please, gentlemen, think of your child's future. I assure you, it can be all strictly confidential if you want it to be, or you can go around and tell everyone that you're pregnant.

We just want to make sure that you're healthy. We've never seen anything like this before, and we need to make sure that as the child grows larger, no serious complications arise." Dr. Mott finishes.

"But what is causing men to get pregnant? Don't you think you should find out? This is the biggest medical discovery of the 21st century." Mia says, rubbing her belly.
"All we care about right now is ensuring a healthy pregnancy. Medical books can wait, medical care comes first. That's all" Dr. Mott said, walking away from the camera.

"Well, you heard it there folks. Truly a strange time to be living in. Mia Vasquez reporting." Mia signed off.

"Pregnant men. Wow, hope that doesn't happen to me.." The male news anchor said.
"Oh, would it be so bad?" The female anchor sitting next to him said.

"Okay, even if she did have the book. That could mean any number of things" Jack said to himself, finishing up the painting.
"It's not like she stole it on purpose. Maybe there was a mix-up. That was it, a mix-up."

Jack finished his work and took a look at everything. Not bad, all things considered for a rush job. Putting away everything for painting, Jack set out to look for Faye to tell her that he was done, and to ask about the book.

He knocked on the door to her room, but heard nothing but a groan coming from the other side. "Faye?" Jack asked, trying to turn the handle into Faye and Charles room. It was locked.

"Faye?" Jack asked knocking on the door.
"Yes?" Faye said, standing in the hallway, in a blue satin bathrobe. Her hair was down and unkempt, making her look wild and fierce. Her lips were a bright, alluring shade of red, her makeup was perfect, making her look irresistible. The blue satin bathrobe hugged her every curve, exposed her ample cleavage. She was barefoot, resting one foot against the back of her leg, as she pressed herself back first against the hallway.

She was rubbing and caressing her every curve with her hands, slowly. Images of Jack's dream from days ago came rushing back to hit him in the face like a two-ton truck that was on fire.

"I - uh, I uh" Jack was having trouble finding words. His brain had melted, his mouth was drive. He wanted her. But this was Faye! The woman who babysit him growing up! His mom's best friend! A married woman!

"I uh, finished all the painting and igottagonowbye" Jack said, rushing down the hallway, but was stopped when she flung an arm out to stop him.
"Where you going in such a hurry?" Faye asked, biting her lip with her teeth.

"IuhgottagohomenowI'msuremymomneedshelpwithsomethingbye" Jack said, talking to fast and trying to escape.

"Now, now, now. You're not going anywhere until I pay you.. And you have some of my famous lemonade" Faye said, grabbing Jack by the arms and leading him downstairs.

Two parts of Jack were now at war with each other: His head and his... other head. His head told him that something was wrong and he needed to leave. NOW.

His.. other head told him to stay for a while. Have some lemonade. Get paid.

His other head was winning, despite a valiant fight by his head.

"Well, that does sound nice, but I really need to go and - - - whoa" Jack said, and Faye threw him onto the couch.

"Kick up your feet. You work yourself to hard." Faye said in a sultry voice.

Faye walked over to Jack and gave him a glass of lemonade. "Drink up. It's good. I can't wait to serve it to my children on hot summer days." She said, forcing the glass into Jack's hand. "Oh! They're kicking up a storm right now. Wanna feel?" Taking Jack's free hand, she placed it on her ample belly with a sultry smile, and begin to rub it all over her very pregnant belly.

Jack's other head as starting to put up a much better fight.

"I REALLY, REALLY, need to go right now" Jack said, gulping down his lemonade and trying to get up from his seat.

Faye grabbed him and pulled him back down.

"Not don't be rude Jack. You're a guest. Stay for just a little while longer." She said, inching herself closer to Jack. He could smell her, she smelled amazing. She put on a very special perfume for just this.. occasion.

Jack's head was losing badly.

"Jack, do you think I look attractive like this?" Faye said, placing Jack's hand back on her belly. "Some people say that pregnant women aren't attractive.. But look at me" Faye said, adjusting the opening of her robe to show off more of her cleavage.

Jack could only make some kind of noise that sounded similar to an old 56K modem starting up.

"I'll take that as a yes" Faye said, standing up before Jack.

Showing grace that you wouldn't imagine with a woman her size, Faye pinned Jack to the couch with a foot, her hands slowly making their way to her robe belt.

"Mrs. Jones, you're trying to seduce me!" Jack said, alarmed.
"Mmmm. Whose trying?" Faye said, undoing her robe, dropping it to the floor and revealing her maternity lingerie.

"A woman has needs Jack." Faye said with a smile.

- - - - - - Jessica - - - -

Out of breath, Mariah and Jessica waddled up to Jack's house, as another car pulled up to the driveway next door. A very pregnant woman in a work maternity uniform got out with a small duffle bag and walked to the front door.

Jessica knocked on the door and after a few moments was greeted by the very pregnant form of Amanda Dale. "Hello Mrs. Dale, you're looking amazing" Jessica said, somewhat envious of Mrs. Dale size.
"Well thank you Jessica. You're looking.. a little full around the midsection.. Are you.." Mrs. Dale said, reaching out a hand towards Jessica's belly.
"I don't want to talk about it" Jessica said, pulling away.
Amanda's eyes suddenly widened. "Is Jack the father?" Amanda said.
"Look, where is Jack? Him and I need to talk" Jessica asked, dodging a line of questions she didn't have answers for.
"He's next door with Faye, a friend of mine. He's helping her out with some chores, since's she so pregnant. We've both big deliveries coming tomorrow from the baby store and - - - " Amanda Dale was interrupted as Jessica and Mariah took off waddling towards Faye's house.

"She's - - uh - uh - got to be the one!" Jessica said, holding her belly and waddling as fast as she could.

Jessica waddled right up past Amber with Mariah right behind her, and knocked on the door.
"I don't think anyone's home" Amber said.
"Wait, don't I know you. Aren't you the girl whose dating Jack?" Amber asked, eying Jessica up and down.
"We're not dating. We're just friends" Jessica said, knocking on the door again.

"He's not the father! I mean he is, but he isn't! It's complicated. GOD WHY WON'T THIS DOOR OPEN UP!" Jessica said, pounding on the door.

Slowly the door creaked open on it's own..

"But, you're married!" Jack stuttered, Faye's swollen breasts directly in his line of sight. He could smell the sweat and heat coming off her and could see her chest rise and fall with each breath and heartbeat.

"And like I said, my husband's busy," Faye grinned, leaning in closer to Jack. "Too busy for me, that's for sure. It's okay, Jackie. If you don't tell him, I won't tell your girlfriend."

"She's not my-" Jack said, remembering what Jessica told him that morning and pausing. He had to come to terms with it. "She's not my girlfriend. She told me so herself."

"Aww," Faye smiled, leaning in to plant a wet kiss on Jack's neck. Jack shuddered at her touch, especially as she included a little lick at the end. "Looks like we both need this, hon."

"B-but, Faye," Jack said, looking back at her, his mind searching for a way to get out of this. "Y-you're...pregnant. Should you really be-"

"Yes, I should," Faye said sternly, playing with Jack's hair. "I need it more than ever." She leaned him deeper into the couch's cushions, pressing her breasts against his face, whispering close to him. "And I know you do too."

A twinge rocked through Jack's body at her last words. "W-what do you mean?"

Finally, Faye sat up, sitting across from our young hero, rubbing her belly with a grin. "It's okay, I've put the pieces together myself. The way you've looked at me, the way you've even looked at your mother, your knocked-up 'friend who happens to be a girl.' Kudos on that, by the way. It took Charles twice as long as you to get a woman pregnant." Faye chuckled to herself, looking down at her belly and barring her teeth. "Or maybe not. Who knows what that dog's keeping from me."

"What?" Jack said. Faye looked back at him with a piercing look again, deciding there's no point in bringing this young man into her personal troubles.

"But, the biggest clue of all came from your mother directly," Faye purred, her eyes opening. "She told me the whole story about you and pregnancy."

"What...what story?" Jack said, raising one eyebrow. What was going on?

"She said you might not remember. As cute as it was, it may have been a little traumatic for you," Faye said, brushing her hair out of her eyes. "But as she says it, when you were little, you were very curious about pregnancy and felt the belly of every pregnant woman you could. And if there's one thing little kids have pretty wide access to, it's the pregnant moms of their little friends. So who should be so lucky as to have a pregnant 3rd grade teacher but little Jackie Dale Jr! And she would let you all feel her big, twin-filled belly whenever you kids wanted, but no one was as enthusiastic as you! It came to be that you wouldn't even ask permission: you would just rub and feel and she would smile and let it happen."

"Well, she was getting pretty big, and one day she happens to be wearing a button-up shirt and her twins give her two particularly strong kicks. It bursts! her shirt open, revealing her bare belly to the whole class. And who runs up and feels and rubs her belly but you! But, unfortunately, the principal was looking in on classes that day and he saw the whole scene. Apparently, he was quite the puritan, so he called an immediate meeting with you and your parents and yelled at you until he was blue in the face. They told him later that it was a bit uncalled for, but they didn't want to reinforce bad behavior. After all, you can't just rub a woman's belly without her asking! We want to be protective of our babies! (Faye gave her own big, bare belly a long rub and giggled) It seemed to have quite the impression on you, as your mom said you never made much talk about pregnancy after that. If anything, you tried to avoid pregnant women."

Faye crawled back toward Jack, who was staring back at her in disbelief. She...she was absolutely right! All of these memories were flooding back into him and he remembered the day with astonishing detail...Ms. Tammy and her belly...

"But things are different now, Jack. I want you to feel my belly." Faye took his hand and pressed it against her maternal flesh. "I want you to be curious," she said in a breathy tone.

Jack couldn't help himself. He planted his face against Faye's quadruplet-filled belly and began kissing and licking, pecking and sucking. He was like a man possessed. While Faye had helped to break down a few mental walls in his head, the real secret behind it was the two coins resonating. Jack had his in his pants' pocket, Faye in the pocket of her robe which lay just at the bottom of the couch. Yes, they were trying to bring Jack's coin into the hands of someone more reliable, like Faye, but it was something more: Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart were right: Jack had a strange sort of power of his own, and bringing the coins together amplified his power over theirs. He could get what he wanted. And right now, only one thing was on his mind.

"Ooh, Jack, that's it," Faye cooed.

"T-this is wrong," Jack sighed, flicking her popped out belly button with his tongue.

"No, it's all right," Faye said, bringing Jack's head up. "Now, I'll bet you've had all sorts of fun with that little friend of yours, huh?"

Yeah, once, Jack sighed in his head. "Y-yeah."

It's close, the coin beckoned to Faye. Hurry.

"Well, I'm sure a young man like you just lost himself feeling her breasts. But now, it's time for you to see what a woman's breasts look like." Faye pulled her shoulders around, having already undone her bra strap while she was telling Jack his own story. The already flimsy lingerie fell into her lap and her engorged chest hung down, bouncing happily as her breasts were freed.

"Uh...uh..." Jack said, things suddenly getting much realer for him.

Faye giggled. "You are so cute," she said, reaching for his pants. Yes, they're in his pocket, get them out. Uh, yeah, that's what I was trying to do, Faye thought back at the coin.

Unzipping them and working them down his hips, Faye reached one hand around in one pocket, her hand searching for the coin, but also trying to feel for his erection.

"What are you-" Jack tried to ask before Faye grabbed his chin. Can't have any distractions, she thought. Get the coin, then we can have real fun.

"Shh," Faye said. "Let mama take care of it." With that, Faye brought her lips to Jack's, who hesitated, looking back at her.

I...I can't...why can't I? It's just a kiss...it'll lead to more than a kiss...I want more than a kiss

Jack leaned up and kissed Faye back, their lips opening to taste more of each other.

"-THIS DOOR OPEN UP?" a familiar voice shouted as the front door gave way and Jessica, Mariah, and Amber tumbled inside, their bellies bumping against one another.

"Mrs. Jones?" Mariah called out. "Could we talk to you, please?"

"I hear someone over here," Amber said, motioning for the two to walk over.

"Mrs. Jones, I'm a friend of...oh my god." Jessica said, her arms falling to her side. Jack looked over and pulled away immediately, struggling as his pants fell even further down his legs.

"J-Jessica, I...I was-"

"I'm going to be sick," Jessica said, running out the door. Mariah followed her out, holding the bottom of her belly to keep it from moving around too much and impeding her movement.

Amber looked back at Jack, her fists trembling. "Wow, so that's why you wouldn't kiss me. Because you were fucking the wife of the guy who knocked me up. You could have just told me, Jack."

"Amber, I didn't...wait, THESE are the people you were talking about?"

"You're the tramp who slept with my husband?" Faye barked back.

"Stay out of this," Amber growled, turning to Jack. "You know what, don't bother coming into work tomorrow. Or for a while. I'll let you know."

She left last, slamming the door behind her. Jack hurried to pull his pants up, Faye's hands stopping him.

"Hey, forget about them. Why don't you and I-"

"Mrs. Jones, I-I'm sorry. I can't," he said, running out the door and calling out to Jessica and Amber as their cars backed out of the two driveways.

Faye sat on the couch and rubbed her big belly, sighing.

We have the book and we've stopped the boy. Now you'll have your babies, Faye.

"Yeah, and not have sex for even longer," Faye scoffed.

The commotion awoke Charles a little, who whimpered from the bedroom.

"Be quiet, dear. Just lay still and cook that baby inside you," she grinned, happy her husband wasn't taking the pregnancy as well as her.

In Faye's nursery, the TV continued to play and the news kept coming in. Mia Vasquez was now standing in front of the local high school, where the parking lot was packed to the brink.

"And now I'm standing outside North Central High, where the school district is holding a city-wide meeting to discuss issues facing the school system, as the recent high number of pregnancies is set to push the city's population well beyond previously projected levels. Parents are also concerned by the number of students in the high school who have become pregnant," Mia said.

"Mia, Rick Sanner here," one of the news anchors said. The entire channel was huddled at the front news desk in anticipation, talking remotely with their top field reporter. "We haven't heard any reports of students dropping out of the high school system in any higher numbers. Are you hearing anything about that?"

Mia nodded. "Yes, that's an interesting aspect. One might expect a student to drop out, transfer, or lay low when they get pregnant at the high school level, but the sheer quantity of pregnancies seems to have created a kind of community among students, even those men who find themselves with child."

"Fascinating," Rick said, still unaware that he was a few months pregnant himself. Over the past few days, Rick had tried to use the "pregnancy epidemic," combined with Mia's own triplet pregnancy, to push her into situations where she would seem like less of a serious journalist. Rick himself was never particularly talented aside from his good looks and charisma and he had heard plenty of talk that Mia would replace him as one of the station's main anchors. Unfortunately, his plan backfired and Mia was proving to be an excellent reporter on the issue and was the only one on the case, which helped her as national attention began to flock to the little town.

"Let's go inside the meeting now," Mia said, nodding to the producers to start playing clips she recorded earlier. The entire meeting was held in the gym, with all of the bleachers filled to the brim and every chair available set up on the floor, each one occupied. At the front of the gym was a long table, with all of the school board's members sitting, accompanied by prominent principles and teachers from the city.

"The fact is, folks, if we all want our kids to go to school in the city, taxes will need to rise across the board," School board chair Sandra DeRosa said, eliciting groans and grumbling from the crowd.

"Why should I have to pay for this mass irresponsibility?" one man said, standing up angrily.

A woman with a slight belly stood up, lifting her shirt so her bulge was clearly visible. "Irresponsibility? I've been divorced for two years and haven't had sex since then. The doctor told me I'm four months pregnant! I had no say in this!"

Another woman stood up, this one with a massive pregnant belly that bobbed around as she stood. "We wouldn't need to raise taxes if you people hadn't introduced 'sexual education' into the schools. You filled all of the students' heads with sex. I'm not paying for our schools to teach my kids to start shacking up!"

"Hey lady, look who's talking?" someone yelled from the back of the room. "You look like you're about to birth some new kids out any minute now."

"I made these babies with my husband with love," the woman shot back, turning around abruptly. "Don't try and twist it around!"

"Alright, alright, let's all settle down," said Srini Vsaraja, principal of North Central High. She stood up, revealing her own round pregnant belly. "We are re-examining our sex ed policy to see where we might have had faults, but we must recognize that there are also some things occurring that we cannot explain. Many students are saying that they suddenly became pregnant, which matches up with what a lot of other people are saying. And we have seen these students before and they certainly weren't nine months pregnant last week." Mumbles of agreement rippled across the gym. "So for now, we need to make sure we have schools for all of our children when they grow up."

The screen cut back to Mia, who was now accompanied by another pregnant woman. "Alright, now I'm joined by Zoe McPhaerson, who's here to show how this issue is not just affecting the public school system. Now, Ms. McPhaerson, what happened to you?"

"Well," Zoe said quietly, "I was a teacher at St. Alphonso's Catholic High, teaching English, and I loved it, but...one day, I suddenly became pregnant, like you can see." Zoe sheepishly rubbed her big belly, which was still dwarfed by Mia's triplet belly. She was a young woman with short, curly brown hair and big chipmunk cheeks. "I explained to them that, like so many other people, it just sort of happened, but because I'm pregnant and unmarried, they thought it sent a bad message, so I was fired."

"And you're not the only one, correct?" Mia added.

Zoe nodded. "We were told not to say anything, but now that I've been fired...I can say that several students were moved into secret, private classes because of their pregnancies and some of the nuns who teach who became pregnant were moved to secluded property in the city."

"Incredible," Mia said, nodding back to the camera. "This sudden swath of pregnancies seems to be affecting every part of life here, and no word yet on a cause, but we will be staying on the case. Back to you."

"Thank you, Mia," said Brooke Roberts, one of the station's anchors. "One part of city life that is benefiting from the high number of pregnancies is a pregnant bikini contest that is conveniently scheduled this week. And joining us live is one of the event's emcees, 101.9 DJ Samuel Wichowitz."

"Thanks, and actually, I prefer to go by Sandwich," he said, standing outside Dino's Bar and Grill, which was adorned with signs for the 101.9 Miss Stork Pregnant Bikini Contest.

"Sam, how has the sudden spike in pregnancies affected the contest?" Brooke asked, silently rubbing her own four-month-pregnant belly behind the desk.

"Well, we've gotten a lot more entrants that we'd expected," Sandwich said, trying not to show his annoyance. "And we were definitely surprised that our own co-host, Lisa Smith, got pregnant and is entering the contest herself. But it should be fun. The big numbers have brought in a lot of advertisers and we're increasing the number of prizes we're offering. It should be a good time."

"And our own Mia Vasquez is entered, I understand," Rick said, smiling with schadenfreude as he hoped Mia's participation would reflect poorly on her.

"Yes, she certainly is," Sandwich chuckled. "And she'll certainly be a strong contender. Either way, she'll get a lot of attention, which will definitely help her in the broadcast world, I'm guessing."

"Hmmph," Rick sneered.

"Well, good luck to you and all of the entrants," Brooke said with a smile, sensing Rick's irritation. "Should be a fun night. Now, speaking of which, we rejoin Mia Vasquez on the scene. What news do you have for us, Mia?"

"Brooke, I'm at Titan Bank, with one of the organizers of the bikini contest you mentioned, Ian Douglas," Mia said, standing next to an obviously nervous Ian. His boss had pushed him out to the media to promote the bank's involvement in the contest, so he had to come up with some proof that he'd actually done his job, which he had not. He got excited when he heard he'd be interviewed by Mia Vasquez, but when he saw her huge pregnant belly, his volupture dropped right off. Jack jinxed me talking about pregnancy so much, Ian thought.

"So, Mr. Douglas, what is Titan Bank's involvement?"

"Uh, yeah, we're involved," Ian said, running through his head for something to say. "We're funding the prizes and...we're looking for more as things go on."

"Like what?" Mia said, foolishly believing that Ian knew what he was talking about.

"Oh, um, some great stuff, lllllllike," Ian said, rummaging around in his pocket, until he found the coin in his pocket. "Like this, um, antique coin. It's...rare and a definite collector's item."

"Interesting," Mia said, nodding. "What a unique prize, especially for a...bikini contest."

"Well, we like to do things differently here at Titan Bank," Ian said, gulping nervously, a little pleased with how well that had turned out. "And there'll be...all kinds of neat prizes like that, so come check it out."

"Alright, well said," Mia said. "Now Brooke, Titan Bank goes beyond just sponsoring the event. A few of the bank's employees are entered in Thursday's contest, like-hey, what's going on?"

The screen went black as someone's hand was clearly covering the camera. "We need you to turn these cameras off."

"Who are you? This is a legitimate news broadcast," Mia retorted angrily.

"Health and Human Services." And then the camera cut out and the station went to commercial.

Now, truth be told, it wasn't what it appeared to be. "JESSICA! PLEASE WAIT! IT'S - - - " Jack screamed after her.

"I - I came over to do some work. I didn't want to! My mom made me! And Faye she just - - - -" Jack said, finally managing to get one of his legs into his pants. Jack didn't realize that it was the wrong leg and that his pants were on backwards.

"She just threw herself at you Jack? Is that it?" Jessica said angrily making her way back to the bus stop.

"OVER!? WE NEVER EVEN STARTED! Jessica, why are you so upset? It's not like we're even going out! We're just friends! You said so yourself!" Jack said, trying to make sense of this nonsense.

"Then clearly you don't understand women, especially me, as well as you think you did!" Jessica said, finally making her way to the bus-stop.
"WHAT DOES THAT MEAN!?" Jack was throughly confused, and now was getting angry.
"IT MEANS I LOVE YOU STUPID SHIT! I LOVE YOU! I'VE ALWAYS LOVED YOU! WHY DO YOU THINK WE HAD SEX? BECAUSE I NEEDED RELEASE?! I LOVED YOU AND THAT WAS OUR MOMENT TOGETHER! IT WAS OUR EVERYTHING! YOU! ME!" Jessica paused her screaming, lifting up her shirt to expose her taut pregnant flesh.
"THESE! IT'S MEANS WE WERE FINALLY TOGETHER! WE HAD EVERYTHING WE COULD EVER NEED! AND YOU THREW IT ALL AWAY FOR SOME... SOME.." Jessica was crying more than a river, she was crying an ocean, her makeup smuding as she let out years of repressed feelings firmly backed by a deep sense of betrayal.
"Slut" Mariah said sheepishly, her head and eyes looking firmly at the ground.. Well, her very pregnant twin-filled belly that happened to block the ground.
"THANK YOU MARIAH. YOU'RE A TRUE FRIEND." Jessica said, turning to her pregnant friend. "SLUT!" Jessica then turned her attention back to Jack to continue her assault.
"But Jessica, you said it didn't mean anything! YOU SAID WE WERE JUST FRIENDS!" Jack shouted back, in shock of what he was hearing.

It was all laid bare before him, and Jack felt like a very special kind of idiot to not have noticed it before. But Jessica words... Can a woman say one thing and mean another?

"THAT WAS CODE YOU IDIOT! IT WAS AN OBVIOUS LIE! YOU WERE SUPPOSED TO SAY "I WANT US TO BE MORE THAN FRIENDS! I LOVE YOU JESSICA! I WANT US TO BE A FAMILY!" Jessica said, putting her hands on her belly for emphasis.
"HOW WAS I SUPPOSED TO KNOW THAT!? " Jack screamed, stretching out his hands from his head, for emphasis.
"IT'S CALLED BEING AN ADULT AND PULLING YOUR HEAD FAR OUT OF YOUR OWN ASS JACK. Why don't you try it sometime?" Jessica said, turning her back to Jack. "Goodbye.."

"What about the book?! What about this!?" Jack said, reaching into his pocket and pulling out the coin.
"Shove it far up your own ass. Maybe it will dislodge your head" Jessica said, back turned towards Jack. "As for the book, don't worry about it. I'll think of something.. Something that doesn't involve you." Her words with firmly baked with hurt and hate.

It was at this time, that it anyone was paying attention, that alone black helicopter was flying over head. But, helicopters in a small suburban town was the norm, so no thought was given to it as it made it's way to the First Regional Hospital's helipad to set-up it's command center.

And the fight was so intense, nobody else did not happen to notice the second, the third, the fourth, or even the fifth matching black helicopters that were quickly making their way across the town, setting up it's perimeter.

Jack was taken back by Jessica's goodbye. It sounded so... final.
"Jessica.. You need me" Jack was hurt. It was like she reached into his chest and pulled out his heart while shouting "Kali Ma! Kali Ma!" (Author's Note: Ha-Ha! Temple Of Doom reference)

"I'll solve this own my own Jack. I don't need you. I'll never need you. I think you better leave." Jessica said, her words cold.

And with that, Jack was sure it was over. Everything was over. This was it. The end of his world. The end of the world.
He couldn't speak. All he could do, was walk slowly back to his house, one leg in the wrong pant leg, fighting back pain and hurt.

Time seemed to stop as he slowly opened the door to his house, and trudged inside, head hung low.

His very pregnant mother came towards with a quickness that would surprise anyone given her size. "Jack, baby, what's going on? Why was Jessica here? Is she pregnant?! Are you the father!? What was all that shouting outside? Why are you pants down? Did you finish your work for Faye? Did " Her words were strong and motherly. She had no idea what was going on with her son, and she wanted answers - - - NOW.

"notnowmomidon'twanttotalkaboutitokay?" Jack mumbled softly to himself, staring ahead into nothingness.
"What was that?" His mother asked, putting one hand into the small of her arching back, the other resting on-top of her mammoth pregnant mound. "Jack baby, what happenned? Why is Jessica pregnant? ARE YOU THE FATHER JACK?! Oh my god, you are the father. I can't believe - - - JACK, WHAT DID WE TELL YOU ABOUT SAFE SEX?! OH MY GOD, YOU'RE GOING TO BE A FATHER. It all makes sense, how long have you been seeing her? Did it start when you moved back? Oh was it more recent? She looked like four months pregnant, Jack have you been seeing her for a year?! Do you know what this is going to do to you!? It's going to make finishing college almost impossible! You can't raise a family on minimum wage! You have to - - - " Amanda's mouth was going 10,000 words a minute, her words full of concern and comfort and more.

"ISAIDNOTNOWMOMIDONTWANTTOTALKABOUTITOKAY? IT'SNONEOFYOURBUSINESS! WHYDONTYOUWORRYABOUTYOURSELF! THERESALOTOFYOUTOBECONCERENDABOUT!" Jack screamed at mother, his words becoming long unbroken sentences as he finally broke down, and threw himself at his mother.
Tears flowed freely from her son as she caught him in her arms, almost losing her balance trying to juggle pregnancy and her full-grown son as he sobbed into her shoulder.
"She was the best thing to ever happen to me Mom! And I-uh-uh-uh-I screwed it all up! Oh god what am I going to do! It hurts so much! ShegoingtoleaveandIllneverbeabletofixanyofthisanditsthatstupidcoinsfaultandI" ; Jack's words were slurring and coming together as he was becoming entrapped in glass case of emotion.

"Sssh. Sssh" Amanda said, trying to comfort her son, stroking his hair. "It's okay baby. It's okay. Just let it all out. We'll figure this out together okay? Just let it out. It's okay, Mommy's here" Amanda said, her maternal instincts on overdrive. Despite being in her 50's and pregnant with FOUR babies she couldn't even imagine having, she would always be a mother to Jack, her first born son, and she would always be there for him, even when trying to keep out with four little ones playing underfoot soon. But how soon? She thought catching a glimpse of herself in the mirror.

- - - - - Meanwhile - - - - -

"Health and Human Services! That's a load of horseshit! Who are you and why did you interrupt my broadcast! Freedom of the press!" The very pregnant Mia screamed at the man and woman dressed completely in black dress pants, black jacket, black sunglasses, a white shirt with black tie for him, and a white button blouse for her.

"Ma'am we're going to need you calm down. We're health and human services" The woman said, quickly flashing a badge to the pregnant reporter before putting it back in her jacket pocket.
"Bullshit! You don't look like any Health and Human services person I've ever seen. You look more like just stepped out of that movie about those guys who fight aliens on Earth." Mia said, so angry she was forgetting obvious movie references and cliches that were standing right in front of her.

"We get that a lot. But we're still going to need you to calm down ma'am, and come with us." The man said, standing up straight and snapping his fingers.

Several armed personal came around the corner, gas masks on, guns at the ready. Dressed from head to toe in body armor and black fatigues, there looked like something out of a video game about special forces.

"What the hell is this!? What the hell is going on!" Mia screamed as two of the heavily armed.. persons, lightly grabbed her by the arms. "Get your hands off me! You can't treat a pregnant woman like this!" Suddenly, another group of armed persons came and started grabbing the camera man and Ian.

"Oh what the hell. First pregnant chicks and now this!? Man can this day get any worse?!" Ian asked as he was grabbed by the shoulders.
"I need everyone to calm down. We're not here to hurt you. We're here to help. Strange things.. unnatural things have been happening in this town, and we're here to make sure that everyone is okay... And that it doesn't leave until we figure out what's causing it"

The doors opened in a flash as doctors and nurses in hazmat suits delicately put Mia, her cameraman, and Ian into the back of the large black van, which had been jury rigged into an ambulance.

"Ma'am, how long have been pregnant? Did you notice anything unusual during your pregnancy?" A doctor behind a hazmat suit flung a hundreds questions at her a second.
"What about your sir? Are you pregnant? Are you experiencing any pregnancy like symptoms? Tender breasts? Swelling of the abdomen? Vomiting in the morning? Odd cravings for food?" A nurse in the hazmat suit flung the questions to Ian and the camera man as they were ushered into the ambulance.

The doors shut firmly close as the three were drug into the car, and it speed off, as dozens, if not hundreds of other similar vans spread out across the town, the scenario playing out over and over again as dozens of black helicopters flew across the town.

- - - - Later in the Dale household - - - - -

Jack was laying on the couch, his head resting on his mother's massive pregnant belly. He should have felt weird about this whole thing, but he was just too damn tired. He was tired from the hurt, and right now he just wanted to rest. He listened to the four heartbeats in his mother's massive belly, he could feel the kicks and punches of his siblings inside her. This is all my fault. You guys shouldn't be in there Jack thought to himself, trying to communicate somehow with his unborn siblings.

Amanda had a smile on her face as she played with her grown son's hair, trying to comfort him as her unborn children played inside her, clearly happy to have their big brother so close.

"Oh Mom. What am I going to do?" Jack asked. He told his mother what she needed to know, not the whole truth. He made up a bullshit story about the year-long relationship, and made up lies to cover lies he never told to cope responsibility for Jessica's condition and their somewhat.. fuzzy relationship status.

"I mean, she never said we were dating. We were just friends.. with benefits" Jack said, reaffirming his lie. "Being grown-up is complicated and weird baby." Amanda said, trying to find something to say to her son. "I mean, look at me. I'm going to be a mother again when my own little boy is starting his own family" Amanda said, trying to put a smile on a lot of mixed emotions.

"I have to fix this!" Jack said, lifting himself of his mother's pregnant belly and sitting up straight on the couch. What he meant to try and fix was this whole situation that the coin caused, but Amanda didn't know that. "Maybe you just to do the right thing baby. Just tell her everything, how you really feel, and say you didn't know, and maybe, maybe she'll forgive you". Amanda said.

Faye, what the hell where you doing? Amanda thought to herself. Next time she saw her, she would have some SERIOUS words about all this.

"Mom, what about Faye.. She.." Jack was trying to find words to make up a lie about why she tried to to do what she was planning to do. You couldn't really tell her the truth about a pregnancy causing coin and a book that may hold the truth to unravel it all.

"Don't worry about her. I'm sure she had a reason to.. do, what she had to do. When she couldn't get pregnant, I'm sure it put alot of pressure on her marriage and.. Like I said, being a grown-up is complicated." Amanda said with a smile.

"Mom, I am a grown up. I'm in my 20's remember?" Jack said, a little annoyed to be talked to like a child. "You'll always be my baby" Amanda said, brushing the cheek of her son.
"Greeeatttt" Jack said to himself.

RING! RING! Amanda heaved herself over to pick up the phone next to the couch. "Dale residence, Amanda speaking" Amanda said.
"Amanda, baby, sweetie. It's Jack. You gotta turn on the the news!" Jack's father sounded panicked on the other end of the line. "Honey is everything okay?" Amanda asked, resting a hand on her belly. "They're taking all of us to First Regional! I'll meet you there okay! Just - - " The line went dead at the other end of the line as Amanda stared at the phone quizzically.

"Who was that Mom?" Jack asked. "It was your father. He said that someone was taking him to First Regional. He said turn on the news" Amanda reached over to the remote and turned on the TV. It came to life in a hum.

"We repeat, this is the emergency broadcast system. We interrupt your regularly scheduled program to bring you this important pre-recorded message:" The voice on the static image of some kind of symbol said.

"Attention residence: Due to the unusual events that have happened in your town these past few days, the depart of Health and Human Services Sector 7, is immediately ordering all residents to the nearest hospital for examinations and pregnancy tests. We do not understand what is causing the pregnancies in your town, nor do we have any idea what is causing the men of your town to become pregnant but we are determined to find the answer.

Please do not be alarmed. We are here for your own safety. Anyone male or female, young or old, that is pregnant or found to be pregnant will be released back into the general population of people found not to be pregnant after some minor and completely safe tests. Each person, pregnant or not, will be given a blue examination card, which will allow you to travel about your town normally. Those without the blue examination card, will be taken to the nearest hospital for an examination. Those who are found to be pregnant will receive a pink sticker on their card. This sticker will be issued daily after the pregnant person is examined by our team of highly trained doctors and nurses.

Failure to head to the daily examinations for those issued the pink sticker will result in major fines and possible imprisonment. We care about the health about the people of this town, born and unborn. For your own safety, armed personal will be present on every major street and corner to enforce the "Blue Card Policy". Failure to comply will be meet with imprisonment. Once you have your blue card, and a pink sticker if you need it, you will be free to move about the town at your own pleasure. There will be no curfew. There will be no martial law. However, until we can safely figure out what is causing the pregnancies, leaving this town is strictly forbidden. We have
armed personal at every major entrance and exit. Do not attempt to cross the quarantine. Food and medical supplies and other items that regularly enter your town will be inspected to help determine the source of the pregnancies.

Life will continue as normal. You will go to work, kids shall go to school, mail will still be delivered, movies will still be shown, you will just be unable to leave town until further notice. We apologize for this, but it's to ensure your own safety, and the safety of others and society outside the quarantine zone. Life will continue as normal. This has been a message from Health and Human services sector 7. Please once again make your way to Regional National hospital for examination. Failure to do so will result in fines and imprisonment.

Armed personal will be by in hours to check for the Blue Card. If you do not have it, you will be taken for examination. Unless you wish to be dragged to your examination, please leave your residence now and make your way to the hospital. This message will repeat for the rest of the day. Your regularly scheduled programming will continue tomorrow morning at 8 on all television and radio stations. Thank you for your cooperation. This message will repeat in 30 seconds."

And with that last phrase the message cut back to the symbol on the screen, leaving Jack and Amanda staring at each other.
"Is this really happening?" Jack asked. This was all to much for him.
"I guess. Did they say that men were getting pregnant?" Amanda asked, her hands cradling her belly, trying to protect it.
"I uh" Jack didn't want to think about it.

"Go get changed. We need to go." Amanda said, standing up.
"Go? Where?" Jack asked.
"To the hospital. Whatever this Sector 7 is, they're not messing around. Let's just go get this over with and find your father" Amanda said with bated breath.
"But why did they take him?" Jack asked.
