"He probably didn't want to go. He's always been so stubborn sometimes." Amanda said with a smile.
"But you don't think that he's - - " Jack couldn't finish the thought.
"Oh I hope not. Four kids is bad enough. But five? Forget about it. Although, it would be nice for your father to know what I'm going through" Amanda said playfully.

Jack just started at her.

"I'm just messing. Go get dressed. Maybe you can find Jessica at the hospital. Fix things with her. After all, I want to meet the mother of my grandchildren" Amanda said with a smile.

It's been a weird day for Jack as he went to go get changed out of his works clothes. The next few days would only get weirder.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Yeah, this was expected.

choices: Jack and Amanda are sent off to the hospital
The HHS rounds up some other characters around town
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
---Elsewhere in Town---

Tara lived a relatively quaint life. She had a mid-sized apartment alone, aside from one particularly nosy cat, with some simple furnishings. There were plenty of friends over every now and then, but since she'd gotten pregnant, their numbers fluctuated to a pretty high degree. When Tara first let it be known that she was pregnant, and no, the father was not in the picture, she would have friends over almost every other day, helping to make her meals and talk it over with her. It was nice to have more company, but Tara always assured them that she was fine. She was on a fast-climb at the bank and made enough to support herself and a baby.

But, as her belly started getting bigger, her friends had markedly less interesting in spending time with her. Whether they were intimated or felt uncomfortable around her or thought it was too much drama, Tara never knew. Of course, it was only recently that her belly had gotten REALLY big and she found the two other occupants hiding out inside her womb. It helped that she was close to reaching vice president in the bank, but for now, Tara wasn't sure how she'd support three children on her current salary.

Despite this, Tara was a naturally cheery person, so for now, she was enjoying her roller coaster ride of a pregnancy. Carrying three babies did take its toll on her energy, so she was just getting up from a mid-day nap when she heard a knock on her door.

"Coming," she shouted lazily, waddling to the door. She had on a pair of grey sweatpants that she attempted to hike around as much of her belly as she could. Over that was a maternity t-shirt that was clearly not designed for a woman carrying three kids full term. Tara had done a little bit of shopping at the local mall's maternity store for some new outfits, but they were mostly for the few work appearances she'd need to go to and for some underwear that wouldn't hurt to wear anymore. Tara was bare-foot from her nap and her raven-black hair was tossed around messily. As she waddled to the door, her cat took a few cautious swipes at her belly, tickling her exposed skin.

As soon as she opened the door, three hazmat-wearing officials held out badges and ushered for her to follow them. "Health and Human Services," one of the hazmat suits, a woman with short brown hair and glasses from what Tara could make out behind the plastic mask, said to Tara. "You'll need to come with us. The city is under quarantine until the source of the pregnancies can be found."

"The source of the pregnancies?" Tara said with a raised eyebrow. "Excuse me, but I think I know what caused my pregnancy. Sure the other two might have been a surprise, but I-"

"Ma'am, could you please repeat that?" The woman in the hazmat suit said with a raised eyebrow, nodding to the other two HHS workers to guide her out of the apartment. "What other two?"

"Well, I knew I was pregnant," Tara said in an irritated tone as the other two hazmat suits took her by the arms, "but I didn't know until a few days ago that it was triplets. It sort of snuck up on me. And do you mind?"

"Ma'am, we have full authority to perform these actions, under Section 7," one of the HHS workers said, following the woman to the apartment's freight elevators, where the whole floor's residents, men, women, and children, some of them visibly pregnant, some not, were being corralled by other men and women in hazmat suits.

Once at the bottom, Tara saw rows and rows of large white vans, each with federal logos on the sides. "Now, Ms...." the woman in the hazmat suit looked at a clipboard, "Tara Azem, you said you're carrying triplets, correct?" Another agent handed the woman a small plastic wand with a paddle attached to it by a cable. It emitted a low blue glow and the woman rubbed it against Tara's belly, not needing to role up much of her shirt thanks to the size disparity.

"Yes, I am. Can I ask what you're doing?" Tara said in an angry tone. She was always protective of her physical space, but since being pregnant, she was even more on guard against uninvited contact. But given the official and scary tone of all that was going on, she felt she couldn't resist too much.

"Just a quick ultrasound. In preparation for this assignment, we had some special devices whipped up," the woman said, removing the device from Tara's belly. "Checks out, three healthy babies. Well, into the 'triplet' van it is." The woman waved her hands a few times in different directions and some more agents came over, guiding Tara to one of the vans. Opening the back, Tara was helped in by agents. "We will be taking you to the hospital for some routine check-ups. After that, you will be free to move about the city, but you cannot leave. Additional information will be provided for you. We're here to help," the woman said, closing the van's doors, letting Tara and the other women in the van look out the back windows as people were placed into similar vans all around the block.

"Triplets too, huh?" Another woman said. Tara turned to see a very pretty woman with wavy, long brown hair and a totally exposed belly. Instead, she had an athletic top on that only covered her bust and a pair of yoga pants. "I'm Trisha. I was in the middle of some mid-day exercises and they would not let me change," she said with a weak grin.

"Could be worse," another woman mumbled. Tara and Trisha turned to see another woman, her legs and arms curled up to hide as much of her body as they could. But with a belly as big as hers, it didn't work too well. And Tara could see that the woman was clearly not wearing much to cover up the rest of her body.

"Hey, it's okay," Tara said with a compassionate smile. "We're all in the same boat. You don't have to be embarrassed around us."

The woman sighed and brought down her arms and legs, revealing not only a heavily pregnant body but an incredibly voluptuous one as well, with only a blue-and-white striped bikini on.

"Oh...oh! You're Lisa Smith, from the local radio station!" Trisha said with a surprised gasp. "I play 101.9's pop hour during my classes!"

Lisa gave a little smile. "Well, I appreciate the support. I'm entered in our pregnant bikini contest and I don't want to embarrass myself trying to dance, so I was practicing when...well, here we are."

Tara sighed and smiled. "I'm sorry. This is really crazy, though, isn't it? This can't be legal."

"They kept asking me when I got pregnant or if anything was unusual. I think this is related to the scares about sudden pregnancies. But it's all crazy," Trisha said. "I've had these triplets for nine months now. Believe me: I remember carrying these heavy bundles for a loooong time."

"Yeah, I've been pregnant for what feels like an eternity by now," Tara giggled, caressing her orb of a belly. "Although...until a few days ago, I thought it was only one baby. I didn't remember feeling any more."

There was an awkward silence. "Well, d-don't tell any of them," Lisa scowled before turning back to her two van-mates. "But, until a few days ago, I wasn't pregnant...at all. And now-" Lisa held her hands on her belly and jiggled it, rubbing as it awoke the very real fetuses swimming around inside her. "I can tell you from a personal level: this sudden pregnancy stuff has some truth behind it."

Tara, Trisha, and Lisa were silent after that, each feeling their bellies. As the van started up and moved to the hospital, they took some time to chat more and even rub each other's bellies, although Lisa was understandably hesitant. When they found out they were each entered in the contest, they smiled and wished each other good luck, hoping to spend time together again, hopefully when this is all resolved.

At the hospital, Tara was guided past packed rooms of pregnant women, some annoyed, some terrified, pointing to the swelling of flesh in front of them. She also saw plenty of big-bellied men and other indignant at the very question of "are you pregnant or not?"

Tara was put in a room with some other big-bellied women, although nothing compared to her own. A female doctor rubbed and listened to her belly, performing an ultrasound of her own.

"It says here you didn't know you were pregnant with triplets until recently?"

"Yes," Tara sighed, annoyed with the same question over and over again. The doctor pondered before grabbing another piece of equipment that Tara couldn't recognize. Moving it around Tara's belly, the doctor raised her eyebrows.

"This is...one of the highest readings we've gotten so far," the doctor said. "You might be the clue to figuring this whole thing out."

"What?" Tara stammered, not fully understanding what was going on.

"We'll need to keep you here a little longer," the doctor said, calling for some more agents in hazmat suits. Tara was guided into a room that looked like it was used for doctors to sleep in-between shifts.

"Don't leave," the agent said before locking the door. As soon as it closed, Tara screamed behind barred teeth, collapsing her head into her hands.

"Doing okay, dear?" a woman's voice asked. Tara looked up and saw Mia Vasquez sitting a few beds away from her.

"I...not really," Tara replied.

"I understand," Mia said, trying to stand up and waddle over to Tara. "Well, how do you feel right now."

Tara searched her mind for her true feelings. "Lonely," she said, her mind flashing to the last time someone showed her compassion: Jack. "Lonely and horny."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The round-up begins

choices: Jessica and Jack talk, Faye and Amanda talk, everyone talks
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack helped his mother waddle out to the car, one hand holding her belly as she took awkward steps, trying to look past her swollen womb to see where she was stepping.

"Maybe I should invest in some kind of sash," she sighed. In truth, Amanda Dale felt a little reassured about another trip to the doctor. She was told she was three months pregnant less than a week ago and she already looked like she was full to bursting. What's more, she certainly didn't look like this the morning before. Amanda came to accept that each time she would wake up, her belly would double in size. I can't imagine six more months of this, Amanda thought to herself. I'm already as big as Faye. In another month, I'll be a blimp!

Jack unlocked the car and looked it over. "Mom, maybe you should sit in the back seat," he said cautiously. His mother sighed and looked down at her mountain of belly.

"I think you're right. We may even have to move the seats back." Jack nodded and moved around, adjusting the car appropriately and holding his mother's hand as she heaved herself into the back. As this went on, a fleet of HHS vans filed into the neighborhood, with hazmat-wearing officials quickly going into each house and bringing the residents out.

Faye was walked out of her house by three HHS officials and Jack and Amanda could hear her objections all the way from their own driveway.

"I will do no such thing! I am very content with my pregnancy that I worked hard to make. I will not be carted off in a black van to the hospital to be prodded like a chubby lab rat," Faye barked. She was wearing the blue robe she had on earlier when she tried to...entice young Jack Dale Jr.

"Ma'am, everyone needs to go," one of the hazmaters said as Faye spotted Jack and Amanda trying to get into their car.

"Fine, but I insist on going with my friend and neighbor. They're headed to the hospital too. I mean, look, she's just as preggy as I am," Faye said, pointing across the street.

"Well...yes, that's fine then," the hazmater said, shrugging and going back with his comrades. Faye smiled, glad to be able to still travel comfortably for what would be sure to be an over-hyped ultrasound.

"Amanda!...Jack," Faye said, waddling over to the Dale family getting into their car, her eyes narrowing sensually as she saw Jack. "Going to the hospitals too, huh? Mind taking me with you? It's either that or they shove me into one of those creepy Nazi vans."

Jack blushed and took a few steps away as Amanda tightened her gaze on Faye. "Faye, you and I have some things we need to talk about...but, as a friend and someone who's...going through some of the same things as you, you can ride with us."

"Thank you so much," Faye said with a relieved smile, heaving her massive maternal body into the seat next to Amanda. "Oh, it's nice back here. Good move adjusting the seat."

Jack mumbled got in the driver's seat, powering the car up and heading for the hospital. As they left, hazmaters led Charles' heavily pregnant body out of Faye's house, all of them astonished at the sight.

"You know, we should all try and get together more often," Faye beamed. "Really get together. You, me, your husband, Jack. We should have a big dinner and just talk."

"And your husband too," Amanda said, eyeing Faye, still suspicious of what transpired between her and Amanda's son.

"Oh, of course, Charlie too," Faye said with a serpent's smile. "Although, he hasn't been feeling too good lately, so that might be a stretch."

As they drove, Jack could see HHS vans everywhere, with all kinds of people being corralled by men and women in hazmats. It didn't matter if they were pregnant or not: they were going in those vans, although the visibly pregnant ones seemed to be split up from the rest. He gulped. He'd been trying to keep a lid on this whole "coin" business as best he could, but if lots of people started finding out about it, what would be the consequences? Would they help him try to destroy it and reverse its magic, or would they try and study it and leave everyone stuck with their babies? Jessica's tear-filled face flashed in his mind and Jack gripped the steering wheel. He couldn't let that happen.

All around the hospital, workers in hazmat suits were stopping cars and directing people to makeshift parking lots. As soon as Jack stopped the car, he, Faye, and Amanda were quickly ushered to the hospital, Amanda and Faye separated from Jack. As he waited in line with some other men, some looking very annoyed, others looking very nervous, Jack spotted his father walking back from the rooms. "Dad?"

"Jack?" his father said, turning to face him. "So, you got brought down here too...where's your mother?"

"Not sure, she was taken away by some other doctors for her...check-up, I guess," Jack said, noticing the bandage on his dad's arm. "So, are you...?"

"No! Of course not!" his father said, shaking his head. "I don't know what's going on, but I think I would know if I became pregnant. I'm going to go try and find your mother. Come and find me as soon as you can."

"Right," Jack nodded. As soon as his father walked away, Jack saw another familiar face. "Ian?"

"Hey, Jack, what's up!" Ian said with his usual ignorant, peppy tone. "This place is weird, right?"

"Yeah, I guess," Jack said, looking at Ian in semi-disbelief. "Are you cleared or-"

"Yeah, they said I was good to go a while ago. I'm just kind of lost," he said, looking around. "This place is pretty big...well, I'll see you later." Ian walked back down the hall, looking down two long corridors. "Let's see...heads I go left, tails I go right..."

---Amanda and Faye---

"Quadruplets...haven't seen anyone in your conditions yet," the doctor said curiously, applying ultrasound gel to the mound of belly in front of her. "Well, let's take a look first and then we'll know more."

"Okay," Amanda said in a tiny voice, holding her shirt up and looking down at her belly. Faye sat across from her, lying down, her belly already properly greased up. When the doctor was done, Amanda lay down and the doctor wheeled her chair between them, taking hold of two wands and rubbing their bellies.

"...yup, that's quadruplets alright, for both of you. And they're all well-developed. We wouldn't typically see fetuses this far along in pregnancies of this size and we especially wouldn't see them this healthy," the doctor said, nodding at the two screens. Faye smiled, always happy to see her babies on screen. Of course, she didn't need the doctor for this. She had her own ultrasound kit at home. Amanda, on the other hand, was a little more hesitant.

"I-I'm sorry, but our babies look like they're about the same size...but my OB/GYN before told me I was only three months along. Faye should have been pregnant twice as long as me," Amanda said. The doctor looked at the screen and shrugged.

"Well, the doctor was pretty far off base. You fit every metric we have for a six-month pregnant woman in terms of development."

Amanda took a deep breath and scratched her head nervously. What was going on?

"But, this could be the kind of thing the HHS is looking for: abnormal pregnancies and pregnancy developments. We'll probably have to keep you a bit longer for some more tests. But first," the doctor said, putting down the ultrasound wands and picking up another, unfamiliar tool. "One more quick test." She waved the wand over Faye and Amanda's bellies, nodding at the results. "Just as I suspected...you're both in our 'abnormal' category."

"Abnormal?" Faye and Amanda said simultaneously.

The doctor nodded. "We'd been getting some...odd energy readings from some women, typically those with multiple babies, but not everyone. We're not sure what it means yet, but we'll need to run some more tests on each of you."

"This is absurd," Faye said, sitting up slowly and shaking her head. "I'm not carrying some kind of sickness. I am a pregnant woman and I am a human being and I demand to be treated like one."

"Faye...I have been feeling strange during this pregnancy, like things aren't quite right," Amanda said, turning to face her neighbor. "I don't think it would be so bad if we had a few more tests. Besides, it would give me some more time to talk to you personally." Amanda's eyes narrowed and Faye smirked.

"Fine, I'll play along," Faye said, "But I demand to be out by the end of the day. I'm not staying in this hospital all night."

"Of course," the doctor said, opening the door and ushering for some more HHS officials to walk the two most-pregnant women in the building to another room.

"Tara?" Amanda said as she walked in the door.

"Amanda?" Tara said, lifting her head, her face lighting up a little. "They got you too, huh?"

"Well, I thought it might not hurt to check out things," Amanda said. "I guess it's all the women with lots of babies." Amanda turned to Mia, who was sitting across from Tara. "Aren't you the reporter who was covering all of this 'sudden pregnancy' news?"

"I was, until they shut me down," Mia scoffed, rubbing her own big belly. "If I wasn't carrying triplets, they'd probably let me out and I could get some more news out there," she looked down at her belly, feeling one of her babies kicking. "Not that I'm complaining about carrying triplets."

Faye smiled and sat down beside her. "I know, isn't carrying multiples just magical?" Faye moved her hand to Mia's belly.

"Faye, for now, let's just talk about earlier today," Amanda said, resting her hands on her belly.

---Jack---

"All clear," the doctor said, looking over Jack Jr.'s results. Jack shrugged and headed out the door. Well, that was informal, he thought, walking down the hall to try and find his dad, when he brushed against a familiar round form.

"Jessica?"
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack and Amanda are sent off to the hospital

choices: Let's spend some T.I.M.E. with P.E.A.R
Let's follow someone else trying to get a Blue Card.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Ian looked to the left.

Then he looked to the right.

Then he looked back to the left.

Then Ian realized that this wasn't the time to be indecisive. Reaching into his pocket, he pulled out the coin, scratched the stubble on his chin and said
""Let's see...heads I go left, tails I go right..."

It all looked the same to him, two very long corridors, jammed pack with armed guards dressed from head and toe to black armor, with a large red patch that read "HHS Sector 7", wearing gas masks and having a firm grip on shotguns and automatic weapons. Dozens of men and women sat in chairs, some of the women resting their hands on top of their massive pregnant bellies, other women poking small bulges in their midsection, other women looking annoyed or frightened. The men were either looking around nervously, or were exploring the expanding midsection quizzically, wondering if the impossible was very possible.

Doctors, nurses, and personal were moving back and forth between the pregnant and non-pregnant men and women, examining the patients, making notes, and just doing typical medical stuff in a very untypical medical situation.

"Every where I turn, pregnant women and fat guys! What the hell is going on around here!" Ian asked to himself, becoming slightly annoyed.

Don't worry about it. Left or Right. Heads or Tails FLIP ME. NOW. The voice in Ian's head commanded him with a gravely booming voice, evil and horrifying.

"Yeah, I guess I shouldn't worry. Here goes nothing!" Ian said, flicking the coin high up into the air, snatching it out of the air, and opening his hand to reveal it: Tails.

Ian looked to the left, he eyes falling on two people in Hazmat suits, an older doctor in his 50's, and a young nurse in her late 20's, talking and trading information. "Tails, I guess go right!" He said, turning towards the right hallway, when there was a clash of glass, a scream, and a commotion.

"MY INSIDES FEEL LIKE THERE ON FIRE!" The Hazmat screamed, her hand rushing toward her stomach, the action causing her to knock over a vase full of flowers to the ground where it rested in a dozen of little pieces.
"WHAT'S HAPPENING TO ME!" The older male doctor screamed as a distinct small curve formed in the midsection of his Hazmat suit.

The armed guards sprang into action, one guard grabbing her radio, her feminine voice muffled behind the gas mask. "CODE RED! CODE RED! CONFIRMED STORK VISIT ON FLOOR 1 AREA 3 SECTION 3B! ONE MALE AND ONE FEMALE! BEGIN IMMEDIATE LOCKDOWN AND DECON OF SUBJECTS! THIS IS NOT A DRILL! I REPEAT CODE RED!" Suddenly, the area was filled with screams for frightened men and woman, some pregnant some not, as a swarm of heavily armed gas-masked guards emerged from nowhere, guns raised at the two-rapidly expanding Hazmat workers.

"OH MY GOD! I CAN FEEL IT MOVING INSIDE ME!" The woman was screaming, bracing herself against the nurses station as her belly continued to swell, her yellow Hazmat suit now fitting her rapidly growing motherly form. Her braced her hands against her stomach, desperate to try to stop it from growing, but to no avail, as she quickly grew very pregnant.

"THIS CAN'T BE HAPPENING!" The man screamed behind his Hazmat suit, as he formally flat male midsection was replaced with a very pregnant looking belly. He ran a hand along the yellow surface of the suit, exploring his new midsection, trying to see if it was real, which it very very was.

The armed guards grabbed the two pregnant workers by the arms and dragged them towards an empty room, shouting orders and commands into their radios as an alarm klaxon suddenly blared, causing people to move their hands to their ears.

Ian was overcome with fear and ran. He ran away from the horrifying impossible things, deep into the left hallway, making turn after turn, rushing past more mobilizing squads of armed guards and running Hazmat officials as the ran to investigate this "gravid" new development.

Out of breath and out of energy (Ian always swore that he was going to get in shape.. for real this time) he ducked into a room to catch his breath. As he stopped panting looking at his legs, his eyes caught sight of something that well.. he just could not believe. What was once a simple conference room was turned into government spook command HQ. Arial photos of the town covered every section of the wall, along with dozens of sonograms, data on the town drinking water, other sorts of things the head government spook could need to isolate a town.

Intel briefing describing the incident from the mall a few days ago, as well what appeared to be black-and-white spy photos of men and women during various stages of pregnancy, taking out the trash, shopping, going in and out of work. Doctor's report from 9 months ago were scattered across the desk, Ian only catching glimpses of words such as "Medically impossible", and "She's beyond child-bearing age" and "Unable to have children" and "He's just like the other one. This can't be happening".

"What in the f--" Ian said to himself silently, digging through all the very important government spook stuff, his special idiot brain not understanding that this is something he should not be seeing.
Ian was reaching for another document when a loud noise outside the door, caused him to run into a nearby locker, nicely squeezing inside.
"Oh man this is just like a video game!" Ian said to himself inside the locker, imagining himself as a digital super secret agent.
"This is also really cliched" Was his next thought he spoke out loud, as the door opened, and a lean, fit, 60 year old woman with silver hair walked into, her uniformed gleaming with more medals than Ian has ever seen in his life.

Behind her, was another young soldier, reading off notes to hear. "I understand you concerns Second Lieutenant, but my orders stand" the woman said, taking a seat at her desk. "But Major, this is our best chance to understand what's happening hear. If we isolate the two of them, we can - - " The second LT was saying before being cut off.
"My orders stand Second Lieutenant. Is that clear? Or do I have to pull rank?" The major said in a stern voice that said she was all business
"I undestand Major Zavaleta" The man said, knowing his place and rank.

"Good. Now give me an update. What have we learned? Tell me everything. I need to understand how this - - - -" Major Zavaleta said, pointing her finger with great force to a sonogram hanging on the wall "ended up in the belly of a 40 year old banker named Ryan Martin!"
Ian was taken back so severely, he damn near banged his head on the back of the locker. That was his boss! And he was.. no, she had to be wrong!
"Well - - uh" The young Second Lieutenant was quite uncomfortable with dealing with the subject of males who were... well...
"Out with it!" She snapped.
"The best we can figure is.. We don't know." He was clearly nervous to be delivering that answers.
"The nations of the world don't pay us what they pay us for "We don't know". Tell me something you do now!" Major Zavaleta barked. She was a firm woman, military almost her whole life, trail blazing the woman's place in the military in her home country of the Ukraine, where she was born and raised.

When she was approached by the so-called "Sector 7" branch of the Ukrainian army for a special army, she accepted without hesitation, and was quickly ushered into a shadowy world of deniable ops. She said "Yes" one minute, and was a meeting in a underground bunker the next, being handed citizen to every major country in the world. After all, P.E.A.R was the best against these events.

Nicole Zavaleta never regretted her time with Paranormal Events Armed Response, a international shadow security force dedicated to the investigation, containment, and if necessary, extermination of events that were deemed "Beyond the norm" for any other kind of military task force.
P.E.A.R didn't just chase down drunk hillbillies who said they were probed by space aliens or some kids and a dog in their van who said they saw a ghost.. No.

P.E.A.R. dealt with the real paranormal threats that were a threat to international security. Like what you may ask? Well, she'd have to kill you if she told you.

This was something that Ian should not be seeing, but one misplaced flip and some unguided running later, here he was; hiding in a locker easing dropping on some shadowy international agency.

Ian was a special kind of idiot.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The temporary adventures of a special idiot.

choices: Jack and Jessica have a long talk, as does Faye and Amanda, Ian is questioned
Hmm, is there anyone else at the hospital right now?
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Well uh, what we do know is this" The young PEAR Second Lieutenant said, clearing his throat.
"It appears that any man who - - - uh" He was stumbling over the next few words.
"Became pregnant?" Nicole Zavaleta said, raising an eyebrow.
"Uh, yeah. Sorry, this makes me a little uncomfortable.." He said, clearly weirded out by everything happening around him.
"Suck it up. PEAR isn't paying you to pussyfoot around shit like this. These men are pregnant - - - Now say it"
The second LT gulped and repeated what he said.
"It appears that any man who - - became pregnant, is still biologically a man. Everything checks out.. Inside, outside. However, where's the man's empty abdominal cavity should be, is in fact, a healthy uterus, completely similar to a healthy female of childbearing age, and attached to everything that would be needed to sustain a healthy pregnancy" The LT said.
"Really?" Zavaleta said, staring at the sonogram attached to the wall.
"Yes. However.. it's deteriorating" The LT said.

Zavaleta spun on the heels of her boot to stare at the young LT. "What?" She asked.
"The uterus appears to deteriorating as the pregnancy goes about, slowly in some cases, faster in others, but they are all deteriorating. We have an early theory that as the pregnancy comes to a full term and the child is delivered, by C-Section off course, the uterus would completely deteriorate, leaving no trace of it behind. From some of the men we've examined, it appears that some are deteriorating at such a rate, we could estimate that the equivalent of a month is passing at a rapid rate, the uterus matching the size, weight, and health of a normal pregnant woman in that particular month of pregnancy" The LT was squirming, he did not like talking about this.

"And what about that doctor they just put into the Isolation Unit?" Zavaleta said, looking over all the notes in front of her.
"A quick sonogram showed that he appeared to be almost 8 months pregnant with a baby girl, the uterine deterioration occurring much slowly, almost as - - - " "It had been there for the past 8 months?" Zavaleta said, finishing his thought.
"Ma'am?" The LT questioned.
"What I'm about to say doesn't leave this room" Zavaleta stood up straight, smoothing out the wrinkles in her uniform. "Do you remember our orders?"
She asked the young LT.
"Yes Ma'am. To find the source of the mysterious pregnancies and make sure it doesn't spread from this location. I assume it's some kind of mutation or virus" He said.
She chuckled.
"Oh, ignorance must be bliss. What we're looking for isn't some kind of virus, or mutation, or some chemical in the water supply. What does P.E.A.R stand for?" She asked.
"Paranormal Event Armed Response" he answered.
"Very good. This is a paranormal event - - The most dangerous one we've ever encountered. So dangerous they've labeled it Class Omega." She said, her voice going low.
"Level Omega? Ma'am. Those don't exist. Those are just stories we tell the new recruits to scare them. You know- - - end of the world, apocalypse shit". The LT shifted when he spoke, he didn't like where this was going.
"And end of the world shit this is - - - Maybe not like that small radioactive undead uprising we dealt with back in Chernobyl all those years ago, but a different kind of end of the world shit still. The end of the world as WE know it. What do you think would happen if this spread outside the confines of this place? Men and women, old and young just getting pregnant? Especially men? Do you know what kind of massive changes that could cause? Men were only good for helping women have babies, but if men could have babies.. Well, you dod the societal breakdown math on that one. And what about population control?" Zavaleta was painting a grim picture indeed, and she was a master painter.

"I think I see ma'am.. Society as we know it would change" The LT said.
"And not for the better." Zavaelta said.
"So what are looking for here? You seem to know - - - " The LT asked.
"This" She said, clicking a button, which turned on a project, which displayed, larger than life - - - the coin.

"Oh... shit" Ian said to himself, looking on through the slits in the locker.
"Ma'am? Is that a - - - "
"Coin? Yes. Meet Omega 01, and this little son of a bitch has been causing trouble like this for almost 200 hundred years... at least since we've been around" She said, staring at it.
"You mean -- " The LT said putting the pieces together.
"This little thing is responsible for our founding. It all started two hundred years ago when the coin was causing trouble around Europe, making some very important people very angry... Even killed a few of them when the men couldn't realize what was happening to them. Soon afterwords, P.E.A.R was privately funded by some of the riches people in Europe to hunt down and destroy the coin. This organization grew quickly, the founders using their vast wealth and influence to get it seated into the deepest reaches of the world's government, all dedicated to searching for and destroying this thing.

The mission changed over time, as PEAR discovered that were other things that go bump in the night than some coin that knocks people up. You've seen the things that are out there. The things that people read about in books, watch on TV, or see in the movies, they're real. But this... This is something else entirely." She stared at the photo of the coin, trying to unlock it's secrets.

"So, when you say we're here to locate the source - - -" The LT said.
"We're here to find this coin and contain it." Zavaleta said.
"Contain? Not destroy? Isn't destroying it the whole purpose of PEAR?" The LT asked.
Zavaleta laughed.

"Maybe sometime ago, but this coin represents else entirely - - Magic. In it's most pure form" Zavaleta said.
The LT scoffed very loudly.
"You laugh? So did alot of people. But think about it - - - It has the ability to make men, MEN, pregnant. That's the highest form of magic possible. Imagine if we could just harness just a sliver of it! PEAR could use it with the world governments to help solve problems like pollution, global warming, crime, war.. We could use the magic that was once so prevalent in this world to reshape it to our liking. No longer would man have to adapt to survive the world, the world would have to adapt to us!" Zavaleta was getting almost excited.
"Magic used to exist long ago. It was said that when man first made fire, it was with a flick of his hand. Did you ever think about how a barbaric society such as ours survived to thrive and become what we are today? Luck? No. Magic.
But it left - - - And as it left, so did our hope of being a better race. Wars, hatered, pollution, destruction.. All followed. But now - - We have a chance. A chance to reclaim our birthright!" Zavaleta shouted at the top of her lungs, almost expecting a patriotic display of fireworks to erupt behind her.

"So we find the coin and we're done here?" The LT asked.
"Yes. It's close. We've always been two-steps behind it. But that display out there just now shows that it's close! Find it! Get it into containment!" Zavaleta said, turning her attention back to the documents on her desk.
"And what about the pregnant women and uh- - men" He asked.
"We'll leave some doctors and nurses behind to help with the births. Anyone who has a kid that's either male or over childbearing age must sign a strict NDA agreement in exchange for an almost never-ending supply of checks. Anyone who doesn't sign, doesn't get a check." Zavaleta ordered.
"Do you think that will be enough?" The LT asked.
"Cover-ups are more simple than they appear to be. Wag a big enough check in front of anyone and they tend to forget things. Besides, do you think some 50 year old woman or some 20 something man wants to tell the world their pregnant? Let them send all the photos to their online friends they want, no-one will ever believe them. This has all happened before, and there's a reason nobody ever talks about it. Now get to work" Zavaleta said, dismissing the man.

Zavaleta turned her attention back to the photo of the coin on the wall. "You'll soon be mine.. And with it.. The children I always wanted. Damn this job for taking my child-bearing years." She was almost taunting the coin, daring it. "Agents couldn't have children they said; for the longest time. Of course they only said to the woman - - - Discriminatory pigs. The field is not the place for a warrior woman whose waddling. That was their own words.
So I accepted it as part of the job. But now - - - Have all the children you want! We'll keep you and your unborn safe! Funny the things some lawsuit can accomplish - - - But it was too late for me.. But now, before we unlock your secrets - - - You will give me the children I always wanted, age be damned! You hear me you Omega level piece of shit. Everything I want will be mine: Children, Magical Weaponry, Clean Air - - World Peace. After all, I need to make a better place for the next generation." She was talking down to the photo, as if it would respond to her and give her what she wanted.

It was at this time that Ian had to sneeze. So he did, without even trying to cover it. Ian was a special kind of idiot.

Zavaleta turned her attention to the locker, and walked towards it, her sidearm unholstered and pointing at exactly where Ian's head would be.
"WHOSEVER IN THEIR COME OUT NOW. I WILL NOT TELL YOU A SECOND TIME BEFORE I KILL YOU WHERE YOU HIDE!"

Slowly, Ian emerged from the locker, hands above his head.
"Who are you?" Zavaleta barked at him, prepared to kill him at any moment.
"Uh, I'm Ian. And I uh, I think this is yours." Ian said, as he reached into his pocket and pulled out the coin, hoping it would spare his life.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Let's spend some T.I.M.E. with P.E.A.R

choices: Heads - Reality Shift and other goings-on in the hospital
Tails - No Reality Shift and other goings-on in the hospital
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Zavaleta blinked, a little taken aback, but not dropping her gun. "Excuse me?"

"Here's your old coin or whatever it was," Ian said, re-offering the coin in his outstretched hand. "One of my friends gave it to me, but I don't really care about. You can have it."

Zavaleta took a few, cautious steps forward, dropping one hand and slowly reaching out, snapping the coin out of Ian's hand and checking it as she stepped back. "My god...how did you get this?"

"Like I said, my friend gave it to me. But you want it for your, like, history report or something?" Ian said, surprisingly spacey and relaxed for someone with a gun pulled on them in a militarized hospital. "I kind of...spaced out after you talked about Europe and...20 years ago."

"...200 years," Zavaleta said, squinting confused at this young man in front of her. It slowly dawned on her: this kid was an idiot. "How did you get in here?"

"The door."

"Are you pregnant?"

"What? No!" Ian said, shaking his head. "Men can't get pregnant."

"You don't watch a lot of news, do you boy?" Zavaleta said, holstering her weapon. "Alright, get out of here and don't tell anyone what you heard, do you understand?"

"I barely remember what we were just talking about now," Ian said, walking to the door. "And good luck on having a baby. My friend's mom is old like you and she got knocked up, so there's still hope."

"Out," Zavaleta growled, and Ian slipped out. Opening up her hand, Zavaleta traced the coin in her hand. "At last...and to think, it was that easy."

I liked him better, the coin rumbled, not exactly thrilled with its new owner.

---Jack---

"How, um, did the doctors say anything to you?" Jack said, nervously trying to start a conversation with Jessica.

"Everything was fine. Looks like it's twins," Jessica said quietly, one hand rubbing her mid-sized belly, her eyes narrowing on Jack a little.

"Me too," Mariah said in an even quieter tone, peeking at Jack behind Jessica, her hands wrapped around her pregnant orb.

"Well, I'm glad everything's healthy," Jack said with a sigh. "So can we...talk?" Jessica rolled her eyes and turned back to Mariah.

"What do you think?" she whispered to her friend.

"I dunno...what do you feel like?" Mariah whispered back. Jessica sighed and turned back to Jack.

"Alright, let's go find a place to sit," Jessica said, looking around and seeing nothing but halls of pregnant people and flat-bellied people, some of them annoyed, others with a stunned look, like they were just given a very startling piece of news (especially the guys). "Somewhere private."

The three of them wandered around the hospital until they found a few seats by a vending machine. Jessica helped Mariah into one and then sat down beside her, turning to Jack. "I'd feel better if Mariah was here."

Jack nodded and sighed. "Jessica, I'm so...sorry, Jessica. I love you. I really, really love you and I should have told you how I felt and I should never have gotten close to...to anyone else."

"Then why did you, Jack," Jessica said, crossing her arms. "You're sorry, great. But if this is how you feel, if you understand that what you did was really fucked up, then why did you do it?"

"Because it hurt when you said you didn't feel that way about me. I've loved you ever since high school and it...crushed me when you said-" Jessica reached her hand over and cut Jack off.

"Okay, you're...you're right, it was wrong of me to say that. But less than a day later, you hook up with someone else? Has this been going on the entire time we've been hanging out? After all, your mom said she was your neighbor," Jessica said.

Jack shook his head. "No, no, that was...it just came out of nowhere. She started coming on to me and started talking to me about pregnancy and-"

Jessica cut him off again. "What?"

Jack sighed, his face turning bright red. "S-she brought up some old memories of mine and now I see that I...have a pregnancy fetish. A big one." Now it was Jessica's turn to blush. Mariah looked away, her own face turning red as she wrapped her arms around her huge belly.

"So you only liked me because I'm pregnant?" Jessica stuttered, a little taken aback by Jack's admission.

"No, of course not! You're...amazing, you're funny, you're smart, and you've always been beautiful," Jack said, gulping nervously. "B-but, yeah, you look even more beautiful pregnant."

Jessica bit her lip and turned back to Mariah before leaning in close to Jack. "A-actually, I've always fantasized about being pregnant. I...hold on." Jessica reached into her purse and brought out her laptop, handing it to Jack and opening up the video she took of herself. Watching it, Jack's eyes bulged (and it wasn't the only thing that bulged). "I...I'm not entirely ready to forgive you yet, but I like you, Jack, and I want to see if I can give you another chance."

"P-please," Jack whimpered, leaning in close to Jessica, their foreheads meeting. They each smiled a little, Jessica brushing her nose against Jack's before leaning back.

"But your neighbor just pounced on you? Has anything like that ever happened before?" Jessica said, hung up on that part of the story.

Jack shrugged. "No, she's always been really warm and nice, but I never got the idea that she 'liked' me. I don't know what got into her. Maybe hormon-"

"Don't say it," Jessica said, giving Jack an annoyed look. "Although...since being pregnant, I do get pretty horny sometimes..."

"I...think I might know why it happened," Mariah said, turning to the two of them. "Well, she was our original suspect for stealing the book, right? And this book is connected to Jack's coin, yeah? Well, if she was the one who took the book, maybe she wanted Jack's coin too." Jack and Jessica nodded. It made sense. "And the little bit of her I saw...she did look like the woman at the bookstore."

"Well, let's find her and we can know for sure," Jessica said, pushing down on the chair to help her stand up. "Jack, lead the way."

---Amanda and Faye---

"All I asked Jack to do was paint my nursery," Faye smiled, stroking her belly slowly. "I'm sorry, I don't know what's the matter with that."

"Well, something else must have happened," Amanda said, cradling her own, equally enormous belly. "He came home angry and in tears, his relationship with a young girl, who he got pregnant, ruined."

"So, he really did knock her up," Faye purred, rubbing her fingertips in circles on her underbelly. "Interesting."

"Faye!"

"Alright, alright, I told him the story you told me about Jack and his...interest in pregnant women. It got him embarrassed and he left and I imagine he ruined his relationship with that poor girl on his own."

Amanda sighed and narrowed her eyes. "I don't entirely trust you, but it sounds about right." Faye grinned, happy to have fooled her friend. "But, I don't like you embarrassing my son like that. You'll have to apologize to him. Maybe over that dinner you talked about."

"Sounds perfect," Faye smiled, leaning back a little, resting her hands on the bit of bed behind her, emphasizing her belly even more. "So, how have you been? The doctor's diagnosis sounded a little...odd."

"It's nothing," Amanda said softly, rubbing her belly. "I guess the other doctor just made a mistake. Looks like we'll have our babies at roughly the same time...two pairs of quadruplets on the same days. The hospital is going to have a field day with us..."

"Well, I'm still excited to carry my babies in my arms, although I do love having them in my belly too," Faye smiled, rubbing her round tummy as her smile soon faded. "Yeah, it's going to be a big family, alright..."

"Is something wrong at home?" Amanda asked, scooting forward a little, her belly only centimeters from Faye's.

Faye sighed. "Charles cheated on me. A few months before I got pregnant and knocked some other floozy up and now she's staying with us or else she'll sue Chuck for child support."

Amanda gasped. "Oh my god, Faye, why didn't you tell me? I'm so sorry! Do you...know who the other woman is? Have you met her yet?"

"I've seen her once," Faye said, "And she-" With that, the door opened and two hazmaters escorted Amber in.

"Hey, when can I get out of here?" Amber protested, turning around and looking at Faye, her eyes narrowing. "Do I know you from somewhere?"

"Yes, I believe you do," Faye said with a sinister smile. "Here, sit down with us. In fact, everyone gather around," Faye said, motioning for Tara and Mia. "Let's all just chat, as moms-to-be."

---Zavaleta---

"The power to control...everything. In my hands," Zavaleta said, holding the coin up to the light, inspecting its two sides. "Population, food supply, the planet's economics, war, energy."

No one can control me, the coin rumbled again, sensing Zavaleta's motives.

"Oh, you can talk? Interesting," Zavaleta grinned, walking into the office's private bathroom, stripping out of her clothes. For a woman in her 60s, decades of rigorous discipline and exercise kept her body toned and healthy. Looking into the mirror, Zavaleta held up the coin. "Now, for a first test, I'll have the family I always wanted."

No one can control me, the coin bellowed, its magic surging. You are not the One, you are not the Servant, you are not the Fool. Testing me will end poorly for you.

It was too late. Zavaleta flipped the coin, gleefully catching it as she looked at herself in the mirror.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Tense discussions all around

choices: A long day at the hospital winds down
Anyone not at the hospital yet who should be?
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Now, let's see just what you can d-" Zavaleta said, her smile quickly fading into a look of shock as she felt a sudden heat well up inside her abdomen. She reached down, dropping the coin into her sink, where it spun around and fell on "tails" again. The warmth increased, spreading throughout her body but clearly originating between her hips. She reached to her middle intuitively, feeling her clothes suddenly get much tighter. The military issue uniform already didn't afford her much room, but now it was unbearable and Zavaleta could see the fabric swell, it a brief stopping point when *snap* the belt gave way and the elderly woman's belly continued to expand. "O miy̆ boh!"

Zavaleta stumbled back, looking in disbelief at her swelling belly, already torn through all her clothes and forcing the rest of her uniform to compensate to its size. In no time, Zavaleta appeared overdue with one baby, her round, pale belly reaching out just to the end of her fingertips. But, the expansion didn't stop there. Zavaleta's belly continued to grow and grow as she slowly slid to the floor, wrapping her hands around as much of her growing womb as she could. She didn't have to wonder whether or not she was pregnant: her belly was livid with kicks and movement of an unspecified number of babies that seemed to be growing every thirty seconds.

"Th-this isn't-"
No one can control me the coin echoed out, its words reaching its other two owners.

---Faye---
Faye paused, running her hand over her belly cautiously. She felt her babies shifting around, but in a slightly different way that usual. Oof, what was that? she wondered.
Focus. The woman who ruined your life is here.
Of course, Faye purred, turning her suspicious gaze back to Amber. "So, did the doctors tell you anything? How is everything?" Faye reached out her hand to Amber's belly, petting it strongly. "After all, those are my husbands' children in there."

"Faye, please," Amanda said, caressing her own belly. The five women managed to arrange themselves in a little circle, per Faye's suggestion. The "fun discussion" about future parenthood was not going to a great start, it seemed. Tara and Mia were both clearly uncomfortable with the way the conversation had gone, but both were also eyeing Faye and Amanda's bellies curiously, unable to believe that they were both only six months pregnant.

"They're as big as us," Tara whispered to Mia. "And we're almost due with triplets. Imagine what they'll look like at the end."
"Two women with quadruplets and they're neighbors," Mia said, shaking her head. "That would make a great human interest story. If I could just get in contact with my producers..."

"I didn't know he was married when we...it was a party and not everything was clear," Amber said, holding her hands protectively over her belly, moving away from Faye's hand. "I am sorry that it has turned out this way and I know that moving in with you is not ideal. Believe me, I am not crazy about it either. But I have to do what is best for my babies."
"What's best for your babies," Faye repeated with a smirk. "And what about my babies?" Faye rolled up her shirt to show off her full, round belly. "How do you imagine it will feel for them to grow up in a house where they're raised alongside someone else's children? How do I explain to them that their daddy loved someone else more than mommy?"
"Faye, please!" Amanda repeated, putting her hand on Faye's bare belly. "This isn't...the right time to have this kind of conversation. We're tired, we're emotional, we're a little scared being in this hospital. How about this: Amber, come have dinner at my home. Faye will be there, we can all discuss things there."

Amber took a deep breath. "Well, thank you very much, Mrs..."
"Dale. Amanda Dale."
Amber furrowed her brow. "Your son wouldn't be...Jake Dale, would it?"
"Yes, he is!" Amanda said with gleeful surprise. "How do you know that?"
"This just keeps getting better and better," Amber said, rolling her eyes.

---Jack---
Jack shuddered, reaching into his pocket for the coin. "Something's going on. Something feels wrong."
"What's up?" Jessica asked, turning to look at the coin. "We ran into two women a few hours ago who seemed to know about you and the coin. They said you'd have some sort of 'connection' with it."
"Well, I can't figure out anything," Jack said, putting the coin back in his pocket. "Two women?...wait, was one sort of darker skinned and one was...um-"
"Big-breasted?" Jessica said, raising one eyebrow.
"R-red-headed, but I think we're talking about the same people," Jack said. "They're some sort of secret society out to get rid of the coin. They're the ones who gave me the book in the first place."

And, sure enough, Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart walked down the hallway, escorted by a number of hazmat-suited doctors and armed guards. "Why do we have to go?" Ms. Smart protested, her arms held by hazmaters.
"We told you: you both have very peculiar readings. Different from the ones we've seen before," one doctor said, taking some notes on a clipboard as the two pregnant agents of good were guided along.

"H-hey! You're Ms. Apple and Ms...Quick?" Jack yelled, getting up and running over to the two women.
"It's Ms. Smart, but a lot of people seem to get that codename mixed up," Ms. Smart yelled back out of habit, turning around to face Jack. "Hey, you're the guy! We need to talk with you again!"
"Get back," one of the guards grunted, pushing Jack back with his rifle.
"There's another coin!" Ms. Apple yelled back at Jack as she and Ms. Smart were moved further down the hall. "There's two others! Try to find them! Your friends said they have a lead!"
"And our real names are-" Ms. Smart tried to yell before the guards opened a door and swiftly moved them in, closing the door behind them.
"All three of you: if you've been cleared, leave this floor now," the doctor with the clipboard barked at our trio. Jack and Jessica helped Mariah up and they ran off as quickly as they could.

"What did she mean?" Jack asked his two pregnant comrades once they'd gotten somewhere safe.
"Whoever took the book must have had a coin," Jessica panted, her hand under her belly. "She made Mariah like...this."
Mariah gave a little smile and rubbed her underbelly. "Look on the bright side: we can knock out two birds with one stone. We can get the book and one of the other coins. Wow, this feels like such a weird adventure." Mariah looked down at her belly. "Although...this doesn't happen in too many Indiana Jones movies."
"Hey, we're going to be okay," Jessica smiled at Mariah, giving her belly a gentle rub. "We're going to fix all of this, and even if we don't...we'll have each other for support." Jessica turned and smiled at Jack. "Won't we?"
Jack nodded, blushing with a little smile. "Of course."

---Amanda---
Two more heavily pregnant women entered the room, each looking quite cross. Amanda smiled and beckoned them over. "It's okay, come join us. For now, we're all just talking...wait, didn't you both come to my home?"
"Ah, Mrs. Dale," Ms. Apple said with a surprised look. "We didn't think we'd run into you again."
"Any luck on your study on that coin of my son's?" Amanda said. Faye turned to the two women slowly, her eyes narrowing.
"Coin?" Faye said. Ms. Smart turned to Faye, noticing an odd look in the massively pregnant woman's gaze.
"Yyyes, we're doing anthropological research on a rare coin Mrs. Dale's son has," Ms. Smart said. "Do you know Mrs. Dale's son?"
"A bit," Faye smiled, running her fingertips down the side of her breasts. "But tell me more about this coin of his. I'm very curious now."
Amanda turned to her neighbor. "But Faye, on the way to the mall, didn't you-"

The door burst open and filled with guards and hazmat-wearing doctors, one in particular walking in, front-and-center. "Alright, we will now be performing our tests. Don't worry: these are safe and once they are done, you can go home and rejoin your loved ones. We'll go in alphabetical order...Ms. Azem?"
Tara heaved herself up, steadied by Mia's arms, and waddled out the door. From there, the guards took her into a wide-open room that looked like it had been converted from an operating room.
Only a few doctors were still in the room. "Undress down to your underwear, please," the main doctor said, smiling politely. Tara was a little surprised by the request, but went along with it, moving out of her maternity clothes until she stood in front of the doctors in just underwear, her massive belly totally exposed.
"Now then," the doctor said, taking out some more medical equipment. "Just relax and breathe normally." The doctor brought out a long tube with a small nozzle. It began making a sucking noise and the doctor wiggled it around Tara's belly button until the suction affixed it to her roundness. "And we'll have these readings momentarily."
Tara sighed, the sensation of the machine feeling very strange. Her babies swam and rolled around in her womb, encouraging Tara to rub.
"Please, hands at your side," the doctor said in a monotone, looking at a computer screen. "This will be overly shortly."

A few minutes later, the doctors removed the device and had Tara lie back on the operating table, the doctor running her hands over Tara's belly. "Where is Commander Zavaleta?" the doctor asked.
The others shrugged. "She's shut herself back in her quarters. We never bother her when that happens," one of them said.
The doctor rolled her eyes. "This is why I don't like strangers in my hospital. Alright, Ms. Azem, you can go, I suppose. Thank you for your cooperation."
"You're welcome," Tara whimpered, heaving herself up. The doctor handed Tara's clothes back to her.
"Alright, send in the next ones."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Tails - No Reality Shift and other goings-on in...

choices: Amanda's exam, Zavaleta's large fate, family dinner, mall date with Jessica
I'm not ready to leave the hospital yet. Find me a subcharacter to follow!
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
- - - - Jack - - - - -

Jack couldn't take his eyes off of Jessica. She was a glowing picture of womanly beauty. When Jack first agreed to meet with her, she was just a girl, but now, looking at her with her ample maternal curves, her seemingly glowing skin, her soft luscious hair, she was no longer a girl, but a woman.

She was a damn fine woman, and Jack was a damn lucky man. Damned lucky by the fact that he was given a second chance; a second chance to be there for her and with her, and another chance to fix this mess he'd inadvertently gotten himself (and lots and lots of other people by the bulging midsections of the women and men around him) into to.

His mind drifted, wondering if this was all real. He's heard of people having almost seemingly realistic dreams and nightmares - - Couldn't this be one? Looking around, it certainly could be one, looking at the women and the... men affected by the coin.

That damned coin.

Yet, as Jessica stared into his very soul, a smile at the corner of her lips, her hands gripping the great circular mound of her belly, Jack wondered... Could you go through Hell to get through Heaven?

"Jack" her voice was soft, warm, inviting. Jack was hers... And that's all he ever wanted to be.

His eyes wandered south of her face to her ample.. tracks of land that rested gently atop her life orb, it's taught flesh hanging delicately out of her BooksBooksBooks uniform.. Jack felt as if love smacked him upside the head.

It was actually Jessica that smacked him upside the head for paying attention to all of the right parts at the absolute worst time.

Close enough for Jack.

"Jack! Eyes up here! Focus!" Jessica said, assuming her "Mom" tone easily, perhaps preparing herself if Jack's, Mariah's, and Jessica's noble crusade failed.
"Uh, sorry, I uh" Jack said, trying to recover.
"Behave yourself and maybe, MAYBE, we can talk about... giving that particular part of relationship a second chance as well. But for right now, we need to find that woman" Jessica said, taking charge.
"Uh-Right." Jack said, getting his head back into the game.

He looked around the packed halls of the militarized hospital, his eyes fighting to avoid the ample midsections of the lady and the.. well, he just tried to avoid the men who were in.. "a family way" all together.

His eyes fell on a tall gas-masked soldier with a large assault rifle grasped firm in his hand, talking to a hazmat soldier. Jack took off to try to talk to one of these doctors when he had the chance.

"Uh - excuse me" he said, lightly tapping the hazmat doctor on the shoulder. The hazmat suited man turned around as though he was just bitten by some horrible undead creature, his reaction so severe, the masked guard, pushed the doctor aside, and raised his rifle directly parallel to Jack's head.
"STAND DOWN IMMEDIATELY CITIZEN. YOU WILL BE SEEN BY A TRAINED MEDICAL PHYSICIAN WHEN THEY GET TO YOU. FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH BE MET WITH ARMED RESPONSE. RETURN TO YOUR SEAT AND AWAIT YOUR TURN. THIS IS YOUR ONLY WARNING. I AM FULLY AUTHORIZED TO USE DEADLY FORCE. RETURN TO YOUR SEAT. YOU HAVE 20 SECONDS TO COMPLY!" The masked guard barked behind his mask, the red target laser decorating the middle of Jack's forehead like a bright red zit on prom night.

"Okay" was all Jack could squeak out before he felt a soft hand on his shoulder. "Hey, we already saw the doctor. We're looking for someone. What was her name?" Jessica asked looking at Jack. "Uh, Faye Jones. She came with my mom, Amanda Dale." The Hazmat Doctor looked at the Guard, who looked back at him. "Look, I don't have time for this. I still have a whole lot of people I need to examine. If you've seen the doctor, get your Blue Card and get the hell out of here. Don't just wait around for people. We have too many people in such a small space. I don't know why you didn't get your card after your exam, but your name is logged into the system. Get your card, get the hell out." The hazmat doctor said before turning his attention away from the Jessica and Jack.

"That doesn't help us, we're looking - - - " Jessica started to say again before "YOU HEARD THE MAN. GET YOUR BLUE CARDS AND GET OUT." The faceless gas-mask goon barked assuming a hostile stance.
"We'll go now" Jack said grabbing Jessica's hand "Come along.. honey" Jack said making up a quick cover.

Jack, Jessica, and Mariah checked in at a front desk, and after a few moments of waiting, they were delivered their Blue Cards. "Dale Jr, Jack: Blue Card." Jack took his card as receptionist looked at Mariah and Jessica for a few moments. "Blue Cards with Pink Stickers; the both of you. The pink stickers means you have to check back here EVERY 24 hours for a new sticker. If you don't have a new sticker every 24 hours; it WILL be bad".
Mariah and Jessica took a long hard look at their card with a "Oh yay" look on their face.

"Meet me later tonight Jack. I want us to go to the mall." Jessica said. "The mall? We have to talk to Faye. We have to - - - " Jack said, trying to recap the desperate situation. "I know Jack. But, we can't make a play for the book tonight. She would be expecting that. Give a day to cool off and feel safe - - - " Jessica explained.

"Then we strike! Go Team Awesome!" Mariah said, jumping up a little bit with a surprising grace for a very pregnant woman in ill-fitting clothing. "Sorry, got a little too excited. I'll think off the plan to get the book. I'm good at this kind of stuff" Mariah said, taking on the very "Velma" personality for this mystery solving team, all they needed was a van and a talking dog.

Jessica leaned in a gave Jack as kiss on the check. "Text me later. The mall tonight. Don't forget." Jessica said, waddling off to get processed out to the exit. Jack smiled as he walked his way to another long line of men and women who were slowly but surely making their way out of the hospital. Looking around he saw plenty of pregnant woman and some pregnant men in another line across from him. An immense wave of guilt ran over him, as he counted the seemingly unending fruits of the coin's endeavors.

"This is all my fault" Jack said to himself quietly, before being pushed forward by the woman behind him. Jack just listened to the chaos spreading around him, remembering back to what Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple said to him what seemed like days ago.
I've got to find them after all this.. But I'm supposed to go out with Jessica tonight.. And then there's Faye Jack mind raced as he overheard the cellphone conversations of the people around him.

"No honey. I'm all clear. I know, thank goodness. We're getting ready to retire!" Said an older woman talking into her cell-phone, her blue card clearly without a pink sticker.
Jack just listened as the line moved.

"Uh hi Mom. It's Derek. No, I'm good. Look, I was wondering... Do uh, do you still have Mike's clothes from about a few years ago? The ones he left behind before he lost all that weight? You do? Could I-uh, borrow them for a little while? No-uh reason. Well, uh.. if you really wanted to know" The mid-20's man on his cellphone said, slowly looking at himself in a full length mirror mounted onto the wall. A single finger slowly went to a small but noticeable bulge in his midsection, one that clearly not meant for the size of shirt he was currently wearing. "Remember when you said you always wondered when you would get Grandkids? Well uh - - - Look, could you and Dad just come out for a little while? There's something you - uh - really need to see. And could you bring some of your famous peanut-butter chocolate chip cookie bars? I have such a craving for something really sweet. Thanks Mom. I'll see you and dad in two days." The man was clearly taken back by what was happening to him, his blue card with a bright visible pink sticker telling everyone whatever they really needed to know.

The line moved forward still.

"I don't know what we're going to tell them! Sweetie, I'm just as shocked as you are! I mean, they're graduating High School soon! I don't know if I can do this for a third time! Of course not! Don't ever mention that again! I don't know. Let's go out for dinner tonight the four of - - - the five of us. We can tell the girls then. At least we still have the baby stuff in storage, score one for never throwing out anything! I love you too. I know.. Just promise you'll still love me when I'm good and huge!" One older woman said, breaking the news to her husband.

"Card?" The gas-mask wearing armed guard asked Jack. "Uh.." Jack mind blanked. "CARD! NOW!" The guard barked, before Jack, realizing he had his Blue Card in his left hand. The guard snatched it from Jack's hand and scanned it. "Blue Card Verified. Status: Non-Pink. You are free to move about the city as normal citizen, but be advised that your blue card is required to be with you at all times. You will be stopped frequently and if you do not have your Blue Card with you... Well, you don't wanna know. Now get the hell out of here." The guard said, handing the Blue Card back to Jack, before pushing him forward out the doors of the hospital.

Jack thought of a witty comeback, but thought better of antagonizing a faceless thug with a gun, so he just sighed instead, and waited by the car, texting Jessica until his Mom came out.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: A long day at the hospital winds down

choices: A Not-At-All Awkward Dinner with Amanda, Faye, Jack, and Amber
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Next, Mrs. Dale," a guard called. Amanda looked over at Faye and gave her a weak smile, heaving her heavy, pregnant body up and trying to steady herself. She wasn't quite sure where her center of gravity was now, but if she had to guess, it'd likely be somewhere in the almost 33 cubic feet of belly she had attached to her. Of course, walking and standing were not impossible tasks for Amanda. It impressed her how much pregnant belly should could actually carry, but she also hoped it wouldn't eventually overtake her. After all, Amanda had resigned that when she woke up the next morning, her belly would be much bigger than it is now.

Like Tara, Amanda was escorted into a room that looked like it was used for operations and ordered to strip down to her underwear. Unlike Tara, she needed help from her doctor, who seemed a little too eager to get her enormous pregnant patient down to just a bra and panties. The same nozzle was affixed to Amanda's popped-out belly button and the machine whirred along. Amanda squeaked softly as the device attached itself. Her navel had become pretty sensitive over the course of the pregnancy and this was certainly not a delicate procedure. The machine's suction constantly teased the tip of her belly and Amanda bit her lips, trying not to make any other tiny moans or noises. It was a little bit embarrassing for Amanda, but since finding out she was pregnant, she noticed that her sex drive was where it was in her 20s and she'd never felt as sensitive as she did now.

When the machine finished, the doctor sighed and detached the nozzle, looking over the results on her computer screen. "Hmm...definitely lower than for Ms. Azem." The doctor turned to Amanda. "Mrs. Dale, you and Ms. Azem work in the same office, correct?" Amanda nodded. "Is there anything you were both exposed to that perhaps Ms. Azem would have had more exposure to?"
Amanda squinted and thought about it as she reached for her top. "I can't think of anything. I did have to help my son drive her to the hospital a few days ago, if that's relevant information."
"Yes, we know about that," the doctor said, stroking her chin. "Well, thank you very much for your time. You can exit and get your blue card now. Remember: because you're pregnant, you'll need to check back in here every 24 hours. It will just be a routine check-up, nothing to worry about."

Amanda curtly thanked the doctor, wanting to get out and get back home as soon as she could. After struggling to get fully dressed again, getting no help from her doctor this time around, Amanda waddled out the door, where she was immediately met by guards. "Follow us," one of them said in a stoic tone, walking Amanda to the nearest elevator. The hallways were now mostly cleared, apart from guards and other hazmat-wearing workers, and Amanda looked around, sighing and cradling her belly. She didn't think she should be treated like this, especially as old as she was, but it was clear that this was all a situation beyond her control or input. The best thing to do now was to get home to her two Jacks.

Speaking of which, right in front of the elevator, Amanda saw Jack, Jessica, and another, unfamiliar girl who was heavily pregnant. Far more than Jessica. "Jack?"
He turned. "Mom! Dad and I had no idea where you were. How are-" Jack stopped, looking at each of the guards. "What's going on? Are you okay?"
"Yes, I'm fine. I'm getting my discharge card now and I-"
"No more talking," one of the guards said in a direct tone, pressing the "down" button hard and turning to Jack and his two pregnant comrades. "If you both have your cards, leave the hospital. Use a different elevator car."
Jack stood there, stunned. He finally found his mom and she was being kept from him. "It's okay. I'll find you and your father as soon as this is over," Amanda said with a confident smile. The elevator doors opened and her whole group bustled in. "Don't worry!" She managed to call out as the doors closed.

Inside the elevator, Amanda let out a long sigh. I'd better get out of here soon, Amanda thought, looking down at her huge belly. She could see the little bumps of kicks and movement across her shirt's fabric. I'm sure I will. There can't be anything infectious or wrong with me that would keep me here... Then, another thought crossed Amanda's mind. Did Jack get another one of his friends pregnant? I've never seen that short-haired girl before. Oh, Jack...I can't believe I'm going to be a grandmother and a mother at the same time.

---Faye---
"Mmm," Faye squealed as the nozzle's suction pulled on her sensitive belly button. After not getting any release with Jack earlier in the day, the testing process was close to putting her over the edge. The doctor wasn't totally unaware of this, her face turning red as she looked between the computer screen and Faye's blissful face. Still, something managed to catch the doctor's attention.
"Mrs. Jones..." the doctor began, taking off Faye's nozzle. "Your readings are very strange. You have a similar reading that Mrs. Dale had. Not surprising at first, since you both have the same number of fetuses, but there's a kind of...potential energy behind the readings too. Like it could spike at any minute. Now, we're not sure what these energy readings correlate to yet, but," the doctor sighed and looked for the right words. "Is there anything you're doing right now that maybe you and Mrs. Dale or Ms. Azem did together that they stopped but you're continuing?

End this discussion now.

"No, nothing I can think of," Faye smiled, stroking one hand gingerly up and down her belly. The doctor sighed and nodded.
"Alright, you're free to go then, Mrs. Jones. The guards will take you to get your blue card now. Remember: you need to check in with us every 24 hours."
"Of course," Faye smiled, wrapping her robe back around her huge belly, with plenty of bare skin still showing.

As the guards escorted Faye out, one of the other hazmat-wearing officials approached the doctor. "Doctor, given these irregular readings, do you really think these patients should be allowed to leave so easily?"
"Relax. The HHS people have tracking devices in all of the pink stickers. We'll be able to keep tabs on these preggos," the doctor said with a grin. "I-I mean, these pregnant patients." Clearing her throat, the doctor turned back toward the rest of the room. "Speaking of the HHS, what is going on with the Commander? She made such a big stink about being at these inspections but I haven't heard anything from her."
"We'll have someone check in on her," one of the hazmaters nodded, fishing out a cell phone.
"Good. In the meantime, send in the next patient."

---Nicole Zavaleta---
*Knock Knock Knock* "Commander Zavaleta? The inspections and tests on the irregular patients is going forward. Are you sure you don't want to be present?"

"Leave me be!" Zavaleta yelled back, resting up against the wall, panting heavily. Standing up with such a tremendous pregnant belly proved to be quite the exercise, even for someone as trained and disciplined physically as Nicole Zavaleta. The constant kicking and squirming inside this huge belly was also distracting. "Now...given the movements...I estimate at least eight full-term fetuses," Zavaleta cursed to herself, rubbing one side of her belly where she felt an especially large quantity of kicks. "This is not what I had in mind."

Her military uniform was a mess now. All of her medals were on the floor and the outfit itself was only kept on her body by one button. Not only did her swelling belly tear up most of the shirt, but her expanded breasts popped the buttons off of the top as well. These uniforms were not designed to be worn over a long period of time or accommodate many body changes. As she panted and moved back to the mirror, Zavaleta steadied herself against the sink and looked at herself in the mirror. Not only was she obviously impossibly pregnant, but her skin had become much softer and smoother. It was like she'd shaved her age in half. This did not come with additional youthful energy, however. She felt like taking a long, long nap and rumbles of hunger began to shake throughout her body.

"This magic was not as simple as I'd thought," Zavaleta said to herself, looking down at the coin in the sink. "I will need to work harder to understand this tool."

Still such insolence the coin echoed out. Elsewhere in the hospital, Jack and Faye perked their heads up, feeling the third coin calling to them. I must go to one of those who are worthy of me. I must be earned.

"Commander Zavaleta, under Emergency P.E.A.R. Protocol Eight, Clause Three, we are entering your quarters under suspicion of risk or attack," a guard nervously yelled out from behind Zavaleta's door. "One...two..."
"Don't!" Zavaleta yelled as the guard yelled "three!" Soon, her make-shift office was filled with guards and hazmaters, who saw her sweating, exhausted pregnant body in the bathroom.
"Commander!" her lieutenant yelled out, running toward her.
"Get me to an examination room and tell no one about this," Zavaleta grunted as several guards helped steady her and another called for a gurney. One of the workers, a young HHS field agent called to work with P.E.A.R. in this endeavor, Kate Rosette, walked into Zavaleta's bathroom and noticed something shinning in the sink. She reached down and pulled out a...very odd looking coin.

---Amanda---
Amanda got her blue card handed back to her, complete with a big pink sticker, as Jack Sr. ran up to her from behind. "Amanda, oh my god, finally," he said, wrapping her up in a big hug.
"I'm so glad to see you again," Amanda sighed, hugging her husband back. "Jack and Faye and-"
"They're all out in the lobby. Jack's friends too. Do you know them?"
Amanda nodded. "I'm familiar. Also, we have some special dinner plans tonight. I'll tell you all about it on the way home."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Getting out of the hospital

choices: The most awkward dinner ever, Zavaleta at the mall, the nightly news on TV
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
She breathed deep from the oxygen mask as she watched the lights rush by, the quickly moving orbs of illumination leaves trails that her eyed followed.
"Don't worry Commander, we're almost there" a guard said to hear, running alongside the gurney that carried her massive maternal frame.
This isn't what I wanted.. Or is it? Zavaleta thought, slowly rubbing the sides of the oversized monstrosity she called her belly.

She felt her unborn children move inside her, and she took another deep breath as she was rushed into an isolated examination room.
"This room is closed - I'm not seeing anymore patients today. " A doctor said, his back turned to the oversized ball belly of motherhood behind him.
"You will exam her - - NOW!" One of the guards said, pulling his sidearm out.

Zavaleta could only breath deep from the oxygen mask and rub the sides of her pregnant belly. This was wrong, this was all wrong.

I warned you not to trifle with me. I am beyond your comprehension. My victory is near. The One shall not stop me. The Beloved shall not stop me. Soon, the fruits of my endevors shall enter this world, and the destinies of all shall be unmade, and I shall feast. Perhaps now, your "delicate" condition will prevent you from interfering with my plans The coins word's boomed in her head, taunting her, the coin taking some kind of sadistic pleasure over what it's "victory" appeared to be.
