A sharp quick from one of her passengers made her give a small whimpering groan. Whatever effect this coin had on the men and women of this town it made pregnant, it choose to spare her from it. Every part of her hurt, she felt the weight of her unborn children pressing against her. She was tired, hungry, scared, excited, nervous, lustful, all at the same time. She was experiencing every high and every low of pregnancy constantly.

You've think you've won. You've only given me what I wanted. Do you hear me?! These are my children! I've spit in the face of Mother Nature and will be having this babies at 60! I will find you again coin, I will unlock your secrets, and I, NOT ANYONE ELSE, I will reshape this world into a better place for MY CHILDREN. Zavaleta thought defiantly and she explored her massive maternal sphere.

"Oh my god!" The doctor said, seeing the massive pregnant body of Zavaleta laid out on the gurney.
The guard pulled the hammer on his sidearmed. "Don't yell. Just get someone in here to help. Get her examined, and tell nobody." The guard was deathly calm. He just stood there, deadly weapon raised at the doctor, taking short calm breathes, as the doctor started finding people to help him with his new final patient for the day.

Transfered from the gurney to a bed, Zavalata pondered her situation. She did the math. When she was 70, her children would be 10, when she was 80 her children would be in college. She didn't care. This was for her. No one else. This is what P.E.A.R denied her, and now she would no longer be denied.

She had years of pay she could never spend. She had access to the best doctors in the world. She had an empty house with empty rooms filled only with empty dreams of her empty heart. Now it was all happening.

Just perhaps a little too much too soon.

"Can you hear me?" The doctor asked Zavaleta slowly, shining a light back and forth between Zavaleta's right eye and left eye.
"I'm pregnant, not deaf" Zavaleta said in a no nonsense tone.
"Ah - well, right" The doctor said, taken back by her hostility.

Moments passed in total silence as the doctor and a nurse worked in tandem to explore, map, scan, document every inch of Zavaleta's massive pregnant belly, each of them taken back by it's nearly impossible size. "So uh - - - When did you first suspect that you were pregnant?" The doctor asked, looking over some of his notes.

"When my midsection expanded and I felt something kicking in there. What do you think? You saw me earlier today, did I look like this?" Zavaleta said, her frustrations with her size and the surrounding incompetence, audible in her voice.
"Uh right" The doctor said taking notes.
"When did - - -"
"Can we finish up this farce? I have much work I need to do." Zavaleta said.
"I uh - - - I uh don't think that's going to be a good idea" The doctor said timidly.
"Why not?" Zavaleta said, trying to sit up in the bed, but the weight of her belly pinning her down.
"Several factors: Namely your age and the current uh - - - numbers of fetuses you're currently carrying" The doctor said.
"Meaning?" Zavaleta said, trying to swing her body off the bed, finding her new... movement sluggish.
"You're 60 years old, and pregnant with 8. EIGHT. Think about that. This kind of pregnancy would be high risk for a woman half-your age, but factor in - - - " The doctor said explaining.

"My age is not the issue." Zavaleta replied sharply.
"I beg to differ. Unlike some of the uh - - - more advanced age pregnancies I dealt with, including my uh - - - male patients, you are some what less healthy compared to them. They all seemed fit as fiddle, you are almost falling apart on me. The weight you've gained is putting alot of pressure on your bones, especially your back. I would put you on bed-rest for the rest of your pregnancy, but I know that's not going to happen. Your blood pressure is through the roof, and - - -" The doctor was interrupted again.

"All very fascinating doctor, but you're not telling me what I want to hear. Are my babies healthy?" Zavaleta asked, finally managing to sit up on the edge of the bed, her belly jutting forth from her.
"Yes. They are all very healthy. I've seen 5 girls, and 3 boys. They - - " The doctor was interrupted again. He was growing tired of this.
"Well thank you for ruining the surprise doctor." Zavaleta said coldly, running her hand along her massive belly containing her sons and daughters. "Am I cleared to return to duty?" Zavaleta asked.
"Return? To duty?" The doctor asked, confused by those words together in that order.
"Yes, I'm a working mother, and I have a job to do. We need to continue to exam the pregnant men and women in this town, and make sure that the quarantine is not breached. I've located the source of - - - " Zavaleta said, rubbing her belly for emphasis on the "source" "Of the events of this town, and we're close to securing everything. We need to make sure everything stays locked down until the source can be completely understood. It's too dangerous to leave this town."

"We're having an entire on-site base being built on the fringes of the town. Here we will hold the Source until such time that we deem it safe to leave." Zavaleta said, trying to stand.
"So, I have much work to do. So, am I fit to return to duty?" Zavaleta asked, finally managing to stand, covering her nakedness with a large bed sheet.
"Uh. No. But that's not going to stop you is it?" The doctor asked, making notes of all of this.
"No" Zavaleta said, tying the bed-sheet around her like a toga, covering her massive maternal curves that we're visible against the tightness of the sheet.
"Well. Just be careful. Sit when you're tired, get lots of rest, and eat right. Try to get some very light exercise. If you feel anything wrong, come back and see me immediately." The doctor said, defeated, making notes on his chart.
"Excellent. You - - " Zavalata said, pointing at the guard, whose "gun readiness" have seemed to drop off completely, who was sitting in a chair, reading a magazine. Upon being called upon by his superior, he stood immediately to attention.

"Ma'am" was all he said.
"Prepare transportation to the mall" Zavalata said, trying to walk slowly, putting support on her back and belly.
"Ma'am?" was all he said.
"I've located the Source. It's not going anywhere. I'll send some people into to retrieve it. For right now I have more pressing matters - - - I need supplies for my little ones" Zavalata said with a smile, standing up straight, her belly hanging off of her.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Knocked up but not knocked out.

choices: A very awkward Dale family dinner
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Lisa Smith rolled down her shirt, the concerned expression never leaving her face. "There's nothing...abnormal about anything on the scan?" She asked her doctor. The doctor took back the handful of paper towels used to wipe the ultrasound gel off of her wide belly and tossed them into a wastebasket.
"Well, not exactly," the doctor said, taking a few notes on his clipboard. "Development-wise, all of your fetuses are right on-schedule for someone in their late third-trimester. That's somewhat unusual in itself in a woman carrying multiples." The doctor chuckled and put down his clipboard. "But, of course, this whole situation is a bit outside of the normal. I've had to throw out a lot of OB/GYN teachings these past few days. But, like I said, everything looks healthy."

Lisa sighed and looked down at her belly, cradling it in her arms. "But...how did this happen? I told you..." Lisa said, leaning in and whispering. "I wasn't pregnant a few days ago, and now look at me."
The doctor shrugged again, "Well, you might have been pregnant and just not noticed it until now. Sometimes the location of the fetuses can shift or they can not exactly present themselves in an obvious way."
Somehow, I don't think that's the case for me, Lisa thought to herself, rubbing her upper belly as one of her triplets gave a kick.
The doctor continued. "But, we still aren't exactly sure about the cause of-"
"That's enough," one of the P.E.A.R. guards said, stepping in, firearm in hand. "If your tests on the patient are finished, we will escort her to get her Blue Card."
The doctor sighed and removed his glasses, rubbing his temples. "Yeah, yeah, I get the picture. She's all cleared. Good luck, Ms. Smith. My son listens to your station whenever I'm in the car with him."
"Thank you," Lisa managed to smile as she heaved herself off of the examining table and waddled with the guards downstairs.

She was in a long line with many other men and women of varying stages of pregnancy, with guards and workers in hazmat suits all around. As she waited, she felt a sudden, large flurry of kicks inside her. "Quiet down," she mumbled, rubbing her wideness.
"What's going on?" one of the guards growled. Lisa bit her lip and hugged and patted her belly as widely as she could.
"The babies are kicking," she responded angrily. "Maybe before you round up all the pregnant people in town, you should understand how the process works.
"Alright," the guard responded sarcastically, standing back at attention. But Lisa was already pissed off.
"Hey, I'm serious. You've all been pretty rough around me and you've been waving guns around. This is a hospital, and specifically, it's a hospital full of pregnant patients."
"That's enough," the guard growled again, some other guards paying attention and walking over.
"And what's next?" Lisa said, raising her voice. The other people in line were starting to turn to listen to her. "When I give birth, are more of you stormtroopers going to come in? Put us in one of your Gestapo vans again and drive me to who-knows-where?"
"Alright, that's it!" the guard bellowed, he and another guard grabbing Lisa by the arms and dragging her quickly into a nearby office. The other guards swarmed the door, blocking it off, one of them cocking her shotgun for good effect.

"We do not want to hear about any more disruptive behavior from you, Lisa Smith," said another P.E.A.R. official, this one wearing less body armor and more traditional military attire. He had a few medals on his chest to boot. "We will issue you your Blue Card now. You are to report back to this hospital in 24 hours for a routine check-up. You can come voluntarily or we can have you escorted here. Your call."
Lisa was sitting down, a guard's hand on both of her shoulders. "I understand," she said weakly. The P.E.A.R. official nodded, was handed a Blue Card with a pink sticker, and handed it to Lisa. "On your way. We will also be escorting you back to your home."

Sure enough, Lisa was taken to the hospital's loading dock by a long line of guards and the same P.E.A.R. official. "We need someone to accompany you on the ride. Someone with medical training," he mumbled, looking around. "You look like you'd go into labor if you sneezed." Lisa turned and sneered at him, but he was already looking around the hospital's halls until he spotted someone. "Rosette! Get over here!"
Kate Rosette jumped and ran toward the officer. She may be HHS, but over the few days of prep for the assignment, she knew not to cross any of the P.E.A.R. officials unless she wanted to be demoted to a basement office in Mobile, Alabama. "Yes, Lieutenant Riker?"
"You've got some medical training, so accompany this woman on her trip back to her home. If one of these people gives birth and we don't get any data from it, it'll be our asses."
"B-but, I was assigned to Commander Zavaleta-"
"You let me take care of the Commander," Riker smirked. In the back of his head, he had been gunning for a higher position in P.E.A.R. and if the reports of Zavaleta making some kind of a screw-up on such a big mission were true, he saw this as a perfect stepping stone for himself. "Now move!"

In no time, the van was loaded up and on its way back to Lisa's neighborhood. Lisa sat, dejected, rubbing her huge belly while Kate sat with her back straight-up. Health and Human Services was by no measure a military organization, but the whole atmosphere of P.E.A.R.'s "occupation" changed her outlook on things. As the ride went on, Kate got a little curious and took out the coin she found again, looking over its strange designs.
Lisa looked up at the coin. "Hey...I think I've seen that somewhere before."
"Yeah?" Kate said, moving a little closer to Lisa. "I've never seen anything like this before."
"I saw on the news...some guy working at the bank said it was being donated to our radio contest." Lisa looked up at the young agent. "I don't think you're from around here, so I don't know if you know what I'm talking about."
"The...pregnant bikini contest, right?" Kate said with a raised eyebrow. "I saw some signs about it. It makes sense in a city like this, I suppose."
"Yeah," Lisa chuckled, deciding not to go into the messy details of the past few days. "But I guess the guy left it at the hospital. He did seem like a bit of an idiot on the TV...probably the same dumb kid I've had to email about the contest."

Give me to her

"Well, if it was supposed to be in the contest, then I guess this belongs to you," Kate said, handing Lisa the coin.
"Oh, thank you," Lisa said, taking it back and looking over the pregnant engravings. "It's a weird prize, but the whole thing's pretty weird, I suppose."

I must be earned

"Your stop," the driver said through a tiny window connecting the back and the driver's compartment. Kate helped Lisa to her feet and walked the two women toward the door.
"Thanks," Lisa smiled. "You're the only nice person I've met who's a part of this operation."
"Well, I joined the HHS to help people," Kate said with a sheepish grin. "Even in a situation like this, I still want to try and help."
"Get back to your house, patient," a guard from the driver's compartment yelled, and Lisa sighed, waddling back to her home. As soon as she closed the door, she collapsed on her couch.

"Lisa!" A voice called from the kitchen. A woman with short, straight brown hair ran out quickly and joined her on the couch, wrapping her up in a big hug. "Oh my God, I was so worried. I came over here as soon as I could."
"I'm okay, Nat," Lisa smiled, before she started shaking. "Actually, no, I'm not okay. Natalie, it was so...awful. There were guards and they pointed guns and me and locked me in an office and-"
"Shh, shh," Natalie said, stroking Lisa's arms and giving her a tiny peck on the cheek. "I'm here now. We're together." Lisa sobbed softly into Natalie's chest and the two lay there in each other's embrace.

After a while, Lisa felt more comfortable. "I...I was also worried the word might get out about...us."
Natalie sighed and pet Lisa's long, blonde hair. "To be honest, so was I. I don't want to do anything to jeopardize your job."
"Why does it have to be such a stupid macho atmosphere there?" Lisa cursed, looking into Natalie's eyes. "I have to pretend to be this big draw for male listeners and if they found out how I actually feel about you, the station's management would toss me out in no time."
"I'm sorry, babe," Natalie said, stroking Lisa's cheeks. "But we're going to get through this. We're trying to plan out for the...for the babies, and we can make it through anything." Natalie paused. "Any...any word on how this whole 'pregnancy' thing happened, by the way."
Lisa shook her head. "No clues. The doctors are just as stumped as we are."

Natalie sighed and stroked Lisa's hair. "Well, we'll be okay, won't we?"
Lisa nodded. "I think so...I'm not sure if I'm looking forward to people calling into the station and calling me a 'MILF,' though."
Natalie laughed and lay Lisa down on the couch. "Wouldn't that make me a MILF too?"
Lisa groaned. "Not even as a joke, Nat."
"Okay, okay," Natalie said, leaning in for a kiss.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Follow something else.

choices: The most awkward dinner in the long history of awkward dinners.
Spyders: Spying on the pregnant men and pregnant women of the town this night.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Life went on in in the town, crazier than usual. Although the round up was winding down, the lives of the people had to go on.
As the hospital slowly emptied of it's pregnant (and not pregnant) men and women, the homes and apartments began to fill up again.
Women came home to break the news to boyfriends, girl friends, mothers, wives, husbands, or, in some such cases, it was the men who were breaking the news of their condition to girlfriends, wives, mothers, boyfriends, and so forth.

Of course, as Lieutenant Riker thought about this, walking through the nearly empty halls of the hospital, his hand absentmindedly cleaning some gunk of his shiny medals.
"I don't like it" He finally said to himself out loud, his voice breaking the eerie silence as the rest of the PEAR guards, stood watch over nothingness.
"Uh, sir?" A male voice questioned through a gas-mask.
"They're going home. All of them. I don't like it." Riker said, his frustrations boiling over inside of him.
"Well, Zavaleta and HQ have - - -" The gas-masked man said again. He was starting to worry of all the tooth-brush aided toilet cleaning sessions he might be "rewarded" with after speaking his mind.

"Never mind that old crone and the fools on the council. This town is a hotbed of Paranormal Activity, unlike anything I've ever seen in my years of service, and let me tell you what, I've seen some shit" Riker turned out the window, watching a woman help her very pregnant husband into the car, concern and confusion on both of their faces.

"I mean look at them out there. Men getting pregnant, mysterious pregnancies spreading across the female population, menopausal women who should be retiring preparing for motherhood again, all while our sensors are going ballistic. And what do we do? Let them go. We bid our time and wait. The Blue Card system is a stop-gap. You know it, Zavaleta knows it, I know it, and the council knows it. But still, standard operating procedure they say. Bullshit, I answer. The Blue Card system is meant for small incidents, nothing like this." Riker watches the pregnant man get into the car, his wife get behind the wheel, and the two drive off.

"I mean look at that. You wonder what they're going to talk about when they get home? What kind of conversation a man who finds himself pregnant is going to have with his wife, let alone himself? What if all the answers are in there... In the homes; and we can't see it, or hear it, or do anything about it." Riker said, his face growing cold.

The two gas-masked individuals look at each. "Not on my watch. Zavaleta is fool, and I'll prove it to the council." Riker turns on his heel, and points at the two guards. "You two, follow me to the loading dock".

And with that Riker left, the two very confused guards trailing behind him. A long walk, a trip down a flight of stairs, and some pushing later, Riker and the two gaurds arrived at the loading dock. "Change of plans everyone. Prepare the Spyders for immediate deployment." Riker commanded to the staff at the loading docks, who were packing and unpacking boxes and crates marked "Health and Human Services - Classified".

"We've gotten no orders" One of the soldiers tried to say. "I'm giving your the orders. Unpack the Spyders now, and get one of those damn technicians down here right now." Riker ordered, filling up with a sense of pride at grabbing the situation firmly by the.. well you get the idea.

Riker watched as dozens of crates marked "Project S - Prototypes Mark II" were hauled off trucks and helicopters. "What's going on here? Who gave the orders to have the Spyders prepared for deployment?" A brainy brain in a white lab coat asked, looking around. "I did" Riker said, turning to face the cliched looking scientist.

"Sir, the Spyder's are not ready! There's still problems in their behavioral sub-matrix! We can't afford - - - " The brain guy said, voicing his concern at this superior. "You'd be surprised at what blank checks for the world's nations can make you afford. Get the spyders ready, they're getting deployed..now" Riker ordered.

"Sir, the Spyder program is" The brain guy said "Still experimental? I know full well what these Spyders are capable off. I signed off on the project! Full automated field surveillance micro robotic arachnids- Tiny spider-like robots fully capable of recording all video, audio, and digital information in the field and transmitting it wirelessly to us. These suckers can tuck away into a corner like a real spider and record hundreds of hours of audio and video, and wirelessly hack in to any computer and download photos, files, data - - - Anything we need. You're last report said they were "Field Ready" so what's your objection now?" Riker said, dumping exposition to anyone around him who might not be aware of PEAR's Spyder program.

"I said they were Field Ready only in the loosest terms. The spyder's behavioral routines are still a little twitchy. Sometime's they'll just completely wander out to be spotted, just crawl along visible instead of hiding in a corner. It's makes for a small chance of detection! Not to mention, we've not fully secured their data streams. If someone caught and broke one of these things, it would be easy for them to download any of the data stored in the micro-HD inside. We're - - -" The brain guy tried to explain but Riker wouldn't hear it.

"We're going to deploy them now. All of them. Into every home, every school, every store, every corner, everywhere. I want a complete intel blanket. I want to know who has it" Riker said, looking out onto the town from the open dock. "Who has what sir?" The brain guy answered back.
"The answer to that is above your paygrade. Let's just say the Source of all of this.. pregnancy nonsense is out there in that town somewhere, and I'm going to find it. I'm going to secure it, and hand it to the council myself, and then I will be in command." Riker said to himself, unaware of his little mini "Explain my evil(ish) plan" diatribe he was going into.

"Sir I - - - " The brain guy tried to explain. "DO IT NOW, or you'll find yourself flipping burgers for the rest of your life in a fast-food joint in the middle of nowhere Alaska for the rest of your life" Riker said, threatening.
"Very well, sir." The brain guy unpacked a laptop, powered it up, and began programming the Spyders to do their work. Moments later, the small robots began to stir, unpacking themselves, and moving out towards the town in a massive swarm of silver metal creepy-crawlies.

"They're on their way sir. They'll be in positions soon." The brain guy said.
"Excellent work. Take me back to our mobile command unit. I want to see everything" Riker said, rubbing his hands.

The blond stood in front of her full length mirror, dressed in only her bra and panties. Her breasts will spilling out of her bra, clearly evident that she needed to buy a larger size, while a small section of her purple frilly underwear hung low under a small bulge in her midsection.
She was in incredible shape, her long flowing blonde hair seemed to shine, as she turned all around in front of her mirror, getting a better look.

She ran a hand over the small bulge that seemed to stretch out a portion of her underwear, and she let out a sigh.

"Look kid. I don't know how you got in there, because it sure as shit wasn't the natural way. I'll make you deal: I'm not exactly Mom material, but I'm willing to give it a go, if you can do your best with what we're going to have, which isn't much. It's just you and me kid." She looked down at her bulge, and back at herself in the mirror.

"You know honey, when I said years ago, when we had the kids that I wished you knew what this felt like, I wasn't serious" The wife said, looking over her husbands test result.
"How do you think I feel?! I mean this isn't normal!" The husband said, his hands on the decent sized bulge in his midsection.
"Millions of women go through it every year. You'll do fine!" The wife said, a smirk crossing her face. She clearly thought this was funny.
"You find this funny don't you?" The husband asked looking at his wife.
"I'll find it funnier in a few months when you're waddling around" She replied back.
The husband just sighed and felt his midsection.

She sat there with a smile on her face, reading a pregnancy book.
She looked to be about 7 months pregnant, even though she hadn't been pregnant for 7 months.
She was going to give her baby up for adoption to her sister out of state who couldn't have children. It was for the best. She could watch her daughter/niece grow up in a loving environment raised by someone who desperatly wanted to be a mother but couldn't be, and she could still focus on her career. It was for the best.
"Well then, I think I need some more peanut butter and cucumber ice-cream. You know I use to watch my figure, before you came along" She said, stroking the underside of her belly, which was hanging out of her shirt.

She didn't have the time for maternity clothes, so she did the best with what she had. It was for only two more months.
"When you get older, you can call me Aunt, even though I'm your Mom. It's not that I don't love you, I just can't do this by myself. I don't want to do this by myself. Your aunt, or your Mom in this case will you love very much, as will I, but this is for the best" She said, as she mixed together her pregnancy craving induced concoction.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: I, Spy(ders)

choices: Jessica calls Jack and saves him from the situation
No mercy. Jack's alone on this one.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack Sr. scratched his beard and puzzled as he looked between his car and the passengers he needed to transport. He, Amber, Jessica, and Mariah had been taken to the hospital by the HHS' vans (separately, of course) and his wife, his son, and his neighbor had all driven together. Seven people for one, five-seater car.

Well, that was hardly the main issue. Even if the car had seven seats, it couldn't fit all of the women in there. Amber and Mariah were each like over-ripe watermelons, Jessica looked like she was pushing toward the end of her pregnancy, and Amanda...let alone another woman the same size as her with Faye. It wasn't going to happen, at least not safely. Jack Sr. turned to his son and sighed. "How about I give you and your friends some money for a cab?"
"I think the whole town's tied up with this hospital stuff, Dad. There aren't any cabs." Jack said. His father sighed and nodded, walking over to his car.
"Alright...all of these people are coming with us?" Jack Sr. said, turning to Amanda.
She nodded. "Well, Jack's friends don't have any way to get home and Amber here is joining us for dinner."
"Why is-"
"I'll explain, dear," Amanda said with a forced smile, putting her hand on her husband's arm. "Please."

With some ingenuity, Jack Sr. worked out the best set-up he could. Amber was in the passenger seat next to him, her belly not quite massive enough to require her to move the seat back. Jessica sat in the back, with Mariah on her lap. Jessica had a visibly pregnant middle, but it wasn't enough to prevent Mariah get close to her. That just left Amanda and Faye to cram themselves together, bending creatively to get their bellies in the air. Amanda couldn't get too upset, as she'd insisted everyone travel together, but now that she was face-first in Faye's chest, she felt a little differently. And, with Faye still in her robe, there was plenty of exposed chest for her to be pushed into.

That just left Jack Jr., and like a true gentleman, he gave up his seat for all of the pregnant women and opted instead for the trunk. Well, he was left no option as far as the seat goes, really. And the trunk was not his idea either. And he protested as vigorously as he could against four heavily pregnant beauties (and his mother).

"Left here?" Jack Sr. called out to the backseat. Mariah nodded sheepishly. Sitting in Jessica's lap was...new to her, and as her heart beat faster, so did her babies' kicks. The car pulled in front of an apartment building and the backseat shifted around as Mariah made her way out.
"Thank you for the drive," Mariah said to Jack Sr. before waving to Jessica. "Take care, Jack," she said, tapping her hand a few times on the trunk door.
Jack Sr. drove off, headed for Jessica's house now. After a few minutes of slight relaxation, Jessica was startled from her new position in the backseat by her cellphone's vibration. Jessica saw that it was from Mariah, which caused her to raise her eyebrow in slight surprise. Opening the text, there was just one, simple message.

<it's her. Bookstore>

Jessica gulped nervously and looked out the window, trying to look at Faye with her peripheral vision. Mariah had been sitting next to her the entire car ride! Of course she would have gotten a good look at the woman who stole the book and impregnated her with twins! Jessica's face turned pale as she tried not to freak out, a scene that did not go unnoticed by Faye. The quadruplet-carrying schemer smiled foxily, turning to the young girl.
"Are you okay, sweetie?" she purred, raising the hairs on Jessica's neck. Just then, Jessica knew it had to be her. The backseat of this car might be the worst place for her.
"I'm fine," Jessica said, clearing her throat. "Just some hot flashes. You know, h-hormones and all." Amanda raised her head a little and turned toward Jessica.
"I-I'm sorry, I have to know. I'm his mother," Amanda whispered. "Did Jack...is he the father?"
Jessica's face flushed more than it already had. "N-no! It's, you know, one of these mystery pregnancies."
Amanda let out such a long sigh, you'd think she'd held her breath underwater for an hour. "Okay, thank you. I'm sorry, I didn't mean to assume you made love with Jack."
Faye chuckled. "She didn't say she didn't."

Just in time for Jessica's face to turn pure red, Jack Sr. pulled in front of her house. "Alright Jessica, here's your stop," he said. "You know, I haven't seen you since Jack was in high school. I wish we'd met under better circumstances," he said with a little chuckle. "B-but, you know, Amanda and I are always here if you need help."
Jessica nodded. "Thank you, Mr. Dale, Mrs. Dale, really. I'll...we'll talk again, I'm sure." With a little smile, Jessica heaved herself out of the car and waddled to her house, whipping out her cellphone as soon as she got in the door to text Jack. <it's your neither>

A few seconds. <wut?>
<Neighbor!> Jessica texted back, growling at her phone. "Stupid swollen pregnant lady fingers!"
Jack adjusted his eyes to his bright phone display in the dark of the trunk, taking some time to understand her message. But when it hit him, it hit him.
Faye has the book...and one of the coins!

In the front seat, Amber was resting her hands on top of her belly. Every now and then, she could sneak a peek at Jack's dad. You've got good genes, Jack, she mused to herself, admiring Jack Sr.'s rugged looks. I guess as you get older, you'll start to look less awkward and virginy. She looked back at Amanda, now stretching out some more in the back seat, her belly still bumping against Faye's. You've got pretty good genes through your mom too. She's probably in her 50s but she looks like she could pass for early 30s.
"You're sure about having her over for dinner?" Faye said at a purposely high volume. "Because when she's entered my home, it didn't turn out too well."
"Faye, please!" Amanda said angrily. "I think we should all talk through this. You're my friend and I want to help you, but we'll do it by my rules in my house, understand?"
"I'm sure you'd take a different tone if I invited your son and his baby mama over to my house to talk things over," Faye said with a raised eyebrow.
"His what?" Jack Sr. said, turning his head around.
"Nothing, John," Amanda said in a tense tone. She bent forward, her belly pushing tightly against Faye's. "Faye, I know things are rough for you now, but watch your mouth. You're not a mother yet so you don't know what it feels like to have someone else talk about your child."
"Ooh, getting kind of feisty now?" Faye giggled, her sensitive belly being rubbed by Amanda's pregnance. "Alright, I'll behave. For now."
Amber kept her mouth shut for now too, waiting for the right time to give them all a piece of her mind. When do I drop the bomb on this couple about their son and their sweet, preggo neighbor?

Finally (and thankfully, from Jack Sr.'s point-of-view), the car pulled into their driveway. He helped Amanda out, then Faye. Amber insisted in getting out on her own. "Oh, I almost forgot," Jack Sr. laughed, opening the trunk and reaching an arm down to his son, who was curled up in the fetal position.
"Thanks, Dad," Jack said sarcastically, working his way out of his cramped quarters. The three women waddled to the house and Amanda turned around, rubbing her belly slowly.
"I was already working on a big dinner when the...hospital event happened, so I'll get through that soon. Maybe half an hour?" As she turned, she bumped her belly into Jack. "Whoops, sorry baby. Keep Faye and your boss company, will you?"
"How did you know she was my-"
"We talked a little," Amanda smiled, walking into the kitchen. Jack turned bright red as he walked over to the couch. His mother's words were far too cryptic for him. What sorts of things did she talk about with Amber? What sorts of things could she have talked about with Amber?

As he sat down on the couch, Faye and Amber both sat down at his sides with a big OOMF and each turned to him inquisitively.
"So," Amber said with a light, teasing scowl. "Keep us company."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Enough stalling! Dinnertime!

choices: Jack and Jessica's Date Night: Dinner, The Mall and.. Bow Chicka Wow Wow.
The awkward family dinner.. Minus Jack.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack's heart raced so fast you could probably use it to power a starship to go faster-than-light.
Okay. Calm down. Your surronded by your pregnant boss - - or former boss, your pregnant next-door neighbor who tried to seduce you to break up your relationship with your friend whose a girl but not your girlfriend in order to stop you from stopping the evil machinations of a coin that causes pregnancy in people... It's not time to panic... yet Jack thought to himself, staring at Amber and Faye who were staring at him.

His palms were sweaty, his eyesight blurry. If this wasn't a time to panic, when was?

"So Jack..." Amber said, finding a more comfortable position on the couch, but her pregnant state making that a bit harder than usual.
"Let's talk about..us" Amber said raising an eyebrow.
"uS?" Jack said, inflecting his voice incorrectly, coming out as a squeak.
"Look, maybe I overreacted." Amber said, putting her hands on top of her pregnant belly. "It's just, ever since I got pregnant" That particular phrase Amber said causing Faye to shoot a million fiery daggers of hate and death at the poor pregnant store manager "I've been lonely you know? This - - " Amber said rubbing her stomach. "Was really not what I had planned for my life right now you know? And when I started getting bigger, nobody wanted me anymore. And then you started working with me over the summer, and as I got bigger, I started noticing.. the looks you gave me." Amber continued.

I have to give this coin credit for one thing. It certainly doesn't take changing reality lightly Jack thought to himself, slightly bemused by how people seemed to be accepting of this new reality that didn't exist days ago.

"I-uh-gave you looks?" Jack said, squirming in his seat. He always wondered how people perceived their new reality, and this was a face-against-the-glass look at Amber's perceived world. "It was more undressing-me-with-your-eyes than anything else, but I'm not going to lie: I was kind of flattered you found my... condition so sexy. Maybe I took harmless flirting as.. something more. The point is Jack... I'm sorry. You're not fired. Hell, I don't even have the power to fire people over that. I mean, could you imagine the lawsuit you could have filled?" Amber said, lightly walking the fingers over the vast expanse of her belly, bemusing herself as she apologized.

"I'm not fired?" Jack was thoroughly confused. Not because he couldn't understand what was happening, but because it was taking one hundred percent of his brain and will power to just stare at the sexy maternal goddesses in front of him. "Why would I fire my best employee? I just.. over-reacted. I - - I have alot of my mind" Amber started to say before being interrupted.

"And a lot in your belly" Faye snidely remarked, an evil (though not being controlled by the coin evil) smirk on her face. Jack shifted in his seat again.
This is hell. I've died and gone to hell. Forced to set in this awkward conversation forever he thought to himself, his eyes glancing over to the clock, watching the seconds take eons to pass by.

"Look Faye, I'm sorry for what has happened. I didn't know he was married. I was lonely, he was an attractive older man buying me drinks, one thing lead to another and - - - " Amber patted her belly. "I'm not going to say I wouldn't do it again because well - - - " Amber inhaled sharply. "These are MY children. He may be your husband, but he's also the father of my children. And I want this to work out - - I... I never had any brothers or sisters.." Amber said slowly "So, I want my children to be surrounded by people who will love them, who will always be with them.. And I want your children.. Their half-brothers and half-sisters to be there. I mean, in some weird way.. We're kind of family" Amber said, trying to create some peace.

BZZZT. BZZZT.
Jack pulled out his phone, and saw a text from Jessica.
Just broke the news. Parents are.... my parents. Come over.. I need you.
"Thank You Jessica" Jack said to himself under his breath.
BZZZZT. BZZZT.
And in case you needed any motivation.... :) Was all the message said.
Second later, Jack Dale Jr received an image that drove him wild.
It was Jessica, in her bra-and-panties standing in front of her mirror, a come-hither smile on her face.

"Something more interesting to you Jack?" Faye said, slightly annoyed at being ignored.
"Uh yeah.. Big uh trouble at the store! Huge trouble. Oh my god the humanity!" Jack said, getting up.
"I didn't hear anything" Amber said, pulling out her phone.
"Oh yeah, superhuge trouble, Don't Tell Amber, is the subject line, need me down there right now, matter of life and death, sorryigottagobye" Jack said, grabbing his wallet and keys, and heading out before his super-obvious lie super-exploded in his face.

"He's not a very good liar is he?" Faye asked Amber.
"No. No, he's not." Amber smiled watching him leave.
"Now, about us - - - " Faye turned to Amber
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Lucked out.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack closed the door behind him and let out a feverish sigh. Sorry Mom and Dad, but you've got to deal with them now, Jack thought, rushing to his car. Well, this was your idea in the first place Mom...

Amanda was finishing up preparing dinner and was unaware of the uncomfortable confrontation now brewing in her living room, although she could easily have guessed. Amber was still gazing at the front door while Faye smirked at her. "Now, about us," Faye said, moving her arms across the back of the couch. Amber turned back to the wife of her babies' father with a nervous but composed look.
"Well, you heard me out. I want my children to grow up in as healthy a circumstance as they can...I think they deserve that much."
Faye chuckled and looked off to the side. "What they deserve...what I think I deserve to have my home to myself after waiting so long to get pregnant." She ran her hands across her belly in large circles.
Amber paused. "If I can ask...what's it like to carry four?"
Faye turned back to Amber curiously. "Well, I don't exactly have something to compare it to, but it's wonderful." Faye wrapped both hands around her belly. "I love being so full with my children. My children."
Amber took offense to her emphasis and put her hands on her own belly. "Are you saying these aren't my children?"
The coin was loving this confrontation and decided to get greedy, giving some of its chaotic, evil influence to Faye. "No, they're my husband's mistakes."

Amber stood up furious when Amanda walked into the living room. "Alright, dinner's rea...where's Jack?"
"He said he had to run off to work," Faye said, still making eye contact with Amber. "Some big emergency."
Amanda sighed. He probably just lied to get out of talking to them... "Oh well. Dinner's ready, so you can come in. Amber, I'm not sure about you, but Faye, as a fellow quad momma, I know you're hungry enough to have about two whole dinners."
Faye laughed softly and pushed herself up slowly, sticking one arm under her belly for support. "You know me so well, Amanda." Amanda waddled over and tried to help her neighbor up, but their bellies just ended up pushing against one another. Amber stifled her laughter and waddled into the kitchen.

Sitting at the dinner table was no smaller struggle, but when everyone finally got down, Jack Sr. helped pass around the various dishes, which Amanda, Amber, and Faye gladly scooped onto their plates. "Where's Jack?" his father asked.
"He had to run to work," Amanda said.
Smart kid, Jack Sr. sighed. I wonder what I could fake to get out of this...

"So, Amber," Amanda smiled at her son's boss after about 15 minutes of awkward, silent eating (and plenty of it), "I don't know much about you. Tell me a little about yourself."
Amber took a long sip of water. "Well, I work at the same store that your son works at, of course, but I also use it to fix and build all kinds of things: computers, smart phones, cameras. I'm finishing up a graduate program in computer sciences."
"That's pretty interesting," Jack Sr. said. "Where are you planning on working with the master's degree?"
"There's a federal program that's working on ways to make more efficient processors that use less precious metals," Amber said, grinning slightly at Jack Sr. He really did look like his son. "I've interviewed with them a few time and I've been asked back again, so I'll probably work there."
"Wow, very impressive," Amanda smiled. "Although, balancing work and kids is even harder than it sounds."
"Oh, don't worry about that," Faye said, taking a big spoonful of rice and salsa verde. "Apparently, I'll be the one raising her kids in my big, mixed-up house."
By now, Amanda knew the scenario they were dealing with pretty well. "Faye, have you and Amber really talked about this? Do you understand where she's coming from?"
Faye grinned evily. "Oh yes, she made her little plea. But, bizarrely, I'm still not thrilled about sharing a house with my husband's mistress and her kids."
"I'm not your husband's 'mistress,'" Amber said. "It was one time, it was a mistake, and I didn't know he was married! You should be angry with him."
"Don't worry, he's being punished," Faye smiled. "And you're right, you didn't know he was my husband. But then you insisted that you come and live in our house or you would press legal action. You destroyed my family."
Amber was starting to shake. "I had to do what was best for my children. Can't you understand?" Amber put her hands on her belly. "We're both going through the same thing, after all."

In a burst of maternal energy, Faye stood up, hitting and shaking the table with her enormous belly. "You have no idea what I'm going through! I thought I would never be able to have children and I've thought all my life that I could never be pregnant! And now that I am, everything is falling apart around me! You had a one-night-stand and got twins out of it! Don't you ever dare compare your life to mine you little WHORE!"

"Faye!" Amanda yelled, shocked, at her neighbor. Amber sat at the table, trembling, before standing up and waddling to the bathroom.
"Excuse me," she mumbled. Amanda got up and took Faye by the arm, walking the two of them into the living room. Jack Sr. sat at the table, a vacant expression on his face.
I should probably keep drinking wine until this gets better, he thought to himself, walking into the kitchen to pour himself another glass.

In the bathroom, Amber sat down on the toilet, still shaking, and proceeded to tearfully scream behind clenched teeth and punch the wall. "That fucking bitch! That fucking bitch!" she said with each punch. Her twins started to roll around inside her womb. Amber wrapped her arms around her belly and continued to sob. "It's okay, dears, it'll all be okay." As Amber lifted her head and sniffled, she noticed a moving shadow and a long, slender leg move behind the shower curtain. The bathroom window was ajar and Amber's mind went to one thing: A big weird bug. Cautiously, she moved to face the shower and could hear the buglike movement. She tried to figure out where the creature was and then...she punched from behind the curtain at the bug, hoping to squish it without actually touching it.

To her surprise, she hit something very hard and sturdy, followed by a loud *thud* on the shower floor. Amber opened the curtain and saw one of P.E.A.R.'s Spyder cameras on the ground, one of the legs twisted out of place while the rest slowly floundered. "What is this?" Amber said to herself, picking it up. The cover had come a little loose so she could open it up and look inside. "It looks like some kind of...remote camera, but inside of a mobile unit...so I should be able to disconnect it like this-" Amber flipped a switch and a red light inside turned off. "Interesting..."

In the living room, Amanda was having a very hushed but intense conversation with Faye. "Now look: I brought you both here to try and figure this out. You're my friend but that doesn't mean you can be this rude to that poor girl. Imagine if the future of your children was up in the air." Amanda put her hand on Faye's belly to emphasis her last point.
At Amanda's words, Faye remembered what the coin had shown her in her dreams: Jack Jr. and his girlfriend taking away her pregnant belly. Maybe cooperating here could help her get another shot at stopping that duo...and maybe get another shot at Jack Jr. himself.
"I'm sorry, Amanda," Faye said, reaching in for an awkward, belly-filled hug. "It's just a strange time for me. I'll do it your way."
"Well, that's good to hear," Amanda said as Amber walked back in from the bathroom, the Spyder hidden behind her. She clandestinely put it into her purse as she returned to the kitchen table.
"Oh, we're still doing this?" Jack Sr. asked as all of the pregnant women slowly took their seats.
"Yes, and it's going to be more productive this time," Amanda said with a big smile. Faye and Amber were now smiling too, but for very different reasons.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Who's Afraid of My Dinner With Andre?

choices: TO THE MALL! Jack and Jessica shop and flirt, Oven's getting big, Zavaleta shops
Back... to the dinner. Is it still awkward? Oh yeah probably.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack felt like he was walking on air. For the first time in a long time, everything felt right, instead of, well you know, being trapped in a rapidly spiraling out of control nightmare of pregnancy.

That all came crashing down moments later, when he was suddenly surrounded at a checkpoint not far from his house.
"Blue Card - - - Now." The faceless goon behind the gas mask told him in a dry tone. Another two gas-masked goons stood by the side, ready for whatever may happen.

"Uh.. This wasn't here that long ago. When did this pop up?" Jack asked the gas-masked goon #1.
"We're very efficient in our job. This is for your own safety and the safety of others until we can determine the source of the pregnancy epidemic. Blue Card now." The gas-masked goon said.
"Are there going to be a lot of these around the time? It's going to make getting from Point A to Point B a bit of a hassle" Jack said.
"It's why you should carry your Blue Card on you at all times. Now - - Blue Card please. We don't want to hold up traffic. This should be a quick and painless process" The gas masked goon said.

Jack reached into his wallet and pulled out his Blue Card and handed it over to the guard. The guard scanned the card with a scanner and handed it back.

"I'd advise you to keep that close. We have more checkpoints around the town. We apologize for the inconvenience." The gas masked goon said as he waved Jack through.

Jack drove on to his goal, his dream, his Jessica... Only to be stopped by another checkpoint just a few moments later, and a third checkpoint some time after that.

It took Jack almost 45 minutes to what was usually a 20 minute drive to Jessica's because apparently there were gas-masked goons everywhere, checking for Blue Cards.

After passing through however many checkpoints it was, (Jack was spacing out after about the 6th one), Jack finally pulled up outside Jessica's house.

With a smile on his face and some pep in his step, Jack made his way to the door. He straightened himself up, breathing into his hand and smelling it, pretty sure that his breath smelled okay. Running his hand through his hair to make sure it was perfect, he nodded to himself. He was ready.

He was about to knock on the front door, his balled up fist just inches away for the solid red door when - - - -

BZZZT. BZZZT. BZZZT.

Reaching into his pocket, Jack pulled out his cellphone to see a new text from Jessica.

<Don't go through the front door you dork. There's a ladder out back. Climb up to my window>

"Oh you have got to be kidding me" Jack said to himself under his breath.

He makes his way to the back of the house and, as Jessica had foretold in her text, was a ladder by the side of the house, and her window wide open.

"Come on up!" Jessica shouted down to him in a loud whisper.
"Seriously? The window again?" Jack shouted back in a whisper, putting his hands out for emphasis.
"Just get up here!" Jessica said, sticking her head back into her room.

Jack hesitates for a moment, before putting the ladder against the side of the house and placing one foot on the bottom rung. Before taking that vital next step, Jack looks around before spotting some roses growing by the side of the house.

Reaching in carefully, he pulls out a small collection of roses, and climbs up the ladder, his love waiting at the top. Moments later, he's eye to eye with Jessica, her twin-filled belly testing the limits of her bathrobe, which hugged every delicate maternal curve of her body.

Every brain-cell in Jack's head exploded all at once, nearly leaving him a babbling pile of goo.... metaphorically speaking.

A smile forme on Jessica's face as she waddled over to Jack and gave him a light peck on the check, her bathrobed belly rubbing every so slightly against Jack's.

"Thanks for coming" Jessica said.

Jack tried to speak, but got at most, a "C" for effort.

"Flowers, Jessica, Pretty" Jack stammered as he held up the roses.

Jessica took one look at the flowers... and frowned.

"Jack, did you tear up my mother's prized roses in a lame attempt to woo me?" Jessica crossed her arms across her chest, assuming an almost "Don't you dare" stance, her motherly instincts kicking.

"If I lie and so no will you be angry?" Jack's said, his brain restarting.
"Yes" Jessica replied.
"And if I did ruin some roses to get this for you, would you be pissed?" Jack asked, already knowing the answer.
"Yes, but less so because it was the a sweet gesture." The smile returned to Jessica's face.

Jack panicked, thinking about his next course of action, but nothing was coming to mind.
"Relax you big dork. I'm having fun with you." Jessica said, waddling over to the bed, one hand in the small of her arching back, the other resting on top of her belly.

She sat down on the bed, and the bedspring groaned in protest. Jessica heard the shrikes of bedspring pain, and frowned.
"I've had this bed forever... and it's never done that to me before" Jack could see tears welling up in the corner of her eyes.

"Hey, hey, hey. It's not a big deal" Jack said, trying to comfort her from the bed's insult.
"IT IS A BIG DEAL! I'M SO FAT! NONE OF MY CLOTHES FIT, I'M STARTING TO LOSE SIGHT OF MY FEET. I'M HUNGRY AT THE TIME. I'M REALLY EMOTIONAL RIGHT NOW!" Jessica said, pregnancy hormones taking control of her.

Jack sat next to her on the bed, his body leaning towards Jessica due to her gravitational pull, wrapping an arm around her.
"You're beautiful Jessica. You're amazing, and pretty.. and sexy" Jack said, no lying either. He wanted her so bad, his body ached.
Jessica laughed and wiped tears away from her eyes.

"Look lover boy, just because I'm in my bathrobe, doesn't mean your getting lucky just yet. You want access to Jessicaland, you have to pay admittance." Jessica said. "A date, a proper one. I know our last date was a not-date date, but I want a proper date. Dinner, movie, shopping. You gotta show me a good time"

Jack gulped the gulpiest gulp he ever gulped. "Are you- - - are you sure?" Jack asked.
"Yes." Jessica said, standing up from her bed, albit slowly and awkwardly.
'Okay, dinner and a movie I get. But why the mall?" Jack asked.

"Because I'm out of clothes that fit. So, you're buying me some. Don't worry, I'll make sure their skimpy. I know how much you like.." Jessica said, her hand going to her belly, as she started undoing the sash on her bathrobe, teasing him, making him yearn.
"But, that's later. First, I want you help me pick out what i'm going to wear." Jessica said, walking over to her closet.

"I've got in narrowed to either the red dress or the blue dress. Either way, I'm going to look ridiculous in it, but I want to look pretty." Jessica said holding the red dress or the blue dress against her pregnant frame.
"Wait, really?" Jack asked.
"Look, I want this date date to be a real.. date I guess. Dinner, movie. Looking nice, beside.. I want to see if I can still fit into one of these things" Jessica said, holding up one of the dresses.
"Red" Jack said.
"Good choice." Jessica said, throwing the red dress on the bed.

"Jessica" Jack said with great pause.
"Hmm?" Jessica asked, going through her clothes.
"Why are we doing this?" Jack asked.
"Because we have strong feelings for each other and - - "
"No. Why am I taking you shopping? We aren't we getting the book! WHY ARE WE REVERSING ALL THIS!" Jack said, his voice getting loud, his breathes deep.
"Calm down sunshine. I got off the phone with Mariah. I'm pretty sure she has this all figured out." Jessica said with a smile.

Jack felt a weight lift off his shoulders. "Really" He hoped for the first time in these past few days.
"Yeah. She has an idea. Says she wants to think it over, but once we get that book back tomorrow night, I'm almost sure that we can figure out a way to undo..." Jessica said, tapping her belly for emphasis.

"But until then.. I'm going to enjoy this" Jessica said, placing her hand on her belly. "Ooh, Well, maybe I'd enjoy it more if these two stopped moving around so much. Want to feel?" Jessica ask.

Jack was over a in a split section, Jessica guiding his hand to the spot where her children were most active. Moments later, a strong firm THUMP made Jessica smile and Jack's eyes light up.

"Wow" was all Jack could say. He was enjoying this belly feeling MUCH MORE than the one with his mom. Jessica, caught up in the moment, gave Jack a deep passionate kiss. It was a fine kiss, a mighty kiss, a kiss that could have moved mountains, and rained down thunder.

And so there they stood, Jack and Jessica locked in momentary eternal bliss, sharing this one special moment between the two of them.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: It's a date.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack walked over to the window and prepared to climb down the ladder. "Jack, wait," Jessica said, pointing to her belly. "Do you really think I'm going to be able to get down that ladder?"
She made a good point. "So, then how are we getting out?"
"Front door, silly," Jessica said. "We'll be able to sneak out, trust me. My parents are..." Jessica's voice trailed off and she looked sadly into the distance. "They didn't take the news well." Jessica placed her hands on her belly and rubbed gently.
"Don't they know about the 'pregnancy disease' or whatever people are calling it?" Jack said, making air quotes around "pregnancy disease." He and Jessica both knew what was really going on.
Jessica nodded. "But they don't believe me. They've never been particularly trusting of me." Jessica sighed and looked up at Jack. "I actually had a bit of a...a pregnancy scare in college. They nearly cut off my tuition." Jack's heart started to sink. While he was just concerned about Jessica taking him back after he kissed Faye in front of her, she was being chewed out at home. He was a selfish jerk.
"Well...we'll fix this, don't worry," Jack said, rubbing her arm. "But for now, let's go have that date. I'm guessing you don't want laser tag this time?"
Jessica chuckled. "I'm a little big to be a target, I think."

Jessica and Jack both snuck downstairs. Well, Jack did. Jessica made creaks on the stairs coming down and bumped into a few loose tables walking down the hall. She'd only had her belly this size for a about 19 hours, after all. Jessica didn't seem too concerned with the noise, however.
"Jess," Jack whispered. "Won't your parents hear?"
"Yeah, but they already know I'm in the house," she winked at Jack. "But they won't be paying attention to any noise you make now." Quickly, the two of them moved past the open kitchen door. Jack could just take a quick peek inside and saw a middle aged man and woman sitting at the table and the woman was sobbing. Jack felt an awful pit in his stomach again. I've definitely got to fix this, he thought. This coin's hurt too many people.
When they got to Jack's car, he leaned over and gave Jessica a kiss on the cheek. She beamed back at him. "That was a nice touch to start the date off. What got into you?"
"Nothing, I just like you," Jack smiled, turning the car on and driving to the mall.

It was later in the day so the mall wasn't as crowded as usual. Even with the mass pregnancies, Jessica got plenty of looks from people, even from other pregnant women and men. "It's probably the dress," Jessica giggled, rubbing the bright red fabric draped over her wide belly.
"Or maybe you're just that beautiful," Jack smiled. Jessica snorted and elbowed him.
"Thanks," she said, running her hands through her hair. "But you're not getting lucky before the date's over, okay?"
Jack laughed nervously. "Yeah, yeah." Jessica smiled and bit her lip, reaching over and holding Jack's hand. They both blushed as Jack closed his hand around hers. "I, um...never really been on a date like this before," Jack mumbled.
"Me either," Jessica said in the same, quiet voice. She leaned over and pecked Jack on the cheek. "Now, let's go find some clothes I can actually wear."

Outside of Jack and Jessica's view was a woman who's pregnant belly looked big enough to fit both of them in it. Commander Zavaleta was marching around the mall, taking long, deep breaths and trying not to look too winded or tired. While most of the pregnant residents of the city (about 25% of the population now) were stuck on waddling, Zavaleta was an expertly trained woman and could manage to walk sternly, even with the biggest pregnant belly in the entire city. And in this city, that was saying something. Letting out a low sigh, Zavaleta rubbed her belly and looked around the mall. "I can feel it here...somewhere."

While the coin's magic and given Zavaleta some of the worst aspects of pregnancy as retaliation against her, it might have exposed her to its magic a little too much. She could sense the coin's magic now and knew it was somewhere in the mall. But where exactly, she couldn't tell. Zavaleta continued to march around the mall, going up to different people and seeing if the chaotic energy was coming from any of them. Of course, a woman as large as Zavaleta would normally draw too much attention to herself, but her military training let her sneak into people's blind spots. Darting around the mall, all she did was work up an even larger appetite. Eventually, she sat down on the lip of the mall's fountain to collect her thoughts and her breath. Zavaleta let out a low moan, rubbing her hands over her belly and inspecting her massively increased bust. All she had was military outfits that, while still durable enough to withstand her mammoth proportions, were still constricting.

"Well, I shouldn't need them for too much longer," Zavaleta remarked with a sarcastic laugh. "It looks like I'll be giving birth any day now." The young inside her started kicking and fidgeting, eliciting a little groan from the older military woman. "And it feels like you're all ready to get out too. Well, I'm excited for that too." Zavaleta started rubbing her belly more as a man with an obvious pregnant belly walked over to her with a clipboard.
"Hello ma'am," he said in a nervous voice. "But, um, I don't know if you've heard about the pregnant bikini contest we're having in a few days and...forgive me for being blunt about it, but you would get us a lot of attention if you participated."
With impressive quadricep strength, Zavaleta brought herself to an upright position and was staring the man in the face. "What did you say to me? You'd dare ask me to dress in a bikini and parade around for your amusement?"
Oven's face flushed. This woman was looking at him with a cold ferocity. Over 50 years in the military would give that to a person. "W-well, it's not just that. There's cash prizes and other rewards." He held out the clipboard with a trembling hand. "H-here's a list of all the prizes. It's getting updated every day too."

Zavaleta scoffed and ran her eyes over the clipboard. Not too many people had signed up today, which wasn't helping Oven's mental state. He'd just learned he was a pregnant man a few hours ago and he wasn't getting any more registrations. Aside from a few notable exceptions, Sandwich was crushing him in this regard. He also felt a little envious of all these women who were pregnant and qualified for the prizes. He was pregnant too! He needed money to raise a baby! As Zavaleta was about to look back at the odd man in front of her and subtly inform him that she'd killed before, something caught her eye. *ANTIQUE COIN: VALUE UNKNOWN*
"That's it," she mused, a smile spreading across her red lips. "You can't hide from Nicole Zavaleta."

In the maternity clothing store, Jack was walking around with Jessica who was oohing and aahing at all of the different options. "I'd always thought maternity clothes were mostly ugly, but a lot of these are really cute!"
The owner, a young woman with short brown hair, nodded with a smile. Everyone laughed at her and her business partners when they said they wanted to open a cutting edge maternity fashion store, but now business was booming. Mmph. Another kick in her side. It was booming just in time for her to be able to wear some of the clothes herself without worrying about how it would affect the inventory. She only remembered being pregnant thanks to Ian's coin flip falling on heads, however.

"What is this music, though?" Jack asked, looking up for the speakers. It was gothic metal music, although turned down enough that it didn't feel totally innapropriate in the store.
"Mommy Kills Best," the owner said. "It's a local metal band of all pregnant women. They're getting pretty popular and they're playing at the pregnant bikini contest this week. By the way," she said with a smile, turning to Jessica. "You're very pretty, miss. You should enter!"
"Oh, I already am," Jessica giggled. "That reminds me, I need to try on a pregnant bikini here that'll fit better."
"My advice? Go with a regular bikini. Shows off more of the maternal body," the owner winked, going back to her work at the front. Jack blushed at the thought of Jessica parading in a bikini...pregnant. And in a few days, she'd be even bigger than she is now...
"Okay, snap out of it, lover boy," Jessica laughed, nudging him. "Help me try on some of these clothes." She took his hand and waddled into a changing stall.
"W-with you?" Jack asked. Jessica grinned and nodded.
"A little reward for being so good so far. Don't make me take it back," she chuckled, giving him a peck on the lips as she closed the stall door behind them.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: To the mall!

choices: Interruptions at the mall move the date elsewhere
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
With some new outfits picked out, Jessica waited as Jack paid for the clothes at the counter. The pregnant owner flashed smiles at both of them as they waited.
"How much longer until your little one comes out?" the owner asked.
Jessica and Jack looked at each other, unsure of how to answer, given the coin's magic. "Six months," Jessica said, trying to remember the last thing she'd heard from her doctor and trying to factor in the month-a-day growth the coin was giving him. She noticed the owner's eyes bug out a little at Jessica's response, her eyes immediately going to Jessica's belly. "It's twins, so it's a little on the big side," Jessica chuckled, patting her belly.
"Wow, twins," the owner mused. "I can hardly contain myself just carrying one. Oouf, although with these kicks, it feels like there's a whole litter in there."
Jack smiled and nodded politely. It was hard not to think of his own mother at the mention of a whole litter. How must it feel for her when his baby brothers and sisters kicked in her belly?
"Although, with all the pregnancies in the city lately, it seems like multiple pregnancies are more common. I'm in the minority with just my little girl in here," the owner said, looking down at her own midsection. "All the girls in Mommy Kills Best have twins, except for the lucky lead singer with triplets."
Jack felt his face getting hot at all of this pregnancy talk. Jessica noticed and smiled, holding his hand and rubbing it with her thumb a little.

Jack bought Jessica's new clothes and the two headed out the door. "Thanks for that," Jessica said with a little peck on his cheek. "Buying me things, just like a real boyfriend on a real date."
"I thought that's what this was supposed to be," Jack chuckled.
"Oh, it is. I'm just impressed you're getting it so right so far," Jessica smiled, rubbing her belly with one hand. "So far. Now, movie time!"

---Nicole Zavaleta---

"You. Tell me more about this coin," Zavaleta said, taking Oven by the collar and pointing to his clipboard.
Oven cleared his throat and looked where Zavaleta was pointing - right where it said "antique coin." "I-I don't know too much about that," Oven stammered. "It was given to us by a local bank branch and one of the other organizers is the one who's actually bringing it in."
Zavaleta adjusted her hand to place one thumb gingerly against Oven's adam's apple. "Who? Give me a name."
"L-Lisa Smith, one of the hosts with me and Sandwich."
"Sandwich?"
"It's just our DJ names. I-I can't remember his real name off the top of my head!" Oven wanted to add that it was because he was paralyzed with fear but he decided to leave that out for now. He felt a fluttering in his stomach. Great. It picked now to start kicking!
Zavaleta thought it over. Now that she had a name, she could try and track down this woman and get the coin from her...somehow, it had gotten from her office in the hospital to this Smith woman. Then, Zavaleta let out another foreign curse. Smith. It would take a bit longer to find this specific woman.

"Would you like to sign up for the contest?" Oven finally squeaked out.
"No!" Zavaleta boomed, releasing him immediately and turning around to think. In the process, her colossal belly smacked against his thigh, causing him to jump back another few feet. "No...it's better to remain in the shadows. Seems even at this age, I'm still doing covert work...my blood is restless with excitement!" She rubbed her hands together gleefully. As a young soldier, she'd trekked through mountains and forests just to get to a target or to intercept a message. She hadn't gotten to do it for decades!
"Well...will you at least show up? You'd draw a lot of media buzz to the event," Oven said, his business-sense annoyingly fighting with his better judgement to leave the terrifying, colossally pregnant woman alone.
"Yes, I'll be there," Zavaleta smiled sinisterly. "But I won't bring any attention with me...you won't even know I'm there."
As she cackled quietly to herself, Oven's eyes moved to her belly. Somehow, I think someone will know you're there.

---P.E.A.R. Field HQ---

Lieutenant Riker was watching the screen intensely, tapping his earpiece furiously. "Damn, I can't pick up any audio from this range."
"Lieutenant, if we could just move the Spyder closer, we could-"
"No!" Riker barked, turning around to face the minor P.E.A.R. agent who was working the console beside him. "If we get any closer, Commander Zavaleta will notice it. The old hag's got incredible senses."
"Old hag?" one of the other agents said. "I keep hearing that's she's in her 60s, but she looks pretty fit to me."
Riker was steaming. "Out. Everyone out!"

The room emptied in a flash and Rike stood up, pacing the room and looking at the multitude of screens before him. "It's just a race between the two of us now. But while you're carrying around that preposterous, fat swell of brats, I've got cameras and microphones all over the city." Riker's face turned up in to a smile. "I will come out on top and I will be the rightful head of P.E.A.R...and using the coin's magic, more than that is not impossible."

Turning his attention back to the screens, Riker flipped between scene after scene of pregnant men and women consoling family and friends, or embracing their pregnant body, or the occasional house with two barren occupants. Flipping from channel to channel, he only found one with static. "Hmm..." Riker said, stroking his chin and looking at the coordinates. "Looks like a suburban house, nothing that would mess with the signal. Oh well. There's over 100 of these things crawling around. At least one's got to run into trouble."

"...find the other coins and bring them together. Then-"

Riker stopped and flipped the biggest display away from Zavaleta at the mall and to the conversation he's just picked up on. It was in some sort of warehouse. A group of four people were listening to one pregnant girl who looked like she was in her mid-20s, approximately.
"You got that from the book?" one of the four, a pregnant, busty redhead, asked.
The one girl nodded. "That's the conclusion I drew from what I read. When all of them are together, it...weakens it somehow and we can probably exert some sort of control." The girl cocked her head a little. "Well, Jack specifically."
One of the four, a huge, muscly guy who didn't look pregnant, laughed and shook his head. "We've looked over that book for years and didn't get that far. You must be some sort of genius or you're full of shit."
"Hey, this is the only lead we have, Mr. Ox," another of the four, a pregnant, dark skinned woman, said. "So, Mariah, what else do you have for us?"
"Well, Jack's got one of them and we have a lead on the other one, plus the book," the girl, who Riker now knew was Mariah, said. "The third...we still don't know yet. But there's definitely three."
The four nodded along. "Thank you for letting us know," the dark skinned woman said. "We'll keep looking ourselves. In the meantime, get the book and the coin. If we can at least hang onto them, we'll be able to prevent more...of this." She patted her belly and the redhead and Mariah rubbed theirs solemnly. "Why couldn't Jack be here? Or that girl he's always with? They're an important part of this too."
Mariah blushed. "Oh...well...they're...together."
Mr. Ox and the other man chuckled and the redhead rolled her eyes. "He didn't look like he had it in him," she remarked.

---Jack and Jessica---

"Mmm, Jack, not now," Jessica giggled as Jack kissed a trail up her arm to her neck in the mall's theatre.
"It's just the previews," Jack whispered, nibbling on Jessica's earlobe. Today, something was really overcoming him with incredible passion and libido.
"Well, I want to watch them," Jessica smiled, giving him a quick kiss back and settling back into her seat, running her hands over her belly. Jack grumbled and sat still in his seat, looking at previews for the next romcom coming the following year. After a few moments of unrest, Jessica and Jack passed each other quick glances, Jessica's grin widening each time. Finally, she reached her left hand over and took Jack's right, resting it on her belly with her hand overtop of his.
"Will this get you through the movie?" Jessica smiled at him. Jack blushed and nodded, spreading his hand out and rubbing her wide womb gently.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The date continues!

choices: Jack: Dinner with Jessica back at that restaurant, and then Bow-Chicka-Wow.
More Characters: Let's see what other characters are doing.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
- - - Jack and Jessica - - -
Jack and Jessica were locked in a perfect moment in time. Jack's hand resting on the maternal expanse that was Jessica's belly, Jessica's head resting softly on Jack's shoulder, a cheesy date movie playing. Despite all that was happening around them, the chaos and pregnancies, this was their perfect moment in time, and they had not a care in the world.

Which was good, because nothing really interesting happened while they watched their movie... But on the other hand..

- - - - - - Ian - - - - -

Ian was a special kind of idiot. Somehow, he ended up trapped in a pregnancy nightmare, surrounded by dozens of pregnant women.. and men apparently. Ian however, was not the special kind of idiot to understand that what was happening around him, espically to the men, WAS. NOT. NORMAL So as he sat, alone in his apartment, watching the national news, the town he lived in making headlines as the pregnancies new spread, he wondered how it all happened.

It's probably something the government is behind. They put shit in our drinking water all the time. I wonder if this some kind of crazy covert experiment gone haywire Ian thought as a doctor on the news explained how a man could possibly carry a child.

"I should leave before something to me!" Ian said, his sense of self-preservation kicking into high-gear. He wasn't the first in his apartment block to try to leave. An older man who lived down the hall tried to leave earlier in the night, saying "I'm not getting knocked up" as he packed his car and tried to get past the roadblocks leading out of town.

"Better leave this up to fate" Ian said to himself. "Heads, I stay. Tails, I stay" He said, reaching into his pocket, searching for Jack's coin he gave him.. only to find nothing. "Oh damn that's right. I gave it to the bank! It's a prize in the damn bikini contest" He scratched his chin, deep in though, which turned out was actually quite shallow.

That bikini contest, pregnant bellies on display. It was something that weirded that out... Not because he was disgusted by it.. No, seeing some of those women.. in those bikinis.. With their breasts.. and their bellies.. It made Ian...

"Stop thinking like that. Come on man. Don't be weird" Ian said to himself, turning his attention back to the TV, which wasn't helping him get his mind of the whole "pregnancy" thing, as footage of the numerous pregnant women in the town rolled by, followed by a few images of pregnant men.

BZZT. BZZT. Ian's phone went off, and Ian gulped deeply as he saw who it was from: His boss Ryan.

MEETING TOMORROW. 9AM BRIGHT AND EARLY. BE THERE OR BE FIRED. - Ryan (and sons)

Ian was curious as to why Ryan signed his text message "and sons" but whatever, he gave him his paycheck every two week, he could do whatever the hell he wanted.

"Well shit, I wonder what this is going to be about" Ian thought as he fired up his game-console.

- - - - - - - Amanda - - - - - -

In terms of disasters, this was quickly approaching levels of "biblical", Amanda thought, sitting in her chair, her hands resting on her belly, her children kicking away inside of her. It seemed so promising, the hope that breaking bread between a pregnant wife and her husband's pregnant mistress might help them resolve their differences.. But after the third screaming match, the fifth use of Faye calling Amber a whore and
Amber calling Faye a word that rhymes with "Punt", Amanda just slowly ate her third piece of cheesecake in defeat.

"HE DIDN'T TELL ME HE WAS MARRIED! I WAS LONELY!" Amber screamed across the table, nearly ready to throw the delicious pasta Amanda made directly into Faye's pregnant face.
"SO YOU'VE HEARD OF A CONDOM?!" Faye snapped back.
"CONDOMS CAN FAIL! HOW DO YOU THINK I ENDED UP LIKE THIS? I JUST WENT TO A BAR AND SAID, BOY I HOPE SOME MARRIED MAN KNOCKS ME UP WITH TWINS TONIGHT!" Amber screamed back.

Jack Dale Sr had abandoned the peace talks long ago, slinking away to the den to do whatever it was he did in there. Amanda was hoping that it was drawing up plans to put everything when Amanda's order from the baby-store arrived tomorrow. Finishing her third slice of the cheesecake she bought, Amanda's hunger FINALLY felt sated as her unborn children inside of her seemed to finally calm down. Over 50 and pregnant, how did it come to this?

Sure, she knew HOW it happened (at least to the best of her knowledge, not knowing about the chaos being sewn by an ancient semi-sentiant semi-evil coin), but still this as a surprise to her. She was beyond happy, but she really wished her new bundles of joy came to her more than a few years ago instead of now when she was at the edge of her golden years. She ran her hand across the mountain that was her belly, and all of her troubles vanished for now.

BZZT. BZZT. Her cellphone went off, forcing her to get up from her semi-moment of happiness and waddle over to her purse, to retrieve the buzzing device. It was a text from her boss Ryan.

HELLO AMANDA. HEARD THE GREAT NEWS AT THE OFFICE TODAY. CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YOU TOMORROW MORNING FOR THE MEETING. MAYBE YOU, ME, AND TARA CAN COMPARE BELLIES. 9AM, BUT IT'S OKAY IF YOU'RE A LITTLE LATE. I KNOW HOW HARD IT IS TO GET AROUND. - Ryan (And Sons).

Amanda smiled. Her boss Ryan was pregnant as well, Amanda remembered the day he told everyone. Nobody really believe it until his middle became much more round, and even then.. If it wasn't for everything that happened the past few days, Amanda would have believed it was all apart of a very elaborate prank. After finding out she was pregnant with quads at her age, she didn't really question anything anymore, even if her male 50 year old boss was pregnant.

Still, maybe some work would get her mind of this pregnancy.. and how much bigger she was getting every day. It was weird, not right, and worried her so. She wanted to scream "WHAT IS WRONG WITH ME!?" But the last thing she needed right now was attracting more attention with all of these... government people in their city. She didn't want to end up on some kind of lab somewhere... again. Today was traumatic enough.
