Faye took her hand off, smiling and laughing softly, strutting around the bed in all her naked, pregnant glory. "Yes, and I wish you would have thought of those kinds of memories before you stuck it in that ginger girl. And I don't need you to touch me and make me feel good anymore," Faye said, taking a towel from the room's closet. "I have the neighbor boy now."

Faye locked the master bedroom back up as she strolled toward the bathroom, stopping when she saw Amber in the hallway, standing in an oversized white t-shirt to cover her belly. "You want to use the shower too, huh?" Faye said.
Amber hung her head, confrontations with Faye always feeling horrible. "Yes." Amber took another deep breath. "Thank you for letting me...sleep in your home for the night."
Faye smiled sarcastically and shrugged. "Of course! You didn't have your car with you, it was late, and you're tired. I know how tiring carrying Charles' babies can be."
"I'll wait for you to finish your shower," Amber said, starting to turn around.
"No, no! We have to learn to share this house," Faye said, beckoning Amber forward. "Just wait in the bathroom while I shower and we can switch. That way we can talk."

For some reason, Amber couldn't say no and she followed Faye into the bathroom which was plenty large to fit the two heavily pregnant women inside. Faye stepped into the shower and smiled and preened as she washed herself, Amber taking the occasional glance over.
"Faye...how old are you again?"
Faye grinned. "Mid 40s."
Amber shook her head slowly. Then how do you have a body like that, especially while you're pregnant with quadruplets?
"Now Amber, I understand you're entering the pregnant bikini contest," Faye said. "Looking for more sugar daddies?"
"No, I am actually trying to win enough money to support these babies on my own, so I don't have to live with you," Amber replied. "Believe it or not, I don't want to live with you and Charles. I just need to do what's best for my children. And if I win, I won't need his support to raise them."
Faye chuckled. "Now noble of you, Amber."
Amber rolled her eyes. "And you're entering as well?"
"Yes, indeed I am," Faye said. "I have...my own reasons."
Amber shrugged and looked around the room, noticing the coin on the bathroom counter. It looked pretty odd. As Amber looked closer at it, she thought it looked similar to some token Jack was carrying around. Amber reached her hand out to the tiny sliver of metal. Faye's wet hand grabbed Amber's just before she picked it up. "Your turn," Faye smiled, nodding her head toward the shower.

When Faye dressed herself and waddled into the kitchen, Amber was already sitting there, dressed, eating breakfast, and taping away at her laptop. "It must be easier to get dressed with a smaller belly," Faye remarked.
Amber nodded. "It must be."
"What's that you're working on?" Faye said with her back turned, turning on the stove to make her own breakfast.
It was actually the program Amber had started work on to control the Spyder camera she'd run across. Most of the navigational controls were already accessible by Amber, but now she was uploading the camera's stream and trying to find away to include the city's mapping into the robot's computer. "Just something for work."
"You're still working? You're not just going to try and drain my husband's remaining money?" Faye said.
Amber grit her teeth and continued working in silence.
"No, of course not. You think you can win that contest, can't you? You seem very confident in your beauty. After all, you seem to have made a life out of stealing away other people's husbands."
"At least I don't resort to kissing my neighbor's children," Amber said. In no time, Faye was next to Amber, belly pressed against belly.
"Get something straight, you little brat: this is my home first and foremost and you are only here because I am allowing it. And I am still planning on finding a way to get you kicked out, whether you've got my husbands' bastards or not."

Flip me! Make her even bigger and more uncomfortable!
No, that would just give her more of Charles' children, Faye thought. Besides, I enjoy being the bigger one between us.
Amber gulped. "Where is Charles, anyway? I haven't seen or heard from him at all in the past few days. He could settle a lot of your issues with me."
Faye curled her lips and stood up slowly. "Charles isn't feeling too well, I told you already."
"Well he must still be able to talk."
"I said. He's. Not. Feeling. Well," Faye said, returning to her stove. "I called Amanda and told her you needed a ride to work. You and her son work in the same place, don't you?"
Amber bit her lip. "Yes."
"Well then, better hurry up and get ready to go," Faye said. "The clock is ticking."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The Most Uncomfortable House in the World

choices: Clash of the Titans - the baby shower
Jack and Amber work, get some familiar customers
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Amber took a deep breath and knocked on the Dale's front door a few times, returning her hands to her twin-filled belly for a quick, comforting rub. A few seconds later, the door opened and Amber's eyes couldn't help but drift down to Amanda's belly. You'd think that an extended period of exposure to Faye's equally-quadruplet-filled, naked body would have inoculated against bellies of this magnitude. With the epidemic of "sudden pregnancies" in the city, Amber had slowly adapted to seeing pregnant men and women all the time. But the same could just not be said about bellies Amanda and Faye's sizes.

"Amber, hi!" Amanda said cheerily, one hand on her belly as she slowly waddled out the door, her belly making the journey a good five seconds before the rest of her body. Amber didn't respond at first, squinting and thinking in her head whether Amanda had actually gotten bigger since yesterday's dinner. "Faye called and said you needed a ride?"

Amber looked up quickly at Amanda's smiling face and nodded. "Yes, I ended up staying the night at her home after all the lunacy with the hospital and those Health and Human Service goons. They took me right out of my home so my car's still there. I appreciate you driving me."

"Well, I try to cut down on driving as much as I can," Amanda smiled softly, rubbing her belly in a larger arc. "Jack's going to take the four of us for the first leg of our carpool."

Amber tensed up, remembering that she'd need to travel with Jack again, before pausing. "Four of us?"

She got it out just in time for Jack and Jessica to walk out the door, the two exchanging a quick, blushing smile as Jessica bit her lip and tightened her grip on Jack's hand. As soon as they saw Amber, Jack froze, his hand slipping out of Jessica's grasp. "H-hi, Amber."

"C'mon, it looks bad if the manager's late," Amber said, turning around gracefully and waddling to the family's car. Jack got in the driver's seat, Jessica as the pregnant woman with the smallest belly got in beside him, and Amanda and Amber both shared the back, Jack having to move his seat forward considerably to accommodate Amanda and his four little siblings inside her.

Jack tried to turn on the radio as quickly as he could but Jessica seemed intent on keeping it off, turning back and smiling at the other passengers who were carrying passengers of their own. "Amber, are you going to enter the pregnant bikini contest too?"

Amber smiled softly and nodded. "Yes, I want to try and get some money to support these two," she said, poking her belly softly. "Besides, I think I look pretty good pregnant and I might as well have some fun with this curvy body for the few weeks I still have it. I don't think I'll be having any more kids for a while after this."

"Twins too?" Jessica said, excitement raising in her voice. Jack looked over at Jessica nervously, wondering how much she knew about his relationship with Amber. She seemed to get over Faye, but it took some work. Who knows how she might take his near-kiss with his boss? He was at least happy at how Jessica was acting happier about her pregnancy. They may really not be able to reserve this process, so at least Jessica was making the best of things, or at least trying. "Same for me. And whoever wins, I'm sure we can all work to raise our kids together. We'll all be new moms at around the same time, it seems."

Amanda nodded and smiled softly. "Well, these four grow so quickly, I might give birth any day now," Amanda sighed. "I hope I can make it to the contest tomorrow. I've been practicing my dancing and I think it'll be fun."

"Fun?" Amber said, with a curious smile. "I admire your courage, going out in a contest like this at...your age." Amber's morning with Faye had left her "shade-throwing" abilities fully engaged and she was having trouble lowering those shields.

Amanda chuckled and ran her hands up and down her hugeness aggressively. "That's part of the reason I want to do this. Expel some myths and maybe inspire some other older women. You know, I've felt better during this pregnancy than I've felt in decades."

"Maybe you'll try and get pregnant again after this litter," Jessica giggled.

"Don't even joke about that," Jack muttered, shaking his head as he pulled into the tech store. "Alright, let's go Amber. Mom, Jessica, you both know what you're doing from here out?"

"Yes, we've got it planned out," Amanda nodded. "Jessica will come with me to my work, where there's a big office baby shower. We both talked and thought it would be a nice chance for her to get that kind of celebration."

"That does sound nice," Jack smiled at Jessica, who blushed and stuck her tongue out at him quickly. "I can visit around my lunch break. That's fine, right Amber?"

"Fine to me," Amber said, stretching out and pulling her work shirt down to cover her belly. "I might join you, if that's okay. I haven't...been to a baby shower either."

"Oh, then you definitely have to come!" Amanda grinned, clasping her hands together. "Alright, have a good day at work you too. Love you, Jack!"

"Love you too, Mom," Jack smiled weakly and nodded, walking into work with Amber.

After some struggling to get out of the car and walk around with a seven-month, twin-filled pregnant belly, Jessica got into the driver's seat and adjusted things so her belly wouldn't get too in the way and drove off to Titan Bank, following Amanda's instructions. During the trip and a lull in the dull conversation, Amanda brought up a sensitive subject. "Jessica...does your belly grow strangely after each night?"

Jessica hesitated before answering. "Yes," she said. "I think it's an effect of the coin...I mean, the 'sudden pregnancy disease' that's going around."

Amanda nodded and rubbed her belly, thinking. "So, you think my pregnancy is a result of that?"

"W-well, if it's growing in that kind of odd way...I think so," Jessica said. "I know that my pregnancy is progressing that way and it was definitely caused by the disease."

"Definitely? You mean you didn't-"

Jessica shook her head. "Not for a long time. Until Jack, but I was already definitely pregnant by that point."

Amanda smiled warmly at Jessica's words before rubbing her own belly. "So these children aren't ones created by me and my husband," she sighed. "Great."

"Maybe they are," Jessica said quickly. "We don't understand this disease yet. It could have been created out of the love you both share or it affected a previously existing pregnancy!"

"Maybe," Amanda smiled. "You know, I think it's incredible that you and Jack are staying together even as you're pregnant. When he was little, he had a...little thing for pregnancy, but he seems to have grown out of that."

Geez, I thought mothers were supposed to be perceptive, Jessica laughed to herself. "It seems so." Jessica paused and looked at Amanda in the rear view mirror. "Thank you for being so...accepting of me, Mrs. Dale," she said. "My parents didn't take the news nearly as well."

"Well, it's scary having your child suddenly become a parent. It means they're growing up and aren't your little babies anymore," Amanda sighed. "And it's not just your parents. Believe me, when I thought Jack had gotten you pregnant, I gave him an earful."

Jessica laughed, feeling her babies kick in response. "Well I would have like to see that. He gets so bashful when I tease him." Amanda's own laughs settled somewhat, her face turning red. Hearing about Jack's girlfriend and...mother of his adopted children talk about their relationship was something she would need to get used to.

The two pulled into the parking lot at Titan Bank, the parking lot surprisingly full. Most of the staff was walking in and Amanda took the time to point people out to Jessica. After all, they'd be the people she'd be sharing her first baby shower with.

"That's the technical 'focus' of the shower, my boss. Having a pregnant man for a boss took some getting used to, but he's very excited. What's odd is that he got pregnant before all this 'sudden pregnancy business started......that's Ian, Jack's friend. He's not a particularly good employee and used to gawk at our female employees more than we'd like. I'm really not sure why we keep him around. He's lucky, I guess.....and there are some other women you'll meet, some pregnant and joining in, some not.....oh, and that's Tara. You've met her before, I think. She's sharp and so funny. I think she'll run this place one day, and that's...that's..."

"Oh my god," Jessica gasped as Zavaleta followed behind Tara. For once in the last week since Jessica and Amanda found out they were pregnant with multiples, they felt downright petite.

"This will be a baby shower to remember," Amanda chuckled, mouth still agape as she stepped out of the car.

Jack will have an absolute heart attack when he sees this woman's belly, Jessica thought to herself. This will be hilarious.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: An awkward drive to work

choices: What's going on at the baby shower? Plus, Jack and co. make an entrance
um...follow some other characters? Always a good backup plan
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack filled out his timecard in the back before walking behind the counter, with Amber already there, one hand beneath her belly, her face mischievously bemused.

"So...we're good?" Jack said hesitantly, looking over at Amber. Amber spread her lips out in a wider grin, turning softly, resting one elbow on the counter, her belly plainly sticking out and center.

"Yes, we're 'good,' Jack," Amber said. "It's been a weird time for us. For the whole city, really." She sighed and leaned in. "I know you have someone else in your life who you care about and I find the idea that Faye pulled some sort of bullshit on you very believable."

Jack chuckled and blushed. As much as he'd made things up with Jessica, he didn't think he'd be able to get the sight of Faye's heavily pregnant, flirtatious body out of his head anytime soon. "Thanks. And I kind of...got a sense of what's going on between you and Faye and I'm really sorry. If you ever want to talk about, you know, anything, let me know. We're still friends, right?"

Now it was Amber's turn to blush. "When did you get so mature?" she muttered, reaching under the counter to get out a clipboard with some points of store info. "So Jack, as I'm sure you can tell, I'm going to have to take maternity leave pretty soon. So while that's going on, you will be the store's interim manager."

Jack froze. "Oh...Amber, I don't know if that's appropriate."

Amber shook her head. "I've had months to think this over. Nearly nine, to be exact. You do your work efficiently, you've brought up ideas and changes that have paid off, and you're smart. I would have picked you regardless of what happened in the last few days." Amber turned her lips up in a laughing scowl. "But just to be on the safe side, if you ever tell anyone about what I've confided in you, I'll get Faye, your mom, and every other big preggo I can find and we'll all crush you to death."

Jack shuddered. "That's...specific."

Amber cackled and turned back to her work. "Well, I'm a big fan of horror movies. Maybe you'd like to...watch some with me some time?" She paused and turned back with an honest smile. "Jessica can join us if she wants."

Jack was shocked by the uncharacteristic kindness from Amber. Did the ghosts from A Christmas Carol visit her last night or something. "Thanks Amber. I'd like that."

The door's bell rang and Jack and Amber turned to see their first customer of the day. "Jack! Good, I found you. Jessica wasn't at work," Mariah said, running one hand under her belly to support it as she hurried in.

"You seem to have a way of attracting women to you," Amber cooed meanly, back to her old self.

"Mariah? What's going on now? How did you even know I work here?" Jack asked.

"Remember when you got kidnapped?" Ms. Smart said, rolling her eyes as she and Ms. Apple waddled inside, both still insisting in wearing high-class designer outfits despite their coin-induced full-term pregnancies. "We've always known where you live and work, kid."

"Make that a certain type of women," Amber said, raising her eyebrows. "Lucky that you like this sort of thing," Amber said, moving her hand to her belly.

"Amber, please," Jack said, starting to get a cold sweat. If those two were here, then things can't be good. "This is important."

"Yes, I'd be quiet and listen up, because this concerns you," Ms. Apple said, giving Amber's belly a look. Amber looked at the fellow red-head with a shocked, slightly infuriated look before Ms. Smart shook her head, putting her hand in her head.

"We do any kind of covert work and you just have to work in movie lines," she said. "Ma'am, actually, could you go into the back? This is a very private conversation."

Amber looked and Jack who just shrugged awkwardly. "Well there goes that maturity," Amber scoffed, giving the rest of the room a disapproving look. "You've got 10 minutes. I'm still the manager, after all."

"R-right," Jack said, turning to Mariah and her new companions frantically when Amber left. "What's going on? Why are you here?"

"I think I know how to stop all of this; how to reverse the coin's magic," Mariah said. "And we've got the pieces all together. We just have to collect them."

"That's...that's great!" Jack said with a big smile. "So what do we need to do?"

"Well, first, we need to get the other coins," Ms. Apple sighed. "We think there's just two others. One's the prize for the pregnant bikini contest-"

"-what a coincedence, huh?" Ms. Smart laughed.

"-right. And the other one is with that woman who took the book. But Mariah said you know who it is."

Jack nodded nervously. "Jessica got a text from Mariah and we've figured it out. It's my neighbor, Faye."

"Your neighbor?" Ms. Apple said. "Well that's perfect. We can get it from her anytime we want tonight."

"Eh, it's a little more complicated than that," Jack said. "She and me, we..."

"Say no more," Mariah smiled, blushing. "I can fill them in later. But the third coin...one of us just needs to win the contest, don't we?"

Jack nodded, sighing. "So we have to do all this on the last possible day. I don't like that risk." Jack nodded along to himself before realizing something. "Wait a minute! My mom's bank is one of the sponsors for the contest and they're keeping most of the prizes together! The coin might be at her bank!"

"A bank's going to be pretty hard to get into," Ms. Smart said. "We have resources but they're mostly just for surveillance and travel."

"No, no, it'll work out. There's a big baby shower there today. Practically anyone who's pregnant is invited," Jack said. "We'll be able to look around and no one will suspect a thing! Heck, with my mom there, her belly will take up most of the office's attention."

"Most people aren't as fixated on pregnant bellies as you appear to be," Ms. Apple said, crossing her arms near her belly, giving Jack a knowing look, at which point Jack realized he'd been gawking at her bump for the last minute or so.

"But that should still work," Ms. Smart added. "And even if it isn't there, we can get it at the contest. Mariah, work on a plan with Jack to figure out how to get the coin and book from this Faye woman. You're friends, you'll work well together."

"O-oh," Mariah said as the two pregnant members of the anti-coin patrol headed out. "What are you both doing?"

"Practicing for the contest, of course," Ms. Smart said. "We've got to cover all our bases. It wouldn't hurt if you came up with a dance routine too."

Mariah crossed her arms anxiously as they left, turning back to Jack. "S-so...I'll meet you at this baby shower. Jessica will be there?"

"Yeah," Jack nodded. "It's Titan Bank. I'll text you when I'm heading out." Mariah and Jack shared numbers when she thanked him and left.

"11 minutes," Amber said, leaning against the counter when they left. "So, what did I miss? Are you going to have four different child support payments to make?"

Jack rolled his eyes. "Geez, one minute I'm a weird nerd who you say can't get any girlfriends, and the next I'm supposed to be getting women pregnant all over town?"

"Maybe you're the cause of this 'mysterious pregnancy disease,' you stud," Amber cackled, putting a piece of gum in her mouth. "Now c'mon Strong Hands, let's do some real work."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack and Amber work, get some familiar customers

choices: The baby shower continues with new guests
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Not much work was being done at Titan Bank, as employees were gathered around the snack table near the conference room, smiling at chatting. Originally the idea was to keep the food and drinks inside the room, but given how big some of the employees had gotten, the baby shower's organizers thought it might not be a great idea.

"It's lucky how so many people got pregnant at the same time," Margaret, one of the office's cheerier employees, a woman in her mid-30s with frizzy blonde hair, said to Amanda, taking a sip of the fruit punch. Margaret took charge of most of the bank's parties and Ryan's baby shower was no different. "We can knock out a lot of celebrations at once. Not that it would be any problem if you wanted to have some more kids."

Amanda laughed and rolled her eyes, patting her enormous, quadruplet-filled belly. She may not have been able to know it precisely, but she was eight months pregnant with Jack's brothers and sisters. A few days ago, the doctor informed her she was three or four months pregnant, but Amanda could tell (and feel, thanks to all this kicking and moving) that that was not the case. "I don't think I'll be having any more children." The words were bitter-sweet.

While finding herself surprisingly pregnant with four babies in her mid-50s, Amanda realized just how much she missed being pregnant the first time around. The heaviness, the smooth skin, the maternal energy, the feeling of life growing inside her. And having a much larger belly was thrilling in its own right. Of course, it had its downsides, and practically, Amanda knew she wouldn't be able to do this again. She wanted to savor as much of this last pregnancy as she could, but as quickly as it was progressing, she wasn't sure how long she would be able to do that.

"I could understand that," Margaret laughed, running her hand on top of Amanda's gigantic bulge. "You're carrying more kids than most people have in a lifetime. Personally, I'm fine never having any kids." Little did Margaret know that, thanks to reckless coin-flipping, she was currently pregnant with her first child.

Tara waddled over, getting a cup of punch from the bowl, and stood next to Amanda. Margaret smiled and removed her hand from Amanda's belly. "Well, I'd better let the two most pregnant women in the world chat. Yolanda, let me help you decorate the cake." She left Tara and Amanda to turn, rubbing their bellies slowly as they talked.

"How are you feeling?" Tara asked, looking down at Amanda's belly. "I imagine getting close to the big day is kind of nerve-wracking with four babies on the way." Tara patted her own swelling belly nervously. "I know I'm scared with just three."

"You'll do fine," Amanda smiled. "And I'm nervous and anxious, sure, but any mother is. Just ask yours."

"R-right," Tara blushed. "My mother." Right on cue, the room got quiet as the planet-sized belly of Nicole Zavaleta bounded through the room, pushing a few people away as she came up to Tara.

"Daughter," Zavaleta said, most of her belly plainly showing, "I must talk with you about our family."

"Sure thing," Tara said, seeing all of the shocked looks clearly painted on people's faces. "A-and just 'Tara' is fine."

They went to the back of the office, talking quietly. "I don't seem to be able to collect much information," Zavaleta said. "I can't talk with these people without force. I will begin interrogating."

"No!" Tara said, making a few people turn their heads. "No, we can make them more conversational. You're just...intimidating. And you're not doing a very good job impersonating my mother."

"Intimidating?" Zavaleta said, resting one hand on her mammoth belly. "However do you mean? I'm using perfect blending techniques."

"That's just it. You're acting like the super spy that you are. Sometimes you blend in so well people forget you're here, then your impossibly big belly scares them again," Tara said, looking her over. The limited clothing selections the maternity clothing store had for Zavaleta left a very tight, revealing outfit. Even in her 60s, with her intense physical training and conditioning, compounded with the intense pregnancy, Zavaleta cut a very attractive, voluptuous figure and it was not very concealed.

"I can get all of the information I need from the servers, but there is still some detail missing," Zavaleta said, stroking her chin, mostly ignoring Tara's advice. "How did the coin come into their possession in the first place? Data from the PEAR center in the hospital shows that both you and Amanda Dale had unusually high readings, usually associated with more exposure to the coin."

"You're talking about that coin again," Tara said. "It's just a dumb promotional item for the contest tonight, but I don't know who's idea it was."

As the "mother/daughter" pair chatted, Jessica walked over to Amanda, a paper plate of snacks in her hand. "Thanks for inviting me, Mrs. Dale. This is pretty fun so far."

Amanda smiled. "I'm glad you're enjoying it. Are a lot of strangers feeling your belly?"

She giggled. "Yeah, but it's not as bad here as I expected. Want to feel too?"

Amanda's smile grew as she reached down to Jessica's middle. For better or for worse, these were going to be her grandchildren if she and Jack stuck it out. "They don't kick much, do they?"

"Not now," Jessica said, looking down at Amanda's hand on her seven-month-with-twins belly. "But sometimes it's like there's aliens inside me."

Amanda chuckled. "I know that feeling," she said, jutting out her belly for emphasis. "Have you had a chance to meet the future parent this baby shower is technically for?"

"Ryan?" Jessica smiled. "He's so busy showing off ultrasound photos and pictures of the nursery he said he designed himself that I've barely had a chance to say hi."

"Well, I'm sure he'll give a speech soon," she said, looking over at Tara and Zavaleta talking. "So...did you see Tara's mom?"

Jessica nodded, biting her lip to keep her grin from getting too obvious. "Hard not to. I like being pregnant but...I don't know if I'd want to be that pregnant. Especially for my first time."

"I know what you mean," Amanda said. "But she makes it look so easy. You can almost still see the impression of her abs on her belly. And look at the size of those arms..."

They clammed up quickly as the two waddled back, Zavaleta's cold demeanor switched to a gentler smile, focusing on her future children to keep her sunny. "So, Tara tells me you're having a pregnancy-related competition soon."

"Well, we're contributing some funding to get our name out there," Yolanda said, walking over with Ryan. "But yes, it's a pregnant bikini contest. Tara, you're entering, aren't you?"

Tara nodded with a grin, stroking her belly. "Yes, and so are Amanda and...Jessica, right? I remember you from Jack giving me a ride after I had my first check-up with the triplets.

An event related to her first pregnancy growth-spurt? Zavaleta noted, looking between them. This could be a clue.

"Yep, I'm entering," Jessica beamed, rubbing her belly. "And I've been practicing like crazy too. Mrs. Azem, are you entering? You could really turn some heads with a belly your size." Jack's in particular, she thought, Although I wouldn't mind seeing what someone that pregnant looks like in a bikini either...

"No, I came to town a bit late for that," Zavaleta said, rubbing her swollen middle. "I'll just cheer on my daughter. But what sort of contributions are you giving?"

"Cash prizes, some novelty gifts," Ryan said. "I put Ian in charge of all that, so it's a miracle it hasn't all fallen apart yet. And, of course, he picked today to take the day off." He shook his head. "Pregnancy always makes immature people uncomfortable."

"I can't believe my son spends so much time with him," Amanda laughed, shaking her head. "Jessica, that's going to be torture for you."

Another connection? Zavaleta thought. I'll have to pay attention for this...Jack

Natalie walked back into the office, hanging up her cellphone after checking in with Lisa. As she did, two more people came in behind her. "Hold the door?" Amber said, smiling to Natalie.

"Sure," Natalie said, blushing a little. I hope she's at the bikini contest. Lisa would knock her out of the water, though.

"Hi Mom. Hi Jessi-" Jack started to say, seeing Zavaleta and freezing in place.

"Hey kid," Amber smiled, elbowing him in the back. "They can all see you gawking."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Crowded baby shower

choices: Follow Jack and Jessica as they plan
Amanda and Amber stay at the baby shower, turn on the news
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jessica chuckled and gave Jack a kiss on the cheek before taking him by the hand and walking him inside. "You're not going to spend my entire baby show staring at another woman, are you?"
Jack laughed nervously back. "I-I mean, can you stop looking at her?"
"Good point," Jessica smiled, getting some more snacks as Amber turned away, still finding the sight of Jack with another woman hard to get used to. Natalie was right beside her, a plastic cup of soda in her hand. "Hi there," Amber smiled at her. Natalie smiled back a little too warmly. If Lisa was any example, Natalie was attracted to strong, confident women. "I'll bet you didn't expect so many bellies at work today, huh?"
Natalie shrugged. She couldn't exactly reveal that her girlfriend was pregnant with triplets, but she still went along with Amber. "Not exactly, but I don't mind it. Pregnant women have an amazing kind of energy around them. Well...I should say pregnant people." Natalie watched Ryan walk past them, still not used to the whole "pregnant man" thing.
"I've noticed people treating me a little differently since I ballooned up," Amber said, patting and rubbing her belly, which Natalie watched intently, "but I'm still ready for it to be over with, you know?"
"Sorry, I should have considered how you felt," Natalie said.
Amber smiled. "Hey, it's fine. I like being pregnant. But if you want to make it up to me, help me load of a plate of snacks."

"Glad you could make it, honey," Amanda said to her son as he got some food, attempting to eat some, only to be disarmed by Jessica's puppy-dog eyes and giving the plate to her. "You know plenty of people here at the bank and it's nice to have these baby showers together."
"It's too bad Mr. Dale couldn't be here," Jessica said with a mouthful of sausage rolls.
"Oh, we had our own private baby shower," Amanda grinned.
"Alright, time to go somewhere else," Jack said, taking Jessica by the hand and walking to another part of the bank as Amanda laughed and started chatting with Ryan. Tara met Jack and smiled, turning to both of them.
"Good to see you again, Jack. Although the last time you were here, I found out I had a few more babies hiding in here," Tara laughed, running her hands over her belly.
"Well, hopefully that won't happen again," Jack laughed back.
"Might give you an edge in the bikini contest, though," Jessica chuckled. "I'm going to look petite on stage with Mrs. Dale on stage."
Tara nodded, looking over at Amanda. "I don't know how she does it. Getting that big that quickly, when I've been struggling with these three for nine months now." Out of the corner of her eye, Tara saw Zavaleta closing in. Tara had begun to adjust to the stealthy movements of the 60 year old octomom. "S-so, Jack, have you met my mother yet?"

"Y-your mom?" Jack struggled to get out as Zavaleta appeared beside him, belly front and center. "N-no, hi. I'm Jack Dale, the son of one of Tara's coworkers."
So this is that "Jack" suspect. "Hello, my name is Nicole. You and my daughter seem to know each other well."
"A little, I guess," Jack smiled, turning back to Tara. "I helped her out a few days ago with taking her to and from the hospital."
"Pregnant women just seem to follow you wherever you go," Zavaleta said slowly, looking intensely into his eyes.
"W-well, this is happening all over town," Jack tried to laugh. "I'm sure I'm not the only one. Were you also...um...affected?"
"Yes, but I am not too concerned," Zavaleta said, stroking her belly slowly, "I've always wanted to be a mother...to multiple children at once." A near slip-up. Zavaleta resolved to punish herself with 1000 squats at night.
"G-good to hear," Jack said, trying to turn away as he felt Jessica staring daggers at him when Zavaleta grabbed his arm.
"I was wondering...will you be attending the contest my daughter is in?"
"Yes, my...girlfriend, Jessica, will be in it too," Jack said, motioning to Jessica, who smiled and waved. "And my mom too, so I'm a little torn between who to support."

Mother and girlfriend both pregnant? And the people who work at his mother's business? "Yes, it's so fun to have people in the same office competing against one another. I've always supported competition and my children will learn to value it too. Jessica, are any of your coworkers entering as well?"
"One of my friends, yes," Jessica replied. Zavaleta smiled sweetly, hiding her smile at confirming her hypothesis. It's him. Somehow, it's him.
"Well this all sounds very nice. Good luck to you, Tara, but I will be hoping for the best from your friends as well. I will leave now, but I will see you later tonight."
"Alright, have a good day, Mom," Tara said, confused why Zavaleta wanted to go now. "Be careful."
"I'm not the one who needs to be careful," Zavaleta said with a smirk, her mind reverting to her military days in the field. "I mean...thank you, dear."
Jack couldn't keep his eyes off of Zavaleta's belly. She was full-term with octuplets and took up nearly four times her normal body thanks to her big belly. He considered taking out the coin and making her even bigger, but decided against it. The fact that the coin wasn't calling to him right now with all of these not-yet pregnant people around was nothing short of a miracle.

As Zavaleta left, Amber got out her phone and saw a notification from the Spyder camera she reprogrammed. She managed to design an application for her smart phone that would let her remotely control and view whatever the camera was seeing. And since she had Jack and Jessica in her sights right now, she figured she might as well track Zavaleta now. She was as taken aback by her size as everyone else and she found her behavior very...suspicious. She reminded her of those goons that examined her at the city hospital.
"Everything good?" Natalie asked, holding Amber's plate and cup of water while Amber looked at her phone.
"Yes, thank you very much," Amber purred, aware of the affect she was having over Natalie. Unfortunately for her, Amber experimented with women already and didn't quite like it.

"Alright everyone," Margaret said at the front of the office. "We're going to open presents now. Ryan, you're the dad-to-be of honor, but we know you don't mind us having gifts for our other expectant employees as well."
"Of course not," Ryan smiled. "As long as I get the first slice of cake." The room laughed as Yolanda handed Ryan a paper bag with tissue paper sticking out of it. Inside was a pair of baby clothes, all with a suit print on them that said "Lil Businessman." Ryan chuckled, hugging Yolanda in reply.
"I love it, thank you," he said. "Although I'm not sure that's the path he'll want to take. I don't see how he can kick this much and not be an athlete."
"You'd be surprised," Amanda laughed as Yolanda handed her a gift. Amanda opened her bag up, finding four baby onsies, all red with "Thing 1," "Thing 2," and even a "Thing 3 & 4" included. "Aw, this is sweet."
"It wasn't easy to get the same design with the extra numbers, but that Baby Universe has everything," Yolanda smiled, getting Tara's gift.
Tara opened it up, finding three baby clothes designed like ballet outfits. "You knew I loved dancing?" Tara said.
"I did my research," Yolanda smiled. "There weren't any good clothes that showed dancing other than these tutus and nothing for belly dancing. I know that's what you prefer."
"That's what I'll be doing tomorrow night," Tara smiled, making Jack gulp at the thought of pregnant-with-triplets belly dancing, especially from someone already as gorgeous as Tara.

The room went back to chatting as the cake came out. "Sorry there's nothing for you," Amanda said to Jessica.
"I've got my present," Jessica smiled, holding onto Jack's arm and kissing him on the neck. "And Mrs. Dale, you've been so much kinder than I could have expected. Nicer than my parents, for sure..."
"Hey, are you getting gloomy?" Amber smiled, walking up behind the couple, hands on her belly. "I came here to get away from my troubles."
"Oh, we can chat more in private," Amanda smiled. "Jack, Jessica, you two can go now if you want. Nothing much else happens in a baby shower."
"This was already perfect," Jessica grinned, hugging Amanda as tightly as she could, bellies pressing together. "But yeah, Jack, let's head out."
"Good idea," Jack thought, the two nodding silently. While this was all fun, they had to work on making sure they got the coin and book back and trying to prevent any of these pregnancies from happening.

Outside, Zavaleta had already stripped out of her maternity clothes and was back in her stealth outfit, forcing another layer around her belly to conceal it better as she prepared to follow Jack and see what she could learn.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The baby shower continues with new guests

choices: Amber follows Mia and Zavaleta follow them both
Jack and Co. try to plot this all out
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack helped Jessica into her side of the car, his pregnant girlfriend smiling sweetly as Jack tried to make her comfortable. "Everything okay?"
"Yeah, yeah, why?" Jack said, voice a little shaky as he hurried around to the passenger seat.
"Oh, I dunno, you're giving me an awful lot of care, maybe because you don't want to me to be jealous of those other pregnant women at the baby shower?" Jessica said, her lips in a tight grin as she raised one eyebrow.
"Come on, you can't think I loved anyone there like I love you," Jack said, trying to laugh it off as he started the car.
"I'll be honest: when I saw Tara's mom, I was excited to see your reaction," Jessica laughed, kissing Jack on the cheek. "You didn't disappoint."
"It's crazy bellies like hers that make it more important that we fix this whole mess with the coin," Jack said, pulling out of Titan Bank's parking lot and heading into the city. "Has Mariah told you where to meet her?"
"Yep, I put the address into my phone. We'll get there soon," Jessica said, resting one hand on her own belly. "Are you sure you aren't trying to stop this whole 'coin' fiasco because of...this?"

Jack didn't say anything as he thought, making the turns the phone told him too. "You know I love you and I said I want a family with you. But let's do it on our own terms, not when some magic coin says you have to get pregnant."
Jessica didn't stop stroking her maternal bulge. "But when would our 'own terms' be? What if we do fix all this but then I get pregnant again by accident? Are you going to force me to get an abortion?"
"Jessica, you know that's different. Anything we do, we do together." Jack paused again. "Are you saying you want to keep this magic pregnancy?"
Jessica sighed as she rubbed her belly. "If I have the choice, I want to have a baby with you, not a coin and some ancient demon."
Jack turned and gave Jessica a little smile. "That's how I feel too. And if you have concerns or fears again...tell me. I want to talk through it with you." Jack reached down and turned on the radio as they drove.

"Yyyyou're listening to 101.9 The Edge!" Sandwich's now-familiar voice said over the air as Jack and Jessica continued driving. "It's busy down here at the station as we get ready for the 101.9 Pregnant Bikini Contest, down at Dino's Bar and Grill tomorrow night! This is proving to be our biggest one yet, right Oven?"
"Thhhhhat's right, Sandwich!" Oven replied, his peppy radio voice camouflaging his rotten attitude. "Over 50 women are participating in this year's contest, and for the first time, we've got multiple women entering who are carrying triplets or more! Including our own, Miss Lisa!"
"Thanks fellas," Lisa said sweetly. "That's right: I'm pregnant with triplets and you'll be able to see me, in a bikini, tomorrow night."
"I know a lot of our listeners have wanted to see you in a bikini, but I doubt many also wanted the pregnant part included," Oven said.
Jessica elbowed Jack in the car. "They don't know their listeners very well." Jack grinned and elbowed her back. "Ouch, I can't believe you nudged a pregnant woman!"
"I can't believe you nudged me while I'm driving," Jack laughed, turning the radio volume up.
"Well, Oven, tomorrow night, you, and our other skeptical listeners, are going to be surprised just how good-looking pregnant women can be," Lisa said.
"Alright you two, break it up," Sandwich laughed. "Lisa, why don't you give the people some more details on tomorrow night's event, for those who haven't already been on our website?"
"Sure thing. Well, all of our moms-to-be, including yours truly, will start off walking on stage, in our bikinis, answering some questions. Then, we'll all have to show a talent of some sort, and then the most exciting portion: a dance competition. If you've never seen pregnant women twerk or pole dance, you'll want to stop by tomorrow night."
"And what kind of dance will you be doing, Lisa?" Sandwich said with a grin.
"You'll have to wait and see tomorrow," Lisa said with a wink. "Thanks to the large outpouring of attention this year's Pregnant Bikini Contest has gotten and the many generous sponsors, the top prize is now $20,000, plus some assorted gifts."

"$20,000?" Jessica said, turning to Jack. "That's...that's real money. If this...these babies really come, that's money we'd need."
"Well, good thing you're a shoe-in to win," Jack said, reaching over and giving Jessica a kiss on the cheek as they pulled into the parking lot as Jessica's GPS told them they were at the right place. "Wait a minute...this place looks familiar."
"Does it have anything to do with that time you were kidnapped?" Jessica said, raising an eyebrow. "Mariah said she's been plotting with some weirdos."
"Yep," Jack gulped, the doors of the building opening up, with Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart walking toward the car. "Great memories at this place."

Inside, Jack and Jessica were sitting on a ratty sofa with Mariah as Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart brought out a whiteboard, covered in writings, newspaper clippings, and photographs. Behind them were the intimidating Mr. Ox and Mr. Quick.
"I've been over it a dozen times in my head," Mariah said. "The answer has to be getting the three coins together."
"Are we sure it's just three?" Jack said, looking between everyone gathered there.
"I plotted it out," Mariah said, pointing to the white board. "With the rate and density of pregnancies, it only makes sense if there's three coins. You have yours and those episodes are...accounted for. Then there's the woman who did this to me," she said, patting her own twin-filled belly, "and her location has been too static for these all to be here. That means one more coin."
"Which is the prize for winning the pregnant bikini contest tomorrow," Ms. Smart said, crossing her arms.
"Some sort of sick joke," Mr. Quick scoffed.
"So we still need to get the book and the other coin from Faye, my neighbor," Jack said. "But I get the feeling she knows we're after her. Or knows that someone's after her."
"I'll bet," Ms. Apple said, tossing her hair back as she looked at the board. Her cleavage was even more prominent than it was when Jack first saw her and her belly size was far larger than Jessica's. Jessica saw Jack looking Ms. Apple over and gave him a much sharper elbowing than she'd done in the car. "And we're not the only ones after her, I'm guessing."
"You mean...those weird government people who shut the city down?" Jack asked.
"We've had a few run-ins with PEAR before," Mr. Ox said. "But never like this before."
"And worst of all, their best agent is in town," Ms. Smart said, plastering Zavaleta's photo on the board.
Jack and Jessica looked at each other in shock. "Oh...oh no."

Zavaleta was already canvasing the city, huffing and puffing as she ran from street corner to street corner, eyes looking for the PEAR "Spyder" cameras. Running was much harder, thanks to her octuplets, but she was still moving at nearly Olympic-level speeds. "Those two...no doubt they left to some secret meeting place. But if I go there, Riker will know where they are too..."
As Zavalta tried to get a plan together, she spied two familiar passengers in a car that passed by her. Amanda and Amber.
"Next best thing," Zavaleta said, running until Amber's car was out of sight. She turned and saw a taxi about to pull out of its parking spot. Zavaleta put her hand on the front of the car, stopping its movement.
"Jesus lady, what the hell kind of strength do you..." the cab driver said, his question trailing off as he saw the size of Zavaleta.
"I need you to follow a car, but be stealthy about it," she said, handing him a wad of cash. "I will tell you exactly how fast to drive and where to go, understand?"
"Sure, but lady, I've followed people before," the driver said, letting Zavaleta in.
"I'm sure," Zavaleta scoffed. "Now move these seats forward and step on it."

Inside their car, Amanda and Amber continued their talk, getting more intimate since leaving the baby shower. The conversation had long shifted to who's babies were growing inside Amber's womb.
"It's hard, because Faye is my friend and she's been my friend for decades, but...I don't want her talking to you the way she has been," Amanda said.
"I feel like she's more upset with me than her ass of a husband," Amber said. "This is really his fault."
"I agree," Amanda said. "I think he's an incredible idiot for what he did." She let out a long sigh. "All this stress is making the babies kick. And not in a cute way."
"Need to pull over?" Amber said, taking a right turn. "My apartment is right in this neighborhood. You can use my bathroom."
Amanda laughed with a bit of a blush. "You can read a pregnant woman's expression pretty well."
Once at Amber's, she helped Amanda upstairs, the tiny staircase not helpful with Amanda's eight-month, quadruplet belly. "Down the hall on the left."

As Amanda relieved herself, Amber snuck into the next room, a remodeled closet for her electronics and other computer pieces, and looked over the master footage from the stolen Spyder camera she was using. "Now where to have you go next?" Amber thought to herself. The Spyder was currently in stasis on a city intersection, camera still on. As it captured footage, Amber saw the local news van park near it, with Mia Vasquez walking out, stretching her own heavily pregnant body. "Well, if I'm going to win $20,000 for my babies...I better get a leg up on the competition," Amber grinned, re-activating her Spyder and sending it into Mia's van.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Follow Jack and Jessica as they plan

choices: Amber, Mia, Zavaleta, and anyone else unfortunate enough to get in the way
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"The solution's simple," Mr. Quick said, walking around the couch to look passively at the whiteboard. "Jack just has to go to this woman's house and get the coin and book back. You know her, don't you?"
"Yeah, we know each other," Jack said nervously. "A little...too well."
"Perfect, then everything's settled," Mr. Quick said. Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart were shaking their heads and rolling their eyes.
"You'd think getting pregnant would make you understand women more," Ms. Smart said. "Clearly your relationship with this Jones woman is messy, but we can still use that."
"A bait-and-switch?" Mariah said, taking a few quick notes on the board.
"Exactly. She's already on the defensive, so you just need to build up her confidence and trust in you. But while she's focused on you and trying to figure out if you'll take the coin back, Jessica and Mariah, you'll both break into her house and take the coin and book yourselves."
"H-how do you propose I 'build up her confidence?'" Jack asked, mind flashing back to his previous intimate encounter with Faye. Her open robe, her eager kisses, her enormous belly. A belly that would be even bigger today than it was then.
"You're a romantic guy," Ms. Smart chuckled. "Take her out, show her a good time, hold her hand."
"Stroke her earlobes," Mr. Ox said. The rest of the team turned around slowly to stare at the towering man. "It works for my wife," he shrugged.

"You want me to seduce Faye?" Jack said to Ms. Quick timidly. "I don't know if I can do that. I love Jessica and when Faye and I were along together before..."
As Jack's voice trailed off, a furious groan came from Ms. Apple. "I cannot believe our whole plan lies in this kid's hands," she barked, waddling over to Jack and Jessica. "This isn't some senior prank. This is about getting all of our lives back. I'm not going to have triplets because you were too nervous to pretend to hit on another woman for a few hours."
"He's worried he'll do more than just pretend," Jessica said, crossing her arms and glaring at Jack. "I've seen her. She's good looking and he has a real weakness for big bellies."
"You're not helping," Ms. Apple said. Rolling her eyes, she grabbed Jack's hand and held it against her chest, letting him squeeze her huge breasts. "Do you still love him?"
Jessica couldn't respond at first, her jaw dropped. "I...well, yes."
"And you, nervous guy: still love Jessica?"
"Y-yes," Jack sputtered.
"See? You weathered another incident with a pregnant woman," Ms. Apple said, leaning back up and throwing her red hair behind her shoulders. "Now grow up and start fixing this mess."
"And while Jack's...dating Faye, we'll be sneaking into her house?" Jessica said. She was holding onto her belly closely, a nervous tick she picked up since she had a belly to hold on to.
"No, we'll let Jack stretch the day out to increase our chances of getting her distracted and getting the coin and book back. She'll probably have it with her while you both spend time together," Ms. Smart said. "We'll use the rest of the time practicing for the bikini contest tonight."
"Seriously?" Jack and Jessica said in unison.
"The last coin is the prize in the contest. We need to put some real effort into one of us winning this thing so we can get that last coin before it's too late," Mariah said. "Based on what they've told me, tomorrow's the last day we have to turn this all around. After that..."
"After that, the chaotic energy from the coin will have too much momentum," Ms. Smart said. "Even if we have all three coins, it might not be possible to undo the rest of our coin-induced pregnancies."

Jack felt his heart pounding in his chest as he got closer to Faye's house. He went alone to minimize the suspicion he brought out of Faye while the rest of the "coin recovery team" helped Jessica and Mariah get what they needed to practice for the contest. Dancing, talent, and showing off their bikini bodies. Jack wished things were less crazy so he could look forward to the pregnant bikini contest without fear or guilt, but no such luck. Besides, if there wasn't a coin involved, he would definitely be having twins with Jessica and that idea alone scared him. Although, not as much as it used to. He was scared but also, he was looking forward to raising a family with Jessica. Still, there would be plenty of time for that. For now, he had a mission to complete.

A few hard knocks on the door and Jack stood at attention in front of Faye's door. Now the fear began to grow. The fear that he would enjoy this "date" far too much. The door opened slowly and Faye poked her head out. "Jack? You're...you're here alone."
"That's right," Jack said, trying to sound natural. "I wanted to apologize about how things got out of hand a few days ago. There was a misunderstanding."
"There was; I'm sorry, Jack," Faye said softly, sighing as she looked her best friend's son over. "I shouldn't have pushed you to-"
"No, I mean, I misunderstood," Jack said, feeling himself blush as Faye looked at him surprised. "You were just trying to be friendly and I overreacted. I'm sorry."
Faye didn't know quite what to make of this. In response, she opened the door more, smiling to herself when she saw Jack's eyes bug out. Her belly had indeed gotten much larger than the last time Jack saw her. The last months of pregnancy see the belly grow at an increased pace and, although she'd only been pregnant for eight days, Faye was eight months pregnant with quadruplets and looked enormous. Her belly was a long, round torpedo, much of which refused to be covered by her loose blue top with a low-cut neck. Faye hadn't forgone pants entirely yet and was wearing a pair of jeans with an elastic waistband.
"Well, I accept your apology," Faye cooed. "I thought, since you're a man now, we can be friends. I enjoy your company, after all."
"A-and so do I," Jack said, switching between crossing his arms and putting them in his pocket a few times, trying to remember to keep his eyes off of Faye's belly. "That's why I thought I'd take you out of your house and let us, you know, spend some time together."

Caution the coin hissed in Faye's mind. Jack felt a shiver go down his own spine, his hands grasping around the coin in his pocket. Faye narrowed her eyes, pursing her lips into an inquisitive smile.
"Does your mother know about this?" Faye asked, raising an eyebrow.
"No idea," Jack chuckled nervously. "Worried she's trying to get me to trip you up before the contest tomorrow?"
"I don't think that's what she's worried about," Faye purred, reaching for her purse and waddling out the door. Now outside the house, her belly looked even larger out in the open. Jack was enamored by it size, its smoothness, its shape. As Faye bend slightly to lock the door, the underside of her belly was clearly visible between her legs. And in addition to the most obvious sign of her pregnancy, Faye's butt was larger, firmer, rounder - all accentuated by her jeans. Her breasts went up another cup size and there was no sign of her wearing a bra that Jack could tell. Her skin was smoother and softer and even had a slight tanned glow to it. Faye's hair was silkier, lighter, and may have even been longer.

"So, where should we go?" Jack asked, walking slowly to match Faye's waddling speed. If the pregnant bikini contest had a race portion that wasn't advertised, Faye would be in trouble.
"Good question," Faye sighed, putting her hand on Jack's shoulder for support and...other reasons. "I feel like I've been to the mall too much lately. Let's see what else this city has in store for us."
"Got it," Jack gulped, helping Faye into the passenger's seat. She slid in backwards, facing out the door as Jack held onto her legs to keep her balanced. The whole process made her belly smack Jack in the face a few times, but he certainly wasn't complaining. "You should probably move the seat back a few more notches."
"Can you reach it for me?" Faye asked cutely. Jack reached down the side of the chair, his face directly above Faye's cleavage as he struggled. To avoid looking deep down into the bottomless canyon, he looked up, getting a knowing grin from Faye and noticing how much fuller her lips had gotten over the last eight days. Once adjusted, Jack hurried into the driver's seat and started the car.
"Off we go, then," Jack smiled.
"Yes, off we go," Faye smiled back, ignoring the cursing coming from her coin.

-------

"Mariah, you can't...that's not really the right kind of talent for this sort of contest," Jessica said.
"Well, it's the only one I can think of," Mariah said. "Believe me, I don't like the idea of doing one of Shakespeare's soliloquies in a bikini, but my line delivery is perfect. I've studied the story and the craft and I think I'm really giving the audience the intended emotions. See, after the ceremony, Hamlet is distraught and we learn for the first time-"
"If you have to do lines from a Shakespeare play, why can't you do Romeo and Juliet? Then it'll be kind of lovey-dovey and sweet instead of...all about how the world is rotting away in sin," Jessica said, trying to sound encouraging.
"Fine, fine," Mariah sighed, looking down at her bare belly and heaving breasts. "But I don't see why we have to wear the bikinis now."
"To practice! We'll be wearing them tomorrow, after all," Jessica said, hands on her widened hips. Both women were dressed scarcely, Mariah in a brown bikini, Jessica in yellow.
"Then let's see your talent," Mariah said, getting her water bottle.
As the two friends argued, Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart watched from the doors. "Should we leave them alone like this? They need some focus."
"They're fine," Ms. Apple said. "Besides, it doesn't matter how much practice they do. I'm winning this thing."
"You're pretty confident," Ms. Smart said, impressed. "You've got a secret ace?"
"Two of them," Ms. Apple winked. "I know my audience."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack and Co. try to plot this all out

choices: Next time on HoT: Carnival of Chaos!
Or maybe our (others) heroes react to Maria's shocking news!
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
A pregnant pause fell upon the Jack and Faye as they drove around looking for a place to continue their "not date" date. As far as "not date" date's went, of which Jack has had three so far, this was by far the worst. He didn't need a date, he had Jessica for that. No, he needed an oppurtunity to grab the coin and get the hell out there.. But he tried to think, he needed someplace public to get away from her in, but also a place that could give the opportunity to get her alone. Quite the quandary.

But alas, his conundrum was solved when a big sign that read COUNTY FAIR - RIDES! ANIMALS! GAMES! FUN!
Below that was another sign - STILL IN TOWN DUE TO QUARANTINE. ALL PREGNANT WOMEN - The word "Women" was crossed out with another sign hanging under that sign that read "PEOPLE" finishing the rest of the added on sentence - GET IN FOR FREE!

It was perfect. He use to love the county fair as a kid, and most of all he loved was the "The Ghost Mansion", a dark ride through a spooky haunted house with pop-up cardboard ghosts, strobe lights, and cheap animatronics - - - The perfect distraction for him to grab the coin away from her and make a bee-line for it.

"Come to the fair!" He thought to himself out loud. "The fair?" Faye asked, raising an eyebrow, her seat somewhat layer back to give her enormous pregnant belly some more room to "breathe".

"Why not? It's still in town, and since you got pregnant a few days - - -" Jack caught himself immediately "I mean months ago, I know you haven't been. So why not? It could be fun. Win you some stuff animals for all them kiddies" In another life Jack would have made one helluva use-car salesmen.

Caution. The Master piece of me is dangerously close.. I can fells 32341#%12 The coin was trying to warn Faye about Jack's true intentions but the overlapping of it's own magic was dangerous. Before the night was over Jack would find out just how dangerous it was.

Faye, in a moment of freedom from the madness of the coin, became her old self again. "Oh Jack, you're so sweet. Such a good kid. Let's go" It was honest and sincere, without a hint of anything more than just being a good neighbor

- - - - Elsewhere - - - -

Maria finished practicing her routine for the bikini competition, out of breath, sweating and somewhat aroused after catching sight of herself in a few of the mirrors. She looked fantastic, even if she felt like hell was rapidly approaching in her life if they didn't reverse this.

PING! "You've got translation" Her computer informed her with a vocal alert. The early chapters of the book were easier to translate then the later chapters, which became a mixture of different languages, syntax and slang. Some pages would have pictures in Russian, with footnotes in German, and pages in Slavic, while an other page would have Cantonese text, Spanish footnotes and Latin headers. It was mess, and Maria thought it would be easier to have help from the internet and modern technology.

Hey, she was under a very strict deadline.

Wiping herself down, and sitting in a chair (Which groaned under a bit of protest) she fired up the translation program which was running in the background and poured over a couple of new pages translated from the book.

It was nothing major… Just more accountants of pregnancies, more theories on the coin, birthing techniques, more pregnancy notes, a dire warning about having the coins close together, an older man's account of his pregnancy, a particularly odd sounding recipe for "Picks and Ice Cream Sundae Pizza Surprise" and - - -

Oh shit.

Maria suddenly clicked hard and furiously on the pages about the dire warning, hoping that perhaps "dire" meant as in the wolf, not "dire" as in "Oh shit things just got dire".

"Oh balls" Maria said, reading that insanely and hilariously rough translated text.

DANGEROUS WORDS! HEED THEM! MUCH BAD HAPPEN IF NOT LISTENED TO!
Coin make many more of itself to spread pregnant badness. Make coin weak and strong at same time. Make many coin for many people to use make many babies on people with. However, never use coin when another coin near by. Very bad happens of badness! Coin together make coin magic strong but coin's words weak. Tempt to use coin very stronger around another coin, but coin's words of poison no longer affect brain. Do not understand why is. Take long time for it to work. Been with other coin person for over few hours now, I feel like old self in head, no poison words in thoughts. But badness follows being free of poison words. If Coin when used around other coin makes magic effect other people instead of one. Many men and women have belly now that I used coin around another person with coin. Me and other coin person unaffected. Shield from bad magic? Coin also very not strong when around other coin for long times. Coin become brittle and bendy. Other coin person burnt hand in campfire when holding coin, coin looks much damage. Fire bad maybe when coin weak? Hear words and listen: Do not use coin around other coin.. Many people will have belly!

"I really should have translated this whole thing" Maria looked on, deer-in-the-headlights look in her eyes and she frantically dialed Jack's number on Jessica's cellphone. Jessica was taking a shower at the hideout, and although Maria swore she would never touch Jessica's cellphone after the famed "Please Respond" incident that went down in "Books Books Books" history, this seemed like a perfectly good emergency to justify the temporary lifting of the ban Jessica had on Maria from using Jessica's cellphone.

"But we got some good news with the bad" Maria finished her thoughts as it went straight to voicemail. "Oh no. Come on Jack, pick up the phone!" Maria tried to re-dial and got voicemail again. "Damn it!" Maria yelled, slamming down the cellphone.

"Oh well, I mean. Maybe he won't use the coin. It's not like he could do that much damage right?" Maria realized the futility of what she saying.

She looked over at the giant red button on the wall with the sign that read "ONLY PUSH IN CASE OF DIRE EMERGENCY". This was dire, the book said so.
She got up from the table and slammed her hand on the big red button, expecting to hear some kind of loud klaxon signaling the dire emergency.
Instead all she got was pre-recorded message that blasted out over the loud-speakers once: "HEY! EMERGENCY!"

And that was that.

"Well that was totally pointless" Maria said to herself. She hoped the rest of the group would find her soon.

- - - - The Dire Date Of Doom! - - - - -

Jack felt a slight tickle behind his ear; an itch almost. He didn't have it before, but being this close next to Faye it was driving him mad. He just couldn't scratch it. It was driving him nuts.

He shook it off as nerves as they pulled into the dirt parking lot of the fair grounds, Jack lucky enough to find parking closer to the front for once he needed to make his fast escape.

"Well, here we are." Jack said, trying to put on his sexy-voice. Faye looked sad looking out the window. She almost looked like she was crying.
"Hey.. What's the matter?" Jack asked, suddenly concerned with Faye's well being that this plan of faux-seduction.
"Oh Jack, I've made a horrible mistake" Faye didn't sound like the Faye of the past few days, she sounded like her old self. The sad next door neighbor who tried everything she could to have a family but couldn't.
"What do you mean?" Jack asked, trying not to claw at the back of his ear. Man, what a tick he was developing.
"Charles… I never should have been that mad at him. We've made mistakes, both of us. I know what happened with Amber should have me furious, but all I feel is sadness. The stress of me not being able to get pregnant drove us apart for a while you know? We were this close to getting a divorce. I… slept with someone else before he slept with Amber. I thought, maybe I could get pregnant by someone else and then say it was his. I just wanted a family with him so bad, and I thought that maybe it was him, not me. Clearly, it was me"

She was on the verge of all out tears. WHat had happened to the woman who tried to seduce him? Tried to drive a wedge between him and Jessica? Who was this sad pregnant thing sitting next to him.

"Shit. I don't know what to say" Jack just blurted out, his mind more on the damn itch behind his ears than anything else. Faye laughed.
"Never change Jack. You'll always be that adorable little nerd next door to me. Nothing more" She smiled and gave Jack a faux and loving tap on his forehead complete with a "book".
"Are you feeling okay. You seem different.." Jack was thoroughly confused. This was the same woman who tried her best to seduce him earlier.
"I feel like myself for the first time in a while actually. Like a weight has been lifted off of my mind. Maybe's it been because we've been in this car for over an hour or I don't know what, but it feels good." Faye said.

GOD, WHAT IS WITH THIS ITCH BEHIND MY EAR?! Jack thought, trying not to scratch at it. He wanted to use the coin to scratch it, he didn't know why. He felt an urge to use it, to use it more than ever before, maybe it would make the scratching stop. STOP THE ITCH BEHIND HIS EAR.

"You alright Jack? You look twitchy" Faye said.
"Yeah I'm fine. Let's go have some fun" Jack said, opening the door, and helping Faye out of the car.
"Let's go have some fun" He told himself again, fingering the coin in his pocket. It seemed softer than before.. And the itch behind his ear was intense as they walked into the fair grounds.

choices: Faye asks too many questions about the coin
Breaking news as we go live to Mia Vasquez
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Even in the pregnancy-friendly carnival, Faye stood out. Or rather, her belly did. Eight months pregnant with quadruplets in an ill-fitting shirt, eyes were on Faye's bouncing and bobbing belly, half of the smooth, tight skin open to all eyes. A few men and women sporting bellies of their own gawked, remarking to their comrades that "I guess things could be worse." Strangely enough, the only one not staring at Faye's belly was the one person there most attracted to it: Jack.

"It's really crowded here, huh?" Faye said, hand on her chin as she worried about bumping into other expectant carnival-goers. "Well, if you offer free entry to pregnant people, you'll be sure to get a lot of customers in our city."

"Y-yeah," Jack said, looking over at Faye shyly. He knew he had to be careful about how he proceeded, but he needed to get Faye to drop her guard so he could get her coin. "Maybe we should hold hands so we don't get separated?"

"I don't think you'd have a hard time finding me," Faye laughed, rubbing her belly in long strokes. A few kicks and tumbles inside her softened Faye's smile and her rubbing slowed down. "But sure, that's a good idea." Faye reached a hand out to Jack's, taking no time to intertwine her fingers in his, squeezing intimately.

Jack blushed as Faye looked over at him with a smile. She waddled a few steps over and every few steps, her gigantic belly brushed against Jack's side.

"Sorry," Faye said, putting her other hand on top of her belly, which acted like a shelf for her hand. "I know how you feel about...pregnant bellies."

"It's fine," Jack said, shaking a little as he prepared his next line. "Trust me. I don't mind it at all."

Faye's smile grew a little. "You don't mind if I take a quick pit stop to get some fatty carnival food, do you? Normally I'd never eat this stuff, but I'm sure you know how cravings can be."

Jack laughed a little and nodded. "I'm familiar, yes. Be my guest." Faye giggled as she turned to walk toward the food stands. Jack was a little confused. A few days ago, Faye was an absolute predator, wearing revealing clothes, crawling all over him, tantalizing him constantly. Now she was...well she was like she'd always been. A fun, slightly teasing woman in her 40s. This wasn't expected. Jack knew he'd need to change his plan some to get her attention so he could take her coin back. He'd need to...woo her.

Faye got a basket of fries and corn dogs and walked back over to Jack as they stood in the small area for eating. "One of the downsides to having so many pregnant people in the city is you can't expect people to give up their seats anymore," Faye sighed, bending her knees a few times to stretch her back, bouncing her belly and breasts in the process. "Everyone sitting down is already pregnant."

"Are you uncomfortable?" Jack said, getting a little closer to Faye.

"Oh, I'm fine," Faye said, rolling her eyes, until she looked Jack in the eye. "A little."

"W-well...one thing that makes my Mom more comfortable when she's eating is if someone rubs her belly," Jack lied. "My Dad does it all the time...may I?"

Faye blushed, putting another french fry in her mouth. "S-sure."

Jack smiled and placed his palm on the front of her belly, rubbing in wide, slow circles. "Better?"

"Mmm, much," Faye cooed as she resumed eating. Jack let out a long sigh as his neck tingled. Was it guilt? After all, he'd already screwed up with Jessica once before thanks to Faye and as much as he hated to admit it, he wanted to rub Faye's belly. He wanted to run his hands all over her full, pregnant body, kiss her nipples and full lips, and then slide his throbbing erection inside her. And Faye would welcome it, most likely.

The tingling was still there, growing into the same itch Jack had since he met with Faye today. It was unbearable. He scratched his neck and ears repeatedly, the twinge not going away.

"Everything alright?" Faye said, turning to Jack.

"No, yes, I dunno," Jack groaned. "There's just a weird feeling on the back of my head." Faye reached a hand to the back of Jack's head, running her fingers through his hair, making him shudder. As she looked closer, her lips traced across his cheek.

"I don't see anything," Faye said, ripping everything off of her last corndog in one big bite, throwing the basket of crumbs and sticks into the trash. "Ah, much better. So, what ride would you like to go on next?" As Faye asked, she placed her hand on top of Jack's against her belly.

"Uh...uh..." Jack said, his brain starting to stumble.

"Are you both going on the Ghost Mansion?" a woman said, holding hands with a man, both smiling.

"We could," Faye said, looking at Jack then back at the couple. "Why do you ask?"

"It's a great ride for couples. And you both look super cute," the man chuckled, looking at his partner with a big smile. "Alone together in a car in the dark. Big jump scares that make your heart race and let you jump into one another's arms. It's perfect."

"Sounds great," Jack said, forcing a smile as he turned to Faye. "I loved the Ghost Mansion as a kid. Want to?"

"Of course," Faye smiled, waddling off with Jack. "But you...didn't correct them when they called us a couple."

Jack knew what he had to say. "Maybe I didn't need to." Faye blushed and stood a little closer to him again, her belly permanently against his waist.

"You're the only one who's helped me out during all this chaos with my husband," Faye purred. "I remember it, trust me."

"T-thanks," Jack said, standing in line for the Ghost Mansion. There were lots of other couples in front of them, touching and pecking each other. Very few of them were pregnant, in stark contrast to the rest of the carnival. The itching behind Jack's ear grew more and more powerful. When they made it to the end of the line, Faye heaved herself into the tiny car, struggling to fit, then trying to get the safety bar down. Her belly was making it impossible.

"Alright, uh..." the pregnant carny said, her ponytailed hair a clearly fake mix of blond and black, her nails bright black as she scratched her head. "The ride's not that fast so if you both hold each other tight, you'll be fine. That should cover our insurance."

"Well that's encouraging," Faye laughed quietly, wrapping her arm around Jack's back.

"C'mon; you too," the pregnant girl said. "Bellies don't bite." Jack gulped and put his hand around Faye's back, his hand resting between her belly and breasts. "Good. Alright, keep your hands, legs, and bellies inside at all times. No flash photography, as it scares the ghosts that reside in this haunted house," she said, all in a monotone.

"Mansion," her supervisor yelled from a few feet away.

"Whatever," she said, hitting a button and sending Jack and Faye's car down the track where the rest of the couples were traveling. A few cardboard ghosts and vampires lazily popped up as plastic spiders dangled from the ceiling. It was nowhere near as scary as Jack remembered. Then again, maybe he was more scared of who was sitting next to him.

"So Jack...about last time we were together," Faye said, turning to her neighbor's son. "If we hadn't been interrupted, how would you have felt?"

"I'd have wanted a lot more than one kiss," Jack said, leaning toward Faye, pressing against her belly so his other arm could get closer to her pocket. "But it was a good start."

Faye smiled and leaned in for a kiss. Jack clenched his eyes and went in for it, kissing someone other than his girlfriend once again, hating how good it felt. He loved Jessica, but he lusted after Faye. He moved his hand to try and get into her pocket, squeezing her butt instead. Faye squealed and placed a hand against Jack's chest, lapping at him with her tongue.

"Jack! I had no idea you could be so forceful~" Faye cooed. Jack's face was bright red as the itching in his head grew and grew.

"I-I guess I'm just...just..." Jack said, the itching starting to turn into words.

Flip me!

"Sorry," Jack said, taking out his coin and giving it a flip. Tails. Faye's eyes were on Jack's after he caught the coin, her smile gone.

"Where did you...get that coin?" Faye said slowly as they began to exit the ride.

"Nowhere. It's just a regular quarter," Jack said, stuffing it back into his pocket.

"No, it isn't," Faye said.

Jack's face flushed as their cart came out the other side as all of the passengers ahead of them struggled to get off, their bellies now unbelievably swollen with twins and triplets.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: And now, our feature: Carnival of Chaos!
