1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"And while the city's plan will see fire hydrants change colors all over the city, the only color local artists are seeing is green," local anchor Rick Sanner said, a tiny smile on his lips as he felt pride in his pun.

"Thank you for that...interesting story, Rick," Brooke Roberts, the station's other anchor, said, putting a finger to her earpiece. "We're going to go live to our own ace reporter Mia Vasquez for an update on this continuing story of the city's mysterious 'pregnancy disease.' Mia?"

"Hello Brooke, I'm here in the heart of downtown, where life is going back to normal after a series of invasive procedures by the NIH and another government organization calling itself P.E.A.R.," Mia said, standing on a promenade facing one of the city's intersections, her triplet belly clearly visible underneath her thin, maroon dress. "These government agencies have taken control over our city under the assertion that the 'mystery pregnancies' are contagious or otherwise harmful. The report I am about to make will directly refute this."

"Doug!" Rick hissed to the station manager, hand covering his microphone so he wouldn't go on air. "We have to stop this broadcast now. We can't have a report about the government agents in top authority in the city now!"

"Good journalism should challenge authority," Douglass Taylor said, crossing his arms. "I'm nervous about it too, but I trust Mia and-"

"M-Mr. Taylor!" an intern in the back of the room yelled, running from his laptop to the manager. "Ratings are off the charts. People have been tweeting like crazy. Nearly every TV in the city is tuned in to this."

"Stay on Mia!" Douglass boomed, pointing to everyone in the room. "Keep us connected, no matter what!"

"I'm here with Dr. Kristen Harper, OB/GYN at the hospital that the NIH has made its headquarters during this outbreak. Dr. Harper is the main local liaison with their medical efforts, but says she can no longer stay quiet about what is going on."

"Thank you, Mia," Dr. Harper nodded, a hand resting against her own belly. "At first, I was supportive of the NIH's involvement. Whenever there is a breakout of a contagion, especially on a scale like the size of our city, I believe state and even federal bureaus should be involved to lend their considerable resources. However, what the NIH has done has not been beneficial to the people of this city."

"Let's start there," Mia said, one hand holding her microphone while the other rubbed the underside of her enormous belly. The thrill of the story was making her heart race, which in turn made her triplets kick with more ferocity. "What has been your issue with the NIH's response to what, for now, we will refer to as the 'Pregnancy Outbreak.'"

"For one, it has had no medical benefit to the people of this city," Dr. Harper said. "I had a...sudden pregnancy, but I am not sick. None of these people are medically suffering. In fact, everyone is astonishingly healthy and have none of the negative side effects pregnancy can sometimes have. I know you were pregnant before this all happened, but other women have found themselves pregnant with multiples for much longer than we typically see. The NIH's actions — quarantining the city, imposing curfews, stops, and mandatory hospital visits — only adds stress and anxiety to the situation. On top of that, the agents have done nothing to provide the city's newly pregnant population with health care."

"You criticized the quarantine, but if this is a contagious phenomenon, shouldn't it be contained as much as possible?" Mia said, playing devil's advocate.

"That's just it: this is not a contagious phenomenon," Dr. Harper said. "While we do not know the cause of these sudden pregnancies, especially in men, none of the data gathered shows evidence of person-to-person pregnancy spreading. There are spontaneous hubs of 'pregnancy outbreak' but they have nothing to do with people who are already pregnant. This quarantine is about control, not health."

"And the ones pushing for this control are not just the NIH," Mia said. "My reporting has showed the depth of the reliance by the NIH on a organization called P.E.A.R."

"And P.E.A.R. is not part of the United States government. Or the government of any individual country," Dr. Harper said. "It's completely shrouded in mystery, but its members appear to be from all over the world."

"They've managed to stay mysterious," Mia said, turning to the camera, hand not leaving her belly. "But I've uncovered several instances of P.E.A.R. shutting down cities and towns in various parts of the world, though nothing on this scale. It would seem that P.E.A.R.'s actions here are about practicing their containment efficiency."

"That is the sense I have gotten from working alongside other P.E.A.R. members," Dr. Harper nodded. As the two talked, the Amber-controlled Spyder camera crept closer, trying to pick up on their conversation.

"You might not be practicing your dancing, but exposure on TV will always help you with the judges," Amber said, magnifying in on Mia's face, panning down across her chest and belly. "But damn, she is a good looking woman. I'll bet Jack's been watching the local news a lot in the past few months."

The Spyder scurried up a street light, getting an eagle-eye view of the two women as its microphone began to pick up their conversation. As Amber adjusted the frequency to get a better listen, she picked up the same signal as the television broadcast. A loud, static shriek went through Amber's controls and into her headphones.

"Fuck!" Amber yelled, her body flailing and hitting her controls. The legs of the Spyder kicked out and the camera plummeted to the ground, crashing feet away from Mia and Dr. Harper.

"Que coño!" Mia yelled, jumping a little (not much, thanks to her belly's weight) at the sudden falling projectile. When she calmed down, rubbing her belly with both hands to quiet her triplets, Mia waddled over and picked up the camera. It was still moving around, but in Mia's hands, it wasn't getting away anytime soon.

"Hello there," Amber said to herself, the camera getting a close-up look at Mia's face. "I guess I won't be using this thing anymore."

Mia turned the Spyder over and read the label on the underside. "Spyder 009 - P.E.A.R. Model V3. I...I don't know what to say, Brooke."

"Mia, what's happening out there?" Brooke said, leaning in. The entire newsroom was on the edge of their seats, with the exception of Rick who was preoccupied prodding his growing belly with curiosity.

"Brooke, this is a P.E.A.R. model...some sort of mobile camera. And it looks like it was spying on my broadcast," Mia said. "This is number 9, so there are likely at least eight other cameras like this in the city, spying on the citizens. This further shows the invasion of our constitutional rights the P.E.A.R. quarantine represents. This is Mia Vasquez, making my report."

"Fuck," Lieutenant Riker said in the P.E.A.R. office at the hospital, watching the broadcast live. "Fuck fuck fuck fuck fuck."

A phone rang in the back of the room. Riker cringed as one of the other agents picked up it, their face immediately turning pale. "L-lieutenant?"

"Yes?" Riker said.

"It's General DeSoto."

"Of course it is," Riker said, a shaky hand taking the phone. "General! Yes, I'm...I know the cameras are supposed to be a secret tool for future operations...I-I know they're not supposed to be used in the field yet...I...I understand." Riker handed the phone back to the other P.E.A.R. agent. "Pack it all up."

"We're leaving?" Lieutenant Han said in shock.

"I just got the order," Riker said through clenched teeth. "Everyone out. Quarantine is over. And I'm...going to be court marshaled."

"What about Commander Zavaleta?" Han asked.

"Let her take care of herself," Riker said, marching out of the room. "She's the one who abandoned HQ. She gets what she gets."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Breaking news as we go live to Mia Vasquez

choices: Check in on whoever you want. Enjoy the freedom.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jessica started striding down the room again, recreating her initial catwalk. One hand was on her hip, cupping her shapely rear as it wiggled back and forth with each step. The other hand was rested against her round, smooth belly, rubbing it slightly. Jessica positioned her hand to not cover up her dimpled belly button, sticking out of her fleshy, tight orb. Jessica's eyes were locked on her reflection on the other end of the room like she was in a trance. She had a small, sexy smile on, eating up how she looked.

She loved being pregnant. The belly. The breasts. The butt. The glow. The kicking. Everything. Even now, as Jessica watched herself in the mirror, it was an out-of-body experience. Jessica still couldn't believe the awkward, goofy girl she'd been before had turned into this pregnant, sexy woman, wearing a bikini and practicing her strut for an adoring crowd. Jessica felt envious of Jack sometimes. She wished they could trade places and Jessica could be the one feeling and embracing the pregnant woman she saw in the mirror. Maybe she felt so disconnected from what she looked like and how she felt because she'd only been pregnant for a week. Or maybe it was because pregnancy was so built up in her mind; it was too much of a dream-come-true.

One misstep and Jessica stumbled, flailing her arms around as she managed to stay upright, putting both hands on her belly when she settled. "Damn it!" Jessica yelled for the sixth time this hour. "How am I supposed to have a sexy gait when I walk out if I can't even see my feet with this thing?" A few kicks against Jessica's palm made her face soften a bit and she started rubbing where she felt the commotion. "It's okay, I'm not mad at you. Momma's just got a lot on her mind and it would be nice if your...your Dad was here to help out."

It wasn't just Jessica's seven-month, twin-filled belly that was getting in the way of her composure. She was nervous about Jack's plan to "seduce" Faye, even if it meant getting all this craziness in the city fixed. The first big rough spot in their relationship was thanks to Jack and Faye kissing and now they were off on a date. And Jessica knew Faye would be hard to resist. Her eight month belly easily outsized Jessica's, and on top of that, she had two more babies in her for good measure. Plus, Faye was a full-fledged cougar. She had bigger breasts, poutier lips, and more sexual experience than Jessica.

"Doing okay in here?" Mariah asked, popping her head in the room. Jessica jumped a bit, her blush turning one shade darker. "I counted six outbursts."

"Six, huh?" Jessica sighed, turning around and waddling toward her friend, rubbing her belly all over as she stood a few inches away from Mariah's belly. "Guess I'm just distracted with...well, everything."

"Everything is right," Mariah said, rubbing her own belly. Thanks to the coin's uneven effects on people, Mariah's belly grew to full-term size with twins and she outsized her friend. "I never thought I'd even have kids."

"You never wanted to be pregnant?" Jessica asked. She knew her own fascination with pregnancy was more than other people, but she didn't think she was that different from other women.

"I never even thought about pregnancy. I just figured it would never happen," Mariah shrugged. "I know what I am. I'm a quiet, weird girl who stays in the back of the room and reads. Never dated, never been kissed, and definitely never getting pregnant. Well...the first two are still right, I guess."

Jessica frowned and wrapped her arm around her friend's shoulder. "Mariah, let me show you something." Jessica walked the two of them to the middle of the room, letting Mariah face the mirror. "Do you know what I see when I look at you? I see a woman who's brilliant, funny, and a stone-cold fox. People are checking you out at the bookstore all the time. And anyone who really got to talk to you would fall in love with you immediately."

"Jessica, you don't need to-"

"I'm being honest," Jessica said, turning to face Mariah. "You're amazing. And anyone who could be with you would be incredibly lucky."

"Do you really mean that?" Mariah said after a pause, looking at Jessica sheepishly.

"I do."

Without any hesitation, Mariah kissed Jessica passionately, cupping her hands on Jessica's cheeks before sliding them down her shoulders and chest. She pressed against Jessica's soft lips, pecking and moaning. Jessica stood stunned as Mariah started to lap her tongue around her friend's mouth.

When Mariah broke the kiss, her face was as red as a sunburn. "W-was that...s-should I have..."

Jessica wiped her fingertips across her lips, looking at the long strands of saliva that came off. "Mariah, I'm flattered but I don't...I'm straight. And besides, I've got Jack."

"B-but he cheated on you! And he could be cheating on you now!" Mariah said, hanging her head. "T-the romance books at the store said this would be the best way..."

"Books aren't always a good representation of real life," Jessica said, smiling a little to pick Mariah's spirits up. "You're incredible and you'll definitely find someone who loves you." She bent in and wrapped her friend up in a hug. "Or rather, you'll find someone who'll be in love with you. I'll always love you."

"Same here," Mariah said, hugging Jessica back. When they broke, Mariah took a few steps back, wiping a stray tear from one eye. "Well, I'd better go practice some more, then. Tomorrow night will be the debut of me entering the dating pool and if I win, I'll rope in even more hotties."

"That sounds like a challenge," Jessica grinned, narrowing her eyes.

"You bet it is," Mariah grinned, waddling back to the door before slapping her forehead. "I totally forgot why I came in here! We need to contact Jack as soon as we can."

"Jack? Why?" Jessica asked, now a little skeptical of Mariah.

"I figured out more of the book. If that Faye woman really has a coin, then when the two are in close proximity, one gets stronger while the other gets weaker. If Jack flips his coin, it could be another major outbreak of the 'Pregnancy Disease.' If we want to get her coin, now's our chance."

"What should we do?" Jessica said.

"I tried calling him, but it's no good," Mariah said, shaking her head. "I think...our best bet is to stick to the plan we already have."

"Let's at least turn on the news to see if he's used the coin," Jessica said, waddling into the main room with her best friend and flipping on the TV, with an aerial view of the city on the screen.

"As you can see, the NIH vans are piling out of the city right now," Brooke said. "Mia, do you have any information on why this might be happening?"

"Not quite, Brooke. The most information I've gotten out of government spokespeople is that they say the 'Pregnancy Disease' is not contagious and is no longer active. While part of that matches up with Dr. Harper's analysis, based on reports of more spontaneous pregnancies at the annual fair, this is far from inactive." Mia held up the Spyder camera next to her belly while turning back to the camera. "I do have one other theory, however."

"Sure, hold it next to your belly," Rick grumbled off-mic. "Score more points for yourself."

"Rick, shut up," Douglass said, eyes glued to the monitors.

"Almost immediately after I started talking about P.E.A.R. and this spy equipment they were using, they started moving out. Clearly, this is something P.E.A.R. did not want us to know about. I'll have updates as I investigate," Mia said.

"Thank you, Mia," Brooke said. "Any information on what's happening at the fair?"

"Not yet. I am heading over now," Mia nodded.

"Alright, that's out star reporter, Mia Vasquez," Brooke nodded with a smile. "Be careful at the fair, Mia. We'd hate to see you at tomorrow's bikini contest with three more babies in your belly."

Mia giggled. "I think some people wouldn't mind, Brooke. This is Mia Vasquez, signing out."

Jessica and Mariah looked at each other. "Guess he used the coin," Jessica said, her heart sinking.

"Let's keep the TV on in case we get more information on the fair," Mariah nodded, putting the remote back on the rickety table the organization kept the television on.

"What's going on?" Ms. Smart said, walking into the main room in her own black bikini. "Why aren't you both practicing?"

"The two coins together has created more widespread pregnancies and may give Jack an opportunity to get the other coin back," Mariah said. "And P.E.A.R. is pulling out."

"They're leaving?" Ms. Apple said, hurrying into the room. Everyone's eyes popped when they saw the buxom, pregnant redhead in nothing but a peach thong and nipple tassels. "What?" Ms. Apple said, looking down at herself. "I'm in it to win it."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Look in on Jessica's day

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Sure you're okay?" Ryan asked, hands on the small of his back. Amanda smiled and nodded as she heaved herself up from her desk with one arm, cradling her massive maternal weight with the other. "I'm taking my maternity...or paternity leave, I suppose, pretty soon and compared to me, you look like you're ready to give birth any second."

"Believe me, I've had that concern whenever I look in the mirror," Amanda sighed. "But they still feel a few months too small. Although I guess this is all pretty different from what I'm used to with Jack." She let out a little groan and clutched her belly.

"Amanda?" Tara said, waddling over.

"I'm fine, it's just when they all kick at the same time, it's a bit much," Amanda laughed through her wince. "I'm fine, Ryan. Really. It wouldn't be fair for me to take maternity leave when I've only been pregnant for about a week, would it?"

Ryan sighed and shrugged. "This pregnancy disease or whatever it is has complicated some things." He rested his hand on his own belly. "Well, it's had some good and some bad."

"That's what pregnancy is," Amanda smiled, wrapping her hands around her swollen womb. "But I'd say the good outweighs the bad."

Ian walked into the midst of the conversation, papers in hand, and looked around. Oh...it's a pregnancy discussion, he grumbled internally. "Uh...boss?"

"Yes, Ian," Ryan sighed. "What is it? I thought you weren't coming in today."

"I know, but I'm still working on this partnership with the radio station's bikini contest tomorrow night," Ian said, looking over his forms again. "But the last emails I got about this say I'm supposed to be, like, helping in person."

"We've been sending those emails for days," Amanda sighed, rubbing her belly in slow circles to quiet her quadruplets.

"I forgot my password," Ian said. Ryan rolled his eyes, eternally regretting hiring this special kind of idiot. "Anyway, what exactly does that mean?"

"You'd have to check with the people at the station," Ryan shrugged. "Particularly Lisa."

Lisa. The name of 101.9's sexy mascot perked Ian's spirits up. "I'll get right on it, boss!" Ian boasted, hurrying out of the office as quickly as he could.

"Ryan, speaking of days off," Tara said, standing beside Amanda, rubbing her belly in synch with Amanda. "Would it be okay if Amanda and I left a little early today? Work's been slow and the bikini contest is tomorrow."

"Go home and practice your dancing," Ryan smiled, putting his hands on both of their shoulders. "I'll be there tomorrow night, ready to see you two duke it out. As far as I can tell, you're shoe-ins."

"Thanks, Ryan," Amanda smiled. "This was a great baby shower. Congratulations."

They nodded and smiled and acted overly polite a little more before leaving the office and waddling down the stairs. "So, worried about tomorrow?" Tara asked.

"About winning or about having everyone see a pregnant woman in her 50s carrying quadruplets in a bikini?" Amanda laughed.

"Either, I guess," Tara chuckled back.

"I thought being in front of a crowd would make me nervous but the more I've been practicing the mirror, the more I've realized...I look good," Amanda smiled. "I'm proud of my pregnant body and it'll be fun. This whole competition is just for fun for me," she said, her voice trailing off.

"But?" Tara smiled, raising her eyebrows.

"But...I may have sneaked a peek at the list of other contestants," Amanda said, getting some sheets of paper out of her purse.

"You hacked the organizers?" Tara said, her lips wide with shock.

"No, no, I just got it off of Ian's email. His password is 'Ian.' It wasn't hard," Amanda laughed. At the bottom of the stairs, the two women turned to face one another, belly pressing against belly. "And the competition might be a little steep."

"Who do we have to look out for?" Tara said. "I know this is fun for you, but frankly, Amanda...I'm single and I'm pregnant with two more babies than I prepared for. This contest would be a big deal for me if I win."

Amanda nodded. Tara, Amber, maybe even Jessica. There were a lot of pregnant women in Amanda's life that she knew needed to win. "Well, the two obvious ones are Mia Vasquez and Lisa herself."

"Lisa's entered?" Tara gasped. "Isn't that...against the rules, if she works for the station?"

"Not sure, but she's in it and she's popular," Amanda sighed. "So is Mia."

"And they're both just as pregnant as me," Tara sighed. "Do you think the crowd will consider belly size a positive or negative?"

"Hard to say, but I know I've come to like my big belly," Amanda blushed.

"Well, if that's the case, at least you're the biggest woman in town, besides Zava...besides my mom," Tara said.

"N-not quite," Amanda said. "My neighbor is also carrying quads and lately she's become very good and flirting and being sexy in general. She's someone to watch out for too."

"I've got a few tricks up my sleeves," Tara smiled. "They won't win this so easily."

"I'm sure," Amanda smiled. "You've gorgeous, Tara."

"Thank you," Tara said, leaving the office with Amanda. "B-by the way, who was that pregnant woman with Jack earlier?"

"His girlfriend, Jessica," Amanda said. "Why?"

"No reason," Tara sighed, patting her belly. "No reason at all."

----

"You forgot your password?"

"It's on the tip of my tongue," Ian said, sitting across from Lisa at the radio station. She had a huge, baggy white t-shirt covering herself up but Ian could still get the impression of her chest through the thin fabric. He'd knew she was pregnant and, with everything that had been going on in the city lately, that still filled him with some fear, but he could still zone out and ogle her breasts.

"I don't have a ton of time to get into details, but yes, you'll be backstage at the event, taking care of the contest's participants," Lisa sighed.

"Backstage?" Ian said, lifting his head up to meet Lisa's eyes.

She gave a sarcastic grin, seeing how obviously he was gawking at her and was glad she managed to break his "concentration." "Yes, only one person actually volunteered to help out during the show so we're adding you to the duty list. It won't be too much work, don't worry."

"So...what would I be doing?" Ian asked, scratching his head.

"I don't know, there's going to be about 50 pregnant women there. They'll want water, they'll want snacks, they'll want massages, and some of the more hormonal ones will probably want someone to talk to and tell them that they look fine in a bikini," Lisa sighed, looking at her phone. "And of course you'll need to oil them up."

"O-oil them up?" Ian said, his face turning bright red.

"Yes, it's a beauty contest, after all. They have to look their best and that means oiling up all the bellies," Lisa said, standing up.

"E-even yours?" Ian choked out.

If there's two people doing it, I don't care how gross and handsy the other person is: I'm not letting you oil up my belly, Lisa thought. "Possibly, yeah. Now I've got to go do a promotional photoshoot for the station website."

Lisa took off her t-shirt to reveal her full, pregnant body, clad only in a bikini. Ian let out a gurgle, turned bright white, turned in time to throw up mostly in a trash can, and collapsed on the floor.

"Ugh, Dennis? Could you call an ambulance? The kid from the bank just passed out," Lisa sighed, hands on her belly as she looked down at him. "And it looks like his pissed himself too...at least I hope that's piss."

"Bellies," Ian mumbled. "T-too many bellies."

As two of the station's employees dragged Ian away to get him more comfortable, Lisa waddled to the shoot where Sandwich and Oven were already waiting. "We've done so many photos for the website, but never quite like this," Sandwich chuckled.

"Maybe you can get Oven to do one too," Lisa smirked. "He's getting round enough."

"Yeah, yeah," Oven complained. "What happened in the office? There was all sorts of commotion."

"That dumb guy the bank used to collaborate with us barfed and passed out," Lisa said. "My guess is there'll only be one helper backstage tomorrow night."

"I don't envy him," Sandwich shivered. "One man responsible for the comfort of 50 pregnant women in bikinis. What's his name?"

Lisa opened a file on her phone and read over the contest's documents. "Jack Dale Jr."

"Put him on the wall of heroes," Sandwich said, shaking his head. "He's giving his life for 101.9 The Edge."

"Wall of heroes?" Oven said, his tone dropping. "So that means..."

"That's right," Sandwich nodded. "A free frisbee. Now let's get this photoshoot over with. Lisa, try to look a little less pregnant and a little more like you don't hate us."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Check in on Amanda

I agree. Whomever you want to follow, go for it.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"It's nothing," Jack said, trying to stuff the coin back in his pocket. He couldn't help notice how warm it was in his hand. It even felt like the tiny shard of metal was vibrating and moving in his grasp, but it was so small and slight Jack couldn't be sure if it was his nerves instead.

Faye reached over, grasping Jack's wrist. Her belly pressed more tightly against him as she turned his palm over. "No ordinary quarter has a picture of two pregnant people smiling on one side." She picked up the coin and turned it over, careful not to actually flip it. "And let me guess: the same pregnant people frowning on the other side."

Jack didn't know how to play it. He couldn't lie and say it was a trick coin, but he didn't want to give away too much information just yet. "H-how did you know that?" Faye looked into his eyes, studying his expression. Jack felt himself get hot, worrying if the "cougar" Faye might rear her head now.

"Ma'am, you need to get out," the same carny who let them onto the ride said.

"Yeah yeah, you need to clear the car," Faye said, waving her away while keeping her eyes fixed on Jack. "I'm eight months pregnant. I take a little bit longer."

"No, I mean now, ma'am," the carny said, grabbing Faye's arm. "We're evacuating. There's been another pregnancy outbreak." Faye and Jack both looked at the woman. Before they got on the ride, she was sporting a healthy, basketball pregnant belly. Now she was gestating a watermelon in her womb, with one fake-nailed hand slowly rubbing and patting it. "Lucky you didn't get any bigger."

"I suppose so," Faye nodded, letting the pregnant carny and a few other employees pull her out of the car. Jack even pushed her wide ass a bit to help her with the leverage, guiltily enjoying the feel as well. Jack hurried alongside Faye, glad the awkward moment of discovery was shaken up a bit. But not much.

"W-weird how this pregnancy stuff just comes out of nowhere, huh?" Jack said with a smile. But Faye had him pinned against a wall with her belly as soon as they were out of foot traffic.

"I think you know more than you're saying, mister," Faye said, her lower lip quivering. "I think it's a little too suspicious that you have a thing for pregnant women and then you have a coin that causes pregnancies. And everyone close to you is pregnant too."

Jack held his hands up. "I-I just found it on the floor today! I swear I don't know anything!" He gulped, an idea sprouting. "How do you know this coin causes pregnancy anyway?"

"Because I have one too," Faye said, reaching into an inner pocket and pulling out her coin. Jack tried to hide his smile.

I know where her coin is now he thought to himself. One step closer, Dale. One step closer.

"Miss?" a big-bellied police officer said, waddling toward the two slowly. "Don't worry: these sudden pregnancies knock into people all the time. Just back up slowly and he'll be fine."

Faye took a breath and stepped back. "Sorry, officer," she said. "But how dare you: I didn't get impregnated by some mystery disease. I grew these babies inside my belly myself."

"My apologies, miss," the officer said, nodding her hand. "Now, please make a line with the rest of the fair-goers and we'll get you out of here in an orderly line."

"Where are the NIH people?" Jack said, looking around. "Don't they spring into action where there's a 'pregnancy outbreak?'"

"They're gone," the officer said. "Not that they did us any help. All they did was harass me because I decided to stay on the force while I'm nine months pregnant. I told 'em, hey, the force doesn't give us paid maternity leave."

Faye and Jack nodded politely as they hurried away, joining the steady stream of pregnant men and women out of the fair.

"So," Faye sighed. "Now that the secret's out, looks like you helped impregnate a whole fair, assuming your story's straight."

Jack blushed a bit. He preferred not to think of his coin-flipping as "impregnating" anyone. How would he feel telling Faye he impregnated her, Jessica, Amber, Tara, and even Mia Vasquez? "I-I'm sure you've impregnated your fair share of people too, Faye."

Faye let out a small, whimpering laugh. "I guess so," she sighed. "I shouldn't have, though. I was so eager to be pregnant, when power fell into my hands, I just..." A tear fell down her cheeks, which she tried to wipe away. Jack beat her too it, stroking her face with a finger. "You've grown into quite the gentleman, Jack."

"You gave me good advice every now and then," Jack said, not entirely lying. In high school, Faye had a sixth sense about when Jack was feeling queasy over a girl and gave him a few good pointers. Maybe if he used them, he and Jessica would have been dating longer than a week. "But I can't just sit by when a friend is crying...especially if they're pregnant."

Faye turned to Jack, a look of slight surprise on her face. She stopped in the middle of the stream and gave Jack a kiss on the cheek. Not a cute, friendly peck. But a wet, open-lipped kiss that lingered and left residual warmth and moisture. When she returned, looking her neighbor's son over for a few seconds, she finally spoke.

"The park's nearby. Let's go walk along there."

Jack nodded, taking Faye's hand. Oh God...Jessica, please forgive me. I like this date.

---Amber---

"C'mon, pick up," Amber groaned, cellphone against her ear as she patted her belly with the other. After a few rings, she got the same familiar message.

"Hey, you've reached Charlie Jones," the recorded voice said. "Not available right now, but leave me your number and email. And your name, while you're at it." The message ended with a little, manly laugh before the beep.

Amber had avoided leaving a message, but with a sigh, decided enough was enough. "Hi Charlie, or as you called yourself about nine months ago, Chuck. Look, I've been trying to do anything to distract myself from...all this," she said, looking at her now-abandonned Spyder controller, "but enough is enough. We need to talk and it'll be easier before your children come into this world. Any of them."

Amber hung up and crossed her arms, looking at her small apartment. The bigger she got, the smaller it looked. The last time she had an ultrasound, Amber's doctor said she was 37 weeks along, which Amber took as the truth. In truth, the procreative sex happened in a haze and the discovery of her pregnancy blurred a few months of her life. Especially when she learned the baby daddy had four babies of his own on the way already. She had no real sense of how long she'd been pregnant. It felt like both an eternity and like a belly sprouted out of her a week ago.

All Amber had to look forward to now was the bikini contest. Self-confidence was never something Amber was lacking so she thought she had a good chance of winning. But as she turned on her TV and saw Mia on the news, her assuredness waned a bit.

"As you can see, there was another outbreak of the pregnancy disease at the local fair," Mia said, her triplet belly unhidden by the camera frame as she pointed to the stream of people leaving. "One fair employee saw it as close as you can. What was your name again, ma'am?"

"Candice," the pregnant carny from the Ghost Mansion said, twirling her dyed hair with one finger. "I saw people leaving our ride, mostly couples, and as they were leaving and getting ready to step off, poof, their stomachs started swelling. A few kinda lost their balance and some other employees had to keep them from falling over."

"And you weren't spared either," Mia said, gesturing to Candice's belly.

"No, I was already pregnant with one when this all started," Candice said, rubbing her huge belly. "Now looks like my little boy is going to have some siblings in there. Wish I had a big belly earlier, though. I'd have entered the bikini contest."

Mia laughed. "You've heard about it, have you?"

"Everyone has. Hell, I'm still going to check it out," Candice smiled. "Still, me entering would have been a waste of time. You'll win easily, girl!"

"Aw, thank you," Mia said. "You're still very good looking."

"Hell, I know. My boyfriend tells me every day," Candice scoffed, crossing her arms.

"Let's talk to some other people who were there," Mia said, walking away from Candice as quickly as she could. "Miss, were you at the Ghost Mansion ride?"

The camera moved to Faye, who turned a bit red. "W-well, yes, but-"

"And is your belly a result of the outbreak?"

"No!" Faye frowned. "I'm carrying quadruplets and I've had them for eight months!"

"Sorry! I get that question a lot too," Mia said, gesturing for the camera to include Jack in the shot. "As a couple on the ride together, was it shocking to see people suddenly become pregnant?"

Jack and Faye both turned pale. "Um...well...we're..." Faye sputtered.

Jack started to feel the same tickling behind his ear. "We've got to get out of here," he whispered to Faye. "Quick."

"S-sorry! Babies kicking on the bladder!" Faye said, waddling away.

Amber was sitting on the floor, jaw dropped. "As you can see, folks, despite the NIH, or 'P.E.A.R.,' pulling out and saying the pregnancy disease is no longer contagious, something is still up in the city," Mia said as Amber turned the TV off.

"He's not with any girlfriend," Amber muttered. "He's still with that big-bellied older woman. Does that whole family just encourage cheating?" Amber bit her lip and heaved herself up. "No more crying. No more feeling sorry for myself," she growled, taking off her shirt and grabbing her bikini. "I'm winning this thing for Amber. And for my twins. I'll give Jack a piece of my mind at the contest."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Back to Jack and Faye

Jack and Faye run into some familiar faces
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack Sr. paced around his desk in the living room, rubbing his hands together. All today at work, he'd spent most of his time on personal matters, trying to see how much money he could scrounge together for the next 20+ years. Now, at home, even though there was a conspicuous lack of distractions, he was hitting a mental wall.

Or he hoped it was a mental wall. Otherwise, Jack had just hit the limit on the Dale family's funds.

"Hiya," Amanda grunted as she twisted and turned, waddling her quadruplet belly through the front door. "Don't worry, your extremely pregnant wife is making through the door on her own. No need to help."

Jack ran one hand through his greying hair. "Amanda...sit down. We need to talk."

"You don't need to convince me to sit down," Amanda chuckled, pushing both hands against her lower back and shuffling to the couch before pausing. After spending so much time in the fog of Faye and Amber's inter-marital spat, Amanda's heart sank at Jack's word. "Oh god, Jack, don't tell me you-"

"No! No no no!" He said, hurrying to the couch beside his wife. "I know what you're thinking. The only bellies around town with my babies in it are right here," he said, patting Amanda's inflated stomach for emphasis. "C'mon Amanda, I love you like crazy. You know that."

"I do~" Amanda purred, rolling her eyes as Jack pecked her on the cheek. "So, what is it?"

"You're...excited to have these babies, aren't you?" Jack said, resting one hand on Amanda's belly.

Amanda took a deep breath and put one hand over her husband's. "I...was surprised, sure. And I can't pretend it's been easy but..." She looked up at Jack and gave a little laugh. "I love being pregnant and I can't wait to meet and raise these babies." Jack sighed and nodded. "Do you mean you-"

"No, no, I do too," Jack nodded. "Since you've been pregnant, it's been like when we were first married. Things are more fun and exciting and you look so beautiful and of course I want to raise more children with you." He held up an ink-smudged piece of paper. "But raising four babies is going to be expensive and we haven't exactly saved up for it. I'm worried about..." Jack trailed off as he put his hand to his forehead, letting out a frenzied gasp.

"Jack, is that all?" Amanda said, putting one hand on Jack's shoulder. "Babe, of course it'll be tricky, but we weren't that well off when Jack Jr. came along and I think you'd agree he's turned out pretty well." Jack Sr. nodded, removing his hand to look his wife in the eye. "We'll be fine."

Jack sighed and nodded, leaning in closer to his incredibly pregnant wife. "But we still need a lot of money that just isn't there."

"I've already thought about that," Amanda said, putting her husband's other hand on her belly. "When I first found out I was pregnant, as soon as I could, I worked things out at Titan Bank. My retirement fund is going straight to the babies."

"Amanda!" Jack said with surprise. "I-I can't ask you to do that! I'll give up my retirement instead."

She held up one hand. "Trust me, the bank's taken a bit better care of its employees. And I won't really be retiring. I have more than a full-time job growing inside my belly right now."

Jack smiled and went in for a kiss, his wife passionately linking lips with him. As the two kissed on the couch, Amanda grinded her belly against Jack until they broke, both blushing brightly.

"So...you said I'm beautiful like this," Amanda purred, tracing a circle around her popped-out navel with one finger. "Do you mean 'more' beautiful?"

Jack Sr. turned even redder, not sure how to respond. "W-well, you've got that glow, you know?"

Amanda crawled toward her husband, weighing him down with her considerable womb. "I always suspected something with you. When I was pregnant with Jack, you had an extra oomph."

Her husband let out a little laugh. "Is that a problem?"

"No, no problem at all," Amanda whispered. "But I feel bad. I never let you watch my dance practice. I should have been more considerate."

Jack ran one hand up his wife's belly. "Well, now's as good a time as any."

"Mmm, I agree," Amanda said, rubbing her nose against his. "But first...let's go up to the bedroom." A pause. "H-help me up, would you?"

---Jessica---

Ms. Apple shimmied back and forth, her belly jutting out randomly and widely as the tassels on her breasts spun around while her chest bounced and bobbed. When the song ended, she stopped, panting and sweating as she put both hands on her wide hips, which thanks to her peach thong, looked naked at first-glance.

"So," Ms. Apple said, looking at her tiny audience. "What do you think?"

"Great," Mariah nodded fervently. "Amazing. You'll win for sure."

"Mariah..." Jessica said, elbowing her friend. "You're not trying to pick her up. You have to be honest."

Mariah gulped and blushed as Ms. Apple turned to her. "What? It wasn't perfect?"

"Ms. Apple," Jessica said, sighing for a second. She hated using the stupid codenames these people insisted on. "You're just sort of...flailing around. It's not really a dance. You're just moving a lot and using your looks to your advantage."

"I'm just using what I've got," Ms. Apple said. "That's a big belly and big tits."

"We can find a style to fit that," Ms. Smart said, walking toward her partner. "But Jessica's right. You were just...all over the place. You'll win the vote of a few dweebs in the audience, maybe, but not enough to win. We all need to be strong contenders for first place to increase our odds of getting the third coin."

"And not to be rude but you're not the only one competing with big breasts," Jessica said. "Mia Vasquez and Lisa Smith have you pretty well matched in that territory and I'll bet they're better dancers."

"And Jack's neighbor Faye is pretty busty," Mariah chimed in.

"Yes, thank you for reminding me," Jessica sighed quietly.

"Fine, fine, I'll work on doing something else," Ms. Apple groaned marching over to the viewing area. "Who's next?"

"I'll go," Jessica said, waddling to the front. She adjusted her bright bikini, subtly trying to made her breasts seem bigger before signaling Mariah to start the music. As the gentle piano and violin came in, Jessica started to glide, twirling and stepping gracefully, letting her belly swing out with each move. Its weight acted as a kind of pendulum, allowing Jessica to shift her balance as needed to pull off her moves. When the music stopped, Jessica let out a long sigh and waddled over to the nearest water bottle. "So?"

"Gorgeous," Mariah said quietly, hands clutched together at her chest. "Honestly."

"Yes, very elegant," Ms. Smart nodded. "It was like a pregnant ballet, but a little more modern and accessible."

"Good," Ms. Apple agreed. "But you need to sex it up a bit."

"Would you stop with that?" Ms. Smart groaned, turning to her partner.

"I'm being realistic!" Ms. Apple said, throwing her hands up. "This isn't just a dance competition. Otherwise, we wouldn't all be in bikinis. C'mon Jessica, you need to shake that nice butt of yours or run your hands over your body or something. The only person who's going to get hard over that dance is your boyfriend."

"I get it," Jessica said, narrowing her eyebrows at Ms. Apple. "I really didn't need that last piece."

"And she has a point," Ms. Smart nodded. "Remember, we all need to be fantastic for tomorrow's competition or we and thousands of other people are going to end up with some bundles of joy whether they want them or not. And I don't know about you, but I don't want mine."

Jessica gulped and looked down at her belly, rubbing it slowly. It's about more than just what I want, she repeated to herself. As much as I want to be pregnant...I have to think about everyone else.

"Now then," Ms. Smart said, walking to the front and taking Jessica's place. "Let me know what you think." Mariah hit the music and Ms. Smart leaped into the air, landing and throwing her hands up theatrically.

"Terrible," Ms. Apple said.

"It's been two seconds!" Ms. Smart yelled back.

"I know," Ms. Apple groaned. "You really need work."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Practice continues

choices: Sure we can. Follow another character.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
The park was, for now, largely empty. It wasn't a bad park. Far from it: large, open swaths of soft grass, plenty of paths with trees for walking, a small but respectable playground near a water fountain. Everything made this park picturesque for a walk with the family.

Which was the problem: the city had hundreds of families in the making instead. The tension of so many people suddenly becoming pregnant, including plenty of men who never thought this was a problem they'd face, made the park less of an attraction in the past week or so. But, as the city's parks director said in a casual interview with the local paper, as she rubbed her twin-filled belly, "we expect the park to become very crowded very soon."

But the lack of foot traffic made the park an excellent place for Jack and Faye to continue their date. Faye was happy to have some secluded time with the young man who she found herself liking and wanting more and more as they spent time together. And Jack was happy to not have anyone around for his coin to affect. Since the accident at the fair, it was clear something strange was happening and the coin was even more potent than usual.

That wasn't the only thing strange about the coin. When Faye mentioned how she had one as well, she talked about it offering her some sort of "power." Jack thought something was suspicious about Faye since she took the book that contained the coin's history and impregnated Mariah while she was at it. Was the coin putting some sort of agenda of its own into affect?

"Jack?" Faye said, interrupting Jack's train of thought. Jack blushed and turned back to his "date." She smiled and gave a little chuckle. "You...loosen your grip."

Jack looked down and saw he was only barely holding Faye's hand now. "S-sorry," he said, squeezing her hand back. Faye giggled and her smile grew, which only made Jack's heart beat faster. He only agreed to this date to get the coin and find a way to save everyone, especially Jessica. He'd loved her for years and now their relationship had become very real, very fast.

But despite how he knew he should feel, Jack couldn't help being attracted to Faye. It wasn't just her belly, although obviously her eight-month quadruplet tummy was always enthralling. But Faye also had smooth skin with a powerful "pregnant glow," an extra-stacked chest to prepare for her coming children, and a beautiful face that was simultaneously mature and assuring while also being fun and friendly.

"You're getting shy again," Faye said, moving one hand to Jack's cheek. "And your face is so hot. Did you not want to go somewhere private?"

"No, no I did," Jack smiled, trembling. "It's just...this is all a little surreal. I had a crush on you for..." He paused, realizing the magnitude of the next admission. "For years. E-ever since I was in middle school."

Faye gave a little laugh and kissed Jack on the cheek again, moving one hand to his wrist and placing Jack's fingertips against her belly. "Seems like we were both looking for one another, huh?" She brought her lips away and began whispering in Jack's ear, pressing his hand more tightly against her pregnant swell, rubbing his palm in small circles. "But it's alright now. I'm here for you now. All of me."

Jack heard chatter around some bushes and quickly moved away from Faye. She was about to protest but when two people walked around, she straightened up and brushed one lock of hair away, smiling. He's like a deer standing up for the first time, she thought to herself. I'll have to be gentle with him...at first.

Why are you playing games? Take me from him! Faye looked down at her pocket (or in her pocket's general direction, with her belly and breasts in the way of her view) and raised an eyebrow. She hadn't heard the coin's voice for a while now. Is something impeding me?

Jack tried to look casual as the other parkgoers walked by, but when he saw who they were, it was hard to stay relaxed. "Oh...you're Lisa Smith."

Lisa sighed and nodded, smiling at Jack and Faye. "Yes, hello. Fans of the show, I take it?"

"I listen whenever I'm driving," Jack said, gulping as he looked at her belly. He'd heard that Lisa was pregnant now, but to actually see 101.9's beauty with such a big bump was something else. Then he turned to the woman next to Lisa and slowly pointed at her. "Aren't you...Natalie?"

Lisa and Natalie were careful to not look too intimate in public, since Lisa knew her future on the air as a sex symbol would be in jeopardy if people knew she was in a relationship with another woman. So when Jack pointed Natalie out, her face turned pale. "Y-yes?"

"I'm Amanda Dale's son," he explained.

Natalie let out a big sigh and laughed. "Oh, of course. How is your mom doing?"

Jack shrugged. "Still pregnant," he said with a nervous laugh, and Natalie replied with one of her own.

"I hope she'll come to the bikini contest," Lisa said with a more relaxed grin now. "How about you, ma'am?"

"Me?" Faye said. "I'm Amanda's neighbor, and don't worry, we're both entering."

"Good to meet the competition," Lisa chuckled, placing one hand on her belly. "Wait, Dale? So you're Jack Dale? Are you Jr.?"

"That's me," Jack said, remembering how Jessica signed him up to help.

Lisa let out another laugh and started walking again, patting Jack on the shoulder. "Better rest up, in that case. You'll have a lot of work ahead of you."

Jack shuddered, not quite sure what Lisa meant as she and Natalie continued their walk, checking to make sure Jack and Faye were out of ear's reach when they started talking again. "Thank God. I thought we'd be stuck with one ugly creep waiting on all of us," Lisa said, rubbing her hands across her belly in large circles to calm down her kicking triplets. "He's not so bad."

"But did you see the size of that woman?" Natalie said, shaking her head.

"What, worried she'll beat me?" Lisa smirked, looking around before sneaking Natalie a kiss. "I think you owe me lunch for that."

Faye smiled at Jack as his trembling continued. "Another crush of yours?"

"M-maybe," Jack said with a nervous smile. "A-all my crushes seem to be getting pregnant lately. Jessica, Lisa. You."

"I think it's because you know exactly what you're doing with that coin," Faye said, rubbing her belly against Jack's sides. As she mentioned it, the strong itching feeling in Jack's head grew again. This time, it was even stronger than at the fair.

I need to be freed! the coin rasped in their ears. Having two of me at once...need to correct!

As the itching became unbearable, Jack ripped the coin from his pocket and flipped it. As it fell through the air, Jack saw a group of people coming toward him and turned away in fear. Instead, he ended up laying his eyes on Natalie as the coin fell on Tails in his hand. It burned in his hand as a cry of surprise from down the park could be heard.

"Natalie!" Lisa gasped as she gingerly put her hand on her lover's enormous belly. "You...do you feel okay?"

"Just...a bit heavy," Natalie moaned as she pressed her hands into her back. The jolt of her womb swelling with sextuplets tore the lower half of her shirt cleanly apart. "But I guess this is how you feel most of the time."

"Kinda," Lisa said, putting one arm around Natalie's shoulders. "Let's get you home."

"It's too late to sign up for the bikini contest, isn't it?" Natalie said, giving a little laugh.

"Afraid so," Lisa said.

Jack stuffed the coin into his pocket again, and as he did so, Faye grabbed his arm, a panther-like grin on her face. Jack gulped. He recognized this expression on Faye's face from the first time she tried to seduce him. Something had changed and she was back to the way she was.

"Why are we still on this silly date?" Faye purred, pressing her belly hard against Jack's hips. "We both know what we want."

"W-we do?" Jack said.

"You want this belly. You want this ass. You want these tits," Faye said. "And I want you too. We're going. Now."

She started dragging Jack by his arm, marching him through the park as she began rolling up her shirt to let her belly hang down. "Where?"

"My house," Faye said with a wink. "There's still lots of redecorating to be done."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack and Faye's date changes settings

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack and Faye walked back to his car, Faye holding his hand tightly the entire time. Something happened and the kind and cool Faye Jack had known all his life was back to being the sultry and intense woman she'd been in the last few days. Jack feared Faye would be like this when he first hatched the group's plan to get her distracted enough that he could take her coin but after spending the day on a date with his quadruplet-carrying neighbor, he was more worried about his own feelings.

As soon as they got into Jack's car, Faye reached over and began kissing Jack. Her lips were wet, pink pillows and her tongue was so fast and strong, it could tie a cherry stem into a knot and then untie it in seconds. Jack's arms slowly tried to wrap around Faye, but she moved his hands to stroke her belly and breasts, letting out a purring laugh as she latched onto her young partner for the evening.

"You don't know what it's like," Faye cooed, nuzzling against Jack's shoulder, "to wait all your life to carry life inside your womb and then to be stabbed in the back by the man you made a promise with. I need to get a clean slate. I need to make love with another man."

Jack trembled as he felt Faye's nipples get hard in his hands. After losing Jessica and miraculously getting her back, he didn't want to ruin their relationship by having sex with Faye, even if his growing lap said otherwise. But getting the coin back and saving the people of the city from their unexpected pregnancies was more important. With his mind racing, Jack tried to think of how to have it both ways.

"D-dinner!" Jack blurted out. Faye stopped and looked up, her eyelids still heavy.

"What are you talking about, Jack?" she asked in her soft, breathy voice.

"Dinner! A dinner date!" Jack said, nodding quickly as if to tell himself You're doing great, hang in there. "It's getting late and you're probably hungry."

Faye paused and put one hand on her hip. "And why exactly do you assume I'm hungry?"

"Ah...well..." Jack stuttered, trying to dig himself out of his hole.

Faye's pout turned into a grin and she patted Jack on the arm. "I'm just kidding. You're right, carrying around four little ones gives me an appetite to match." She patted her hands on her belly and her smile grew. "You like it when I do this, don't you?" Faye rolled up her shirt and fondled her bare belly, flicking her popped-out navel with her fingers. "Ooh, that felt good. Remember that for later."

Jack's blush kept growing and he turned back to the steering wheel, turning the car on. "Great, I could eat too. And what's more romantic than a dinner date?"

Faye leaned over and kissed Jack on the cheek. "I see my lessons when you were younger didn't completely go to waste."

Jack decided not to take Faye to the Italian restaurant he and Jessica had been going to recently. He wanted to keep some things pure. But as he was driving around, trying to think of where to go, he got a tap on the shoulder from Faye. "There. Let's go there."

Jack looked and gulped when he saw the establishment Faye was talking about. What was once a local dinner club with some shmoozy name had been redone as "Belly Busters," complete with a sign featuring a pregnant waitress posing like a 1970s Playboy model, her bare belly sticking out from her uniform.

"I've heard about it, but Charles never wanted to go," Faye sighed, her hands resting on top of her belly. "But I doubt you'll have a problem."

"N-no, no problem," Jack said, hands trembling as he pulled the key out of the ignition and walked around, helping Faye out of the passenger side. Since the coin's reality changes didn't seem to affect him, Jack was unaware of a pregnancy-themed restaurant popping up in response to all the craziness and chaos he had a hand in spreading.

Inside, there was old, sappy pop music playing while a middle-aged man stood at a small podium and smiled at them. "Hello, welcome to Belly Busters. Do you have a reservation?"

"No," Jack said, looking around at what he could see. <good so far. having dinner now. meet at her house soon>

Next, Jack opened the text from Amanda, his mother. <where r u?>

<With Jessica for the night>

As Jack got up, his phone buzzed again with a reply from Amanda again. <ok be safe : )>

Reaching out several of it's disgusting clawed hands, it pulled down the long spiderweb like strands of destiny, and ate with them with a disgusting slurp, it's endless horrible hunger sated in a brief fleeting moment as it devoured the true destiny of all those who became affected by the horrible things horrible influence with it's horrible things.

SLURP. SLURP. Still it ate, as men and women's true destinies were altered, reshaped, reforged by the horrible thing's horrible toys across all the world it's horrible influence could reach. PING! Another strand of destiny was reforged as a young man destined to write a novel that would change the world was now forced to sell car insurance to take care of the twins he was now pregnant with thanks to the horrible thing's horrible things across the world.

The horrible thing ate with contentment, growing fatter with each devoured strand of destiny. PING! Another new strand of destiny was reforged as a woman destined to become the greatest actress of all time was now a stay at home mother of four children she was now pregnant with thanks to the horrible thing's horrible thing.

It greedily clawed at the destiny that once was and ate it, making sure what once was could never possibly be again, it's other disgusting horrible taloned hands clapping together celebrating it's own horrible horribleness.

It saw everything as it ate, it saw at husband and wife compare the size of their bellies, trying to figure out who was more pregnant, PING! It ate this strand with delight, all thanks to Jack Dale Jr.

Yes, Jack Dale Jr was one of the horrible things favorite playthings, almost as much if not more that Jack's friend Ian. Both performed beyond the horrible things horrible imagination. The chaos it spread, the destinies that were rewritten, the FEAST! Soon, the horrible things horrible time would come. The horrible thing's dark works would not be able to be undone, and with all the eaten destinies, it would be closer to finally being free.

The coin was it's greatest power and it's greatest weakness. The drinks could not be undone, the game could not be undone, the coin could.
If it was undone, it hurt the horrible things in the most horribly horrible ways possible. The work it would have to do!

The horrible things didn't fix, it destroyed. It hated when it had to fix, in fact, fixing nearly kills it. However, for the horrible thing it rarely has to fix.
It always made sure it never had to fix, it had it's tools, and right now, one such tool, Faye was close to making sure it would never have to fix this particular world in this particular universe.

It was a risk whenever the coin came to one, that the horrible thing's works could be undone, but things always seemed to workout for the horrible thing.
After Jack, the coin would find itself in the hands of another, spreading it's horrible influence to another, and when that user was unable to break the horrible thing's horrible magic, it would be another step closer to being free.

It was a long horrible game the horrible thing was playing, but one day it would win…

Mia felt herself shake as she brought her hands to her cheeks. "A-are you serious?"

"Yeah, the first two were," Jessica said with a little laugh, moving one hand under his chin so he'd look back into her eyes. "These new tenants are Faye's fault and I'm placing the whole blame on her now." She wrapped her arms around her belly and puffed out as much as she could, showing off her size. "You break it, you buy it."

Brandon let out a nervous laugh of his own. "But see? It's stuff like that that makes me like you, Jessica. I've always liked you. And in these past few days..." He reached one hand around Jessica's back, pulling them as close together as her belly would allow. "I think I love you too. I've never felt this way about another woman before."

"Stop," Jessica said, looking away as her face got red. "Seriously, you don't have to do this."

"Then let's work together," Brandon said, hugging Jessica with both arms, feeling her face against his chest. "We'll put everything we have into getting that coin back and beating Faye and turning the whole town back to the way it was." He pulled away and smiled at Jessica. They could both tell they were starting to cry a little. "Okay?"

"Okay," Jessica nodded. "I'll dominate the bikini contest and get that third coin."

"I know you will," Brandon said, leaning in to her lips. "I'd vote for your big belly in a heartbeat." They kissed and let their hands travel down to Jessica's belly, stroking it as they moved their tongues around in each other's mouth.

Jessica gave a small giggle and rubbed her belly gently when they broke the kiss, moving her hands up and down her massive expanse. "You're sweet," she said. "Isn't this better?"

"What?"

"Us being open about this," Jessica said, patting her belly. "How much we like it."

Brandon laughed in reply. "I see what you mean. It's like a...a weight's been lifted or something."

"And I don't think I need to remind you how much I like it when you describe my pregnant body," Jessica purred. "Only now, you've got more room to do it in."

Brandon shifted positions so he was looking directly at Jessica's enormous pregnant middle, his hands softly caressing each side. "Hmm, since you're at quadruplets now, I guess I need to do it again. You're like the queen of pregnancy now."

"Aww," Jessica smiled, feeling her toes curl.

"And you've got this great, smooth skin," Brandon smiled, tracing one finger across her belly. "It makes me just want to..."

"C'mon, say it," Jessica panted.

Brandon pounced, kissing Jessica all over her breasts and neck as his lap rubbed against her belly. "I guess I'm having sex with a quadruplet-carrying woman tonight after all."

"And not just anyone," Jessica smiled, reaching over and removing Brandon's shirt. "The future winner of the Miss Stork Pregnant Bikini Contest. By definition the sexiest pregnant woman in the city."

"No arguments there," Brandon said, nearly ripping his pants getting them off. As they fumbled around to get appropriately undressed, Brandon had Jessica's belly smack him in the face several times.

"Sorry," Jessica laughed, sticking her tongue out. "I'm not that used to it."

"No complaints," Brandon smiled, sucking on her popped-out navel. Jessica groaned and gripped the bedsheets as her hands stroked her swollen womb. "Too much?"

"It's just...everything's a lot more sensitive now," Jessica panted. "I told you how the...the moment is more intense since getting pregnant?"

"Yeah," Brandon said, his face heating up.

"I'll bet it'll be insane now," Jessica grinned, biting one of her fingers as she spread her legs.

"I-I say we test that hypothesis," Brandon gulped, putting his hands around Jessica's big pregnant body, trying to find the best positioning.

"C-can we stop talking my coy nerds and just fuck already?" Jessica laughed, thrusting forward and positioning herself on top of Brandon. "There we go."

---

"So they need all three coins to do this?" Faye said, tapping one finger to her lips. "That explains a lot."

"Y-yes it does," Mariah said, trembling as she stood in front of Faye, hands behind her back. "S-so do I get a-"

"Oh, right," Faye smiled, running the tip of her pinkie down Mariah's belly. Jessica's bookworm friend shuddered where she stood as the sultry housewife gave her pregnant stomach a light stroke. "Now how do they know this?"

"I-it was in the book," Mariah panted, squeezing one hand with the other. "The one we stole from you. It's a diary of every piece of information we know about the coin."

I've told you far more than that book would the coin's demonic essence whispered in Faye's ear.

"Quiet," Faye said in a low voice before running one foot up the side of Mariah's leg. "Now then, dear, what else did that book say?"

"If we...they don't undo everything tomorrow night, all the pregnancies will be permanent," Mariah squeaked as her knees got weak.

"Tomorrow night?" Faye chuckled. "How convenient. Why then?"

"B-because you were the first person the coin got pregnant," Mariah groaned, her face getting redder and redder as Faye's foot got closer between Mariah's legs. "A-and you'll give birth soon."

Faye pounded her couch with her fist, enough to make Mariah yelp and jump. "So I was right. They are trying to take my babies away," she growled. "Then I really will stop them."

"A-and that's not all," Mariah squeaked. "I mean...if you want to hear more."

Faye's mask of fury turned quickly to her flirty face as she heaved herself up and waddled around Mariah, occasionally giving her a light touch. "It sounds like this will be good."

"T-there's a third coin besides yours and it's a prize in the bikini contest tomorrow," Mariah said, nearly moaning at this point. "A-and Jessica and me and our other people on our side are practicing to win it."

"So all I have to do is win the contest," Faye laughed. "Should be easy enough with the way I look."

"I agree! Mariah cried out, hugging Faye closely. "I'm sorry, I couldn't control myself any longer. Please!"

Faye shushed Mariah gently as she pet her hair. "Dear Mariah, you've been a tremendous help. And you're very beautiful too."

"Take me," Mariah whined, her face buried in Faye's chest.

"O-oh," Faye said, not knowing Mariah would want to go that far. She took her as too shy. "Tonight?"

"I've never...even kissed," Mariah said. "consentually and I want to sleep with you! You're...you're the most gorgeous woman I know."

Faye paused. She had been sex-starved for months. And it wasn't like she'd never slept with another woman before. And as far as looks go, she could do far worse than Mariah.

"Alright cutie," Faye sighed, holding Mariah's head up. "Let's do it."

"R-really?" Mariah said, her eyes gleaming.

"Really," Faye smiled, leaning down to kiss Mariah on the lips.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: New day, new Jessica, new belly

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
(Quick note: I have seen that I accidentally called Jack "Brandon" in the last chapter. Sometimes these stories run together. I apologize and am correcting the mistake in this chapter. Please have a pleasant day.)

"Good morning," Jessica whispered as she felt Jack stir awake. He smiled as her hair tickled his face, kissing Jessica on her cheek. After exploring Jessica's new quadruplet-pregnancy body extensively last night, the two had been ready to go to sleep, though there was one problem: Jessica was now too big to share her bed with someone else. So they had to get creative and have Jack sleep slighting sitting up while Jessica lay on top of him.

They both liked this sleeping position plenty. Not only did it mean Jessica could rest without her belly hanging off the side of her bed or sticking up in the air and weighing her down, but Jack got to wrap his arms around her round pregnant stomach.

"Good morning," Jack laughed in reply, hugging Jessica a little more tightly now that they were waking up. "You seem cheery."

Jessica bit her lip. "Let's just say last night confirmed something for me."

"What's that?"

"Remember? The...bigger my belly gets, the bigger 'it' is," Jessica smiled, turning to face Jack with a blushing face.

"'It?'"

"The big moment," Jessica giggled, moving her naked butt back and forth against Jack's lap. "You know."

"Ah, yes, the big moment," Jack laughed back. "I think it was better for me too." He started to rub his hips against Jessica too, his erection already more awake than he was. "Though I think a few more tests wouldn't hurt."

Jessica gave a mock gasp and turned around, her belly now filling the space between Jack's legs. "Mr. Dale, you've gotten awfully forward. Is this the real you beneath that shy exterior?"

Jack grinned and moved his hands up Jessica's sides. "Maybe. Or maybe I just love spending time with the mother of my children."

Jessica laughed a little more loudly. "Okay, now you're getting a little cheesy." She leaned in and pecked Jack's lips. "Though I liked where we were going with that." She smiled and the two began kissing for real, reacquainting one another with the way their bodies interacted.

"So...about going another round?" Jack said when there was a pause in the make-out session.

"You've got a mind like a steel trap," Jessica said, rolling her eyes. "And sure, but not here. My parents might-" Jessica stopped and her eyes bugged out. "My parents! Shit!"

"What?" Jack said as Jessica started to slowly get off the bed and waddle around for her clothes. "Is something wrong?"

"Jack, do you remember how your parents reacted when they found out you were dating a pregnant girl?" Jessica said, struggling to put on the first bra she found. "Well imagine if these were actually your babies. And then you came home with someone. And they were a lot less cool."

There was a knock at Jessica's bedroom door. A loud one. "Jessica? You're awake?"

"Pretend like you're asleep," Jessica hissed at Jack, who gladly did as she was told. Jessica then grabbed her cellphone and opened the door. "I'll call you back."

"Who was that?" an older woman with Jessica's features said, crossing her arms.

"It was Mariah, relax," Jessica said, lowering her voice. "Be quiet. He's...still asleep."

"Is that him?" Jessica's father said, standing next to her mother. "I'll take him out before he gets a chance to wake up."

"Please, dad, don't," Jessica said, her voice starting to shake. "I told you, it's not what it all seems."

"Did you get bigger?" her mother gasped. Her hand hesitated over Jessica's belly before retreating back. "How pregnant are you now?"

"Quadruplets," Jessica said. Her parents both gasped and looked down in distress. "And I'm fine with it, by the way. Thanks for asking."

"You're fine with it," her dad scoffed. "It's hard enough raising one baby."

"And Jack and I know that," Jessica said. "But we promised each other we'd work hard to take care of these children."

"He'd better," her dad grumbled.

"They aren't his. They're barely even mine," Jessica said. "It's the pregnancy disease. Haven't you been watching the news?"

"That's all a bunch of garbage," her mom said, shaking her head. Jessica had the unfortunate parenting of two very strict, very stubborn, and very skeptical people. "But I believe that they aren't his. He doesn't even seem like he could work up the courage to ask you out, let alone get you knocked up."

"So what is it, Jessica?" her dad said, stepping forward. "Are you manipulating him to raise your babies for you or is he lying to you to get some sex from a vulnerable woman?"

"Mom, dad, I know you can't believe it, but despite all this, we love each other," Jessica said, her voice trembling as her eyes watered up. "This has not been easy for me and you two have been treating me like a pariah ever since you learned I was pregnant."

"Because we care about you!" her mother yelled. "Why can't you understand that? We don't want our young daughter being pregnant and single, let alone with four extra mouths to feed."

"I'm not single. I've got Jack," Jessica said, her tears now starting to flow. "And yes, it's scary, but...I like being pregnant. And the idea of raising a family with someone I love makes me really happy so...so there!" Jessica reached up one arm and rubbed her eyes clean. "And if you two had ever cared about what's best for me or what I was feeling, I'd ask you for help. But you haven't, so it'll just be Jack and me. And maybe his parents. They care a lot more about me than either of you."

Her parents stood in the hallway fuming for a few moments. "Then if that's the case, get out," her mom said. "We'll pack up your things for you but you physically have to be out of the house in an hour. Your boyfriend too."

"I won't need that long," Jessica sniffled, closing the door with a slam and waddling back to bed. As soon as she made it there, she started sobbing and fell into Jack's embrace. "I'm so sorry you had to see that."

"No, no, I'm sorry," Jack said, rubbing Jessica's back. "That really is all my fault."

"I guess...we'll need somewhere to go," Jessica mumbled.

"We can go to my place," Jack said, kissing Jessica on the forehead. "And I don't think my parents'll mind if we have sex there."

Jessica laughed through her tears and gave Jack a kiss. "Help me get changed?"

Once Jack helped his pregnant lover into an outfit, they headed out through her house. Jack was terrified one or both of her parents would jump out and slug him in the face, but as he squeezed Jessica's hand, he made it out without seeing either one of them. They made their way to Jack's car and drove as quickly as they could to his house. The emotional episode in front of Jessica's parents had turned back into the arousal they'd felt earlier, only now it was a little stronger.

"Oh, Jack, there you are," Amanda said as from the couch as Jack and Jessica hurried inside. "Jessica...did you get-"

"Yep, long story," Jessica said as she tried to waddle up the stairs as fast as she could.

"We'll tell you later," Jack said. "Maybe."

"O-okay then," Amanda chuckled as the door to Jack's bedroom slammed and the sound of shuffling feet could be heard.

"Jack's home?" Jack Sr. said, walking into the living room.

"He sure is. And I think he'll be in his room for a while," Amanda smiled, lowering her shirt collar to give her husband a look at her swollen cleavage.

"N-now?" Jack Sr. said.

"I've got a feeling I won't be pregnant much longer," Amanda grinned, wiggling her eyebrows. "So let's make the most of this while it lasts."

"Well," Jack Sr. said, with a gulp, "a-anything for my wife in her time of need."

"What a selfless man," Amanda laughed before tossing her shirt on the ground.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Day 9: Brandon wakes up in Jessica's house

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jessica and Jack walked into the warehouse base of the anti-coin gang, with Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple already waiting in the main room, and to Jack's pleasure, in their bikinis. "How'd it go?" Ms. Apple asked, her hands tracing the sides of her belly.

"Looks like we have another casualty," Ms. Smart sighed, looking at Jessica's belly, now twice as large.

"It went good otherwise," Jessica smiled as Jack held up the book, detailing the history of the coin. "We got the book."

Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple let out a grateful sigh and Ms. Smart took the tome, leafing through it quickly. "Now when Mariah gets here, we can how much more we can learn."

Ms. Apple saw Jack and Jessica looking at each other nervously and put her hands on her hips. "What?"

"Mariah...may be the real casualty," Jack said. "Faye caught us and as we were running away, Mariah got left behind." He turned and looked at Jessica's belly. "If this is what happened to Jessica, I can't imagine what Faye did to Mariah."

"I'll bet you could imagine," Jessica smirked, nudging Jack with her hips.

"Oh good, we're on the brink of a massive, unplanned, and unnatural baby boom in your city, including the two of you being straddled with several new babies to feed and clothe, and one of the few people who could help us out is kidnapped by our enemy, but thank goodness you kept your flirty relationship," Ms. Apple sighed. "What's our contingency plan?"

"Not sure," Ms. Smart said, closing the book. "All we can do is keep practicing."

Then, the sound of the safehouse's metal door opening drew all their attention and Mariah slowly waddled inside, already changed into her bikini and keeping her head low. "H-hi everyone,' Mariah finally squeaked out when she made it over to them.

"Mariah! You're safe!" Jessica beamed. "And you didn't put on any extra baby weight, by the looks of it."

"N-nope," Mariah said, biting her lips and keeping her gaze low.

"Mariah. What's wrong?" Ms. Smart said, walking close to the shy, short-haired pregnant woman. "Come on now. Tell us."

"I...talked with Faye," Mariah said, her hips rubbing together.

"What did you talk about?" Ms. Apple fumed, crossing her arms against her abundant breasts.

"The...um...coin. And book. And...the plan," Mariah gulped. All four of them threw their hands against their foreheads.

"Mariah! You...that was our whole upper hand!" Jessica said before taking a breath. "Wait, I'm sorry, she must have...I dunno, threatened you or something, right? Or tortured you? What happened?"

"We...um...y-you know," Mariah blushed with a little grin.

"Great," Ms. Apple groaned. "I thought he would let his libido ruin the whole plan but seems I was looking in the wrong place."

"Hey!" Jack pouted, while secretly in his head thinking about Mariah and Faye getting intimate together. I-Is rubbing bellies together a thing? he wondered.

"Exactly how much did you tell her?" Ms. Smart said slowly, running her hands through her long silky black hair.

Mariah shrugged. "That you want all three coins. That the other coin is the prize in the bikini contest. That the book had all that information." She turned to Jessica, her lips trembling. "I'm sorry! She was so beautiful and no one else ever liked me like that!"

Jessica sighed and hugged her friend. "We're not bad at you Mariah. Sex can be...tricky."

Ms. Smart traced her fingers against her chin. "This may not have set us back that badly. We still just have to win the contest and she already had her coin carefully guarded. Getting her coin back is still the hardest element of any of this."

"Winning the contest will be easy," Ms. Apple chuckled. "I mean, how good can one woman in her 40s be?"

"Good," Mariah immediately replied. "Very, very good."

"She's right," Jack nodded. "She'll be crafty. Faye may even cheat to win."

"Then we have to be vigilant," Ms. Smart said. "You'll be backstage working on the contest so that will be another set of eyes on her."

"R-right," Jack gulped. "How could I forget..."

"Aww, gettin' bashful?" Jessica laughed, rubbing Jack's back and chest.

"Geez, what, did you two fuck this morning?" Ms. Apple asked. There was an awkward silence that made her bust out laughing. "Sorry, my bad."

"We need to focus!" Ms. Smart said, clapping her hands together. "Practice and planning, that's what we need to do until the contest. Jack...we'll call you if we need you. For now, you're a distraction and frankly I don't want to be near that coin."

"Right," Jack nodded, turning back to Jessica and kissing her on the lips. "Kick ass, Jess."

"I will," Jessica grinned, pecking her lover again as she held her hands against her belly.

"Okay, Jessica, you're a blimp now so you need the most practice," Ms. Smart said. "Everyone else, this is the crunch time. We can get rid of this evil once and for all."

As Jack left, he saw he was getting a call. It was from-
