1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack saw that Ian was calling him and chuckled a little. He hadn't heard from Ian in a while, at least since the "pregnancy" issue in the town had really gotten out of hand. Jack accepted the call and brought the phone to his ear. "Hey Ian, what's up?"

"H-hey dude," Ian said. He sounded shaken up. "You free today? I feel like we haven't talked lately."

"Am I free," Jack repeated to himself as he tried to think out his schedule for the day. His shift at work with Amber wasn't starting for another few hours. "Sure, I have some time to kill. Meet at the mall?"

"The mall?" Ian said on the other end, sounding a little jumpy. "Uh...sure, I guess that would be fine."

"You sure? You sound kind of...off, Ian," Jack said.

"N-no, mall is fine," Ian replied, taking in a deep breath. "See you by the Game Bucket?"

"Sounds good to me," Jack said. "Looking forward to talking again, Ian."

"R-right," Ian laughed nervously before hanging up. Jack shook his head as he pocketed his phone. Ian had always been, well, an idiot but he'd never sounded this weird.

At the mall, it was packed as usual, and thanks to the liberal use of the coin in days past, it was more cramped thanks to the abundance of pregnant bellies taking up space. Though things were hardly stressful or confrontational as a result. In fact, most of the women (and men) who were waddling around seemed pleased to be able to meet and talk with fellow expectant mallgoers and had no problems rubbing round middles together.

For Jack, this meant blushing very strongly as he navigated his way through the occasional labyrinth of pregnancy that would crop up in the mall, buoyed by his love for Jessica and the assuring knowledge that her belly was bigger than any of theirs, and thus, more desirable. But with every appealing bare belly he saw, he felt a familiar tickle in his ear.

Flip me

Jack clenched his teeth and remained resolute. After nine days of carrying the coin around and feeling it slither its way into his mind and heart, he was able to resist the urge to take out his coin and give it a flip, knowing the consequences all too well.

Look at her...look at that perfect glow

Next to Jack was a tall pregnant woman with yellow and brown hair, a warm smile with pink lips, and beautiful olive skin. She had on a loose skirt and a thin top that only secured her breasts, leaving her warm belly to stick out proudly as it shone. Jack felt himself shudder as he saw her. She typified pregnant beauty. The woman noticed Jack's gaze and turned to smile at him. "Hi there. Interested in a sample?"

"A...sample?" Jack relied, clearing his throat. He noticed she was carrying a tray of various creams and gels.

"Belly butter, stretch mark cream, moisturizer for pregnant skin," she chirped. "Got anyone expecting in your life?"

"Y-yeah, my girlfriend," Jack said before his voice trailed off to add, "and my mom."

The woman giggled and handed him a large bottle with a press-squirt top. "Better show them this then. I'm Carolyn, by the way."

"Jack," he gulped.

Wouldn't you love to make her belly even bigger

"Are either of them going to be in the bikini contest tomorrow?" Carolyn asked.

"B-both, actually," Jack gulped.

"Both? Sounds like a competitive family," Carolyn laughed again before nudging Jack with her belly. "But I'll bet I can take 'em."

"R-right," Jack said as he felt the coin's whispers getting louder. "I have to go, sorry. Thanks for the sample."

"No problem," Carolyn smiled, waving to Jack as he hurried away. "Nice to meet you!"

Jack hurried to the mall's more out-of-the-way video game store, the Game Bucket, breathing heavily as he tried to ignore the coin's persistent egging on. Ian was inside, looking through a discount bin, when he saw Jack. "There you are dude. It's been a while."

"I got...tied up," Jack said, not wanting to expand on his interaction with Carolyn. "So, what's up?"

"It's hard to really explain," Ian said, his hands still trembling. "But I think that coin you gave me was cursed or something."

Jack's eyes went wide. He remembered giving Ian the coin that one time but having it somehow split into two, then later three with Faye. But did Ian really figure it out? Jack pegged him as a little too slow for that.

"Ever since I got that coin, it's like pregnant women have been following me everywhere," Ian shuddered. "At work, in the streets, all around the city, and especially here in the mall. I can't take it."

"It...can't be that bad, can it?" Jack said, wondering if the coin really had affected him differently.

"No, it's bad dude. I actually passed out when I found out all I was supposed to do with that bikini contest."

"You mean the pregnant bikini contest?" Jack said, raising an eyebrow. "You didn't know there was pregnancy involved?"

"I didn't notice," Ian said.

"It's on the posters all over town. On the radio," Jack said, scratching his head. "Isn't your bank one of the sponsors?"

"Yeah and I was put in charge of it but they're taking me out now after my 'accident,'" Ian said, making air quotes. "Which is a relief, I guess."

Jack started to realize an opportunity here. "Hey, you know, I was signed up to help out at the contest too."

"Yeah?" Ian said, picking up a game before putting it back.

"Yeah so since you were in charge of organizing the contest on your side of things...you could get me into the venue early to set up, right?"

"I dunno," Ian said, his voice trailing off. Jack knew he just had to use Ian's dumbness to his advantage.

"No, see, I signed up as part of a contract, just like you're contracted through the bank and the radio station," Jack said, making something up on his feet. "So it stipulates that, with the insurance dividends associated with the production, all maintenance staff on a non-permanent basis must-"

"Okay, okay," Ian said, so confused by Jack's jargon that steam was practically coming out of his ears. "I'll get you in early."

"Great!" Jack smiled, glad to be contributing to the plan. He checked his phone and saw that he had to leave for work soon. "There's more details we need to talk out though...mind coming with me to work while we chat?"

"No, I'm not working today," Ian said, following Jack out of the mall and to the electronics store. Once there, they resumed their talk and Jack managed to get Ian to agree to let him in two hours prior to the official start of the bikini contest.

"You're such a big help," Jack grinned, glad he might have a chance to talk with Faye and get her coin away from her now.

"Right, right," Ian nodded, pretending to understand what he agreed to. He looked around the store and his eyes fell on a new controller for his console. "This is pretty neat. Can I get your employee discount on this?"

"Sure, I think that'd be fine," Jack nodded as the back curtain opened and Amber strode in.

"Giving out discounts to more people than just your girlfriend now, huh?" Amber smiled, turning to Ian. "Hiya, kid. One of Jack's friends?"

Ian just let out a blubbering gasp when he saw Amber and her round middle. He fell straight backwards and collapsed on the floor, the controller still gripped in his hands.

"He wasn't kidding about passing out," Jack murmured as he went over to his friend.

"Just put him in the back until he wakes up," Amber said as Jack helped Ian onto a sofa in the storage room. "Good to see those strong hands at work again, Jack."

"T-thanks," Jack gulped as Amber began tracing her hand against her belly. "S-so...how are you?"

Amber shrugged. "Talks with the father of these babies' wife didn't go well, though she's also twice as big as me."

"So...what are you going to do?" Jack asked.

"Only thing I can do: win that contest and provide a good life for these critters," Amber said, patting her round stomach and giving Jack a sultry smile. "Shouldn't be too hard. I look good, wouldn't you agree?" Jack let out a squeak of agreement and looked away as Amber laughed softly and rested against the counter. "Never thought we'd both be parents, Jack. You and your little friend, me and these things. Weird times."

"Weird times," Jack agreed with a nod as he felt the coin in his hand. Something told him the day was going to get a lot weirder.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jack and Ian meet again

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack smiled and handed a customer a receipt for her new set of headphones. The woman immediately plugged her headphones in to her music player and strapped them around her belly, playing music into her womb as she waddled out with a blissful grin on her face.

"You should have asked her if she wanted a hand," Amber laughed, elbowing Jack and making him jump a bit.

"R-right," Jack gulped as his manager leaned down, showing off her breasts swollen with hormones as one hand caressed her full-term, twin belly. "Maybe I should check on my friend in the back."

"I'd still give him some time," Amber said, turning and leaning against the counter so her belly blocked the path. "On top of my lamaze class, I took some first aid and other basic health training. The best thing we can do for your light-weight buddy is to let him rest."

Jack wasn't sure whether Amber's rudimentary medical expertise was something she already knew or something the coin's reality warp threw into the mix but he took Amber's word for it. She always came across as an exceptionally smart woman. Besides, the only way to get to Ian would involve pushing past her belly and he was worried how that would turn out. Amber may not be actively trying to start anything physical with him because of Jessica but he didn't put teasing past her.

"So, looking forward to tonight?" Amber smiled, one hand slowly rolling up her work shirt to reveal more and more of her glowing bare belly. "This must be like heaven for you, huh?"

Jack shuddered as he opened his mouth, getting ready to protest, but he also realized how rough things had been for him all the years he'd denied his pregnancy fetish. The little bit he got to talk about it with Jessica felt like a weight off his chest, so why not try that a little more? "I think so," Jack said, his face turning red as he grinned. "There are a lot of good looking pregnant women in town."

Amber laughed out loud and began to purr as she moved closer to her employee. "That's a franker response than I'd anticipated. Does your baby mama know you feel this way?"

"I think so," Jack said. "She knows she's the only one I truly love and we've both...ogled other pregnant women. It'll be fun." Of course, Jack knew it would be more stressful than he was letting on. Jessica, Mariah, Ms. Smart, and Ms. Apple were all with him trying to get that last coin away from Faye.

"Fun," Amber laughed, running her fingers down her round stomach. "It'll be fun when I see the expression on that cow's face when I win the contest." Jack gulped. He had thought about bringing Amber into the plan but he knew she had her mind set on beating Faye and winning the contest after all the drama in the family regarding the parentage of her fetuses. Telling her the truth would mean Jack telling Amber that he was the one who got her pregnant, not Faye's husband.

"I think you have a good chance to win," Jack said with a warm smile. "Honestly, good luck."

Amber laughed again and turned from her belly to Jack. "Is that flirting, strong hands? I knew you were bad, but that was just clumsy."

Jack began to blush and crossed his arms. "I mean...obviously I hope Jessica wins but-"

"Say no more," Amber sighed, rolling her eyes with a smile.

Jack felt his heart beating quickly. "A-Amber...you know...if Jessica wasn't in the picture, I'd want you to win."

Amber waddled over to Jack and gave him a hug, which caught him off-guard. "You are too sweet for your own good, Jack. In fact, sometimes it gets a little tiring." She let go and instead pressed her belly against him and laughed. "But for the record, I think I'm too mature for you."

As the two employees were letting their sexuality awkwardly spar with the others, someone else entered the store. But it wasn't a customer in the front, it was someone using the back door. Nicole Zavaleta picked the lock to the loading dock and snuck in, her footsteps making no sound despite her incredible gravid belly. Zavaleta could have easily ripped the lock off the door instead but she was trying to be less aggressive now that she was sharing her body with her eight future children.

As the colossal super-spy prowled around the back, she finally spied what she came for: the lost Spyder camera, kept by Amber for repairs. Zavaleta gave a quick check to see if there were any security measures in place, which there were not. She scoffed and removed the Spyder, shaking her head. "This is the easiest mission of them all. Maybe it's experience or maybe these people are too inept."

Zavaleta heard a low groan and tucked into a roll, hiding behind the nearest shelf. It wasn't hard for her to curl up since, with her belly, she was mostly a ball already. She cursed herself for speaking out loud, chalking it up to "pregnancy brain," and laid her eyes on the source of the moan: Ian laying on a couch in a small employee area. Her mind whirred as she tried to recall where she'd seen Ian before. He worked at Titan Bank and he'd been at the hospital during one of the pregnancy outbreaks. Zavaleta smiled, patting her belly with pride.

"My luck is as good as it's ever been," she chuckled, hurrying over to the couch and putting her knees on Ian's legs, looking directly at him. His eyes blinked open and he could only see a huge pregnant belly pinning him down. Ian nearly screamed but Zavaleta already had her hands against his ribs and applied pressure to take the air out of his lungs. "Take one long breath."

Ian's shocked face nodded and he wheezed, color returning to his face. "W-w-w-who are you?"

"Don't shout any more. And stay with me," Zavaleta ordered him. "What do you know about the coin?"

"The coin? What coin?" Ian stammered. "There's no coin!" Zavaleta handed Ian a promotional flyer for the bikini contest, with the antique coin listed as one of the prizes. "Oh, that coin."

Zavaleta sighed, quickly realizing that she was dealing with an idiot. "Yes, what do you know about it?"

"I dunno, I guess it's valuable or something," Ian said. "A-are you really this pregnant?"

"Yes, don't talk when I don't tell you to," Zavaleta replied. "Is there any way to enter this competition now?"

"No, it's closed," Ian said. "T-though I think you may have been too big for it anyway."

"How dare you," Zavaleta grunted, pressing her belly further down on Ian's chest. "My womb is swelled with my children and I could never be prouder of it. Now tell me: who is running the event?"

"T-the radio station, I guess," Ian panted. "Sandwich, Oven, sexy Lisa...and Jack, I guess."

"Jack?" Zavaleta said, relieving the weight of her pregnant middle. "What is his role?"

"Checking on women, something like that," Ian groaned. "He's going in early. Said it was important."

Just as I thought...he's important, Zavaleta thought to herself, stroking her belly. "You have been helpful to me. Thank you."

"N-no problem," Ian said, taking a deep breath as Zavaleta moved herself off of him. He was not as petrified by her pregnant body now as he thought he might be. But as Zavaleta stood up, he could see all of her and not just her belly. "H-hey...that's a cool hair style."

"Hair style?" Zavaleta asked, slipping the flyer back into her pocket.

"Yeah, how it's dyed grey. It's neat," Ian said.

"This isn't dyed. My hair is grey," Zavaleta replied. "I'm in my 60s." Ian let out a groan as he passed out again, unable to handle that bit of information. Zavaleta didn't pay it any attention as she smiled and stroked her middle. "Don't worry, my children. We're getting closer."

In response, the coin in Jack's pocket began to burn more and he felt his head tingling again. "You okay?" Amber asked.

"Y-yeah, I'm okay," Jack said, looking down to see the coin already in his hand.

"Good, because we need someone to clean the bathroom," Amber smiled, rubbing her stomach. "I'd do it but I've got this big heavy belly," she said with a pout.

"I...uh..." Jack said, the sight of her belly exciting the coin some more.

"Fine, we'll flip for it," Amber said, pointing to Jack's hand. "Heads you, tails me."

Do it

Jack didn't have a chance. He flipped the coin and it landed on heads as he looked at Amber. She grinned as her belly swelled out, pushing her shirt away so all of her creamy bare stomach was on display.

"Get moppin'," Amber chuckled, her hands wrapped around her belly. "And do it quick. These triplets kick me in the bladder so many times a day."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: We haven't seen Amber in a while

choices: Jessica gets a call! She rushes home to her newly very pregnant parents!
Oven's big fat pregnant day of setting up the contest.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Faye was ready to end this once and for all.

As she drove to her destination, she went through the plan in her head.

She KNEW that Jessica and Jack where at Jessica's place. She got the address for Mariah after spending the most incredible..

After Mariah was "interrogated" by Faye, Mariah more then willing to spill the beans.

She wasn't crazy, they WERE trying to take her babies away from her.. Well they wouldn't be a problem anymore after this.

The coin was burning a hole the pocket of her maternity jeans, the kicking in her belly becoming increasingly frequent as she got closer to her ultimate victory.

They won't be able to stop me once that Jessica is a beached whale of babies She grinned evilly, imaging the sight of Jessica swelling to a ridiculous size as Faye just stood there flipping.

And Jack loves pregnant bellies so much, let's see how he looks with a big one himself Faye thought again, cackling to herself.

She's leave them so massively pregnant they couldn't move, and then she would win.

Pulling up outside Jessica's parents house, Faye heaved herself out of the car, preparing to launch her surprise attack.

She would knock on the door, Jessica would answer and then..

Faye patted the pants pocket that held the coin.

Our time is nigh, finish this! The grotesque voice of Yaral echoing in her head. He commanded, she obeyed, in her own way.

Bracing one hand into her back, and the other on top of her belly, she made the climb to the front door.

She knocked once, twice, thrice, and then a fourth time, her patience dwindling with each knock.

The door opened and instead of Jessica, Faye was greeted by Jessica's mother, who looked like almost exactly like Jessica, except that she was in her very late 40's.

"Oh my, may I help you ma'am?" Jessica's mother Courtney said, pushing her hair aside from her face.

"Is Jessica home?" Faye asked, her plan coming to a sudden stop.

"Jessica.. no longer lives here. She decided to move in with the.. father of her children" Courtney said, trying to hide her anger, pain and disdain for Jessica's current "situation".

"Oh.." Faye said. Damn, she just missed her!

"How do you know my daughter?" Courtney asked.
"We met at a pregnancy class. I'm a friend of hers" Faye said, thinking up a very bad lie very quickly.
"Funny, Jessica hadn't been to any pregnancy classes lately. But then she also said she's suffering from some kind of rapid "pregnancy" disease" Courtney said, rolling her eyes when she talked.

"Did I say class? I meant section, we met in the pregnancy.. section of Books Books Books" Faye said, correcting her lie, and making it all the more obvious.

"I thought you said you met her in a class?" Courtney said, catching the lie.

"May I come in?" Faye asked, with a threatening smile.

"I think it's best if you leave. My husband and I don't want anything to do with pregnancy right now. This is a hard time for us." Courtney said starting to close the door.

Faye forced herself in, using her increased weight and belly size to force Jessica's mom Courtney aside, inviting her in.

"Oh, I'm sorry. It's just I left a very important book with Jessica, that I absolutely need back right away. She said last night I could come over and get it this morning. So if you could just show me to her room and I'll " Faye said, making modifications of the plans to get that book back.

"Jessica took most of her belongings with her when she moved out this morning. Now please get out of my house before I call" Courtney said.

"Oh it will only be a moment. I just need to get that book and I'll " Faye said, starting to look around for the book.

"Who are you? Courtney, who is this woman and why is she in our house?" Jessica's father Travis asked, coming out of his home office.

"Oh hi, I'm Jessica's good friend Faye. She didn't mention me? Well, no bother. She borrowed a book from me, and I'm just going to grab it and then head out. You don't have any idea how important that book - - "Faye was interrupted by Travis.

"I don't care. Jessica made some bad decisions and now she's paying the consequences, and so are you, if you lent Jessica something. She's irresponsible" Travis said, still bitter about Jessica's "predicament".

"Now, that's a little harsh do you think? It's not like she could help what happened to her" Faye said, whipping up another quick lie.

"What do you mean?" Travis asked with suspicious eyes.

"Her pregnancy. It's going around. Don't you watch the news? Sudden mysterious pregnancies? Affecting a lot of people, women, men, your daughter. Even my poor husband is "in the family way" as they say. You should see him, huge and pregnant. It would be tragic if it he didn't deserve it!" Faye said with a cackle, some truth showing through the lie.

"Ma'am, I'm a scientist, and I can assure you, pregnancy is not some "disease" that people can catch, espically men" Travis said, with a stern look on his face.
Like Courtney, Travis was in his very late 40's, or at least that what he tells people. He was not looking forward to his 50th birthday party next month.

Show them what happens to those who doubt you. The coin called to Faye.

A wicked smile came across her face.

"Well, I'll have a look around, don't worry about helping me. " Faye said reaching into her pocket.

"No, we'll help you with leaving " Travis said, approaching Faye.

"Hmh." Faye laughed to herself quietly. "Jessica's a good girl who's in over her head. But I'm sure it will all work out for her. But you really should have believed her about her pregnancy" Faye took the coin out of her pocket.

"Why's that?" Travis asked, stopping in front of the massive pregnant frame of Faye.

"It really can happen to anyone " Faye said, flipping the coin, high into the air, grabbing it, and opening her hand to reveal it.

Tails! No Reality Change! The voice declared

"Even you!" Faye said.

"What do youuuu" Travis said as his belly began to expand, as his pregnant expansion began.

"TRAVIS! OH MY GOD! WHAT'S HAPPENING!" Courtney screamed, running over to her rapidly pregnafying husband.

"Uh, uh, uh. The family that's waddles together, stays together!" Faye said, flipping the coin again, looking at Courtney, opening her hand to reveal it again.

Tails! No Reality Change! The voice boomed again!

Courtney let out a squeak as her belly began to expand, slowly growing outward into a twin-filled pregnant belly.

Courtney and Travis braced themselves as there pregnancy expansion slowed, finally stopping at a twin-pregnancy for Courtney, Jessica's mom, and a big round triplet pregnant belly for Travis, Jessica's Dad.

"Oh, my, don't we look adorable so fat and pregnant!?" Faye said with a wicked smile. "I'll look around, don't get up, just sit there and rest. I'm sure that was a trying experience." Faye said, rubbing each of the bellies with a smile.

"Nothing, or no one will stop me!" Faye said as she began her search of Jessica's house, her newly very pregnant parents confused by the Gravida consequences of Faye's visit.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: A visit with Gravida consequences.

choices: Faye prowls and meets other characters
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Oven grumbled as he walked around the sports bar and held onto his large cup of coffee. There were still dozens of rows of chairs that needed to be set up, lights had to be rigged, and something had to be done about the VIP seating. Originally, only a small amount of the floorspace in the large Dino's Bar and Grill was going to be allotted for the contest but as popularity and attention grew, thanks in part to the outbreak of the pregnancy disease or whatever it was around the city, the whole place was going to be packed.

"You shouldn't be drinking coffee," Lisa chuckled as she waddled up behind Oven, her full-term triplet belly bumping against her co-worker. "Caffeine'll get to the baby and make it all jumpy when it's born."

"Ha-ha," Oven said in a low monotone. "I guess you're the only expert on pregnancy since you actually know how you'll get yours out."

"I'm sure we could think of a way to get it out when it's time," Lisa laughed again, taking a pair of scissors from a nearby work bench. "But if a c-section doesn't work, I'm all out of ideas."

"Okay, okay, easy you two," Sandwich said with a laugh, standing between his two expectant on-air companions. "I'm sure you're both ready for your pregnancies to be over but let's get the place set up before you start cutting your bellies open."

"At least Oven can still pass for fat," Lisa snickered, rubbing one hand against her belly. Her shirt was smaller today and she let all of her pregnant roundness from her navel down be seen.

Oven let out a huff and went over to the workers currently setting up the lights. Sandwich kept laughing as he turned back to Lisa, hands on his hips. "You seem less worried about your pregnancy today."

"I'm about to be on stage in a bikini," Lisa said, rolling her eyes as her hands traced her huge round middle. "If I wasn't comfortable by now, I'd have taken my name off of the list."

"Maybe but it feels like something is different," Sandwich said, scratching his chin. "Like you're not just okay with the bump. It's something more."

Lisa smiled and looked down at her belly. "I've...enjoyed the idea of being a mother. I even picked out some names and I've got someone to raise them with."

Sandwich chuckled. "So the fear's gone away?"

"No, not by a long shot," Lisa laughed. "Especially now that I have some other kids on the way too."

"Other kids?"

"I'll explain some other time," Lisa sighed, looking back up at Sandwich. "It's a long story."

"Well, whatever happens, I'm sure you'll be a good mother," Sandwich smiled, his eyes meeting Lisa's.

Lisa looked at her co-worker, a gross-out rude shock jock, with surprise. "Thank you, Sandwich. That's...really nice of you."

"C'mon, we're off the air. Call me Luke," Sandwich smiled back before speaking again. "Do you...think I would be a good parent?"

"Oh," Lisa said, hesitating before responding. "Um, sure, I think you would. Are you thinking about starting a family?"

"You could say that," Sandwich chuckled.

"I didn't even know you were married. Or had a girlfriend for that matter," Lisa said.

"I don't," Sandwich said as Oven walked back over. "I'll explain later too."

"Lights are hooked up," Oven said, looking over a list on a clipboard. "So here's how we'll run things: each woman will come on stage individually, strut and introduce themselves, then line up in the back."

"You'll just keep them on stage?" Sandwich asked.

"Sure, it's no fun if they aren't being forced to show off their big bellies," Oven cackled. "That's the whole point of this: pregnant women are supposed to hide their stomachs and now they're going to be on full display. It's funny."

"So I'm supposed to be covered up?" Lisa purred, lifting her shirt a few more inches.

"Yes, you are," Oven snapped with a glare before turning to his clipboard. "Then when they've all come out, we'll do the talent portion one at a time. Luke, you and me'll be on the side stage introducing them since our planned MC went and got knocked up in the middle of our planning."

"Sorry for spontaneously growing a pregnant belly," Lisa scoffed.

"And then finally, the dance portion, also one at a time. Hopefully everyone will have sent their music in by the deadline or else...I dunno, we'll play some kind of club music for them to shake their pregnant guts to," Oven said.

"Oven, geez, reel it in with the preggo-hate," Sandwich laughed nervously. "You're a little too heated."

"I've got a reason to be heated!" Oven shouted back, touching one hand to his stomach. "Somehow, I've become a pregnant man and still we're having this big event for women to have fun 'showing off their curves.' Well I don't feel fun. I feel fat and I feel like a freak and at the end of all of this, I'm going to have a fucking kid to take care of that I don't want."

There was a painful silence between the three of them, and before Lisa could open her lips, Sandwich talked. "You really don't want the baby?"

"No, of course not," Oven said.

"Then...would it be okay if I adopted it?" Sandwich said. Oven and Lisa both looked at him in surprise. "I'd been thinking about adoption lately since I figured there'd be a need with the pregnancy disease and...as a friend, I was thinking you might be willing."

Oven gulped. "I mean...sure, absolutely. That'd be a big weight off my shoulders. But you want to raise a kid by yourself?"

Sandwich took a deep breath. "I won't be by myself. I've been talking about this for a while...with my boyfriend."

Oven and Lisa's eyes grew even more and this time Lisa spoke first. "You're gay?"

"Yep."

"But...you make all those sex jokes at work about women and me especially. You're always so lecherous and crude."

Sandwich shrugged. "They're funny."

Lisa didn't know what to say. All this time she thought she couldn't be open about her identity, let alone her relationship with Natalie, because she'd be considered an outcast at the station. And now it turns out the grossest guy there (well, 2nd grossest after Oven) was gay the whole time.

"I was actually thinking about officially coming out on the air next week," Sandwich said. "Is that okay?"

Oven and Lisa both nodded as their co-worker smiled and sighed. "E-excuse me for a minute," Lisa said. "I've got to go make a phone call."

---

"Like this?" Amanda said, pivoting her hip a little.

"Yeah, and turn forward a bit," Jack Sr. smiled. "Gotta show the goods to the audience."

Amanda gave a quiet laugh and turned with his directions, letting her belly stick out front more. "You're starting to like the belly, huh?"

"I like yours," Jack Sr. chuckled. "But don't worry. You don't have to be worried about me tracing other moms-to-be at the bikini contest."

"Good, because I know they'll be chasing after you," Amanda purred, running her hands down her roundness. "My big, strong, handsome silver fox, you."

"Easy now," her husband grinned. "You don't want us to take another break, do you? Practice is important."

Amanda waddled forward and sat her enlarged rear in her husband's lap. "I feel like a college girl again. All this energy should go to good use, don't you think? Besides, the contest's just for fun."

"It's been fun alright," Jack Sr. smiled, his hands moving to Amanda's bikini top and gently moving around the knot to loosen it. Just then, the doorbell rang a few times and they sighed.

"I'll get it," Amanda said, using Jack Sr.'s help to stand up. She waddled to a nearby chair and picked up a robe, grunting as she bent down. "I may have more energy, but your babies are still awfully heavy."

"Hey, that's your side of the family," Jack Sr. laughed. "I've met your brothers."

Amanda stuck out her tongue as she left their bedroom and waddled to the front door. When it opened, she saw a very pregnant man and woman on the verge of tears. "Are you...Jack Dale's mother?"

"Yes, I am," Amanda said slowly. "May I help you?"

"We're Jessica's parents," Travis said. "We tried to call her but she wasn't answering her cellphone."

"She's probably just practicing," Amanda said as Courtney held her closely, trying into her chest. "Oh...oh my."

"We were so awful to her!" Courtney sobbed. "Please, maybe your son knows where she is. We need to talk with her and apologize."

Amanda sighed and smiled, patting Courtney on the back. "Don't worry, I'll get in touch with him. In the meantime, why don't you both relax on the couch."

Travis sniffled, tears starting to stream down his face too. "Thank you, Mrs. Dale. And do you have anything to eat?"
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The contest gets set up

choices: Follow Faye around for a bit
What are other characters up to?
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack paced around the floor of the sports bar where the contest would be held that night. It seemed like there were plenty of hours left to plan and scheme but Jack still felt a fear tightening his chest that there wasn't enough time left. Time to practice, time to plan, time with Jessica and her pregnancy, especially now that it had gotten to quadruplet proportions. But at least he had a bit of a leg-up on Faye now that he could get into Dino's Bar and Grill early.

"May I help you?" Lisa Smith said as she waddled behind Jack. He tensed up when he heard her familiar voice and slowly turned around. He, like many other men in the city, had a thing for the buxom radio personality. Though now that she was gestating three full-term fetuses inside her belly, he may be one of the few who still felt that way. When Lisa saw Jack, her face softened and she smiled. "Oh, I met you yesterday. Out walking in the park with another woman."

"T-that's right," Jack said with a shaky smile back.

"She looked even bigger than me," Lisa said with a laugh, resting one hand on her round middle and giving it a little stroke up and down. "She said she was your neighbor, right?"

"Yep," Jack choked out as he nodded.

"Thank you for volunteering to help out with the contest," Lisa said, putting one hand on his shoulder. "We didn't get anyone to agree to help, which I guess is to be expected. It's fun to laugh at big, round women waddling around on stage but less fun to help us fatties out back stage."

"N-no, it's my pleasure," Jack said. "A-and you great, Ms. Smith."

Lisa raised one eyebrow and a sly smile spread across her lips. She recognized his gaze as the same one Natalie had when she looked at Lisa's belly. "I see…well like I said, thank you. Hope you have fun tonight."

As Lisa turned around and waddled back to those working on setting up the show, Jack heard another voice whisper behind him. "Hiya." Jack turned to see Tara standing behind him, a knowing smile on her sandy lips as her hands clutched her own belly, just as big as Lisa's, if not larger since Tara was shorter. "What are you doing here?"

"I could ask you the same thing, I guess," Jack said, crossing his arms and trying to look casual.

"Oh?" Tara laughed, mirroring Jack's body language. "Titan Bank is helping to put this thing on and I thought I should take a look for myself since I work there too. I'll be on stage and…" she leaned in to whisper. "The guy from the bank in charge of this contest is a pretty big idiot."

"Ian? He's a friend of mine," Jack said. There was an awkward pause as Tara's face began to lose color. "And yeah, he's an idiot."

Tara let out a relieved gasp and a laugh as she put her hands back against her belly. "Oof, that's tight."

"Are you okay?" Jack said quickly.

"Yeah yeah, it's all good," Tara sighed. "It's just false contractions since I'm getting near the end. Mind if we sit down?" Jack followed Tara to one of the chairs set up in the sports bar as she slowly lowered herself down. "There we go. Hope I have enough energy to perform tonight."

"I-I hope so too," Jack gulped. Tara flashed him a grinning glance and he tried to reorganize his words. "It'd suck if you couldn't get a chance to go up and all, I mean."

"Mmm," Tara said, still smiling. "So, I asked first. Why are you here now?"

"I'm helping out backstage during the show," Jack said. "Helping out with all of you performers, actually, so if you want anything, let me know. I'll even bring you a few vanilla cokes, maybe."

Tara laughed out loud, her belly shaking with each guffaw. "Maybe they're bad luck for me since I ended up with two extra babies the last time I tried to drink one."

Three, actually Jack thought, not wanting to tell Tara the truth about her pregnancy and the coin. Of course, Zavaleta had already clued Tara into plenty but she didn't want to show Jack that she knew.

"So how did you get the unfortunate job of entertaining dozens of hormonal pregnant scantily-clad women?" Tara said, hands on her belly as she eyed Jack. Now he was really blushing.

"M-my girlfriend signed me up as a joke," Jack said. "But, you know, I'm happy to help."

Tara let out another little laugh and sighed. "Her name's…Jessica, right? I think I met her at the shower at the bank." Jack nodded as Tara leaned in closer to him. "To be honest…I've had a thing for you for a few days now."

"Me?" Jack said.

Tara nodded. "Jessica's a very lucky girl. I hope you treat her well."

"I will," Jack said. "I mean, I do. I…we like each other a lot." Tara laughed and gave Jack a light kiss on the cheek.

"Good luck to both of you," Tara said, slowly heaving herself up. "Maybe I'll see you and your babies around the park someday soon."

"Y-yeah," Jack said as he watched Tara waddle away. He also had a crush on Tara but he didn't want to tell her that. The cliché would have been to say "if it weren't for Jessica, you and I would be together" but he didn't even know if that was true. There was Amber and…maybe even Faye. Jack shuddered as he thought about what a bizarre week it had been.

Then he felt his phone buzz and he picked it up. "Jack?" Amanda said on the other end.

"Hi Mom," Jack replied. "What's up?"

"Jessica's parents are at the house and they really need to get in touch with her," Amanda said, making her voice quieter.

Jack froze. "M-Mom, I don't know if that's such a good idea. They're both kind of-"

"Jack, trust me," Amanda said. "They need to talk."

Jack sighed. "Okay, I'll tell you where she's practicing and they can go see her."

-----

Jessica stood in her individual practice room, stroking her chin. She'd been practicing her dance so much, it was only now occurring to her that she never developed her talent portion of the competition. Could her dancing could as a talent? That seemed like cheating. What was she good at?

"I know one thing Jack would say I'm very good at," Jessica chuckled. "But I don't think I could do that on stage…"

Ms. Smart walked into the room in her bikini and glared at Jessica. "You've got visitors."

"At a secret hideout?" Jessica asked. "How?"

"That's what I'd like to know," Ms. Smart huffed. "But they say it's an emergency."

Jessica sighed and waddled out, still getting used to her quadruplet size, and made it to the main doors of the warehouse hideout. As she opened it, her face went pale as she saw her parents' faces. Then she saw their bellies and just got confused.

"H-hi dear," Courtney, Jessica's mother, said, her lips trembling.

"Mom…Dad?" Jessica said, turning to Travis too. "What's…you both…"

"We caught that pregnancy disease, I guess," Travis said. "We're…we're so sorry for doubting you."

"Can you ever forgive us?" Courtney said, now starting to cry. "We were just concerned about our daughter. To us, you're still our little girl."

"Of course I forgive you," Jessica said, now starting to cry as well as she went into her parents' arms. It was hard for the three of them to hug with their massive pregnancies but they were able to communicate their feelings effectively.

"It was so strange," Courtney managed to get out. "One second we were at home with this pregnant woman talking to us, then it was like there was a water balloon in my stomach."

"A-a woman?" Jessica said with a sniffle. "Was she…big like me?"

"Yes, she was extremely pregnant and she was talking very strangely," Travis says. "I guess this disease is contagious after all."

Jessica was fuming with anger. Faye…you're really going to get it now she thought. "Well…I'm so happy we got to talk like this but I need to practice," Jessica said, looking at her parents. "I want to talk soon though about my new little siblings."

"Yes, we'll make sure of it," Courtney smiled, giving her daughter a pat on the belly. "Good luck tonight. We'll be there."

Jessica waved as Courtney and Travis went over to Jack Sr.'s car where he was waiting. "That was quick," he said.

"It was easy to say," Courtney smiled. "Thank you for driving us."

"No problem," Jack Sr. said, spying Travis' belly in his rear-view mirror. "And…you said this disease is contagious?"

"It might be," Travis nodded.

Guess I need to wash the car's interior soon Jack Sr. thought as he drove away quickly.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Jessica and her parents reconcile

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Faye softly cackled to herself as she waddled into the thick of the city's downtown. One hand was devoted to stroking and rubbing her large, exposed pregnant middle. Over the past months, she'd had her fun shopping for maternity clothes and other baby supplies for her coming children but with a nine-month quadruplet belly, all Faye wanted to do was show it off. Of course, the "shopping" over the past months was all in her head, thanks to the coin's "reality warping" abilities. In reality, Faye had only had time to buy things for her quads for a few days and she'd barely worn the few maternity clothes she bought.

After waiting nearly forty years for the chance to carry her young inside her womb, Faye was not going to stop herself from having as much fun with her round tummy as she could. She smiled as she saw surprised eyes fall on her swollen stomach, though it wasn't quite the shock she was expecting. Then again, with the pregnancy disease mixed with the baby boom that coincidentally occurred months prior to the disease hitting the town. If anything, Faye was in line with the fashion trends of the city in letting her belly stick out without her shirt covering her glowing ball of flesh up. The main difference between Faye and many of the women here (the pregnant men in the area were still very much interested in keeping their bulging stomachs covered and concealed) was the sheer size of Faye's baby bump. The number of triplet pregnancies here was definitely thousands of percentage points more likely than in the rest of the world but no one outside of Jack's circle of contacts had quadruplets or more.

Two women with leather jackets, various ear-and-face piercings, and hair that seemed like it couldn't be dyed even blacker, waddled past Faye, their bellies just as exposed as hers. Their pregnant curves were covered in writing and drawings, catching Faye's attention almost as much as their appearance. As Faye stared at them, she could tell they were staring at her.

"The fuck do you want?" one of the women said, brushing her bangs out of her eyes.

"I was just admiring your wonderful bellies," Faye cooed, turning toward the two of them. "Triplets?"

The other woman chuckled and pressed her hands into her back, pushing her belly out and accentuating its size. Written on the front of her belly in big black gothic letters was "It Wants Out" and below that, in similar print, was "Kicking and Screaming." "Yeah, each of us in the band has triplets. Probably because we got knocked up the same night and Taurus was rising."

"Lilith, enough with that astro-garbage," the other woman said, rolling her eyes. "You left that all behind when we saved you from playing in that bullshit hippie wiccan folk band." On her belly, this woman had "Bad Belly Bitch" written all across the front. Both women also had little drawings of monsters, skulls, and the like drawn across the wide real estate of their pregnant stomachs.

"I love these tattoos," Faye purred, touching her hand against Lilith's belly. Lilith and her friend looked startled but didn't do anything to stop her. "I've seen a few tummies with tattoos on them but none so specific to pregnancy. So creative."

"Well, they aren't really tattoos," Lilith said, her cheeks starting to blush, even under all the make-up she was wearing to look paler. "They're just drawn on. We'd look kind of strange if we had these when our pregnancy ends."

"Though knowing her, Tiamat will probably get another litter inside her as soon as this one's over," the other woman laughed.

Faye's smile grew as she turned around, touching her belly to the other woman's. "I'm sorry, I didn't get your name."

"Jezebel," the woman said with a smirk as she crossed her arms.

"I'm Faye," Faye giggled, still grinning like a snake about to strike. "Jezebel...that's a very interesting name."

"They're stage names," Lilith said. "We're in a band. Maybe you've heard of us: Mommy Kills Best?"

"Oh yes, you're playing at the bikini contest," Faye said, her eyes lighting up. "I'll have a front-row seat, I suppose. I'm competing."

"With a belly like that, I'd say so," Jezebel laughed, giving Faye's swollen stomach a light spank. She was a little taken aback by how firm and smooth Faye's belly skin was to the touch. "Anyway, yeah, I'm the singer and Lilith here is the bassist."

"Now I haven't heard any of your music myself, but I can take a guess to what it's like," Faye purred. "Metal?"

"Not just any metal," Jezebel said, her voice starting to growl as she bared her teeth. "The darkest, most gothic metal in the world. There's only three words you can use to describe us: evil, chaotic, and pregnant."

"Evil, chaos, and pregnancy," Faye laughed, tapping her hand against her belly. "I know a lot about that." Jezebel looked at her a little confused as Faye could hear the coin's rotten voice chuckle in her ear.

"Yeah, for a while we'd been working as a regular metal band without any spark and things weren't going that well," Lilith said, walking around Faye's planet-like bump to stand beside her lead singer. "But then it hit us: what's more metal than being pregnant? Your body swelling and changing as something inside you grows and sucks up your energy, all because you had sex. It's so brutal."

"That's not how I like to think about it," Faye said, stroking the sides of her belly carefully. "I love being pregnant. I think it's wonderful."

"So do we," Jezebel grinned, "but maybe for different reasons."

"In any case, it was very nice meeting both of you," Faye smiled, her whole face lighting up. "I look forward to seeing you perform tonight."

"And I look forward to seeing you in a bikini," Lilith said before Jezebel could elbow her in the side.

"But before I go, you both have to tell me where you got that writing on your bellies done. I just love it," Faye cooed.

"Just a block away. Eve's Inks is doing it," Jezebel said with a sneer. "Can't miss it."

"Thank you," Faye nodded, giving their bellies one last pat before waddling away.

"Weird lady," Jezebel murmured to Lilith as the quadruplet-carrying woman went down the street. "It takes a lot for someone to creep me out."

"I've told you, pregnancy has its own energy and power to it. Back in the coven, there was one woman who got pregnant without sex and she could cast spells on us," Lilith whispered back.

Jezebel groaned and kept waddling, running her hands all over her belly while being careful not to smear her designs on her stomach. "You fell for a lot of stupid stuff back then...but there was definitely something strange going on with that Faye."

After some time, Faye stepped out of Eve's Inks with a rosy smile and "Big Mama To Be" emblazoned on her belly in big red letters. She made a bee-line for the most crowded part of the downtown as she held the coin in her hand.

"Tonight's a big night, isn't it buddy?" Faye said.

We'll be at risk. I can feel it. Be on guard.

"Oh, I know about all that," Faye pouted. "But Jack and his friends won't stop me from having these babies." She giggled. "You know, all my life I've wanted children but even as I'm at my biggest and ripest, I hope they stay in there just one more night."

That I can promise the coin said with a nasty laugh.

Faye smiled and looked around at the people in the heart of the city. "I love being pregnant. Absolutely love it. Love feeling my young kick inside me, love seeing my tummy grow and change, love how my skin is glowing, love how people want to feel and gaze on my belly." She ran her fingers over the coin. "It'd be a shame not to share it with everyone else."

She flipped the coin and watched with joy as hundreds more people either rushed to a garbage can as they were overcome with nausea or saw their stomachs expand before them.

In all my years and worlds, I've never met someone as eager as you

"Maybe we can keep collaborating in the future," Faye purred, gripping the coin tightly in her hand. The coin's voice was silent but she could still feel its influence pumping through her. "Sleep on it."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Follow Faye around for a bit

choices: The women march out in all their pregnant glory
Before they go out, the coin talks to Jack
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Even with people just quietly whispering and chatting with each other, Dino's Bar and Grill was pounding with noise as the time of the contest approached closer and closer. The whole sports bar was packed from wall to wall, and thanks to the second floor being opened up for "VIPs," ceiling to ceiling. On the side, Luke and Ryan, or "Sandwich and Oven" as they were known to listeners, peered from behind the curtain and banner to look at the gathered crowd.

"That's...that's a lot of people," Oven said. "I know we set up for it and planned it out but really seeing them is shocking."

"I didn't think we'd get this many people when the station owner first gave us the order to set up the contest. I mean, a pregnant bikini contest? Who'd want to go to that?" Sandwich said, shaking his head. "We got lucky that pregnancy outbreak hit us when it did or else this would have probably been a failure."

"Yeah, lucky us," Oven grumbled, feeling his own growing belly continuing to play with his stomach's appetite and constitution. "I could have been eaten out by the boss instead of being a freak of medical science."

"One of many," Lisa Smith said, waddling up behind her two co-hosts and patting them on the back. "So don't feel so bad. At least you're giving Sandwich and his partner a baby to raise. And if it makes you feel better, you're glowing."

Oven scoffed before laughing and turning to his fellow radio DJs. "Through all this craziness, I guess there's no one I would have rather done it with than the two of you. 101.9 The Edge really held it together, didn't we?"

"We sure did," Sandwich nodded, walking out onto the stage. Before Lisa went her separate way, Oven grabbed her wrist.

"Before we start," he said, gulping nervously. "I know I've asked you this sort of thing before-"

"Oven," Lisa said in a low voice.

"But, seeing how we're both pregnant, there's no one who could understand your body and its needs better than me. So, what do you say?"

Lisa sighed and shook her head with a smile. "Sorry Ryan, but I'm already sleeping with someone who's pregnant." She kissed him on the cheek as Oven mulled on what she meant by that before walking to the back section with the rest of the women.

"Oven, where are you?" Sandwich said, his voice magnified by the microphone. Oven hurried out to the cheers of the crowd. "There we go. Now we can both welcome you to the first ever Miss Stork Pregnant Bikini Contest, with 101.9 THE EDGE!"

"T-that's right," Oven said, clearing his throat and getting back into his on-air persona. "We've got a lot of moms-to-be ready to show off what they've got. Well, what they've got for the next month at least. Though some of these women look like they might go into labor tonight if you surprise them with a camera flash."

The audience laughed loudly. "Knock on wood, Oven. Let's not jinx things," Sandwich said with a big grin. "Now, of course, we couldn't have this great event without our sponsors, so we want to give a shout-out to all of them right now, first of all, Titan Bank for all their-"

---

Backstage, as Sandwich and Oven were rattling off the various sponsors, Jack was pacing around with his eyes to the floor. When he felt a hand on his shoulder, he nearly jumped out of his skin. "A little nervous, Strong Hands?" Amber laughed.

"A-a little," Jack said, turning to see his red-headed beauty of a boss smiling at him, her eyes looking right through him.

"Where's your girlfriend?" Amber said, putting her hands on top of her belly. Like most of the other women, Amber was currently in a robe to stop from showing off her bikini body just yet. She was plenty big, with full-term twins, but unlike some of the larger women here, her robe could still conceal all of her belly.

"In the bathroom," Jack said, watching her hand carefully. "You, um, look nice."

Amber gave a breathy laugh and spread her robe some to show off her creamy belly skin. "You're sweet, Jack. Really." She leaned in close to him, her lips inches from his ear. "But I'm going to wipe the floor with your girlfriend."

"G-good luck," Jack said, starting to tremble.

Amber grunted a little when she leaned back up, pressing her hands into the small of her back. "Oof, that's hard to do this far along. When this thing really starts up, I'm going to need plenty of massages from you. And I won't be the only one." Jack felt his face starting to turn hotter. "You haven't seen your...neighbor, have you?"

"Faye? No," Jack said, looking around. As he looked, a different quadruplet belly blocked his view. "Hey Jess."

"Hi babe," Jessica said, giving him a light prod with her belly before turning it to Amber. While most of her body was covered by her robe, her huge pregnant middle was totally exposed and pressed against Amber's. "And hi Amber. Your hair looks great tonight."

"Had it done just for the show," Amber purred, eyes intently meeting Jessica's. "Well, good luck to both of you. I should go size up the competition."

Jack let out a long sigh as Amber waddled away and Jessica tussled his hair. "Relax, dude. These pregnant women aren't going to get all hormonal and tear you apart or whatever you're afraid of."

Jack shrugged. "I dunno, it's just...we already broke up because I was too close with Faye and now I have to pamper and take care of all these pregnant women. In bikinis. At a beauty contest."

Jessica laughed and hugged Jack against her belly. "You are such a goofball. I signed you up for this contest, remember? I think it'll be funny to see you interacting with all these hot preggos...well, maybe not Faye but it's all totally fine, Jack."

"Really?" Jack said, looking up at Jessica but only seeing belly.

"Really. Now get up and try interacting with them. They'll think you're creepy if you just mope back here," Jessica said, nudging him again.

On the other side of the room, Faye and Mariah had their lips locked tightly. Faye was calm and steady with her kisses while Mariah was struggling and moving around far too much. Finally, Faye broke the kiss and put her fingers on Mariah's. "Okay, okay, easy now."

"Sorry," Mariah panted, rubbing her belly quickly up and down. "I just think you're such an amazing woman."

"Thanks," Faye said, running her hand down the side of Mariah's face. "Now, what do you know about your friends' talents for the show tonight? Or their bikinis? How revealing are they?"

"Their bikinis? You mean you'd change yours?" Mariah asked.

Faye smiled and opened her robe up some to reveal her naked breasts. "I have a few I'm thinking about using."

Mariah turned bright red and felt her knees get weak. "J-Jessica's is yellow, Ms. Apple's is small and red, and Ms. Smart has a black one. I don't know about their talents, exactly."

Faye sighed and gave Mariah a small pat on the belly. "That's okay. Thank you for all your help, dear." As Mariah turned away, Faye reached around her and fondled her breasts. "One last question: they don't have the book with them, do they?"

Mariah was panting heavily now, trying not to squeal out loud. "J-Jack has it with him," she moaned.

Faye kissed the back of Mariah's head and let go. "Thank you." As Mariah hurried away as best her big, triplet belly would allow, Faye looked at the coin in her palm. "Perfect. All that's left is to win the contest. Getting the coin and the book from Jack Dale Jr. will be the easy part."

There is something else at work

"Something else? What are you talking about?" Faye frowned.

You do not hold all the secrets

Faye cursed and hid her coin. Trisha, Amber's lamaze coach, waddled by and stared at Faye's frenzied scowl. "What are you looking at?" Faye growled, making Trisha hurry away.

---

"And of course, big thanks to Dino's Bar and Grill for hosting this event," Oven said, as the room filled with applause once again. "Dino's is open and selling snacks to anyone who wants them, but unfortunately, this is a dry event so no alcohol." The room groaned and laughed.

"Hey, you can get plenty tipsy off of soda," Sandwich chimed in with a smile. "But I'd still recommend only people who aren't gestating a fetus inside them drink a lot of that."

As Sandwich and Oven went on with some more shtick, up in the VIP section, Nicole Zavaleta hid, peering down on the stage.

"Two idiots are the only real muscle guarding this event," she said to herself in her native language. "This mission still feels deceptively easy. But it's my last and best shot at finally getting the coin – all of the coins – for myself."

"And now," Sandwich and Oven said in unison, "give a big round of applause for your contests to see who will be Miss Stork's Pregnant Bikini Champion!"
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Finally, let's start the contest!

choices: Some of the women need help from Jack
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack had to steady himself when he saw the line of beautiful, bikini-clad pregnant women lining up to make their way onto the stage. Since he was expected to stay backstage to take care of anything the expectant contestants might need, there was a television set up with a feed running to cameras recording the show. From the back, Jack could see all of the women parading out but he felt a urge to see a little more for himself. Now was the only time when all of the women would be participating together so no one needed him in the back. He hurried to the side of the stage, obscured by the darkness back there, and prepared to drink it all in. No one would be scrutinizing him for his gawking back here and now he had a perfect waypoint to see all the women as they attempted to look their best.

Perfect? Hardly a voice cackled in his head. Jack hesitated, pulling out the coin as pregnant women of no consequence to this story started to walk out. Over the past nine days, he had heard the voice many times, even when it said more things than just "Flip Me." So he could tell when the voice was clearly something different. Before it had been a growling, nasty way of speaking, devoid of any human characteristic aside from the words it was forming. Now, Jack could hear the words very clearly and the voice was much softer, almost as if it belonged to a woman.

"What do you want?" Jack hissed at the coin in his palm, hoping no one would see or hear him seemingly talking to himself. People who do that usually aren't trusted to see to the emotional and comfort needs of dozens of gorgeous pregnant women.

You want to destroy me, don't you Jack? the coin said with a fluttering laugh. It was clearly a feminine voice now. Yes, I've managed to slip into your mind and I'm coming through much more strongly now. You and your girlfriend have a scattered plan to eliminate this vessel. One that you don't even know will work.

"You wouldn't be talking to me if it wouldn't work," Jack said with a panicked laugh of his own.

There's a lot of room for error, Jack Dale Jr., but let me just leave you with a thought: what if I could work to your advantage? Jack stayed silent, feeling the coin's essence creep through his brain. I can give you much more than what you've managed with this little coin. Power over pregnant women. Sounds appealing, doesn't it?

"What do you mean, 'power over pregnant women?'" Jack said, his voice getting a little louder.

The coin's new voice let out another triumphantly evil laugh that echoed in his head and said nothing else. Jack grumbled and stuck it back in his pocket, trying to focus back on the stage and ignore the remnants of the laughter.

"Good luck to you, Charlotte, and your mother. That'll be a tight competition!" Oven said in his booming announcer voice. "Up next, no, don't reach for the fire alarm, it's just fiery red-head Amber!"

Amber strut on stage, waving with one hand while her other hand caressed her twin-carrying belly. Jack recognized the same hungry, sexy look in her eyes that she so often teased him with. That'll definitely win over a few voters, even if they don't like pregnant women.

"And now," Sandwich said, trading off from Oven. "She's a yoga instructor so hopefully we'll see if she's just as flexible with triplets on the way, give a big hand for Trisha!" Out walked the yoga instructor from when Jack took Amber for her class. She was one of the few naturally pregnant women in town but thanks to him, she got a little more than she planned with his coin. As she walked across the stage, she kicked one leg straight up and off to the side of her belly, making the audience gasp and hoot in response.

"Following her is another woman with triplets on the way and, according to her friends, one of the smartest people in the entire city, give it up for Mariah!" Mariah waddled out on stage, waving shyly as she made her way. She had clearly not changed much and her lack of self-confidence may be hurting her walk. Still, with her striking good looks, huge belly, and her strong blush from her last "bump-in" with Faye, she won over plenty of hearts and made up for a lack of stage presence.

"Next, we have...um...all it says on my card is 'Ms. Apple.' Sandwich, who wrote these?" Oven said, whispering the last part.

"Yeah, yeah, you got it right," Ms. Apple sneered as she hurried out on stage. She welcomed the audience with open arms and got lots of cheers for her red bikini top, which seemed to have been made as part of a contest to see what designer could make a legal top with the least amount of fabric. And given Ms. Apple's "upper-body," that was quite a feat. "What's up everyone? You like me? Vote for me!"

"You're not allowed to do that," Oven grumbled as she moved into line with everyone else. "I mean...Hey! Let's keep the energy going for our next lady–oh god damn it another weirdo–'Ms. Smart!'" Out paraded Ms. Smart in her sleek black bikini. Rather than try and shock the audience with sexuality like Ms. Apple, she moved gracefully and tried to give everyone her charms and let her good looks work for her.

"Now, ooh, you all know her but let's see if she can win your vote, Ms. Mia Vasquez!" The applause picked up even louder than when Ms. Apple ran out as Mia waddled on stage. Her smooth, shining brown skin was helped by the spotlights as she stroked her enormous triplet-belly with a warm smile. Ms. Apple grit her teeth nervously in line but stopped after Ms. Smart gave her a quick elbow.

"But coming to the stage next, another beautiful young woman who may be able to challenge any of our competitors, please give a warm round of applause for Jessica!" There was another big gasp as Jessica's belly started to appear on stage before the rest of her body. Instead of shying away from her size, Jessica moved with purpose and caressed her enormous bump with pride, smiling and waving to the crowd. Jack cheered too and saw her flash him a quick wink when she heard him.

"She's very pretty," Natalie whispered. Jack turned and saw that she was standing beside him, huffing and rubbing the sides of her colossal belly. She must have just hurried over to get a better look herself. "Though no match for my Lisa."

"We'll see," Jack chuckled. "Though...Ms. Smith looks amazing, I have to admit. She'll be a tough one." He paused. "You're, um, very lucky to have her."

Natalie gave a little fawning aww and put her hand on his arm. "That's nice of you to say. And your girlfriend's a big obstacle too. In fact, I wouldn't mind if Lisa had her belly. I think I'd like her a little bigger." She looked down at her belly and laughed. "But this is a little too big."

"You look great too," Jack said as Jessica got in line. "If you were on stage, you'd be the one to beat."

"If I was on stage in a bikini, people would run screaming," Natalie chuckled.

"Up next, she works with one of our sponsors and has promised us a great dance later on, so please give it up for Tara!" Out walked Amanda's co-worker Tara, with her raven-black hair newly styled, just like Amber. As she walked, she made sure to give the audience a few hip wiggles, possibly as a preview for what was to come. Jack gulped and wondered how things would be if he ended up with her instead. Or Amber. Or even Faye.

"Following her, oh, another woman to look out for, please give a big hand for Faye!" Speak of the devil Jack thought with a shudder as Faye crept out on stage. Her bikini was just as revealing as Ms. Apple's and she'd clearly applied a glob of skin cream just before walking out and was currently rubbing it into her round belly skin. There was a fierceness in her eyes like he'd never seen before and he could swear she looked directly at him as she turned her head to get in line.

"And now...oh wow, our third competitor carrying quadruplets. This'll be quite the contest, ladies and gentlemen, but for now, please welcome Amanda!" Jack's mom hurried out, waving and smiling with glee. It had happened slowly over the past week or so but now Jack could really tell how pregnancy had changed her. Not only was her belly, well, enormous, but she looked several decades younger. Amanda could be confused for his sister now instead of his mom. Hopefully, if she won, she'd agree to give him the coin. Or give Jessica the money.

"Finally, coming to the stage: She was going to host but something changed in her life and soon, you'll see what that is. Please, give a warm 101.9 The Edge welcome to Ms. Lisa Smith!"

The place erupted with cheers as Lisa walked out, her voluptuous body well displayed in her tight little bikini. Her triplet belly stuck out proudly, with her skin glowing under the lights. She waved and paraded around longer than the other competitors before stepping back in line, getting death stares from Ms. Apple and Faye.

"You have to admit, that was a little unfair," Jack whispered to Natalie.

"What can I say?" Natalie cooed. "She's a star."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Before they go out, the coin talks to Jack

choices: Faye starts to hatch her own plans
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Give a big hand for all these moms-to-be, though some of them have already been through the process of waddling around with a belly before," Sandwich said loudly, gesturing for the audience as they began to applaud.

"Though probably not like this," Oven chimed in with an aggressively phony laugh. "Although maybe they have! We have a lot of good-looking women on stage so they may have flaunted their pregnant bodies in a bikini in the past. Who knows?!" Jack gulped at the thought of his mother competing like this when she was pregnant with him. The idea didn't bother him but it certainly made him feel a little funny. "Okay, our ladies are going to head backstage while we get ready for the second leg of our competition: the dance contest!"

Another round of applause roared out of the crowd as all the pregnant women in bikinis made their way to the back. Jack steeled his nerves as he saw the flood of enormous bellies headed toward him, trying to single Jessica's out of the lovely fray. Much to both their amusements, he could pick Jessica's quadruplet midsection out of the stampede and he walked with her to the side of the room.

"You looked great out there!" Jack said excitedly. Jessica laughed softly in response. "Seriously, you were so poised and your skin looked amazing in the light and, wow, this bikini is just-"

"I get it," Jessica said with a chuckle, placing one finger over Jack's lips. Jack looked down to see both hands were on Jessica's belly, rubbing it gently. "Hey, it's okay. You get to feel this big tummy whenever you like, pal."

Jack laughed nervously again as he leaned in for a kiss with Jessica. As soon as their lips met, he heard a small noise behind him. "O-oh!" Jack turned around to see Mia Vasquez standing there, a hesitant smile on her face. "Sorry."

"No, it's fine," Jack said. "You're, um, a really great journalist. I love seeing you on the news." Jessica gave him a sharp kick to the ankle. "I-I mean I love seeing your reports on the news."

"Thank you," Mia said with a playful curtsy. "But now I just need a little help from you."

"H-help from me?" Jack said, raising an eyebrow as he felt his cheeks turn red.

"Yes, you're the volunteer here to give us a hand backstage, correct?" Mia said. "Unless I got my information mixed up."

"No, that's me," Jack said, flashing a mildly terrified look at Jessica, who just smirked back at him. "What can I do for you?"

Mia turned around and pointed to her bikini straps. "I did my bikini wrong and I'm worried it's too loose."

"T-too l-loose," Jack said, clearing his throat. "Um, I, wouldn't you, um-"

"My dance is very...frenetic, let's say," Mia giggled, wiggling her hips seductively just as her plump ass was in Jack and Jessica's faces. After that move, even Jessica was starting to look shocked. "And I wouldn't want my outfit to fall apart while I'm out there."

"No, we wouldn't want that," Jack gulped.

"So could you just re-tighten it for me?" Mia asked with a purr. Jack made a confusing string of syllables come out of his mouth that meant "yes" and touched his hands to Mia's back. Her muscles were tight and her skin was sort and warm. He worked as quickly as he could to try and get her top tightened, occasionally feeling her arm brush against his fingers.

"T-there, that should do it," Jack blurted out.

"Not quite. It tightens in the front too," Mia said, turning around and striking Jack with her belly. "Oops! Sorry!"

"He's fine, trust me," Jessica chuckled. Jack looked up to see Mia's ample chest. She was busty before Jack's coin got her pregnant and now she was one of the curviest women competing tonight. Nestled between her breasts was a small knot for the bikini. "It ties in the front too. I need a lot of support." Jack was about to agree with her but miraculously, what remained of his mental filter caught that line. He got close to her belly, hoping his erection wouldn't raise any alarms, as he began to undo the knot. Her top loosened more and her breasts began to be freed before Mia caught them. "There we go, all secure. You can keep going."

Jack gulped again as he tried to work, focusing every neuron he could on the task at hand. But Jessica wouldn't make it that easy for him. "So Mia, are the babies' father in the audience tonight?"

Mia sighed and looked past Jack at Jessica. "Between us girls...the father's not in the picture. I tried to keep it a secret because I didn't want it to wreck my career as a prominent reporter in the area but it's just me and these little guys...or little gals, not sure."

"Surely you could try dating," Jessica said. "I mean, you're a good looking woman with a great job. There must be plenty of guys interested in you."

"Yeah right," Mia scoffed, running her hands slowly down the front of her belly. "What guy would be interested in all this?" Jack let out a small moan as she caressed her roundness and shoved his erection forward a bit. "Oops, sorry to hit you," Mia said.

"Y-you're fine," Jack whimpered as he stepped back. "Done."

"Great, thank you so much!" Mia said, bouncing a bit to make sure her bikini was properly tightened, which didn't help Jack's mindset. "And I guess I shouldn't say things like that about me. We're here to celebrate pregnant women's beauty and, damn it, I do think I look good!"

"You do!" Jessica said with a laugh.

Mia leaned in close to her. "And again, between you and me, if I met a guy who felt the same way, I'd give him a quick fling that he'd never forget. After 40 weeks of no action, my energy's really been building up."

Jessica laughed and gave Mia a pat on the shoulder as she walked away. Meanwhile, Jack was facing away, letting out another groan. "I'm going insane," he murmured to Jessica.

"Hey, you'll be fine. Or at least, you better be," Jessica murmured back.

"Why?" Jack said, turning to her.

"Because you've got more company coming," Jessica said, smiling widely as more pregnant women waddled over. "Hi!"
