1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Faye cackled to herself, her fingers gently brushing against the farther part of her enormous pregnant belly, as she watched Jessica and Jack hurry off to the back. The hormones and pheromones they were giving off were so strong, she could practically smell them. The mother-to-be of quadruplets was still annoyed she was never able to bed Jack and have the kind of sex she preferred while she was expectant but she was not too put off. For one, Mariah proved to be more than enough fun to play with and was willing to do anything Faye asked of her.

But more importantly, Faye was not worried because she had her eyes on the prize. If she won the bikini contest, she would have two of the three coins and it would only be a matter of time until she had Jack's third enchanted disc of metal. Then, as the voice coming from the coin had promised her, she would have complete control over pregnancy. Faye always wanted to be a mother and she was happy to raise the babies currently kicking and swimming inside her womb but over the past nine months (the coin may have revealed many truths about its powers to her but it still kept her deluded as to the truth of her 9-day pregnancy) Faye discovered something else she loved: being pregnant.

Faye caught herself at times not counting the days until her children arrived but wishing her pregnancy could last longer. Every step in the process was wonderful to Faye. The magnificent swelling of her belly into a colossal smooth ball of warm, tight skin and the shivers it sent down her spine when she ran her hands across her maternal curves, all the way to her inverted navel. Her individuality as a woman began when her umbilical cord was cut as a newborn and became her belly button and now that she was starting that process again, it popped out into a cute nub as if to signal the cycle again.

Beyond that, Faye loved the other changes in her body. She had always remained beautiful as she aged but her pregnancy breathed new life into her skin and hair, simultaneously shaving off decades and highlighting the mature glamour she had accumulated. Plus, her ass, breasts, hips, and thighs had taken on new volume and tone since Jack's coin-flipping set her on this course and Faye was totally fine with that.

Then there was the aspects of pregnancy that went beyond the simply physical. Faye loved just <u>being</u> pregnant. The fullness, the sense of being ripe with new life. The squirming that went on inside her belly at all hours of the day. Her heightened senses and changes in perspective and palate. And Faye was having some of the strongest sex dreams of her life each night of her pregnancy. In truth, much of the reason Faye could love her pregnancy so much was because of the coin itself. Her allegiance to the coin and its goals resulted in Faye getting the best of her condition and none of the negative side effects. No soreness, no tightness, no morning sickness, no rosacea, nothing.

It was no wonder that Faye had plans continuing after she got her hands on all three coins. After giving birth, she wanted to be pregnant again. Maybe with even more babies. And maybe for longer than nine months. A lot longer. So was Faye annoyed that she didn't get to have sex with Jack? Sure. But was she despondent? No, because she knew she would win this contest handily and get pregnant again when she'd have plenty of time to re-seduce Jack and do so successfully this time.

Still, Faye knew if she was going to have her idyllic life of pregnancy and motherhood, she couldn't be content to just win this contest by her good looks and sexy dancing. She would need to clinch the competition and try to take out the top contenders. Her eyes scanned the room, looking each woman up and down. After a while, Faye realized why she wasn't having success picking her next target: she <b>knew</b> she was the most beautiful so all the other women looked plain by comparison. She needed an objective pair of eyes.

"Oh Mariah~" Faye cooed, calling her pregnant booty call over. With her face flushed, Mariah hurried over, arms and legs trembling. "Don't be shy. Your friend Jessica has gone off with her boyfriend to make love." Mariah's blush grew and Faye chuckled, putting her hand on Mariah's shoulder. "Aww, jealous?"

"We were...close," Mariah nodded before looking into Faye's eyes. "B-but that doesn't matter because I have you now!"

"Yes, you have me," Faye said, applying pressure to Mariah's shoulder. Taking the hint, Mariah slowly got on her knees, groaning some as her pregnancy made this uncomfortable. Faye began to pet Mariah's hair as Mariah embraced Faye's massive belly. "Now, do two things for me."

"Anything!" Mariah squealed, planting a kiss on Faye's belly.

"You're on the right track, dear. Just a little higher." Mariah followed her instructions and began to suckle on Faye's popped-out navel. "Good, now while you do that, I want you to scan the room and look at each woman very carefully."

"Do wha?" Mariah said, drool slurring her words some. But Faye just pressed Mariah's head back against her tummy and twirled Mariah's brown hair in her fingers. Mariah shuddered and followed her mistress's instructions. Faye followed Mariah's gaze around the room. Depending on who Mariah saw, her "belly button fellatio" got more or less vigorous, which gave Faye a good measure of her competition's attractiveness. When Mariah had finished going around the room, Faye saw her top threats clearly: Lisa, Mia, and, unfortunately, Amber.

"Thank you, dear," Faye purred, stepping away from Mariah and stroking the young woman's belly. "You were an enormous help."

"W-wait," Mariah said, struggling to stand back up. "Would you like to...um...go somewhere private?"

"No time. Have to prepare for the contest, after all," Faye chuckled, adjusting her bikini top to present her breasts more favorably as she patrolled the room, paying no mind as her large belly pushed away comparatively smaller women. The first woman she saw was Lisa Smith, standing in all her voluptuous glory. Faye had already gotten a strong vibe from Lisa and could tell she was just as mentally strong and formidable as Faye herself. Faye stroked her belly as she thought, before seeing Lisa's lipstick: a distinctive shade of red.

Faye scanned the room before finally finding one other woman with the same shade: Trisha, the yoga instructor. Faye smiled as her eyes locked on and she waddled toward the athletic woman. "Hello there."

"Oh, hello!" Trisha said with a jolly smile before Faye reached down and kissed her passionately. Trisha moaned and her arms trembled as Faye made sure to press her lips as closely against hers as she could, even flicking her tongue around a bit for fun.

When Faye broke the kiss, Trisha was beet red from head to toe. "Good luck," Faye purred, getting a silent nod in reply as she turned and waddled toward Natalie waiting in the wings. Natalie was on her phone and didn't notice when Faye bumped her belly right up against hers, leaning in with a wide smile. "I had a talk with your friend, Ms. Smith. She's a very nice woman."

Natalie was about to thank her before she saw Faye's stained lips and felt her heart sink. The sextuplet-carrying woman clumsily waddled out to the main room, calling for Lisa with an angry tone. Faye cackled and set her sights on Mia Vasquez next, who was very popular as she talked with all the women. Stretching out one hand, Faye prepared to undo Mia's bikini strap before something stopped her.

Enough with these school-girl tricks, the coin snapped. Use what I have given you!

Faye paused and removed the coin from between her breasts. It was right: something like that would not be sufficient. Faye thought...Mia was a reporter covering the pregnancy outbreak, so what would distract her? Faye peeked out into the audience and flipped the coin. A chorus of shouts and screams erupted as several people experienced a sudden growth in their bellies and a bought of nausea. Mia heard the clatter of chairs and the cries and hurried out to see for herself.

With a loud cackle, Faye returned her coin and was ready to take on her last and worst competition, according to her read of Mariah. It made Faye more than a little upset that her new lover took a shine to Amber as well but that just fueled her fire anymore.

Don't just go on rage. Be smart, woman.

"I will be," Faye purred, locking eyes with Amber as the two waddled toward one another. "Hello Amber."

"Faye," Amber said with a nod, putting both hands on her hips and popping her belly out to touch Faye's. Immediately, the fetuses inside them began to kick. "Huh, guess they know their siblings are nearby."

A vein pulsed on Faye's forehead but she tried to remain calm. "Oh Amber...you sweet, foolish girl..."

"What do you mean?" Amber said, not expecting that kind of an insult from the wife of the man she slept with.

"Here you are, just thinking you're a whore and a slut when in fact, you didn't get impregnated by my husband at all," Faye purred, reaching into her chest to retrieve the coin. "You see this?"

"Yeah."

"It's a magical coin that causes pregnancies. It's the cause of everything in the city," Faye said, getting ready to drop the bomb.

"You're telling me a coin is making women pregnant?" Amber said, raising a red, sleek eyebrow.

"Oh, not just women, trust me," Faye chuckled. "And it's true. You should ask the man who used the coin first and got you pregnant in the first place."

"Yeah? And who's that?" Amber said. Faye just pointed behind her and waddled away smiling. Amber turned to see Jack and Jessica leaving the bathroom hand in hand.

"Now there's no one left in my way who isn't distracted," Faye laughed to herself as she patted her belly, relishing the movement inside her womb.

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
You large grotesque cow of a woman!? Do you know what you have done!? The coins screamed in her head, It was angry, very angry.

Although, the hungry thing beyond the beyond was more angry at itself more than it was upset at Faye. It cannot blame human stupidity, as human stupidity was a blessing and a curse. It was a blessing in order for it to spread it's chaos and feed, but every few hundred years, the magic blows up it in the horrible thing many faces, and this was that time.

It should have been clearer, should have explained the rules to her. It should have told her that even though reality can change, that women can think they were pregnant for months, that men can be made to think that getting pregnant was normal, reality is still delicate, like glass. Easy to mold, easy to break.

And reality was about to break, because of Faye's words to Amber. Amber was now aware of the fact that she wasn't supposed to be pregnant with Charles children, that her current condition was the cause of the coin. Faye had told her so, and in doing so, the "glamour" of the coin's new reality came crashing down.

She had two memories now, the truth and the reality she perceived the truth; a drunken mistake in the bar, a growing belly, a quest to find the man who was the father of her children. But yet, she remember dancing and getting so wasted just a week or so ago. Spending money on new skin tight dress that emphases her breasts and tight stomach. Buying shoes not cribs, buying makeup not diapers.

And suddenly, what once seems to be her accepted truth became a dream, a bunch of fuzzy memories.

The magic was gone when Faye told the truth, Amber suddenly remembered how everything use to be, should be. Soon everyone who though reality was one thing will soon remember what it should be. The truth can be like a virus, easily spread.

Amber felt a kick in her belly.

She looked down.

She screamed.
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Reality Bites.

choices: You heard the man: dance time
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Amber screamed as the realization hit her. When Faye first told her about how her pregnancy – the physical process of growing, gestating, and nurturing two of her own biological children inside her womb for 40 weeks – was in fact the result of some kind of magic and she had only been pregnant for little more than a week, Amber ignored it as nonsense. After all, could you think of anything stupider than a coin that causes pregnancy? That wouldn't even make a good story, let alone a believable cause for her condition.

But it made Amber start to think about her pregnancy and search for evidence to the contrary. That was when Amber realized she could not recall any details before last week. She couldn't remember seeing her doctor for an ultrasound, not counting her less-than-cordial run in with the army of HHS agents that ran the city for a while. She couldn't remember picking out baby supplies or watching her belly slowly grow over the nine months. Hell, Amber couldn't even remember having sex with Faye's husband to cause the pregnancy in question. All she had was the vague impression that these things must have happened but...there wasn't a shred of memory in Amber's head to confirm that.

As she screamed with shock at the horrifying realization, her eyes narrowed on Jack, the man Faye just told her was the reason she couldn't fit into her pants without fully unzipping them. She stormed toward Jack, her large belly pushing against his still-vigorous erection. Any other time, Amber would have taken the time to tease her employee about this but right now she was not in the mood.

"You!" Amber hissed, grabbing Jack around the throat with one hand. "You did this to me!"

"Whoa, easy!" Jessica said, her quadruplet belly awkwardly pushing against Amber's. "What's going on? Let him go!"

"You're not the only one with strong hands, hon," Amber sneered, eyes still locked with Jack's. She could see the fear on his face as clear as day, though there was no doubt a flicker of excitement from being attacked by a pregnant beauty like his boss. "It all makes sense...why there are so many pregnant women around you, why you're always playing with that fucking coin..."

"Oh no," Jessica said, suspecting the worst. "Amber, relax. The coin, all of it...we're trying to fix it."

"Fix it?" Amber grunted before stopping to think. Gradually, her grip softened and Jack stumbled back, clutching his neck and coughing. "How many people know about this thing?"

"Better not to get into that," Jack choked, still clearing his throat.

Amber turned to Jessica and prodded her enormous middle with one finger. "So yours is also..."

"Yep," Jessica said with a sigh, reaching both hands across her belly and slowly rubbing both sides, feeling the kicks in response to Amber's touching.

The gorgeous red-head snickered. "And here I thought Jack was dating a girl carrying another man's babies. I knew you weren't that much of a push-over."

"Hey, even if she was, I'd still love Jessica," Jack said, putting one arm around her shoulders and pulling her close before touching his other hand against her stomach. "Isn't that right?"

Jessica purred and kissed Jack on the cheek. "My, getting kinda feisty, aren't you?"

Amber sighed and ran her hands through her long fiery locks, pushing her hips and belly out in the process. "So...you two think you can fix this?"

"We have to win the coin that's part of the prizes for 1st place," Jessica explained. "So if you win..."

"Yeah yeah, it's yours," Amber nodded, stroking her belly and looking around the room. "But what if no one wins?"

"No one? What do you mean?" Jack said before following Amber's gaze. Things were not looking good. Bits and pieces of their conversation were being overheard and the damage Faye's prodding had done was already damaging the delicate reality bending already taking place. Women who were overjoyed and rosy with their pregnancies were realizing how, until recently, they were going about life with an utterly empty womb. And that resulted in no small amount of panic.

The mother-daughter competitors were both hyperventilating and touching each other's bellies nervously, unsure what to say to the other. Trisha, still reeling from her kiss with Faye, began to question everything that had happened at her class and ran her hands around her stomach, fully aware that there was one fetus too many inside her. The sensation of an "alien" baby mixed in with her previously natural twins chilled her to the bone. Tara was pacing around madly, her hands rubbing every square inch of her massive triplet belly. She was worried enough when her second and third babies showed up unannounced but now that the whole pregnancy and all of her concerns about finding the father and raising a family alone were twisted around and magnified. She doubted even Zavaleta could console her at this point.

But no one was reacting as poorly as Mia Vasquez. The triplet-carrying bombshell was having a full meltdown, hesitating to even touch her belly. Everything she'd worked on for the past week had revolved around her pregnancy and the pregnancies of the people in the city. Now that was all a lie or some kind of even stranger medical event than the "pregnancy sickness?" And where did these babies even come from? When she felt them start to kick, Mia screamed with fear and tried to hide her pregnant body, which was exceedingly difficult since she was in a skimpy bikini.

"This is bad," Jessica said, looking around.

"And the panic is only getting worse," Ms. Smart said, storming over to Jack. "What did you do?"

"Nothing! Honest!" Jack said, holding up his hands in self defense.

"It was her," Amber said, pointing to Faye. The massive mom-to-be was currently muttering to herself and was clearly not happy with the latest developments.

"Perfect, she's somehow undone the reality change from the coin," Ms. Smart sighed. "If this spreads out into the audience too, we could have a full-on riot and we're only a few hours away from the deadline."

"Deadline?" Amber asked.

"You're too new to this, red," Ms. Apple snickered, waddling over and sticking out her chest and belly to compare against Amber. "Don't ask too many questions or you'll just hurt your head."

Meanwhile, Faye's internal argument was only getting worse. There needs to be a victor!

"Why? Why can't I just live my life and have my babies?" Faye whined, cradling the underside of her massive bump.

You threaten everything by leaving us exposed! The competition must go on!

"Fine, fine, whatever," Faye grumbled. "As long as I get to be pregnant after all this is over."

Mortal, I will give you a pregnancy only written about in myth. But you need to win.

"I will! I'll crush these bitches!" Faye cackled. "What do I have to do?"

Give me to the chosen one.

"The...who?"

The boy.

Faye's heart sunk right into her womb. "Jack?"

He has control and affinity that you do not. If mistakes are to be corrected, I need more power.

Faye shuddered with anger before a wave of nausea and contractions overcame her. The coin was not playing around. With a growl, she waddled over to Jack, nearly bowling him over with her belly. "Here." She shoved the coin into his chest, feeling the stinging stares of Amber, Jessica, and Ms. Smart. "Fix this and then keep the coin ready because I'll take it right back from you, sexy."

"T-thanks?" Jack said, looking at the second coin nervously. He took out his own coin and held the two together for comparison. Both were identical in every way and Jack could feel his skin start to tingle as he held them close.

Tthhaatt'ss bbeetttteerr a grotesque voice said in his head. Amber saw Jack's confused look and cocked her head as well, but in the meantime, she felt her heart rate start to slow down.

Suddenly, the situation she faced – being impregnated by a coin and believing it was natural all this time – was no longer as distressing. She knew she had only been pregnant for a few days, sure, but it was not as distressing. And around the room, other women were clearly relaxing as well.

"I heard some commotion back here," Oven said, peeking his head around the curtain. "Is everything okay?"

"We're all fine," Jessica said back with a smile.

"Where's Lisa?" he asked, looking around the room. "Well whatever. She'll need to show up when her name's called. It's dance time, ladies!"

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"We've already got your music queued so when you get on stage, just wait a moment for it to start," Oven called out as the women lined up. It stretched all throughout the back room because of how many women were participating and because so many of them had such extreme belly sizes. "And remember, you only have a few minutes to show the audience what you've got so stay focused and make it count."

Most of the women in line were laughing at chatting with one another. Even with the prizes being offered, this was all taken as a light-hearted event. It was a pregnant bikini contest, after all. Not much gravity behind that. But for the women most closely connected to Jack, they were nervously pacing in place, hands stroking their bellies faster than ever before. Jessica, Ms. Smart, and Ms. Apple were worried about whether they could perform well enough to win and get the final coin back, Mariah was still uncomfortable with her betrayal to Faye, and several other women had just discovered that their pregnancies had not lasted as long as they'd thought and they too were victims of the "pregnancy disease," with their bellies appearing only a handful of days prior.

Out of the women Jack knew personally, only his mother Amanda and Faye looked composed. He'd done his best to keep Amanda insulated from the controversy surrounding the coin and the pregnancies it had caused, especially since she had enough on her plate with the coin giving the 50 year old quadruplets. Faye had her usual sultry smile across her plump lips because...well, she was Faye. Even with the loss of her own coin, she had enough sensual confidence to win it all back once the competition was over. Even Ms. Apple and Smart had to admit that Faye was a top contender to win the whole contest.

She was clearly attempting some kind of dance combining her flexibility as a fitness instructor with the size and shape of her tanned twin belly but just before she was called out, Faye had given her a strong kiss to steal some of the color from her lipstick. Trisha's knees were weak and she stumbled in her steps, trying not to make eye contact with the father of her babies. And it didn't help that, until a moment ago, she was unaware that she was originally only carrying one.

"Thank you, Trisha," Sandwich said, reading off of his cards as Trisha hurried off-stage. "Next we have...our own Miss Lisa Smith!" The crowd erupted with applause as Lisa walked out slowly, her heavy breasts on full display in her skimpy bikini and her triplet belly hanging out proudly. She stood on stage, nervously patting her belly as she tried to get Natalie out of her mind. And there aren't a lot of women full term with triplets doing strip teases either. But she wiggled her hips and rear and chest in front of the crowd, bending and turning, all while jutting her belly out and stroking it. The audience, especially those familiar with 101.9's programming, hooted and hollered while several people remained quiet, assuming a pregnant bikini contest would be somewhat family friendly.

But as Lisa was ending her routine, she got sight of Natalie off to the side. Her arms were crossed and resting on her sextuplet belly, half exposed from under her shirt. And Lisa could see her still scowling up at her, but this time, she was also crying. Lisa stopped dead in her tracks, just staring at Natalie. The audience murmured to one another as Lisa's music died out and she waddled off stage in the wrong direction.

Sandwich cleared his throat into the microphone and looked down at the next card. "N-next up we have...oh, another local celebrity, Mia Vasquez!" Mia waddled out quickly after prodding from Oven to undo that awkward showing, and stood tall on stage, hands on her hips.

I don't even know how these babies got inside me Mia said, sticking her hips out to accentuate her swollen middle. But you're about to get the ride of your lives. Mia's music came in slowly and she began to move gracefully around the stage, letting her hips wiggle to make her pregnancy dance above the audience. As they oohed and awed, the beat dropped. Mia hopped as high as she could and began to shake her body all over. Ass, breasts, belly, everything was whipped around and fondled in rhythm with the music. She continued to dance, a big smile on her face as she got lost in the music, when she heard a familiar voice.

"Oh my god...Mia?" Brooke, one of her station's anchors said. Mia saw her shocked expression and looked down at herself. Her bikini had come loose again. Very loose. It was off and Mia had been dancing with her chest exposed.

Mia hurried off stage as Sandwich scrambled to grab the microphone and introduce the next participant. "O-okay, up next we have Mariah-"

"Pass."

Sandwich looked up to see Mariah shaking her head. Her face was as red as a cherry ferrari. "What do you mean, 'Pass?'"

"Pass. I forfeit this round," Mariah said, trembling before running away as well.

"Jesus Christ," Sandwich muttered, unaware his microphone picked that up. "Okay, uh...Tara? Are you still here or is the whole show falling apart?"

"Here," Tara said, already front-and-center on stage. She'd managed to change a little before this part of the competition and it certainly made an impression. Her bikini top was still on but she had a long, dark skirt around her legs with some beads sewn in. But most surprisingly was the extensive paint done on her belly, flowering out like a henna painting. When the spotlight went on her, the audience could see it and gasped. Then her music started: a mid-paced Middle Eastern song with plenty of drums. Tara began to belly-dance, shaking her hips and undulating her large pregnant belly along with the drums as her skirt flapped out and her beads jingled. Jack peeked through the curtains at her movement and fell a shudder run through his core.

Sandwich let out a sigh of relief, glad a real dance had finally come as Tara's time ended and she left the stage to great applause. Faye huffed, unaware she would put on such a good show. Next came Ms. Smart, whose familiarity with high arts let her do a graceful dance with plenty of hip movement to show off her pronounced belly. Following her was Ms. Apple, who had a little more composure than her practices but still relied heavily on showing off just how inviting her cleavage was, which seemed to get plenty of reaction from the crowd.

"At least her top didn't come off too," Sandwich muttered again, still unaware how much his voice was being picked up by the microphone. Ms. Apple shot him a withering look as she left and Sandwich introduced Amber. If Lisa had been trying to do a strip tease, Amber was a full-out champagne room entertainer. Spreading her legs, Amber dipped down and gyrated her hips, letting her belly follow suit as she glided around the stage, making eye contact with the most nervous men and women in the audience and smiling and purring at them. She'd had so much success teasing Jack so why not try it out on her audience?

Next came Amanda, who got plenty of applause for her notoriety as the oldest woman competing and many were still surprised at how good she looked at her age. Better than many of the women in their 20s, even! And Amanda used every bit of energy she had in her, rushing around the stage to "Flashdance" and letting her belly do all the talking. She didn't shy away from the size of her pregnancy and the crowd loved it.

"That was an energetic one!" Sandwich said with a chuckle. "Up next is...Faye Jones!" The lights went out and the crowd yelped in response. Then one spotlight came on, showing Faye in the center of the stage. She had her flirty smirk on and her body was newly oiled up. As burlesque music began to play, Faye slowly ran her hands up and down her body, cupping her chest and stroking her belly. With each stroke, Faye walked closer to the edge of the stage, eventually stepping down and mingling with the audience, inviting people to touch and touching them back.

"You do you all think should win?" she cooed to one pregnant woman who wasn't competing. The music died down and she flashed a grin, waddling back behind the stag.e

"Not really a dance," Sandwich muttered. "But straight guys'll fall for anything, I suppose...okay, up next! Give it up for Jessica!"

And out she came. Her music was the peppy but with a little electro edge. Jessica bolted out and took a deep breath before hitting her marks. She had reversed every step so many times for so many days and it showed. Hips, arms, legs, belly. She moved with expert precision, as if her hulking quadruplet belly didn't weigh a thing. The audience marveled at her, a mix of sexuality and technique, until Jessica came to a stop, arms outstretched and belly sticking out. The audience roared with applause as she smiled and waddled off, into Jack's arms.

"T-that was amazing!" Jack laughed, kissing her on the lips.

"Yeah?" Jessica laughed, nuzzling against him. "Maybe you'll get to see it up close someday. In a private show."

"I wouldn't mind," Jack said, touching one hand to her belly. "Maybe I could even coach you. A little hands-on training."

Both giggled and headed for the back as Sandwich picked his mic back up. "Great showing. Up next, some character who doesn't matter to the plot...wait, who wrote this?"
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: You heard the man: dance time

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Backstage, Faye was fuming. Hands on her wide hips, she leered at the monitors displaying the scene out front and tapped one foot incessantly. Here she was convinced she had managed to knock out the top threats in the bikini contest and Jessica managed to come out and throw a wrench into her plan. Her dance was charismatic, sensual, and didn’t shy away from showing off her pregnant belly. Even Faye’s advantage of being close to the largest woman in the whole competition in terms of pregnancy size was undone thanks to Jessica also carrying quadruplets.

Mariah, still answering to Faye with eager puppy love, was staying cautiously far from her new lover. She’d been used to Faye’s…mood swings, let’s say…and didn’t want to anger her any further. Mariah certainly didn’t want to point out that Jessica was only carrying quadruplets because of Faye’s reckless use of the coin when she, Jessica, and Jack snuck around in her house.

“Y-you did great,” Mariah said quietly.

“Of course I did,” Faye snapped, turning and shooting Mariah a piercing gaze that nearly made the pregnant bookworm faint right on the spot. “But why didn’t you tell me Jack’s girlfriend was such a skilled dancer? You both trained together.”

Mariah just warbled and didn’t get any clear answer out, leaving Faye to scoff and turn away. The truth was, when Faye asked Mariah for her assessment of the competition, Jessica and Jack were getting busy in the bathroom so she’d gone under the radar. But Faye had bigger problems. Her big plan for the talent portion was going to be using the coin to make someone pregnant (or based on the audience, more pregnant) and pass it off as a magic trick. With the coin throwing a tantrum and demanding to be held in Jack’s possession for now, she was left out in the cold.

“You like me, don’t you?” Faye said to Mariah.

“Y-yes!” Mariah said hurriedly.

Faye smiled and touched one hand to Mariah’s cheek, feeling the girl shudder at her touch. “Then develop a new talent routine for me. One that will cement me as the top of the competition.” She touched her belly against Mariah’s and leaned in for a kiss, sealing the deal.

The kiss did not go unnoticed by Ms. Smart, who was watching after Mariah declined to participate in the dance portion of the bikini contest. “Looks like we’re down one team member,” she reported back, joining Jack, Jessica, and Ms. Apple.

“I had a feeling about her,” Ms. Apple sighed. “She had the same look in her eyes I give men when I mesmerize them for information.” She crossed her arms, propping up her heaving chest in the process. “She’s smitten.”

Jack gulped, and not just because his eyes were now drawn to Ms. Apple’s enticing cleavage. He was thinking about how close he was to Faye – before everything happened with the coins and during the plot to steal the book back from her. Could he have been put in the same position as Mariah?

“T-that’s okay, we don’t need Mariah,” Jack said. “Jessica killed it out there. And even if, by some crazy oversight, the crowd didn’t like her, you both danced really well too.”

“I don’t know how they couldn’t love me,” Ms. Apple said with a little smile, kicking her hip out some and running one hand down her bosom.

“Hey, focus up,” Ms. Smart sighed, patting Ms. Apple on her red-haired head. “We’re still going to need Mariah’s help decoding the book if it comes to that. Plus there’s still the talent portion and I don’t think Mrs. Jones is done with her tricks just yet.”

Jack and Jessica nodded as Sandwich started up on the microphone again. “Okay, now that our ladies have had time to rest, let’s welcome them back out for the last section of the night before voting: the talent segment! Please, give a big hand as these moms-to-be show us what they’ve got!”

The crowd began to clap as the women lined up to go back out. “Do your best,” Jack said with a smile, kissing Jessica on the lips and stroking her belly. She held his hand against her midsection long enough to feel a few kicks before lining up.

Up in the rafters, Zavaleta was still watching with care, stroking her enormous octuplet belly and feeling how tight it was getting. Clearly, something had changed with the chaotic magic as the crowd seemed unsteady with the previous “reality rewriting” that the coin created. By her guess, one of the coin’s owners – Jack or Faye – had tried to manipulate it or destroy it and it didn’t go well. But now that things seemed steady, only one of them was holding onto it now. But Zavaleta didn’t know who was the likelier candidate.

After a few other women of no barring to our story, out came Mia Vasquez with a big smile on her face. A little too big, especially considering how distracted she was with her bikini constantly falling apart and the realization that she hadn’t been pregnant, particularly not with triplets, for longer than a week or so.

“Hello,” Mia said, speaking into a microphone. “When I learned there was a talent portion in this contest, I wasn’t sure what to do. But then I sat down and thought about it and it became clear that I have one very definite talent: reporting.”

The lights on the stage dimmed and a ceiling-mounted projector showed slides depicting large sums of money and numbers of individuals, linked with the names of various government and private-sector organizations.

“So for my ‘talent,’ I’m going to clue you all in to what my reporting has recently revealed about our city’s take-over by the Department of Health and Human Services,” Mia said, her smile growing and growing as the audience stirred uncomfortably in their seats. “Namely, how HHS was never in charge of the operation to begin with.”

Everyone watched in shock as Mia went on and on, in great detail.

“As you can see from this form, this is not an issue limited to one country,” Mia said, now deep into her report. “This organization, PEAR, has resources from nearly every country, and at least every industrialized one. And again, they only appear when issues surrounding pregnancy arise and they take total control, as they did in our city.”

“Hey, what a talent!” Sandwich said, laughing nervously. “But we are about…30 minutes over your allocated time so it’s time to welcome our next expectant lady!”

As the audience clapped politely, Sandwich walked Mia off-stage as she continued to talk. “This organization exists outside of any international charter! It is essentially an illegal military force and any inquiry by any country could reveal even more!”

Zavaleta chuckled, watching Mia leave. This may be the death knell in PEAR once and for all. She was a dedicated soldier and followed PEAR for years to try and get her hands on the coin but now that Mia’s report was done, Zavaleta was glad to see it go. PEAR betrayed her at the first chance and she was pregnant. She didn’t need them anymore.

After a few more competitors, out strolled Faye, a terrifying look on her face. She wasn’t scowling or even clearly angry. That was what made her so scary: she looked eerily happy. She glided across the makeshift stage and struck a pose in front of the audience and scanned them slowly, letting her pouty lips and heavy eyelids work their magic.

“My talent?” Faye said into the provided microphone. She paused, thinking of something to say. Mariah was too busy running around backstage to give her any ideas. So Faye did what she had to. “My talent is that I am still keeping my family together.” The audience murmured. “For years, I was told I couldn’t bear children. Then when I find out I’m blessed with four babies of my own, growing in my glorious, swollen womb, what other news do I get?”

She turned and pulled on the curtain to expose the rest of the women and grabbed Amber, dragging her out on stage.

“I learned my husband also got another woman pregnant!” Faye barked, pointing at Amber’s belly. “This fiery slut!”

“You bitch!” Amber growled.

“Whoa now,” Sandwich said, hurrying between them. “T-this is a fun event, let’s remember.”

“Here’s my talent: 10 years of command sambo,” Amber spat at Faye, reaching back for a punch and accidentally hitting Sandwich in the head and chin and knocking him out cold. “Oops.”

Oven rushed out, looking between the three of them as the audience gasped and hooted. “Uh…brief intermission,” he said as a new curtain dropped down and Amber and Faye left.

Backstage, Mariah was trembling as she got close to Faye. “Y-you did a good job out there. You’ll get big points for sympathy from anyone who’s ever been cheated on, for sure.”

“Oh shut up,” Faye snarled. “You obnoxious child. I could get anyone to take care of my beautiful body and I picked you because I thought you were useful. I was wrong.” She ripped Mariah’s bikini top off and shoved her away. “No wonder no one likes you.”

Mariah whimpered and hurried for the nearest corner, curling up and shaking. As she began to lightly sob, Jessica came over and put one arm around her back. “Hey…everything okay?”

“Faye…broke up with me,” Mariah sniffled.

“I don’t think she was a good fit for you,” Jessica said with a chuckle. “C’mon, let’s get you some new clothes.”

“E-even after I helped her beat you?” Mariah said softly.

“Yeah, even after that,” Jessica sighed. “You’re my best friend, after all.”
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Faye is none to happy after that

choices: Faye interrupts with her own demands
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"You're up next," Oven said, one hand on his budding pregnant belly as he passed by Jessica to walk over to where Sandwich was lying with a wet towel compress. Sandwich had come to but he was still a little groggy.

"Knocked out by a pregnant woman," Sandwich said, holding his chin and adjusting his jaw. "That's a new one."

"At least it wasn't Lisa. I thinks she's wanted to deck us for years and if she actually KO'd one of us, we'd never hear the end of it," Oven chuckled. "But we might be fasttracking the rest of the night. We have a lot of women and it's almost midnight and I don't want those two to let their family drama turn into a riot."

Backstage, Jessica was pacing around, rubbing the sides of her belly as she had a small frown on her pink lips. Jack and Mariah looked at her worried. "Hey, everything okay?" Jack asked. "I know the stuff with Faye and Amber's fighting is still scary but we'll figure this all out."

"It's not that," Jessica said, nibbling on her thumb. "I kind of focused all my time on learning to dance and...forgot to come up with a talent."

"Did I hear that right?" Ms. Smart said, charging over with Ms. Apple waddling up behind her. "You don't have a talent?"

"I was focusing on just being...sexy and confident," Jessica said, looking down at her quadruplet middle as her face turned pale.

"Hey, I think you excelled at that," Jack smiled, kissing Jessica on the cheek.

"Ease up, casanova. We have bigger things at stake here," Ms. Smart said, patting her tight, dark belly. "This competition needs to be a slam dunk. There can't be the slightest chance anyone else wins outside of our circle."

"Think, Jessica. You must have something you can do," Mariah chirped. "You're so talented and...amazing." Mariah started to blush and curled her hands around her belly.

"What's up with her?" Ms. Apple said, gesturing at Mariah.

"She just went through a breakup – she's fine," Jessica said. "I could try and dance again. That would work."

"Against the rules," Jack said, shaking his head. "I read up before coming here to help out backstage."

"Hey, boy," Trisha called out, waddling over and prodding her wide bump with one finger. "My tummy skin is drying out. I need some moisturizer."

Jack blushed and grabbed a bottle of skin cream. "B-be right over," he said before looking back at Jessica. "I-I'm sure you'll come up with something." He hurried over to the pregnant exercise instructor, kneeling down before her bare belly as he started to rub the moisturizer into it.

Jessica continued to ponder before a little light went off in her head. "I think I might have something," Jessica said, grinning at her collaborators. "I'll see you all in a bit." Jessica waddled across the backstage area to Amanda, who was resting in a chair while holding onto her huge stomach. "You look winded."

"Dancing while pregnant is not easy. Especially at my age," Amanda chuckled, patting her enormous belly. "You did a wonderful job."

"Thanks, you were good too," Jessica smiled, putting her hands on her hips. "Say...what did you have planned for your talent?"

Amanda shrugged. "I was just going to lip sync to one of my favorite songs. I thought it would be funny and I'm just here to have a good time." Her smile grew as Jessica slowly sat down next to her. "Why?"

"I was thinking...we haven't done a lot together as mother and daughter-in-law," Jessica said. "Maybe we could...share this one? Do a duet?"

Amanda laughed out loud, a big smile on her face. "Oh Jessica, that would be wonderful." She put one hand on Jessica's belly. "And I'd get to share a memory with my grandchildren...I know they aren't exactly Jack's but-"

"No, they are absolutely your grandchildren," Jessica smiled, placing one hand on top of Amanda's. Both women sat there in silence, feeling the kicks and hiccups inside Jessica, until Oven came over.

"You're up," he said. "Do you need the sound people to cue anything up?"

Jessica turned to Amanda and smiled. "We'll be doing ours together. Cue up Mrs. Dale's music." Oven nodded and hurried back, talking into a headset, as Jessica and Amanda helped each other to their feet. "So what's our song?" Amanda just smiled in response.

Both women waddled out on stage to applause from the crowd. "Ladies and gentlemen, this is my mother-in-law and these are her grandchildren," Jessica said, pointing to Amanda and her own swollen stomach.

"And this is my daughter-in-law and her, I suppose, brothers and sisters-in-law," Amanda giggled, rubbing her belly. The audience laughed softly and gasped in pleasant surprise. "So since we're both about to bring our children into the world, we wanted to share a little something while they're all still inside us." Both women nodded to the sound crew. Shania Twain's "I Feel Like A Woman" started up and Jessica nearly burst out laughing as Amanda mouthed along to "Let's Go Girls."

Luckily, Jessica knew the song by heart as well and both women paced around the stage with sultry grace, exchanging verses and rubbing their bellies together when it came time to shout out the chorus. The audience loved it, laughing and clapping as it went on. When it was done, both women stood at the front and waved, with Amanda bending down to kiss Jessica's round belly.

"Thank you," Amanda whispered to Jessica, tears forming in her eyes. "That was...special."

"Okay and up next, give it up for Mariah!" Oven said, with the audience clapping again. Backstage, Mariah turned to Ms. Apple and Ms. Smart with big, shocked doe eyes.

"I-I don't have anything to do either," Mariah squeaked. Ms. Apple slapped her forehead and Ms. Smart stepped toward Mariah, pushing her back with her belly.

"You helped our enemy conspire against us and I am not as nice as Jessica," Ms. Smart said through clenched teeth. "Just do something."

"I-I have a lot of Shakespeare memorized. I could do some of that," Mariah said.

"Yes, fine, just go!" Ms. Smart said, turning the trembling triplet-carrying woman toward the stage and pushing her forward. Mariah stumbled onto stage, looking terrified, before turning up toward the spotlight.

"A-a reading of a famous poem," Mariah said before taking a deep breath. When she started to speak, it was like an entirely different woman was on stage, full of energy and power. "He jests at scars that ever felt a wound. But soft, what light through yonder window breaks?" Everyone was silent, suddenly transfixed by her line delivery. "It is the east and Jessica is the sun."

Jack hurried over to Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple. "Did she say...Jessica?"

"Thou, her maid, art more fair than she. Be not her maid, since she is envious; her vestial livery is but sick and green and none but fools do wear it; cast it off," Mariah said, her voice getting choked up. "It is my Faye, O it is my love: O that she knew she were!"

"Uh oh," Jack said.

"She's still doing pretty well," Ms. Apple whispered back.

"Shh," one of the other participating pregnant women hissed at them. "This is beautiful. Don't talk."

"When he bestrides the lazy puffing clouds and sales upon the bosom of the air," Mariah said in conclusion. "E-especially the bosom."

The room filled with thunderous applause as Mariah quickly bowed and hurried away. Her face was bright red and she was trying to hide in the back. But the pregnant woman who hissed at Jack waddled over, putting one hand on her bare back. "Hey...that was terrific."

"T-thanks. I t-think I messed up some lines though," Mariah squealed. This other woman was very attractive.

"You got this sense of real passion for not just one woman, but all women," her new pregnant friend said. "I'm Juliet, by the way."

"S-seriously?" Mariah choked.

"No, not really. I'm Gina," she giggled. "You know, I love Shakespeare too. And I love to read."

"M-me too," Mariah said with a little smile. "I, um, work at a book store."

"That's so cool!" Gina said. "Hey, do you want to go somewhere and...talk?"

Mariah smiled and looked down at their touching bellies. "I'd like that," she murmured.

"Wow," Oven said on stage. "I-I mean, up next we have...Ms. Apple. Why can't we get her real name?"

Ms. Apple strutted out on stage with a big smile on her face and a banana and a condom in her hands. "Hey everyone. My talent is that I am the fastest at putting on a condom with just my mouth. Now if someone wants to time me-"

"Okay, that's enough of that," Oven said, hurrying her off-stage and welcoming up the next competitors. The rest went through quickly as the clock was counting down to midnight.

"This had better be over soon," Zavaleta said, stroking her tightening belly as she watched the show from the rafters. "I am losing my patience quickly and I have not seen any sign of the coin."

Ballots for voting were all handed up to the front, where Oven and a newly steady Sandwich counted them up. "Looks like we're ready to read out our winners," Oven said with a big, showbiz smile. "Your winner of the First Annual Miss Stork Pregnant Bikini Contest, sponsored by 101.9 The Edge is-"

And just as Oven read out the name-
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: time for Jessica's talent

choices: Fuck it, make me the pregnancy master
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Jessi-coah!" Oven said, gripping his stomach as it tightened and pushed out. He grunted, feeling his shirt start to roll up and reveal more of his round curve. "Ugh, that felt weird," he said to himself, worried what people might think if they saw. Male pregnancy was not exactly rare in the city lately but he didn't know how people would react to his gut actually expanding in front of them. But when Oven looked back up at the crowd, he saw he was the last thing on their minds.

Throughout the audience, pregnant women were groaning and panting, the floor soaked with amniotic fluid. As soon as the midnight hit, nearly everyone's water broke and contractions were coming fast. It was deafeningly loud as men and women heaved themselves out of their slippery seats and tried to waddle to their loved ones or make it out the door, tightening bellies bumping into one another.

Backstage, it was even worse. Bikini-clad women with enormous middles were panicking, all stroking their swollen middles as they felt their fetuses start to really try and escape. Jessica was one of the few who were immune but her progression to be full-term with quadruplets still took the air out of her and she doubled over while clutching her stomach. It was now double her arms' length and the kicks were much stronger. Jack held her in his arms as she rode out the last tremors of growth.

"You did it," Jack whispered in her ear, giving his increasingly pregnant girlfriend a kiss on the cheek. "You won."

"Not in time," Jessica sighed, looking at the struggling women backstage. Mariah, Ms. Smart, and Ms. Quick were hurrying over, all red-faced and sweating as they gripped their stomachs. "How are you holding up?"

"They're moving fast," Ms. Quick winced, moving her hand to her lower belly, patting her dark tan skin. "You two might want to...oof." She squatted, spreading her legs as she rubbed her stomach in wide circles.

"You've done this before. You can hold it in," Ms. Apple chuckled, turning to Jack and Jessica. "What she means is now that you won, hurry up and...oh boy." She leaned back, pushing both hands into her lower back to stick her pregnant swell out even farther, its rosy smooth surface constantly shaking with kicks and punches.

"I think I get the idea," Jack said, turning to Mariah. "Before we grab the last coin, any advice on how to undo all this? You had the book."

"R-right, um," Mariah panted, her hands rubbing quickly near her navel. "The closer they all get together, the weaker they'll become. So if...if..." She squealed and her knees buckled. "O-oh that feels even better than Faye~"

"It's always the quiet ones," Ms. Apple sighed, grunting with another contraction. By this point, medics were starting to hurry in and help pregnant women out of the sports bar and into vans and ambulances to take to the hospital. Some of the response plans left in place by the CDC and PEAR seemed to still be in effect. "Just...just do something!"

"Guess we're up," Jack said, turning to Jessica. He pulled out the other two coins, both burning in his palm. "Let's collect our prize."

Jack and Jessica made it onto the front stage, where Sandwich and Oven were looking around frantically. "See Lisa yet?" The biggest belly in the crowd bobbed past them as some medics tried to get Natalie to sit still in a wheelchair while she reached out to Lisa.

"I'm sorry I didn't trust you!" Natalie yelled as she clutched her stomach. "I'm so excited and scared to have these babies with you!"

"Me too, me too!" Lisa cried back, struggling to walk as two men held her arms and helped to support her. "Hey, watch it!" she shouted at one of them when she felt him getting a little too close to her chest. "I don't turn into public property just because I'm in labor!"

"Hey," Jessica said, patting Oven on the back. "Where's my prize?"

"You're worried about that now?" Oven said, gesturing at the lovely chaos in the room.

"We just need it, okay?" Jack said. "Where's that rare coin?"

"Here, jesus," Sandwich said, tossing the coin to them. Jack and Jessica screamed and Jack hurried to catch it before it technically flipped. A laboring woman cried out in shock as her tightening belly got a whole lot tighter and pushed away her helpful husband so he didn't quite make it.

"Okay, okay, now what?" Jessica said as Jack hopped off-stage and placed the three coins together. Once joined, Jack felt a shiver run through him and he went weak, stumbling a bit so Jessica caught him for support. "Jack?"

"Jack!" Faye called, staggering from back stage to see him. The angry, lusty woman Jack had sparred with for the past few days was gone and the loving, scared face of a desperate mom-to-be looked back at him. "Please, don't take my babies away. I know I've been bad to you lately but...I want to be a mom so bad. I see how Amanda and your father raised you and I want that too. Even with Steve and his affair, I want-" She grunted and bent over, one hand going between her legs. "They're so close."

"Let's get you somewhere more comfortable, ma'am," a medic said as she took Faye and walked her out of the sports bar. Faye was moaning loudly, a soft laugh coming out of her mouth as she felt her children make their way through her birth canal.

"You want to check on your mom?" Jessica asked. "She's got to be as far along as any of them."

"No time," Jack gulped, looking down at the coins. The air around the seemed to be bending as he focused his attention. "What do I do...what do I do?"

"You can put your hands up, for starters," a growling voice said. Jack turned and instinctively raised both arms. A very large, very naked Nicole Zavaleta had a pistol pointed at his head, her face doused in sweat. Just like the coin's revenge made her pregnancy as uncomfortable as possible, so was her labor. "Now back away from the coins."

"You're...enormous," Jessica gasped, eyeing Zavaleta's octuplet belly. It looked like a balloon, so ready to pop at any moment. Her pale skin was so tight, Jessica could even make out the silhouettes of her eight fetuses, all throwing tantrums as they lowered into position. There was a steady stream of amniotic fluid coming from between her legs.

"W-who exactly are you?" Jack said, stuck between his fear of her gun and his admiration of her extremely pregnant body.

"Someone who's had her eye on you for quite some time now," Zavaleta said through gritted teeth. "Now give the coins or-"

"Oh my god...that's a head," Jessica said, one hand over her mouth. Zavaleta's enormous belly and tree-trunk thighs made it hard to get a good look at her birth canal but Jessica had positioned herself to see all the action. She had long fantasized about pregnancy and motherhood but actually seeing a woman crowing in person was a bit of a shock.

A mix of pain and maternal emotion overtook Zavaleta and she lowered her gun and reached one hand down to her lap. "My baby! My first baby! It's...it's happening!"

Jack was frozen, watching this whale of a pregnant woman literally giving birth in front of him while the coins he'd been after for the past days sat right in front of him. But hearing Zavaleta talk about motherhood snapped him back to the reason he was here in the first place. He turned his attention to the coins and thought about the last nine days. How he was the one who set all of this into motion. How he was the master of the city's pregnancies.

Taken your rightful place, eh? that familiar, sick voice said in his head. Time felt as though it slowed down around Jack as he brought his hands closer to the coins, feeling its energy prick at his skin. Well, you run the show now. You can have whatever you want.

Jack prepared to tell the coin to undo things but a fold developed in his mind. "Any...thing?"

The voice laughed gently. Yes, I can help you do so many things with pregnant women. Make them all fall in love with you. Make any woman pregnant. Make them as big as you want. All up to you.

Jack trembled, imagining that fantasy life and feeling his erection grow. "Or I could just destroy you."

You could but how do you know that wouldn't just create its own chaos? the coin replied. A lot of decisions here, chosen one. You carry a heavier burden than your girlfriend there. Jack looked over his shoulder at Jessica, her hands patting her belly as she stood radiant in her bikini. You could make any woman in the world lust after you the way she does. You can be the true master of pregnancy.

He could feel his mind being filled with images. All different scenarios ran through. He was lying in a mountain of bellies in one. He was helping Jessica take care of their children in a nice home in another. He could see Faye and his mother screaming in the hospital together in another.

Better make a choice! the coin's voice cackled.

Jack shut his eyes. "I want..."
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: The clock strikes midnight

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
Jack sighed and thought about it. The wave of pregnancies in town certainly made his life a lot more exciting and there were women like Faye who were ecstatic about having a baby on the way. But at the same time, he'd seen all the people it was hurting. He thought about Jessica and their relationship. Her growing a belly made things more interesting but he didn't need to the coin to date her. They were already together.

He didn't want the coin to hurt anyone ever again. But as he started focusing his mind, the coin seemed to follow his thought process.

Okay, okay, I get it. You're a good guy, the coin said in its snake-oil salesman voice. You want to do the right thing. That's why you're so easy to manipulate.

Jack winced, feeling the coin further permeate his mind.

Get rid of me and sure, the next person won't flip me. But your friends are still going to be in the hospital, screaming as they push out all those brats. Or you could undo everything but then I'll just roll on out of here and wait for the next chance.

Its unnerving laugher filled Jack's ears.

So what's it gonna be, kid?
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Something else

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"Destroy the coin is what I want." Jack said to the coin.

Immediately after Jack said that, the three coins merged and disintegrated.

"It's over." Jack thought, until Jessica brought him back to reality.

"Jack, what happened to the coins and why is everybody still pregnant?" Jessica asked Jack.

"I destroyed them so they can't be used anymore, but it seems that it didn't reverse the pregnancies." Jack responded,
1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.title: Destroy the coin

1141111112212121111122211122111112121111.content:
"T-the town," Jack said, opening his eyes and glancing over at Jessica, her hands held against her massive bulging belly. He would miss it.

A little louder the coin said in a low cackle.

"Save the town, undo what happened since I first flipped you," Jack said, leaning in close to the coin on the stage. "And then get the fuck out of here."

Deal

In a blink of the eye, Jessica was back to her fit, slim figure and she patted her flat stomach in shock. "Wow...it's...it's gone. It's really gone!" She lept into Jack's arms, hugging him tightly and kissing him. "You did it!"

"You did more than me. You won the whole contest," Jack smiled, reaching his hands down her bare back. He could feel her breasts against his chest, still as big as they were a moment ago. Some things didn't change. "So...maybe I should have consulted you."

"About what?" Jessica asked as they broke the hug, looking at him with some confusion. Her hand was still on her waist, stroking her empty belly out of habit.

"I had a few choices about what to do and...I chose to undo all the pregnancies," Jack said with a sigh.

"Well that's good," Jessica said, putting her hands on her hips. "Did you think I'd miss being a young mother?"

"It means the coin got away," Jack said sadly. "I just passed the problem on to the next person. I was...selfish."

Jessica studied him for a moment before wrapping in a lighter, warmer hug. "Hey, you cared about your friends and family. Nothing wrong with that. And we managed to overcome the coin so I'm sure the next person will too." She kissed him on the forehead. "And you know...if we wanted me to be pregnant again...there are ways to do that."

"Oh yeah?" Jack chuckled, leaning in to kiss Jessica before seeing Zavaleta over her shoulder. "Wait..."

The enormous, naked super soldiers was still squatting with a belly the size of a cluster bomb. Through grit teeth, she was grunting and clenching all of her muscles, sweat dripping off of her pale skin like a monsoon. Against her chest, she held one newly-born infant, its umbilical cord still attached.

"Here...come...number...two!" Zavaleta shouted in a mighty boom, catching the head of a second baby as it pushed out of her birth canal. "Ah, moje dieťa! Ahoj!"

"Did you only cancel my pregnancy?" Jessica said in a panicked voice, turning to Jack.

"N-no! I said everyone since I got the coin!" he said quickly. "Unless...oh no. Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple said we had until we gave birth. The coin didn't undo when people gave birth!"

"So if anyone actually delivered a baby before you did your thing..." Jessica said, nibbling nervously on her fingertips. "We...we better go to the hospital!" Both ran out of the sports bar, leaving the coin alone on the stage as it vanished into the shadows, searching for its next home.

The roads were a mess with ambulances and taxi cabs. Some people got out of taxis, looking down at their flat stomachs with surprise while Jack and Jessica could hear screams of women, men, and babies coming from the backs of some others. Jessica spotted a recently vacated taxi and got in the back seat while it waited in traffic. "Mind if we take this?"

"As long as you pay your fare," the driver shrugged, looking at Jessica in the rear view mirror. "You're not pregnant so I don't know what your rush is."

Jack climbed into the seat next to Jessica. "City hospital, please."

"Easy enough. That's where I was going anyway," the driver said. "But it'll take a while."

"Yeah, looks that way," Jack sighed.


When Jack and Jessica made it to the hospital, it was chaos. Nurses were trying to help patients navigate the floor and people were asking why their bellies had gone away or, more often, why theirs hadn't gone away. Jack snuck past the distracted security to get right into the thick of the maternity ward for the men and women still delivering their babies.

He poked his head into a few rooms to try and find someone he knew when someone called his name. "Jack! Jack!" Behind a curtain, Faye was gripping onto the side of her bed for dear life, covered in sweat, with a big smile on her face. "Jack, look at them! They're my babies!" Two nurses held two wet infants, swaddled in blankets. "I did it!"

"You...sure did," Jack said, eyes bugging out a bit when he saw the head coming out from between her wide-spread legs.

"Whoa," Jessica said, a little stunned. "I saw a lot of videos to prepare but up close...whoa."

"I'm so sorry for everything I did! I was just scared about my family!" Faye shouted again before doubling forward.

"Okay Mrs. Jones, you'll need to focus and push," a nurse said.

"Faye, did you see my mom when you left?" Jack called out as another nurse tried to get him to leave.

"NNNNEXT ROOM!" Faye screamed as she started pushing out her third quadruplet. Jack took her advice and darted into the next curtained area. Sure enough, Amanda was lying in bed, her gigantic belly still towering above her. Jack Sr. was by her side, holding onto her hand.

"Mom," Jack said, a little surprised to see her like this.

"J-Jack," Amanda said weakly, giving him a faint smile. "Good...you're here. And Jessica's here."

"H-hi Mrs. Dale," Jessica said, walking over to her side with Jack. "You're doing...good."

Amanda laughed and looked at her bare belly. "Well, when you get to be my age, child birth is a little trickier. Especially with four of them."

Jack gulped nervously, trying to figure out why she was still pregnant if she hadn't delivered yet. Then he remembered: he didn't flip the coin on her. She did it herself at the flea market before he found the coin.

"Oops," he said to himself as the nurse knelt down by her lap.

"Okay Mrs. Dale, you're fully dilated. I'm going to need a really big push." Amanda grabbed his husband and son's hands and let out a big sigh.

"Here they come," she murmured.



"One month later, health officials are still unsure of what to make of the so-called 'pregnancy disease.' For some, it came and went, and for others, it has been a happy surprise. But life has largely gone back to normal as residents settle in to their new lives of motherhood and fatherhood. Filling in for Mia Vasquez on her maternity leave, I'm Brooke Roberts."

Jack turned off the TV and looked at Jessica, laying in his arms. "Guess they're still going with calling it a disease."

"I don't think they would have been able to understand the truth," Jessica sighed, cuddling up against Jack. "I miss Mia's reporting. She was good."

"And I miss hearing Lisa on the radio but they'll both be back after they adjust to having triplets," Jack said. "Not everyone can be like Faye."

Speaking of which, Faye burst into the Dale's house, pushing two strollers with four babies total inside. "Hel~lo everyone! Hel~lo Jack! Hel~lo Jessica!"

"Hi Faye," they both said in unison, looking up from the couch. Faye was glowing even more than when she was pregnant, clearly ecstatic to be a mother.

In walked Amanda and Jack Sr., each holding two babies. "Hi Faye. I'm sorry, I'm running a little slow. I'm not used to changing a diaper."

"Or four," Jack Sr. added as they put Jack's siblings into strollers. "But a walk will be good. Is Chuck coming today?"

"Yes, we've been going to...marriage councilling and things have been going well. He likes being a father," she said with a little smile. "He'll probably ask you a lot of questions."

"He can ask away. With four, I have a lot of questions too," Jack Sr. said with a laugh as they left the house.

Once alone, Jack and Jessica turned to one another. "How long do you think we have?" Jessica asked him, looking up toward Jack's room.

"Eh, we have Mariah's girlfriend's thing in a few hours, don't we? We should probably get ready for that," Jack sighed, stretching out. "I don't know how Mariah would have handled being a mom."

"At least this soon. Same for your boss, April or whatever," Jessica said.

"Amber," Jack said, correcting her. "I dunno, Tara at my mom's office seemed pretty scared but she seems to be good at taking care of triplets. And my mom's boss enjoys being a new dad though...I'm still not sure how he gave birth."

"Some mysteries we'll never answer, like what happened to the coin," Jessica said, stroking Jack's arm. "Are Ms. Smart and Ms. Apple already out looking for it?"

"No, they're waiting in town for a bit until Ms. Apple gets a handle on her new babies," Jack said. "I wonder if we'll ever learn their names?"

Jessica laughed and looked down at her flat belly. "It was kinda fun, wasn't it?"

"Sometimes," Jack smiled, leaning over to kiss Jessica. "But I'd rather us become parents on our own schedule."

"Uh oh. Then I've got bad news," Jessica said, reaching over and shoving a large pillow up her shirt and cradling it like a belly. "It came back."

Jack shuddered and grinned nervously. "O-oh...what should we do about that? Let's get you upstairs to rest."

"I thought you said we didn't have time," Jessica purred, stroking her fake belly.

"I changed my mind...but let's decide," Jack said, reaching into his pocket and pulling out a quarter. "Heads we wait, tails we go upstairs. Flip a coin."


The End

Jack, stepped on the , wanting to get to the restaurant as quick as legally possible. His mindset was if he could drive fast enough, he could get to his and Jessica's not date before any other distractions presented themselves.. "Once we are at the restaurant, it will all be fine." Jack mumbled to himself.

"What was that?" Jessica asked. "Oh! Uh... Nothing." Replied, struggling to recover. "Just a little nervous is all."

"Well don't be" Jessica said as she cracked a smile. " it's just to friends who haven't seen each other in awhile catching up and having fun. Nothing to be worried about."

"Well, that's a relief." Jack said, nervously laughing. "She thought I was worried about our not date. " he thought, grabbing a drink of water that he usually kept in his car. "Well, I am nervous about that. But I am more worried about this coin, Jessica could wind up like Tara if my theory is correct. No, your being crazy, if it didn't affect her first time, she must be fine, everything is fine." Jack said, desperately trying to dispel his own fears and calm himself down. And he was starting to relax to.

That is, until Jessica leaned over and whispered in his ear in a voice so sultry and carnal that even a priest would fill with lust and desire. "But let's see where the night takes us, big boy."

That drink that Jack took never made it down his throat. Instead, it wound up being choked on by Jack. He almost swerved into traffic, he was so shocked. He didn't see that one coming.

Jessica, for her part, burst into an uncontrollable fit of laughter. "Oh my god that was priceless!" She said, wiping tears from her eyes. "You should have seen your face! I can't believe you fell for that! I mean, come on! Big Boy? Who says Big Boy?"

"Glad to see you find my confusion so amusing." Jack said.
"I do. I really do!" Jessica said, still giggling.
"Well when you are done laughing at your ride home, we are here." Jack said.

It was nice place. Family owned for at least fifty years, it was one of the big staples of Jack's hometown. He and Jessica spent many hours in this place, and he figured bringing her back would be a good start to there not date. It was also near many of the social activities of the town as well, one of which being the laser tag Jessica so desperately wanted. Yes, it really was a nice place, a shame jack wouldn't get to enjoy it that evening.

When Jessica saw their destination, she gasped. "Awwwww! I can't believe this place is still open! I can't believe you took me here! You can certainly pick the right spots can't you?" She said, giving jack a big hug, causing him to blush and his blood to rush to a place it probably shouldn't go for someone on a not date.

There was an awkward moment of staring, until Jessica said "well? Aren't you gonna open the door for me?"
"Oh right! Sorry!" Jack said. And fumbled his way out of the car to open her door for her.

Now Jack was never the most sure footed person around. Heck, he wasn't even the most unsure footed person around! And it only got worse for him when he was nervous. And he had never been more nervous than on that not date. So it was no surprise that when he was scrambling to the other side of the car, he tripped and stumbled to the ground quite unceremoniously.

This brought forth another burst of laughter from Jessica. "Good job, "Big Boy"!" She said. "I think I will let myself out, that way you don't hurt yourself even more."
Oh don't worry, I'm just lay here for awhile." Jack said, mostly to wait for his bright red face to cool down. If only he had gotten up faster.

"Hey look, there's a free coin on the ground!" Jessica said.
"That's great! I guess its yours for now then!" Jack said, the embarrassment of his past blunders and the nervousness of being on this not date clouding his mind on the importance of that statement until it was far too late.

"Hey, I wonder if I can still do that coin trick my uncle taught me." Jessica wondered aloud.

Jessica's uncle had taught her many things, many of which weren't exactly good things. Her uncle was a convicted con man. When she was little, her uncle would always dazzle her with stories of thrilling heists and big scores. None of it was true, but Jessica didn't need to know that.
Her uncle also taught her many cons and tricks to swindle people of their money.
Jessica couldn't remember half the things her uncle taught her. And the half she did know, she wasn't skilled enough to perform. Not that she'd want to anyway.

But the one thing that always stuck in her mind, the one trick she could perform, was a trick that would always help her be the winner in a decision. That trick was how to rig a coin flip to land on whatever side she wanted.

"Let's see if still got it." Jessica said as she turned to the window of the car door to see herself, wanting to see her own skill with her own eyes.

It was then that Jack realized the importance of that earlier statement. His eyes shot open and his hand flashed to his pocket. The coin was gone.
Jack bolted upright and stared at Jessica as it all unfolded before his eyes.

With a flick of her thumb, Jessica launched the coin into the nighttime sky. Jack lost count of how many times it revolved in the air, but he knew it was at least double digits. The coin came down to land on Jessica's thumb, and he caught a glimpse of what he thought was heads, before Jessica shot the coin up again.

The effect was instantaneous. The roundness that Jack noticed about her earlier definitely grew more pronounced. Her belly soon swelling outwards at an incredible pace. The red shirt that covered her torso slowly lost ground to the new front that was the growing orb of flesh.
And her stomach wasn't the only thing growing. Jack could see her breasts slowly increasing in size as well, filling with milk for her unborn child. Jack could almost see the months of pregnancy go by as her womb filled with new life. Seven months, eight months, nine months, she looked to be full term and yet continuing to expand. By the time the growth stopped, Jessica looked vastly overdue. And then the coin landed on heads yet again.

This happened several more times. Jessica would flip the coin high into the air, it would always land on heads, and she would continue her unchecked growth as more children filled her womb. Jack was frozen on the spot, the shock of what was happening keeping him firmly rooted.

As for Jessica, her stomach continued to expand without hindrance. The red shirt that once covered her entire top half had lost so much ground in the war against the encroaching womb, that it was now nothing more than a glorified bra.

Speaking of bras, Jack could hear the snap of her bra as her breasts ballooned well beyond the C cups they were designed for. Now they were easily E cups, and still growing.

On the seventh time the coin landed on heads, Jessica grabbed the coin and smiled to herself in the car window. "I still got it. " she said, and winked to herself.

Jack was stunned beyond words. Jessica was absolutely huge! The red shirt now just barely covered enough of her G cup breasts so as not to be inappropriate, but Jack could clearly see her nipples poking and rubbing against the fabric of the only thing keeping her from being publicly indecent. Her jeans (thankfully not the skinny ones, she had wrestled with earlier today) were fully unzipped and being unzipped by her new gravid belly, again just barely scraping by on decency.

And then there was her belly, it was MASSIVE! Jack had never seen a belly so big. And yet, not a stretch mark could be seen anywhere. Her belly stretched three feet out from her easily.

"Ready to go in and get on with the celebration?" Jessica asked, rubbing her new super belly.
"Celebration?" Jack inquired, not all there yet.
"Yeah, my one year celebration. Most women pregnant with seven children barely make it past twenty weeks, but here I am! On pregnancy week 52! I can still see the doctor's face every time would come in. But he says there are no complications, amazingly, and that the walking and exercise might start up my
Labor, but I highly doubt it. If they'be stayed in this long, I don't think they will come out anytime soon." Jessica explained. "Did you really zone out that much? Never mind, let's just get in there soon, I wanna get as much food as I can, I'm eating for eight you know." And with that, Jessica started making a slow waddle towards the restaurant.

Jack just stood there, wondering what the hell just happened. "You gave her permission, so she can change while you remember." the alien voice said inside Jack's mind. He fished in his pocket to find the coin had magically returned to his pocket. He then remembered what he said to Jessica when she found the coin,"That's great! I guess its yours for now then!" Jack surmised that the coin must have taken that as permission for her to use the coin while he would still remember her as she was before.

Jack was at a loss for words, the only thing that came to mind at first was "so are we still going to laser tag"
Jessica looked back and laughed. " do you honestly think they would let me in there like this?" She pointed to her belly. "They probably don't even have a vest big enough for me. We never discussed laser tag for the celebration, only dinner and a long walk in the park to help start labor, even though it won't work." She said. "Why would you suggest something crazy like laser tag? Doesn't matter let's go "Big Boy" I have to feed eight stomachs!" She said as turned back to her slow waddle, giggling.

Jack now found the perfect words to describe the situation "WHAT THE HELL JUST HAPPENED!?!?" He screamed to the heavens.
