11411121.content:
The previous night - Jack had laid the groundwork for the next day. He called back to work and said he was taking tomorrow off. Now he woke up around 10 o'clock the next morning. He went for his cell phone and called Jess. They set up to meet around 1 o'clock in the afternoon, have some lunch and then go see a movie. Jack was looking forward to this. He immediately went to the shower. Afterward, he got dressed and went down for a light breakfast. On his way to the kitchen, he noticed that his mom was having coffee with Faye. He had a bagel as he listened to them talking - Faye mostly talked about her cravings. He didn't think a woman COULD eat as much as Faye wanted to. Regardless, he left the house around noon.

He met with Jess at the rendezvous point. The two of them made their way to a restaurant. Jess placed quite a large order of several platters and appetizers. Jack was amazed at her appetite. All he ordered was a burger. When the meals arrived, Jess dug in and she didn't stop. Perhaps it was possible for a girl to eat that much. Was he supposed to pay for all of that? He asked her what brought this on. She told him that ever since yesterday, she just had these strange cravings. She saw most of her desires on the menu and couldn't resist helping herself. Jack was grateful that he had uninhibited access to his father's credit-line. But he knew he also had to leave a generous tip.

They soon went to the movies. They both shared a large soda. The movie was enjoyable, but Jack noticed that Jess started to look a little nauseous. He leaned over to ask her if she was alright, when suddenly she vomited all over his shirt! She was so shocked and embarrassed that she ran out of the theater. Jack was taken aback by the incident as well. It made him a bit sick, but he was also a bit concerned. He immediately took after her. He managed to see her disappear into the Ladies Room nearby. He followed her inside and heard her retching into a stall.

"Jess - are you alright in there?" he asked. He was answered by more retching, but soon the sound was joined with sobbing.

"Jack...I'm so sorry," she said between sobs. "I didn't mean to...it was an accident. I'm sorry for ruining your shirt."

Jack gave a light smile. "It's alright Jess. I'm not mad. I'm just hoping that you're okay."

Soon the stall door opened. Jess stood there, dabbing the tears away from her face. She finally smiled back at him. "I-I guess I ate too much."

"Perhaps," Jack said, raising an eyebrow. She looked down at the disgusting stain on his shirt.

"Let's get you cleaned up," she said. The two of them moved over to the sink where they got Jack's shirt as clean as they could. Soon after, they left the theater. It was already late at night when Jack drove Jess back home.

"Jack," she started to say. "I bet you're probably thinking that this was a pretty lousy day. But I just wanted you to know that I had a really good time."

"Really?" he asked in return. "Well, that's good."

"Yeah - and I'd really like to do it again sometime."

"Huh...well...I don't see why not," he said nervously.

"Excellent - I'll talk to you later then. Good night," she said climbing out of his car.

"Wait Jess!" he called to her. "I...just want to know one thing. Was this a Date?"

She looked back at him blankly for a few minutes before smiling. "Good question...I think we should probably figure that out." She suddenly winked at him before closing the door and proceeded to her house.

Jack's eyes were wide and his face was red. He leaned back in his car and took a deep breath. "That...was a Date. A pretty bad date, but still - she's into me."

Whenever he tried to put it out of his head, it was like the coin itself kept bringing him back to it. He'd been hearing voices as if something was in his head, talking to him. The coin was weird. He thought about giving this woman a piece of his mind, but he thought better of it. Needless to say, the Broad got her meal first - after complaining about having to wait too long for them to cook it. Jack had the satisfying belief that the cooks promptly spit in her order.

Jack got his meal patiently like everyone. He just hoped that the cooks weren't pissed off at everyone after that incident. He took his meal and got a seat by the window. But as much as he tried to enjoy his meal peacefully, he couldn't help but be distracted by the same whore that cut in line. When she wasn't bitching about something with her other two girlfriends, she made sounds akin to a garbage disposal while eating her chicken. She was absolutely disgusting with how she ate as well as how she acted. Jack always thought better of himself for his ability to keep his temper, but he was just so put-off by how she'd cut in front of him and everyone else in line. He was half-tempted to going to let her have it.

His old philosophy dictated there was one way to handle this. And he reached into his pocket for the coin. His judgement halted his movement. If he did go over there, then who knows what could happen? She and her friends could flip out on him. But still, he couldn't get over how much she angered him. He wanted to get back at her so badly. As he contemplated, he rubbed his thumb over the coin. He continued to fiddle with the coin, rubbing his thumb in a circular formation over and over.

Flip me, NOW!

After about rubbing the coin five times, he decided. Heads - he'd go over there and tell her to shut her trap. Tails - he'd just let it go. He positioned it and flipped the coin. It spun into the air a total of five times before coming back down.

Don't. Look. Away.

He barely noticed the voice's orders. He never took his eyes off that horrible woman until the coin landed in his hand. He turned his palm down on his other wrist before looking to what it was...Tails.
He sighed - partially relieved that he wouldn't do anything. The Broad probably would've kicked him hard in the balls if he had said anything. So he went back to his chicken strips and fries. The Coin's Decision was Final.

Suddenly - the restaurant was disturbed by a horrendous scream; a shriek of absolute terror. A table was suddenly flipped over. That caused Jack and everyone to look toward the source of the scream. Jack's jaw-dropped. It was the woman who'd cut in front of him. A huge, bulging stomach jutted out from her trashy tank-top. Somehow - her stomach just imploded, instantly. She looked like she was five-months pregnant! She was screaming and freaking out. Clearly whatever this was, wasn't supposed to happen.

Jack suddenly looked down at the coin. What WAS up with this coin? Ever since he'd got it, he'd been hearing voices every time he'd flipped it. But...no way, it couldn't be. He didn't believe in the occult or supernatural. This coin couldn't have caused it. He flipped it while looking at other people and they didn't just...implode with a baby in them! But then he thought about it - the one example he'd remembered was Faye. He flipped it when he looked at her...and the next day, she was pregnant. Extraordinary coincidence. But it took her a day - she didn't just balloon. But then Jack thought. He rubbed the rim of the coin a total of five times. She looked five months pregnant...Maybe that was how it worked. The coin would drop you into a month of pregnancy based on how many times your fingers circle the rim.
But all of this sounded insane. He looked down at the coin thinking all of this was a crazy dream. There was only one way to prove that this was real...he had to test it, and see if the same effect happened again.
114111211.title: A bit of Revenge

choices: experiment on himself, it wouldn't be fair to force another person into this
1141112111.content:
The following morning Jack was sitting at his desk stairing at the bizzare little coin, almost like he thought it would break down and confess. There was little doubt in his mind that all this pregnancy based wierdness started right after he bought the thing at that store, it couldn't have been a coincidence but at the same time it seemed impossible.

"Just what exactly are you?" He asked, he had also done some searches on the internet but there was nothing really prelevant, well except for stumbling on a website that had a bunch of fictional stories about guys getting pregnant, but that was hardly helpful. Jack then picked the coin up and felt it in his hand, it weighed about as much as an old eisenhower silver dollar, and despite sitting on his bedside table all night then on his desk for about an hour now it was surprisingly warm, like it had been in his pocket.

'flip me' the voice came back as it always seemed to whenever it was on his person, the voice stopped when it was on his table but in the back of his head there was this strange tingle that almost made him want to pick the thing up, while the voice was creepy having the coin in his hand seemed to have sort of a calming effect on him.

'flip me' he looked down on it then at the full length mirror on the back of his bedroom door, and odd thought crossed his mind. Would the coin work on men, there was a picture of a pregnant guy on both sides but it wasn't like guys had all the "equipment" to carry a baby or anything.

The wierd stuff seemed to happen to who ever he was looking at when he flipped the thing, so the question is what now?
1141112111.title: Test it Tomorrow

11411121111.content:
While the thought did cross his mind Jack knew better than to go use this thing on someone who wasn't ready to accept the outcome of what happened, so he had little choice than to use himself as a guinea pig. He looked down at the innocent looking coin in his hand, and grips it tightly.

'flip me!' The voice came again, and Jack knowing what he was doing, sort of, flipped it in the air, deftly caught it and then glanced at his reflection in the mirror.

'reveal it!' came the voice, right on cue, Jack knew that whatever came up something weird was going to happen, whether or not it was to him or someone else.

Preparing for the worst Jack closed his eyes, took a deep breath, counted to ten and looked at what came up on the coin.
11411121111.title: morality wins

choices: She catches a glimpse of herself in a mirror - Herself
Nina - She looks at her best friend
Chris - She looks at Nina husband's Chris.
Someone Else - She looks at someone else after flipping the coin
12.content:
What am I doing here? Samantha thinks to herself with a sigh, roaming amongst the tables of the Flea Market.
I know Nina and Chris wanted me to get out and meet someone, but here of all places?

Samantha Peters was a little on the sad side. She just recently celebrated her 55th Birthday alone and childless, after her twenty year marriage to her ex-husband Thomas recently imploded after discovering he was having an affair with a woman literally half his age.

She blamed herself, deep down, because Thomas always wanted children, a lot of children, and getting pregnant and raising ungrateful little brats was something that she never, ever, wanted to do. She hated children, always had in fact, probably due to the fact that she spent the last 30 years teaching, and was exposed on a daily basis on the worst children had to offer.

Still, maybe she could have had at least one child, maybe that would have made Thomas happy. And maybe it wouldn't have left her "golden years" so damn lonely. She came home to an empty house, filled with bad memories, and did nothing. Watched TV, read books, worked on her garden, with only her empty sighs breaking the silence.

It's too late for any of that now She thought to herself, as she continued to peruse the tables, blushing aside a slowly greying strand of her platinum blonde hair aside. Too old she thought. And she was beginning to feel it.

She woke up with crow's feet under her eyes, more and more of her once gorgeous long platinum blonde turning grey, her joints beginning to ache, and her once tight figure beginning to sag, especially her upper regions. Old Maid Samantha she thought to herself.

Her best friend, Nina Weeks, and her husband Chris, had insisted that she join them to this big Flea Market that was in town for the weekend only, hoping to get her out of her lonely cold house, and hopefully meet someone nice. She didn't share their optimism, but she thought it would be nice to get out, even if it was just with friends. She chose her nicest blue sundress she had, and put on a little makeup, and joined her friends for this "hot day on the town".

Her best friend Nina, could not have been more different from her. While Samantha's marriage floundered over a lack of children, Nina and Chris's thrived with an overabundance of children. Four precisely,all boys, the youngest, just heading off to college
a few weeks ago, leaving Nina and Chris alone in their big house for the first time in their lives.

They're lonely Samantha thought. That's the reason they wanted me to come along. They don't want to be alone with each other, afraid to find out if the only reason their marriage worked was because they always had children to think of.

Still, it must have been nice Samantha thought, her mind racing back to her own shattered marriage and loneliness .
After a few more moments of walking around, a bright silver gleam caught her attention on a table next to her; a coin, approximately the size of a quarter sitting on the table. Full of scratches, the strange coin appears to have the image of a pregnant woman, and a...

Strange, the male figure on this coin looks pregnant like the woman. I wonder if this some type of old ceremonial coin? she thought to herself, looking at the coin.

What appears to be a pregnant man and a pregnant woman are on the head of the coin, a happy look on their face, while on the tail end of the coin, are the same pregnant man and pregnant woman, a look of panic and fear on their face.

"Ah, my dear lady. You like the coin?" a voice asks her. Samantha's attention is taken off the coin, to a twenty-something year old man, dressed all in black, wearing way too much makeup and mascara, with several piercings on his face. "At Lavern's Lair Of The Occult, any item you purchase could have powers beyond your wildest comprehension! These cursed, haunted, and otherwise supernatural items come from the deepest darkest regions of Earth" he says, with quite the sales pitch.

"Yes, this quite the strange coin. Where did you get it?" Samantha asks, turning her attention away from the goth man and to the coin.
He looks at the coin for a moment, and then his face goes blank.

"Oh that? I got that some fat guy who was desperate to get rid of it or something. Said it brought him nothing but trouble. Judging by his gut, looked like it gave him nothing but pizza." Lavern says.

Buy Me Samantha an alien thought raced through her head.

"How much?" Samantha asks without hesitation.
"Well, how about a dollar? The guy just gave it to me, telling me to get rid of it forever, but what does he know? He just shoved it in my hand, and then waddled back inside when two of his kids started crying from his house" Lavern says.

Pay for it the alien thought races through her head again.

"I'll take it!" she says, taking a dollar from her purse and putting it on the table.

"Thanks lady. You've been my first customer all day. I was hoping that all this fake mystical crap I got off weirdoes from craigslist would have been more profitable. Oh well" Lavern says, putting the dollar in his money box.

Samantha didn't hear him thought, she was walking in a daze, staring at the coin, running her fingers along it's surface.

"Samantha! Over here!" She's brought back to reality, by her friend Nina, who approaches her. Nearly Samantha's age, she's dressed in jeans and a t-shirt, with the words "World's Greatest Mom" written on it. Her once dirty blonde hair is slowly greying just like Samantha's, but Nina could still pass for mid 40's if she really tried.

Her husband on the other hand, was skinny as a rail, with a short haircut, and wear khaki's and a button up shirt. Slightly younger than Nina, he looked like a stereotypical father you would see on a sitcom, right down to the mustache. Both of them worked together in the same office, where Chris did IT work, and Nina did sales.

"Did you find anything? Some clothes? An antique? A man?" Nina says slyly.
"Oh honey, leave her alone" Chris says, playfully nudging his wife.
"I found this strange coin" Samantha says showing it to Nina and Chris.
"Weird art on it" Nina says.
"It's probably one of a kind. Let me borrow it sometime, I collect coins, I can probably do some research on it for you" Chris says.
"Chris" Nina says, slightly annoyed.

"What? I didn't say now. I said later, after she's had it for a while" Chris says correcting.
"So do we want to hang around here some more? Or should we head back home?" Nina asks Samantha.
"I'm having a great time. I could stay here a little bit longer" Chris says.

Samantha is not hearing any of this though, her attention once again drawn to the strange coin.

Flip Me Samantha. Heads Or Tails. the alien thought races through her head once again.

Without even realizing it, she places the coins on her thumb, and gives it a nice strong flick, sending it high into the air, and then catching it in her hand, closing tight around it.

Look at someone Samantha. Look. the thought charges through her head with the coin in her hand.

Who does she look at?
12.title: Samantha Peters - The Single 55 year old divorc...

choices: Tails - No Reality Change For Samantha!
121.content:
Look at someone. Look the thought raced through her head.

As her eyes lifted from the coin in her closed fist, she caught a glimpse of someone - herself.

Apparently, at that exact moment, a person at another table just put out a huge standing mirror, catching her own reflection.

She looked old. Older than she thought. Every flaw, every wrinkle, every hint of her 55 years on this planet seemed to be amplified back at her in this mirror.

I look so old Samantha thinks to herself looking at her reflection.

Suddenly, the air seemed to grow heavy around her, the faint smell of dust prevalent, her whole body seemed to tingle with electricity.

Reveal it. Heads or Tails! the strange though echoed in her head.

Still staring at herself in the mirror, she unclenched her first, revealing the coin in her hand.

It was...
121.title: She catches a glimpse of herself in a mirror - ...

choices: Fast Pregnancy - Samantha Experiences a 9 Pregnancy starting NOW.
1211.content:
Heads. The side the coin landed on was of a woman and man, both pregnant, but for some reason both had smiles on their faces despite the oddity of the situation depicted.

Reality change! The words calmly echoed through Samantha's head, but she had no idea, and as she gazed at the picture of the smiling man and woman, she could not help but start smiling herself, her free hand finding its way down to her stomach.

"Hey Sam, you alright?" Nina asked her friend with a brow raised in curiosity, "that was a pretty nice catch though!" she added.

"Huh? Oh yeah...thanks I'm fine Nina!" Samantha replied as if coming out of a trance, the smile she had previously going away for a few moments. Suddenly the tingling sensation Samantha had began to feel after catching a glimpse of herself in the mirror seemed to intensify, spreading throughout her entire body.
1211.title: Heads - Reality Change For Samantha!

12111.content:
All of sudden, that warm feeling left her body and settled into her midsection, causing her to jolt, as if she had just opened the door on a cold winter's day, blasting in the cold air. The settling feeling then turned into a pervasive nausea.

"Sammy, are you okay?" asked Nina.

"Yeah, I'm fine, just feeling a bit nauseous...urp!" Samantha suddenly felt incredibly sick, and ran for the nearest bathroom to throw up in a toilet.

"URRGLAGH!" she deposited the contents of her stomach into the porcelain throne. As she spewed away her lunch, the magic of the coin modified her memories. Approximately a month's worth of memories were altered. Samantha now believed that this case of nausea and vomiting was merely the latest in several weeks of off and on sickness. And that wasn't all: according to her new memories, she'd had a sexual encounter about a month ago with...
12111.title: Fast Pregnancy: Samantha Experiences a 9 Pregnancy

choices: Had accidentally dropped the coin! (Follow another coin owner's story.)
Had managed to keep holding the coin! (Follow Samantha until her due date.)
12112.content:
As the tingling sensation worked up to its peak throughout her body, Samantha doubled over and began to moan softly as she clutched her belly. Looking down, she was shocked to find it was growing at a fast pace right before her very eyes. It grew bigger and bigger as she began to rub her increasingly larger abdomen, which was quickly outgrowing the blue sundress she had put on this morning. Luckily, the dress still managed to cover a lot, though instead of reaching down to her knees like it was originally intended to do, it now only came up to the upper part of her thighs.

Speaking of her thighs, those had begun to grow a little bit larger, though nowhere near the extent of her belly, which had long since passed the size of a woman at full term with one, and was nearing the size of a woman almost 9 months pregnant with twins.

As her belly's growth neared completion, Samantha was surprised to feel her butt also gain a little bit of heft, but what drew her attention immediately after was the tightness of her bra, and as she looked down she saw that her breasts were also growing considerably. She had always been a modest B-cup herself, but at this point she looked to be pushing out at around a D-cup, and her poor bra was being put under a good bit of strain as it struggled to contain Samantha's larger assets.

As the growth came to a stop, Samantha gave a sigh of relief, but suddenly she froze as she felt something rock her belly a bit, surprised once again, she looked down to find visible bumps pushing through her sundress, and at the sight of it, only one thought went through her mind?

"I'm...Pregnant?" She whispered tentatively as she watched the passengers inside her womb kick outwards. Surprisingly, as the question left her lips, the words clicked, as if it was just the right way she wanted to be described. "I'm pregnant!" She repeated, but this time it was more of a conformation as she smiled at the notion of her being with child, and the more she told herself that phrase, the more it just felt right to her, as if she couldn't imagine ever not being pregnant. Strangely enough, no one in the market or the stalls had noticed one bit of this, and kept about their business as if nothing was even happening, not that Samantha really cared, as she was taking joy in the children that, to her, had been there since 9 months ago.

"Hey Sam!" A yell broke her out of her happy state of maternal bliss, and she looked up to see it was Nina calling out to her again with a worried look on her face. "You alright?" Her friend asked.

"I'm fine Nina!" Samantha called out to her friend, "just the twins kicking a bit!"

"Jeez, it's like they knew you'd be going out today for some fun time huh?" Nina said with a giggle.

"Yup! These little rascals just can't keep still when they know Momma is getting her exercise!" Samantha said with a chuckle as she give her huge belly a couple of pats, which did little to sooth its active occupant's.

"So when are they due Sammy?" Nina's husband, Chris asked her, "I mean, you look about ready to pop any time now!" He added jokingly.

"Well gee thanks Chris!" Samantha said as she rolled her eyes at the just, "the doctors said my due date was in about a week."

"Well if we're done here, let's get a move on!" Nina exclaimed, "I'm starving!"

"Speak for yourself!" Samantha laughed while clutching the bottom of her inflated stomach, "I'm eating for three here!"

The group shared a laugh as they began to head out of the market, thoughts of having a nice lunch (or huge lunch in Samantha's case) fresh in their minds as Nina and Chris walked, while Samantha simply waddled after them.

Suddenly a man rushed towards Nina and Chris, obviously in a hurry for something, the couple managed to get out of the way, but Samantha, whose movement and center of gravity was hindered by the twins in her womb, couldn't get out of the way in time. And the man accidentally ended up knocking her to the ground, Samantha landing on her side with a thud.

"Hey, watch where you're going jerk!" Nina yelled as the man disappeared into the crowd, while Chris went to help Samantha back up as the two asked if she was ok.

"Yeah I'm good, he just brushed up against my back and knocked me off balance." She explained to her friends, who sighed in relief. "Now we were heading for lunch correct?" She asked, the hunger in her voice quite obvious. Nina and Chris nodded as they all headed out of the market and finally headed off to lunch. However, during the time when Samantha had been knocked down by the man, she...
12112.title: Pregnant Expansion - Samantha's Belly Expands

choices: Fast Pregnancy - Samantha Experiences A 9 Day Pregnancy starting NOW.
Pregnant Expansion - Her belly begins to expand.
1212.content:
Tails. It was tails, the image of the pregnant looking man and woman on the back of the coin with the look of fear and panic on their faces clearly visible.

No Reality Change! the those words echoed through her head, not sure what they meant.

"Wow, impress flip and catch Samantha! Didn't know you could do that!" Chris says, after just witnessing this scene, which to Samantha seemed to take hours, but was in fact, just mere moments.

The tingling sensation in her body, seemed to spread, from her head to her toes, giving her the feeling of being wrapped in a warm blanket.
1212.title: Tails - No Reality Change For Samantha!

choices: Her friend Nina, checking up on her.
Her Ex-Husband, Thomas, wanting to meet her.
12121.content:
All of sudden, that warm feeling leaves her body and settles into her midsection, causing her to jolt, as if she just opened the door on a cold winter's day, blasting in the cold air.

The warm feeling in her midsection continues, forcing her to place her hand on her stomach, and let out a groan.
"Umph" she says.

"What the matter Sammy?" Nina asks her friend.
"I just feel really weird all of the sudden" Samantha says.
"Weird how?" Chris asks.
"I feel really nauseous all of a sudden" she says, her stomach churning.

"Maybe you're coming down with something" Chris says.
"Yeah maybe" Samantha says to herself, the warm feeling in her stomach finally subsiding, but the nausea remaining.

Taking her hand of her stomach, she places her newly purchased strange coin into her purse, and looks back at her two friends.
"So what now?" Samantha asks, fighting off the nausea.
"Well, we can stay here, or head back home" Chris says. "I'm up for staying".
"Me too" says Nina.
"Well then I guess that's settled. Count me to hang around. I mean I found this coin, you never know what else I might fi- - - -HMMPH!" Samantha is interrupted by a sudden, strong desire by her lunch to make a dramatic reappearance. She quickly covers her mouth and takes off running away from her friends, towards the bathrooms.

"Samantha! You gonna be okay?!" Nina and Chris yell out after their soon-to-be-vomiting friend.

She ran. Faster than she ever thought possible, her hand over her mouth, desperatly trying to keep her lunch down. She reached the ladies rest room in record time, probably running into people, and knocking them aside. She bolted through the door, her stomach churning, her mouth full of sick, and knelt before the porcelain god in front of her.

HURK! was the only sound she made, as the contents of her stomach emptied into the toilet bowl in front of her. HURK! She seemed to throw up for a seemed like minutes, desperately trying to keep her fading blonde hair from becoming thick with sick. Eventually, her stomach settled, and she stood panting by the toilet, filled with her (former) stomach contents.

"Ugh" is all she say, trying to catch her breath, and calm down after her puke-a-thon. She grabbed some toilet paper, and dabbed the corners of her mouth, before tossing it into the bowl and flushing it. She picked herself off the floor, and washed her hands and face, feeling calm and relaxed as the cold water splashed on her face.

What was that? Samantha asked herself, as the sudden wave of nausea seemed to vanish as quickly as it came.
A new feeling came over her: Tiredness. Extreme tiredness. She felt exhausted.

I must be getting sick she said, studying her reflection in the mirror. She took a few more moments to collect herself, before leaving the bathroom and rejoining her friends.

"There she is! Samantha! What happened to you!" Nina asks with worry on her face.
"I just had to throw up all the sudden. It was weird" Samantha says, the new feeling of tiredness washing over her.
"You gonna be okay?" Chris asks.
"Yeah, I'm just really tired now. I think I'm coming down with something. I'm going to head home, I'll take to you guys later." She says before hugging her friends goodbye, and heading back out to her car.

"You think she'll be fine?" Nina asks.
"Oh yeah, she can take care of herself" Chris says.

Samantha's drive back was nothing if not uneventful. No more bouts of strange sudden nausea, just an overwhelming desire to sleep. Eventually she pulled into the driveway of her two story house, with a large front-and-back yard, in a nice quiet little neighborhood.

She often wondered why she didn't sell the house. It was a house for people with children, in a neighborhood for people with children, not a house for a single childless divorcee. Getting out of her car, and into her house, she didn't even make it to her bedroom, plopping down on the couch, kicking off her shoes, and falling almost instantly asleep.

Her dreams were troubling. In her dream, she was massive, big as a house, very, very pregnant. She was cooking a large dinner for her other three children sitting at the table, loudly waiting for their dinner, while tormenting each other. "Mommy, is it dinner time yet! We're hungggrryyy!" Her oldest daughter whined, banging her silverware up and down on the table.

"In a moment sweetie! Mommy can only do some much with your little brother or sister inside of her!" She says, stirring the big pot of pasta with one hand, rubbing her belly with the other. Her middle child, her son, sat at the table banging his utensils against his dishes, making an unholy racket, while her youngest child, her second son, sat the table, completely dirty from head to foot, playing with his army men.

She was still the same age as she always was, but now dealing with three very young children, aged 6 -2 with another one on the way. Her house was a mess, dirty clothes and toys everywhere, dishes stacked up in the sink, the TV blaring some children's cartoon show in the other room.

Then she awoke with a start, alone, back in her house, as it always was. No children screaming for food and banging plates. No dirty clothes and toys strewn about the house. No pregnant belly. Just her, alone, as always.

What a nightmare she thought to herself, her dream reminding her of why she never wanted children. Still she said, placing a hand on her stomach and looking down, a faint smile crossing her face. Suddenly, she shakes her head and is brought back to reality. Come on Sam, snap out it.

GROAN! A mighty hunger gurgle comes from her stomach. She was hungry. Very hungry. It felt as if she hadn't eaten for days.

"Well I guess I better get something to eat. Hopefully, I can keep it down this time" she says aloud to herself. She headed into the kitchen, and opened the fridge. Soy Milk, a few pieces of fruit, a couple of old slices of pizza. I really need to go shopping she thinks to herself, seeing that there is very little to actually eat.

Without thinking, as if almost by instinct, she grabs the pizza, and takes a bite out it. Not bad but could use something else she thinks, and begins digging through the cabinets in here kitchen. She didn't have much, just an half-eaten jar of peanut butter (she hated the stuff) and an unopened jar of pickles.

She grabs the peanut butter and the pickles, and begins to apply generous portions of both to her slices of pizza. She grabs the pickle-peanut butter pizza and takes a bite, her mouth filling with a flavor that while many would consider disgusting, she thought was heavenly.

Weird, I hate pickles and I HATE peanut butter, but this tastes so good on this pizza she thinks to herself, adding more pickles and peanut butter to her remaining slices of pizza, and heading off into the living room. She plopped down on the couch, and turned on the tv, searching for something to eat while enjoying her bizarre food mixture.

News, movies, gardening shows, none of these interested her right now as she looked for something to watch. Eventually the channel lands on the image of a very pregnant woman, getting her belly casted, her husband by her side. Oh god, another one of these pregnancy shows. Why is this always on every channel? she thinks taking another bite of her pickle-peanut butter pizza.

She was going to reach for the changer to switch to another channel, but stopped. For whatever reason, she suddenly became engrossed in this tale of this woman's pregnancy. Minutes flew by and the show ended with the woman giving birth, and then another episode of the series came on, following another woman's pregnancy. Samantha continued to eat her pizza, watching the mini-pregnancy show marathon, sharing in the laughs and tears along wit the expectant women in the show.

Three hours passed, as the marathon finally ended, Samantha curled up on the couch, tears running down her face, wearing the widest smile.

Just as she was in her happy place, her phone rang, snapping Samantha out of her daze.
She picked up the phone.
"Hello?" Samantha asked, turning off the tv, now that her program was over.

It was....
12121.title: Fast Pregnancy - Samantha (Day 1)

choices: She goes to bed for the evening - (Jump To Day 2)
She stays up a little longer, doing things around the house. (Still Day 1)
121212.content:
"Good evening Samantha, it's Thomas how are you?" Her ex-husband said on the other end of the line.

Great, this is TOTALLY who I wanted to hear from right now Samantha thinks to herself, letting out a small sigh.

"Hi, Thomas. What's happening?" she says in a disinterested tone. "How's the witch doing?"

"If by witch, you mean my lovely wife Lucy, then she is fine" Thomas says with a stern voice.

"You still cheated on me with her, I think calling her a witch is very nice of me" Samantha says a smile coming across her face.

"You didn't want to have any children Sam, what was I supposed to do? We were" Thomas is interrupted by Samantha.
"Look, we've had this conversation a thousand times. What do you want Tom? Why are you calling me?"
"I want you to meet me for lunch tomorrow at The Velveteen Grill. Don't worry, I'll pay for everything." Thomas says.

"And to what do I owe the pleasure of your company?" Samantha asks.
"I want to discuss the house. I know you got it, but I have a great offer in the works for it, and I think it would be benefit both of us to talk about it." Thomas says.

The house. It's always the bloody house. Samantha thinks to herself, although she couldn't really blame Thomas.

With no-one else in her life, it was simply just too much house. Half of the rooms were empty or being used as storage; no-one young or old to occupy them. Aside from her bedroom, she spent most of her time downstairs, never bothering to at least set-up an office for her. She did all her work on the couch with her laptop.

"Sam, are you still there?" Thomas asked.
"Yes Thomas. Okay, I'll meet you for lunch. I'm just coming to listen, as far as I'm concerned this house is mine, and I'll hang onto it until the day you pry the deed from my cold dead hands." Samantha says, ferocity coming from behind her words.
Thomas sighs on the other end of the line.
"Look, this is a really good offer. Don't be so quick to say no. Just listen to what I have to say tomorrow. You won't regret it I promise." Thomas says.

"Goodnight Thomas. I'll see you tomorrow. Noon." She says dryly and then quickly hangs up the phone.

That felt great She thinks to herself.

She gets up off the couch, stretching her arms high over her head, cleaning up the crusts of her pickle-peanut butter pizza, and throwing it in the trash.

She stifles a small yawn, feeling once again, that feeling of extreme tiredness washing over her.

She been driving for a while...

"Oh my God!" they said simultaneously.

"What's happening to me?!" Nina said with fear, a hand on her belly, trying to make the growing stop.

Samantha could only watch in horror as Nina continued to grow. Finally, it stopped growing, to the point where she looked eight months pregnant, her belly button popping out.

"Ohmygodohmygodohmygod!" Nina said, pulling up her shirt to reveal her swollen belly.

Samantha realized that this situation was identical to Christina's situation hours ago, except that Nina was horrified.

"What did you eat before you came here?" Samantha asked, placing her own hands on Nina's hard belly.

"Nothing! Absolutely nothing! I came here straight after my late shift at work!" Nina said.

"Nina could you...could you be pregnant?" Samantha said, putting an emphasis on the word 'pregnant' for some reason.

"What?! No absolutely not! I haven't had sex in years, and I've had my tubes tied! There's no way I could be preg-" Nina stopped a look of horror on her face.

"What?" Samantha asked.

"Never mind." Nina said.

"What?" Samantha persisted.

"I think I just felt a kick..." Nina said.

This is impossible! How could she be pregnant this fast? Samantha thought.

"Alright we need to get you to a hospital NOW." Samantha said, helping her newly-pregnant friend up from the couch.

Nina attempted to pull her shirt down, but it would only go until just above her belly button.

The two went to Samantha's car, en route to the hospital.

They decided to go the the ER, as this situation was something that had to be addressed now.

Once inside they approached the receptionist, who looked at Nina appalled, for two reasons-she let her pregnant-looking belly hang out in the open, and a woman her age would even be pregnant to begin with.

"What do you want?" the receptionist said dryly.

"We need a doctor for my friend here right now!" Samantha said.

"You'll have to wait in line unless it's an emergency."

"It IS an emergency! I...think there's something wrong with my baby, I need to get it checked out." Nina said, hand on belly.

"Okay, okay! We'll get a nurse to call you over in a few minutes. Just take a seat." the receptionist said, caving in.

The two sat down in the lobby.

"So you're sure you are pregnant, then?" Samantha said.

"I'm almost certain. This thing's been kicking up a storm. You wanna feel?" Nina asked.

Samantha took a moment to ponder.

"Oh...okay." she said, placing a hand on Nina's belly.

Sure enough, Samantha could feel whatever was in Nina's belly kick and punch and squirm. She began to get caught up in the moment, and started to tear up a little.

"You alright?" Nina asked, giving an odd look to Samantha.

"Yep, just a little emotional, that's all."

Damn it, Sam! When you get home you need to stop watching those pregnancy videos! she thought to herself.

"You know Sammy, it's a shame you never got kids of your own." Nina said, beginning to take a liking to her own odd pregnancy.

"So I've been told..." Samantha replied her hands drifting to her own small, mysterious bulge.

A nurse entered the lobby, calling Nina's name.

"Don't worry Sammy, it shouldn't be too long. You can just wait in here." Nina said, entering the hallway with the nurse, leaving Samantha to herself.

Minutes turned into an hour, and it was soon ten o'clock. Samantha's seemingly endless fatigue had really taken its toll on her, and she soon drifted to sleep.
12121211112122.title: Pregnant Expansion - Nina's Belly Begins To...

choices: Samantha (FP Day 3) - No, Nina needs rest.
121212111121221.content:
Her mind raced. What had happened to her friend Nina? How was she suddenly pregnant? And not just pregnant, VERY pregnant?
As she sat in the waiting room at the hospital she just drove her friend to, Samantha sat racking her brain for the answers to these questions, ultimately find nothing.
What just happened isn't possible! A woman doesn't just grow pregnant instantly! She ponders to herself, her hand absentmindedly finding itself resting ontop of her small mysterious bulge in her midsection, giving a small rub.

And yet, I saw it happened TWICE today. First to that hostess. What was her name? Christina. And now to Nina, my best friend, who had her last child pushing forty, and now her she is, damn near my age, pregnant. Oh god. She's pregnant Samantha thinks as the days events finally catch-up to her.
Is she going to be okay? How is she going to react? I mean, she seemed to be enjoying it. She always enjoyed being pregnant, but still, she's over 50! Women her age should not be having babies! How will Chris react?! His wife was not pregnant when she left for work, and now here it is, past ten, and now his wife looks 8 months pregnant! Can they afford another baby? Samantha over thinks to herself, as she covers with mouth with hand, stifling a yawn.

So damn tired. Why I am so damn tired? It's like all I've done these past two days is sleep and eat. I must be coming down with something. Probably the flu. Those match flu symptoms. It couldn't be anything else. I just need to rest she thinks, shifting her body to a more comfortable position, resting her head agains the soft fabric on the wooden chair, and let the sweet siren call of sleep cover her like a blanket.

Another Dream

Blood red leaves fell to the pavement during a violent breeze against the dark red setting sun on that pleasant Autumn evening. These blood red leaves lived an average leafy existence, after all they were leaves, before being trampled into a crunchy red pile by the clomps of the ghosts, ghouls, goblins, witches, and other otherworldly shapes that marched through the neighborhood, tightly clutching their smiling orange buckets.

Each house looked like a scene from a horror movie. Zombie arms reached through the green grass, threatening to grab the first person foolish enough to come close, while the skeletons of dead man hung from trees, front porches covered in massive spiderwebs, monsters, and glowing orange vegetables.

Halloween.

Inside her house, Samantha was putting the final touches on the princess costume her 6 six year daughter was wearing, making sure it fit properly (and safely, most importantly) for the long night of candy-begging that awaited her, and her two younger brothers.
"Don't squirm sweetie, this will only take longer." Samantha says, (awkwardly) trying to bend down to pin the last safety pin into place. It was a difficult move for Samantha, because of how pregnant she was, her massive orb of life making it difficult to completely bend down to her daughter's level.

This halloween, Samantha decided to go with a "sexy" costume, feeling her inhibitions run wild as she walked the aisles of the local Halloween store with her children two weeks ago.

Her six year old daughter wanted to be a princess, which was humorous to Samantha, because she really was a princess, at least to her. Her four year old son wanted to be his favorite superhero from those Saturday morning cartoon shows he loved. Her youngest child, her two year old son, didn't really have a say in what he wanted to be, as Samantha instantly fell in love with a little pumpkin costume that was just his size.

After spending longer at the costume shop than she should have, she finally decided on one of those "Sexy" costumes, which made women look like something, well, something Samantha really wouldn't say. The costume she choose was "Sexy Witch", which was basically knee high stockings, a halloween theme skirt with magic looking symbols on it, then a top which was just basically a frilly bra, and a large pointed witches hat. It was really only the hat that made this costume look like a witch's outfit and not lingerie.

The costume was meant for someone literally 30 years younger than Samantha. It was meant for young wild 25 year old in perfect shape for the exposed midsection piece, not a 55 year old heavily pregnant woman towing around three kids under the age of 10. When Samantha tried it on after getting home from work, she was surprised by how sexy she felt in this vastly inappropriate costume.

The skirt (which only fit after some alterations) hung low and snug around the underside of her mound, while her breasts nearly spilled out over the top. She spent the time between getting home, her children fed, and getting them ready, to paint various Halloween shapes and words on her pregnant belly with some new glow-in-the-dark halloween paint she found in the costume store that said it was safe. Ghosts, cats, pumpkins, witches, stars, and the words "Trick or Treat" "Boo!" "Happy Halloween!" and "Little Monster Inside" were painted along the vast expanse of her gravid belly, which after she was done, had to give herself credit for doing a pretty good job at doing by herself.

After taking several pictures of herself in her halloween costume (a tradition she's done with every halloween costume she wore while pregnant) she grabbed some fabric glow-in-the-dark bags with Halloween pictures on them, and prepare to go Trick-Or-Treating with her children.

Samantha finished up the work on her daughter's costume, and gathered up the rest of her little flock. After a few last minute checks to costumes, and making sure they had their little glow sticks on them, they were ready.

"You guys ready for Halloween!" Samantha says, resting her hands into the small of her back, slightly pushing her belly farther ahead of her.
A cheer went up from her children, forcing Samantha to smile.
"Okay, here are you bags! Now remember, don't run ahead of Mommy! Your little brother or sister makes her move slowly these days! And NO EATING Candy without Mommy checking it first! If I see anyone eating candy before I check it is going to be in BIG trouble! And stay on the sidewalks!" Samantha commands her flock.

"Now let's go!" Samantha says, opening the door and showing her children out the door, with a smile, watching them file out with a cheer. She gives her mound a rub, before turning off the lights to her house and closing the door behind her.

====

She was awoken by a tapping on her should. As she her eyes opened, all she saw in front of her was belly, very pregnant belly, that now belonged to her friend Nina, looking at her, positively glowing, a smile a mile wide across her face, the wrinkles and crow's feet lightly showing around her happy expression. Nina was holding a sonogram in front of her barely covered belly, showing off her new child which she just seemingly aquired some time ago.

"It's a girl!" She says, tears in her eyes. "I finally have my little girl!" Nina was on the verge of tears, as Samantha just started at the picture in front of her. Nina had three boys, the youngest of whom she just sent to college a few weeks ago. While Nina loved her sons, it was no secret to anyone that she always wanted a little girl, and now, she finally has her, growing inside of her, despite not being pregnant hours earlier.

"Congratulations?" Samantha asks, unsure if this is a good thing or a bad thing. Nina rubs her hands across her 8 month pregnant belly, checking to see if
it was in fact real, and it was very real. Samantha could see the kicks and jabs against Nina's skin from her new daughter inside of her. "I'm going to name her Miracle" Nina says with a smile, rubbing her belly.

Nina had changed, her once sagging breasts had seemed to be perkier, heavier, and bigger, and she has seemed to gain some weight, although Samantha couldn't guess where it came from.
"That's a lovely name Nina" Samantha says. "But what about Chris?"

Nina just looked at her new pregnant belly and just smiled, not caring about the world around her.
"Chris knows. I mean he knows now. The doctor called him after the examination, telling him the baby was fine. Everything checked out, she's great. Chris, on the other hand, is a little confused. I tried to explain on the phone, but he seems to think this is all an elaborate prank. I think he's going to come face-to-face with the truth very soon." Nina says, putting her hands on her back.
"Did he seem upset?" Samantha asked.
"A little; also confused. I have the sonogram and the paperwork to show him" Nina says.
"Among other things" Samantha says look down at Nina's belly.

"Well, I think this little girl and I should go home and get some sleep. It's been... It's been a day." Nina says, looking down at her gravid middle.
"I think I'll drive" Samantha says, eyeing Nina.

Hunger washed over her like a wave, her stomach groaning.
Oh come on. I can't be hungry after that big lunch I had earlier Samantha thinks to herself, placing her hand on the bulge in her midsection.
"What's the matter?" Nina asks rubbing her belly.
"Just a little hungry" Samantha says.
"Well, I'm a little hungry too, although for probably different reasons than you" Nina replies, emphasizing her new pregnant frame.
"Nina, you should really get some sleep though. I mean, what's you been through..." Samantha says.

"Food, sleep. I could go for either right now" Nina says, resting her hands ontop of her belly.

Samantha looked at the clock: 12:31 AM.
Not a lot will be open this late...
121212111121221.title: Samantha Fast Pregnancy -  Day 3 Dreams & Joy

choices: The rest of the teachers started filing in.
1212121111212212.content:
She needs to rest. Not just for her sake, but for that brat now inside her Samantha thinks to herself, staring at the pregnant midsection of her friend.
"Come on Nina, let's waddle your butt home. I think food can wait for you. I think you have a confused husband who might want some answers" Samantha says, poking Nina's taut, firm belly.

"Yeah, you're probably right. Besides, I have some pickles and ice cream at home" Nina says with a devilish grin, and pats her pregnant stomach.
Pickles and Ice Cream sounds pretty good right now Samantha finds herself thinking, before shaking her head, removing the idea from her head.
"What was that?" Nina asks, rubbing her gravid mound.
"Nothing, just had a foolish thought". Samantha says, heading towards the door, Nina now waddling behind her.

It was an awkward ride home for Nina. The chaos of her sudden pregnancy, as Samantha could best describe it, had died down, replaced now with a near silence as Samantha tried to keep her eyes on the road, and off her friends pregnant middle. Nina had fallen asleep with her hands resting on top of her life-filled orb, a small flurry of kicks and jabs visible under the portion of her skin that was not covered by her shirt. Catching glimpses of it out of the corner of her eye, Samantha was both enthralled and disgusted at the same time.

Eventually, she made the turn into Nina's driveway, and politely woke her expectant friend up. "Hey Mommy, you're home." Samantha says, teasing her friend. Nina, opened her eyes and drummed her fingers along her belly with a smile on her face. "Thanks Sam, I owe you" she said.
"No, you don't. Besides I think you got bigger problems to deal with tonight" Samantha said.
"Emphasis on bigger huh?" Nina laughed, patting her belly.
"Just keep me informed Nina. This is unusual, and I want to make sure you'll be okay." Samantha said, putting her hand on her friends shoulder.
"I'll be fine. WE'LL be fine." Nina says, looking at her pregnant orb.

She unbuckled her seat belt, grabbed her medical documentation, and then waddled to the front door. As Nina unlocked the door, the lights came on from the master bedroom. Nina entered the house and flicked on the light. Moments later, a very audible "OH MY GOD NINA" was heard, the unmistakable sound of Chris's voice, followed by the sound of breaking glass, Chris dropping whatever it was he was drinking.

Samantha smirked, sorry to miss the show that was about to unfold, but shifted her car back into drive and headed home.
After some time, she found herself in the warm embrace of her bed, and drifted off into a dreamless slumber.

BZZT! BZZT! BZZT!

Her eyes opened what to her were mere moments later, to the buzzing of her alarm clock. which read 5:00 AM.
Oh damn that right. Work's back Samantha thought, remembering that she has to be a teacher again today, after one glorious week off thanks to another made up break due to budget cuts. When the school board told them it was more weeks off from school or less pay, the teacher's union went with more time off.

Samantha sat straight up, and slowly walked her way to the bathroom. For the first time in two days, she didn't feel like puking her guts out.
Small miracles she thought as she prepared for her day. After disrobing, her jaw dropped as she saw that her breasts appeared bigger than yesterday, encroaching the upper C range to low D range, while the small bulge in her stomach was bigger than yesterday. Her breasts were firm, heavy feeling, and started to have visible veins around her nipples, which were larger as well, and taking a deep dark shade of brown.

The bulge was the size of small tennis ball if not larger. When she turned sideways in the mirror, she could see that it started to slope downwards, and the her back appeared to start arching, giving it a distinct curve, and roundness to it.

What in the bloody hell? she thought. Why am I still swelling? I thought with the nausea gone, this flu I'd be fighting would start causing my other systems to go away. she thought. She was alarmed, but some part of her, deep downside inside of her, ignored what was best for her, turned away from the mirror, and took a shower.

After drying herself off, she got dressed for the day, putting on white undershirt, blue sweater, and a pair of black pants. They were very snug against her, so much so, that the waistline of the pants seemed to dig into her potbelly, making her uncomfortable.
"Oh come on" she says out loud, unbuttoning the pants, and trying again. She sucks it in (something she's never had to do before this day) and tries to refasten the button on her pants. She does, buttoning it lower, making the firmness of her pot-belly seem to spill over her pants.

The sweater and undershirt went on fine, but the problem was that her clothing was more snug around her breasts and stomach, the sweater now only covering 95 percent of her, leaving a small section of belly peeking out from under. The sweater and pants seem to make her new "curves" that much more pronounced.

She looked at herself in her dressing mirror, turning to the side to see her profile. God, I'm so fat. she thought, as rush of sadness and emotion sweeping her away, tears forming in her eyes.
"Oh, why am I crying?" she says out loud to herself. She wipes away the tears, and heads downstairs.

Looking at the clock, inspecting her new body has taken her longer than she thought, and was now in danger of running late. She was always early. Letting out an audible swear, she picked up her car keys and prepared to head out the door.

Take Me Samantha an alien thought was back in her head.
She looked over to where she was sitting last night, when Nina's new pregnancy "just happened" as Samantha could best describe it, and saw the coin sitting on the table where she left it.
Strange, didn't I put this in my pocket last night? she thought.

She stared at it for what seemed like an eternity, before picking it up and placing it in her pocket.
Maybe someone at the school could identify this she thought.

She got her things together, and got in her car, heading off to work. Halfway there, she became hungry again, and deciding not to argue with herself, got some drive-thru breakfast sandwiches from the local burger joint. She normally hated fast food, but this morning, it was impossible to resist. She scarfed down every crumb of the two triple-bacon egg cheese sandwiches, a large orange juice, and two sides of good morning fries.

No wonder my clothes don't fit. I'm a fatty she thinks, sadness coming over her like dark rainclouds. As she pulled into the teacher parking lot of Twin Hills Elementary School, her mood was about to go from bad to worse as she saw the cherry red convertible parked in her designated space at the front of the parking lot. The cherry red convertible that she knew belong to Ms. Brooke Edwards, the 26 year old strawberry blonde bombshell that everyone calls Bombshell Brooke, or in some cruder circles of men, Ms. "DD" Edwards.

"Damn her. She took my spot again! That's the third time this month!" Samantha says slamming her first into the steering wheel. She sighed, pulled around the parking lot, and pulled into Ms. Edward's spot located at the very back of the lot. Parking spots were assigned by the years worked at the school, and Ms. Edwards just started this year, while Samantha was fast approaching 30 years.

Thirty years. Thirty years of teaching 4th grade. Thirty years of dealing with children. she thought, the irony not lost on her. She just kind of feel into teaching, not really sure what to with herself. She enjoyed it at first, watching young minds grow and learn, filled with a sense of pride. But the years went on, and the children's behavior steadily grew worse and worse, her workload becoming more and more intense, her class size becoming larger than she should have had to handle. Eventually it got to a breaking point, and she found disdain for both her job and children. She considered quitting, possibly working at a higher grade level, but in reality, she was close to retirement age, put some decent money away, and was quickly counting down the years until retirement.

Tread water until your pulled from the sinking boat she thought as she walked, with some great difficulty into the school, not quite sure what that phrase meant. She walked into the teacher's lounge and sat down to enjoy a few minutes to herself before the rest of her coworkers arrived. She was always one of the first to arrive everyday more so for peace an quiet than job pride.

"Good morning Samantha" a male voice said. She looked up, and her mood brighten considerably, since the voice belonged to Dylan Best, the very handsome 30 year old 5th grade teacher that taught down the hallway from her. Smart, young, funny, kind, good looking, with sharp brown hair, and in amazing shape, Dylan was the type of man she could have literally killed for, if she was twenty-five years younger.

Twenty five years younger Samantha thought to herself. Am I really that old? Am I that foolish to pine for a younger man?
Twin Hills Elementary school was for the young, and she was not talking about the student. Most of the teaching staff were in their late 20's, early 30's, many landing these jobs straight out of school, apart of the school districts desire to revamp education with hip, new young teacher to make kids more excited about learning with someone they saw as a friend. The results were promising.

"How was your break Samantha?" Dylan asked making coffee.
"It was interesting to say the least. I had something odd happen - - - "

Samantha was interrupted when -
1212121111212212.title: Samantha (FP Day 3) - School Daze - Part 1

12121211112122121.content:
"Good morning losers!" was the workday-morning greeting belong to one Ms. Brooke Edwards, the 26 year old strawberry blonde bombshell, that sauntered into the teacher's lounge like a lingerie model strutting down the catwalk.

Ms. Brooke Edwards, was by the far, the least teachery looking teacher in the history of teachers. 6'2, long legged, narrow at the hip, with a 45 DD chest, which had given her the nickname "DD Edwards" by some of her male co-workers, long pink fingernails, and a firm supple rear-end, that was always perfectly outlined in whatever she was wearing, (which, was as little as the school board dress code would allow), she looked more like a high priced supermodel that just walked off the list of "The World's Top 10 Sexiest Women Ever".

She was the school new's gym teacher, making sure all the students at Twin Hills Elementary got their physical activity, with different activities including kickball, an obstacle course, and her personal favorite dodgeball. She was good at her job, even if it looked like she belonged on the cover of some girly mag, and not in the gym of an elementary school.

While her work was great, her attitude was terrible. She was mean, at least Samantha thought so. Not just mean, cruel. Constantly starting bickering matches with other members of the female staff, she would often insult co-workers about their lack of fashion or physical fitness, among other things, while constantly flirting with many of the male staff members at the school, Brooke was more like a Hollywood Party Girl in personality than an educator.

She acted like she owned the place, and truth be told, she probably did. Her father was loaded, and had a habit of making generous donations to the school whenever Brooke became a "problem" for the school board. A few hundred thousand dollars or more, a few new computers or laptops, and any complaints with Brooke (of which were several), seemed to vanish in thin-air. Brooke may have been stunningly beautiful on the outside, but she was rotten on the inside, not that most of the male staff members (Dylan included, Samantha noticed the way he looked at her) seemed to mind.

"Good morning Ms. Edwards" Dylan says, checking out Brooke. Today, her hair was in a long ponytail, wearing a pair of grey sweat-pants that hugged every curve on her lower half, with a skin-tight white t-shirt with the words "Twin Hills Elementary" written on it. Her black lacy bra was visible under the curve hugging white t-shirt. Samantha could see that Dylan liked what he saw. She couldn't blame him, he was a man.

"Dylan, making me coffee? It's like you knew I was going to be nursing a hangover this morning" She says, taking Dylan's coffeecup and taking a huge swig from it. "You're almost marrying material" she says with a devilish grin on her face. "Yeah, too bad your not the kind of woman I wanna marry. You know, the kind that's a decent human being" he says with a smug smile.

Ouch Samantha thought with a grin. "Oh, Dylan, Dylan, Dylan. Who needs a personality when I look like this? Come on, it's the 21st century. Why don't we just give into our basic primal instincts?" she says, in an alluring breathy voice, moving in closer to him, her amazing body brushing against his.
"Your body is amazing Dylan. I know you work out all the time. I've seen you playing basketball in the gym after school. How about you and I get together after work for a little extra credit physical education?"

"Tempting. But I'm worried about what I may catch" Dylan says.
Zing. Smart, funny, sexy. Oh if only I was twenty years younger Samantha thought herself.
"The only your going to catch is my - - - " Ms. Edwards was about to say something particularly vulgar when Samantha stood up from the table.
"Okay, children. I think we should stop this hear before it ends with Ms. Edwards father having to buy another computer lab and band equipment for the school" Samantha says, putting a stop to this conversation.

As Samantha stood up, Dylan and Brooke's eyes fell upon her round belly, slightly visible against the tight contours of her sweater.
"Samantha - - " Dylan says, entranced by Samantha's covered midsection. "What happened to you?"
"It's obvious. She pigged out over break. Oink-Oink!" Ms. Edwards said, thumbing up her nose to make a nose.
Tears suddenly started to form in Samantha's eyes, Brooke's harsh words making her emotional about her weight gain.

"Brooke! That was not okay!" Dylan says looking at her.
"Oh come on, it was a joke Samantha. Don't freak out about it" Brooke says in a tone that makes it seem like she's the victim.
"It's swelling. I've been fighting a sickness for the past few days" Samantha says, fighting back tears and a lump in her throat.
Damn, so emotional right now Samantha thinks to herself.

"Hey, don't cry Samantha. It's barely noticeable." Dylan lies, poorly. "Besides, I think it's kind of sexy. Shows that a woman can enjoy a good meal every now and then huh?" Dylan says, chamingly.
He's just saying that to me feel better. It's working Samantha says looking down at her small round middle-section.


Flip Me the unknown voice races through her head again.

"I'm feeling better. I'm sure the swelling will go down soon." Samantha says, placing her hands on her belly.

The small moment was interrupted when the principal of the school, Ms. Lisa Jacobs, came in. In her mid-40's, she was dressed in a grey suit with a white button up blouse. Her hair, still golden blonde, was up in a bun. Lisa Jacobs was a dedicate career woman, never stopping to get married or have a family. Her job was her husband, and her student were her children, she heard her say on numerous occasions.
"Good morning Samantha, Dylan" She nodded to them, before slowly turning her attention to Ms. Edwards... attire for the day.
"Ms. Edwards, I see you're still pushing the limits of the dress code and good taste around her" Ms. Jacobs said with a stern tone.
"Don't worry boss. I'll make sure Daddy buys us some new playground equipment." Brooke said with a smile.
"Yes". Ms. Jacobs says, rolling her eyes.

Flip Me Samantha the thought ran through her head again.

Ms. Jacobs eyes Samantha's midsection, and her the curves of her bust, and raises an eyebrow. "Uh, Samantha? Something different about you?" Ms. Jacobs asks.
She covers her chest with one hand, and her belly with the other, suddenly ashamed of how she looks.
"Uh - - - " Samantha tries to speak, no words forming.
"Samantha is just having a rough week. She's fighting off something that's causing her to retain water and swell. The doctor says the swelling should go down soon." Dylan lies for her.

"It's nothing serious is it?" Ms. Jacobs asks, genuine concern in her voice.
"Uh - no. Just some swelling and uh - - water weight." Samantha acknowledges Dylan's lie.
"Well, okay. It if gets worse, come see me, so we can get you some medical leave." Ms. Jacobs says.
"More like Maternity leave judging by the size of her!" Brooke says with a cackle.
Emotions begin to well up inside of Samantha.

"Ms. Edwards! What did I tell you about how you talk to fellow female staff members?! My office in 1 hour!" Ms. Jacobs says, her voice raising at Brooke.

Flip me. The voice echoes through her head.
Samantha couldn't fight it. She was on the verge of tears, emotions running through her she couldn't explain. She grabs her purse off the table and begins to dig through it looking for tissues, instead, her hand grabbing the strange coin.

Flip me!
She did.

In one quick motion, she flicked the coin in the air, and grabbed it, with a snatch of her hand.
Look!

She did.

Through her watery eyes, her gaze fell upon..

Through her watery tears, her eyes locked onto Dylan, hoping for some kind of comfort from him.
Say something. Were friends aren't we Dylan she thought, the coin still clutched tightly in her hands.

Dylan, Brooke, and Lisa were staring at Samantha, who just reached into her purse, pulled out a coin, flipped it high into the air, and snatched it within miiseconds, her eyes never leaving Dylan.

There's my friend she thinks, smiling, still clutching the coin. Although I wish it could be more than friends
She may have been 55, but she wasn't dead.

REVEAL IT! the voice commanded her.

She revealed the coin. It landed on...
