Pregnant Expansion - But why wait? His midsection is starting to look puffy.
1212121111212212112.content:
Tails! No Reality Change! the voice boomed in her head.

A sudden chill went through the teacher's lounge, as Samantha stood there, looking at Dylan, holding the strange coin, showing tails.

"Hey Samantha, that's an odd looking coin. Where did you get it?" Dylan asked, oblivious about what was to happen next.

She just stared at him, holding the coin, blank look on her face.

"Samantha, are you okay?" Ms. Jacobs asked.
1212121111212212112.title: Samantha (FP Day 3) - Dylan - No Reality Change

12121211112122121121.content:
Suddenly, Dylan's face went pale, and he grabbed his stomach.
"I don't feel so good..." he said, and sprinted off to the bathroom.

"What the hell's wrong with him?"asked Brooke, sipping the coffee that she took from Dylan.

"He got sick, obviously. Poor guy." Samantha said.
He probably has what I have. I hope that I didn't give it to him. With luck, Brooke will get hit with it, too. she thought.

BEEP!BEEP!BEEP!

Ms Jacobs looked at her watch.
"Oh! Time to work, everyone! Hope you all have a nice day."she said, leaving the break room.

With that, Samantha left to teach her class.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------
Class was...different.

Her bigger belly made it difficult to stand the whole day.
Damn this illness. This belly better go down in a few days... she thought.

Samantha went to sit down.

"Miss Peters, what happened to your tummy?" a student asked.

"Oh...well...I have an illness that causes swelling. So be sure to wash your hands often!" she said, glad that she dodged a bullet.

The hours went on without any more problems, until Samantha's belly began to groan in hunger. She was able to make it until lunch, her hunger growing greatly.
12121211112122121121.title: Fast Pregnancy - Dylan's certainly in for a...

choices: Lisa Jacobs - The Principal. There was change in the schedule.
Someone Else - It wasn't the Principal, it was...
121212111121221211211.content:
The lunch bell's shrill ring was a welcomed sound to Samantha.
Finally, I can get off my feet. Although sitting's also become a problem. Samantha thinks.

While her teaching day was uneventful, it was becoming increasingly more difficult. If she stood for any length of time, her back began to ache, forcing her to sit down. And yet, if she sat for too long, her ankles and feet began to swell, causing her legs to hurt after a short amount of time.

Up, ache, down, ache. This was her routine for the first few hours of teaching. While she received no more questions from her students about her swelling mid-section, she could all see them staring at it, as she stood teaching, the tiny silver of taut belly peeking out from under her sweater.

The students all filled out of her classroom, room 4B, (Fourth Grade classroom B), taking their lunch money or their brightly colored, licensed lunch boxes with them, leaving Samantha alone in her room, in peace and quiet.

The lunch hour was always broken up into two sections: 45 minutes to eat, and 15 minutes of in-door "Free Activity", allowing the students to go the library, or play small quick board games that were in the "cafeteria", although, the cafeteria was officially labeled as a "Activity Area" because of the lunch room having board games, books, and other things for the children to do after finishing eating.

Samantha looked around her classroom with a sigh. It was a disaster, just like it was every day of the school year. Falling into the same routine, she went around the room, cleaning it up. Walking by the desk of one of her best students, Amy, she noticed a scrap of paper left on her desk, with the words "Names For Miss Peter's Baby! By Amy Larson"

In the corner, in a semi-decent drawing, was a representation of Samantha, wearing what she was wearing today, with a pregnant looking belly, with a little stick figure inside. A note above the drawing reads: Miss Peters! I'm so happy you're having a baby, even if you're very old. But old people are nice like my grandma! You will make a great mommy! - Amy

Above two columns listing names for boys and girls is a note:
Miss Peters is having a baby! Her belly is getting big just like when Mommy had my little brother last year. She might need help picking out a name for her new baby!

Some names were listed in each of the columns: Brandon, Cameron, Zayn, Liam for boys, Trisha, Julia, Rebecca, Veronica listed for girls.

Looking at the note, a wash of different emotions came over her, in what felt like a hormonal cocktail.
First was anger.

How dare this little girl make such an assumption that she was pregnant! She wasn't pregnant, shouldn't wouldn't EVER be pregnant.
This was borderline offensive. She told the girl that the reason her belly was getting big was because she was sick. This is was not okay, and she felt as though she should really talk to the young girl about how something like this might hurt someone's feelings. She should also talk to the girl about respecting people's privacy.

Yes, her emotions slingshotted to another emotion: Happiness.
Here was this young girl, who was so happy that her teacher (at least to her) was having a baby, and all she wanted to do was help, unselfishly.
She worked very hard to come up with some very pretty names for her teacher's (pretend) baby, and even signed it herself, letting Samantha know that it was her, Amy, who helped her out.

Without missing a beat, a third emotion hit her: Sadness.
No, she wasn't sad because she wasn't pregnant, no matter how hard this little girl wanted her to be. She was sad at how fat she was getting.
I worked so hard to stay in decent shape my whole life, and I catch some kind of disease and now little kids think I'm pregnant she thinks looking down at her swollen middle.
She was also sad for the little girl. She was so happy that her teacher was going to have a baby (in her eyes), that she didn't even realize that it was impossible for a woman her age to have a baby She was going to be crushed when she told her that she wasn't having a baby, or wasn't ever going to have a baby. That would lead to the next question: Why not? Which always lead to the same answer: Because well, some people don't want to have babies. Some people are content with just being by themselves, and I'm one of those people. This wasn't the first time she had to answer that question.
She was asked that question when she was teaching one of the Nina's three boys when they went here. They asked her why didn't she and Thomas have a baby, because they were married for a long time, and married people have babies.

Thinking back on Nina, she worried about her friend. I should call her during lunch. Find out how she and her... baby are doing Samantha thought, tripping over the words. If nothing else, I should find out what Chris thinks.

A groan of hunger rumbled from her stomach, and she sighed.
"Always hungry! It must be some kind of stomach parasite or something. Probably from when I ate that organic imported fruit." She said outloud to herself.
"Well, I'm already fat enough. I'm just going to go out, eat a like snack, and then call Nina"
She took Amy's little list of baby names, and put it in her pocket. She would have a talk with her later about this.

A few moment later, she was in the "Activity Area" watching the students eat their lunches, talk to each other, play games, and cause havoc.
Whose on lunch duty with me today? She thinks to herself. A few teachers from the classrooms sat at the teacher's table, supervising the chaos that was a daily lunchtime, the rest would enjoy a nice quite meal in the teacher's lounge, trading horror stories for the day.

As she scanned the "Activity Area" she actually was surprised to see Dylan Best, the 5th grade teacher, sitting by himself at the Teacher's table, eating a large meal and nursing a ginger ale. He looked like hell, slightly pale, and his hair disheveled.

"Dylan? Are you okay?" Samantha asks Dylan, as he stuffed several tater tots into his mouth.
"Well, I'm feeling better but not great" he says, drinking down his ginger ale. "I have no idea what happened to me this morning. I came in feeling great, excited to be back teaching, and then I was just talking to you guys, and then I just had this overwhelming feeling of being nauseous. Like boom, out of nowhere, I just going to puke. I managed to make it to the men's bathroom in time, where I heaved my guts out for like 30 minutes. Actually had to get someone else to cover the early part of my class because I was so sick."
Dylan takes a huge bite out of a very grey looking cheeseburger that the school was serving today, mayonnaise, ketchup along with pickles, tomatoes, lettuce, and onions spilling out of the bun. He barely chews his food before shoving more tater tots into his mouth.

"Well, you must be certainly feeling better." Samantha says sitting down across from him.
"It's the weirdest thing. A little while after I puked, I was starving. Like I haven't eaten in days kind of thing. I usually don't eat the junk this school serves you know loaded with fat and calories, I usually bring my lunch, but today, I don't know. This is my second helping of these burgers and fries. It's just so good" He says shoveling more food into his mouth.

Samantha might have been disgusted of how much a pig Dylan Best was making out of himself, but she just gorged herself like this earlier this morning, so she couldn't hold it against him. Besides, he would burn off all those calories in a heartbeat. He was young, thin, and athletic.

Samantha looked at Dylan stuffing his mouth, and her hopes of having a small lunch soon went flying out the window, as she grabbed two of the grey looking school cheeseburgers, some fries, and three little paper cartoons of milk, returning to her seat across from Dylan, and begins to eat her food like no tomorrow.

Dylan raises an eyebrow in her general direction. "Swelling huh?" He asks, referring to her expanded midsection. "I don't know Dylan. I think I might have some kind of parasite or something. I ate some organic imported fruit and probably had a bug in it. Would explain the hunger and throwing up I've been doing" She said, her mouth full of burger.

"Well if that's true, you should get to a doctor." Dylan says, finishing up his meal, and wiping the corners of his mouth.
"Yeah, if it keeps up. But I wasn't puking this morning, so that's probably a sign that things are getting better. What's your excuse?" Samantha asks.
"My niece was staying over at my house over the break, I probably caught something from her. She was sick a little bit." Dylan says.
"You gonna okay?" Samantha asks.
"Yeah, I think so. I'm still feeling a little bit queazy, but if it goes worse, I'll head home and lay down" he answers.
"Okay, if you need to, drop your class of me. I'll figure out something to do with them". Samantha says.
"Thanks Sam. See you around" he says, picking up after his meal and leaving.

Lunch ended all to soon, as Samantha picked up her tray, cleaned up after her mess, and walked back to her classroom.
She saw Amy looking for the baby name note she meant to give her, but Samantha said nothing, instead focusing on continuing teaching, while constantly dealing with the increasing pain in her back, her swollen front, and her aching feet.
She was constantly getting up and down from her desk to teach, her students continually watching her as she struggled to get up from her chair each time, her belly getting in the way.

Damn, maybe Dylan's right. I should get a doctor soon. She thought, her hand absentmindedly brushing her bulge lightly.
After a few moments of up and down teaching, there was a knock on the door.

Samantha turned to see...
121212111121221211211.title: Samantha (FP Day 3) - Lunch Time With A Dad-To-Be

choices: Tails! No Reality Change for Brooke!
1212121111212212112111.content:
Ms Jacobs stood at the door, waiting for Samantha to open the door. Samantha turned to the class as she opened the door.

"Look, kids! It's Principal Jacobs! How are you?" she said, turning to the principal.

"I'm doing well. How are you children?" Ms Jacobs said with a smile.

"Good!" the class replied simultaneously.

"Can I see you outside for one moment Ms Peters?"she said.

Samantha agreed, and escorted the principal outside the classroom.
Am I in trouble? What could she want with me? she thought.

"Unfortunately, Dylan had to go home early today, he was feeling really sick" Ms Jacobs said.

"Oh, well I'm sorry to hear that." Samantha replied.

"He requested that you take his care of his students for the rest of the day. Is that okay with you?" she said.

"Yeah, absolutely. I'll just take them outside or something...'' Samantha said.

"Great! And also, Brooke will be joining you to help out. I hope that's alright?" Ms Jacobs asked.

"That's fine, it shouldn't be anything I can't handle. Brooke is such a bit-uh...beautiful person, I'll enjoy working with her." Samantha said, catching herself.

Miss Jacobs then left to continue her day.

Was this Dylan's idea of a joke to pair me up with Brooke? He know how much we don't get along. Anyway, I have to do this, for Dylan. she thought.

"Class, stop what you're doing-we're going outside!" Samantha said.

The class erupted with joy, as the kids were screaming with delight.

"Okay, okay calm down!" Samantha said, cupping her ears.

She took them outside, which was difficult with her swollen feet, ankles, and belly, but she made it. Brooke was already there, doing exercises with the Dylan's class.

Samantha approached Brooke, pulling her aside.

"What are you doing? I was hoping that we could do something...educational?" Samantha asked, ticked off.

"Just relax! I'm just trying to get these kids some exercise. You should join, you need it, after all." Brooke said, poking the visible sliver of her swollen belly.

That statement upset Samantha, so she walked away, broodingly.

Flip me Samantha the alien thought had returned.

She grabbed the coin from her pocket and flipped it, staring angrily at Brooke from a distance.

Reveal it! the thought rang in her head.
1212121111212212112111.title: Lisa Jacobs - The Principal. There was change i...

Pregnant Expansion-Her normally toned belly was staring to get bigger.
12121211112122121121112.content:
God she annoys me so much! She needs to get what's coming to her! Samantha thought.

Tails! No Reality Change! the voice boomed in her head.

A cold wind blew through the air, seemingly slowing time.

Suddenly...
12121211112122121121112.title: Tails! No Reality Change for Brooke!

choices: Ms. Lisa Jacobs - The single principal in her mid-40's.
Someone Else - It was busy hallway. Another staff member was passing through..
121212111121221211211121.content:
Approximately 34 and a half seconds passed since Samantha flipped her coin, looked at Brooke, and revealed that the coin landed on tails.

During those first 32 seconds, nothing of interest happened. Samantha stood there, shooting daggers at the busty 20-something gym teacher leading a joint-class session between Samantha's class and Dylan's class (who had gone home a few minutes earlier due to sickness that would several days later be revealed to male morning sickness), the mysterious coin still lying on her open palm.

At exactly 33 seconds, Samantha closed her first around her coin, and began the motion to put back in her pocket, while Brooke, the strawberry blonde busty gym teacher, couched the class in a particularly intense game of Capture The Flag.

At 34 and a half seconds, Brooke became nauseous. Her hand went to her bare, perfectly toned stomach, which was glistening with sweat. When this impromptu "field day" started, Brooke changed from her usual "barely there, barely appropriate" school attire, to her "physical actives" attire, which was just a pair of tight bicycle shorts, (which showed off her firm and shapely rear-end), and a white curve hugging belly shirt, with the words "Let's Get Physical" written on it in bright gold glitter.

"Oohhhh" Brooke moaned, suddenly awash in feelings of nausea. She bent over, hands on her stomach, panting deeply.
"Ms. Edwards? Are you okay?" One of the children from Samantha's 4th Grade class asked his Gym Teacher.
"Yeah" Brooke said, taking in deep breathes of air. "Yeah, I think so, I just suddenly feel so nauseous. But, I think I'm going to be fine. Go back to playing, and watch your team's left side, they're going to - - - -" Brooke's hand suddenly went to her mouth at the speed of light.

"MMMMMM!" was all Brooke could say, before lightly pushing the young student aside and running down the field, hand over her mouth, tears in her eyes.

She ran as she fast as she could possibly could. If she was running a marathon, her display of athleticism would have for sure placed her within the top four runners, but alas, this was a race against what would later turn out to be pregnancy-related nausea, and this was a race she was never going to win.

URK! This sound never sounded so sweet to Samantha, who was on the sidelines, watching this scene play out. As she did, one of her hands, absentmindedly found it's way to rest of her swollen midsection, which, to Samantha's surprise, will turn out to be MUCH MORE than it appeared to be, but that story is for later. URK! That was the current story, happening at this exact moment!
URK! The sweet sound continued as Brooke stood in the middle of the field, bent over, head between her knees, puking out her lunch.

"EWWWWWWWWW! Ms. Edward's barfing!" was the collective call of the combined 4th and 5th grade classes, as they all watched Brooke Edwards, the cruel gym teacher, empty the contents of her stomach onto the field.

URK! This was the finale refrain as Brooke finally finished her bought of sickness, catching her breath, wiping away the mess around the corners of her mouth, with the back of her hand.

"OH NO! It got all over my brand new designer sneakers! This were $700!" Brooke screamed at the top of her lungs, a wicked smile forming on the edges of Samantha's face.

This day has suddenly become ALOT better Samantha thinks, stopping one of the children near her, trying to run away from the quote unquote "girl germs" on the field.

"Go get the principal. I don't think Ms. Edwards is feeling very well. I think she needs to go lay down for a while" Samantha tells the young student, who nods, and runs off to find the principal.

As Samantha slowly walked over to Brooke, (her swelling ankles, aching back, and swollen midsection making it harder for her to work than usual) she tried to hide her smile.

Hopefully Brooke caught whatever the hell has been going on around here. She deserves it. Samantha thinks to herself, putting a hand on Brooke's back, who was still bent over, catching her breath.

"You okay Brooke?" Samantha asks, putting on her "concerned" face.
"I think it's stopped. I don't know what the was all of a sudden. It was like I needed to puke my guts out from out of nowhere." Brooke says, standing back up.
"Maybe it was something you ate?" Samantha asked.
"No. I don't eat any of that garbage they make here. I always bring a specially made meal everyday, designed to help me keep my amazing figure. I don't shovel two grey cheeseburgers in my mouth like you and Dylan did today." Brooke says with a bite in her words.
Samantha was taken back. Brooke saw that?

'Oh yeah, I saw you two pigging out on that disgusting cafeteria food. No wonder he got sick, and you - - - Well, let's just say, with you it explains some 'new' things" she says with a catty smile, poking her finger at the slight sliver of exposed firm belly flesh that hugged Samantha's tighter sweater.

Samantha was about to slap the ever loving hell out Brooke, but was unable too as the school principal, Lisa Jacobs, in her mid-40s came onto the field, lead by the student that Samantha sent off.

"Ms. Edwards! I heard what happened! Are you okay?!" Ms. Jacobs asked.
"Yeah, I'm fine.. BUT MY SHOES ARE NOT! THESE WERE DESIGNER! FROM NEW YORK! AND NOW THEY'RE COVERED IN PUKE!" Brooke yelled, clearly more shaken by the loss of her designer shoes than her bizarre sudden bout of sickness.
"Well, shoes or no shoes, do you need to go see the school nurse? Do you feel like you'll be able to continue with the rest of the class session?" Lisa Jacobs asked, assessing the situation and her options.
"I don't know. First I felt like puking my guts out, now I'm tired as all hell" Brooke says, rubbing her eyes, trying to banish the tiredness away.

"Okay, that's it. This class is over today. I'm sending these students to the library for the rest of the day, Brooke I'm sending you home. Don't argue with me! Not today! Dylan tried to power his way through the day, but was puking his guts out in the men's room. I'm sending you home. Hopefully whatever has affected both Dylan and yourself will clear up with some good bed rest. If you're feeling up to it, I want both of back here tomorrow. If not, stay home.
Samantha, I can trust you to take care of these kids at the library? We have some educational DVDS in there with some board games. Just kill time, and hopefully they learn something" Lisa Jacobs says, asserting her authority.

Finally. That's all I wanted to do with these kids Samantha thinks.
"Sounds great to me Ms. Jacobs. I know some great videos they can watch. They'll learn and have fun" Samantha says with a smile on her face.

Flip Me the thought comes racing back to her head at a million miles an hour.

"Okay kids, Ms. Peters is going to take you back inside to the library. You're going to watch some fun videos!" The principal said with a smile on her face.

As Samantha dug through her pocket, and slowly pulled out her coin, she lead her class back towards the school, much to the disappointed groans of the classes, while Lisa Jacobs lead Brooke inside.

Passing through the doors back inside the school, the urge to flip the mysterious coin she bought days earlier, ate at her.
Flip Me Samantha! the voice ordered her.

As Ms Jacobs lead the class towards the library, with Samantha and her gaggle of 4th and 5th graders walking behind her, with poor Ms. Edwards dragging herself at the tail end, a small scuffle between a 4th and 5th grade boy broke out. The shoving match caused a chain reaction, with each student accidentally bumping into the one in front of them, like dominoes.

This lead to little Amy, Samantha's best student to bump into the back of her teacher, which in turn, sent Samantha's coin flying out of her hand.
With a grace that she didn't know she had, (nor that her new swollen figure would typically allow) she burst forward with an outstretched hand and grabbed the coin in mid-air.

"Got it!" Samantha said out loud to no one in particular.

However, little did Samantha know, the coin counted this as a flip, and echoed it's next command into her thoughts.

Look Samantha

She did. Her eyes fell upon
121212111121221211211121.title: Samantha (FP Day 3) - School Daze - Fields Of Fun

"Wow! That was quite the impressive catch Samantha. Two in one day! You're quite good at that!"

These were the words that drew Samantha's eyes off the coin in her hand and onto Ms. Lisa Jacobs, the principal.

As Samantha looked at her, she noticed that her and I were a lot alike. There looks were beginning to fade with age, although Lisa was a few years younger than Samantha. Wrinkles were starting to line her face, parts of her body began to drop, the ravages of age, as they would say.

"Uh, thanks" was all Samantha could say as she looked at Lisa.

Reveal It the coin commanded, the words echoing in her head, loud as a train.

Her hand slowly opened to reveal the coin had landed on...

Pregnant Expansion - Ms. Jacob's belly seems rounder than before...

Tails! No reality change! the voice seemingly cackled in her head.

The air became cold, and smelled faintly off, like burnt plastic.

"Well, I think we should get these students into the library Ms. Peters. I want to bring Ms. Edwards to the school nurse before sending her home" Lisa said, looking at her Samantha.

"Yes. Lets." Samantha said as she started to put the coin back in her pocket.
12121211112122121121112112.title: Tails: No Reality Change For Ms. Jacobs The Pri...

choices: BRING! Time passes and school's finally over.
121212111121221211211121121.content:
As the smell of burnt plastic disputed, Samantha turned to see that Ms. Lisa Jacobs, the single mid-40 something school principal, face had gone pale.
In a motion that she had already seen twice today, Lisa's hand went over her stomach, and she let out a groan.

"Uhhhhhh" was all the principal could say as she bent her head slightly down.
"Oh no. Not again" Samantha said aloud to herself, pretty confident about what was going to happen next.
Exactly six seconds later, Ms. Lisa Jacob's mouth went from her stomach to her mouth, and she took off running towards the large garbage cans they kept in the hallway.

URK! The sound of the principal throwing up filled the hallway, followed immediately by the call of "EWWWWWWWWW!" from the collection of 4th and 5th grade students in the hallway.

"All the adults are getting sick!" one student cried.
"Are we going to get sick too? That would be cool! We could miss school!" another student said.

"Nobody's getting sick! Everyone into the library now! I'll be in shortly!" Samantha said, putting her hand on her forehead.

None of the students followed her instructions, instead watching their school principal throw up into a trashcan.

"Wow! She can barf!" her heard someone say from the back of the line.

Something welled up deep inside of Samantha, a strange emotion she never felt before. It was a deep commanding emotion, stern yet caring. She channeled this to her voice, which itself would take on a tone she never used before.

Normal people would call this the "Mom" voice, but this was all new to Samantha.

"Everyone listen to me right now. Get in that library right now, sit down, and wait quietly until I come back! If one person, ONE PERSON, misbehaves, so help me, I will personally drive your parents down here to punish you! Now MOVE IT!" Samantha says, in the voice that only a mother would use when a child is in serious trouble.

The use of this voice brought all of the students to stand straight up, and march, in complete silence into the library. These students had heard the tone of voice before, and they knew it meant business.

Samantha, this strange feeling suddenly disappearing deep inside her, walks over to the principal, who stood hunched over the trash can, trying to catch her breath.

"You okay?" Samantha asks.
"I think it's over. I mean, I still feel nauseous, but I don't think I'm in immediate danger of throwing up all over the place." Lisa said, between deep breathes.
"Come on, I'll take you and Ms. Edwards to the school nurse." Samantha said, helping Lisa up.

It took a while, but she eventually got Ms. Brooke Edwards, the busty gym teacher, and Ms. Lisa Jacobs, the middle-aged principal, to the school nurse.
"Oh no, not more!" The school nurse said, looking over her new patents.
"More?" Samantha asked. How many sudden cases of violent nausea did she have today?
"Yeah, this flu that's going around is really nasty. I was hoping it would die out, but apparently those signs that I hung up around the school, that said "Wash You Hands to Fight The Flu!" was just a waste of my time." She said with a sigh, putting the two women on the beds.

"So, you've seen this before?" Samantha asked.
"Oh yeah. Nausea, tiredness. Tale tell signs of the flu." The school nurse says, sticking a thermometer into the mouths of the two "flu" suffers.
"What about hunger?" Samantha asks, hoping to finally get a confirmation of her self-diagnosis of her current "illness" she had been suffering from the past few days.
"In some cases, patients can suffer from a loss of appetite, or in some cases, over appetite." The nurse says.

That settles that she thinks, absentmindedly poking a finger on the bulge in her midsection.
"I can take it from here." The nurse tells Samantha.

She nods, and heads back to the school library, feeling better than she ever had in the past few days.
I knew it. It was just the flu. Nothing else. Nothing else. she thought to herself.

She entered the library to find both the 4th and 5th grade classes sitting quietly at tables, doodling on paper, drawing pictures, of just staring blankly.
Samantha let out a smirk. She had no idea what that commanding tone was, but she could get use to using it. It had results.
"Alright classes, with Ms. Edwards getting sick, and Mr. Best going home for the day, we're going to watch some DVD's. Won't that be fun? Now I want everyone to take notes about what they learned from the video. Write your name, and which class your from in the upper right hand corner of the paper. Turn them in when the videos are done. The best papers will receive a special prize from myself and Mr. Best when he gets back. This is going to count towards your grade, so don't goof around!" She says, her voice strong and commanding, as the tone from earlier makes a small resurgence.

She inserted the DVD and pressed play, the music of a popular children's education show starting to blare through the library. The class was immediately
captivated by what was on the screen, only periodically breaking eye contact from the video to jot down some notes.

A small minor pain in her lower back caught Samantha off guard, and she let out a small groan. She placed a hand in the small of her back, giving it a rub.
"Oh man, my back's killing me again." She complained. This was a common occurrence for her today, and frankly she was getting annoyed with it.
She lowered herself into a chair, looking over the two classes she was put in charge of.

Time seemed to be moving slowly, each second that passed felt like an eternity, and yet Samantha sat there, doing her best to manage the two class rooms she had be burdened with.

The clock ticked by, second by second, minute by minute, until...
121212111121221211211121121.title: Samantha (FP Day 3)  - Ms. Lisa Jacob -  Mom To Be

choices: She's feeling exhausted. She decides to go home. (Jump To  Day 4)
She wants to check up on Nina.
1212121111212212112111211211.content:
The shrill ringing of the bell signaling the end of the school day was music to Samantha's ears.
She had no idea how long she was in the library, watching those kids, but it felt like an eternity.

Eventually they all finished the video and their assignment that went with it, but there still time in the school day, so they moved into playing quiet board games or reading to kill the time.

Time was eventually slain, the shrill ring of said school bell signaling the victory of the young students over the monster that was school, as they excitedly packed up their belongings and prepared to head home.

Oh man, I'm glad that's finally over. When I offered to help Dylan with his class, I didn't actually think he'd take me up on the offer Samantha says with a sigh.

She cleaned up the small mess the students had made in the library, grabbed the papers, and put back the DVDs onto the shelves.
By the time she was done, her back with aching again.

With a mighty groan, she put her hands into the small of her back to work on out the kink. Catching herself in the mirror, she was shocked by what she saw.
With her bigger breasts and swollen stomach hanging out of her clothes, she looked radiant, positively glowing, almost.. motherly.

STOP IT SAMANTHA she screamed in her head, trying to stop this train of thinking that had been running through her head recently. It was those damn pregnancy shows she watched. She was going to go home and kill her TV.

"I'm going on a diet first thing tomorrow!" she said sighing and poking a finger at her firm stomach.
She left the library, heading back to her classroom, where she continued the class room clean up, grabbed her things and prepared to leave for the day.
We've got that half-day coming up in a few days she thought. I should treat myself to day out
The half day was one of those state mandated tests, the one's that marked how well or how poorly the school was doing. It was just a huge waste of time, time that could have been spent teaching them something useful, but Samantha didn't have to do much that day except for collect tests to be mailed off, and then get paid for the whole day.

It was a win-win in her book.

As she grabbed her personal belongings and headed out to the teacher parking lot, she passed by the front office, where the nurses station was located.
She paused for a moment, before deciding to check in on Ms. Edwards and Ms. Jacobs.

As she knocked on the door to check up on her co-workers, she was surprised to see the two beds empty.
"Where did Brooke and Lisa go?" Samantha inquired to the school nurse.
"Home. About 45 minutes after you left they each threw up again. I was almost concerned until I brought them some small sandwiches from the cafeteria, and they devoured them nearly whole, even Brooke, who was complaining about calories and saturated fats, but she ate it all the same, well, ate two of them all the same" the nurse explained.

"Yet still they went home?" Samantha asked, confused as they clearly sounded like they were feeling better.
"Policy. Any teacher that pukes twice or more during school hours to sent home to rest, even if they're feeling better. The school avoids liability that way."

With a shrug, Samantha left the nurses office, and headed out to her car. Getting in, plopping her purse in the backseat, she started the car and drove back towards home.

Stopping at a red light, just like many of the red lights she stopped on her way to-and-from work, she grabbed her cellphone from her purse.
I should really check on Nina Samantha thought. She couldn't even begin to imagine what her friend was going through.
Going from not-pregnant to 8-months pregnant instantly for no apparent reason was beyond strange to say the least. While Nina seemed to be alarmed at first, she seemed to accept her new expectant state well, despite she was now in her early 50's and very pregnant.

While she never cared for children, she was concerned about the health of Nina and her new unborn child. Nina was one of her closest friends, and if something happened to her she would be devastated.

As she contemplated looking dialing her friend, she looked out her driver side window to see a very sexy, very pregnant 22 year old brunette standing at a bus-stop in skin tight jeans and white shirt, that seemed to make every single curve on her body that much more pronounced. Her belly was massive and hanging out, the bright tan belly flesh visible under the way to small t-shirt that read "I make this look good".

She certainly did, even if it was extremely inappropriate to be wearing something like that in her condition. She was rubbing her vast, taut pregnant belly with a smile on her face, striking a pose only a model could, her dark black sunglasses hiding her eyes, her hair blowing in the wind.

As she watched the drop-dead sexy pregnant woman rub her pregnant belly, Samantha absentmindedly removed a hand from the steering wheel and placed it on her own firm bulge. As she began to rub it, her eyes closed, becoming lost in a tide of emotions. Joy, excitement, a feeling of being whole, and dare she say, maternal feelings.

She was snapped back to reality by the blaring of the car horn behind her, demanding her to go as the light had changed to green.
"Move it grandma! Some of us have places to be today!" The jerk behind the wheel yelled at her.
She looked over at the pregnant woman, who noticed her and smiled, and Samantha waved back before driving on her way.
"Tomorrow I'm not only going on diet, I'm going to see a shrink" she said to herself outloud.

As she got farther away from the school and closer to home, she thought about dropping by to check on Nina.
Yet, all of the events of the past twenty-four hours began to weight heavily on her.

She decided...
1212121111212212112111211211.title: Samantha (FP Day 3) - When The Working Day Is Done

choices: She ran into some of her co-workers from yesterday.
Nope, her coworkers from yesterday were still out sick.
12121211112122121121112112111.content:
I'm so bloody tired Samantha thought, making the left hand turn towards her home.
While she concerned for her best friend Nina, they're wasn't much she could do for her. It's not like she could undo the mysterious pregnancy that seemed to befall her 50-something friend. Beside, Nina seemed to be enjoying her pregnancy, and the doctor said it was a healthy pregnancy, so there was nothing to worry about right?

She pulled her car into her driveway, got out of her car, opened her door, and threw herself onto the couch.
It felt great to lie down. Her ankles were swollen and hurting, her back ached like she couldn't believe.
She grabbed one of the extra pillows on put it on her back. It was like floating on a cloud. All the pain and pressure on the small of her back was gone.

"Oh that's better." She aloud to herself. She looked down at the small bulge that had taken up residency on her midsection. It was round, very round, and very, very firm. Slowly she lifted up her sweater to take a look at it. It was like a little dome, round and smooth. Looking at her middle while laying down it's small roundness caused a little bit of her block to be viewed. She ran her hands over it, exploring it.

"This has to be swelling and weight gain, but it feel different, it feels like - - - It almost feels like Nina's belly - - " Samantha said to herself, realizing what she was saying.
Could I be pregnant? she thought. No. That's impossible. I haven't been with anyone in years, and my doctor said my childbearing days were behind me. But this, this can't just be - - - It's just like Nina. I mean Nina wasn't pregnant until last night. I mean could I - - - she tried to push the thought to be the back of her mind.

"Samantha, stop scaring yourself. You can't be pregnant. Your doctor said you couldn't get pregnant even if you tried. You're too old. You're too old and nobody wants you." Samantha said getting up off the couch and heading up the stairs into her bedroom.

She disrobed, dressing down into her bra and underwear. ignoring her reflection in the mirror, and crawled into bed, turning out the light.
She was still going to bed in the early evening, the clock barely reading six o'clock. She didn't care. She wanted to sleep everything away. Her mysterious swelling, her friend Nina, the illnesses of her co-workers. All of it.

She laid out her back for a few moments before her back began to bother her again, so she switched to her side, burying her face deep into her pillow, waiting for sleep to overtake her.

She dreamt a dreamless sleep.

She was awakened not by an alarm clock, but a light fluttering in her belly. It was like a butterfly was trapped inside her. She awoke with a gasp, flinging the covers of her bed aside, turning on the light.

She nearly screamed.

Her belly was bigger. MUCH bigger than yesterday. It was like someone shoved some kind of overinflated ball into stomach. She put a hand on it, and it was very firm, just as it was yesterday, but so much bigger. It was causing her plain panties to dig uncomfortably into her new large mound, the elastic
and fabric stretching across her new expansive middle, giving it a very round shape.

Her breasts were bigger, like oversized cantaloupes, spilling out of her bra uncomfortably.

Then she felt it again, a light fluttering from inside her. She sat motionless, her hands cupping her belly, waiting to feel whatever it was she was feeling again.

She waited for a few moments but no more "fluttering" could be felt. Eventually she lifted herself off the bed. She felt like she weighed a ton. Standing up, she placed her hands on her new enlarged middle and explored it, mapping every curve.

She walked, (more like waddled) over to the mirror, and inspected herself for every angle she could she. She belly jutted forth like she smuggling some kind of ball under her skin, firm and round. Her skin was shiny, and she thought she could see little red lines forming on the sides of her skin and belly.
She placed her hands into the small of her back, and pushed her stomach forward.

It looks pregnant. I look pregnant. But it's impossible! I haven't been with anyone in years! I'm too old! I hate children! I can't become a mother! she screams inside her head, looking for explanations and reasons to deny what was quickly becoming obvious to anyone who saw her.
"I'm not pregnant! I'm not pregnant!" she keeps telling herself, even as she ran a hand over her new round middle.

She was on the verge of tears as she walked into her bathroom, got cleaned up, and came back to get dressed.
I'm not pregnant. I can't be. It's not possible. she thought, as she tried to cram her into regular clothes.
She was going with a button up blue blouse, that was, if it would fit.

She could button the middle just fine, but she it very difficult to button the top and bottom of the blouse. The bottom buttons would not come together over her new larger belly, while the top would not button due to her new "assets". After struggling for several moments, she decided to leave her top buttons undone, showing off some very firm and very ample cleavage, that would put most 20-something supermodels to shame.
Even Brooke would be impressed with theses "things" Samantha thought to herself, cupping her sensitive ample bosom.

She struggled with the bottom buttons for a longer while, and finally managed to get them to hold together, but just barely. The buttons were under some serious strain, small patches of her tight belly poking through the gaps between the buttons.
And then there was the tiny problem that the blouse decided to not fully cover her new round orb, only stopping halfway down her belly, the rest exposed for the world to see.

Her pants barely fit, and hugged the underside of her belly snugly, her belly spilling out over top. It was not comfortable.
"Forget the diet, I'm going to the doctor first thing tomorrow" she said, disgusted by what she in the mirror. She turned away from her expectant looking reflection, heading downstairs.

The stairs took her longer than usual, her sudden new weight gain, as she called it, left her breathless as she reached the bottom steps. She put her hands into the small her back, causing her belly to be pushed forward again, and increasing the strain on the buttons of her blouse.
"I'm so hungry, but I'm so big. I really shouldn't eat" she said to herself in a debate she ended up losing.
Digging through her pantry, she poured herself two large bowls of cereal with an apple she found in her vegetable crisper. She woofed down the two bowls with a ferocity she didn't know she had, letting out a small belch after she was done.

She closed her eyes for a moment, and her hands came to rest on top of her belly. She was alone and scared. She had no idea what was happening to her body, and no one there to calm her down. She felt like screaming, like running out into the middle of the street, ripping off all her clothes and asking the world about what was happening to her.

She didn't of course. She instead cleaned up mess, and got ready to get to work. She had a job to do, and she was going to do it.
Maybe with a little luck, she could get some help from someone she worked with.

She longed to see Dylan. Dylan knew everything, he could tell her what was wrong.

She waddled out to her car, and tried to get in, finding her seat far to close for her to fit inside. She moved the seat back from where she kept it for years, and got in the car. Her breasts and belly seemed to rest onto of each other, her clothes straining as she drove the car.

After what seemed like an eternity, she finally pulled into the teacher parking lot of Twin Hills Elementary.
She pulled into her parking spot, parked, and heaved herself out of her car.
"Either Brooke parked in her own parking space today, or she's still sick" Samantha said to herself.

The fluttering from inside her started again, her hands instantly going to her belly with an OMPH! She held her belly, waiting to feel it again, to try and get a grasp on what it was, but nothing happened. It was gone as quickly as it started.

"Just gas" she said to herself, refusing to accept the obvious truth.
She opened the door to the school, and entered the teacher's lounge.

It was there that...
12121211112122121121112112111.title: Samantha (FP Day 4) - The Quickening

choices: She ignored it enough - She called the doctor immediately
Denial, Denial, Denial - She decided to check up on Nina.
121212111121221211211121121112.content:
The lights were on but nobody was home; so to speak.
As Samantha entered the teacher's lounge, it quickly became apparent that Dylan Best, 5th Grade Teacher, Brooke Edwards, Gym Teacher, and Lisa Jacobs the principal were not in today. Instead, she saw the regular staff hanging out in the teacher's lounge, drinking coffee, exchanging small talk, and just going about there day-to-day business.

Fully entering the teacher's lounge, she felt everyone's eyes fall upon her. The women looked upon her with a smile on their face, while some of the men couldn't take their eyes of her ample bosom.

"Samantha... Is there something you would like to share with us?" One of her younger female co-workers asked her, her eyes looking at her round middle peeking out behind the strained buttons of her blouse.

"Not really. It's just swelling. I have a doctor's appointment tomorrow" Samantha said, feeling very sensitive about her expansive middle.
"Sammy, I don't think that's swelling. If your embarrassed about being pregnant at your age, don't be. I think it's great! I've seen the way you are with your students, I think you're going to be a great mom!" Her female co-worker came over, and rested her hands on the side of Samantha's belly, with a smile on her face.
"So are you having a boy or a girl? What do you want? I know most women just want a healthy baby, but come on you have to have a preference. What's it like being pregnant at your age? How did you keep this secret from us for so long? How do you feel? Are you going to tell your student today? Do you have any names picked out yet? When my sister was pregnant she - - - "
"GET YOUR HAND OFF ME! I'M NOT PREGNANT! NOW LEAVE ME ALONE!" Samantha shouted at the top of her lungs, pushing the hands of her female co-worker off her belly.
"Samantha, I'm sorry. I just assumed" The female co-worker began.
"Well don't. Now where is everyone else?" Samantha asked, her mood for the rest of the day soured.

"Dylan's out sick." A male co-worker said, his eyes casually drifting over to the amazing cleavage of Samantha.
"Still?" Samantha asks, sitting down awkwardly, her belly making it difficult.
She had that fluttering feeling inside her again, but she ignored it the best she could.
I'm not pregnant Samantha chanted inside her head, trying to ignore the obvious.

"Yeah, guy called in this morning. Said he was puking his guts out this morning, and that his chest was sore. Probably has some kind of infection" One of her male co-workers said, taking another bite of his donut and drinking his coffee.
"Lisa's out sick as well, said she was puking her guts out this morning as well, and she didn't get a lot of sleep last night. She said she had odd dreams" Another co-worker informed her.

"And Ms. Edwards?" Samantha asked, worried if the trifecta from yesterday would be complete.
"She's not here yet. She probably won't be. You know Ms. Princess, she only works when she feels like it. She probably doesn't feel like it today." Another co-worker said.

That was true Samantha said, her hands cupping her heavy middle under the table, out of eyesight. Brooke doesn't work when she doesn't feel like it

The bell rung signaling the beginning of the school day, and Samantha, with great effort, got up from the chair, and walked to her classroom.
By the time she got there, her ankles were already swelling and her arching back was sore.
She placed her hands on her back giving it a rub, and then opened the door.

All of her students stared at her as she walked, more like waddled, into the classroom, with her hands pressed into her back, which caused her belly to stick out even further.
"Good morning class" she said as she walked to the front of the class.
"Good morning Ms. Peters" the class said in unison.

"Everyone take out your homework from last night and put it on your desk please. I'll be shortly to pick it up" She said standing at the front of the class, both hands pressed into her arching back.

One of her students raised a hand. "Ms. Peters?" The student asked.
"Yes?" She said.
"How come you're having a baby? I thought old people couldn't have babies." The student said.

A wave of emotions once again washed over Samantha. Anger, sadness, happiness, she felt the entire emotional spectrum at once. After a few moments, she collected herself and answered the young students questions.

"Like I said yesterday, I'm not having a baby. I'm just sick" she said firmly.
"But my mom is pregnant, and your belly looks just like hers!" the young student said.
Samantha looks down at her round middle, feeling something stirring inside her.
She placed her hand on the side of her tight belly, as her class stared at her.

It was becoming harder and harder for Samantha to deny what some many other people had been pointing out to her: She was pregnant.
Samantha tried to push back against the obvious, going through elaborate mental gymnastics to find some reason, any reason, that she wasn't a single 55-year old divorcee who was now mysteriously pregnant.

"I'm happy that your mom is having a baby, but I'm not. Now enough talking about this. Turn in your homework and take out your books please" she said.
Amy, the student she caught yesterday coming up with a list of baby names for Samantha's "Baby" raised her hand.
"Yes Amy?" Samantha asked.
"Can we pretend you're having a baby?" Amy said with a smile.
Samantha let out a sigh, her hands absentmindedly rubbing her belly.
"Fine. But that's only in the classroom okay? And when I've said pretend time is over, it's over okay?" Samantha says.
"Now, let's stop talking about this and learn something"

The class continued on as normal could be, except for the increasing pain in Samantha's feet and and back, her increasing need to go to the bathroom, and the mysterious stirring inside her. Lunchtime came and went, Samantha once again finding it impossible not to stuff her face with two helping of turkey, mash potatoes, gravy, and macaroni and cheese.

As the day progressed, the stirring inside her intensified, Samantha finding herself rubbing her middle to get it to stop.
As the final bell of the day rung, Samantha let out a relived sigh, finally happy to get this day over with.
Her students were none stop through the day asking to feel her belly, playing their "Miss Peter's Pretend Baby" game as she called it.
They would talk to her belly, put their ear against it, poke it with their fingers, all while saying things like "Hello Ms. Peter's Baby! How are you in there? Treat her good, Ms. Peter's is really old!" It annoyed her to no end, but she let them have their little moment.

As the rest of the students left, she walked around the room, picking up the mess, her back still killing her.

As she bent down awkwardly to pick something up, she felt it.

THUMP.

It wasn't a fluttering this time, and it certainly wasn't gas. It was a firm solid THUMP from inside her, feeling like her stomach was dropping out in a roller coaster. Her hands instantly went to her belly, and she felt it again, stronger than before.

THUMP.

It was a kick. A baby's kick.

HER baby's kick.

Her mind went blank as she stood there, feeling her unborn child kick firmly inside of her.

"This... is.. impossible" she said to herself, moving her hands along her belly, feeling the kicks.
"I can't be pregnant. I haven't been with anyone in two years. My doctor said my child bearing days were over. This can't possibly be what I think it is" she said as explored what she was now sure was her pregnant belly.

THUMP. Another firm kick.

As she stood in her empty class room, trying to rationalize what was happening, she made a decision.

She could either accept the facts and make a doctor's appointment, or she could try to continue to deny the truth.
121212111121221211211121121112.title: Samantha (FP Day 4) - Ignoring The Obvious

choices: She wanted to check up on Nina.
1212121111212212112111211211121.content:
Another firm THUMP from her unborn child sprang Samantha into action.
Moving as quickly as she could, she reached into her purse and pulled out her cellphone.
She dialed the number for her doctor, and stood waiting as she was waited for the phone to be picked up on the other end.

RING. RING. RING.

She listened, a phone in one of her hands, her other hand resting on her belly.

Her pregnant belly.

"Come on! Come on! Pick up! Pick up!" She shouted nearly at the top of her lungs, the truth of her "condition" quickly becoming more and more apparent to her.

RING. RING.

"Hello? Twin Hills Medical Center. Is this an emergency? If so, please hang up and dial 911 immediately. " The nurse on the other end said plainly.

Is this an emergency? It sure as hell feels like one. 55, single, and mysteriously pregnant. Samantha thought to herself, looking down at her midsection.

"Hello?" The person on the other end said.

"Uh yes. Hi". Samantha said hesitantly.

I should hang up. This is ridiculous. There's no possible way I could be pregnant. But still she thought, moving her hand across her midsection.

"How can I help you?" The nurse stated in an annoyed tone. Clearly this call wasn't proceeding as quickly as they had hoped.

"I need to make an appointment with Dr. Kristen Harper please, as quickly as possible, like now if possible" Samantha said as she felt another sharp THUMP from inside her.

"Dr. Harper has gone home for the day. I can check to see if she has anything for tomorrow" The nurse said.

"FIRST THING TOMORROW." Samantha said, her voice somewhat demanding.

An annoyed grunt from the other end of the phone, as Samantha sat down at her desk with great difficulty.
She rested a hand on top of her mound, drumming her fingers lightly as she waited.

i should have done this two days ago. She thought to herself. What am I going to do IF I am pregnant? I hate kids. I never wanted kids. I'm 55 and single. This is a nightmare.

"Hello?" The nurse on the other end of the phone said.
"Yes?" Samantha replied.
"I have an appointment tomorrow when she first comes in at 9."
"That would be perfect" Samantha thought.
"Who is the appointment for?" The nurse asked.
"Samantha Peters. I'm a regular patient of hers." Samantha replies.
"And what is the appointment about? I need to put it on your chart and her morning notes" The nurse asked.
"Uh" Samantha said.

Do I lie? She's my doctor. I should tell the truth, but who would ever believe me? But at this rate I don't think it's going to matter. I think it's going to be obvious to anyone who sees me Samantha thought to herself looking at how her belly was sitting in her lap, the strain on her blouse visible as firm belly flesh poked through between the buttons.

"Samantha, what is the appointment about?" The nurse asked.
"I think..." She said slowly.
This is it Samantha. Say the words. Stop ignoring the obvious She thought to herself
"I think I'm pregnant" She said, the words, once spoking feeling like a great weight lifted off her shoulders.

The tale-tell click and clack of keys on a keyboard could be heard from the other end of the phone, followed by a pause.
"Ma'am is this a prank call?" The nurse said suddenly very annoyed.
"No." Samantha said, knowing what was coming next.
"Ma'am according to our files, your 55, I find it highly doubtful that you're pregnant" The nurse said.
"Please, I'm very very sure I'm pregnant. Could you just please schedule the appointment?" Samantha said.
"Fine. She'll see your first thing tomorrow morning." The nurse said before hanging up the phone with a click.

Samantha put the phone down and placed her hands on the side of her belly.
"Well, I guess that's that. Kid, I don't know if you're actually in there or I'm just going crazy, but we'll find out tomorrow." Samantha said.

When she didn't receive a reply she sighed.
"Samantha, you're talking to your fatness. You've gone crazy." She said to herself, heaving herself out of her chair and gathering up her belongings.

She waddled out towards her car, moved the seat back, got in and drove off.

As she traveled the familiar path towards home, her mind once again thought back to her friend Nina.
I should really check up on her.

And she sat at the red light, Samantha decided that
1212121111212212112111211211121.title: Samantha (FP Day 4) - Making The Call

choices: She should leave. This is getting uncomfortable.
12121211112122121121112112111212.content:
I should really visit Nina. Just a quick visit. Samantha thought, turning on her blinker and making the turn towards Nina's and Chris' house.
It took her a few moments, but she finally pulled into the driveway, and as she did she noticed that Chris's bright red new sports car he just bought was missing.

Instead, in it's place was a bright blue mini-van, brand new, a pink ribbon still tied to the grill. It did not take long for Samantha to guess what happened.
"Chris loved that sports car. He considered it a gift to himself as an end of parenthood" Samantha said looking at the mini-van.

She saw herself in the reflection of the car's still "show room floor" clean windows. She turned to see her profile, and it was obvious she was pregnant.
"If I walk to the house like this, I think Nina will have a bigger heart-attack than Chris" she said, putting her hand on her belly.

She walked back to her car and opened the trunk. She always kept an oversized winter coat in her trunk for cold weather emergencies or snow, this seemed like a perfect time to use it. She put it on, buttoned it up, and put her purse in front of her. Checking her reflection in side-view mirror, the coat did an admirable job of hiding what was obviously her pregnant belly. Sure her midsection looked a little bigger under the coat, but she could probably pass it off without raising too many questions.

She walked back to the house, and knocked on the door.
Several minutes later, heavy, almost angry sounding foot steps approached the door.
"I'm getting the door Nina! Just like I'm getting to do everything around here!" It was Chris's voice. He was not a happy camper.
"Don't give me that excuse! I saw you get up for ice cream, peanut butter, and apples, I'm sure you could get up to answer the door!" He was shouting back at Nina.

The door opened with a mighty force, revealing a haggard looking Chris standing at the doorway.
"What?!" Chris yelled, oblivious to Samantha's existence.
"Hi Chris" Samantha said sheepishly.

This was a mistake coming here Samantha thought instantly looking at Chris.
"Oh hey Sam. How you doing?" Chris asked.
Oh just peachy.I'm probably pregnant at 55 and on my own. Oh and did I mention I hate kids? She thought to herself.
"Just fine" she lied.
"Well that's good. We were worried about you after a few days ago" Chris said.
"I was more worried about Nina. How's she doing?" Samantha asked.

Bad Question Samantha asked.
"She on the couch. Why don't you see for yourself." Chris was clearly not happy about this situation.
Samantha entered the house, and made her way to the living room, where she hear the TV blaring loudly.
As she turned the corner, she saw her.

She looked like a beached whale in sweatpants and a bikini top. Nina was laying on the couch with a pillow on her back, slurping down a huge bowl of ice cream, staring blankly at the TV. She was wearing grey sweat pants that hung low around her massively pregnant belly, which looked even bigger than Samantha remembered it.

Probably a mixture of laying down and pigging out for the past few days Samantha thought to herself, surveying the carnage. Junk food containers littered the room, along with a stack of what appeared to be brand new pregnancy books, (mostly dealing with pregnancy at an older age), her laptop, which had a recent photo of Nina on it, doing the classic pregnancy pose on it as her background.

A stack of movies were next to her, along with the remotes, and some half-written letters stuffed with more photos of Nina's current pregnancy.
She was wearing a blue bikini top that did nothing to conceal the massive pregnant belly of her over 50 year old friend, her belly shining in the light. She had a dark line going from the top of her belly to the bottom through her popped out belly button vertically, and the sides of her belly were covered in bright red stretch marks.

Her skin was tight like a drum, the movements of Nina's unborn daughter visible under the skin.
"Samantha! You came to visit us!" Nina said, putting down the bowl of ice cream, and resting her hands on her massive 8 month pregnant belly for emphasis on the word "us".

"Hey Nina, how are you doing?" Samantha asked, her eyes not leaving Nina's massively round pregnant belly.
"Oh we're doing fine!" Nina said with a smile, giving her belly a pat.
"Well, one of us is" Chris said loudly, sitting down in his chair across from his very pregnant wife, who has taken up all the room on the sofa.
"Oh Chris, would you stop?" Nina said, rolling her eyes.

Samantha was at a loss for words. Her friend Nina was taken to her new sudden pregnancy quite well despite being close to the same age as Samantha. She looked happy, as she watched TV her hands resting on her massive pregnant orb.

"So how are you doing Samantha?" Nina asked with a smile.
Nina seemed more youthful, radiant, even if the bikini she was wearing showed too much skin that told a different story. Her greying hair was up in a pony tail, and it looked healthier too. Her breasts that were once sagging, were now much more firm and bigger. She was glowing, as they say.
"I'm fine. Saw the new car out there. Nice mini-van" Samantha said.
"Yeah, can't drive out new baby around in a sports car. Not safe, so I had Chris trade it in for a mini-van." Nina said.
"Which was great, because we traded in the old mini-van for a sports-car for us because we done with children, but whoops! Now we had to trade the sports car back in for a more expensive mini-van. But hey, at least they put a pink ribbon on the grill right?" Chris says with a mean tone.

"Samantha just ignore him. Have a seat" Nina says gesturing to an empty chair in the living room.
Samantha sat, hoping her secret wouldn't be exposed when she sat.
"You look great Nina" Samantha lied to her friend. She looked like a whale.
"Thanks, I feel great. I missed being pregnant. I forget how great it made me feel" Nina says, rubbing her pregnant middle.
"Glad you feel great Nina. Because that's how every pregnant 50-something should feel. Not panic or anything" Chris says sarcastically.

"What is your problem Chris?" Nina said, resting her hands on top of her bare stomach.
"That's my problem Nina!" Chris said angrily pointing at Nina's pregnant belly.
"I get a call in the middle of the night telling me that my pregnant wife is fine, and next thing I know you're showing up waddling with a massive pregnant belly. You give me this long complicated story about how "you just grew pregnant" that I'm just supposed to believe? Women don't "grow" pregnant Nina!"
"What do you want me to say Chris?" Nina says yelling at her husband.
"I want to admit that this is some kind of hoax! Some kind of sick elaborate prank you've played on me ever since I made you get your tubes tied." Chris shouts at his wife.
"Oh don't you dare bring up this again. You know for a fact that this!" Nina says, pointing at her massively pregnant belly "Isn't a hoax! You've felt our daughter in there! This morning I put your hand of my belly, and you felt OUR daughter kicking around!"
"That's not my kid!" Chris shouts at her
"Don't you dare say that again!" Nina gets up from her laying position, standing up by jutting her belly forward, and bracing herself against the furniture.
"Why shouldn't I? It's been a while since you and I have been together!" Chris is practically hurling his words at Nina like daggers.
"Does that matter?! I named her Miracle for a reason Chris. She's a miracle! A baby given to us to change our lives!" Nina says, rubbing her pregnant belly with her hands.
"Change your life! Not mine! I was done having kids! Our kids were out of the house, getting ready to start there own lives, and now look at you! "The baby's kicking, my back hurts, my feet are killing me, I'm hungry again" Chris says in a mocking tone.
"Nina, I love you more than anything, but we're supposed to be living our lives right now. We're getting close to retiring. We talked about working less hours and getting out more, seeing the world! Doing everything we always wanted to do before we had kids!" Chris continues.
"Nina, I don't want this new baby your having. I think you should give it up for adoption.

"I'm not giving up this baby Chris! She's our miracle!" Nina says, wrapping her hands around her midsection.
"She's your miracle! Nina, I'm done with kids! No more ballet practices, parent-teacher conferences, dirty diapers, midnight feedings, no more temper tantrums in crowded stores" Chris continues, listening off the reasons.
"Chris, you said you always wanted a little girl!" Nina responds back.
"Yeah, years ago. But we're older now, the boys are gone. Did you even think about what to tell the boys? They'll be here visiting in a few days. They're going to be here a whole month! How are we going to explain this to them?" Chris asks.
"I -uh. I don' know." Nina says looking down at her pregnant belly.
"And did you think about the costs? We gave away all your old pregnancy and baby stuff! We're going to have to rebuy all new things! There's childcare, doctor's visits, all the toys she's going to want, school fees, college! Nina, we can't afford this baby! We're going to work until we're 90 at this rate!" Chris is practically shouting at her.

"I KNOW CHRIS! I'VE THOUGHT ABOUT ALL OF THIS! ALL I KNOW IS I'M HAVING THIS BABY! I'M HAVING OUR BABY! I just want some support right now! I'm going through a lot right now! I mean, I wasn't pregnant last week and now look at me! I'm old and pregnant Chris! I just wish you could understand what I'm going through!" Nina shouts tears in her eyes.

Samantha shifted uncomfortable in her seat. She should really leave, but she wanted to be here for her friend.
12121211112122121121112112111212.title: Samantha (FP Day 4) - Nina's Joy; Chris's Anger

choices: Tails: No Reality Change For Chris.
121212111121221211211121121112122.content:
As Chris and Nina exchanged volleys in their war of words, one single lone thought raced through Samantha's head.

Flip Me Samantha the voice commanded her.

She obeyed it without question, her mind going blank as she reached into her purse and pulled out the strange coin.

"Chris, I just want you to know what I'm going through! Of course I'm scared! Of course I'm worried about what's going to happen! I'm nearly Samantha's age! I know how crazy it is to have a baby at that age, but I'm having it anyways! I want this baby! And you should want it too!" Nina screams at the top of her lungs.

"But I don't want it! You know what I want! I want peace and quiet! I want to be able to go anywhere at anytime I want! I want to ENJOY my golden years, not raise another child!" Chris yells back at his pregnant wife.

Placing the coin unto her thumb, she gave it a mighty flick into the air, snatching it mid-fall and wrapping her hands around it.

"You don't honestly mean that!" Nina yelled.
"I do! I don't want to raise this child! If you want it so bad, it's your responsibility! You have it, you take care of it, you raise it! Me? Maybe I'll just be out enjoying the rest of my life!" Chris yelled.

Chris's harsh words instantly drew Samantha's eyes to him.
How could he be so cruel? He wasn't really going to leave his wife was he? She thought to herself.

Reveal it Samantha

She opened her hand to reveal the coin.
121212111121221211211121121112122.title: Irony, thy name is about to be Chris.

choices: Rapid pregnancy - Chris gets to his wifes point in a few days
Expansion - Chris gets to his wifes point now
1212121111212212112111211211121221.content:
'Reality change!'

The voice called out in Sam's head, as the air around Chris starts to waver and warp like he was the subject of a fun house mirror, and from the looks of things Samantha was the only one who could see it, seeing as the two continued to argue like this wasn't happening.
1212121111212212112111211211121221.title: Heads: Reality Change For Chris.

choices: Stay here and try to make sense of this
Go home and sleep the madness off
12121211112122121121112112111212212.content:
After the voice in her head made its announcement, Samantha can't help but gape at what started to happen in front of her, time seemed to slow down and speed up at the same time, as Chris's body began to transform, first his stomach started to bloat out, growing bigger and bigger by the second, then after a few seconds his chest started to grow too, getting to somewere in the mid-b cup range before stopping, then other parts of his body like his thighs his butt, and so on grew and shrunk in response to these changes, and finally his clothes seemed to melt and then regenerate into, oh god is that a mumu?

Then when all the changes are done, time restores to its normal flow, and oddly the loud angry arguing from before had sudenlly changed and now Chris was sobbing like, well like a hormonal woman, while Nina was doing her best to hug him with both their bellies in the way.

"It's just we went through all to sign me up for this experiment, and I was supposed to carry our new baby, then you go and do this, I just don't understand." Chris managed to say between his sobs.

"There, there honey I know, it's been rough on you, and I'm sorry but I promise you, while I don't really know where my baby came from, we can get through this together." Declared Nina while tears streamed down her own face.

And all trough this Samantha just stood there and stared at what just happened, now her best friend and her husband were pregnant, and they were acting like Chris was the one who was supposed to be pregnant, it was just to much, what was she to do?
12121211112122121121112112111212212.title: Expansion - Chris gets to his wifes point now

choices: Fast Pregnancy: Chris will know what his wife is going through. 9 Days!
Pregnant Expansion: Why wait? Chris is starting to round in the middle.
1212121111212212112111211211121222.content:
Tails! No Reality Change! the voice boomed in her head as she continued to look at Chris.

"You'd leave me?!" Nina says, tears filling up her eyes.
"Yes. No. I don't know. Nina, this is a lot to take in. I just don't know anymore." Chris says putting his hand on his head.

Samantha stared at Chris.

This was man who was torn between what he wanted to do and what he needed to do.

They agreed to "for better or worse" and this was quickly becoming "for worse" at least in the eyes of Chris.

"Nina, I know I said some things, but I love you that's all that really matters" Chris says, lowering his voice.
"Then why are we arguing? You love me, I love you, and soon we'll have a new baby to love us." Nina says softly, her hands going to her belly.
"But Nina, I don't want this baby. I want us to retire, to live it up. We can't do this with a new baby" Chris says.

This argument was quickly going in circles.
1212121111212212112111211211121222.title: Tails: No Reality Change For Chris.

choices: Samantha stays for dinner and a movie.
12121211112122121121112112111212221.content:
"Chris, we've argued about this for the past few days - - -" Nina said, waddling closer to her husband.
"I know. We'll probably argue some more." Chris said. "But I just need you to see things from my point of view" he finished.
"And I just wish you could just know what I'm going through and realize we need this baby!" Nina says softly.

In a moment that I'm sure the universe deemed hilarious, due to Samantha's coin flip, Nina was going to get her wish, and then some, because at that exact moment after Nina said the exact words "And I just wish you could just know what I'm going through and realize we need this baby!", Chris's hand went over his mouth as he experience a sudden and violent bout of nausea.

He ran out of the room to the downstairs bathroom, where he loudly began to puke violently.
"Just like him to fake getting sick to get out of argument. He's done it before." Nina says, gently plopping her massively pregnant form back onto the couch.
While it was true that on precisely one occasion Chris faked an illness to end an argument with his wife, (an argument that was never actually resolved and remains unresolved to this very day), this bout of illness was not fake.

It was quite the opposite in fact, as Chris's nausea was actually caused by the fact that he was now pregnant with triplets. Chris's pregnancy would be a huge shock for his wife, and even more so for Chris himself, but that story is a short ways down the road.

For right now, Samantha just sat in shock as she just watched what was a very uncomfortable argument between her best friend and her husband.
"Is he going to be okay?" Samantha asked, oblivious to the truth of the situation.
"Oh he'll be fine." Nina said, assuming her relaxing position on the couch, her pregnant belly sticking high into the air.
"You don't think he's going to leave do you?" Samantha asked.

"Oh don't be ridiculous" Nina said with a scoff, her hands resting on her pregnant belly.
"I know he said a lot of things I didn't want to hear, but in the end he'll stay."
"Are you so sure of that?" Samantha said.
"Of course. He's just having a man tantrum that all his plans for the future have been changed because of our little Miracle" Nina said, rubbing her pregnant belly.
"So, you're still sticking with calling her Miracle?" Samantha asked trying to change the subject.
"Of course. She's our miracle! Our baby from nowhere.. but" Nina said, her voice trailing off.
"But what?" Samantha asked.
"I feel bad." Nina asked.
"For naming your only daughter what sounds like should belong to woman who takes her clothes off for money while men hoot at her on the stage?" Samantha said with a catty tone. She was loving this.
"Oh ha-ha. Pick on the old pregnant woman. Very funny. No. I feel bad for Miracle well, she won't have anybody to play with her own age." Nina said, looking at her belly.
"What do you mean, when she gets to school age, she'll make lots of friends" Samantha says.
"Not if she's anything like my boys she won't. I just don't want her to be lonely. I kind of wish she could have some more siblings to play with" Nina said.

Little did Nina know, Miracle would have several siblings to play with.

"Look, if having a kid at your age is crazy, I don't want to know what having another one is when you're older" Samantha said,
"I'm mean not now. I meant I just hoped she could have come sooner when some of the boys were younger that's all. I just want to her have a brother or sister her own age that should could always have by her side, you know?" Nina said.

Once again, Miracle would in fact have two sisters and a brother to play with as she got older, thanks to her father who was currently working on them, unbeknownst to him.

"I don't know Nina. You know I don't really like children. All this is foreign to me." Samantha says, trying to ignore what she was almost 100% sure was her unborn son or daughter inside of her.
"If you had children you wouldn't hate children. Trust me on that" Nina says.

A loud flushing sound from the bathroom signaled the return of Chris who stood at the door rubbing his (for now) flat stomach.
"You alright honey?" Nina asked, looking at her husband over her massive pregnant belly.
"Yeah, just felt really sick all of sudden. Don't know why". Chris said.
"That's been going around the school where I work. Probably a bug or something". Samantha said looking at Chris.
"Yeah probably." Chris said sitting down back at his chair.

"Well, I'm hungry again" Nina said, patting her belly again.
"You know, oddly enough I'm starving." Chris said, unaware of what was happening to him.
"You hungry Samantha?" Nina says looking over at her friend.

{I am pretty hungry Samantha thought to herself.But you could cut the tension in here with a spork. I should probably leave
"I am hungry, but I should really go." Samantha says, making a move to get up.

"Oh don't be like that! Stay for dinner! We're having.." Nina looks over at her husband.
"Well, I was going to make something with Chicken, but you know, I have the most bizarre craving for pizza" Chris said.
"Oh Pizza sounds so good right now! I haven't had it in forever!" Nina says, lightly tapping her hands on belly like a drum excitedly.

Pizza does sound fantastic right now Samantha thought to herself.

"Well" Samantha said hestantly.
"Oh come on Sam. Stay have some Pizza with us. We'll get it delivered, we'll watch some of these movies I had Chris pick up for me. It'll be great, we'll all hang out just the three of us. I mean, we won't be able to do it once little Miracle arrives" Nina says with a smile.

Samantha weighed her options.
12121211112122121121112112111212221.title: Samantha (FP Day 4) - Apathy To Empathy Belly.

choices: She went straight to bed. (Jump To Day 5)
She stayed up a little later. (Continue Day 4)
121212111121221211211121121112122211.content:
I should stay. Nina really wants me to. I know I won't be able to see her much once she has that little brat inside of her Samantha looking, staring at her friends massive pregnant belly, which was squirming as the child inside moved.

"Oh what the heck. Dinner and movie sounds great." Samantha said, Nina beaming with happiness.
"Fantastic! Chris, would you be so kind to order the pizzas?" Nina said, looking over at her husband, who sat in his chair.

"Yeah. What does everyone want on the pizza?" Chris asked.
"Pizzas. Plural. This little one and I could finish off an entire large pizza by ourselves." Nina said rubbing her pregnant belly with her hand, with a smile on her face.
"Okay, how many pizzas should I order?" Chris asked, picking up the phone.
"3?" Nina asked looking over at her friend.

Samantha thought for a moment before a well placed THUMP inside her gave her an answer.
"Four." Samantha said, trying desperately not to place her hands on her own enlarged middle as her friend Nina was doing.
If I really am pregnant, this little brat inside me is trying to make me fat. If I'm not, then I have to have some kind of parasite or something Samantha thought to herself. There was some part inside her that was fighting off the very obvious truth that she was pregnant, because facing that truth would put her in a position she didn't want to be in.

"I better make it five. Just in case. I'm starving." Chris said. Samantha noticed that he had placed a hand on his flat stomach, which was unusual.
Chris finished placing the order, and then sat back down after placing the DVD inside the player.
