It was one of the generic romantic-comedies that the movie industry seemed to make every year. This one was called "40 Years 40 Weeks" which Samantha had never heard of before. It was about a single 40 year old business woman who becomes pregnant after a one-night stand with a much younger co-worker. It was cookie-cutter plot; busy business woman meets attractive new co-worker at an office party, has a one night stand, and gets pregnant, and the two decide to remain friends, but slowly fall in love, and eventually end up together after overcoming great odds and make a happy little family.

Halfway through the movie, (when the business woman, now half-way through her pregnancy and started realizing she was falling in love with her younger co-worker) the pizzas arrived.

Chris got up from his spot, payed for the food, and placed the food down on the coffee table. Everyone grabbed slices of pizza and dug into the food with such ferocity, it looked like something from a nature special where the pack of predators ripped apart their prey as fast as they could.
Chris, who had not been feeling well earlier, ate with extra ferocity, nearly finishing off a whole pizza by himself. Nina on the other hand, did finish off a whole pizza by herself, while Samantha ate more than her fair share of the hot greasy meal.

As the movie came to an end, with the very pregnant business woman going into labor after getting the big account for her company, and getting proposed to by her younger co-worker, all that remained of the food was a pizza and a third. Just before the credits rolled, the business woman was celebrating the first birthday of her child with her husband, when the camera pulled back to reveal that she was pregnant again.

"Oh, what a cute movie!" Nina said, resting her hands on top of massive belly. "It was okay. I mean, it had some funny moments, but I've seen this same story a million times" Chris said, giving his review of the film.
"What did you think Sam?" Nina asked her friend.

I really liked it. Maybe there's hope for me and Dylan Samantha thought. She was found of Dylan, but she was always afraid about the age difference between them would "make it weird" as the younger generation put it.
But come on Sam, look at you. Your 55 and getting older, parts of you and wrinkled and sagging, and you might be pregnant. You're hopeless her negative thoughts came back to her again.
"It was okay. I wasn't crazy about the pregnancy angle to the film, but I laughed a few times" Samantha lied.
Maybe it was the fact that she might be pregnant, the idea of a woman that old having a baby spoke to her. Awakened something deep inside her that she thought she buried deep down a long time ago.

"Oh Samantha, your always so negative about everything that has to do with pregnancy, babies and kids. Lighten up. They're not so bad. Beside, you ate like a pregnant woman tonight." Nina teased.
Samantha tried to fight the urge to place her hands on her belly which was hidden under her large coat.
No one can know. If I am pregnant, I don't want anyone to find out. Not until after the brat is born and I can give them up for adoption she thought to herself exploring her options.

Although, what other options were there? Have the kid and raise it? She hated kid. She couldn't be a mom.
Could she?

"Well, should I put on the next movie?" Chris asked.
Nina looked over at Samantha, who just shrugged.
"Put it on!" Nina says, rubbing her pregnant belly.

Chris put on the movie and sat back down. It was another generic drama about a clean cop in a dirty city and the corrupt police chief out to get him.
Samantha thought it was better than the last movie, but that wasn't saying much.

The movie continued on, and the hours grew late. Samantha looked over to find Nina as sleep on the couch, a smile on her face her hands on her pregnant belly.

She better enjoy that sleep while she can get it Samantha thought.

The movie was just about to end as she looked over to Chris, who hand fallen asleep in his chair.
Strangely, he had a smile on his face, both of his hands resting on his stomach.

Hmm, I wonder what he's dreaming about Samantha thought.

The movie came to an end, and Samantha was the last person standing, as her friend had drifted off to sleep.
She looked at the clock, and it was pushing 11PM.

Quietly turning off the TV to not awaken her friends, she stood up and unbutton her coat to reveal her round belly.
With a sigh, she snuck out the door, locking it behind her.

She got into her car, and drove off towards her home.

As she pulled into the driveway, she let out a little yawn.
She stayed up later than she usually did, but it was worth it to be with friends.

Walking into her house, she thought about what she should do.
She could stay a little while later, or she could go to bed.
She did have a doctor's appointment early the next day.

She decided...
121212111121221211211121121112122211.title: Samantha (FP Day 4) - Pizza & Preggos

1212121111212212112111211211121222111.content:
I have the doctor's appointment at 9, I guess I should get some rest... Samantha thought to herself.

She waddled into her bedroom. Slowly, Samantha unbuttoned her shirt and took off her pants to reveal her pregnant-looking belly. Dressed only in her tight bra and panties, she sat down heavily on her bed, it creaking under her increased weight. Sighing, she placed a hand on her tight belly, rubbing it slowly.

"This makes no sense!" she said out loud. "Even if I am pregnant, how am I this big this fast?" She shook her head in disbelief. "I guess I'll find out tomorrow..." she said, giving the side of her belly a pat. She was responded with a strong THUMP. "Great..."

Samantha pulled the sheets on top of herself and quickly drifted off to sleep.

Dream

"Kids! Come down stairs, your relatives are here!" a very pregnant Samantha called out to her children.

It was Thanksgiving. A time to get together with family, watch football, and ,more importantly for Samantha and her unborn child, to pig out. Samantha was dressed in maternity jeans and a tight t-shirt which read "Fully Cooked!" on it. Samantha was nearly at her due date, as her massive belly and popped-out belly button had indicated. Quite often, it was clearly visible that her child was moving around freely against her skin.

Her young children made their way down the stairs wearing nice clothes. "Do we have to dress like this?" her oldest son asked. "Yeah! We feel stupid!" her daughter said.

"Come on, you look nice! Just be glad you aren't like you're little brother or sister, who isn't wearing a thing!" she said, giving a hearty belly laugh.

"Eeewww! It's naked?!" her daughter said.

Before Samantha could respond, there was a knock at the door. Samantha slowly waddled to the door and opened it to a wave of family members. Her parents were first, and were thrilled to see her.

"Sammy! You look great! How's the baby?" her mother asked, rubbing her belly.

"We're doing fine!" she responded.

"When are you due, again?" her father asked.

"VERY SOON..." Samantha said, arching her back for emphasis.

After all of her relatives piled inside, Samantha announced, "Who's ready to eat?"

=====

THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP

Whatever was inside Samantha's belly wanted her to get up. She slowly removed the covers and was shocked at what she saw. Her belly, like yesterday, was much bigger than before. It was if she had swallowed a basketball. Although her breasts had slightly grown, it wasn't much.Samantha looked at the clock, and saw that she only had thirty minutes until her appointment.

"Crap!" Samantha said, slowly getting up. She waddled over to her closet to quickly decide on what to wear. The only pants that would fit were some old sweatpants, and she was forced to wear a t-shirt that rode up to show most of her belly. Although she was getting a bit hungry, she had no time because the doctor's office was thirty minutes away. Running late, she left the house as fast as she could waddle.

The car ride seemed to take an eternity. The thumping in her belly had increased and was more frequent, and she could swear that she could feel it in multiple places at once. A hand on her belly and a hand on the wheel, she was able to make it to the doctor's office with moments to spare. She entered the office, her big belly leading the way.

Samantha approached the desk, signing in. The secretary looked at Samantha from over the computer, and was in awe at her pregnant-looking form. "Oh my...Doctor Harper will see you in just a moment. Please take a seat. Please" the secretary said, her mouth agape.

She didn't need to be told twice. Taking a seat close to the door, she sat down heavily. Everyone in the waiting room was staring at Samantha. Yep. They all think I'm pregnant. Join the club she thought. Minutes later, a nurse entered the room.

"Samantha Peters? Wow..." the young nurse said. Samantha sighed and got up, following the nurse into the back rooms. The nurse led her into the room and told her to take a seat on the examining table.

"So...being pregnant at your age must be...interesting..." the nurse said. The nurse was in her mid-20s, with long blonde hair and green eyes.

"Actually I'm not pregnant-well I might be-I don't know-I'm finding out today." Samantha said.

"Really? You don't know by know? You must be like six months!" the nurse said, her hands on Samantha's belly, which responded with a strong THUMP. Her hands shot off of Samantha's belly.

"I'm so sorry...Doctor Harper will be with you in a minute." the nurse said, embarrassed.

Minutes later, Doctor Harper entered the room. She was a woman in her 40's with good skin for her age, and she had brown spiky hair and brown eyes. Like everyone else, her eyes shot to Samantha's belly. "Well, congratulations, Samantha! Now, ideally, it isn't recommended to get pregnant at your age, but there have been stranger cases."

"Actually, I don't know if I'm pregnant or not. I was hoping to find out today." Samantha said.

"Well no problem! I'll just examine you and give you and ultrasound and that should answer all questions. Does that sound alright?"

Samantha nodded.

"Now, let's just take your weight real quick..." Doctor Harper said. Samantha waddled to the scale. Stepping on it, she could hear it creak. Doctor Harper adjusted the number on the scale. "Alright. It looks like you've gained thirty pounds since your last visit. Samantha just sighed.

The doctor ushered Samantha back onto the table to lie down. She rolled up Samantha's shirt to reveal her entire belly. Doctor Harper began to feel all over Samantha's belly, pushing in and out in certain places. "It's quite firm." she said. "Could you tell me what it feels like?" she said, gesturing to the round dome that was her stomach. "Well it's heavy, like there's a bowling ball in there or something." Samantha said. "What about inside? Can you feel anything? Like kicking maybe?"the doctor said.

Samantha sighed and placed a hand on her rounding belly. "Yes. And it's been more frequent lately. And sometimes...I can feel it in multiple places..."she said, surprised when a strong flurry of thumping erupted from her belly, clearly visible beneath her skin. Doctor Harper placed both hands on Samantha's belly, feeling where the movement occurred. "Those are definitely kicks!"she said.

Doctor Harper wheeled in an ultrasound machine and turned it on. She grabbed a tube of gel and began to smear it on Samantha's belly with the wand. Please let this be a dream! she thought, closing her eyes.

"Ah! There's it is! Congratu-wait...I think I see another one, yes I do! You're having twins! A boy and a girl!" the doctor said happily.

Samantha willed herself to open her eyes. It was true. On the screen, she was able to make out to two small images, almost alien-like to her. She was going to be a mother. Tears began to fill in her eyes.

"Let me get a few papers for you to fill out and then you'll be on your way. I'm sure momma must be getting a little hungry!" the doctor said, patting Samantha's belly.

She left Samantha to herself for a few minutes. This is impossible! I can't be pregnant-and with twins?! How will the people at school react? How will Nina and Chris react? How- Her train of thought was interrupted by her baby boy and girl kicking gently, making her cry. "Damn it..."she said softly, rubbing her belly, "I guess I'll just have to adjust..."

Flip Me the alien thought entered her head.

Reaching into her pocket, she grabbed the coin. Samantha gave it a flip, her eyes falling on...
1212121111212212112111211211121222111.title: Day 5-The Moment of Truth

choices: Heads - Reality Change For Doctor Harper
Tails- No Reality Change For Doctor Harper
12121211112122121121112112111212221111.content:
Samantha caught sight of Doctor Harper who was just passing by the hall, talking to the nurses.
The strong THUMPS and KICKS from her unborn children did not seem to pull her out of her daze that she was in as she flipped the coin high into the air.

She caught it with the swiftness that's she caught it with several times before, her eyes never leaving Doctor Harper.

Reveal it the strange though told her.

She obeyed it, opening her hand to reveal that the strange pregnancy inducing coin had landed on..
12121211112122121121112112111212221111.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - Doctor Harper

choices: Fast Pregnancy - Doctor Harper's First Hand Experience
Pregnant Expansion - Doctor Harper's New Addition.
121212111121221211211121121112122211111.content:
Tails! Reality Change! the strange thought boomed through her head.

A faint shimmer seemed to envelope Doctor Harper, who stood there, taking notes from her nurses, and gathering a few pregnancy related pamphlets for Samantha.

No one seemed to notice the shimmer that surrounded the athletic 40-something doctor as she just stood there, talking.

The shimmering became brighter and thicker, as Doctor Harper suddenly adjusted her stance, placing a hand on her flat stomach.

Samantha just stared blankly, unaware of what was happening, her mind a total blank.
121212111121221211211121121112122211111.title: Heads - Reality Change For Doctor Harper

choices: She wanted to talk to Nina.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
The THUMPS of her unborn son and daughter inside of her brought Samantha back to reality, as her hand snapped to her belly.
She looked around in a confused daze as she put the coin back into her purse.

Back in the hallway, Doctor Harper left as the shimmer around her disappeared and she walked off to finish her doctorly duties.
Another firm volley of kicks from her children caused Samantha to look down at her basketball sized midsection.
"This can't be happening. I'm pregnant. Really pregnant." She said as she ran her hands over her mound, her unborn children stirring inside her.
What am I going to do? I was always so sure I was never going to be a mother, and yet here I am. 55, Single. Pregnant - with twins! she thought.
She got off the table and stood in front of the large full-body mirror mounted onto the wall.

She turned to her side, pushing her hands into the small of her back, making her pregnant profile that much more pronounced.
Slowly, with one hand, she pulled at the hemline of her shirt, revealing her pregnant mound in it's full unrestrained glory.

"What am I going to do with you two?" She asked, moving her hand along the smooth firm skin of her twin-filled belly.
"I never wanted to be a mother you know." She talked to her belly, her hand moving up and down, back and forth around the firm round dome.
"I never wanted to have kids. Can't stand them. And yet, here you two are, inside a woman who should be past her prime in doing this."

Her two unborn children thumped along inside her in response.
"I'm 55. 55! Divorced. Yeah, you two heard me. Divorced. There's no Dad in the equation. Although, I'm not even sure you two even have a Dad. " She continued to run her hand along her pregnant belly. She could feel the bumps in her skin caused by the movements of her unborn children. She could feel how tight and firm and smooth her skin was. Rubbing her pregnant belly filled her with so many emotions.

"I think you two would be better off with someone else. Someone younger, hipper. Someone who could have the means to take care of you" she said, looking at herself in the mirror. She was huge, there was no denying that.
"And yet, I don't think I could do it. I may have never wanted children, but now you're MY children. You two are a part of me" She said, a smile coming across her face. "I don't know if these damn emotions and hormones running through me. I swore that I never wanted any children, but now that you two are here inside of me, I never want to let you go. Can you hate children and still love your own children more than anything else in the world?" She asked her two passengers.

They responded with two firm and strong kicks.
"Heh, I guess that settles that. Look, I need to say this to you two before I change my mind. I don't know how you got there, but you're mine. I'll do my best but I can't make any promises. I know really a "child" kind of person, but you're my children so that will have to count for something. So - - - "

Samantha let in a deep breath. As soon as she said these words, there was no turning back.
Her life would change forever. It would be a life filled with dirty diapers, school plays, Christmas mornings, birthday parties, tough love, yelling, checking the closet for monsters, and strained bank accounts.

Can I even do this? she thought to herself.
She received a swift THUMP from one of her children in response.
Guess I don't have a choice in the matter.

She wrapped her hands around her bare pregnant belly, staring at it.
"Hello, I'm Samantha Peters - - - But you can call me Mommy" She said to her belly.

So that's it then. I guess my name is Mommy now she thought rubbing her belly, a smile slowly crossing her face.
Mommy. Guess that's not so bad. I've been called worse

The door to the examination room slowly swung open, and Doctor Harper entered in a waddle.
"Okay Ms. Peters, or should I say Mommy.. I've got everything you need." The doctor said, a stack of pamphlets in one hand, her other hand placed firmly in the small of her back. It took Samantha a few moments to realize what she was seeing. What had been Doctor Kristen Harper, the 40-something fit athletic doctor with short spikey brown hair and deep brown hair had been replaced with a similar looking yet very different Doctor Kristen Harper.

While this Doctor Harper was still a 40 something fit athletic doctor with brown eyes, there were a few minor yet major difference. Her brown hair was no longer short and spiky, instead it was long and flowing, like liquid strands of chocolate. Her breasts were bigger too, much bigger than before, firmer and much more rounder. They were visible through the green-scrubs she was now wearing under her unbuttoned green scrubs, her new cleavage spilling out the top of her scrubs.

But her newest addition by far was the 9 month pregnant belly that was attached to the doctor's midsection. It was perfectly round and huge, the green scrubs she was wearing were straining to hold back her life filled orb, it's tightness giving her maternal curves that much more emphasis.

"Sorry about the wait, I forget how much longer it takes me to do simple tasks because of her" Doctor Harper says with a smile, patting her pregnant scrub covered belly.
"So here are some pamphlets about pregnancy in older women, read the yellow one it's been especially helpful to me, ever since I found out I was pregnant at my age. I know you're worried Samantha but trust me, if I can do it, you can do it. I'm going to give you some prescriptions for some vitamins, and I want you to exercise. Alot of pregnant woman just want to lay around and get fat, but you can't do that, especially at our age. I want to walk for at least a few miles, it will help keep blood pressure down, and will help with swelling in your legs, and the pain in your back. I walk a few miles in the morning before work." Doctor Harper says cupping her pregnancy in her hands.

"Everything else checks out fine. Despite your age, your babies are looking extremely healthy. I would say that I was surprised, but that would be a lie. My own doctor told me this morning that he's never seen a healthier baby in an older mother before." Doctor Harper explained.

"Also, one last thing Samantha. I want you to enjoy your pregnancy. It's a special wonderful time in a woman's life. Don't stress about your age, or the birth, or work or anything. Just enjoy being pregnant. Write a journal, take photos of yourself, do something. Just enjoy it. It's goes by faster than you think" Doctor Harper finished.

Samantha understood the words that her pregnant doctor was saying, but she was having trouble listening as her mind raced as she stared at her pregnant doctor.
She's pregnant! She's definitely pregnant! She was not pregnant moments ago! It's just like Nina and that waitress, yet she's acting like she's always been like that! Samantha thought, staring at her doctor's belly.

"Samantha, what's wrong?" Doctor Harper asked rubbing her belly.
"You weren't pregnant" Samantha said, the words falling out her mouth.
"What do you mean?" Doctor Harper asked confused.
"You weren't pregnant last time you " Samantha says flabbergasted.
"Last time you saw me? This is why I tell you to schedule more frequent appointments. 9 months ago there was this mixer at this hospital fundraiser, and a few drinks with another handsome doctor my own age and well " Doctor Harper patted her belly with a smile.
"He's not in our life right now. Says he's too old to play daddy, but he'll support us. I guess it's for the best. Most kids probably don't want to know they were the product of a drunken grope fest" Doctor Harper says looking down at her very pregnant belly.
"Still, why that may not have been the smartest decision of my life, I'm certainly glad it happened, as this little girl is going to be my joy. I'm sure she's going to be a doctor just like her mommy".

Samantha's mind raced.
My doctor's pregnant and she's acting like it's normal. Something weird is going on she thought when it hit hurt like a two-ton truck that was on fire and full of clowns firing machine guns.

The coin.

Whenever something like happened she had used the coin. Her memory of it was fuzzy, but she vaguely remembered the coin.
But that's insane? A coin couldn't cause someone to get pregnant! Could it?

"Okay Samantha. I've got a lot of other people to see today. My nurse will see you out" Doctor Harper said, handing over the stack of papers to Samantha. Doctor Harper waved with one hand, the other resting on her belly, as Samantha slowly walked out the building, everyone's eyes on her and her pregnant form.

"I'm pregnant" she finally said to herself as she sat in her car, the seat all the way pushed back to make way for her belly.
"I'm pregnant. And so is Nina. And that waitress, and my doctor. And each time I can vaguely remember the coin. Could that strange coin I bought really be behind" a thump in her belly cut her off in mid-sentance.

"I know little one. I'm just thinking. Maybe we should go home and check it out" Samantha said resting a hand on her pregnant belly.
She was pregnant. She was going to be a mom. She was going to have not one, but two little lives to take care of and fill her life with love and joy.
A smile crossed her face as she accepted that fact.

"Hmm. Maybe I should come up with names for you two. I can't call you boy and girl, or little ones." She said looking down at her belly.
"So what do you think? This coin might seem to be the reason you're here. On the other hand, I should really talk to someone about this, and your aunt Nina is the only pregnant woman i know right now. Well, the only pregnant woman I know right now that doesn't seem to remember being pregnant. What do you think mommy should do?" She asked her children, rubbing her belly.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - Doctor, Doctor.

choices: It was Nina who opened the door.
It was Chris who opened the door.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
Another series of firm THUMPS from inside of her gave Samantha the answer she was looking for.
"You're probably right. We should tell Aunt Nina and Uncle Chris the big news about you two" Samantha said with a smile, rubbing her pregnant belly in her car.

She just sat and stared at it, her hand smoothly moving back and forth along the massive surface of her skin. She was enthralled by her changing body. She never would have thought her belly would get this big, and yet here it is, and it was only going to get bigger as her two children, she was going to have children!, continued to grow.

She had no idea what she was going to do. She meant that literally of course. She knew what she was going to do, she was going to get bigger, bigger than a house (figuratively), as her pregnancy progressed, she was going to go into labor, she was going to have these children, and raise them to the best of her ability to be kind upstanding human beings.

She meant she had no idea what to do before and after her son and daughter were born. She had nothing. No baby clothes, no maternity clothes (although that was obvious to anyone who looked at her), no cribs, no baby food, no diapers, no bottles, no books on parenting, no toys, no anything!

She had no idea where to start. But she knew of someone who could probably help her with that.

"Now, they're not really your aunt and uncle, but for all intents and purposes, we'll just call them Aunt Nina and Uncle Chris. She's having a baby too. So you'll have a playmate little girl" Samantha said, resting her hand on a particularly active spot on her round pregnant belly, hoping that this particular occupant was her unborn daughter.

"Besides, Mommy needs some advice on how to get started taking care of you two. I'm probably going to need some books, and cribs, and toys or something" Samantha said talking to her two children, and received several more KICKS at the mention of toys.
"Oh you like it when Mommy said toys huh? We'll don't get too crazy, I have some money saved up, but don't expect to be drowning in toys. I'm only a school teacher, and I have to make sure you two end up in a good college."

Oh god. College. Samantha thought, holding her pregnancy in her hands. And Christmases. And birthdays. Temper tantrums, homework, school plays, baseball practice, dance recitals. Oh god Samantha, are you really going to do this? She thought to herself, staring at her pregnant belly.

"Too late now huh?" She patted her belly with a smile, and then drove off to Nina's.

Some time later, she pulled her car into the driveway of Chris and Nina's house. Oddly enough, she saw that Chris's car, which was now the mini-van was in the driveway.
Odd for him to take a day off from work Samantha thought to herself.

As she waddled toward the door, she stopped and looked down at her midsection. When someone answered that door, they would know she was without a doubt, pregnant. While she did come over to tell her friend about her new "passengers", she did want to have a little fun with it. After all, this was going to be her first time dropping the baby bomb on someone.

She waddled back to her car, and took out the thick winter coat she wore last night. Before putting it on, she lifted up the shirt she wore, laying her pregnant belly out bare. She then fastened the coat over her very bare pregnant belly, the coat buttons straining to contain the life orb hidden underneath.
Looking at her reflection one of the exterior mirrors the best she could, the coat managed to hide her pregnancy somewhat, as long as the person wasn't paying attention.

Samantha hoped that Nina wouldn't be paying attention so she could really surprise her friend. She waddled back to the front door, adjusted her coat, put on a serious face, and knocked on the door.

Some shuffling was heard on the other side of the door, before it opened.

The door opened and it was...
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - Off To Nina's We Go.

1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
"Who is it?" said Nina, yelling from the living room. Of course Nina probably hasn't gotten up since I last saw her, Samantha thought. She saw an eye peering out at her through the peephole of the door. "It's Sammy!" said Chris, opening the door.

Chris was different, to say the least. His normally thin body was replaced with a small potbelly and some man-boobs, to Samantha's surprise. His buttoned shirt straining over his belly. "Well, Chris, looks like you've put on a bit of weight since yesterday!" Samantha said, patting his rounder belly, which was oddly firm. "Yeah, it appears so. I've been throwing up all day, so I probably have that virus that you have...how has that been, anyway?" he said, a hand on his belly. "That's actually what I came here to talk about, can I come in?" she asked. Chris lead her into the living room where Nina was laying on the couch, eating. She hadn't bothered to change since yesterday, her pregnant belly sticking high in the air.

"Sammy! What brings you here?" Nina said, giving her belly a rub, as her daughter was kicking violently inside. Samantha stood in the middle of the room, while Chris stood by the couch that Nina was weighing down. "I'm not really sure how to say this, so I won't...so here we go..." Samantha said.

She turned away from the expecting couple and unbuttoned her jacket, dropping it on the floor. She slowly turned around, revealing her twin-filled belly to Chris and Nina. "Oh my God..." they said simultaneously. They sat in silence for a few minutes, in awe at Samantha. "Are you-" Chris began. "Pregnant." said Nina. Samantha began to rub her belly. "Yes, I am pregnant, and with twins, I might add." she said, as she felt kicks from both occupants. "Congratulations!" said Nina, slowly rising from the couch. She waddled over to Samantha and started to rub her pregnant belly. Chris was silent. "I can't believe we're pregnant at the same time! How long have you been hiding this from us? How far along are you?" Nina said happily. "I'm not really sure...I'm probably going to go back to the doctor's in a few days to see what's what..."

Chris was staring into space. "That must mean I'm...." he said lightly, before trailing off, looking down at his belly. Nina and Samantha couldn't hear that statement, as they were still talking about Samantha's pregnancy. "Excuse me, I'm going to get something to eat." Chris said, walking into the kitchen. "Has he seemed different to you?" Samantha asked. "What? Besides the belly? Yeah. He's been getting sick these past two days, and it seems like he eats ALL the time. It's like he's...pregnant or something. But that's not possible!" "Yeah, I thought the same thing about my self!" Samantha said, putting a hand on her belly. "Don't worry about it, he's probably just sick or something." Nina desperately wanted to believe this to be true.

"Oh, Sammy! I just thought of an idea-let me take some maternity photos of you!" Nina said. "I don't know...do we really need to?" Samantha said, slowly rubbing her belly to her occupants' delight, who repaid her with strong kicks. "Come on, it'll be fun!" Samantha agreed, and Nina slowly waddled away, getting a camera.

Nina returned minutes later. "All right, now just strip down to your bra and panties and let me take a few pictures!" she said. "What!? Come on, Nina!" Samantha said. "Please?" Nina asked kindly. "For the children?" Samantha sighed. She took off her belly-baring t-shirt and plopped on the couch to remove her sweatpants, leaving her in only her panties and a bra that was too small.

Looking down at her bare body, she finally came to terms-she was pregnant, very much so. Nina had Samantha do various poses, cradling her belly, and others, even the classic Demi Moore pose. Twenty minutes later, it was finally over, although Samantha thought that she might succumb to delirium from the camera flashes.

Samantha put back her clothes on, as Nina approached her with a large scrapbook. "Sammy, this is for you to scrapbook each moment of your pregnancy. It goes by so fast, just enjoy it while you can!" Nina said. Samantha took the scrapbook, which already had pictures from the recent photo shoot. "Thanks," Samantha said,"I'll do that..." "Great! Just call me once in an while so I can fill you in on what's happening to your body. You know what's odd? A few days ago you were really skinny, and now you look really pregnant!" Nina said. "Yeah, I guess I sorta popped overnight..." Samantha said, rubbing her belly. "I should be going now, I need some rest." Nina understood.

Samantha grabbed her coat and walked to the front door. "Bye, Samantha!" Chris said, peering out of the kitchen, with food in his mouth. Samantha could have sworn that Chris's belly was slightly bigger than before, but she put if off for now.

In her car, a wave of fatigue hit her. She needed rest but she also wanted to see if she could find anything about the coin. She decided to...
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: It's Chris, who looks a bit different...

choices: Her email notice went off on her laptop.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
The need for sleep washed over her as she sat in the car. She leaned over and took her new scrap book, looking through it. Staring at the pictures of her very pregnant self, she was amazed at how big she was, at how big she could possibly get. She looked at the photos that Nina made her do, the poses she was placed in; a side profile with her hands in her back, a comical shocked expression as she looked down at her belly, the classic Demi Moore pose.

As her mind drifted off looking at the photos of her pregnant self, she wondered how this happened. She hadn't been with a man in years, and more importantly, her doctor, her very own doctor, who herself was now pregnant at 40, despite now being pregnant hours ago, told her that her child bearing days were over. Yet, her she was now, having twins. Twins!

She thought of Nina, her pregnant friend, who like herself, wasn't pregnant a few days ago. She thought of the young waitress that was supposedly now her ex-husband's other woman on the side, the one who would finally give him the child he longed for. She, like Nina and Samantha was not pregnant a few days ago.

Her unborn son and daughter kicked away inside of her as she pondered the situation. Placing a hand on her firm orb she let out a sigh.
"I think I've put it off long enough. I think it's time to figure out where you two came from" Samantha reached into her purse and pulled out the strange silver coin she purchased exactly five days ago.

"And I think you have something to do with it!" She said to the coin, examining it yet again. She turned it this way and that, hoping to try and decode the mysteries held within just by reflecting light of the surface of the coin. Her eyes feel upon the image on the coin, of the pregnant woman and what appeared to be a pregnant...man?

That train of thought led her back to Chris. His belly was bigger and he was developing what could only be described as man-boobs. Surely, if the coin was the source of her pregnancy, it couldn't affect Chris could it? There was no possible way, and yet, all the symptoms matched. The weight gain, the vomiting, could it really be?

That's impossible Samantha. Something else is wrong with Chris. He's not pregnant Samantha thought looking at the coin. Still that's what you though about yourself, and look at you now... Mommy She thought.

"I think it's time we find out more about you" Samantha said, putting the coin back in her purse. She started the car, buckled her seatbelt, and drove home.

After a stop for lunch at a burger joint (the stop was short, the meal itself was quite large including an extra large burger, an extra large milkshake, fries, a salad, and some ice cream), Samantha pulled into the driveway of her home, wiping away the particles of food at the corner of her mouth. I know my doctor said not to pig out, but I'm eating for three here. Besides, I'll go for a walk in the park later Samantha thought to herself as she hefted herself out of the car.

She in the driveway, hands in her back as she looked at her house. This house, which once seemed too large and lonely, will soon seem way to small and way to full. She smiled as she placed a hand from her back onto her belly, giving it a rub.
"Welcome home little ones. I know it's not the best, but it's ours." Samantha talked to her occupants as she looked at her house, no not just her house. Her family's house.

There was nice front yard to play in, and she could probably put some swings and a playset in the back. She could watch her children laugh and play as she sat on the porch, rushing to their aid as they fell and skinned knees. That's what Mom's do right?

She continued rubbing her belly, looking at her house, soon to be alive with sounds of children. The thought both captivated her and terrified her, but they're was nothing she could do about it now. She heard a gasp to her right, and looked over to see her neighbor staring at her. He was watering his lawn with a hose, staring at Samantha's new maternal figure, his mouth agape.

"Oh hi Mark! NIce day isn't it?" Samantha asked, returning to her hands to the small of her back, pushing out her belly that much more than it already was.
Mark said nothing, and just continued to stare at her.
"Give my best to your wife. Come on little ones, we have things to do" She said looking down at her belly before walking into her house.

She put down her purse, took off her shoes, and sat down on the couch, her belly filling her lap. She sat and sighed contently as she rubber her belly.
"Okay you two. Time now for Mommy to rest. Why don't you two go to sleep or something? You've been awfully active" Samantha said, holding her belly by the sides.
She picked up her laptop and turn it on, resting it firmly on her belly.
"Well, at least it's useful for something" Samantha said commenting on her own expanding midsection as she began to work on the laptop.

She surfed the web for a few moments, finding out information on pregnancy later in life. Lots of information on being pregnant in your 40's, but very little information about pregnancy past 50. It's almost like people weren't expecting women in their 50's to BE expecting.
"Well, fat lot of good that does us huh?" Samantha says to her unborn children.

After a few moments, she stopped surfing the internet and started researching the strange coin, that to the best of Samantha's beliefs, was the cause of her new "condition". She spent what seemed like hours searching coin databases, chat rooms, and search data to try and find out anything about the coin. Eventually she found a small thread that eventually led her to a website about strange magical and other paranormal items.

"Paranormal huh?" she thought, staring at the screen.
I don't know why I'm even bothering with this. The coin can't be responsible for my two little ones she thought, preparing to exit the internet browser. But a nagging thought at the back of her head was pulling at her, pulling her away from exiting, and continuing onwards in her quest for the truth.
"Oh what the hell" she said, but realizing that she just swore. "You two didn't hear that. Sometimes Mommy needs to use grownups words, and if I ever hear you two talk like that, you're in so much trouble" she said to her pregnant belly.

She typed in a few more keystrokes, eventually landing on the page about the various so-called "magical, mysterious, supernatural, or paranormal items" that exist in the world. Scrolling down through the page she found entries about creepy dolls, monkey paws, wish granting fish, unknown islands in the middle of the ocean, haunted cars, and more. She continued to roll her eyes as she went by objects after objects before finding a link that read:

Don't See What You're Searching For? Contact us!

She sighed, gave her pregnant belly a scratch, and clicked on the link. An email box opened up, and she started to type, explaining the story of how she bought the coin, the situations she's been involved with the coin, and of course, her current expectant state. After including photos of the coin, and sending in photos of herself, she sighed and closed the laptop.

"Well kids. Either we're going to get answers or some weirdoes on the internet will think your pregnant 55 year old mother is crazy." Samantha said with a sigh. She walked into the kitchen to find something to eat, as her hunger was seemingly endless. She searched for a good ten minutes before realizing that she had nothing to eat.

"Well you two, I guess it's time we go to the supermarket." She said looking down at her midsection. Was she really going to go out in public like this? While she wasn't ashamed in being pregnant, she knew people there who certainly ask some questions, the answers for she did not have. Yet, it would be even more awkward to show up with children at the grocery store and not have an explanation that people would by. If they saw her pregnant now, they wouldn't ask questions when her children were born.

"Well come on you two. Let's go get some food. Anything you want for dinner tonight? Mommy was thinking chicken and macaroni-and-cheese. I have such a craving" she said, placing a hand on her belly. Her two passengers were silent.
"Great, not listening to me when I need them to. Already off to a fantastic start."

She grabbed her purse and slipped back on her shoes.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - The Coin.

choices: She went to bed. (Jump To Day 6)
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
She opened the door and stepped out into her driveway.
Humming to herself a little song that she didn't quite now, she approached her car.
Out of the corner of her eye she noticed that her neighbor Mark was staring at her from the behind the curtains of his living room window.
She placed a hand of her belly, and waved at her peeping neighbor with the other.
"Hello again Mark. Just heading out to the grocery store!" Samantha said with a smile, rubbing her pregnant belly with her one hand.

As she looked back at the window, she could see that Mark's wife, Beth had joined him at the window, staring at her as she made her way to her car. As Samantha buckled herself in her car, she could see Beth's mouth agape, staring at her newly pregnant neighbor.
"It's like you'd think they've never seen a pregnant woman before, hmm little ones?" Samantha talked to her belly, as she pulled her car out of the driveway and left to go the grocery store.

It took her a little while to get there, as Samantha seemed to get nothing but red lights. On any other day this would have aggrivated her to no extent, yet today was not just any other day. Today was the day she found out she was pregnant, that she was having not one, but TWO, children. Two children that would forever change her life, for the better. Now, Samantha took every opportunity she could to just be by herself, and enjoy her time with her unborn children.

Eventually, she pulled into the parking lot of the grocery store, got out of her car, gave her belly a little pat, grabbed a cart, and headed inside.
The store was crowded today, more so than usual, which made navigating some of the more narrow aisles a little hard for Samantha and her largeness. She grabbed everything she could ever hope to eat in her pregnant state, and then some. Frozen pizzas, potato chips, sandwich meats, cereals, pastas; everything, including pickles and ice cream.

As she slowly filled her cart to the brim, she could see every pair of eyes falling upon her. Well, to be more precise, falling upon her belly. Every time she could feel a pair of eyes on her, she would look. Most of the time the pair of eyes belonged to an woman, ages differing from woman to woman, but every time one of the woman looked at her and of course her belly, a small smile formed on the woman's face.

It made Samantha happy, as she felt like she was apart of some sort of sisterhood. Women would just come up to her, asking questions about her pregnancy, what she was having, when she was do, those kind of things. She always felt welcomed into this group, and that she could always connect to now, not just a woman, but as a mother.

However, she noticed that a few of the stares were not as warm or as welcoming, even from the women. Quite a few people seemed to look at her with disgust on their face. Their looks said it all - "Having children at your age? How revolting. Think of them instead of thinking of yourself. You're too old."
Every time Samantha saw those looks on their faces, it gave her more pain than she could possibly know.

It wasn't her fault. She didn't ask for this. Yet, we all have to play with the cards that have dealt to us, and Samantha choose her hand wisely.
She was going to do the only thing she could think of doing - become a mother. If they didn't like it, well, she could tell them where they could place their head.

She bought all her groceries, and for once in her life, actually did take the help of having someone assist her with the bags. She would have done it herself, but her back was starting to kill her.

She loaded herself into her car, and drove back to her house. As she pulled into the driveway, she once again noticed Mark and Beth staring at her from the windows of their house. It took her nearly forever to bring all the groceries into the house by herself, but she eventually got everything put into their proper place, and she put the macaroni and cheese and chicken into the stove.

35 minutes later, she was scarfing down the delicious combination with a force she never knew she had, cleaning her plate not once, not twice, but three times. Stifling a little burp, and rubbing her stomach contently as her two unborn children moved around inside of her, Samantha was truly happy for the first time in years. Somewhere deep down inside of her she began to think, did she really hate children, or did she just hate the prospect of having Tom's children. As she rubbed her belly, she began to think about what she ever saw in him in the first place.

She hoisted herself out of her chair, and put away the rest of her dinner, packing it away to be used as lunch tomorrow.
Eventually, evening turned into night as Samantha sat on the couch, her twin filled orb sticking into the air, watching TV.
The clock chimed 9 and the desire for sleep came over her.
"Well little ones. I think it's time for bed. Mommy has work in the morning... and she has to figure out how to explain you two" she said, as she watched her belly squirm around as her children became active again.

DA-BEEP! Her laptop chimed as she received an email message. She checked the time. 9:02. She had to be up early tomorrow to get ready for that half-day of testing, but this might be that email about the coin she was waiting for.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - Let's Go (Grocery) Shopping.

choices: It was from Nina. She had an important email for Samantha.
It was the website. Answers await.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
I should probably get that. It might contain the answers I seek Samantha thought to herself, rubbing her belly with one hand.
She picked up her laptop and gently placed it on her mammoth mound, balancing it perfectly on the very top. She connected to her wifi, and then clicked on the email logo she had placed on her desktop.

CONNECTING TO SERVER......

Samantha waited patiently as she was connecting to the server.
She was nervous. What if they didn't have an answer for her? What if they did? What if the answer they gave her was the one she was fearing "It's just a coin". If it was just a coin, what did that mean?

DA-BEEP! The email message downloaded, and she opened it.

It was from...
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - You've Got Mail.

choices: There was a knock on her door. At this hour? (Day 5)
She gave up and went to bed. (Day 6)
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
The email was from Nina, marked with the subject line - EXTREMELY URGANT - RE: MOMMYHOOD.

Samantha clicked on the message, expecting some kind of update from her friend. An update on Samantha's pregnancy, information that she could possibly use, or even an update on Chris.

Instead she was greeted with an advertisement - ONE DAY ONLY FIRE SALE! 50% OF YOUR PURCHASE WHEN YOU USE THIS COUPON!

The Baby Barn is having a one-day only massive sale, tomorrow at the Twin Hills Mall! We've over-ordered on all the new products that are coming in from the factories and so everything must go! For one day only, present this coupon to any of our wonderful cashiers at your local Baby Barn located at the Twin Hills Mall and receive 50% off your total order! No items is invalid from savings! Cribs, car seats, clothing, toys, high chairs, changing tables, strollers, baby slings, everything and everything must go! This sale will last one day only, so if you get here on Friday, this sale will be gone! So don't miss out, and get your items at 50% off today!

Attached to the email was a printable gift card to the "The Baby Barn" in sum of $250. Written under the advertisement in pink letters -

Sammy, consider this a baby shower gift since I'll be so busy once Miracle arrives. I'll be at the mall tomorrow since work put me on maternity leave. We can totally shop together, while Chris gets what he needs. He decided to take a short mini-vaction with the time he saved up. Says he needs to get new pants and shirts as just an hour again some of his clothes barely fit him anymore. Then he started crying. I have no idea what's happening to him. But I'll worry about him later. Tomorrow is OUR day. See you there preggo. - N

Samantha hit the print button on both the advertisement and the digital gift certificate a smile crossing her face.
"Well, if Aunt Nina spoils mommy like this, I dread to think what she's going to do to you to. You have no idea how much Aunt Nina wanted Mommy to have you two." Samantha said, moving the laptop of her pregnant belly.

She got up and walked (although she noted that was getting closer to waddling than walking now) and collected the two items, folded them and put them in her purse.
"Luckily for us tomorrow is a half day at work hmm little ones? We need to get everything ready for you two." Samantha said looking down at her belly.
She felt a tiny little kick from inside, and placed one hand on her belly, slowly gliding it over the left side of her dome, her hand following the curve slowly.

Then Samantha's eyes went wide.

"Oh no. I'm going to need someone to move out all those junk from those upstairs bedrooms. I mean, I don't think you two should share the same room. Lord knows I don't need a fussy baby walking up the one that's actually sleeping" She said to herself. "But how am I going to do it? I can't lift any of that stuff. I mean I could do it before I got pregnant" her voice still stumbled over the word pregnant, although it was quickly becoming a word in her "most often used words in the last 24 hours" pile.

She sighed, and placed her hands in her back. She was in quite a jam. She had babies she had to get ready for, a one-day sale where it was a safe bet she was going to buy out the store, and no place to put either.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - One Day Only!

choices: It was her next door neighbor Mark and his wife Beth.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
KNOCK! KNOCK! KNOCK!

Samantha turned, her belly moving with her, to look at her front door.
"Now how could that be at this hour?" Samantha said to herself out loud.

KNOCK! KNOCK! KNOCK!

She waddled (yes, she admitted to it, she was waddling now) to the door, bracing her back with one hand, and open the door with the other.

Her belly would be the first thing this late caller would see, hoping, Samantha thought, that would see that they were disrupting the lifestyle of someone who needed some peace and quiet.

As the door swung open, the late caller was revealed to be..
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - Come and knock on my door.

choices: Samantha slammed the door in their face.
She would take them up on their offer - - - Right now.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
It was Mark and Beth on the other end of the door, and instead of saying "Hello" or "Nice Evening" like any other people, Mark blundered out something far less appropriate.

"You see honey! She's huge!" Mark said, his eyes not leaving Samantha's belly.
"Oh my god! I thought it was a trick, but oh my god!" Beth said, bending down, coming face-to-belly.
Beth reached out a hand, and gave Samantha's belly a firm poke with her finger.
"It's so firm! She's not fat! She's pregnant just like you said!" Beth said her mouth agape.

"Hello Mark, Beth. Can I help you? Or did you just come over at past 9 o'clock at night to prod your 55 year old pregnant neighbor" Samantha said sounding irritated. How could she not be? Her two next door neighbors invited themselves over and just started poking and prodding her without a "Hello".

"Samantha, is there something you'd like to share with us?" Beth said, moving her face away from Samantha's belly and back to eye level.
"Like with the fact that you broke that pact!" Mark said nodding his head.

Mark and Beth were high school sweethearts that became college sweethearts that became the happily married Mark and Beth Dentons. They moved into the house next door about two years after Tom and Samantha first moved in. Samantha wouldn't really consider them friends, just people she talked to on occasion. She really didn't have a lot of the same interests as them, she enjoyed reading a good book, they would go out on exotic adventures. She would cook a small meal for herself, they would dine out at the best restaurants in town. She drove a sensible car, they owned sports cars and boats.
They did have one thing common though: They didn't have children, and didn't plan on ever having them. However, as Samantha stood before her two neighbors it was quite obvious that specific common interest was no longer there.

"It wasn't really a pact Mark" Samantha said, rubbing her belly, emphasizing her point.
Mark and Beth were close to pushing 40. They both looked people who fell out of a magazine that sold boats and sweaters to rich people. The button up shirt for him with sweater wrapped around his neck, polo pants, with Beth wearing the latest fashions with a sensible haircut at large flashy jewelry.
Mark had some serious money after selling off his computer company to some big name several years ago.

Some people would have moved away to a better neighborhood, the kind with gates, and butlers, and tennis courts, but not the Dentons. The Denton were the type who spent all their vast amounts of money for their own enjoyment, not their own vanity. "A house is a house, besides we're almost never in it, so why not just buy sensible?" Mark always said. He was proud of the fact that he bought a sensible house, fixed it up, and was going to sell it back for 5x what it was worth when the market turned around.

"When we said we weren't ever going to have children, you agreed. That's a pact" Mark said.
"Mark, I said while going through a bad marriage where children were the focal point. It was never written in stone" Samantha said lying. It was always the plan, but plans change.
"But Samantha, at your age? Have you even thought this through? Your 55! 55! When those kids are 5, you'll be 60! When they're 15, you'll be 70! When they're getting out of college, you'll be almost 80!" Beth said.
"Thank you for the basic math Beth." Samantha said, her friendly face getting tested to the limits.

She was aware of how she was going to be as her children grew up, but that was hurdle she was going to have to face. She didn't care. She had two little children to think about. She would eat right, exercise, and go for as long as she could. That's all anyone could ever ask.

"Samantha, how did you even get pregnant at your age. I would've though the plumbing would be all rusted up at this point" Mark said.

Now she was angry. Mark didn't just cross the line. He dropped a nuke on it.

"And what business is it of yours what I do with my life!?! Who cares how I got pregnant! It doesn't have anything to do with you! Now, what the hell do you want? Say it quickly before I slam this door." Samantha said, fighting back tears and uncontrollable rage.

Beth elbowed her husband in the shoulder as hard as she could.
"Ow!" Mark said looking at his wife,
"Nice going!" Beth said.

"Goodbye!" Samantha said, about to slam the door.
"Wait! Wait! Wait!" Mark said, and Samantha did in fact wait.
"Look, what I said was inexcusable, Look, if you decided to have children, that's fantastic. It's not our business to tell you what to do, even if I think it's not in your or our best interest" Mark said.

Samantha was one sentence away from punching Mark in the nose. Beth picked up on this and elbowed her husband in the ribs again.
"Ow! What did I say?!" Mark said looking at his wife.
"What he meant to say is: "Congratulations Samantha. We hope your child - - " Beth said before being interrupted.
"ChildREN. I'm having twins" Samantha said, cupping her belly for emphasis.
"Seriously? Wow." Beth said, taken back. "I mean, we hope your children fill your life with joy and happiness, and if there's anything you ever need for us, don't hesitate to ask!" Beth said.
"Wait what?" Mark said looking at his wife.
"Look you dolt, you just came over here and insulted the woman twice. Your plan was to come over here and have her talk to an adoption agency is a bust." Beth said to her husband.
"You came over to. Something about "not hearing screaming brats in the backyard" Mark corrected her.

These two are horrible human begins. They came over here to convince me to give up my children for adoption so they won't be the only childless couple of the street. How money can make people to monsters. Samantha thought.

"Shut up Mark!" Beth said, before turning her attention back to Samantha.
"If there's anything you need from us, just ask. Also, we would really like it if you didn't tell any of the other neighbors we had this conversation, it would make us look really, really bad, and Mark's running for president of the homeowners association in the neighborhood.

"So, you came over here, at 9 o'clock at night, to convince me to give up my children for adoption as there is a chance that as they got older their playing might disrupt YOUR lives, despite the fact that you live in a house in a neighborhood full of children, a house I may remind you, you are only in about less than 60 days a year. You didn't think this through did you?" Samantha asks with a smug sense of self satisfaction.

Beth and Mark's face went blank as the jig was up. They looked like deer caught in the headlights of a on-fire semi-truck that was barreling towards them at over 100 miles per hour.

"Uh---" Mark stammered.
"If you uh - - ever need anything" Beth said.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - The Nosy Neighbors

choices: She got what she needed from them. She sent them home for the night.
The coin suddenly called to her.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
A wonderful idea crossed Samantha's mind, fighting off her urge to slam her front door right in the disgusting faces of her next door neighbors.
"Actually, there is something you can help me. Right now in fact" Samantha said, a devilish smile coming across her face.
"Uh - - " Mark continued to stammer while Beth just stared blankly.

"I need some rooms upstairs cleaned out. There's not alot of stuff in there, just some boxes and other junk. I need it to be brought into the garage so I can get those two rooms set up for the babies" Samantha said, cupping her pregnancy for emphasis. "Now usually I would have someone do it, but since I'm getting everything I need tomorrow at the big Baby Barn sale, I kind of need to be done now so I can get everything ready as I go along. So, what do you say neighbor? Want to help out an old preggo and take that stuff out of there for me... tonight?" Samantha said, rubbing her belly for emphasis.

"You want it done.." Mark said.
"Now?" Beth asked.

"Why not? It's only 9. If you two work together you could have done by 11:05 tops" Samantha said, feeling quite devilish.
"But we uh" Beth started to say.
"We only came over here at 9PM to tell you to give your children up for adoption so they won't disturb us, and, oh don't tell anyone we said that as we're running for president of the homeowners association?" Samantha said with a smile on her face.

Beth looked at Mark, who looked back at Beth, knowing that they were both backed into a corner they could not get out off.

"Uh does it really have done tonight?" Mark asked.
"Can it wait till tomorrow afternoon?" Beth asked.
"Maybe. Before or after I make a few calls to the other people running for the home owners association president?" Samantha asked.
"But - - " Mark said, his own words coming back to haunt him.

"I mean, I could always meet them in person. I'm a pretty convincing person, and I'm sure some of them would love to take out my children I'm having" Samantha said, rubbing her belly.

Beth pressed two fingers to the ridge of her nose and sighed.
"This isn't my fault" Mark said looking over to his wife.
"This is entirely your fault" Beth said.

"So, if you get started now, you can probably get it down by 11. It's not much" Samantha said, moving aside inviting her two new "helpers" in.
Mark and Beth stepped inside, and Samantha showed them the two rooms that were now going to be used as the rooms.

Sure enough, true to Samantha's words, they were full of boxes and tubes, mostly junk that belonged to Tom, that he said he was going to collect, but never did. Samantha was now pretty sure that he was just using her house as free storage knowing that Samantha would never throw out his things unlike his new wife.

Soon to be ex-wife once the witch finds out about Tom's little secret Samantha thought to herself.
Beth and Mark got to work, carrying out boxes and tubs from the two rooms, carrying them down the stairs and into the garage, which she never used.
Tom used to use it as work area, making sure that Samantha always parked her car out in the driveway. Sure, Tom got to keep his car in the garage with his tools, but not Samantha.

In retrospect, Samantha did always find that a little odd, but she no longer cared. Tom was long gone from her life, and his things were going to be replaced with things that belonged to her children.

Her children, still Samantha could not believe it. She stood in the door frame, watching as her two "helpful" neighbors moved all of Tom's garbage into the garage. As the piles of boxes, tubes and other junk began to get hauled down, she could start seeing the bits of room that her children would call "their room".

In her son's room, she could see where his crib would go, and then where his bed would go as he got older. She could imagine him playing with army men and race cars on the carpet of his room, while posters of sport stars and comic book heroes hung on the wall.

In her daughter's room, she imagined tea parties, stuffed animals being flung everywhere, a doll house in the corner. Samantha rubbed her belly with a smile on her face as she imagined the life that she would soon have.

Time passed, and eventually Samantha's back and feet started to hurt her, forcing her to return to her laying position on the couch. She lifted her shirt up, examining the great fleshy orb that was attached to her midsection, drawing invisible circles on it with her finger. A little after 11 PM, her two neighbors, dirty, sweaty, and looking very tired, came down the stairs to find their pregnant neighbor on the couch, belly exposed watching late-night talk shows.

"We're finished" Mark said, looking exhausted.
"Both rooms?" Samantha asked, moving into a sitting up position, her belly filling her lap.
"Both rooms. They're bigger than they look. We must have moved about a hundred boxes!" Beth said.

"Well thanks a lot, I appreciate it." Samantha said getting up, her shirt still lifted up showing her belly.
Beth and Mark's eyes looked at it, her tight skin reflecting the light in the room.
"I know huh? I'm getting so big!" Samantha said with a smile, rubbing her belly before lowering the hemline of her shirt in an attempt to cover whatever amount of pregnant flesh she could.

An awkward moment passed between them as...
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - A Helping (Pair Of) Hands

1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
There was slight buzzing in the back of her head as Mark and Beth started talking to her.
About what she didn't really know as she couldn't focus; she thought it was about the home owners association, and not telling, and something along those lines. They just seemed to prattle on.

The buzzing in her head intensified before the booming alien thought she became used to once again filled her head.
Flip me Samantha the alien thought called to her.

She obeyed it's siren call.

Waddling over to her purse, she pulled out the strange coin.

"And we'd just really appreciate it if you didn't tell anyone about this because" Mark droned on, talking in circles.

Flip me

She did. High into the air it went, turning over and over and over again.
She caught it in mid-fall with one hand, her fist clenched tight around it.

"Uh, Samantha. What are you doing?" Mark asked as Beth just looked at him shrugging.

Look Samantha the voice commanded her.

She looked.

Her eyes fell upon..
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - It's Coin O'Clock!

1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
Samantha's eyes fell upon Mark, who still blathering on, trying to save his own rear-end after this absolute spectacle went sideways.
"Samantha, are you even listening to me?" Mark asked. "I know I came over here under what some people would call not the best circumstances, but after spending two hours emptying out two bedrooms for you, I think you at least owe me a "I'll never tell anybody" about this".

Reveal It Samantha the alien thought commanded her.

Slowly, she opened her fist revealing the coin, showing that it landed on..
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Samantha (FP Day 5) - Mark

1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
Tails! No Reality Change! the voice in Samantha's head boomed.

Samantha continued to stare at Mark, only semi-aware of what was happening. A few minutes from now all of this would be a barely recallable blur.

As Mark became frustrated by Samantha's action, it all happened at once.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Tails (No Reality Change) - Poor Mark (Yeah Right)

choices: But wait, the coin's not done!
Everyone went home for the evening.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
"Come on Beth, let's just go. We try to do the right thing and - - - URK!" Mark suddenly stopped in the middle of his sentence as his hand shot to his mouth and his face went pale.
"Mark?! Mark honey, what's wrong!" Beth asked, suddenly concerned about her husband sudden need to empty the contents of his stomach.
"SICK" was all Mark could eek out as his sudden bought of nausea hit him like a two-ton truck.

He looked over to Samantha, fighting back tears (and his dinner) as Samantha pointed him to the downstairs bathroom. He took off running and several seconds later, the house was filled with the sounds of URK!

Beth ran to the closed bathroom door, and began to knock on it.
"Mark! Mark are you okay! What's going on?!" Beth asked.
"GO-URK-AWAY!" Mark managed to get out between bouts of throwing up.
"Samantha, what's going on with Mark?" Beth asked, suddenly in a panic.
Little did Beth know, (and Samantha had a suspicion about) Mark was now pregnant with twins, a condition he would not agree with.
"Maybe it was something he ate" Samantha said, her mind suddenly becoming unclouded.

URK! The sounds of Mark's sickness could still be heard from behind the bathroom door.
"Do you think he'll be fine?" Beth asked.
"Oh he'll be fine" Samantha said, matter of factly.
He might need bigger pants soon though Samantha thought absentmindedly.

"I'll get him some water, follow me to the kitchen" Samantha said, waddling her way to the kitchen, and pouring some filtered water from a pitcher.
A few moments later, the sounds of the toilet flushing signaled the end of Mark's binge.
He came out, eyes red and watery, wiping the corners of his mouth.
"Oh man, what was that" he asked to everyone.
"Oh are your okay Mark?" Beth asked, holding onto her husband's arm.
"Yeah, I'm fine. I just felt like I really had to puke all of the sudden. I feel much better now. In fact, I'm starving." Mark said.
"Starving? We just ate two hours ago." Beth asked.
"I know, but I'm pretty sure that was dinner in there." Mark said.

"Well, than maybe you guys so go. It is getting late, and Mark might need to lay down" Samantha said, handing over the glass of water to Mark.
"Thanks Samantha" Mark said, chugging down the water in several huge gulps.
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.title: Fast Pregnancy - Mark's Big Surprise

choices: It landed on Tails. (No Reality Change)
1212121111212212112111211211121222111112.content:
The buzzing in Samantha's head came on again like a swarm of loctus from out of nowhere, a buzzing that just seemed to overwhelm her, blocking out all thought.

It was as she looked down did she see that she still had the coin with her, on the counter. She must have brought it with her, yet she had no memory of doing that.

Once again, the voice commanded her, and she obeyed.

Flip Me Samantha

She did, catching the coin in the palm of her hand, gripping a fist around it tightly, afraid it might disappear.

Look Samantha

She did, her eyes falling upon Beth this time, who stared at her wide.

"Again with coin Samantha? What is it a nervous habit or something? Making subtle decisions for the rest of us in your head hmm?" Beth asked. She was no longer in the mood for this oddness, not when her husband just became randomly sick to his stomach.

Reveal It Samantha the voice told her, and she obeyed.

She opened her fist to reveal the coin had landed on...
