The next morning Erica woke up with a groan and looked up and saw that it was after three already. Cursing herself and blaming yesterday exercise session and big dinner for her sleeping as long as she did, Erica tried to get up but found this harder the she thought.

“Put them in the extra’s dressing room, WHERE’S HAS THE HAT BOX GONE?” Simon was at his wits end, he was constantly at his wits end, he was that kind of guy who was worried and impatient with the world before he started at school and now he was the director of a play. He decided to go with Romeo and Juliet a classic that should be easy, though most of his crew and actors were simpletons who wouldn’t know great drama if it hit them on the head, killed them, and blamed it on the brother. Erica was good a professional and whilst Samantha was cold and icy about not getting the part of Juliet it only served to improve her performance of lady Capulet, the only other competent actress had her ankle twisted after a scenery mishap with the balcony set, which caused them to waste another day reinforcing every part of every set. Every other actor and actress was hopeless, the nurse kept smoking on set, the prince kept adlibbing lines all of which were foul and out of place and the actor who played Romeo was so bad at remembering his lines Simon was forced to get the man’s twin brother to share the role with him so that both had to learn half the lines. And now the costumes had come in and every had lied about their real size and those who didn’t had really unusual body shapes, it seemed like everything that could go wrong had, and things were about to get worse. “WHERE’S ERICA? IT’S TIME FOR HER SCENE”
“She locked herself in her dressing room and won’t come out.” Simon turned and saw Peter behind the piano talking to a man who had somehow managed to put the back half of a pantomime horse on upside down.
“Why won’t she come out?” asked Simon.
“Don’t know,” said the man giving a shrug before lighting up a cigarette.
“I told you lot not to smoke in here,” said Simon before turning to Peter and saying, “Peter, you and Sunny get everyone else ready I will sort this out.
There was a small crowd outside the door to Erica’s dressing room by the time Simon got there, “Erica what going on, it’s your scene,” he said whilst knocking on the door.
“GO AWAY,” came Erica’s voice from the other side of the door.
“She screamed a few minutes ago,” said a stage hand by the name of Jimmy, “not the lookout he’s got a knife scream but the I stepped in something squishy and…”
“Yes, thank you Jimmy,” Simon had worked with actress before and knew several things about them and how to deal with them. “Is it the outfit?”
There was no response, ‘that’s a yes’ thought Simon to himself, “To small?”
Still no response, ‘another yes’, “it was made for Sunny and she is a bit shorter than you and..”
“GO AWAY.”
‘Nope,’ Simon gave up he didn’t have time to deal with this, he decided to use his next trick of the trade, “If you can’t do the part I’m just going to have to let Samantha t…”
“NO.”
‘Bingo,’ “You are going to have to come out then,” said Simon.
There was a very long pause before Erica slowly opened the door and stuck her head out.
“Come on,” said Simon calmly, or what he thought it was.
The was an awkward moment where Erica stepped out into the hall, the outfit for the balcony scene was a pale blue nightie, which was made for Sunny who was shorter than Erica and not as full in some areas, but that would of only caused the nightie to be rather skimpy and someone Erica’s body and vanity would have no problem with that. Except that Erica was now much fuller that she was before especially in the belly. There were several gasps and sniggers as Erica came into view, whose bulging belly cause the nightie barley reach her hips.
“What’s that?” said Samantha mockingly.
“It’s nothing,” said Erica blushing and trying to tug the nightie further down in fruitless attempt to cover her panties with were purple.
“That’s a lot of nothing,” said Jimmy.
Erica started to blush even more, “Everyone back to you place, you all have jobs to do,” said Simon, “Will sort this out later just do the scene.”

The rehearsal wasn’t good for Erica, first the balcony set creaked ominously as she walked on to it, and she was told to just practice on the stage whilst it was made sure that the set was safe. Secondly was the breeze, her backside was open to the wind and there seemed to a lot more of it, both the wind and her backside, and no matter which way Erica turn someone was going to get a good look at it. Finally was the stares, mostly at her belly, in particular it was the stare from Samantha, because whilst everyone else was staring in disbelief, Samantha was had a grin on her face at the sight of what Erica was going through.

After rehearsal Erica was back in her dressing room getting changed into a large sweater the kind would appear on the model in winter clothing catalogue and some black pants, that she couldn’t button up and only half zip up but at least had more give then her jeans. Just as she was about to go she heard the voice in her head again.
Flip Me
Despite it being in her head she thought it was coming from her handbag, which she reached into and pulled out the coin. Strange, she didn’t remember putting it in there.
Doing as the coin commanded flipped and caught it

1312111122211122112.content:
Time seemed to slowed as Samantha’s belly grew, bulging out from beneath her shirt and popping the button on the jeans before her navel popped out. There was a flash of light and Samantha’s clothes changed to a loose fitting dress and her expression glee was replaced with the cold thin lipped line she had normally.
There was a couple seconds of silence which was broken by Erica saying, “you look…pregnant,” she finished lamely.
“That’s because I’m six months with child,” said Samantha changing position to try and reduce the appearance of her bump, “what’s your excuse?”
“Bad…food…bloating,” was all that Erica could stutter out, how could Samantha be pregnant. Admittedly it had done a lot to help figure, flaring out her hips and increasing her breast size as before she seemed to have the body of a snake, though careful dressing had disguised that fact, and whilst pregnancy had moved her body slightly away from serpentine appearance, her distended belly still gave her the impression of a boa constrictor digesting some sort of mammal.
“Bloating, you nearly as big as me and…”
“Who’s the father?” interrupted Erica in an effort to steer the questions away from her.
Samantha, sighed,” Don’t you know I thought everyone did by now. It’s Simon’s.”
“Simon’s?!,” said Erica nearly as surprised by this, “isn’t he?… you know,” Erica made a variety of hand gestures.
“I don’t know what Simon is, but several months I got him drunk to get him to give me the part and one thing led to another,” Samantha looked dreamy for a moment before saying, “and I then got I stuck with this and forced into the part of lady Capulet because with that outfit, no one would know I was pregnant and Sunny ended up getting the role then goes and hurts her foot, so if I waited I would have had the part, but now you have the part and you’re looking rather b…”
She was cut off as Erica tried to force her way out through Samantha, it would of normally worked but at the moment Samantha had the most mass out of the two girls, but the shock of it caused her to step back and Erica made her escape. Not long after Erica left the room there came a loud groan from Samantha’s belly, she felt immensely hungry. She felt hungrier than she normally did after getting pregnant but just now she felt like she could eat a horse.

When Erica arrived home she found her mother waiting for her, by that it meant her mother was sitting at the kitchen table next to several emptied plate slowly rubbing her belly, when stood up with a bit of effort, when Erica passed the down the hall, “Erica you’re back urp,” she said catching her daughter up.
“What!” said Erica turning around so abruptly that her bloated belly came up against her mother’s.
“Whoa! Is there something you wanted to tell me?” She said place one hand on her daughter’s belly and one hand on her own to illustrate the point.
Erica snorted before storming to her room.
'Her backside has blown up quite a lot as well' thought her mother watch it sway.
1312111122211122112.title: Erica (FP Day 3) Samantha's bugle

13121111222111221122.content:
It was late, and being as fatigued as she was, Erica decided to get some sleep. Now that she was fully undressed, she noticed something. She was big, and not just in her stomach area. Her recent, drastic weight gain (what she wanted to believe) had spread to her breasts and butt along with slightly widened hips. Judging from her mother's pregnancy, she figured that she looked maybe five or even six months. Her breasts were larger, rounder and more sensitive. She could also see that her nipples had darkened.

"What the hell is going on here?" she said out loud, a hand on her belly. After minutes of observing her expanded body, she put on pajamas (which were getting too small around the middle) and tried to go to sleep. This proved to be a more laborious task than Erica had expected. Laying on her stomach was out of the question, for obvious reasons. Although she thought it would be possible to lie on her back, she quickly discovered that the weight of her larger stomach was somewhat difficult to bear. After trying multiple sleeping positions, she had finally passed out from exhaustion.

Dream

The heat of the stage lights caught Erica by surprise. She stood on a balcony, dressed in a blue robe that was much too tight. Looking down at her self, she noticed that her belly was gargantuan, possible due with triplets, or more. Suddenly, she felt movement inside her stomach, making her realize that she was pregnant. The crowd was in awe at her large size. Off the side of the stage, Simon shouted, "Line! Line!" Without thinking, Erica let out, "Romeo, Romeo. Wherefore art thou, Rom--AUGH!" A sharp pain hit her massive stomach, followed by a large splash of water. Suddenly, Erica's mother stood up in the crowd, a hand on her own belly. "Oh, Erica! It's time!" Erica looked up at the lights, then faded to black.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------
Erica woke with a gasp. She looked at the ceiling, and realized that what just happened wasn't real. "Well that was just about the worst dream I've ever had." she said, taking a deep breath. While still in bed, she thought about what she'd do today. She didn't have play practice today, so the day was open. Sitting up after numerous attempts, she was in awe at what sat before her.

Her belly had grown over the night, making her look well over six months pregnant, and nearing seven. "Just stay calm. You're not pregnant. You're not pregnant." Her "non-pregnant" belly had other things in mind. Erica began to feel movement from inside her belly, similar to her dream, albeit not as strong. Erica let out a scream loud enough to wake her mother. While the movement continued, Katelyn bumbled into the room. Katelyn's buttoned-down pajamas could not contain her belly, as half of her shirt was unbuttoned. Erica's mother was shocked. Not only the fact that her daughter appeared to be pregnant, but the fact that she was close to her size, belly-wise.

"Oh my..." her mother said, eyes widened. It couldn't be real. It had to be a joke. She had to make sure of it. Katelyn drew her hands to her daughter's beyond-bloated stomach and felt the movement inside. ''Okay, I'm going to call Dr. Sommers and see if I can get an appointment for you, okay dear?" Katelyn said, trying to remain as calm as possible, not wanting to frighten her probably-pregnant daughter any more than she already was. Rubbing her belly, she called the doctor's office. After three rings, the receptionist finally picked up.

"Triple Rainbow Pediatrics how may I help you?" "Yes, I'd like to schedule an appointment for my daughter, Erica Shaffer. As soon as possible, please." After a few seconds of the sound of paper shuffling, the receptionist returned. "We have an appointment available twenty minutes from now. Would that suit you?" "Yes, thank you." "Before you leave, may I ask what the appointment is for?" Katelyn paused for a moment and looked at her big-bellied daughter. "I believe that she's pregnant..." "You BELIEVE that she's pregnant? Have you been able to identify any symptoms? Like cravings or morning sickness?" "Yes both of those. She was sick two days ago." "Has she gained any weight?" She glanced at Erica. "Little is a bit of an understatement." That was all that the receptionist needed, and she hung up.

Katelyn looked at her daughter. "Erica, we're going to see the doctor right now to find out what's wrong with you."
13121111222111221122.title: The next day (Start Day 4)

choices: Nothing happened.  Erica was free to go.
131211112221112211221.content:
Erica was frightened. "Mom, what's happening to me?" she asked. Her pregnant mother approached her, calmly grabbing her arms. "I don't know, honey. But we're going to find out." Erica put her hands on her swollen belly, noticing that the movement had ceased, for the moment. "Am--am I pregnant, Mom?" Katelyn didn't know what to say. Obviously, she looked to fit the part. But on the other hand, it seemed impossible, considering how much she had grown. "Maybe." Erica's face went pale, as if that was the final word on that matter. Katelyn helped her larger daughter up from the bed, escorting her to the car, both not bothering to change from their too-small pajamas.

The drive was silent, as both of the big-bellied women were thinking about what was about to happen. Arriving at the office, Katelyn approached the desk where the receptionist was sitting. She checked Erica in, and sat down next to her daughter. A woman across from the two noticed the ladies and their big bellies. "Wow, so you're both pregnant? Mother and daughter? There's a show about that on TV!" This made Erica even more embarrassed, as she remained silent. Just then, Erica was called into the doctor's office.

Inside the cold examination room, Erica heaved herself onto the table, waiting for her doctor to enter. Minutes later, her doctor, Dr. Rey, a married mother of three, entered. Her long, brown hair flowed, and it was clear that she had benefited from motherhood. When she first entered the room, she saw Katelyn. "Hello, Ms. Shaffer. How is the baby doing?" she said with a smile. "Fine. But I'm more worried about her." Katelyn said, pointing to Erica. Dr Rey turned towards Erica, as her eyes widened. "Oh my, well now I see why you believe that she's pregnant!" she said, worriedly.

The doctor grabbed a chair and sat in front of Erica. "So, Erica, when was the last time you had sex?" "Well over a year ago. This started a few days ago." she responded, holding her belly. "A few days? Please, give me a rundown of the past few days." she said, grabbing her clipboard.

"Three days ago, me and my mother were at a buffet. While I was there, I threw up, and I got really hungry afterwards. The next day, I was sick again, but it only lasted a few hours. I noticed I was really bloated, and I was still hungry. I tried to go to the gym, but I felt really tired. The next morning, I was bigger, and I had a wardrobe malfunction at practice for a play of mine because I had gotten so big. Now this morning, I was a lot bigger. And earlier, I could of sworn I felt something moving inside. It's stopped since, but it really frightened me and my mom, which is what made her call. Now here we are." she finished giving her belly a slap.

Dr. Rey finished writing on her clipboard, and looked up at Erica. "Could you lay back for a moment?" she said. Erica obeyed as the doctor approached her. She pulled back Erica's shirt, leaving her belly on full display. It was incredibly round, and her belly button was still an innie, but was becoming increasingly shallow. The doctor felt the tightness all over her rounded midsection. "Well, Erica, it would appear that you're around seven months pregnant, from the looks of it. I don't see how this just started three days ago. Let's just do a quick ultrasound to see what's really going on in there."

The doctor rolled the ultrasound machine to the side of the table and began to squirt the ultrasound gel onto Erica's swollen belly. Grabbing the wand, she pressed it into Erica's belly, moving it all around. "Ah! I see one! Wait, a minute, it looks like someone's having twins! No triplets! Wow!" "Triplets?!" Erica and Katelyn said simultaneously. "Yep! Two boys and one girl! My congratulations to you, Erica!" Erica didn't know what to feel. On one hand, she had always wanted to be a mother--just not this young. She also didn't want to be having triplets her first go around. Dr Rey went to get a few papers for the newly expectant mother, leaving Erica and her mother alone.

"Are you mad at me?" Erica said, feeling her belly as her babies had began to kick again. "No. I don't think so. I just really want to know why this is happening to you!" "Me, too" she responded.

Dr. Rey then entered the room and...
131211112221112211221.title: Continue

choices: (FP Day 4) Heads:  Dr. Rey was always pregnant.
(FP Day 4) Tails: Erica gains more passengers.
1312111122211122112211.content:
It only took an instant for the coin to take hold over its host. Erica hypnotically reached for the coin and felt over it with her thumb and finger. She was gazing absentmindedly around the room, her attention in a haze. In the room was a mirror where she could vaguely see her own reflection. She was almost afraid to look at herself in this state, ready to pop. And it would for sure get worse. She couldn't see her mother, but Katelyn was patiently sitting in the corner of the room, observing her daughter.

Erica's mother was an observant person. She was very critical and capable of observing a lot about people. This sudden change in her daughter had thrown her for a loop. There was so much to consider; certainly Erica was in no place to care for three children. Katelyn had enough to think about with raising a new child of her own. It would likely mean that Erica would have to give up her children for adoption. She was a little perplexed by how her daughter was behaving just now. It wasn't normal.

Dr. Rey had returned with a folder of information and was telling them both about it. She was a good doctor, and was going over a plethora of important information concerning Erica's health and well being. The poor girl didn't seem to be listening, however.

There was a glint of light as a coin flew into the air. Katelyn couldn't tell if Erica was looking at Dr. Rey, or her own reflection in the mirror.

The coin fell perfectly back into Erica's hand, and the world began to change once more.
1312111122211122112211.title: The coin called to Erica

1312111122211122112212.content:
Erica and her mother left the examination room and made their way out of the reception, as soon as they stepped outside Katelyn’s belly gave a loud groan.
“Excuse me,” she said pardoning her belly, Erica’s mother pointed to a shopping mall across the road, “I’m going to get some groceries, after all if we want to eat tonight we are going to have to get some more, you can come too, or go home. I’ll just catch a bus back if that is the case.”
Erica was in too much of a daze to go or to even point out that her mother was still wearing pajamas, she hopped into the car and started to drive home.

As she drove home Erica past several take away food outlets, her belly gurgled, it always seemed to be asking for food until she stuffed herself to bursting point and a few hours after that she would be hungry again. She had been resisting her hunger for the last few days, and now she knew why…but she didn’t, she couldn’t be, after all Dr Sommers had pegged her at four months with triplets, but Erica hadn’t had sex in over a year, somehow she knew it was tied up with the sudden pregnancies of her mother and Samantha but theirs were instantaneous and no one seemed to notice a difference, whilst everyone seem to notice Erica steadily growing belly. She held off going to one of the food outlets she didn’t want anyone to see her pigging out, which she knew she would do if she decided to have even just a snack.
She got home, went to her room and fell back onto her bed, there she lay for a while slowly rubbing her belly. She felt a kick Erica jolted it didn’t seem to be followed by anymore, she tried not to think about it after all she couldn’t really be pregnant, this must all be some sort of mistake. She heard some noises from the kitchen told her that her mother was back.

When Erica entered the kitchen, sure enough, her mother was already settling down to cooking up something that she bought earlier that day. Erica made her into the kitchen and stood there. Her mother turned to see her “Triplets, well that explains the sudden appe….” She began to say with a grin but stopped when she saw that her daughter was barley holding herself together. “Awwww there there,” she said went to hug Erica, this proved more difficult them normal, as the women could stand with faces about a metre apart and their bellies would still be touching. After a few seconds of awkward leaning forward Katelyn managed to embrace her daughter in a friendly comforting hug. “There, there,” she said softly, “a nice meal will make you feel better.” Erica would of normally of said no, turning to food for comfort was not what she would do, especially if what she needed comfort from was the fact that she gaining weight. But she hadn’t eaten all day and she was starving. At that point the oven pinged telling the world that it was finish, at the same time her belly gurgled. At least she could stuff herself at home without people watching.
1312111122211122112212.title: Nothing happened.  Erica was free to go.

13121111222111221122122.content:
When Erica woke up the next day she wasn’t surprised that belly seemed bigger, she heaved herself out of bed went to get dressed. Clothes were big problem for Erica as none of them fitted her anymore. When she was… she left that thought stop there, even though she saw it with her own eyes Erica didn’t like to think that was something alive inside her, three somethings. She needed to buy some more clothes unfortunately she had rather late again, not as late as last rehearsal day but late enough to prevent her going to the shops to buy some new clothes and get to rehearsal on time. She could use some of her mother’s maternity clothes, but knowing her mother they would have no style and would have been bought when she was having Erica so they would be even further out of fashion, beside her mother needed them for herself.
She was proven wrong on this last point when she went down to the kitchen, dressed in her sweats, and saw her mother in her pajamas again eating a large lunch or breakfast or dinner, her life seemed to have become one large meal, Erica wondered why the woman hadn’t exploded, though her belly seemed to bigger or at least more strained and making loud groaning noises as more food was forced into. Her mother greeted Erica, though she could be too sure as mother said this with her mouth full and came out incredibly indistinct. Clearly aware that her own belly was about the same size as her mother’s Erica decided not to get anything to eat despite her on belly’s protest, these days once she started eating she didn’t seem able to stop.
Erica spent the time in her room trying not think about food, the large mirror in her room didn’t help, whilst sweat fitted in they covered all the important parts that allowed her to go out in public, her belly still peaked out between the parts, plus the bulky shapelessness of the clothing combine with her increased weight just made her feel fat. She vowed that tomorrow she would get some new clothes.

When the time came to go to rehearsal Erica made her way to the door, telling her mother where she was going as she past the door way to the kitchen, her mother made an indistinct noise which was drowned out by a groan from her belly telling her to back to eating. Erica sighed and half walked half waddled to the car.
The rehearsal wasn’t as bad as the last one, whilst she was bigger she didn’t have to do the balcony scene and hence her outfits were long flowing dress, despite this there was still an unmistakable bulge to show the world that she was with child, and whilst this was better than the truth that she was with children, Erica would of rather been without. Everyone seemed to be whispering or sniggering at she hear it at the edge of hearing as lumbered around the stage, somehow everyone knew she was pregnant, then again when she arrived with a belly as big as hers there is only one logical conclusion. Samantha was still unhappy, despite that Erica was by now the definite larger of the two girls they had made them switch roles. Erica had overheard that there was not enough time to people switch roles.

Erica had a break whilst a few scenes that she wasn’t in were rehearsed, she made her way over to the chairs set up for the audience several days in advance. On stage Simon was shouting at the twins who were playing Romeo, instead of learning opposite halves of the play each or alternate scenes the brothers for some reason had learnt alternate lines and now Simon was wondering whether there was enough time for them to learn the correct lines or to come up with some elaborate system to have them both on stage and say their lines. Erica sat down next to Sunny who was too good natured to giggle or make snide comments about her. A few seconds after Erica had heavily sat down next to her Sunny leaned over and gave Erica’s bulge a pat asking, “When are you due?” There was that, Sunny was that good natured she would be friendly and make conversation and Erica’s belly was an elephant in the room, it felt like one. Erica was just about to respond when…

131211112221112211221221111.content:
Time slowed in an all too familiar way, the bandages around Sunny’s foot unraveled and disappeared into thin air, whilst her belly rapidly grew. It surged forward, inflating like large balloon under her skin, her shirt rose up revealing her growing belly. The chair started to creak and groan under her increasing weight, the front of her skirt burst open from the stain of her swelling belly and widening hips, underneath her stretched shirt came the unmistakable snapping sound as a bra gave way. Erica looked at Sunny in the torn remains of her clothes before they were replaced, her shirt fanned out as it became larger, it changed color to a pastel pink and the logo changed to a ‘humorous’ image of an oven front with bun on both levels inside it and a slogan that Erica didn’t need to read to know what it was going to say. Sunny’s skirt was had become a set of maternity jeans made for her new size.

Time started again, Sunny looked expectantly at Erica, in all meanings of the words, “I don’t really know,” repeated Erica who wasn’t too sure.
“Well you look ready to give birth any day now, lucky you, I still got another two months,” said Sunny cheerfully.
“Aren’t I,” said Erica in a gloomy tone, she wondered if to tell Sunny about the fact of it being triplets then decided against it, Sunny would be good natured about it.
“It’s a shame I couldn’t do the play but it would look a bit silly if I was playing Juliet whilst I this big,” said Sunny sticking out her belly to emphasis it. It was true that Sunny was bigger than Erica being seven months with twins but this did nothing to lift Erica’s spirits as she knew that it was just a matter of time before she would make Sunny’s large bowling ball of a belly look small. “Still it is probably good thing though, I could of really hurt myself when the scenery collapsed couple of weeks ago.” ‘That explains whilst her ankle is no longer bandaged’ thought Erica looking around to see if anyone else had noticed that Sunny’s belly had just blown up like a balloon. No one seemed to have noticed. “I’ve got to go,” said Erica standing up and leaving in an effort not to talk about her belly. A few seconds after Erica had Sunny’s belly gave aloud groan and she felt immensely hungry.
131211112221112211221221111.title: Instant pregnancy for Sunny

choices: Erica (FP, Day 8) Erica receives news about where the coin came from.
Erica (FP, Day 8) Katelyn ends up using the coin.
1312111122211122112212211112.content:
When Erica returned home, her mother was pretending to watch the latest soap opera. “Come join me, Erica,” she said sweetly. Katelyn was clearly concerned for her daughter’s well being. At this point in Erica’s development, she was just the same size as her mother, which she felt horribly self conscious about.
“What is it, mom?”
“I just think we need to talk about what’s going on.”
“I don’t want to talk about it.”
“Now, Erica. There isn’t much time left. I know that this must be stressful, but you won’t feel better if you don’t let your feelings out.”

         Erica waddled over to sit beside her mother on the couch. She couldn’t look at her with the shame that she felt. “What am I going to do?” she blurted out. She stared down at the dome laying heavily in her lap.

“I was thinking,” Katelyn sighed, “I know that you can’t continue your career with three children to take care of, and I was already preparing the house for one. It will be tough, but I can help you. I never thought that I would have to raise multiple children at once. I don’t want you to worry about being burdened by everything. Why don’t you allow me to take care of your sons and daughter?”
“Mom!” Erica started. She bolted from the couch in shock. Tears were pouring from her eyes, and she sobbed horribly. “I can’t do that to you,” she said. Erica felt terrible for her mother. She thought that she must be the worst daughter in the world.
“Erica, I was meant to be a mother. Let me do this for you.”
Erica relented.
“You weren’t meant to be a mother again! You weren’t even like this a week ago! We were at a buffet, and you weren’t even a little pregnant. Then all of a sudden you were like this!”
“Erica, calm down. You’re not making sense.”
“I know I’m not! All I did was flip a coin and then suddenly you were expecting. And it keeps happening: everyone keeps changing right before my eyes. I can’t take it anymore.” Erica paused. She hadn’t quite put it together until that moment. She took the coin out of her purse and thrust it into her mother’s hands. Then she hurried to her room to cry. Katelyn was utterly bewildered as she looked at the object in her hands. What in the world was going on with her daughter?

         As she sobbed, Erica recalled a difficult time that she had had in acting school. Back then she had been depressed about her weight, as she had been underweight and bony. Now she had the opposite problem, but she recalled that the best way to deal with this issue was the same. She had to focus on her work. Expecting triplets? Don’t think about it, she resolved. She would get through this play if it killed her.

Day Six.

“You’re off the show,” Simon told her.

         The daily cycle had repeated itself as usual, and Erica had woken up larger than before. Her belly was surely on par with Sunny’s and had maybe surpassed it. Erica felt like she would cry, but was determined to power through. Today was tech rehearsal, and ultimately more work was going among the tech crew than herself and her fellow actors. Erica had to wait several times during the stop-and-start, uncomfortable in her new form as everyone gawked at her. The tech crew, bless them, were apparently working overtime to disguise the issues among the actors. Simon and Samantha had been talking throughout the process, when suddenly Simon called Erica aside to speak with her.
“What do you mean I’m off the show,” Erica cried, “when you know I can still do it?”
“You can’t” said Simon. “I don’t know what health problems you’re having right now, but that’s too extreme for the crew to handle. The costumer is giving me hell. I told her, ‘what if we give everyone and empathy belly,’ and she pitched a fit.”
“You did what?”
“It doesn’t matter. Look, it’s Tech and I have to do emergency re-casting. I need you to accept this and get whatever medical help that you need.” Simon but his foot down and walked off. Erica was devastated.

         On her way out, Erica passed by each of her old acquaintances. Samantha didn’t speak to her, but gave a little smirk and a fake polite wave. Sunny gave Erica her condolences, as she was genuinely shocked at the casting change. It seemed that they had recruited Sunny to be Lady Capulet, and Samantha would be Juliet instead. There wasn’t much time to talk, as Sunny needed to hurry back into rehearsal. As Erica left the doors, she ran into Jimmy.
“It’s bullshit,” he said. He was not a great speaker.
“What, Jimmy?”
“We were looking forward to seeing you perform. What happened?”
Erica laughed. “I don’t know. I found a magic coin and suddenly nothing makes sense.”
“Magic what? Anyway, you think maybe someone’s been poisoning you with some kind of super weird drug?” Jimmy was not great at theories.
“Well, you let me know if you find anything in my dressing room,” Erica said wearily. Jimmy nodded.

         Erica went home and collapsed into bed. Her dreams were bizarre and uncomfortable.

Day Seven.

         She grew yet again. Today would have been dress rehearsal. She didn’t want to get out of bed that day, which was a difficult task anyway. She looked overdue, if such a thing could be described. As she sank into a depression, the day passed by uneventfully.
1312111122211122112212211112.title: Time to go home

choices: Epilogue: Erica's Future Life, and All Necessary Exposition
Reset: Return to The First Day when Erica received the coin
13121111222111221122122111122.content:
Katelyn looked at her daughter laying in bed. Erica had refused to get out of bed. Not that it would have been easy; she was wallowing in her misery and much heavier than she was used to. Katelyn was shocked at the massive ball spilling into Erica’s lap. Her daughter was wearing a mostly unbuttoned nightshirt, and she could see her future grandchildren were far more active than her mother at the moment.

         “I know this isn’t what you wanted. You were going to become an amazing star. I believed in you; you had such talent and vigor for acting. Then, as life does, it drops children quite literally into your lap. I know how you feel, what with this little one and all. You end up having to make a choice between what you always wanted, and what you need to do. Not everyone gets to live a dream life, but many people aren’t as fortunate as we are. Frankly, I’m just as surprised as you. I had always wanted grandchildren, but I never thought….anyway, I’m proud of what you have accomplished. I’m sorry that you lost the role, but there will be others. I promised you before that I would take care of your children, and I mean to do so. It won’t be easy, but I’m used to making sacrifices. I want to see you smile again. You won’t feel better right away, but I know that talking to me has always made you feel better in the past. Why don’t you tell me what’s on your mind?”

         Erica was trying to speak as best as she could, but the words were sticking in her throat. Worse, her unborn children were distracting her more than ever. Her mother had a way with timing. The thing was, Erica had always respected the idea of becoming a mother. Her own mother had made her proud, raising her on her own. Erica never felt like she was good enough for the scrutinizing Katelyn, however, and there was no ideal way to get her to leave the room.

         “Mom. Everything is over. How can I expect to continue on even if I wasn’t taking care of three children? My body’s a wreck. I’ll have to work so hard just to get it normal again, and then it still won’t be the same as it was. People will know what I’ve been through. They will know that I somehow had three kids and no father is around.”

“That’s not so bad.”

         “Yes it is! I’m grateful that you raised me on your own, but I can’t do that for three kids at once. I hadn’t even really made it big yet. Ha! “Made it big!” Well, now I’m stuck and I have nowhere to go. I might as well take care of my baby sister and my own kids, instead of you taking care of mine. I feel like the world’s out to get me. All this over a stupid coin.”

“The coin again?”

“Yes, it did this whole thing to me.”

         Katelyn sighed. “Erica, there’s no such thing as magic. I mean really, you’re telling me that I had a one night stand nine months ago because you flipped a coin just this past week?”

“I know it sounds crazy.”

“It is crazy, Erica. I know you’re stressed, but you need to calm down. Look, let me show you.”

         “Don’t!” Erica screamed. But it was too late. Looking in Erica’s bedroom mirror, Katelyn flipped the coin and gazed at herself. In a moment, Katelyn’s body morphed as it had in the restaurant. Her clothing changed and extended outward just a little bit. Then the world resumed.

“See, Erica, I’m just a pregnant with twins as I was a second ago.”

Erica sobbed. “Please leave me alone,”

“Look, I’ll show you again,” Katelyn said, looking at her daughter.

         “Don’t!” Erica cried. As she did, the enchanted coin was already in the air. She vaulted herself as well as she could forward, but she could only get onto her knees by the time the coin descended into her mother’s hand.

“Calm down, Erica,” her mother said. “There, tails.”

         Katelyn was about to ask “and you’re no different, are you,” but she found herself swallowing her tongue. Erica, astoundingly, was growing before her eyes. The already massive, gargantuan belly full of triplets billowed forth against Erica’s hands. Her daughter began to sob as her active children kicked against her insides. What had been confirmed as triplets now seemed twice that number, but there was no way to be sure. The taut stomach had shot through the mostly unbuttoned nightshirt, and the additional growth had caused one of the remaining buttons to snap off.

         The world itself seemed to halt. Erica was a blubbering mess, and Katelyn couldn’t process what she had just seen, in fact what she had just done. It was, in essence, a cruel moment within their lives. What had begun as a heartfelt attempt for mother and daughter to connect had horribly crashed to the ground. For the sake of tact, we will give these two privacy in this troubling moment.

         What can be learned from this all? A young woman, ambitious and vain, is unfortunately beset by a misfortune. Her will has not, nor her relationship with others has not created this problem for her. Yet as Time tries all, we all must experience certain universal truths. We are all driven by relationships built with parental figures, just as Erica had learned her ideas of herself ultimately from her own mother. The connections with our acquaintances will determine who helps us when we are in trouble, and poor friendships make for poorer counsel. Erica no doubt suffers more greatly for her lack of bond with her childhood friends.

         Shall we say that there is more to occur within this story? It is the eighth day, but there is still time to make meaningful discoveries. Where did the coin come from, and is there a way to undo the curse? Or will Erica have to learn to give up her dreams and become a mother? Perhaps that is a worthwhile substitute to some, and not to others.

         Or perhaps I, as the being Time, shall allow you one chance to subvert the victory of this wicked trickster, this “cursed coin.” I can, for the sake of a different universe, turn back the clock, and we may begin this story anew from the moment Erica received the coin. There is no guarantee that she won’t still encounter its curse, but she may have more of an opportunity to undo its effects. If that is her wish. An if that is your wish, when choose this option, and allow us to travel to this new universe, at the crucial moment.
13121111222111221122122111122.title: Erica (FP, Day 8) An Unfortunate Ending

(FP, Day 2) Erica wakes up in the dark, and the coin beckons to her.
1312122.content:
As the silver coin rapidly fell toward Erica's hypnotized hand, she blinked hard to clear her dizzied mind. Her lids fell on the sight of a young black woman entering the room. In the brief instant, Erica noticed a red emblem on the woman's t-shirt, but couldn't define its shape. Nor could she when her eyes opened, as it had disappeared. What was once a casual t-shirt was now a dress, highlighting the woman's maternal nature. Erica blinked a few more times as the woman hurriedly passed towards the nearest stall. What had just happened? She was sure that she had seen the outfit of the girl, or at least its color. Another moment passed as she remembered what she held in her hand. She gazed down at the coin, and it gazed back.

A foreboding feeling hung in the air as she finished her evening with her mother. The two went home, where Erica tried to study her lines. She was already comfortable with them, but she hoped to distract herself from the unusual feeling in her mind. It appeared like a curious light, tempting her to approach a bizarre sensation. The coin, which she had placed atop her dresser, was almost calling to her, as if to repeat the event at the restaurant. How ridiculous, yet the idea was almost playful. Why not pretend for a moment that she had the power to change reality?

"Stop it," she groaned. She wasn't going to get any work done at this rate. Surely some sleep would get rid of this pesky sensation. Why did it bother her? It wasn't right; something wasn't right. The world was dramatically changed only a couple of hours ago, but it must have been her imagination. It had to be. She recalled the first time that she had flipped the coin while looking in the mirror. It had been an similarly hypnotic moment, but nothing dramatic had happened--she had just felt a mild tingle. The second time she had flipped it, a person had completely changed in front of her.

"It's just my imagination."

As Erica prepared for bed, other sensations started to pester her. Her skin felt more sensitive, and her mind kept drifting at random. She thought briefly of snacking more, but it was easier to quell this notion. She had disciplined herself to pursue a healthy figure for the stage, and she resolved that she wasn't going to break any more beyond her weakness at dinner. She went to lock the front door.

Just inside the door, she saw a card addressed to her. What was this? A strange end to the strange day; the card itself had no words. Instead, a cartoon of a sun was imprinted on the inside, smiling up at her. Sunny. Was she the one that had dropped off the coin this morning?

At any rate, it was time for bed. Erica put out the lines and tightly gripped her covers as she rested. Her stomach bothered her, and the distracting temptation to flip the coin still pecked at her attention. She thought that she could hear a clock toll on the midnight hour, when she suddenly plunged into sleep. What would happen over the next several days, no one could prepare her for.

13121221.content:
Erica dreamed of receiving the Tony awards. When her name was announced, she hurried onto the stage to receive the award. It was a silver disk held atop a pedestal by a frame. On the disk there was an image of a happy and sad face, but in her dream she saw the image of the coin. The disk began to glow and spin. Erica heard whispers all around her, and she felt a great heat and pressure within herself. She had to sit herself on the ground, she was so overwhelmed. As she sad on the stage, her stomach grew and pushed forward until it reached her knees.

She had not slept well. Her dreams were wild and eccentric. She'd imagined herself pregnant, which was altogether an unpleasant thought. When she woke up, she had felt groggy and miserable. Looking at herself in the mirror didn't help. Everything was swollen. Erica looked aghast at the distinct change in her profile.
Her breasts were bigger, and they ached. Then she saw her belly gently sloping outward. She had lost control of herself the previous night, eaten too much. But that wasn't a good excuse. She couldn't just get rid of fat when it appeared. That's what her mother always told her.

She chastised herself as she dressed for the day, thankful that everything still fit. Erica glanced at the coin and considered whether she could learn anymore about it. She was superstitious, so the coin went with her.

Feeling sick and ashamed of herself, Erica walked over to Ashley's place. It was a bright and sunny day, and full of bustling life. The area had a wild rabbit problem, and Erica saw several on her way. She had always found animals to be cute. Suddenly there was a wild hare stopped in front of her. Rather than pet it, Erica pulled out the coin and flipped it. The hare appeared to sense danger and bolted away. When the coin landed, it was heads.

Erica turned her head to see a woman pushing a stroller directly towards her. The world seemed to shimmer, and the woman halted. Before Erica's eyes, she swore that she saw the woman swell. Her belly expanded outward in almost and instant, but the stranger only rubbed the fecund orb pleasantly.

"Are you okay?" Erica asked.
"What? Oh, yes, I'm feeling lovely," said the woman. "I just need to take a break from walking sometimes."

Her question answered, Erica hurried away. What on earth had happened?

Ashley was an adorable woman, and a friend to everyone. Erica liked her too, as a person. Ashley's sunny disposition was a good aid for conversation, and she was always willing to listen. Erica wasn't sure that she would listen to her unusual tale, however, or whether it should be brought up at all.

She knocked on the door, coin in hand.

choices: (FP, Day 2) Tails...Erica expands to some degree.
(FP, Day 2) Tails...Erica's change doesn't show, yet...
13121222.content:
In the stygian black of night, the air of Erica's room was deathly silent. The air only slightly moved with the passage of her breath. Her sleep was deep and heavy in dreams. Beside her bed, on the nightstand, lay the enchanted coin. Imbued in its metal was a mischievous spirit, ever calling to interact with humans. It's call could not be heard with the human ear, but open minds could perceive its message. The spirit wanted its power to be used, and it had one primarily effective method of persuasion.

The spirit's call reached Erica's resting mind and tapped into her dreams. She dreamed of herself in ways she never had before. She was living her role as Juliet, gazing out from a balcony. She could feel a thrum pervading the air, causing her body to tremble. The moon above was changing phases from new to full, and it seemed to be getting closer to her. As if in response, she felt a change in herself. Her slim belly was expanding in kind, becoming full and great before her. Inside she felt a warm and comfortable presence. Her belly grew to absurd proportions, first as if she expected twins, then triplets, and then even further, until she couldn't imagine how many she carried. Above her, the moon had changed into a flipping coin, each side cascading an eerie light upon her.

When Erica awoke, she was sweating. She felt somewhat heavy in her bed, but she was too uncomfortable to stay where she was. Her hand caressed her slim stomach as she pondered the bizarre dream. Did it feel different? No, of course not. The time was 3AM as she sluggishly walked to the restroom. Erica washed her face and drank some water from the faucet.

"Flip me."

What was that? Erica walked back to her bedside table and pondered what she had sensed. The gifted coin that she had been flipping since last night was sitting there. She picked it up. "What are you?" she wondered.

"Flip me."

"Why should I?" She wondered. There was a small tug in the back of her mind. It was a primal feeling, something she couldn't explain. She shouldn't flip the coin, but why not? She flipped the coin once, but in the dark she couldn't see how it landed in her hand. She felt a strange affection for the motion.

"Flip me."

This time, the compulsion was different. She found herself moving, as if sleepwalking, back toward the bathroom mirror. She saw herself, still drained from her lack of sleep. She was moving without thinking, marveling selfishly at herself. She wanted to flip the coin, to cause something to happen that she couldn't describe, and yet she was rebelling against the notion. "What am I doing?" she asked her other self. "This is stupid." And yet, she felt a bizarre yearning. It was just a coin, of course. She was just tired and drained. What was it that she wanted?

A wave of nausea struck her, and she raced to the toilet to gag. Damn it all. She was thankful not to vomit again. Shaken from her daze, she stood back up and looked once more into the mirror. She hoped that this wouldn't be a continuing issue. She hadn't made it far before the compulsion to flip the coin returned.

"What the heck," she said, and she flipped it once more, trying to look as cool as she could in the mirror...
13121222.title: (FP, Day 2) Erica wakes up in the dark, and the...

choices: (FP, Day 2) Erica goes to dress rehearsal and eventually uses the coin.
(FP, Day 3) Dress goes off fine, but Erica expects triplets by morning.
131212221.content:
Her attempt to look cool didn't work. As the coin landed in her hand, Erica felt an abrupt disturbance. The world, which had been so serene and peaceful, began to stretch. Her vision of herself in the mirror blurred as the entire room seemed to smear and swirl. The dizzying effect was overwhelming. She held her head in her hands and reeled, wishing for things to grow still.

Eventually, it did. Erica opened her eyes to find herself in the bathroom again, so overcome with nausea that she vomited in the toilet. She sat against the wall of the bathroom, steadying her breath. Whatever had occurred had shaken and frightened her. Her stomach felt uneasy and tight, and she rubbed it gently to ease it. The motion was in vain, though, as she couldn't help but fear that it was slightly bigger than it had been before. Erica returned to bed after washing out her mouth; her rest was disrupted by more odd dreams.

Erica woke up and met her mother for breakfast Katelyn had prepared a large breakfast of eggs, hash browns, and melon for them both.

"Oh, Erica, you look so exhausted," her mother whispered. She pulled a chair back for her daughter. When Erica sat down, Katelyn affectionately combed her daughter's hair.
"I didn't sleep well," Erica mumbled.
"It's only natural. I remember when I was in your position. I was so nervous."
"My position..." Erica mumbled, but she stopped herself. Katelyn had never pursued acting to her knowledge, but the argument wasn't worth getting into. She turned her attention to her breakfast. Erica was normally particular with how much she ate, and she paced herself well. Today she found that difficult, as a great hunger was possessing her. By the time that she finished her usual amount for breakfast, she was hankering for seconds.
"You look so cute today, honey. I can see your little bump already," Katelyn giggled.
"Mom!" Erica gasped.
"Oh, dear, it's perfectly normal."
"You can't just call me fat." Erica retorted. She put down the remainder of her food and hurried back to her room.
"Come back and finish your breakfast, Erica," her mother called.

Erica started getting dressed, bewildered by her mother's behavior. Katelyn had always been very critical if Erica showed any excess weight, and she was determined to stay in shape. Now that she thought about it, though, Erica looked down at her belly. There was a tiny, perceptible curve poking out in her center. It was oddly firm to the touch, disturbing her. Erica was afraid that she was starting to look pregnant: something that she had never wanted in her life. She resolved that she would go to the gym.
"Honey," Katelyn called through the door. "Overreact if you want, but I'm just trying to make you feel better. Now, I have to go to work. I'm proud of you."

Erica went to the gym, confused at her mother's behavior. She had grown up always conscious about her weight, in no small part due to Katelyn's criticisms. She entered the gym with purpose, but soon found the routine difficult. For reasons that she did not yet know, she was becoming exhausted more quickly.

As she was cooling off with light walk on the treadmill, her coworker Samantha appeared on the treadmill beside her. There was a tense silence for a moment. Erica wasn't in the mood for talking, but she supposed it couldn't be helped.
"Hey."
"Hey. How're you feeling?"
"Good."
The silence returned. Samantha let out a sigh as her treadmill picked up the pace. "I talked with Rachel yesterday." Rachel was the costume designer.
"What about?"
"She's really excited for the show. I don't know how she does so much by herself."
"It's such a tough job. She's really great," Erica agreed.
"She was very clear that she didn't want any accidents during dress rehearsal tonight. She's not going to have enough time for modifications."
"We're professionals. Nothing bad's going to happen."
"Knock on wood," Samantha quipped.
"Yeah." There was another brief awkwardness, as Samantha struggled to say something.
"Hey, what you're doing... it's impressive." She said.
"What?"
"Don't make me repeat it. It's impressive. I don't think I could do the same thing in your shoes."

The two had a strangely amicable time together. They didn't talk too much about themselves, but rather the show and the crew. The longer that they talked, though, Erica felt a nagging sensation in the back of her mind. The coin was still in her pocket, calling to be flipped. As she cleaned up, Erica glanced at herself in the mirror, determined that the tiny curve in her abdomen would eventually be vanquished.

Rather tired, there wasn't much to gain from spending more time at the gym. She shared tea with Samantha, and went over lines before the dress rehearsal that evening. All the while, the scratching voice in her became stronger.

What Erica didn't know is how the coin flip that morning had affected the world around her. Everyone knew that she was pregnant, and with twins at that. Only Erica was unaware of this. To others, Erica was relentlessly pursuing her career in spite of her physical limitations, but none of them could possibly have known that each passing day was causing history itself to rewrite.
131212221.title: (FP, Day 2) Heads...Everyone Knows but Erica

choices: Day 3 (triplets): Erica gets a sonogram, uses the coin at the hospital

1312122212.content:
Rehearsal went fine. Not good, or great, but fine. The performances were not to the quality that Erica wanted, and on occasion she requested that they redo scenes. The director, Simon, was thankfully okay with this. Even though Erica was doing this play to help out, she wanted the others to do a good job. Not everyone was appreciative of this.

It could be said that their Romeo, a man named Duncan, was a bit eccentric. He was prone to carrying charms around with him, and would whisper tiny affirmations and prayers to them between scenes. The thing that concerned everyone, primarily, was that he always appeared to be exhausted, which had not been the case when he was first cast. Perhaps the stress had simply gotten to him. Regardless, his irritability mounted, and eventually he refused to redo scenes.

The rehearsal ended, and Erica went straight home. She was feeling exhausted herself. When she got home, she laid in bed at around midnight. She was gazing at the alarm clock when when the digit changed to 12:00 AM, when the world dissolved. She was whirling into sleep, lucidly conjuring strange images in her mind. She kept seeing herself in various different states, replaying the same scene on stage. Sometimes her hair would change, other times her dress. Other features would change as well. No matter how many times the scene replayed, she was never the same. Her dream was akin to a flip book, and the many disconnected images flashed before her. One thing that stuck out to her was that one part of her only seemed to grow bigger.

As she dreamed, she felt an uncomfortable pressure in her stomach.

Erica awoke groggily. She laid still for a few minutes, perplexed at something that she was feeling. Her hand was cupping under a new swell on her belly. Bewildered, she threw off the covers and got a better look at herself. On her belly was a distinct swelling, a tiny bump, and inside something was stirring.

It was impossible. Anxiety and terror welled up within her as the reality of the thing became all too apparent.

"Mom?!" She cried. Erica hurried out of her room and found her mother in the kitchen. "Mom..."
"Good morning darling! Oh, look at you. Aren't you precious? You look so beautiful." Her mother came over and hugged her.
"Mom, I think something's wrong with me."
"What do you mean? Is everything alright?"
"I mean... this, just look at it," Erica moaned. But her mother didn't seem to be listening.
"Oh, you're adorable. I remember when I was five months pregnant with you, I looked just like that. I guess we know what that might mean! Isn't it exciting?"
"Pregnant..." murmured Erica. It didn't make sense. Nothing made sense. Her mother went back to preparing breakfast.
Kaitlyn looked back at her daughter. "Now, Erica, your doctor's appointment is today, isn't it? You need to freshen up. Go make yourself ready. I'll have your breakfast ready for you."

Erica did as she was told, a hand never leaving the new bulge of her belly.

Her clothing was different. Erica had never in her life bought maternity clothes, but in her dresser, unmistakably, were clothes meant for her new physical condition. It was all too much, but she had to pull herself together. She found herself following instructions, driving to a doctor that she had never known before, to get a sonogram for a condition that she never thought would have. As she approached the hospital, she felt a foreign object in her pocket as she walked.

It was the coin. Erica looked at the bizarre object with a new suspicion, although it seemed impossible. She could barely speak; everything around her seemed impossible. What she didn't understand--indeed what she couldn't fathom--was that her pregnancy was progressively increasing in number each day. This was the unnatural result of using it twice on herself: once Tails, and then the second time, Heads.

Resolving her shaken self as best as she could, Erica turned to the hospital and prepared to enter.

1312212.content:
This was nuts. Erica hesitantly probed the massive orb with the tips of her fingers. It couldn't possibly be real. Using the toilet proved awkward, but if nothing else she was able to sit and breath for a moment. No matter how tightly she shut her eyes, not matter how hard she wished otherwise, she was pregnant. Worse, she was impossibly big; there would be no easy way to hide this from anyone. She quickly put her shirt back on as well as she could. It didn't cover any part of her stomach.

         The only thought Erica had was to get to safety: to get home. She struggled to put away all of her fearful thoughts. What would happen to her? Was she going to give birth right then and there? She felt incredibly uncomfortable. The new weight of her abdomen was serious, and the skin of her belly was tight. Furthermore, the unborn children in her womb were moving. Tears welled up in her eyes as she waddled out of the dressing room.

         She raced out of the building. Rehearsal had gone into late night, so there weren't many people still in the building. It didn't matter to her, though. There was no time or probability for being stealthy. She rushed to her car, not thinking of whether people saw her. As she got to the door, she fumbled her keys out of her purse, only to drop them.

"Shit," she cried. The keys lay before her on the ground of the lot, taunting her. What followed was a humiliating series of attempts to lower herself to the pavement. Her knees ached. The keys were just out of reach,

"Do you need help, Miss?" called a familiar voice.

It was the director, Simon.

"No," Erica groaned, almost praying. "Leave me alone."

         But Simon didn't listen. He hadn't recognized Erica from where he stood, but knew clearly that this large pregnant woman needed some help. Hyper focused on the keys, he hurried over and picked them up. As he held the keys out, he finally saw Erica's face.

Then they stood there, staring at each other in shock.

         "Simon," called out a woman's voice. It was Sunny, the stage manager. She was a nice, short woman with black hair. She was dressed for a social outing at the local bar, the usual hangout for the cast and crew after work. As she came to Simon's side, she also looked at the mortified Erica. Here eyes filled with shock as she, too, became a frozen statue. "Oh my God," she whispered.

The world did not revert to normal as she had hoped. When the coin fell down into her hand, it's magic took hold again. She felt an electric sensation pass through her body. Her belly, which had already astonished her, began to press out further. A heat built up inside of her. Erica did not feel real during this moment; everything was impossible and bewildering. Her emotions raced, and she felt sensations that she had never expected. Naturally, she was afraid. Her stomach was becoming tighter and heavier as it grew. The truth was plain to see that she was pregnant. This would have terrified her enough on its own, but the enormity of the image was beyond her. For a moment, a guilty kind of pleasure invaded her senses, which she recoiled at. What in the world was going on?

         Her children moved. There was no way to tell how many children she was surely having, but one would simply be too few for her ever-growing figure. The flurries of kicks inside of her seemed everywhere, and she felt the pressure against her hands. Erica was awash in heat and pressure and tingling. She suddenly felt dizzy, and uncomfortably fell to her knees. Tears were in her eyes, but she couldn't afford to cry. Unfortunately, the growth of her stomach wasn't stopping. Her blouse had lost its buttons and her pants had become uncomfortably tight. Against the onslaught of sensations, she tried to think of what to do.

         She took a breath, feeling her swelling lungs against her rib cage. All of her insides felt cramped. The first thing she had to do was call an ambulance. She rattled her brain for where her phone had been, and remembered with horror that it was on the other side of the room. With a desperate push, she raised herself from the floor and raced to her phone. Her stomach was so heavy, and the constant movement inside was distracting. Erica found her phone, turned it on, and froze.

         First, she noticed the time. Everything had occurred in such a short period that she almost forgot that she had plans with her mother that night. The momentary thought of her mother's shame wet her eyes. Second, she realized that the pressure inside of her belly had ceased. The belly that she beheld was phenomenal. It was bigger than she had ever personally seen in a woman before, and she had known women with twins. Third, she noticed was that she was still holding the coin. She turned again towards the mirror that she had run from, and felt a great shock at how she had changed. Worse yet was an unusually familiar feeling, that of a calling. Flip the coin, it said again. In shock and horror Erica threw the coin at the mirror.

         This was a mistake. As the coin flew through the air, it's magic activated again. It bounced off of the mirror and began to roll atop the floor. Almost mockingly, it got nearer to Erica, and fell...

Option 1: Heads. Erica's reality changes and stabilizes.

Option 2: Tails. Erica encounters a final change, (she becomes pregnant with sextuplets), and undergoes labor.

132.content:
Erica looked and saw her first high school 'crush'. It was Madelyn Keim, the gorgeous and delightfully cute physical education teacher. Her jaw dropped. "Miss Keim, is it really you?"

"Yes, Erica, I heard you were here. I came to see you and to know if you even remembered me. I'm glad you do. Please, Erica, call me Madelyn or some part of it; I don't want to be that teacher called 'Miss Keim' with you; I want to be seen as your equal, both of us women and neither of us a teacher to the other. You're more beautiful today than you were then." She brushed her fingers through her short brown curls and looked into Erica's eyes.

Erica held her eyes to Madelyn's and held her breath in surprise and delight. "Madelyn, I always wanted to be more than a student, more than a friend, to you; still do. As an actress I have men falling all over themselves pursuing my heart and body; but my heart has always wanted you, the apple highest in the tree that I could never have." She moved toward the emerald eyes and smiled at the soft smile on Madelyn's face.

Madelyn's arms reached out as her eyes spoke volumes.

Erica's lips found the softness of Madelyn's against her own as the two women wrapped their bodies together. The long, slow kiss sent chills of joy, sensual sensations through both of them. The love that began during Erica's senior year was now free to blossom into lifelong love and passion with her high school teacher who was filled with the same depth and wonder of romantic love for the young woman who had once been untouchable.

In the privacy of her room, Erica ended a kiss with an extended look into Madelyn's eyes. Then took her by the hand, led her to the bed and pulled Madelyn onto herself. "I'm so in love with you yet I've tried to hide my love of the loveliest woman in the world, for the sake of my reputation; but right now, I put all that behind me and let loose all my love for you forever. "You're making my daydreams and my best night dreams come true. I hope you felt all my love for you in that kiss just as I felt so much love from you to me in that kiss."

Madelyn, "These are the best moments of all my life. I wish we could marry, even so, we'll never be apart again. I've found you again and will love you in every way all my life." She kissed the full, luscious lips open to her and kissed Erica's slender neck, her ear lobes and her hands found their way to sweep across the full, soft breasts of the woman who had at one time been her student. "I love you so much, Erica."

Later, after hours together on the bed and in the shower, Erica and Madelyn sat on the patio with wine coolers remembering the time they were together and the years they had been apart.

Erica had dropped the gold coin and it rolled under the bed.

"Oh, Honey, I just thought of something. Just before you came in, I had found a strange coin with symbols of pregnant couples on each side of it. I had flipped it then looked up and saw you." She laughed. "There must have been some magic in that old coin I found. It brought me you." Erica smiled and patted Madelyn's hand.

Madelyn laughed. "You don't know the myth about the coin with pregnancy associated with it. I can't believe this!" She laughed even harder and louder. "Erica, my sweetheart, that means if you looked at me when you flipped it, I'm supposed to be pregnant and have a baby in nine days."

Erica laughed. "Really? You'll look really cute being pregnant. You're so small, you'll blow up like a balloon. If that happens, we'll be parents. Boy or girl? Which do you want?"

"Well, either would be fine. My brother's a good guy, and handsome too. You're beautiful and wonderful. So either will suit me." Madelyn laughed. "But that's all just a myth, 'hocus pocus'. No magic. But we have each other now."

"Girl, if it's no myth, we need to have a home and be ready in nine days. We can't be living here in my dressing room. Hell, I don't even have an apartment; I hope you do." Erica laughed.

"I have a very nice home in the suburbs of Las Vegas. Why don't you go home with me today?"

"I will. We two are one now and we just may, by some mythical magic, be three in nine days. I'm ready as soon as I call my publicist." Erica picked up the phone and dialed a number. "Mark, as my publicist, you need to know, I'm retiring to a little home in the burbs of Las Vegas. Yes, starting today. Cancel everything and close up my cubbyhole here. Yes, I mean my dressing room."

When Erica and Madelyn left the dressing room that day to live as lovers and wives for the rest of their lives, the gold coin lay under the bed where it had rolled. It was found by the young maid who tossed it to her boss that afternoon. He missed it and it landed on the floor. As he picked it up, he looked toward the maid who was looking straight at him. "Sometimes I wish you knew what it was like to be a mother!" Rachel Glover yelled at her husband, Leon, who sat glued to the TV, nursing a beer.
They didn't always fight, but it seemed to quickly becoming the norm around the Glover household. Ever since her husband took that promotion.
Oh sure, the extra money was worth it, they needed it ever since her home business started slowing down.

But still, the long hours and extra workload added extra stress onto the already stressful Glover household. The reason for the stress in Glover household was cleanliness, or lack thereof. Oh, it wasn't some disgusting pigsty, but it wasn't something you'd see in a magazine either.

There were always laundry to be washed and sorted, things that needed fixing, chores to be done. Several years ago, Rachel and Leon paid their children to help around the house; doing laundry, taking out the garbage, cleaning the house, general chores. They would spend their money on movies, video games, comic books, toys, whatever their son and daughter wanted.

Now, her son and daughter, both teenagers in High School, had jobs. Real jobs that earned them real money. Real jobs that they had to balance with real school work, to get into a real college for their real futures. They day of pretend jobs as "picking up toys, recycling papers" were long gone, and as such, those once menial tasks began to pile up.

Before his promotion, her husband worked steady hours, at a steady pay, at a steady job, allowing him time to help out around the house. But ever since the promotion, his hours had become chaotic, his pay had doubled, and his free time was mostly reserved for the vacation time he had saved up for Thanksgiving week and two-week long Christmas holiday, with the occasional family trip, should it ever happen.

He hadn't seen a non-working weekend off in a year. He'd work most of a Saturday, then try to relax by himself on a Sunday, before heading back to work on Monday to repeat the cycle.

As such, his helpfulness around the house ground to a dead stop. All he wanted to do now when he got home was relax, try to get in as much "me time" as he could before he would start his work day again bright and early the next day. This left all of the housework to fall on Rachel.
She worked from home yes, and yes, that would allow her extra time in the day to, in the words of her husband "Get done what needed to get done", but that still didn't mean much to her.
Grocery shopping, errand running, house cleaning, dinner cooking, all of this took much longer than anyone in her family could be lead to believe. Factor that in with the small sewing business she set up for herself online, her days were packed to the brim.

Of course, her husband never really saw her home business as much of a job. He saw it as a way for her to earn some extra spending money for herself while she raised the kids. HE was the bread winner after all. The little amount she made did help with the bills, but hardly compared to what her husband made yearly.

She make various little trinkets, blankets, baby clothes, and more from her home studio, selling them online via websites, and at country fairs and craft shows. It took up most of her time, but back then she had her children to help her out around the house when they got home early from school, allowing the place to always look spotless.

Now her children were teenagers with jobs, and the clutter around her house was pilling up. Everyday she asked her husband the same thing, "Can't you help around her a little?" and he always said the same thing "I do. I pay the bills." The argument would usually escalate from there, eventually ending in the same way, Leon saying "How hard can it be? You're home all day!"

Leon still loved her very much, but the stress of his promotion was starting to get to him. While he kept in shape, (Lord knows how he could find the time Rachel frequently asked him), the new job duties were causing a strain in their marriage. They were arguing more, he was helping less, she was crying more.

Today was expectantly bad, as dinner was late because her son's baseball practice ran over. After picking him up, doing the laundry, getting everything settled, dinner had just barely started cooking. Leon was not happy about this. Rachel was not happy about Leon not being happy.

They argued, for a long time.
"Rachel, how hard can this be! I could do all this standing on my head!" he shouted, his eyes not looking up from the TV.
She had enough for today!
"Sometimes I wish you knew what it was like to be a mother!" Rachel screamed at the top of her lungs.
She wasn't quite sure what that meant, but there was passion behind her words. She meant what she said, even if she wasn't quite sure what exactly she said.

Leon rolled his eyes, when there came a knock on their front door. Leon looked at her expectantly, and Rachel sighed and rolled her eyes.
It will only get better. It has to. she thought.

She opened the front door, to see nothing.
No one was there. She looked around, and then a small glint of sliver caught her eye: It was a coin.

A small little silver coin about the size of a quarter. It was covered in scratches, but the coin appeared to have what looked like a pregnant man and a pregnant woman are on the head of the coin, a happy look on their face, while on the tail end of the coin, are the same pregnant man and pregnant woman, a look of panic and fear on their face.

What is this? A Coin? Where did it come from? she thought as she picked it up.
She examined the coin on both sides, looking at it in the porch light, the sun setting off in the distance.

"Who is it?" her husband bellowed from the couch.
"It's no one!" she said, still examining the coin. It was unlike anything she had ever seen ever.

Flip Me Rachel. A voice that was not her own echoed sweetly through her head.

Closing the door and heading back into the living room, she could see a lot of activity down the street. The neighbors were outside talking.
Her husband sat on the couch, watching tv, drinking his beer.

Flip me Rachel the voice commanded her.

She did what it asked, flipping the coin high into the air and catching it with one swift motion.

"Nice catch Honey" Leon said, in a sweet genuine tone.
He could still be the sweet amazing man I married she thought, looking at her closed hand.

Look the voice commanded her.

She did, as her eyes full upon...
144.title: Rachel Glover - An Unexpected Package.
