"Emiko and I did talk about it", said Alice,"But neither of us liked the idea. I won't deny that I'm scared, but I'm determined to be a mother to this baby, no matter what."

"I've always felt the same way", said Nicole. "Which is funny when you consider what a self-absrobed little twerp I'd always been up to that point. Why, are you thinking of giving up your baby, Sheila?"

"No, no, I feel that same way as you all do. I just wondered if everyone else affected by the coin felt that way, too."

"Now that you mention it", said Nicole, "To my knowledge, all of the other affected women are keeping their babies. Do you think it's the coin affecting our thinking?"

"It could be", said Sheila. "I'm still researching it. I may have some news next week."

"Well, keep us posted."

In time, the party broke up. As Alice stood up to leave, her belly seemed to drop downwards.

"Oh, my God, I can breathe again!", she said.

"Looks like your baby's dropped" said Sheila. "It's only a matter of time, now."

When Emiko and Alice got home, it was just about 6:00 p.m.

This is it, thought Alice, Sometime in the next 24 hours, I will become a mother!
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: Day Eight for Alice

choices: The New Mother's First Day in Her New Home
Wasn't There a Magic Coin in This Story? Whatever Happened to That?
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
That evening, Alice relaxed in front of the TV while Emiko made last minute preparations. From time to time, she stopped to see how her friend was doing.

"Alice, can I get you anything?" she asked.

"No, Emi, I'm fi - AIIIEE - ne!" said Alice.

"Alice, are you OK?"

"Yeah, yeah, I'm OK, just a bit of a contraction."

"Oh,my God, the baby's not coming now, is it? Should we get you to the hospital?"

"Calm down, Emi, you sound like an expectant father from a 60's sitcom! No, I don't think the baby's coming now. I'm pretty sure that was what they call a 'Braxton-Hicks' contraction. Just my uterus firing a warning shot, is all. But since you ask, I could go for some more ice cream."

Emiko went to fetch the requested treat, and then came back and sat down next to Alice with a snack of her own.

"Done with preparations?' asked Alice.

"Yeah", said Emiko, "We're about as ready as we can be."

"Good", said Alice. "Just sit with me a while. I could use the human contact." She leaned her head on her friend's shoulder. "It just occurred to me that this is probably my last night in this apartment. The place is kind of a dump, but I have some fond memories of my time here."

"Well", said Emiko, "We'll just have to make some new fond memories in the future. Say, Emiko, in all the rush, I never asked you - do you have any names in mind?"

"I do, but I'm keeping them to myself until the kid is born. I'm not usually superstitious, but just this once, I don't want to jinx it."

The next morning, Alice awoke feeling surprisingly calm. Emiko, however, seemed to be a bundle of nerves.

By lunch time, Alice couldn't stand it anymore.

"Quit jumping around, Emi, you're like a long-tailed cat in a room full of rocking chairs. This baby may not come for hours, yet."

"I know, I know", said Emiko. "I almost do feel like an expectant father, you know. As if there aren't going to be enough people assuming we're a couple as it is."

"You know what, Emiko?" said Alice."I don't care if they do think that. I could think of worse partners to have than you."

Emiko sat down next to her.

"You know, Alice, we've never discussed this, but I'm not really all that interested in boys..."

"Me, neither", said Alice. "But, as interesting as this conversation is, I'm afraid we're going to have to postpone it. We've got something more immediately interesintg to talk about right now."

"What's that?"

"I'm pretty sure my water just broke."

"What? Really?"

"Stay calm, Emi. Now, I've read that there's usually some time between a woman's water breaking and the start of her labor. However, because of the 'accelerated' nature of my pregnancy, I expect it to be sooner rather than la- AAAAIIIEEE- ter."

Emi called Doctor Gomulka and spoke to her, briefly. The doctor agreed that it sounded like it was time to take Alice to the hospital. In the meanwhile, Alice called Sheila and Nicole to let them know what was happening.

As Emiko drove Alice to the hospital, the mother-to-be's contractions began coming closer together. Fortunately, the hospital was nearby. Emiko helped Alice check in, and then sat down to wait. Her wait was not a long one. It seemed like she had hardly sat down when a nurse approached her.

"Excuse me, you came in with Alice Wang, didn't you?"

"Yes, that's right. Is something wrong?"

"No, nothing's wrong. Your friend has just given birth, that's all."

"What, already?"

"Yes, it was very fast. The doctor said he'd never seen such a quick delivery. Anyway, your friend and her daughter are just fine."

Daughter! So Alice had a girl!

"When can I see her?"

"In just a little while. The doctor's just giving her a once-over, and then they'll move her to a room."

While she was waiting, Emiko called Nicole and Sheila again. Soon thereafter, she was ushered to Alice's room. Alice, looking exhausted but exultant, lay in a hospital bed with her newborn daughter in her arms. Emiko smiled. The baby looked just like Alice.

"Hey, kiddo, won't you introduce me to your new friend?"

Alice smiled. "I've named her after my mother - and my dearest friend. Emiko, please meet Pearl Emiko Wang."

Tears came to Emiko's eyes even as a big, beaming smile filled her face. Then she laughed.

"You realize, of course, that you've given your baby initials that spell 'PEW'?"
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: Day Nine for Alice

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
After a day and a half in the hospital, Alice and Pearl came to their new home in Nicole's condo. Within a few short weeks it was Nicole's turn to give birth, as she had a healthy young son, George Peter Winters. That was the month of many births. Soon after George's birth, Betty gave birth to a daughter, Margaret Mary O'Donnell. Bridget followed suit by giving birth to a daughter of her own, Jean Moira O'Donnell. They heard also of the birth of Sylvia's son, William Harold Hayes, Chloe's daughter, Rhiannon Marielle D'Alphonse and even Bunny Waterford's son, Zachary Taylor Waterford-Harris.
As she had previously planned, Nicole went to stay with the O'Donnells after she left the hospital, leaving Alice and Emiko on their own in her condo. She came back home after another month. All this time, Sheila - now effectively eight months pregnant - had been researching the coin. That month, she was distracted somewhat by the birth of her sister Jean's son, Patrick Andrew McCormack, not to mention the imminence of her own child's birth. However, one day she had made a discovery that led to her asking Nicole, Emiko and Alice to come see her.

Nicole hung up the phone, and went and spoke to Alice and Emiko, letting them know that Sheila wanted to see them.

"She said to bring the babies along, too, she's finally got her place baby-proofed."

The other two were free at the moment, so they agreed that now was a good a time as any.

"OK, then", said Nicole, "I'll let Tiffany know we're going."

"Tiffany" was Tiffany Biltmore, Nicole's 18 year-old cousin, a petite blonde girl. She had come to stay for the weekend at her mother's urging, in order to give Nicole and her friends whatever help they needed.

"Tiff", said Nicole, "We're all going out to see a friend. We're taking the babies with us, so you're going to be on your own for the next few hours, at least. We'll probably have dinner there, so feel free to help yourself to something here, or eat out, if you want."

"OK, Nicki", said Tiffany, "maybe I'll take the bus downtown and meet up with one of my friends."

Nicole smiled at her cousin. she was a good kid, still caught up in the world of partying and hanging out that Nicole had been a part of not that long ago. Nicole went into her room and took the coin out of its hiding place and set it down on top of her dresser next to a pile of loose change that she had set aside to sort and roll up later. At that moment, she heard George begin to cry. She ran to the nursery and picked him up and began to comfort him. Just then, Tiffany, came into the room.

"Sorry to bother you, cuz, but I just remembered - the buses around here insist on exact change, right? I've got money on me but not much change. Do you have any change I could borrow?"

"Sure, just take whatever's on top of my dresser, that's fine."

Emiko, now effectively five months pregnant, and Alice, carrying Pearl, came into the room.

"Could one of you guys drive?" asked Emiko. "I'm starting to reach the point where it's hard for me to fit behind the wheel!"

Distracted, Nicole left the condo, having forgotten to go back and get the coin. It was only when they had sat down in Sheila's parlor that she remembered.

"Crap!" she said. "I left the coin on my dresser!"

"I imagine it'll be OK until we get back", said Emiko.

"I hope so", said Nicole. "I sent Tiff in there to get some change for herself. She's not shifty or anything, but you know how that thing can call out to you!"

"Do you want to call her and ask about it?" asked Alice.

"Maybe I better not", said Nicole. " I don't want to to draw her attention to it. Anyway, apart form cooing over everyone's babies, what did you want to see us for, Sheila?"

"I've found another reference to the coin", she said. "It's in an old copy of the writings of Paul d'Austrasie, a Frankish monk living in the time of Charlemagne. I think he may have been one of Durnovarius' sources - if not his only source. Anyway, Brother Paul says pretty much the same things Durnovarius did, plus a few things more. One is that the coin is indestructible, at least by any known means. It has been cast into the hottest furnaces, and even into an active volcano, and still come out intact. Furthermore, he says that the spirit in the coin has sought down through the centuries the one through whom it will be reborn."

"'Reborn'?" asked Alice.

"Yes, although I'm not quite sure what that means. I'm not sure Brother Paul did, either. However, I get the impression that he thought that the spirit - Gignerus, we'll call it - wants to escape from the coin and take on physical form."

"You mean, like, to possess someone?" asked Nicole.

"I don't know, Nicki, Paul doesn't say. Of course, how he knew any of this, I have no idea."

"Is there some way to recognize whoever is going to be the One?" asked Emiko.

"If there is, Brother Paul doesn't mention it."

"So what do we do about this coin, then?" asked Nicole.

"Well, apparently, we can't destroy it, and using it is dangerous and unpredictable. We could toss it into the ocean, or bury it, but it'll just surface eventually."

"I have a safe deposit box at the bank" said Nicole. "Maybe we could store it in there?"

"That's a thought, Nic" said Sheila. "That would be as secure a spot as we can manage. I mean, we're dealing with a magical object here, so we can never be 100% certain."

"Well, it's Saturday now", said Nicole. "The bank won't be open again until Monday. I'll bring it in then."

With that, the four friends began simply socializing, and eventually had dinner together.

Earlier, when Nicole had told her where to find her change, Tiffany had gone into her cousin's room and, spotting it on the dresser, had swept it all into her purse, inadvertently sweeping up the coin as well.

Tiffany took out her cellphone and called her boy friend, Joey MacDonald. As far as she was concerned, Joey was her soulmate. They had met in kindergarten, and had become fast friends after discovering that they were born on the exact same day. She really loved Joey - not simply because he was big, handsome and studly - which he was - but because he had such a great personality. They really meshed well together. Tiffany liked to say that if Joey had been born a girl, she would have liked to have "her" as a best friend. They arranged to meet at Von Steuben's, a moderately pricey restaurant downtown.

She left the house and walked down to the bus stop. When she saw the bus approaching, she reached into her purse for some change, and pulled out an odd-looking coin.

What the heck is this? she thought. She reached in again, and pulled out some proper change, and got on the bus. Paying her fare, she sat down and looked at the coin.

It must be Nicole's. I must've picked it up when I took her change. Oh, well, I'll put it back when I go back.

Holding the coin in her hand, she looked out the bus window. The bus stopped at a red light outside Fenneman's, a high-class department store. She perked up as she noticed her Auny Lucy, Nicole's mother, going into the store. A sudden urge to flip the coin came over her. She could almost hear it speaking:

FLIP ME.

While staring at her aunt, she flipped the coin, and...
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: Wasn't There a Magic Coin in This Story? Wh...

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
REALITY CHANGE.

What? thought Tiffany. Although she didn't realize it, she had just changed her aunt's life forever. But how?

Was it...
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: REALITY CHANGE for Lucy

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
Oblivious to the fact that reality had been re-written so that her aunt was now three months pregnant, and still holding the coin, Tiffany continued her ride downtown.

Arriving at the stop nearest Von Steuben's , she went inside and met up with Joey. He was a tall, well-built, brown-haired boy.

"Hey, babe, good to see ya", he said, leaning down to kiss her. She returned the kiss, and the pair went in and sat down.

"So, what have you been up to?" she asked him..

"Aw, just hanging out with Steve and Marty." He looked at her hand.

"Say, kid, what's that you're holding?" he said.

Tiffany realized that he meant the coin.

"This? It's my cousin's. I borrowed some change off of her and picked this up accidentally. I'm not sure what it is, but it might be some kind of a good luck charm. These characters look pregnant and she just had a baby."

She held the coin up and looked at it. "Maybe she -WAH!" The coin had slipped out of her hand, fallen to the floor, and rolled until it bumped against the shoe of an older man sitting across from them. The old man picked up the coin, and looked at Joey.

"Is this yours, son?" he asked, unconsciously flipping the coin.

Before Joey could answer, the coin's magic took hold, and Joey became...
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: PREGNANT EXPANSION for Lucy

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
Before the old man's eyes, Joey began to shimmer. When the shimmering stopped, what the old man saw was...

Where Joey had been sitting was a pretty, well-built girl with her brown hair in a ponytail. A slight bulge around her midsection gave the hint that she was in the early stages of pregnancy, perhaps about three months along.

But was the boy aware of what had happened to him?
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: Josie!

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
REALITY CHANGE.

The old man was astonished! The boy who had been sitting there had been replaced by a girl, and yet his (her?) friend didn't seem to even notice!

How will things proceed for "Josie"?
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: REALITY CHANGE for Joey

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
Josie, now a three months pregnant eighteen year-old girl was concerned about the old man in front of her.

"Sir, are you OK?" she asked.

"I-I-I...um, sorry, I..." he stammered. "I could've sworn...A-anyway, is this coin yours?"

"No, it's hers," said the girl, indicating Tiffany.

"Here you go, then", said the old man, looking at Tiffany and flipping the coin onto the table in front of her. And then...

Once more, he heard the strange voice.
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: PREGNANT EXPANSION for Josie

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
The old man was startled when he once again heard the odd voice. Am I losing my mind? he thought.

REALITY CHANGE.

The coin's magic began to affect Tiffany. What it did was...
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: REALITY CHANGE for Tiffany

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
Flustered, the old man didn't even notice when Tiffany's belly expanded to match her companion's.

"Excuse me," he said, and left with a distressed look on his face.

Tiffany looked at her best friend, Josie MacDonald. The two had known one another since kindergarten, and were as close as sisters. Tiffany always liked to say that if Josie had been born a boy she would have wanted to marry "him".

The two friends had celebrated their mutual eighteenth birthday three months before, with their friends Steve and Marty. Unfortunately, they hadn't celebrated as carefully as they should have, and both girls had gotten pregnant. Their parents had gone ballistic when they found out. Fortunately for Tiffany, Marty had stood up and accepted responsibility. Tiffany liked Marty, but didn't want to marry him. It had been agreed, however, that he would contribute to the child's upbringing, since Tiffany was determined to keep her baby. Things were worse for Josie - Steve had ratted on her, and skipped town. After their initial anger, her parents had been supportive.

The two friends enjoyed a leisurely meal, and then hung out together for a while. Eventually, Tiffany noticed the time.

"I suppose I should get back to my cousin's. She and her friends will be back before too long, and I've got to catch a bus."

"Hey", said Josie, "I've got my car, why don't I drive you there?"

"OK, thanks", said Tiffany. "You should meet my cousin. She and her friends are cool. They're all unwed mothers, so you don't have to worry about them being all judgmental."

So, it was that they arrived back at Nicole's house shortly after Nicole and company arrived back home. After introductions were completed, Tiffany spoke to Nicole:

"Oh, hey, Nicki, I've got the rest of your change here, I'll put it back on the dresser. Oh, and sorry, I accidentally picked up your lucky charm or whatever it was."

Tiffany handed the coin back to Nicole.

"It's kind of weird, isn't it? I dropped it and the old guy who picked it up acted like he'd seen a ghost."

She shrugged and gestured to Josie.

"Come on, Jo, I'll show you around the place." Once the two younger women had left the room, Alice spoke up.

"Those are the two that got pregnant on their eighteenth birthday, right?"

"That's what I remember", said Nicole. "But if they had the coin all day, then maybe they just became pregnant this afternoon!"

"Neither of them seemed weirded out or anything", said Emiko. "Whichever one of them flipped it ought to have had some reaction. It really freaked me out when I did it."

"Maybe this old guy they mentioned was the one who flipped it" mused Nicole. "It's hard to say without knowing more, but I can't really quiz them on it without getting them interested in it, and I don't want that. I feel bad. I was careless leaving it around like that."

"Carelees", said Emiko, "Or maybe it was the coin's influence."

The conversation stopped as Tiffany and Josie came back into the room.

"I guess I better head along now", said Josie. "Nice to meet you all!"

She turned and hugged Tiffany. "Talk to you later, Mommy!"

Right after Josie left, the phone rang. Nicole picked it up and answered flippantly, "Hello, Winters Home for Unwed Mothers, how may we help you?"

Her eyes went wide in astonishment.

"MOM?" she said. "Uh, uh, sure, Mom, tomorrow Noon is fine. What? Oh, yes, I love you, too. Bye."

She turned to her friends. "She wants to come and see me tomorrow. She has something important she needs to talk to me about."

"Was that Aunt Lucy?", asked Tiffany, "I saw her going into Fenneman's this afternoon, but she didn't see me."

Nicole went pale as a sudden thought struck her.

"Is something wrong, Nic?" asked Tiffany.

"Oh ah - nothing. I'm just a little worn out, is all."

Later, while Tiffany was watching the babies, Nicole, Alice and Emiko went for a walk.

"My mom sounded really upset", said Nicole, "and for her to suddenly call me like this after not speaking to me for months..."

"And Tiffany had the coin all afternoon", said Emiko, "and you think the two things might be connected."

"Oh, Emi, I'm so sick of that damned coin!" said Nicole. "Monday I'm going to lock it in the bank and never take it out again. I'm going to make sure that you two can get a hold of it if something happens to me, but I hope none of us will ever see it again after that."

The next day, Emiko and Alice took Tiffany and Pearl out to lunch, so that Nicole could talk to her mother in private. "We'll be nearby if you need us, Nic", said Alice.

When Lucy arrived, she was wearing loose-fitting clothing, so it was hard for Nicole to tell whether she might be pregnant or not. Lucy was only in her middle forties, so it would not be impossible. She had a haunted look on her face.

"Hi, sweetie", she said, when Nicole answered the door. "Can I come in?"

"Oh, Mommy, of course you can!" said Nicole, ushering her mother in and guiding her over to where baby George lay in his crib. "Come in meet your grandson."

"Such a beautiful boy", said Lucy. "He reminds me of my father, somehow. Oh, baby, I've been so bad to you!"

Lucy collapsed into Nicole's arms in a storm of tears. Wordlessly, Nicole guided her mother to the couch, trying to comfort her.

"It's alright, Mom, it's alright."

"No, it's not! I've been such a hypocrite!"

"Mom, what do you mean?"

"I'm pregnant! Three months pregnant!"

Oh, thought Nicole, so it's true.

"Mom, how does that make you a hypocrite?"

"You don't understand! The baby isn't your father's!"

"WHAT?"

Sniffling, Lucy tried to explain.

"We've tried to put a good face on it for you, but your father and I have had a marriage in name only for many years. Maybe we never had one. When I married your father, he was reasonably attractive and from the right sort of family, and was nice enough. I convinced myself that I could love him. I tried. He tried, we thought maybe having you would help, but even then, it didn't work. Don't misunderstand me - we both love you, but we've never really loved each other."

"Mom, I never knew. I mean, you weren't the closest couple ever, but I just thought you weren't very demonstrative."

"Maybe I should have been an actress", said Lucy. "No, we definitely weren't the closest couple. Your father hasn't touched me - not that way - in years."

"But then how - ?" asked Nicole.

"Well, I'm morally certain that your father's been sleeping with his secretaries for years. He's been very discreet - never done anything that I would be able to confront him with. I wasn't that bothered by it, as long as he didn't embarass me. It wasn't as though he was giving them anything I wanted, and he always made sure you were taken care of. I thought about finding a lover for years, but for years I couldn't work up the nerve, until finally I met a man who really made me feel desired - as a woman, I mean."

"Who?"

"Well, you didn't think I really liked tennis all that much, did you?"

Nicole was astonished.

"You mean - STEFAN? Your TENNIS PRO?"

"Yes, dear", said Lucy, quietly.

"BUT, MOTHER -", said Nicole, before biting her tongue.

"Go ahead and say it, dear, I've earned it. In fact, I'll say it with you: three, two, one..."

"HOW COMMON!" the two said, together, laughing. Lucy touched her daughter's face.

"Oh, that's the first time I've laughed in a month. So, now you see my hypocrisy. After berating you for carelessly letting yourself get pregnant, I did the same thing myself."

"So", said Nicole, "My mother is human, after all."

"Yes", said Lucy. "Annoying, isn't it?"

"So, does Daddy know?"

"Yes."

"How did he take it?"

"Well, you must understand - I knew - or suspected at least - when I was about a month along. I was in total denial, until I began to show. Even then, I could hide it from him - we've had separate bedrooms for years. But then one day last week, he happened to take a call from Doctor Grundy, who mentioned my pregnancy to him, assuming her already knew. Your father confronted me on it, and I admittted the truth. Anyway, he's divorcing me. Not that he really cares that I slept with Stefan, this is just a convenient excuse for him. Our lawyers are thrashing it out. I'll get the house - he's already moved out - and I still have the money I brought into the marriage. Maybe it's for the best. the only good thing to come out of my marriage is you, dear. And now little George, too, of course."

"Oh, Mom, I am sorry."

"Thank you, dear, but in alot of ways, I brought it on myself. If you ever do marry, do yourself a favor and marry for the right reasons."

"Mom. what will you do?"

"The best I can. Try to be a better mother to my second child than I was to my first."

"Oh, Mommy, you know that I love you" said Nicole, embracing her mother. "Whatever has gone on between us, don't ever doubt that."

The two sat and discussed the situation together. After the others came back, Nicole and Lucy explained the situation to them.

"When Mom gets closer to her term, I'm going to stay with her for a while. If you guys are still here by that time, you'll have to live without me, I'm afraid. In fact, I'd be happy to have you stay here, so that the place wouldn't be empty."

The foursome discused the situation for quite some time. The next day, Nicole took the coin to her bank, and had it locked up in her safe deposit box.

The coin stayed locked up...

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
Time passed. The next month, Sheila had a son, Louis Henry McKenzie, Louise had a son, Michael Arthur Carlson, Debbie had a son, Martin Howard Jackson, and Angelica had a son, Vittorio Luigi D’Abruzzi.

A few months after that, Emiko had her baby. This time it was Alice’s turn to be the concerned partner, although she did have help from Emi’s mom, Rumiko, who flew in from Japan. Emiko had a daughter, who she named Rumiko Alice Matsumoto, after her mother and best friend.

A few months further on, the last of the “Children of the Coin” were born. Tiffany had a daughter, Brittany Angela Biltmore, Josie had a daughter, Andrea Phyllis McDonald, and Lucille had a daughter, Henrietta Jane Winters, Nicole’s new baby sister.

Alice and Emiko lived with Nicole for a while. Eventually, they moved out and into a home of their own. They had their challenges, but they faced them well. The women who knew about the coin – Nicole, Alice, Emiko, Sheila and Jean – kept the secret to themselves, not telling even their closest friends.

Twenty years went by. The children grew up, leading mostly pleasant lives. They all were friends to one degree or another. They knew nothing of the coin, or of how it connected them. However, somewhere across town, something was happening that would change the lives of them all.

Karl Van Dijn was a wealthy man, who had made a lot of money, some honestly, some dishonestly. Right now, he had a problem. His wife had discovered that he’d been cheating on her for years. However, instead of simply seeking a divorce, she had quietly spent years gathering hard evidence of his illegal business dealings, and was now blackmailing him. He would have cheerfully had her ”eliminated”, but she had the evidence in a safe deposit box in a bank, with orders for the information to be made public if she had an “accident”. He had high hopes that the man he was speaking to today would help him resolve this problem. The man in question was an extraordinarily nondescript that Karl knew only as “Mister Eight”.

“Here’s what I would like you to do”, said Karl. “Break into this bank’s vault, and empty out as many of the safe deposit boxes as you can. Bring me the contents of this one box. In return, I will pay you your usual fee, plus a forty per cent bonus. The contents of the other boxes will be yours to do with as you see fit. Can you do it?”

“Yes”.

“Will you do it?”

“Yes.”

Mister Eight took his leave. Karl was not surprised that he did not ask why Karl wanted him to rob so many other boxes when he only wanted the contents of one. Perhaps he understood that Karl believed that if only his wife’s box was robbed, she would immediately suspect that he was behind it, but that if the entire vault was robbed, she might think it was a coincidence. Probably Mister Eight didn’t care what Karl wanted, as long as he was paid.

A few days later, the town was rocked by the news of a daring bank robbery. Mister Eight and his team had carried out their assignment perfectly. Karl received the contents of his wife’s deposit box. Unfortunately for him, his wife was cleverer than he thought and had planned for this eventuality. Things went badly for Karl from then on.

Mister Eight didn’t care. Elsewhere, he and his teammates – Miss Softly, Uncle Intention and the Pomeranian - divided up their fee, and sorted out the other items they had stolen. Some they set aside to sell, some they aside to keep, and others they disposed of. Afterwards, as was their habit, they went to a park near the river and sat on a bench, looking into the water.

“So, everything is sorted?”, asked Mister Eight.

“There’s just one last thing I meant to ask you about”, said Uncle Intention. He held up the Coin of Gignerus – one of the boxes had been Nicole’s.

“What is that?”, asked Mister Eight.

“As far as I can tell, it’s someone’s lucky charm or something. Dunno why it was in the bank, but people do lock up some odd stuff.”

Mister Eight took the coin and looked at it, and then at Uncle Intention and the Pomeranian.

“Either of you want it?”, he asked. They both shook their heads. He turned to Miss Softly. “How about you?” She shook her head.

Still looking at her, he asked himself, “Do I{/b{ want it?” He thought about it, and said:
1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.title: ...Twenty years

“NO REALITY CHANGE.”

“What was that?”, he said.

“I didn’t – urp – hear anything”, said Miss Softly. The coin had made her two months pregnant. She wasn’t showing yet, but her stomach was bothering her a bit.

“Are you OK?”, asked Mister Eight. “You look a little green.”

“Actually, I’m feeling a little queasy”, she said. “If we’re done here, I’d like to go lie down for a while.”

“Sure”, said Mister Eight. “Take care of yourself.”

The coin had not fallen into the river. Instead, it lay hidden on the river bank, where it was eventually found by…

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
The few people that knew about the coin – Nicole, Alice, Emiko, Sheila and Jean – were upset to hear of its theft. For some time after it was stolen, they watched the news closely, looking for reports of unusual pregnancies. As months passed with no signs of the coin being used, they relaxed a little. Perhaps whoever had stolen it had discarded it , not knowing what it was, and somehow having avoided its influence. On the other hand, perhaps the coin was biding its time, and would allow itself to be “found” when it was ready… As it happened, 21 years after the birth of the youngest of the 16 “Children of the Coin”, the Coin of Gignerus finally re-surfaced.

One of Von Steuben’s private function rooms was reserved that night for a triple birthday party. Three young women – Brittany Biltmore, Henrietta Winters and Andrea McDonald – were all celebrating their 21st birthdays. The party was hosted jointly by several of the attendees. George Winters, who was Henrietta’s nephew (although he was a few months older than her) was there. George was a tall, dark-haired young man with suave good looks.Also present were Meg O’Donnell, her aunt Jeannie O’Donnell (who was about the same age as her niece), Bill Hayes, Rhi D’Alphonse, Pearl Wang and Rumi Matsumoto (who had bene brought up as sisters), Zach Waterford-Harris, Lou McKenzie, Mike Carlson and Pat McCormack (who were all first cousins), Marty Jackson and Vito D’Abruzzi. None of them knew about the Coin of Gignerus, of course. They had grown up in the same area, and their mothers all knew one another. They were not aware of any other connection. Pearl and Rumi knew there was some mystery concerning their fathers. Neither of them knew who their fathers were, and their mothers would never speak about them. As it was, both of them looked so much like clones of their moms, they sometimes used to wonder if they were clones.

However, that night, no one was thinking about such things. Everyone was in a mood to party hearty, and so they did. Large amounts of food and even larger amounts of alcohol were consumed. The organizers had anticipated this, and had made sure that everyone had some way of getting home safely.

No one was second to George when it came to drinking that night – he was Nicole Winters’ son, after all, and she had been something of a party girl in her day. By the end of the night, George was so drunk he could barely stand, He had a dim notion that he should get some fresh air, so he wandered outside. He ambled along aimlessly, until he found himself near the river, right where Mister Eight and his associates had sat about a year previously.
Stumbling over a rock, he fell to his knees on the riverbank, narrowly avoiding falling in. After vomiting copiously into the river, he dimly noticed something under his left hand. It was a weird coin of some kind. He managed to get to his feet and squinted at the coin in the moonlight. Through a boozy fog, he realized that it wasn’t money. Beginning to feel dizzy, he flipped the coin away from him. Even as he fell backwards onto the bench, he saw…

1453311122121122111121221112211122122121.content:
George woke up the next morning, feeling curiously refreshed. Usually, he got a nasty hangover when he drank the way he had the night before, but today he felt as though he’d gotten a good night’s sleep. When he opened his eyes, he started in shock. He wasn’t in his own bedroom! As he looked around, he realized that he was in his own room, but it had been re-decorated! It looked like a young woman’s room. When he tried to shift in the bed, he realized that he felt oddly heavy. He looked at himself and saw that he was wearing a pink nightgown and that there were two heavy weights on his chest where a woman’s breasts would be. He also noticed that his stomach was oddly swollen. Shucking off the nightgown, he swiftly realized that the “weights” were breasts, and that they and the belly were real, and a part of him. Reaching further down, he soon ascertained that his “manhood” was gone, replaced by a vagina.

In shock, he got out of the bed, and stumbled into the bathroom. He nearly fell, the extra weight made him awkward. Naked, he looked at himself in the bathroom mirror. Looking back at him was a pretty, dark-haired woman who might have been his sister. She was heavily pregnant. At that moment, new memories began to float into his head, alongside the old ones.

Georgia Petra Winters had had a similar life to George. She’d had many of the same friends, and had similar experiences. Seven months earlier, she’d gotten drunk at one of Rhi D’Alphonse’s beach parties, over-celebrating her own 21st birthday. That night, she’d fallen into the arms of some guy she didn’t even know, and had gotten pregnant. When she’d told her mother, Nicole had looked rueful, and had told Georgia the story of her own conception.
(Although Georgia didn’t know it, Nicole had gone to the bank the next day, and checked to see that the Coin was still safely locked away. At that time, it was, and Nicole decided that Georgia’s pregnancy was just a natural occurrence. )

Georgia had bene at the birthday party last night, but because she was pregnant, she hadn’t had any alcohol, and had made an early night of it.

His head whirling, George suddenly felt quite nauseous, and threw up into the toilet. As he cleaned himself up, he heard a knock on his bedroom door. It was his mother.

“Georgia, are you OK? Can I come in?”

“Sure, Mom”, said George, and the higher, feminine tone of his voice freaked him out even more.

Seeing her daughter, standing naked in the bathroom with a panicked look on her face, Nicole became concerned.

“Baby, what’s wrong?”, asked Nicole.

“Mommy, I think I’m going crazy”, said George, tearfully.

Nicole embraced her daughter, and led her back to her bedroom. Helping her back into her nightgown, Nicole sat Georgia on her bed, sitting down next to her.

“Baby, tell Mommy all about it.”

George told Nicole in the best detail that he could what had happened. To his surprise, his mother seemed to accept his story without question. She hugged him and said:

“Georgia – George – I want you to know one thing. You are not crazy.”

“How can you be so sure? It almost sounds like you know what caused this!”

“I think I do. Look, I’ll tell you all about it, but I’ve got to make some phone calls first. Take a shower, and get dressed. Then we can talk while we have some breakfast.”

George did as his mother asked. It was easy to let the “Georgia” side of him handle things like hair, dressing and make-up.

When he went downstairs, Nicole had prepared a light breakfast. Suddenly, he was famished. He and his mother ate and chatted about inconsequentialities. A few minutes later, the doorbell rang, and his “Aunts” Emiko and Alice came into the room. They had let themselves in, as they still had keys to the condo. They all sat down together over coffee.

Nicole sighed, and then told George the story of the Coin, with Alice and Emiko chiming in to verify and amplify when needed.

“Wow”, said George. “This is all too much to take in. Even though it happened to me, it’s still hard to believe. And there’s no way to undo this? I’m going to have to be Georgia for the rest of my life?”

“I’m sorry, dear”, said Nicole. “But I think you are. It will be hard, I know, but I think you’ll find that the new memories will start to seem ‘senior’ to the old ones after a while. It might be easier to be ‘Georgia’ than you think. And George or Georgia, you’re still my baby and I will always love you.”

“Thanks , Mom”, said George, hugging his mother. “I love you, too. So be it, I’ll be ‘Georgia’ as best I can.”

Georgia hugged her mother again and kissed her on the cheek. “So, what now?”, she asked.

“I want you to show us as best you can where you found that coin last night. We have to try to find it if we can.”

The four women drove down to the riverside. Georgia sat on the bench while Nicole, Alice and Emiko searched thoroughly as they could without attracting anyone’s attention. Georgia chatted with another expectant mother who happened by. After an hour’s search…

In the blink of an eye Nicole watched as Betty's poisonous grin transformed into a look of pure nausea.

"Oh god...what the hell." Betty groaned as she quickly put a hand over her mouth. "I-I'm g-gonna..."

"Ew don't vomit here!" Nicole shouted in disgust.

"Then outta my way!" Betty moaned as she tried to make a run for the bathroom, only to be stopped by Nicole's belly blocking her path.

"Nicole get your gut out of the way!" The sickly girl, who was almost turning green from holding back vomit, ordered angrily as she shot the party princess an icy glare of her own.

"Hmph," Nicole grunted as a revenge-ridden smile worked its way onto her face, "I don't think so. If you think you can come in here, not only not support me as my best friend throughout my entire pregnancy, but also keep insulting me, and then think you can use my bathroom as a personal vomit bucket then you've got another thing coming!"

"Let me through!" Betty tried to weakly protest as she felt another round of nausea course through her. Nicole could swear as Betty heaved that time that she saw her her former friend's lunch almost make an appearance.

"Sorry Betty," Nicole sneered, "but I think you've overstayed your welcome, and I don't want you sticking around here anymore, or ever again for that matter! We're through!" Nicole punctuated this declaration by giving Betty a light shove towards the door with her belly. Betty was unable to speak at the moment, but the look of hatred she sent Nicole sent a clear enough message as she hurriedly hobbled out of Nicole's place, moaning and clutching her aching belly all the way.

Soon after Betty had left her room for good, Nicole had finally noticed that in all the excitement that her unborn child had woken up and began to kick fervently. At this, a motherly smile washed over Nicole's face and she began to caress the spots on her stomach that were being assaulted. "There there little one," she cooed, "the mean lady left, mommy is alright."

Having this moment of happiness with her child suddenly made her remember something Betty had said, and had actually made a good point with. She really needed to go shopping for some baby supplies soon, seeing as she only had a month left until her due date. She knew money wasn't an issue, as her father, being a total pushover when it came to his little girl, had set her up with a large amount to support both her and his grandchild. Her mom was an entirely different matter at first, but as time had went on she'd come to find that she found herself rather excited at the prospect of a grandchild as well, and so Nicole was on relatively good terms with her mom, though not as much as her dad.

As she headed outside to go shopping at the mall, she noticed one thing was missing.

Where did the coin disappear to? It was right in my hand before...

I wish you were pregnant too! See how you like it! The blond bratty girl had shouted at her.

A look of horror crossed her face as she felt a huge wave of nausea hit her, and she waddled as fast as she could back inside her house, making a beeline for the bathroom. It went without saying that things definitely wouldn't go well for the blonde bombshell in said room.

As for Betty, she'd tried to hold her laughter in, as she was afraid that Nicole would have heard her cackling, but as soon as Nicole had rushed inside she'd began laughing out loud, causing a few passerbys on the street to give her odd looks as they walked past.

"Oh man that was great!" Betty sighed happily as her laughs finally began to subside, "guess she did catch whatever I have after all! So she can suck it for not letting me use her bathroom when I needed it for the same thing!" She said, doing a little victory jig at the perceived karmic retribution, whilst using both of her middle fingers to display two universally understood signs of victory, or disapproval.

Guess she won't be going to the mall after all then... Betty mused to herself. Deciding that she'd seen enough, the red head began walking back home whilst thinking up a plan of revenge on Nicole. Because as much as I liked seeing her puke her guts out, it's still not enough! She vehemently declared, not even noticing that she'd flipped the coin again and caused a nearby woman to question why her belly was beginning to balloon out at an alarming rate.

Yup, Betty vowed silently, one day there's gonna be a reckoning, and its name is gonna be Nicole Winters...

As Nicole spit out the last of the remaining bile in her mouth, she rose up, wobbling both from the weight of her belly and the weak feeling that the nausea had left her with. After steadying herself for a moment on the counter Nicole hurriedly washed her mouth out, eager to get the taste of vomit off of her tongue.

Finally, after shakily heading up the stairs and trudging down the hall to her room, she finally heaved herself onto her bed with a resounding 'Oomph.' Tan belly rising straight up like a mountain as she slowly traced her hands over the naked skin.

"Well, whatever this is, it sure wore mommy out!" She said, yawning as the fatigue of the days events finally caught up with her body. Being so close to term, she knew that her stamina was a fraction of what it had been before, even though she'd been quite athletic. "Well baby," she cooed, giving her belly a loving pat, " I guess I'll see you tomorrow morning then."

Hopefully without anymore of this stupid stomach illness or whatever it is. She added on snidely, yawning another time as she felt her eyelids begin to droop, and finally began to snore softly, subconsciously cradling her belly protectively all through the night...

Nicole left the house and returned to her condo.

145331121.title: Fast Pregnancy-Nicole will have to celebrate mo...

1453311211.content:
Nicole put her bags down and pressed her hand over her stomach, trying to subside the nausea she was feeling.

"I don't feel like eating anything," she moaned softly to herself, marching to her bedroom like a zombie. Once there, she took off her jacket and shoes and looked at herself in her bathroom mirror. Her skin had definitely lost some color, which was a bit of a feat for someone who tanned as much as Nicole. Taking a deep breath, she stood up a little straighter.

"Alright, I'm okay," Nicole said to herself. "I'm okaUUGH!" Immediately, Nicole turned around and dry heaved into the toilet, gripping the sides. After the wave of nausea left her body, she paused and spat out the last bit of bile that remained and walked back over to her mirror. "Not okay."

Nicole filled up a cup of water and washed her mouth out, trying to eliminate the barf taste and get rid of some of the bad breath. She walked back to her bed and stripped out of the rest of her clothes, save for her underwear, and slipped on a white t-shirt. As Nicole crawled into bed, she could hear her phone buzz in her pants on the floor. Groaning, Nicole reached down and picked it up. Scrolling through her phone's notifications, it was nothing but people writing on her Facebook event wall that they were excited to go to her birthday party in a little over a week.

In the throngs of nausea, Nicole was much less interested in what a bunch of people she didn't know wanted to do at her party. These things were always just excuses for people to drink and dance and it never mattered what the occasion was or whose party it was. As a pretty avid party-goer, she knew this first hand. Groaning again, Nicole rolled over and awkwardly put the phone back on her pants, before feeling another lump in the pocket. Reaching down, Nicole pulled it out, looking at it in what little light the room had. It was the same weird coin she'd seen and picked up earlier.

"Man, this thing is weird-looking," Nicole mumbled to herself, placing it on her bedside table. "I'll have to show it to someone later."

With that, Nicole curled her blankets around her and settled into bed.

---Dream---

The music was pounding and the lights were flashing. Everyone was cheering and the DJ was throwing out promotional swag while a promoter sprayed the crowd with champagne. Then, everyone turned and cheered even louder. Out came Nicole, carried by four guys in a portable "party throne." And what's more, she was massively pregnant, only wearing a white tube top and a miniskirt, her bare belly totally on display for everyone to see.

"The party mama's here at last!" Nicole yelled, raising a glass of her own. Of course, it was filled with sparking white grape juice to match the champagne everyone else had. The music got even more dancey as Nicole was brought to the center of the floor, the room opening up so she could be let down. Nicole reached her hand out daintily as someone from the audience helped her step down. Rubbing her big belly with one hand, Nicole smiled seductively as she walked to each of the four, handsome men who carried and gave them a kiss, running her hand down their muscular bodies as she did.

Walking out to the middle of the floor, everyone flooded in, men and women, to dance with her. Nicole soaked it up, wigging her belly around as she grinded against anyone she could, letting people rub and kiss her inflated womb. Reaching into a pocket in her skirt, Nicole got out some cream and rubbed it against her belly, giving it a sparkling shine, and then sprinkled glitter across her motherly orb.

As she danced, a younger girl, probably a teenager, walked up to her. "Mom!" she yelled, "when are you going to be done here? I can't look after little Kimmy all night!"

"Oh, you'll be fine looking after your little sister!" Nicole said back, swinging her hips back and forth with another handsome party-goer.

"Well, let me know when we can drive back," the girl said. Then, Nicole paused and gripped her belly.

"Uh oh...I think you'll need to drive me," Nicole said, turning to face her daughter. "Because the baby is coming NOW-"

"know, like, We! are never, ever! Getting back tog-" Nicole reached down and turned off her phone's alarm clock, lamenting having set it in the first place.

"Ugh," Nicole said, turning around in bed and sitting up. One nice thing she noticed is she no longer felt nauseous. In fact, she felt totally fine. A little sleepy maybe, but otherwise good. Her bra felt a little tighter, was all, but she probably just slept on her chest funny.

As Nicole picked her phone up to check the exact time, she noticed that she'd gotten a lot of texts over the night from one number. It was-
1453311211.title: Got some rest (Day 1 End)

14533112112.content:
Nicole grumbled and flipped through the texts. <Please call us> <Tried calling. Please pick up> They were all mostly the same message. Nicole sat up and wiped her mouth with her wrist as she dialed home. The phone rang a few times and then a voice came on the other end. "Hello Nicole."
"Hello Daddy," Nicole said, lying back and relaxing. "You wanted to talk to me?"
"Yes. Are you alright? You don't sound too good."
"I'm fine, I just felt a little sick last night," Nicole said. Actually, now that she thought about it, Nicole was surprised that her nausea went away as quickly as it did. Sure, she'd gotten some rest but...that shouldn't be all.
Her father cleared his throat and sighed on the other end. "Nicole, were you out drinking again last night? We've told you so many times-"
"Oh, calm down Daddy, I can handle myself. And besides, I wasn't out drinking. I just got nauseous and went to bed early but I'm fine now. Did you want to talk to me to do anything besides harassing me about having fun?"
"Actually, yes. Your mother and I have been talking for a while now and...while we're fine supporting you financially through school, we both feel that you need to start taking some responsibility as well. So, we're going to keep paying for your condominium and other big charges, but we also want you to...to get a job."

Nicole almost dropped the phone out of her hands. "A job, Daddy? You can't expect me to-"
"You cannot keep dodging responsibilities like this!" Her father said back sternly. Nicole had her father wrapped around her finger pretty well, but when he got upset with her, it really came out. Likely a result of how bottled up he kept his emotions. "I worked in university. Your cousins all work while they're in college. Even Danielle has a good job now that she's out of school and it's thanks to the work and effort she put in over the past four years. It's important that you do the same."
"But Daddyyyy," Nicole whined.
"I-I just...here's your mother," Nicole's father said quickly.
"No, Daddy, do not-"
"Hello, Nicole," a smug, feminine voice said on the other end.
"Hello, Mother."

Nicole Winters had a shaky relationship with her parents. Roger Winters, her father, was relatively easy to manipulate. He wasn't much for sharing his emotions or listening to other's problems, so one easy way to keep Nicole from interacting with him was to fund her various needs and wants (mostly wants). As the head of a successful PR company, the Winters made a sizable income, so it wasn't as if Nicole's pleas for a car or Spring Break trips were going to bankrupt the family, so Roger was always willing to oblige. One major downside that Nicole saw was that Roger was also a somewhat strict traditionalist, so when Nicole crossed boundaries that he didn't approve of (like making out with a member of the varsity swim team on his couch when she was a freshman in high school), he could really give her the riot act.

Lucille Winters, on the other hand, was never particularly fond of indulging her daughter's activities. Lucille was never that great of a mother, and as she maintained quite nearly all of her young looks over her life, she would always remind her daughter how important it was to look nice. She even took a few stabs at Nicole every now and then over the fact that Lucille never got plastic surgery but still looked like, as Nicole overheard some of her male classmates say, a stone cold fox. Nicole did not care for her mother.

"So, your father told you about our decision, I hear," Lucille smiled behind the receiver. Nicole couldn't see this, of course, but she could sense it.
"Yes, and I think it's ridiculous."
"Well, it would be nice if you could learn the value of a dollar, dear. And some work might give you something to do. You're a smart girl, aren't you? You can figure something out."
"You know, I noticed that Daddy said he worked in university, but never said that you did," Nicole said, getting out of bed and putting her hand on her hip for emphasis. As she did so, Nicole noticed that her hips felt a little wider than before...and maybe a little pudgier.
"Oh, Nicole, don't be so petty. It was a different time. Women weren't as encouraged to work as they are now," Lucille smiled, swirling the glass of mimosa in her hand. "I know you approve of the steps we've taken since then. After all, I see the bills for your birth control prescription we pay for."
Nicole was still pressing her hand against her midsection, definitely noticing that it was a bit bigger than before. "Nicole?"
"I...I'll call you back. We'll talk more about this later. I need to start my day," Nicole stammered. "Goodbye, Mother."
"Goodbye Nico-" Nicole switched her phone off and threw it onto the bed, groaning.

"Well, this is just great," Nicole said, shaking her head. "And more stress from a job isn't going to help put this extra weight off...I need to go to the gym."
Packing up her bag, Nicole headed to the local gym. It was a part of the nearby university, which gave Nicole a wide array of cute, young guys to check out while she exercised. Usually, Nicole wore a jogging top that covered up just her chest and upper torso, showing off plenty of middrift and cleavage. But since she felt a little...larger than usual, she opted for a white t-shirt instead, while still keeping her tight running pants. The extra weight gain seemed to give her breasts and ass considerable attention too, which Nicole was certainly not complaining about. It was nice to get some added volume there without taking another trip to the cosmetic surgeon.

Nicole went for a few miles on the elliptical, still smiling and flirting with passing-by guys as she did. It felt good that she could still turn so many heads and she was concerned less with her new weight gain. Although, truthfully, she felt much more tired than she normally did on the machine. As she finished up and was wiping down, one of the students who worked at the gym walked over to her. He was a tall, handsome guy with his hair shaved down almost to the skull and some fair facial stubble.

"Hey, nice job there. Most girls your size don't go that long on the machine," he said with a smile.
"Oh, well, I come here a lot," Nicole smiled back. "I like to keep my body nice and flexible."
"Yeah?" The guy said, nodding and grinning curiously. "I'm Marcus."
"Nicole," she said, moving her hair back gently. "I'm having a 21st birthday party in a little over a week. Maybe I'll see you there."
"Maybe," Marcus nodded again.
"Sorry buddy, she's not interested," someone said from next to Nicole. She turned and saw the worst possible person: her ex-boyfriend Chris.

"Chris, what are you-"
"She's not seeing anyone right now. That's what she keeps telling me!" Chris said, throwing his hands up in the air. He was tall and handsome too, his chestnut hair down to his ears and a much thicker 5 o'clock shadow on his face. "Besides," Chris said, raising his voice. "She doesn't like black guys."
"Chris, what the fuck!"
"I'll see you later," Marcus said, waving to Nicole and rolling his eyes at Chris. As soon as he turned his back, Nicole turned around and shoved Chris hard.
"Seriously, what the fuck!"
"Hey, you told me you didn't want to go out with me because you were focusing on yourself. What gives?"
"We went out, Chris. It didn't work. I don't want to see you anymore," Nicole hissed back at him before pushing him out of her way.
"See you at your 21st!" Chris yelled back. Nicole scoffed and rolled her eyes, heading home immediately.

As she showered, Nicole closed her eyes and tried to think of something positive to get her mind off of the awful day so far. One positive is that, as she showered, Nicole could tell that her breasts had definitely gotten bigger.
"I'll have to ask Daddy to pay for some new bras," she smiled, before frowning again. "Or does he want me to pay for them with a 'job.' This is such bullshit."
Climbing out of the shower, Nicole decided to visit Betty and get better that way. They could drink, smoke weed, and gossip. That was always a fun way to kill time. Nicole got dressed, putting on a sweater to cover up some of her perceived doughiness and drove her Mercedes over to Betty's.

"Oh my god, that sucks!" Betty said as Nicole told her the story. "So what are you going to do?"
"I dunno," Nicole whined, muting the TV as "Guy Code" switched to a commercial. "You're lucky that your parents still let you do what you want."
"Well, besides making me go to college," Betty scoffed, spitting out her gum into a tissue. "But that's not so bad, I guess. Plenty of good-looking guys on campus."
"Mmm, yeah," Nicole smiled.
"I'm going to get some beers. You want one, I'm guessing?"
"Oh yeah," Nicole said. "It is not too early to drink for me today." Betty laughed and stood up, walking into the kitchen, bending over and looking through the fridge.

Flip me

Nicole felt a strange voice in her head. She noticed that her hand was in her pocket, fingers wrapped around...something. Pulling it out, it was the same coin she found yesterday. I don't remember taking you with me, Nicole thought.

Flip me

Nicole shrugged and flipped the coin, catching it as she looked over at Betty by the fridge. It was-

1453311211222.content:
"Alrighty, here it is--"Betty began, before falling back on her butt. "Wow, you klutz. There's something called balance, maybe try it sometime," Nicole said, approaching Betty.

Betty didn't respond, as she placed a hand on her midriff. Suddenly, her flat stomach began to slowly push outwards. Betty pulled up her shirt, as her belly increasingly began to round out, passing the five months mark.

"Betty, what the fuck did you eat?" Nicole asked, her eyes widening at the same rate that Betty's stomach did. Betty remained silent, and could only watch in horror as her stomach continued to grow.

Finally, the growth stopped, giving Betty the appearance of a woman eight months pregnant, popped-out belly button and all. "I don't think I've ever seen bloating that bad before, damn." Nicole said, placing a hand to Betty's stomach, obviously oblivious to her friend's impending motherhood.

After she felt the tautness of her Betty's round belly, she pulled her hand away. "Nicole, I don't think this is fucking bloating, okay?!" Betty shouted in annoyance. "Why not?" she asked.

"Because I feel something moving. In here." Betty said, placing a hand on her belly. "Wait, so you're saying that you're pregnant? We gotta get you to the hospital!" Nicole said.

"Are you kidding me? I'm not going out like this! Just call Dr. Anderson and get him to do a house call!" she pleaded, rubbing her belly.

Since Nicole and Betty's families were close, they shared the same doctor. Nicole grabbed her cell phone and dialed the doctor's office number.

"Dr. Anderson's office how may I help you?" the secretary asked. "Hi, this is Nicole Winters. Can I speak to Dr. Anderson please?"she asked. "Dr. Anderson is currently in an appointment right now. Would you like to leave a message?"

"No. This is an emergency. I need to talk to him right now." Nicole pleaded to the secretary. "Fine. Hold on a minute."

After a minute of waiting, the doctor picked up. "Nicole? Is everything okay?" he asked. "Uhm...something...happened to Betty. You need to get here right away." "What happened? Is she alright?" he asked, with a tone of concern. "I can't explain it, really. Just get here now." Nicole said.

"Damn it, okay. I'll be right there," he said, hanging up the phone. Nicole glanced at Betty, who was rubbing her belly. Seeing this reminded Nicole of her own recent weight gain. She went into the bathroom to see if she had grown at all.

Closing the bathroom door, she pulled up her sweater and saw her belly. It was slightly bigger than it was this morning, giving her the appearance of a woman three months pregnant. The doorbell rang as she pulled down her sweater, confused at her midsection's slight growth.

Nicole pulled Betty off the ground (a tough feat, all things considered), and ushered her towards the couch.

Nicole opened the door, and was greeted by Dr. Anderson, a grey-haired, bespectacled man in his early 50s. Nicole knew Dr. Anderson on a personal level, as he had directed her to a few of the finest plastic surgeons i the area. "Hey, Nicole. Where's Betty?" he asked.

Nicole led him into the living room, and saw Betty sitting on the couch. "Oh my god! Betty!" he said, in utter shock. "What happened?" Nicole and Betty told Dr. Anderson what had happened, and he was clueless as to what had caused it.

"I...this just doesn't make sense to me. Betty, when was the last time that you had sex?" he asked her. "A few weeks ago, but he used protection and I'm on the pill--I....don't know what's happening to me...."

"Alright, Betty could you lie down for a second?" he asked her. Betty lifted her legs up and lay on the couch, her large belly weighing her down. Dr. Anderson felt around her belly. "Those are definitely kicks..."he said. He pressed a stethoscope to Betty's rounded middle, and was able to hear an extra heartbeat or two.

"Well, Betty, it would appear that you are pregnant. Around 7-8 months I'm guessing. Now, I'd like to run an ultrasound on you to really know what we're dealing with. My next available appointment is two days from now. Is that okay?" he asked. Betty nodded. As Dr. Anderson walked out of the door, both of the girls' stomachs grumbled.

They decided to...
1453311211222.title: Pregnant Expansion-Betty's midsection is lo...

choices: Nicole gets another call from her parents about a job opportunity
14533112112221.content:
Betty rubbed her belly, scowling. "Great, now I'm getting cravings too."
Nicole sighed and crawled onto the couch next to her friend, the two lying side-by-side. "Hey, it's okay. I'm pretty hungry too, so you don't have to be the only one pigging out. Besides, if you really are...pregnant, then you can always use that as an excuse to eat more." Nicole turned over and smiled at her friend. "You don't have to be fat like me."
Betty rolled her eyes. "Nicole, you aren't fat. You look hot. You always look hot." Betty rubbed Nicole's shoulders slowly. "You're a sexy bitch, okay?"
Nicole scoffed. "Yeah, yeah. Here, I'll order us something to eat. You won't have to leave the house and let anyone see you."

Betty complained silently as she rubbed her belly, looking at the massive ball of flesh with concern. After all, what was she supposed to do when she did have to leave the house and let people see her? Nicole pulled out her phone and scrolled through the take-out places she knew about. Then, a weird wave of hunger hit her. A very specific wave of hunger. At that moment, Nicole absolutely wanted Chinese food and would not rest until she got it. In no time, she dialed the Peking Palace and ordered a few boxes of lo mein, a few boxes of sweet and sour pork, and a box of pea pods. Betty raised her eyebrows when Nicole hung up the phone. "Wow, you really do make me want to feel better."
Nicole blushed. "I said I was hungry, geez," she said quietly. Despite both being pretty shallow and bitchy people, Nicole and Betty remained close friends. They knew each other as little kids, both of their parents knowing each other at their local country club. The two of them had gone through scores of friends individually, but Nicole and Betty had always remained together.

Nicole sat next to Betty on the couch, smiling at her compassionately. "So...what's it feel like?"
Betty sighed and stroked her bare skin. There was plenty sticking out, her original top barely fitting her in the first place. "It's not terrible, I guess. It doesn't hurt or anything. It's just really, really tight and I feel full. Like I just ate a shit load. And I can...you know...feel moving inside."
Nicole nodded quietly. "Can I feel?"
Betty shrugged and rolled her shirt up some more. Nicole slowly put her hand down onto the slope of belly. Betty was right: it was unbelievably tight, but also a little soft. And warm, of course. Betty let out a little sigh. "It feels kind of nice when you rub." Taking her cue, Nicole moved her palm all around Betty's belly.
Nicole giggled and smiled back at her friend. Then, an image from last night's dream flashed through her head and Nicole moved her hand away. "S-so, are you still going to go to class?"
Betty shrugged again and threw her arms down. "I dunno. I guess I have to, right? If I have to actually give birth to a baby...or two, I'll need a job or something and I'll need a college degree for that." Betty sighed again, wrapping her arms around her new baby bump. "My parents can help support me too...if they don't cut me off because of this."

Nicole frowned and moved her hand back to her friend's belly. "Can't you explain how this just sort of happened?"
Betty scoffed. "If I told you I just 'became' pregnant, would you believe me?" Nicole thought about it. Betty had a point.
"Are you going to tell them?"
"I'll have to at some point," Betty said, patting her massive belly. "I mean, look at me. If I don't tell them, they'll just figure it out on their own."
"Well...I'll give you whatever help I can," Nicole said. Betty looked back at her friend, giving her a little smile.
"Thanks, Nicky." Nicole smiled back, blushing a little, and the two rubbed Betty's belly and laughed at the little kicks and movements they felt.

After sitting around like this for a while, the doorbell rang, echoing through the house. Nicole turned her legs and got off the couch, walking up the the front door. The delivery boy handed Nicole the food, smiling as he looked over her face and her ample chest. Nicole was used to being looked over like this. Hell, she dressed to encourage it. And her breasts had definitely gotten a little bigger lately. Nicole flashed him a polite smile and handed him the money and a tip as she took the food back. "Alright Betty, let's eat until I look like you."
14533112112221.title: Call for delivery

145331121122211.content:
Nicole and Betty ate vigorously, not caring about appearance or manners. Noodles, chicken, pea pods, everything was chewed and gulped down in a flash. Betty watched Nicole in almost awe as she kept working her way through a box of noodles, finishing off, belching, and then opening up the next box. "Wow Nicky. I'm pregnant. What's your excuse?" Betty laughed. Nicole turned to her friend with cheeks full of noodles, looking at her sadly. "Just kidding, geez," Betty said, rubbing Nicole's shoulders. "But really, I've never seen you eat like this before."
Nicole slurped down her present mouthful and shrugged. "Maybe it's stress-eating."

As the pair worked down to their last mouthful, Nicole's phone started buzzing. She picked it up and rolled her eyes. "My dad. Hang on." Nicole walked into Betty's bathroom and sat down on the bath's rim before answering the call. "Hello?"
"Hello Nicole," Roger Winters said on the other end. "Good news. I was able to find you a possible job in the area."
Nicole groaned. "So you're really going to put me through this, Daddy?"
Her father cleared his throat. "Now Nicole, I put my neck out trying to secure you this job. I cashed in some favors getting you a position as a receptionist at an office. It's part-time so you won't be there all day and the work's not too hard. This should be a good opportunity for you."
Nicole sighed again, leaning back slightly, pouting out her lips. "So just like that? You're so nice, Daddy."
"I'm not going to continue funding you, so you can quit that act right now, Nicole."
"Urgh, Daddy!"
"Your mother is already upset with me for finding you a job and not forcing you to do the job hunting yourself. Give it a try, will you?"
Nicole rolled her eyes. "Fine. When do I start?"
"Well, you still have to interview for the position on Monday, and if they accept you, you'll start Tuesday."
"Interview?" Nicole almost yelled.
"You'll do fine, Nicole. We can talk more at dinner tonight. You're coming over, aren't you? Your cousins are stopping by."

Nicole's cousins. She knew exactly which ones he meant. Jenny, Stacy, and Rachel Winters. All the good looks and money that come with being a part of the Winters family, with added smugness and success. Each one had a strong start on their career and would always come to her house along with their parents to talk about how great their lives are. Rachel was engaged to a man set to be valedictorian at his law school, Stacy was a firey businesswoman who just got promoted to chief of her division at a massive software company, and Jenny, the smuggest of all (in Nicole's mind) was a news anchor and local celebrity. Nicole couldn't stand them and it didn't help that her parents constantly reminder her how close in age she was to all of them and how much they were managing to accomplish. Lucille Winters would also slyly throw in that they all look amazing and none of them had ever gotten plastic surgery. Of course, Nicole still thought she was much hotter than any of them and she was convinced that Jenny had some kind of work done.

"Yeah, I'll be home tonight," Nicole sighed. Saturday night and she was having dinner with her relatives. Well, she could probably still catch some pretty good parties afterward. The good ones didn't get going until late. "We'll talk more then."
"Okay. Love you, honey," her father said unemphatically, hanging up the phone. Nicole pulled the phone away from her ear quickly and let out a long groan.
"Okay in there?" Betty asked. She opened the door slowly, her belly peeking out through the crack.
"Yeah, I'm fine. I have to eat dinner with my stupid, stuck-up cousins tonight and I've got a job interview Monday," Nicole said.
"Well, at least you don't have to go look for a job," Betty said, rubbing her belly listlessly.
"Why do you keep going that?" Nicole asked.
"Doing what?" Betty responded. Nicole pointed to her rubbing hands and Betty quickly stopped, her whole face turning red. "T-they just sort of do that on their own..."
"Hmm," Nicole said, walking up and putting her hands on Betty's unexpected pregnant bump. "I guess it is kind of fun." The two of them stood in the bathroom doorway as Nicole played with her friend's swollen womb.
"Oof, let me through," Betty said after a while. Nicole looked at her inquisitively. "I think they're...kicking my bladder. I have to pee really bad." Nicole blushed and got out of her friend's way, the door closing behind her.

The two continued to spend time together for about an hour, watching MTV and eating whatever Chinese food was leftover. Betty continued to rub her belly in small circles, every now and then letting out a little "oh" of surprise as her little ones kicked her. As the program ended, the credits for the next one started up. "Sixteen and Pregnant."
"Ugh, turn it off," Betty complained, waving her hand toward Nicole. Nicole obliged her, switching the TV off. "At least those girls got to prepare for nine months to have a baby. How many weeks do you think I've got? One? A day?"
"Hey, it'll be alright," Nicole said, sitting close to her friend. "I'm sure you've got time. You're not that big."
"Liar."
"Okay, so you're huge, but when you go to the doctor, I'm sure things will be clearer. And your family's loaded so at least you'll be able to support the...the..."
"Babies. You can say babies in front of me, it's okay," Betty mumbled. "And what am I supposed to do until then? I can't go to class like this! I can't go to parties! I won't be able to get laid."
"I dunno about that, there's some guys who might be into pregnant girls," Nicole said. "Besides...it looks like pregnancy gave you some bigger tits." She gently prodded Betty's engorged chest.
"Hey!" Betty said, covering her breasts with her hands, her face turning red.
"Look, it'll...it'll be okay. Just let me know if anything changes," Betty said, looking at her phone. "Shit, I have to go. Keep me in the loop, okay?"
"Okay," Betty said quietly, heaving herself up to give Nicole a hug.

Nicole drove home and changed into something a little dressier and without any soy sauce stains. After some consideration, she put on a larger outfit that covered up some of her new weight gain. She was sure her mother would bring it up in front of everyone at the dinner table if she didn't take some sort of precaution. Driving to her parent's house, she pulled into the wide driveway, already filled with two cars and a board. The house itself was almost like a mansion: three stories with cut rock on the foundation and a huge, manicured lawn on the front. Nicole walked down the winding path with arranged stones and various fresh flowers to the front door and rung the doorbell.

Flip me

Nicole automatically reached into her pocket and pulled out the strange coin. What am I doing? she wondered to herself as she gave the coin a flip, catching it on her hand as the front door opened to reveal her-
145331121122211.title: Privileges of a Rich Family

1453311211222111.content:
Lucille Winters opened the door and smiled villainously down at her daughter. "Hello Nicole, glad you finally decided to show up. Everyone's here and we just waited on you to start dinner."

"Nice to see you too, Mother," Nicole hissed, catching the coin in her hand. She blinked dumbly as she looked down at the coin. Why had she just done that? It was like a split second of her life had vanished out of thin air and it somehow led to her weird coin being flipped.

"Well, are you just going to stand there or come inside?" Lucille said again. Nicole looked between her mother and the side of her coin. It landed on-
1453311211222111.title: Mother

14533112112221111.content:
Nicole looked back at her mother and saw an astonishing sight. Lucille's mid-section began to swell and swell, just like it had for Betty, until Lucille appeared to be an overdue pregnant woman. She had been wearing dark pants and a light red blouse. Her outfit now strained to confine Lucille's incredible pregnant belly. Nicole's eyes bugged out of her head.
"Mom...you're-"
"Nicole, honestly, hurry inside," Lucille said, resting her hands on her belly. "We're all ready for dinner. I know you think starving yourself will keep you in shape but no one wants a girl who's too skinny, now get in here. You're acting like a child and I don't need any more of those." Lucille's left hand stroked the side of her belly almost by instinct at her last line.
Nicole gripped her fists tightly. "Jesus, Mother! Can you lay off me for one second? What happened to you?"
Lucille let out a long sigh. "Nicole Shosanna Winters, we are not having a discussion about my pregnancy right now, do you understand me? We've had a thousand of these talks already."
Nicole walked inside the house, if only to get a better look at her mother's belly. "A thousand talks? What are you talking about? I mean...is this something that's happening to lots of people? The same thing happened to Betty a few hours ago."
"What happened to Betty?" Roger Winters asked as he walked into the foyer. "Hello Nicole, glad you made it. Ready to eat?"
Nicole was stunned and hesitated on the next syllables out of her mouth when she heard a chorus of voices come into the room.

"Is that Nicole?" Jenny said as she, Rachel, and Stacy walked into the room, each of them smiling and laughing. Jenny scooped Nicole up in a hug before setting her back down and looking her in the eye. "I haven't seen you in so long!"
"Like a month," Nicole replied quietly. Jenny was a gorgeous blonde, about the same height as Nicole with a toned body, nice chest, and radiant, clear skin. Her cheeks were also pretty big and it gave her adorable dimples.
"Well, let's eat!" Stacy said eagerly, rubbing her hands together. "Sorry Mom and Dad couldn't make it tonight, they had a charity ball Dad had to attend for work, but they both gave their regards." Stacy was just as gorgeous as Jenny, but quite a bit taller than her, with a dark beauty mark above her lip and jet-black hair tied in a bun.
"Yes, I'm starving," Rachel laughed. "I had a dance class today to get ready for the wedding and it takes a lot out of you." Surprise, surprise: Rachel was a stone cold fox as well. Her long brown hair was wavy and draped over her shoulders nicely and she had the most piercing blue eyes.

If Nicole had even seen a surrealist movie in her life, she'd have a pretty good measuring stick for the dinner. Here, she was stuck with some of the most irritating and overbearing people she knew, all of them talking and laughing in her ear, but the entire time, Nicole was distracted by the impossibility of her mother's sudden pregnancy. Especially because no one was taking it as a surprise! They all acted like Lucille had been pregnant for, well, about nine months! Hell, more than that by the look of her.

Finally, Rachel broke the silence when it came to Lucille's pregnancy. "You know, Aunt Lucille, you've really made me less afraid about having children of my own with Peter." Lucille smiled as she took a sip of water. (That was another shock to Nicole: her mother wasn't on her second glass of wine at this point in the meal. She had to be pregnant to stop that.)
Jenny laughed. "Peter's already talking about having kids? Man, he's something else!" The two sisters giggled as Nicole took another big scoop of food and shoved it in her mouth rudely. Despite the big meal at Betty's, Nicole still felt voracious.
"Nicole, please, show some manners. Why did we put you in those cotillion classes?" Lucille said, setting her glass down.
"Yeah, Aunt Lucille isn't even eating like that and she has three mouths to feed!" Stacy laughed.
"Three?" Nicole said, turning back to her mother.
"Nicole, I swear your memory is so spacey sometimes," Roger said, shaking his head. "Yes, your mother is having twins."
"And we're not going to spoil them so much this time," Lucille said, her comment directed right at Nicole.
"Well, I don't know about that," Roger laughed, turning to his nieces. "I might spoil these kids even more than I did Nicole."
The four of them laughed while Nicole glared back at her mother.

"So, Stacy, you have a pretty big presentation next week, I hear," Roger said, interrupting another period of silence in the dinner conversation.
