"Yes, it'll be my first major action as the division chief and the upper management will be there. It should really determine my place in the company," Stacy smiled.
"Well, I have plenty of business experience, so I can give you any help you need," he responded, turning to Jenny. "And I hear you're hosting a big event next week as well?"
Jenny smiled. "Yes, well, I'll be at the state fair and there should be some pretty interesting things going on there. Saying I'm "hosting" it might be a bit of a stretch, but I'll be doing most of my news station's coverage."
Roger beamed, turning to Nicole. "Big events all around. And Nicole, you'll be interviewing for a new job next week too!"
Nicole forced a smile, not wanting to be outdone by her cousins. "Yes, and I think I'll have a good shot at it."
Lucille laughed as she took a sip of water, making a loud sound. "I'm sorry, I just coughed," she said with a grin. "Please, continue dear."
"You know...I think I need to be excused for a moment," Nicole said, standing up and dropping her napkin on the plate. Nicole stormed into the bathroom and screamed loudly. "Who does that...that knocked-up cow think she is? Oh, I'm not pretty enough or successful enough? Well, you know what I'm not? Pregnant in my fucking 50s!" Nicole paused and thought about it again. "Wait...wait...how is she pregnant anyway? I mean...she wasn't when I got here...or did I really just forget? Maybe seeing Betty just confused me..."

Nicole walked back to the dining room, trying to look as composed and confident as she could.
"Everything alright?" Jenny asked in an innocent tone, batting her eyelids.
"Oh yes," Nicole smiled.

Flip me

"Everything's fine," Nicole said as she caught the coin, looking up at Jenny.
14533112112221111.title: Heads - Reality Shift

145331121122211112.content:
Jenny took a sip of water and hesitated as the drink went down her throat. "Oouhh," she burped slowly. "I...I think I need to go to the bathroom too. Excuse me, everyone." Jenny got up from the table and ran past Nicole. Nicole caught a quick glimpse of her cousin's face and noticed how pale she was and how her hand was going straight for her mouth.
Just like me yesterday, Nicole thought as Jenny's vomiting came muffled through the bathroom door. Everyone else at the table looked around concerned.
"I knew broadcast news could be stressful," Stacy chuckled, trying to lift the room's spirits. Rachel joined in, lifting a glass of wine to her lips.

Not enough...more! Flip me!

What? Nicole thought, confused at the voice in her head. It had been there a few times before, but she also noticed herself lifting the coin out of her pocket and giving it a flip as she looked over at Rachel, who was bringing the wine to her lips.
145331121122211112.title: Tails - No Reality Shift

1453311211222111121.content:
As the coin fell back into Nicole's hand, she quickly hid it under the table. Why had she just done that? At least no one at the table seemed to notice. Their eyes were focused on the bathroom door, where Jenny's vomiting sounds were coming from.

As soon as it fell back into Nicole's grasp, Rachel looked down quickly at her wine glass and set it down surreptitiously, wiping the little bit from her lips and looking around nervously. All of the levity that had been on her face was gone and Nicole took notice. The obnoxiously happy Winters sister was now a shy, worried woman. Nicole noticed that she didn't look quite as pretty as she did before either, but then she noticed why: Rachel's face was turning pale too.

"I-I think I need to be excused as well," Rachel said, holding her hand over her mouth and rushing to the bathroom. A muffled "Move over, sis" came from behind the door, followed by a second round of vomiting sounds, asynchronous with Jenny's. Nicole should have been thinking about the coincidence that all three of them were experiencing sudden nausea in such a short time-span. And it's not like she didn't notice. But Nicole was more preoccupied on the glee of watching her two peppy, better-than-you cousins fighting over the same toilet bowl to barf in.

Good... the voice seemed to cackle in Nicole's head. She felt her fingers wrap around the coin once again. Flip me!

Nicole obliged, turning her eyes to the last cousin at the table - Stacy - and letting the coin fly a short distance into the air before falling back into Nicole's palm.
1453311211222111121.title: Heads-Reality Shift: Maybe wine's a bad choice now

14533112112221111211.content:
Nicole caught the coin and puzzled to herself. Wait...didn't I find this coin when I started feeling nauseous yesterday? Nicole looked over at Stacy with a mix of concern and glee. I-is she going to hurl now too?
Roger Winters looked around agitatedly. "This is terrible. Is it food poisoning? Lucille, how do you feel?"
Lucille Winters rubbed her massive pregnant belly slowly and sighed. "Well, my stomach feels a little odd, but I tally that up to the two fetuses kicking and moving around in here." Lucille grinned and took another sip of water. "But other than that, I feel fine."
"Well I don't feel anything either," Roger said, turning to Nicole. "Didn't you say you felt nauseous yesterday, Nicole?"
She nodded. "Yeah, but I feel fine now."
As Roger turned to Stacy, a little grin spread across her lips. "How about you, Stacy?"
The grin spread. "Well Uncle Roger, I feel a little odd too, but I took some medication in preparation."
"Preparation...of what?" Roger puzzled. Stacy's grin turned into a full-blown smile.
"Preparation for morning sickness." Lucille's grin started to fade as she stared at her niece.

Rachel and Jenny walked out of the bathroom slowly, each covered in sweat and taking deep breaths. "Morning sickness?" Jenny asked. "You mean, like..."
Stacy bit her lip and nodded eagerly. "Yup. I already told Mom and Dad but...I'm pregnant!"
Jenny let out an enthusiastic but exhausted squeal and ran over, scooping her sister up in a big hug. "Ohmigod! Ohmigod! Ohmigod!" Rachel had a surprised look just like Roger, Lucille, and Nicole, but she still went over and joined in the group hug.
"Alright, alright," Lucille said, heaving herself out of her seat, jutting her own pregnance forward. "I'm happy for you too, Stacy, but what exactly is your plan? Is the father in the picture?"
Stacy shook her head. "No, it was...unplanned, Aunt Lucille," she said, placing her hand over her own flat stomach (flatter than Nicole's right now, our hero noticed with envy). "But, I have a very stable and high-paying job. And this is the modern way now. There's another woman at the company who was single but got pregnant through artificial insemination and she still managed to move up into one of the vice-president positions while caring for her one-year old."
"Well, this is a happy occasion, anyhow," Roger said, getting up and joining in the big hug. Jenny looked over and smiled at Nicole.
"C'mon cuz, join in!"
Nicole slowly walked over and hugged her family members, feeling her mother's pregnant belly rub against her on one side and Rachel's vomit breath on the other.

After that, the family decided to call it quits on the dinner. Two episodes of vomiting and a pregnancy announcement would do that to a meal. Everyone continued to hug and talk to Stacy as they left. Nicole rolled her eyes, annoyed by the whole scene. Now Stacy's success would not only be rubbed in her face, but the fact that she's working at a great job while also caring for a new baby would be a deadly weapon of low self-confidence in Lucille's hands. Nicole looked over at her mother and shuddered to think about how much she'd rub her own pregnancy into Nicole's face. Especially how good she still looked despite being over 50 and pregnant with twins...

Nicole and her parents were the last ones in the house and Nicole flipped through her phone, looking for messages from Betty. "Well, I should be going," Nicole said, exhausted by the whole night, especially the two sudden pregnancies in her friend and mother.
"We'll talk to you in the morning, Nicole," Roger said. "I want to make sure everything goes well for you at the interview."
"Yes, you'll certainly need the help," Lucille smiled, wrapping her hands around her belly. Nicole scowled and headed out the door.
"We'll talk, Daddy," she spat as she closed the door behind her, swearing from the steps to her car.

Nicole got home and collapsed into her bed, groaning loudly. "Here's to a better day tomorrow," she said, peeling out of her clothes and running her hands over her slight paunch. "And hopefully, more work to get rid of this fat." And with that, Nicole fell into a deep, tired sleep.

That night, Nicole had another dream where she boasted a massive pregnant belly. This time, she was wearing maternity lingerie as two, large hands caressed her from behind.
"Mmm, Marcus," she moaned, wiggling her ass around her lover's crotch. Marcus smiled and pushed against Nicole, rubbing her belly lovingly.
"Our kids are growing big, huh?" he said, kissing her on the ear.
"Yes, I can't wait for you to put another litter in there. Maybe more next time," Nicole purred. Suddenly, the door opened and Lucille, Jenny, Rachel, and Stacy all marched into the room angrily, each with their own big pregnant belly.
"Hey! Get away from the father of my children!" Jenny barked, pointing at Nicole.
"W-what?" Nicole said, the dream world starting to shift all around her. Rachel, Stacy, and even Lucille all nodded.
"Yes, he got me pregnant first," Lucile said. "Of course he would. I'll always look better than you." Lucille clutched her belly and smiled. "And I'm even going into labor before you. I'll be a mother again before you!"
"No! I'll get these babies out first!" Nicole yelled, pushing hard.

Nicole woke up in her bed, muttered about babies. She looked around quickly, vaguely remembering the dream but still feeling like it was so vivid that it must be real. Nicole pulled the sheets off and noticed something with a groan. She looked even fatter today. In fact, she looked like she had a full-on pot belly.

"Great," Nicole whined, falling back into bed when she heard a few knocks at her front door.

"Hey, Nicole?" A muffled voice said. "It's-
14533112112221111211.title: Heads - Reality Shift

145331121122211112111.content:
"It's me, Chris. Could you open up?" Nicole threw on a tank top and entered the living room, about to open the door. Wait a minute! I can't let him see me like this! she thought referring to her pot belly.

Nicole puttered into the kitchen (while she noticed that her increase in weight had slightly altered her walk), and began to fiddle with the cabinets and stove, to make it appear that she was busy. "Um-door's open!" she said.

Chris opened the door, and entered the living room. "Nicole? I'd like to talk to you for a second," he said. "In the kitchen," Nicole mumbled, a hint of nervousness in her voice. Nicole opened the pantry, appearing to look for food, her back facing Chris.

"So, Nicole, I'm sorry for the way that I acted at the gym, but the guy had it coming! I mean, he can't just come up to you and immediately be your boyfriend! Shit, I worked years for that, Nicole!" he shouted, exasperated.

"He's NOT my boyfriend. I just met they guy, Chris! It's not a big deal that he's going to my party!" Nicole said. Staring at the food in the pantry made her very hungry, as the audible growl from her stomach showed. Again, she had garnered some odd cravings. She grabbed the jar of pickles, and also grabbed a jar of Nutella. Nicole began to eat this disgusting combination ravenously.

"Well, if he's not your boyfriend, then you should take me back. I've changed, Nicole. For real this time." he said. Nicole finished chewing. "Chris, this is the fifth time you've told me this. Sorry, it's not gonna happen." she said.

"Could you at least look at me?" he asked. He grabbed her shoulder and spun her around. "Nicole, what the fuck?" he yelled, finally getting a look at her swollen belly, which was roughly the size of a woman five months pregnant.

"Did that dick at the gym do this to you? I swear to god...Wait, wait...is it mine?" he asked. "What? No, no, no. I'm not pregnant, Chris! For fuck's sake, I've just put on some weight." she said, covering her belly with her arms. "Well, you might want to go to the gym more, because you honestly look pregnant!" he said. "Ok, asshole. Get the fuck out!" she yelled, shoving him out of the door, slamming it shut.

"So insensitive..." she said, absentmindedly rubbing her belly. Returning to her bedroom, she removed her tank top and looked at herself in the mirror. "He is right, though. I do look pregnant..." she said, poking her stomach, noticing that it was still hard. Nicole decided that she needed to go to the gym. She put on a pair of yoga pants and the sweater she donned yesterday. To her horror, her belly was clearly visible. "Shit..."

Nicole grabbed her car keys and left the house. Entering her car, she realized that her belly was pressing into the steering wheel. She adjusted the seat, and took off.

On her way, she recieved a call. It was from...
145331121122211112111.title: Chris, her ex-boyfriend

1453311211222111121111.content:
Nicole moaned. It was a big enough hassle having her father try to talk to her again, especially after the miserable family interactions she'd had the past day, but she had really hoped Betty had gotten a hold of her. Ideally to tell Nicole that the whole sudden pregnancy was just a weird bout of indigestion or kidney stones or...something. Pregnancy seemed to be following Nicole wherever she went. Her mother and Betty turned from regular women into baby-filled blimps in the blink of an eye and Stacy gave her big announcement at dinner last night. And Chris' obnoxious comment certainly didn't help either...

"Hello Daddy?" Nicole said, putting her phone on speaker. Obviously, the college town had restrictions on cell phone usage while driving, but Nicole was pretty accustomed to getting and doing what she wanted. Although given her present condition, she should have been more concerned with her motor safety.
"Hello Nicole," Roger Winters said. "You left dinner pretty soon last night so I didn't get to talk to you about the job interview."
Right, that, Nicole remembered with a grumble. "Yeah, well, dinner got pretty weird. Everyone started barfing and Stacy and Mother suddenly announced that they were pregnant.
Roger chuckled in confusion. "Well, Stacy certainly did, but you know that your mother's been pregnant for quite some time. I wouldn't say she just dropped that news on us last night."
Nicole rolled her eyes. "Okay, I wish you would both stop saying that to me. Is this some sort of prank as punishment? I'm going to the interview, isn't that enough?"
Roger paused. "I'm not sure what you're talking about, but good to hear about the interview." Damn, Nicole had inadvertently handed her father a perfect segue. "I emailed you the exact time and address so you've got it down exactly. I know the people doing the interviewing and you should be fine."
"People...plural?" Nicole asked. This was turning out a little scarier than she'd expected.
"Yes, three of the office's department heads will need to talk to you for the position. The manager, the head of HR, and the head of administrations. But you'll do fine. You'll be a fine receptionist."
"A receptionist?" Nicole said with a raised eyebrow, pulling into the gym. "You made it sound like I would have a position with a little more flair, like a secretary."
"Don't look at it that way, Nicole," Roger said on the other end. It was clear that he was trying to move onto something else, the sound of moving papers audible on Nicole's end. "Think about Megan Draper. She was glamorous, wasn't she?"
Nicole rolled her eyes. Yeah, to old guys like you maybe.
"Well, I've got to go, Nicole, but we'll be back in touch. You'll do great. Good-bye." Roger hung up in his typical, dry, stentorian voice, leaving Nicole to throw her phone down into the passenger seat in anger.

Back in the gym, Nicole was running furiously on the elliptical machine, looking around nervously to see if any other people (especially other girls who were as catty as her) were looking at her recent, bulging middle. That made her exercising a little more difficult than usual. It also didn't help that her sports bra was digging into her skin even more than yesterday. Damn, I'm getting fat everywhere! Nicole thought to herself. Her yoga pants were also hugging more tightly than she'd like. And, like the last time she was at the gym, she was way more tired than usual.

Nicole was dripping with sweat as the machine switched to "cool down" and she relaxed, still trying her luck at flirting with other guys at the gym. She managed to get plenty of interested smiles and once-overs, although a few stopped at her belly and walked away. Nicole felt bad, but she'd expected some of it. But she noticed more and more guys were looking less interested in her, and a few girls pointing and whispering about her.

What really set Nicole off was when one girl walked up to her; she looked like she was about 18 or 19. "H-hi," the girl said. "I just wanted to say...I think it's really brave of you to go to college here while pregnant."
"Oh, I'm not a student here," Nicole said, smiling as politely as she could fake while wiping sweat off her forehead. Then, she stopped and turned back to the girl. "Wait...I'm not pregnant! You think I'm pregnant?" Nicole was furious and lifted up her sweater to show her new potbelly. "Just because I got a little fat doesn't mean I'm fucking pregnant!"
It wasn't just "a little fat." Nicole did have a clear rounding in her stomach and it was still hard and tightly concentrated. However, that wasn't why the girl had come over.
"I-I'm sorry, I was told by some other girl here that you were pregnant," the girl squeaked.
"Who?" Nicole bellowed.
"C-Claire Reynolds, from Sigma Mu."

Claire Reynolds. Nicole and Claire had been as close to mortal enemies as two high school girls could be. They were like the United States and the Soviet Union in a Cold War of throwing shade. Claire was actually a student at the local college where Nicole lived and did what she could to make Nicole's life miserable when she could. Telling people Nicole was pregnant was a new tactic, however.

"Well, when you see Claire, tell her I'm looking for her," Nicole growled. "And tell her I'm not pregnant!"

"Excuse me, but you'll need to keep it down please," a voice said behind Nicole. She turned around to see Marcus again in his campus fitness outfit. "Oh...Nicole, right?" He smiled.
Nicole smiled back, letting out a relieved sigh. "Yeah. And you're Marcus. I remember you." She left out his little cameo in her last dream and looked him over a few times. "Sorry about that, I was just a little upset. Working out can do that to you."
"Yeah, I know what you mean," Marcus smiled with a little laugh. "When I'm done with a big set of lifts, sometimes I feel like I just want to go wild."
Nicole bit her lip. You could go wild on me anytime you want. "Yeah," she said with a little laugh of her own.
"So," Marcus said with a pause. "Would you like to get together and go for a run sometime? And maybe we could get something to eat after?"
Nicole felt her heart soar. "Yes, that would be great!" They exchanged numbers and Nicole left, chuckling giddily. Who cares if I look fat? Nicole thought to herself. I've got a date with that hot guy and I turn 21 in nearly a week. Nothing could go wrong.

As soon as she got to her car, Nicole's phone rang and she found out that, in fact, something could go wrong.
1453311211222111121111.title: Her father

choices: Went out to meet with her cousins
14533112112221111211112.content:
As soon as Nicole brought the phone to her ear, she regretted it.
"Hi Nicki!" Jenny's oppressively cheery voice said on the other end. "Nicki" was Jenny's pet name for her cousin that no one else used. It annoyed the hell out of Nicole.
"Hi Jenny," Nicole said, putting on her own phony, pleased voice. "What's up?"
"Well, there's a former governor giving a speech at that college you live near tonight and I was hoping you could help show me around so I could interview some students," Jenny said with a sweet tone. "Rachel and Stacy are coming too. They want to see their little sis in action." Jenny giggled. Nicole rolled her eyes. "Oh! And when it's done, could you give us a tour of the campus? That would be so, so cool."
"I-I guess so," Nicole said, annoyed that Jenny's warm personality, however fake and malicious it might be, made it hard to say no to her. "Sure, I can do that."
"And, do you think you could get me into that college gym?" Jenny added with a giggle. "I don't want to pay for a gym membership and it looks like it's made me put on a little bit of weight, so I was hoping to get in some exercising to clear my head and get in shape while I'm here."
"Sure," Nicole said, a little pleased to hear that she wasn't the only one getting fat in the family.
"Great!" Jenny said with another giggle. "You know, that university has such a nice campus. It's a shame you don't actually go there." And with that, Jenny hung up. Nicole let out a furious shriek and threw her phone down angrily for the second time today.

Back home, Nicole took a shower, her hands moving across her rounded middle as the warm water fell down on her. "Why is it so hard?" Nicole muttered to herself. "Maybe it's my abs because I've been going to the gym so much." That lifted her spirits a bit. She was also keenly aware of her cup size upgrade in the past few days and felt like her hips had gotten a bit wider. Nicole didn't think she looked that bad, really. Maybe she was getting a little hotter in preparation for her big birthday bash.

Nicole heard her doorbell ring as she got out of the shower. Wrapping a towel around her body and hair and putting on a bathrobe, she walked to the front door and looked the peephole and saw Betty's face. "Finally!" Nicole said to herself as she turned the doorknob. "I'll see Betty, learn everything was okay, and things can go back to normal."

Nicole opened the door and saw that things were not back to normal at all. Betty was wearing sweatpants and a spaghetti strap top that showed off plenty of her bare pregnant belly. "Hi Nicole. Can I come in?"
"Betty, Jesus Christ! What if someone saw you?" Nicole yelled, grabbing Betty's arm and bringing her friend inside. "So, you're still..."
"Pregnant?" Betty said, rolling her eyes and putting her hands on her hips. Well, she tried to put them on her hips, but the new addition to her midsection meant that Betty's hands missed slightly and ended up cradling her pregnant orb from below.
"Hey, we don't know if you're pregnant yet," Nicole said quickly, trying to avoid the impossible scenario before her. Betty had suddenly become pregnant. And so did her mother. And now people were calling her pregnant too.
"Nicole, it's real," Betty said, moving her hands further around her belly. "I'm pregnant. I can feel the babies moving and kicking inside me. I...I know what this is." Betty sighed and looked down at her belly. "I guess it's maternal instinct."

Nicole held her friend's hand and guided her to the couch. "Hey, hey, it'll be ok," Nicole said with a weak smile. As she sat down on the couch, she took off her bathroom and loosened her towel some. Betty caught a glimpse of Nicole's stomach and looked up at her friend.
"Nicole?...why didn't you tell me that you were too?"
Nicole looked at Betty with a confused look. "What are you talking about?"
Betty pointed at Nicole's bulging stomach. "You're pregnant too?"
Nicole's face flushed. "No, I'm not pregnant! I just got a little fat, okay?" She was shaking all over. Betty put her hand on Nicole's shoulder.
"I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have said anything," Betty said, resting her head on her friend's shoulder. "Things have been crazy, I don't want to fight." Betty let out a sigh. "I don't have any other clothes. These are the stretchiest, baggiest things I own. And I have to go back to school pretty soon. I can't keep missing classes."
Nicole chuckled a little. "Well, I'd say you can use my mom's old maternity clothes but...I think she's using them now."
Betty looked up at Nicole. "Your mom's pregnant? But isn't she...old?"
Nicole rolled her eyes. "Yeah, no kidding she's old." She paused to decide whether she should tell Betty the full story and decided it was only fair to her. "Actually...the same thing happened to her that happened to you. I went home and she walked out like usual, and then she suddenly grew a big, pregnant belly."

Betty sat up straight with a concerned look. "R-really?"
Nicole nodded. "Yeah, except, she acted like she'd always been pregnant. It didn't just 'suddenly happen' from her point of view. And no one else was freaking out about it either. Everyone acted like she had been pregnant for a while now."
Betty looked at Nicole. "You think this is, like, contagious? That something's going around making people pregnant?"
Nicole shrugged. "I dunno, that sounds impossible."
Betty rubbed her belly in big circles. "So is this."
Nicole swallowed nervously. If this really is going around, I hope it doesn't get me next, she thought to herself. "Well...yeah. When's your appointment with the doctor to get everything checked out?"
Betty leaned back and puckered her lips in thought. "Tomorrow, actually." She turned to her friend. "W-would you come with me? I've never exactly gotten an ultrasound before and I hate hospitals."
Nicole smiled. "Of course, Betty babe." The two hugged closely, Nicole blushing as her new endowments were pressing against Betty's own breasts. Yep, definitely bigger, she thought to herself.

Nicole gave Betty a bulkier coat to hide her pregnance a bit better and waved her out the door and back to her own place. Nicole sighed and went to change, noticing her belly once again as she changed. "I guess I do look kind of pregnant," she muttered to herself. "I don't get how all this fat got here in such a sort time...I guess I just haven't been paying attention. Or maybe it's all the stress Daddy is putting on me."

Nicole put on her outfit and-
14533112112221111211112.title: It was Jenny

145331121122211112111122.content:
Nicole got a text from Jenny, letting her cousin know that she and her two sisters had arrived on campus. Nicole let out a sign and walked out the door. Much to her surprise, Jenny's car, a dazzling new Mercedes, was parked right in her own driveway. Jenny got out of the driver's seat and Rachel and Stacy came out of the other seats. Jenny waved to her cousin. "Hi Nicki! We thought it would be easier to come right here!"
Nicole faked a smile and a laugh, like always. "Great, now we can all just drive straight there."

Stacy and Jenny both walked over and gave Nicole a shallow hug. Nicole could tell that they both put on a little weight since yesterday. Jenny was still wearing her tight, bright outfit that showed off her curves so any extra pounds she put on were easier to see. It made sense that Stacy was a little bigger. After all, she'd announced that she was pregnant yesterday. But still, Nicole thought she was showing a little early. Maybe Stacy's been pregnant longer and only told us recently, Nicole thought, trying to remember what she looked like yesterday. Rachel walked over with less energy that usual and gave Nicole an even weaker hug than the other two. Rachel's gotten a little pudgier too, Nicole thought to herself. It must be that stomach bug that hit us all the past few days.

Nicole got into the passenger seat and the four Winters girls drove over to the nearby university. They parked in an already-crowded lot, with people coming from all over to hear the former governor speak. Nicole wasn't sure how good of a tour guide she'd be. She only went to the gym to work out and watch basketball games and to the nearby apartments and frat houses for parties and boys. But, Nicole had run through campus enough times to be able to show some things. The four walked around and Nicole was keenly aware that her three gorgeous cousins were taking away the attention she usually gets. Especially Jenny. A few guys even asked for her number, but she giggled and politely turned them down.

"Well, that's a nice self-esteem boost, that I'm still getting pick-up lines even when I put this weight on," Jenny laughed. "I might just be bloated, though. Nicole, you look like you've had the same bloating for a while!" Jenny and Stacy both giggled a little as Nicole's face flushed. She closed her sweatshirt a little more to try and cover the belly she was developing (and would continue to develop for the next seven days).
"I'm sure it'll go away in a few days," Nicole said in a hurried tone. "I work out all the time. I'm even going out with one of the guys from the gym."
All three cousins oooh'd at this. "A guy who spends that much time at the gym must be pretty cute," Stacy purred.
"He is," Nicole said, flashing her a malicious grin.
"Be careful or else you'll end up pregnant like me," Stacy said with a laugh, rubbing her relatively flat belly. Jenny laughed along with her, but Rachel turned her head away with a melancholy expression.

"Trust me, I'm not getting pregnant," Nicole said with a scoff. "I would hate that."
"Seeing your mom pregnant at her age probably doesn't help," Jenny said. "Although Aunt Lucille is carrying it pretty well. Especially with twins."
Stacy nodded and let out a sigh. "I hope I don't end up carrying twins. I go for an ultrasound tomorrow so I'll know the exact number in here." Stacy rolled up her shirt and padded her bare belly for emphasis. "Although I am pretty big for just two months..."
"I-I have to go to the bathroom, excuse me," Rachel said quickly, walking away quickly. Jenny and Stacy both looked at each other and shrugged.
"We might try to get some food now, Nicole," Stacy said. "I'm getting cravings."
"I'm pretty hungry too, but I wouldn't call it cravings," Jenny said with a laugh. "Are you coming?"

Nicole hesitated. "I'll meet up with you," she said. Nicole wanted any chance to get away from her bitchy cousins. All they were doing was making her feel miserable. Her two cousins shrugged again and walked off, still laughing and gossiping. Nicole wandered around the campus, going toward some buildings she actually recognized. On the way, a group of girls walked up to her, with one familiar girl at the front. "Oh my god, I didn't realize how big the baby bump would be up close."
Nicole looked over at the front girl with a scornful look. "Hello Claire."
Claire Reynolds smirked, with the rest of her sorority behind her. "Hi Nicole. So, planning on having a baby shower on the same day as your 21st birthday?"
Nicole fumed. "I'm not pregnant! I had a stomach virus and it gave me some bloating, okay?" Nicole smiled evilly. "But, since I've been going to the gym to work off the weight, I'm not dating one of the hottest guys on campus who works there." Nicole was embellishing a little, but that's the way the game is played.
Claire raised an eyebrow. "Oh really? He won't leave you when you try to pass this baby off as his?"
Nicole wanted to scream. "Stop telling people I'm pregnant! It's a really childish, shitty move, Claire!"
Claire chuckled again and started to walk away.

Flip me

What? Nicole thought, hearing the same mysterious voice again.

Get revenge. Flip me!

Nicole reached into her pocket and fished out the coin, watching Claire as she walked away. "Hey, come back here!" Nicole yelled, feeling that Claire needed to be close by for some reason. As she fumbled, Nicole dropped the coin on the ground. She bent down to pick it up and looked around, but Claire was gone in a sea of students. One guy carrying books hunched over and ran to barf in the middle of the quad, however.

Damn, she got away

Got away from what? Nicole wondered. As she walked back to the main building, she ran across Rachel. It was clear that she'd been crying some. "Rachel?"
"Oh...hi Nicole," Rachel said in an embarrassed voice.
"What's wrong?" Nicole had always felt that Rachel was the nicest out of the three sisters, maybe because she was the middle sibling.
Rachel let out a sigh. "Promise you won't tell anyone?"
Nicole nodded. Deep down, she wanted dirt and gossip and it sounded like Rachel had some. After all, she wasn't that much nicer than her sisters.
"Well...I'm pregnant," Rachel said. "Two months now."
"Oh," Nicole said, not finding the news as juicy as she'd hoped.
"But...the baby isn't Peter's."
"Oh!" Nicole said. This was big after all!
"So Stacy's constant talking about her own pregnancy and being happy with it...it's tough."
"I understand," Nicole said, trying to stifle a grin. Rachel wrapped her up in a big hug.
"Thanks Nicole. You're a great cousin." Rachel gave Nicole a little kiss on the forehead. "But it's getting pretty close to time for Jenny to set up. I should probably go over to her or else she and Stacy will get suspicious."

Rachel and Nicole walked over to the campus cafeteria where Jenny and Stacy had clearly polished off a massive meal. "Before you say anything," Stacy said with a smile. "Most of the eating was done by Jenny."
"That's not true!" Jenny lied with a grin. "I've just been feeling a little hungrier lately, but I'm not some kind of pig!" She turned to Nicole. "But I can use your campus gym after this, right?"
"Right," Nicole said with a fake smile. She had to hold back on this new Rachel news for when she really needed it.
The three sisters thanked her for the tour and went to the auditorium to help Jenny prepare for her news coverage and interviews. Nicole said goodbye to them and walked around campus some more, wondering how long she'd have to wait for a ride back and whether she should just brave walking to her house.

Then, Marcus jogged past her on the quad's perimeter. "Nicole! Hey!" he said with a laugh. "I tried to call you, but you never picked up."
"Sorry, I was with family and I wasn't paying attention," Nicole said with a giddy smile. Seeing Marcus cheered her right up, especially in his tight, sexy running clothes.
"I'm almost done with my run for the day. Want to get something to eat after?" He asked.
Nicole smirked and nodded. Take that, cousins, she thought, cackling to herself. Instead of working or dealing with pregnancy stuff, I'm going out with a hot guy.
145331121122211112111122.title: Went out to meet with her cousins

1453311211222111121111221.content:
"Alright, Nicole. Think you can keep up?" Marcus smirked. "For sure, I'll be right next to you." she replied with a grin, although she was nervous, considering her recent 'weight gain'. Marcus took off, much faster than Nicole had thought. She tried to run her normal speed, but it was seemingly impossible. She followed Marcus across the campus, and they ended up in the parking lot of a burger joint.

"Hey, sorry about that. You ready to eat?" he asked. "Yeah...yeah...let's go..." she huffed, trying to regain her breath, while her belly was grumbling. "Hopefully you won't take too much out of my paycheck, it looks like you're well fed." he chuckled, obviously referring to Nicole's rounding middle. She replied with a fake laugh.

Inside, Marcus ordered a burger and a salad, along with a bottle of water. Nicole, however, ordered two double cheeseburgers, fries, and a large shake. Marcus didn't even know how to reply to this event, and just watched Nicole eat. "So, Nicole, what were you doing on campus earlier today?" he asked, while Nicole finished munching.

"I was showing a few of my cousins around, but I'm really glad we ran into each other, I can't sta--"she said, before being interrupted by a light fluttering in her belly, like there were butterflies in her stomach. She gave her middle a slight rub, and thought nothing more of it.

"Nicole, you alright?" he asked. "Oh...yeah. I can't stand them, they're just really stuck up and selfish." she said, unaware of the irony in that statement. "I know the feeling." he said.

The two continued to talk for the next hour, telling each other about their families and other personal things, including the pregnancies surrounding Nicole. "For real, that's crazy. All of my cousins are guys, so I don't think they have to worry about that, unless they have a few baby mamas on the side." he joked. The two got up and approached the restaurant's exit.

Flip me, Nicole.

She grabbed the coin from her pocked, and gave it a flip, as she turned around to catch it, she caught sight of a frat boy. "Nice one." Marcus grinned. They exited the restaurant, oblivious to the pandemonium that was unfolding as the frat boy's stomach began ballooning out in front of him.

Marcus gave Nicole a ride home, and they soon arrived. "I had a really nice time, Nicole." Marcus said with a grin. "Yeah? Me too. We should do this again sometime." she replied. Marcus agreed, and gave her a goodnight kiss before Nicole walked into her house.

Nicole entered her bedroom and undressed. Her belly appeared a bit bigger than before, to her bemusement. She placed a hand on her rounding middle, and the light fluttering returned. "What the hell?" she asked herself, as the fluttering ceased. Nicole stifled a yawn, and lay down on her bed, which gave a small creak. She was asleep within minutes.
1453311211222111121111221.title: Nicole and Marcus' date

choices: Betty and Nicole cope with the news, go shopping for maternity clothes
Stacy and Rachel aren't the only family members at the office
14533112112221111211112212.content:
Nicole was rolling around in bed, moaning and grumbling. Finally, she opened her eyes, blinking a few times in the dark. "Mmgfh," she complained, reaching for her phone on the dresser drawer. 2:23 AM. "What the fuck," Nicole groaned. Why had she woken up this early? A rumble emanated from her stomach and she realized why. She was hungry.

Nicole slid out of bed and walked into her kitchen, rubbing her eyes and yawning. She reached down and opened the fridge, wincing as the light shown brightly through. But in the fridge's light, Nicole could see something else: her belly. There was no doubt about it now: Nicole looked absolutely pregnant. There was a wide and obvious curve that made her look at least seven months pregnant. Her belly button was now a little nub sticking out of her body. It was like one of those monitors you put in a turkey that pop out when the cooking is done. And boy did she look "done."

"This...this isn't just fat or gas," Nicole muttered to herself. "This has to be something else." Sure enough, Nicole felt more of the fluttering from yesterday. At first, it just felt like something ran across her belly, but then the tingling and moving sensation spread across the entire womb and the tickling was turning into pushing and moving. Like there's something in there...multiple somethings, Nicole thought. She was terrified but her hunger kept overtaking her. Nicole reached into the fridge and grabbed whatever leftovers were the closest and didn't require any preparation. Flipping on her bedside lamp, Nicole started eating in bed, rubbing her belly with one hand. "I really do look...pregnant now."

In no time, Nicole was able to polish off her late night meal and settled back into bed. Immediately, she realized it would be harder now with her bigger belly. When she tried to lay face down, her belly pressed uncomfortably against her. When she tried to lie on her back, her breasts, which swelled even more overnight, weighed too heavily on her (Nicole cursed getting those implants now). And lying on her side was too awkward and too heavy. In the end, Nicole used her pillow to prop up her back and sat sitting up and leaning against the bedpost. It was surprisingly comfortable and she drifted off to sleep, not realizing that she was cradling and rubbing her belly with her right hand.

Nicole woke up at a far more pleasant hour and stretched happily. More maternal hormones were flowing through her now which put Nicole in a better mood, even if she didn't realize it yet. She groaned as she got up, the t-shirt she slept in becoming increasingly cumbersome as she'd gotten bigger. "I might have to switch to just sleeping in my underwear," Nicole remarked to herself, rubbing her sensitive breasts. "Speaking of which: I need a bra that fits better now..."

Nicole had a breakfast that was just as vigorous as her fast food meal the night before and her late night snack that same morning. All throughout, she unconsciously rubbed her new belly, angrily groaning each time she caught herself. When she finished her breakfast and cried out after she noticed her belly rubbing again, she felt the kicking inside her again. "Quiet down, you!" Nicole yelled at her belly. "Wait, what am I saying? There's no one in my belly! I'm not pregnant! I can't be pregnant!" Nicole paused. "I-I mean...there's no way I could get this big this soon..." Nicole checked her phone and saw that Betty had texted her a reminder to drive her to the doctor's. "Maybe I should get an ultrasound while I'm there too..."

At Betty's, Nicole braced herself for the reaction she knew she would get when she opened the door. Betty waddled out, in her typical attire that didn't match her present condition at all. Her jaw dropped. "Nicole..."
Nicole sighed. "I know...weird, right? I'm going to get an ultrasound along with you, if you don't mind." Betty shook her head and wrapped Nicole up in a big hug, their swollen bellies pressing against one another.
"Oh, Nicole, I'm so sorry...what is happening to us?"
"I don't know, Betty, but hopefully the doctor can give us some answers." Nicole paused as Betty broke the hug. "And maybe afterwards, we can go buy some maternity clothes, huh? We'll probably both need them."

On the drive over, both friends didn't speak much. Betty mostly looked between the passing scenery and her own big belly. Finally, Nicole broke the silence. "What does it feel like when they kick and move?"
Betty shrugged. "It's hard to explain. It's just like something's rolling and swimming inside me. I can feel...them...separate from my own body." Betty looked over at Nicole with a little smile. It felt better to talk about these things, especially with her closest friend. "Why?"
"I think I'm getting the same thing," Nicole said softly, rubbing the side of her belly with one hand. "It's not very strong or anything, but there's definitely some...some movement."
Betty sighed and reached over to feel her friend's belly. "Yeah, I can feel a little something." Betty blushed. "Geez, I'm talking like some old lady midwife. I've only been pregnant for three days, what do I know?"
"A lot more than me," Nicole said as they pulled into the hospital parking lot.

Nicole sat patiently as Dr. Anderson ran the ultrasound wand over Betty's huge belly. Sure enough, there were two, distinguishable figures on the screen. "That's twins," the doctor said.
Betty let out a long sigh. It really did happen. One second she was as fit and flat as any other girl, the next, she was full term with twins. "How could this happen?" Betty asked. "I told you, I wasn't pregnant. Nicole can attest to that. Suddenly, boom, pregnant!"
Dr. Anderson shook his head. "It's a mystery, for sure. Sometimes pregnancies can be atypical and not really show up. Maybe you were already pregnant and it suddenly slipped into place so it was visible."
"But I didn't have any symptoms. I've had my period!" Betty protested. The doctor just shrugged and shook his head again.
"Like I said, it's a mystery, but pregnancy is a mysterious process medicine still doesn't fully understand."
"Well...alright, thank you for letting me know, doctor. And you won't tell my parents yet, right?" Betty said, raising one eyebrow. Dr. Anderson smiled and winked. "Okay. Now, my friend Nicole thinks she's having the same thing happen to her as me. Nic...Nicole?"

Nicole got stage fright and left the doctor's room. It really happened. Betty was pregnant. Which means she could be pregnant too. Sudden, unexplained pregnancy. What was the world coming to? If Nicole really was pregnant, she didn't want to know about it. She walked down the halls of the OB/GYN office before running into a familiar face. "Nicole?"
"Stacy?" Nicole said. One of the three worst people to run into. Well, add her mother for four. "What are you doing here?"
"Pregnant, remember?" Stacy giggled, pointing to her own belly. It was bigger than yesterday, looking like a little potbelly. "And I just got the big news: triplets! Can you believe it? I really outclassed Aunt Lucille."
"Y-yeah," Nicole said, feeling dizzy. Triplets?
"Hey, why are you here anyway?" Stacy asked, before looking down at Nicole's own belly. "Oh my god." Stacy could hardly hide her smile. "Are you-"
"Don't," Nicole said, pointing her finger angrily at her cousin. She gulped. "Don't tell anybody, okay? Please? I'll do it on my...own time."
"Alright," Stacy said with a smile, walking past her cousin with a gorgeous pregnant gait. "Congratulations, by the way."

Nicole screamed silently and hustled back to Dr. Anderson's as quickly as her big belly would let her. She had to know for sure now, lest Stacy spread rumors. On the way, she ran into another family member. "Rachel?"
"Nicole?" Rachel said, looking as scared as Nicole. "I-I was just hear to check on...well, you know." Nicole couldn't believe it. Rachel looked as big as Nicole did yesterday! "And the news just keeps getting better and better...it's quadruplets."
Nicole's jaw dropped. "R-really?"
"Yeah," Rachel said nervously, rubbing her own little belly before noticing Nicole's. "Wait...are you-"
"I won't tell anyone about you, now do the same for me," Nicole said, waddling back toward Dr. Anderson's.

Back in the office, Nicole was breathing nervously, holding Betty's hand as the doctor applied the wand. "It's alright to be nervous. I get lots of patients like that all the time."
Probably not too many like Betty and me, Nicole thought as the image came on screen.
"Well...huh, that's unusual but...you're definitely pregnant," Dr. Anderson said. Nicole's heart sank. How could she be pregnant? Just days before her 21st birthday, no less.
"Wait, what's the unusual part?" Betty asked. Nicole looked at her and then back at the doctor.
"Well...you're about four months pregnant so it might be a little hard to tell at this point but it looks like quadruplets."

Nicole could only stammer out one word. "What?"
14533112112221111211112212.title: The big news (Nicole: Day Four/Cousins: Day Three)

choices: It was her father, reminding her that her interviews were in a few hours
It was her cousin Rachel, she needed a shoulder to cry on
145331121122211112111122121.content:
"W-what?" Nicole couldn't believe what she had heard.

"Quad-quadruplets?"

"Yes, that’s correct. I’m seeing four heartbeats here." The doctor said, still running the wand over Nicole's belly.

I can't believe it Nicole turned her head away from the screen, gazing over the back of the doctor. Tears began to form in the corners of her eyes, Nicole trying to blink them away. She found herself looking in the mirror on the other side of the room.

What am I going to do?

Flip me

Obediently, the hand not grasping Betty’s pulled the coin out of her pocket, flipping it and catching it in one motion. Unbeknownst to her, the coin landed heads. Quietly, her belly grew underneath Dr. Anderson's hand. Bigger and bigger until she was almost as big as Betty. Her breasts swelled in her already undersized shirt, the seams beginning to split.

"Oh!" Dr. Anderson exclaimed, "Five, six...seven! Seven, not four" His wand sped over previously non-existent belly.

"S-seven?" Nicole whispered. She looked back at Betty, whose face had dropped "I-I thought you said four."

"Oh I did, but it looks like the others were hiding behind each other. This tends to happen with pregnancies that have a high number of fetuses."

Nicole was speechless. She looked over her huge belly, and realized she was only going to get bigger.

"I am a little disappointed, Nicole. You too, Betty." Dr. Anderson said, turning off the ultrasound machine and handing her some paper towels, "You two should have known to come in earlier, getting as big as you are."

"I-I guess I wasn't thinking clearly." Nicole began wiping the gel off of her expanded stomach

I guess I could have come in yesterday, that would have been the only time I could have come in earlier. Was I this big this morning? Her hands felt puny as she rubbed the rest of the gel off herself.

“Yeah, I just kind of blew up.” Betty chimed in.

"You’re just lucky that there are no complications yet. I want you both in here again at the end of the week.” The doctor stripped his gloves off and walked towards the door. “Oh, and congratulations."

Just in time for my party…

"Betty" Nicole got off of the table and stood, feeling her belly settle into her pelvis, "what are we going to do?"

Betty stared at Nicole’s belly for a moment before closing her eyes and taking a deep breath "We're going to take a moment, step out that door and do what we do best. Shop."

In spite of herself, Nicole grinned. Then she smiled. Then she let out a laugh.

"Shop? You want to shop, now? Like this?" Nicole thrust out her belly.

"Well, I know I don't have any clothes that fit. And from the looks of things, neither do you." Nicole turned around to face the mirror again. Her belly was totally uncovered. A giant tan oval, it stuck out over a foot from her body. Her breasts were crammed into her tiny t-shirt, the seams threatening to burst at any moment. Any slack in her sweatpants had gone out the door, ass and hips straining against the cotton.

I look...hot

After a few moments hesitation, Nicole squeaked out, "Yeah...let's go shopping." The two waddled out to Nicole's car, Nicole noticing a disturbing amount of symmetry between their bellies. She squeezed into the driver's seat, pushing the chair back as far as it would go.

I don't remember being this cramped on the way over...

As the pair arrived at the mall, Nicole began to question how well-thought out their plan actually was.

"Betty, I'm not so sure I want to go outside right now."

"Why not? You're going to let me go in there and get judged alone? You can't keep denying this forever." Betty rubbed the side of Nicole's vast womb. She didn't notice Nicole's blush at her touch.

"Come on, we'll do this together. Two babes who just happened to get knocked up in the last week." With that, Betty swung herself out of the car.

The pair waddled into the mall. Immediately, every eye was upon them. Eyes were drawn to them like pendulum swaying from side to side. Nicole cast a glance behind to see a fair few just as captured by her departure. She grinned.

I do look hot.

Onlookers found Nicole’s hips swaying just a little bit more as the pair made their way to "The Baby Bump"

Well that’s…appropriate. Nicole mused, rubbing the side of her belly. The two girls made their way to the back of the store.

“Now, I don’t see why they would put the stuff for the biggest girls in the back. It’s just inconsiderate to make us walk all that way.” Betty complained, a light sheen of perspiration forming on her stomach. The two found the selection to be surprisingly diverse, plenty of options for the growing girls. Nicole’s fears were founded when she discovered that everything Betty could fit into, fit Nicole almost as well. Except for the chest. Once Nicole took off her tiny shirt, there was no getting it back on. Even without the implants they would have been huge. Now, she was flying down the alphabet.

Nicole walked out of the changing room, feeling much more comfortable in her new purchases, until someone grabbed her from behind.

“32I? How did you even find one in your size?” Betty released Nicole, who stuffed the tag back into her shirt.

“You’re one to talk, you’re only a few sizes behind.” Nicole tried to cross her arms over her new bust to pout.

Betty laughed, her own sizeable bust bouncing, “Come on, let’s go. We’ve been here for hours.” The two girls checked out with their numerous purchases, each paying with a parent’s credit card. Nicole had to admit, she looked good. The dress she chose to wear out was completely form-fitting, showing off her newly acquired curves and huge belly. Momentarily forgotten was nature of her impregnation, the eventual confrontation with her parents, not to mention the interview that was scheduled to take place.

“You know, Betty, I think we're the only girls on Earth who could look this good after getting this pregnant a few days ago.” She looked over to see Betty smiling.

“I think I could t-“

Betty stopped mid-sentence, interrupted by the ringing on Nicole's phone.

"Hello?"
145331121122211112111122121.title: Shopping for Seven (N:D4/C:D3)

1453311211222111121111221212.content:
"H-Hey N-Nicole?" A shaky voice answered Nicole back.

"Rachel?" Nicole responded back in a confused manner. Her cousin sounded as if she was having to hold back tears judging from the tone of her voice and the occasional sniffle she heard on the other end. What the hell is wrong with her? Nicole wondered, and if something is wrong how come she's calling me of all people? Indeed, Nicole knew it was no secret that she and cousins had never gotten along very well, and it showed a lot in the way they spoke to each other. Heck it's probably half the reason mom invites them over so much, Nicole thought snidely. However, Nicole decided to bite the bullet and see where this was going.

"O-Oh Nicole thank God you picked up!" Rachel gave an audible sigh of relief after hearing Nicole answer, before reverting back to her shaky tone of voice, "I was worried that you wouldn't pick up..."

She was looking for me specifically? Okay now I know something must really be up... Nicole thought, obviously baffled by her cousin's words. "Rachel what's wrong? Is everything all right?"

"Um...not really...I-I..." Nicole was a bit annoyed by the fact that her cousin wasn't just spitting out what she wanted already, and she dearly wanted to voice her irritation, but with a frustrated sigh she calmed herself to at least keep entertaining the conversation.

"Rachel? What is it?" She asked pointedly, hoping the straightforward approach would work best so she could get her cousin out of her hair.

"Look...can you...can we talk somewhere privately right now? I-I just...need someone to talk to..." Her cousin responded, sounding like she was about to burst into tears again. "C-can I come over to your place in a l-little bit?" Nicole groaned inwardly at this since she had planned on spending the day with Betty and sorting out this pregnancy business as best she could, but it looked like she was going to have to put a hold on those plans since from the sound of her cousin this talk was obviously something that shouldn't be dismissed.

"I guess...come by in half an hour while I get back to the house."

"T-Thanks, I'll b-be there." Her cousin said as Nicole heard her hang up. However, what surprised Nicole was the fact that her cousin had said it in a tone that Nicole had never heard them use towards her before: gratitude.

"Nicole? What's up?" Nicole was snapped out of her thoughts as she realized that Betty didn't know what had just happened.

"Oh, that was Rachel." She told her as Betty's eyebrows furrowed in recognition.

"Rachel? Your cousin? What did she want?"

"Not really sure," Nicole shrugged, "she just told me that she needed someone to talk to really badly."

"And she decided to call you, the person that she and your other cousins get along with the least, to talk to?" Betty asked incredulously.

"I know right? I guess it must be pretty bad then, so I guess we're gonna have to cut this trip short..." Nicole whined with a pout as she looked longingly all the stores that she didn't get to shop at yet.

"Well maybe another day then." Betty said as she hit her friend's shoulder playfully to snap her out of it. "Besides, maybe this is your chance to bond and have at least one cousin you can call a friend."

"Psh...friends? With my cousins?" Nicole asked in mock horror, "what is this the apocalypse?" Both of the girls giggled at the joke before Nicole placed a hand under her chin thoughtfully, I guess it would be kind of nice to not hate at least Rachel though...

After that, the girls grabbed ahold of their acquired purchases and waddled as fast as they could back to their car. After placing the clothes they had bought, or rather their parents's credit cards had bought, in the trunk, Nicole once again settled herself into the driver's seat of the car. For the second time today she felt the tip of her belly rubbing lightly against the steering wheel and looked back to see if the seat was already pushed back, and indeed it was. She looked over to Betty, who's belly seemed to mirror her own in size shape, at least for now.

"You alright Nicole?" Betty asked, raising an eyebrow curiously at her friend's pause.

"Betty..." Nicole hesitated briefly before going on, "do I look...bigger than before?"

"Well Nicole," Betty gave her a playful grin, "you've got like seven kids stuffed in that thing so-"

"That's not what I meant!" Nicole yelled, but couldn't suppress the grin from spreading across her face, "I meant like...I don't know...like before we went for the ultrasounds..." She trailed off as her friend's grin faded and turned into a thoughtful look.

"Well..." Betty said hesitantly, "I'm pretty sure you were always that big right? I mean we woke up this morning and you were about the same size as me right?" She asked more to herself than to Nicole.

"Yeah...I mean...I sure feel like I've always been this big..." Nicole placed her hands and felt the taut skin of her belly, the light reflecting off the sweat that had come from the strain of carrying all seven of her children throughout the mall. She felt Betty place a reassuring hand on her shoulder.

"Hey come on Nicky," She said with a look of assurance, "don't think too hard on it you know? This whole thing's been pretty crazy so I wouldn't be surprised if our memories are a little fuzzy with all that's been going on. Besides, it's not like your belly grew while you were having the ultrasound or something."

"I guess..." Nicole shook her head. She still wasn't sure that she'd been this big at the start of the day, but common sense told her that it was impossible for that to have been true. Well, not like this situation isn't impossible already. She thought absentmindedly as she started up her car and prepared to drive home.

The car ride to Betty's house was pretty uneventful as the two friend talked about their purchases and lamented at how they weren't able to buy more. After only a few minutes of idle chit-chat they arrived at Betty's house, and Nicole helped her put away the clothes she had bought before bidding her friend goodbye and settling back into her car for the drive home, which wasn't long as she didn't live too far from Betty's house anyways, and before long she had gotten home and stowed away her own ensembles in her closet while changing into a light purple long sleeve shirt which managed to cover all of her belly quite nicely, and a comfortable pair of black sweatpants that fit her just right.

Sighing in contentment, she went to lay down on the couch and prepared to wait for her cousin's arrival.

A little while later, the doorbell rang and Nicole heaved herself upright before yawning and arching her back to stretch. After a few moments of waking herself up she waddled over and opened the door and saw that it was...
1453311211222111121111221212.title: It was her cousin Rachel, she needed a shoulder...

14533112112221111211112212121.content:
Nicole opened the door with another yawn, as she was still a bit sleepy from the little nap that she'd taken earlier on the sofa. However, she woke right up as she found a sobbing Rachel almost tackle her full force, which almost made her lose her balance, but luckily the added weight of her belly, breasts, thighs, and rear were able to keep her standing.

"Uh...Rachel? Wha-" Was all a bewildered Nicole had time to utter before her cousin stopped sobbing and began to outright bawl. However, due to Rachel being too busy crying over who knows what, Nicole found her cousin burying her tear-stained face into her quite sizeable bust, which had only grown even larger since her pregnancy had started. Turning a shade of crimson as she bit her lip to keep herself from moaning, her breasts were quite sensitive to even the smallest touch after all, she found herself awkwardly rubbing Rachel's back in a lame attempt to calm her down.

After about half a minute of this Nicole realized that this was getting them nowhere and pulled Rachel's face out of her cleavage and tried to get her attention.

"O-oh Nicole, it's h-horrible!" She wailed. Nicole rolled her eyes as she desperately wanted to make some sort of sarcastic remark, but held her tongue as she knew that acting like she usually would to her cousin's probably wouldn't help the situation at all.

"Shh..." Nicole nervously wrapped an arm around her cousin and tried to quiet her down, "come on Rachel it's ok..."

"N-no it's not..." Her cousin whimpered as she continued to sob into her hands. Nicole shook her head and sighed at this before figuring that the couch would be the best place to talk, and so after a bit of coaxing she managed to lead her cousin over to the couch, where she set her cousin down in an abrupt manner before sighing in relief as she sat down beside her, feeling the strain of carrying the weight of seven children being temporarily lifted off of her legs.

"Rachel?" Nicole tried to snap her cousin out of her crying fit, but the attempt proved fruitless as her cousin continued to weep. Sighing in frustration, Nicole opted to make herself comfortable and sit back on the couch while keeping one hand to rub her cousin's back, while she absentmindedly repeated reassuring phrases such as "there there," and "that's it, let it all out," while the other hand she used to explore her what looked to be full term with twins belly. However, since it was filled with seven, she found that even though her's and Betty's bellies were around the same size, there was barely any of the movement in her womb unlike the soccer match that she had felt going inside her best friend's abdomen. She felt the occasional light flutter of a kick here and there, and found that even though she had wished that this pregnancy was nothing more than a dream, she felt strangely giddy and even excited at feeling her unborn children move around inside of her.

After a few minutes of feeling her brood move around a bit, she noticed that Rachel's sobs had began to peter out, and she looked over to find her cousin wiping her eyes, and while she was sniffling a few times here and there, for the most part she seemed to actually be in a condition to talk now.

Though I would have preferred her to cry on something other than my new shirt... Nicole thought, a little irritated as she looked down at her shirt to find the wet-spots that signified the places where her cousin's tears had stained. She pulled her mind away from this train though and figured that maybe now her cousin would be able to respond.

"Thanks Nicole..." Her cousin sniffed and wiped her eyes to dry them, "I really needed a good cry like that, and I'm glad you were willing to let me come over and do that..." She finished before giving what must have been the first genuine smile that Nicole had ever received from one of her cousins, or at least one that didn't give off the impression that they were plotting something against her.

"U-Uh...no problem I guess?" Nicole stuttered. Is she actually...thanking me? Nicole shrugged inwardly, huh...first time for everything I guess. "But what in the world had you so broken up Rachel? I mean-" Nicole stopped as she remembered how earlier in the day, before she and Betty had gone in for their ultrasounds, she had briefly talked to Rachel before going in, and had found out that Rachel was pregnant with quadruplets. "-oh...wait this about what happened today isn't it?"

"Y-yeah." Rachel nodded sadly as she confirmed Nicole's suspicions. "I-I just don't know what to do...I mean I always wanted to have kids one day...but now, and so suddenly? What will my boyfriend say? Oh God what will my parents, or aunt Lucy and uncle Roger think?!?" She yelled as her lip quivered, and Nicole couldn't help but feel a great deal of sympathy towards her cousin as she remembered that she'd felt the same way when the signs of her pregnancy had started showing up.

"Hey, c'mere Rach..." Scooting over towards her cousin, Nicole wrapped Rachel in a comforting hug that actually felt as if for the first time that they weren't mortal enemies, or glorified strangers. Rather, as Rachel wrapped her arms around Nicole in return while letting out a few light sobs, they felt that for the first time, they were actually family. "I mean come on, I know how you feel to be honest." Nicole confessed, turning to her cousin after they had broken the hug.

"R-really?" Rachel looked up in astonishment at Nicole, who smiled warmly back at her.

"Yup, I definitely know the feeling, though of course on me it shows way more than it does on you," Nicole giggled as she patted her belly for emphasis, and

"O-Oh my God! Nicole!" Rachel gasped as she realized that this entire time she had been unaware of her cousin's belly, which in comparison to her own, made her look absolutely tiny. "You're huge!" She added in shock as she placed a hand on top Nicole's own growing middle.

"Oh thanks!" Nicole snidely remarked with a frown.

"Eep!" Her cousin turned a bright red as she realized what she'd just said. "I didn't mean-" her hasty attempt to correct herself was cut off by a laugh from Nicole.

"Aw Rachel lighten up!" Nicole said with a proud smirk at having fooled her cousin, "I know I'm pretty huge, though it's to be expected with how many I have inside here..."

"Oh really?" This piqued Rachel's interest. "How many are you having?"

Brace yourself cous...cause you ain't got nothing on me right now... Nicole sighed inwardly as she spoke, "I'm having seven."

"SEVEN???" Nicole snickered to herself as she saw Rachel's eyes practically bugging out at the news. "And here I thought I was having the worst luck with just four!"

"Yup..." Nicole chuckled, "and the worst part is nobody knows except me, you, and Betty."

"Not even your parents?"

"Are you kidding? I'm still trying to figure out how to even tell them! I know they'll probably kill me though!" Nicole huffed and hit her head lightly against the back cushion of the couch in irritation at the mention of her parents. Though at this point they could probably figure it out by just looking at me... she thought gloomily as she placed both hands on the top of her swollen womb.

"Yeah...no kidding..." Rachel agreed. "My parents would probably do the same, or even worse, and I'm not even having as many as you are!"

"Well I guess with a mom and dad it's not about how many you have, but just that you're having one that counts in their minds." Nicole remarked as the two shared a laugh that soon faded into a comfortable silence.

"Nicole?" Rachel asked, breaking the barrier as her cousin turned her head back towards her.

"Yeah Rach?"

"What are we gonna do...about both of our parents I mean..."

"Not really sure if there's really anything to do but tell them. I mean sure they'll be mad but they have to calm down eventually right?" Nicole reached over and squeezed her cousin's hand reassuringly. "But whatever happens at least we both know we have someone that knows what we're going through right?

"I guess..." Rachel trailed off, before giving her cousin a warm smile, "thanks Rachel..." and stopped talking as she once again welcomed silence for the both of them. After a while of enjoying the unusually calm atmosphere between themselves Rachel finally got up and walked over to the door. "Well, guess I'm gonna head out then..."

"Alrighty then..." Nicole said quietly, as she actually felt sad for once that her cousin was leaving. "See ya later Rachel..."

"See ya Nicole..." Rachel responded in an equally quiet manner, before turning to head out the door. Right before she left however, she turned back one last time. "Nicole?"

"Yeah Rachel?"

"I just wanted to say, that even though I don't like this pregnancy happening to me, that I'm glad that it was able to make us behave like actual cousin's for once." She said beaming.

"You know...strangely enough I feel the same way Rachel." Nicole agreed as she returned an equally joyful grin.

"Worth it?" Her cousin asked with a smirk.

"Well we'll see how much it hurts going into labor and then I'll tell you." Nicole joked as the both of them gave a hearty chuckle before Rachel finally left. After hearing the door shut Nicole gave a tired, yet happy sigh as she lay on her side, leaving her belly to jut out a good foot from the edge of the couch as she made the furniture her temporary bed. Guess you were right Betty... she thought with a soft smile after closing her eyes, I guess this pregnancy business really was good for something after all... Nicole let her thoughts drift away before giving one last yawn before finally falling asleep.

After a while...
14533112112221111211112212121.title: Rachel! Her cousin!

145331121122211112111122121211.content:
Morning came, and the sun heralded its arrival by peeking in through the blinds in Nicole's living room. Unfortunately for her, since she had chosen to fall asleep on the couch after yesterday's events, she ended up getting a rude awakening via a face-full of sunlight.

"Mmph...seriously?" She mumbled groggily to herself as she winced as she felt the ray of warmth assault her visage, "bad idea to sleep on the couch I guess..." Annoyed by the sun's intrusion upon her sleep, she pulled her arms over her face to block it, which managed to keep the blinding ball of light from her eyes much to her satisfaction. However, seconds later an audible growl came from her midsection, making her give a sigh of defeat as she felt an immense pang of hunger wash over her which she knew meant that she needed food ASAP!

At that point she decided to give up on the idea of sleep altogether and gave a petite yawn before heaving herself up. However, she kept her eyes closed in a vain attempt to at least pretend that she was still peacefully asleep. Curiously, she noticed that for some reason she felt a lot more...heavy and lethargic this morning. Huh...I guess that trip to the doctor's and the mall really took a lot out of me... She mused as she got up to go get herself some breakfast, only for her to find that the task of getting up off the couch had significantly risen in difficulty from yesterday evening as she found herself falling backwards onto the couch after only getting halfway off the couch. This brought enough of a wake up call to her that something was definitely off.

Nicole opened her eyes hesitantly, and upon seeing what was in front of her, let out a gasp of horror and felt her eyes shoot open in shock at the sight that met them.

She had thought that she was huge the day before, and was accurate in saying that since her belly's size was akin to that of a woman that was carrying twins at full term, a.k.a Betty. The enormous tan oval that made up her midsection however, put her size yesterday to shame. The light purple long-sleeve that she'd picked out yesterday that had kept all of her pregnant form hidden did nothing to stop the display of her gravid middle now, having ridden all the way up until it had hit her breasts, which thankfully seemed to have retained their size, though Nicole did notice that they felt oddly heavy today. She noted with dismay that her sweatpants a good deal tighter and knew that her butt had grown as well as she felt the cool air of the living room brushing the top of her cheeks.

"Alright...calm down Nicole..." She whispered shakily to herself, "just get yourself to the bathroom and look in the mirror, and see if it's really as bad as it looks..." She took a couple of deep breaths to calm her nerves before trying to get up. This took a lot of effort however as she felt that her weight had increased a fair amount and almost lost her balance a couple of times. Eventually though, she managed to stand upright, arching her back to stretch as she felt it tense up at the amount of pregnant weight it was supporting.

As Nicole started down the hall, she noticed that her pregnant gait had become even more pronounced, and slower than yesterday. Oh God I can barely move like this! She thought panicking, No! No...just focus on getting to the bathroom... she steeled herself and continued down the hall, noticing that even such a short walk through her house was tiring to her as perspiration began to form on her brow and belly. By the time she had reached the bathroom her leg muscles were crying out for rest as she puffed tiredly into her destination, leaning back on the counter as she gulped down air in order to catch her breath. After a few minutes of regaining her composure, she turned and faced the mirror, hoping that somehow she wasn't as big as she felt, only for that hope to be instantly snuffed out as she fought back a scream at the sight of her reflection.

Her belly had definitely hit a growth spurt, as she figured it had almost doubled in size, now starting to grow up and to the sides as well as outward, her belly button popped out like the peak atop a mountain. She also found that her assumption about the growth of her derriere was true as well as she saw that the black sweatpants were now taut and had even ridden down some, giving the world quite the inviting view of her backside. She stood there in shock for what felt like hours as a multitude of thoughts ran through her head. Among them were inquiries of "how could I possibly have gotten so big overnight," and "how big am I even going to get?" To her surprise though, one thought came to the forefront of her mind above all else:

"I am unbelievably...hot," she gasped as she admired her pregnant form. She couldn't believe how amazing it was! Her huge, swollen breasts, her great, heaving, pregnant belly, her voluptuous and tantalizing rear! She found her new gravid form to be absolutely sexy and blushed a hue of red that would outrank even the ripest of tomatoes at the thoughts she was having about herself.

However, she was interrupted from her admiration by a new sensation. It left as quickly as it came, and she might have missed it had she not felt it come and go so suddenly. She froze and waited to see if it would come again, keeping her eye on the mirror just in case. Sure enough, a few seconds later she felt something push out lightly on the top of the vast expanse of belly while seeing a visible indent in her skin rise up. She felt her breath catch and watched as it lingered a bit and even moved down and to the left a bit before receding back into her womb. Immediately, whether it was up to intuition or the maternal hormones, she knew what was going on and felt tears of joy begin to well up into her eyes as she realized that her children were beginning to kick. "I really am pregnant aren't I?" She whispered to herself as a huge smile began to form on her face, and as she felt as well as saw her children kick and move more and more she found herself caressing her belly in an almost motherly fashion, rubbing gently in each and every place that she felt her seven children kick.

However, this state of maternal bliss didn't last long as after a few minutes Nicole heard a knock at the door. After sighing dreamily at the happiness she was feeling from that session, she wondered in confusion who would be visiting her right now. Of course, she groaned tiredly as she knew that answering the door meant having to walk all the way back to the living room, but knew that she'd have to move at some point and set off slowly waddling back to the living room. After a minute or two of carefully making her way there, she rested for a couple of seconds while still hearing the knock at the door.

"Alright hang on! Geez..." she sighed in exasperation before opening the door, only to find none other than..."
