145331121122211112111122122.content:
"There they are, two perfectly developed fetuses," the doctor, Kristin Harper, said, pointing to the screen. Lucille Winters smiled, looking over at the display. Dr. Harper smiled back. "I just love when older moms-to-be come in and I get to give them the good news of a healthy pregnancy." She chuckled. "Although, you look like you could be in your 20s, Mrs. Winters."
Lucille gave her a little smile that said "I know" and looked back at the screen. Twins in her 40s. She could still hardly believe it. But so far, everything was going well. No abnormal symptoms. No excess fat where it wasn't wanted. Nothing but a textbook twin pregnancy. Although, she doubted most women would look as good as she did at this stage in her pregnancy, even if they were twenty years younger than her.
"Wow, aunt Lucille, that's so amazing!" Jenny gelled, looking at the sonogram images. Lucille nodded and looked on. "And you said it's a boy and a girl?"
"That's what this doctor tells me," Lucille said dryly. Dr. Harper forced a little grin. Lucille might have been one of her most fascinating patients so far (no one carried a pregnancy this well, especially in the 40s!) but she was also her rudest. She had a very smug attitude, like all of these medical procedures were just a formality and she could do all of this on her own. Lucille actually did say at one appointment: "My body works fine. I know what will happen. I'm here at my husband's insistence." Dr. Harper remembered it with a grimace. Well won't you just make a lovely mother.

When the check-up was done, Lucille wiped her gel off of her belly with a towel - a proper towel, one she brought herself. Not that paper garbage the doctor had. Jenny waited patiently with a smile for her aunt to slowly get down from the inspection table. Jenny thanked Dr. Harper for her aunt and the two walked back down the hall, just missing Nicole and Rachel. "That was great! I've seen an ultrasound up close before!"
"Hmm, I suppose it was interesting the first time I had one," Lucille said, pursing her lips in thought. "Oh well. It's nice to hear more confirmation that everything's healthy." Lucille started rubbing the front of her belly. "And thank you again for driving me. Uncle Roger was in meetings all day and frankly he's seen enough of these to last him a lifetime."
"I see," Jenny said, wondering if her uncle was really aware that his wife was having ultrasounds without him. "Well, I was happy to take you! You're my favorite aunt after all."
"Because I'm your only aunt. Funny as always," Lucille mused, pressing the down button on the elevator.

In truth, Jenny was trying to get money out of her aunt. She had an easier time bonding with her aunt than her uncle and a few mentions of how much better she was doing than Nicole always buttered Lucille up. While Jenny was doing quite well at her job, her own parents had rewarded this hard work by cutting their daughter off. Unfortunately, Jenny had become accustomed to a certain quality of life she wanted to maintain. "So, Aunt Lucille, did you watch my reporting on the local news last night?"
"Mmm?" Lucille said, looking up from her phone at her niece.
"I-I said did you get to see my reporting on TV last night? For the governor's speech?"
"Ah, no. This makes me a little tired, dear," Lucille said, rubbing her wide belly. "But I have it on DVR. Uncle Roger and I will watch it later. His company donated a bit when the governor was first running."

There was her in. "Really? Do you both donate a lot to campaigns?"
Lucille put her phone back in her purse. "Hmm, every now and then. Uncle Roger likes to keep his name out there, support what he likes in people."
"So, would you consider investing a little in me?" Jenny said with a small grin. "I'm working on getting some bigger interviews for the station, but it'll require some more upscale outfits."
"Well, your parents-"
"My parents are very supportive, but not with money. They don't understand that good clothes are the way the game is played now, Aunt Lucille."
"Well, that's the truth. Looks can get you so far," Lucille said, getting her phone back out and taping it a few times. "I just sent myself a reminder. I'll get something deposited directly into your back account."
"Thank you, Aunt Lucille! You made a great investment in my future," Jenny smiled. "My cousins are going to have such a great mother." Lucille flashed her an annoyed look. Jenny clammed up. Too far on that one, Jenny thought.

"Speaking of the importance of looks...Jenny dear, you really need to go on a diet or get some sort of exercise," Lucille said, looking down at Jenny's pot belly. Jenny tried to conceal it with two layers of sweaters, but it didn't do a great deal of good.
"I-I know. I've been exercising more but it might be a symptom of the nausea," Jenny said to try and explain it.
"Well, keep up the good work," Lucille smiled. "You've always been a beautiful girl. You remind me a lot of myself." They shared a tight hug, with Lucille's belly and breasts pressed tightly against her niece. "Now, just take me home, please."

Lucille continued to fiddle with her phone as Jenny drove, a worried look on her face. She knew, of course, that she'd put on weight yesterday, but to have gained this much the next day? That was really odd. She didn't have to be on camera today, but tomorrow she would and it would be obvious. And Jenny's breasts were getting larger too. Her creepy director would definitely point that out and start drawing attention to her. They might stick me in weather, Jenny shuddered. But no! I'm going to be a real star! The front desk is for me!

Jenny dropped her aunt off and waved, driving back to her own apartment. She wanted to go to the gym again, but she had to at least rehearse for the next broadcast. If she came in looking like she did AND was unprepared, she would get skewered. After going over papers and papers and eating a very...strange dinner (where was that craving coming from? Jenny wondered to herself), Jenny put on some skimpier clothes and headed out the door. "The best exercise is partying, isn't it?" She mused to herself. "Let's see what I can do tonight."
145331121122211112111122122.title: Family Gatherings

choices: Nicole and Betty shop, blissfully unaware of any of this
1453311211222111121111221221.content:
Jenny headed out the door and into her glitzy car, speeding off to the downtown area. She strutted toward her favorite club, the Four-Sevens, and waited in line with the other club-goers. Even just in line, Jenny got plenty of interested looks, which she responded to with pearly grins. In truth, Jenny wasn't all that different from Nicole. She was just as vain and attention-obsessed. But Jenny prided herself in better, natural looks, skills and an attitude that made her more successful, and a more mature personality. After all, while Nicole might go to the nearest fraternity party, Jenny was getting into one of the city's hottest clubs.

The bouncer let her in without a moment's hesitation and Jenny preened into the club. The music was blaring what sounded like an original remix of Swedish House Mafia and the strobes were pulsing at just the right brightness and frequency. Jenny surveyed the room and gracefully danced into the center. It didn't take long to find a handsome guy that she made enough eye contact with and the two were back-to-front, Jenny rubbing her ass against his hardening lap. She didn't quite notice it, but her hips had gotten wider and her rear had gotten plumper over the past few days. Of course, even if she noticed it, Jenny would never have guessed why it was happening.

After she found a guy who she had suitable chemistry with, the two made their way to one of the couches on the peripherals of the dance floor and started to kiss sloppily. The guy moved one hand to Jenny's buxom chest, which made her chuckle in between kisses and hold his wrist, pushing his hand down her side.

"Nuh-uh, not yet, buddy," Jenny smiled, looking into his eyes. "I don't even know your name yet."
"It's Ro...wait," the guy said, looking down at his hand, his thumb resting on Jenny's slightly swollen middle. "Are you trying to find a new baby daddy?"
"What are you talking about?" Jenny said.
"What do I mean? You're pregnant, aren't you? I know the signs. Look, I've already got one kid. I don't need-" It was too late. Jenny gave the guy a strong slap to the face and was back in the center of the club, gyrating in an even more sultry manner on another guy.

The pattern continued the same as before: Jenny moved from guy to guy, rubbing and dancing until she found someone she had a good vibe with. They moved to the couches and made out, but this time the guy waited to move ahead a few bases. After a while, the two looked in each other's eyes lustily, each waiting for the other to make a move.
"Can I buy you a drink?" the new guy asked.
Jenny thought about it. She had one of her longer work days tomorrow and she started early. If she started drinking now, she'd definitely be a wreck in the morning. "No thanks, cutie. I'd better not."
"Oh, right, what was I thinking?" the guy said, shaking his head.
Jenny thought this was a strange reaction. "What do you mean?"
"Well...you're pregnant. You can't have alcohol."
"I'm what?"
"Hey, it's no problem. I'm actually into that-"

He didn't get a chance to finish. This guy got an even stronger slap than the first guy and Jenny walked quickly to another side of the club, shaking angrily. What was happening? She put on a little bit of weight and suddenly everyone thought she was pregnant? Jenny looked down at her own bulge. Sure, it was a smaller, tighter outfit, so the little bit she'd put on was maybe more accentuated, but still: pregnant? Hardly!...well, it was pretty rounded and well-centered. In fact, Jenny was glad the fat didn't spread anywhere other than this pot belly. Her thighs were still toned and smooth, her waist was still pretty trim and curvy. The only things that had gotten bigger were her chest and ass and there were no complaints from her there.

To her surprise, the guy she'd just slapped was now a few feet away from her and still walking up. "Hey, I'm sorry if I offended you. I get that being pregnant and in the club can be intimidating, but trust me, it's sexy and I think we could have a lot of fun together."
Jenny took a few steps back. "Look pal, I don't want to, okay?"
"That bitch is doing it again!" Nearly everyone in the club turned their head to the owner of the slur. It was the first guy Jenny had slapped and it was clear that he'd gone through quite a few drinks since then. He stumbled over to where Jenny was and pointed a finger at her. "Get outta here, you knocked up slut!"
"I'm not pregnant!" Jenny barked at both the guys. "And don't talk to me like that. Do you even know who I am?" She swatted his finger away which really set him off. He looked ready to charge when a third man walked over and stopped him.
"Why don't you cool off, pal," he said. "Getting drunk with alcohol at these club prices? You must have burned through a lot of money. Go sit down." The guy stopped slightly and club security escorted him and the second guy away moments after. Jenny looked at the guy who'd come between her and the drunken suitors with a raised eyebrow.
"Thanks for that," Jenny said. "But I think I could have handled myself...name's Jenny."
"Chris," the guy responded, flashing a grin. "And I'm sure you could have. The guy just seemed like a jerk. And besides...you kind of look like an ex-girlfriend of mine.
Oh great, Jenny thought. This guy might be a nut too. "Yeah?"
"Yeah," Chris replied. "Actually...a lot like her. Do you know Nicole Winters?"

Jenny chuckled. "She's my cousin."
Chris covered his mouth as he laughed. "Really? Wow, small world. Hey, can we sit down? The speaker's right here and the couches are way better."
Jenny shrugged in her mind and agreed. On the couch, Chris continued his conversation. "But yeah, I heard what those guys were saying. Sorry about that."
"Well, I have put on some weight," Jenny said with an eyeroll.
"Yeah, same with Nicole, actually. But she really looked pregnant." Jenny tried to remember what Nicole looked like when she saw her yesterday. Chris kept going. "And a friend of mine who lives near her told me she definitely looked pregnant today. Like unmistakably. I just hope it's not mine...or maybe it would be better if it was mine. Then we could get back together."
Jenny looked at Chris like he was crazy as he began to talk to himself and slowly slinked away.
"Nicole I miss you so much!" Chris began to bellow to himself as Jenny walked to another part of the club near the entrance. Maybe today was just not a lucky day for her. At least she'd gotten some fun fondling and dancing out of the night. As she left, she accidentally bumped her hip against another woman's.
"Oh, I'm sorry," Jenny said.
"No problem," the other woman said, looking over at Jenny and grinning slowly. "Hey...aren't you from WBEL's newscast?"
Jenny smiled. "Yes, I am. Thanks for watching."
"I'm a real fan. You make the news on there so fashionable and give it real energy. You're a cool chick," the woman said, her grin expanding. "I'm Claire."

Outside of the club, Claire and Jenny were talking and laughing as Claire looked for a cab. "So this going to be a good party? Even for a college campus?" Jenny asked again.
"Trust me, I only go to parties worth going to," Claire scoffed as she finally hailed a cab. "And you'll fit right in. You look great and I already know that you're a killer personality too."
"Well, thanks. I need a good party tonight. I'm bored, I've got work in the morning, and I might have just learned that my cousin's pregnant," Jenny beamed, excited to move onto a scene that sounded better than the bum night at the Four-Sevens. "And you look cool too."
"Mmm, thanks," Claire smiled as the cab got closer. She wrapped one arm over Jenny's back and moved in for a kiss, managing to get her lips on the corner of Jenny's.
Jenny jerked away and took a short step away. "Whoa, what was that?"
Claire continued to laugh. "Sorry, I'm a little drunk. It won't happen again, promise."
"Okay," Jenny said hesitantly, getting into the cab with Claire, wondering where the night would take her now, not noticing that the slight fluttering in her stomach was not butterflies, but kicks. Five, to be exact.
1453311211222111121111221221.title: Jenny parties, runs into some of Nicole's a...

14533112112221111211112212211.content:
A relatively short drive later, the cab pulled into the college neighborhood, right in front of a fairly large house with kids in the lawn and pumping music barely audible from the outside.

"Claire," Jenny said, turning to her new friend. Claire was asleep against Jenny, specifically her chest. "Claire." Jenny jostled her shoulder a bit, trying to wake Claire up. Jenny hadn't seen her at the club, but Claire had been drinking pretty heavily. As her eyes opened from Jenny's nudging, Claire suddenly shot up.

"Woo!" Claire said, looking between Jenny and the house. "We're here! C'mon!" As Claire tried to pull Jenny out of the car, Jenny paid the driver and the two hustled toward the house. Inside, it was really just like the club they'd both just left, but about five times as cramped. Girls and guys were grinding and bumping against Jenny and Claire as they walked through the crowd, making their way to a series of couches in the back. It was filled with other attractive girls and a few guys, most of them waving to Claire.

"Who's this?" one girl, a tall redhead, asked. Claire held Jenny's arm and laughed.

"This is Jenny. She's awesome," Claire said, still laughing. Jenny smiled and didn't say anything. She figured out by now that Claire was a little gone. "She slapped two guys who tried to hit on her and she-she does the TV!"

Jenny's smile perked up a little more. She loved attention and telling people she was on TV was always a great way to get that. And if someone else said it, she could also come off as modest. The college students on the couch chirped with interest and the guys there looked her over with an interested smile. Claire was right: Jenny was liking this party quite a bit.

Claire took Jenny by the arm and walked her around more of the party. "Want something to drink?"

"No thanks," Jenny said. "I've got work in the morning."

"Right, TV!" Claire said excitedly, laughing again. "God, you're so cool. You're like a big sister!"

Jenny just smiled and went along. Besides, she was getting plenty of easy compliments out of it. "I've actually got two other older sisters."

Claire squealed. "Are they as good looking as you?"

Jenny chuckled and didn't say anything, looking around the room again. It was too late to go home with anyone and still get enough sleep in the morning. As she prowled the room, Claire put her hand back on her shoulder.

"C'mon, are they hot like you?"

"Claire, I think you might need to slow it down," Jenny said, taking Claire's hand away. "This was fun, but I should probably leave soon. Let's exchange numbers, okay?"

"Nooo! Let's just dance!" Claire said, swinging her arms around. "I-I'll find some hot guys, okay? It'll be fun, then you can go."

"Okay," Jenny nodded. She'd left her car back at the parking lot by the club anyway, so it would take her a while to really get home anyway.

-- Hours Earlier ---

Nicole drove with Betty, neither of them saying anything. Betty had her hands wrapped around her big belly, now knowing that there were definitely twins growing inside there. Although, it seemed like they wouldn't be growing too much longer. Dr. Anderson said that Betty looked like she was maybe a week away from delivering, adding that this was a rough estimate, as she wasn't exactly in chartered medical territory.

"Nicole," Betty finally said softly as they pulled into a nearby parking lot. Nicole was shaking, gripping the steering wheel. "Hey..."

It was no use. Nicole started to bawl, her head falling against the wheel. "How? How did this happen? I'm on birth control, guys use condoms, I...four babies?"

Betty scooted over a few inches and wrapped one arm around Jenny's waist. "It's okay, Nicole. You can cry it out." Tears started to well up in Betty's eyes. "Believe me, I know how scary this can be."

Nicole wrapped her arms around Betty's shoulders and the two cried into each other, although Nicole did most of the sobbing. Finally, Nicole sat up and sniffled loudly, wiping her eyes.

"I don't know how I'll tell my parents," Nicole said. "My mom'll kill me...especially when she's already got two on the way."

"Maybe that will help her sympathize," Betty laughed, wiping her own eyes. "C'mon, let's do something to cheer up...let's go shopping!"

Nicole scoffed and nodded. "Yeah, with four, I'll need some new clothes eventually..." She rolled up her shirt and looked at her own rounded, bulging middle. "God, I'm so big already...what'll it look like at nine months?"

"Actually, I've been looking into pregnancy stuff ever since..." Betty rubbed her belly gently, "A-and anyway, apparently it's more like 10 months. 40 weeks."

Nicole shook her head. "Well, that'll give me more time to figure out what I'm going to do, at least." She turned the car back on and headed for the mall. She and Betty cheered up a little and were back to gossiping and laughing about other guys and girls in the area, but it wasn't quite the same. At the mall, the two walked toward Baby Universe, the well-advertised maternity clothing store in the area. On the way over, Betty got plenty of looks, some shocked, some curious, some a little more...interested. Betty blushed and tried to cover her belly with her arms somewhat. It wasn't surprising. She was big, plain and simple. And she wasn't wearing clothes that covered her belly much at all. As bad as she felt about it, Nicole was glad her friend's belly was so big because it distracted from her own developing middle.

Nicole and Betty shopped around the maternity store, getting pleasant smiles from the young clerk with short, brown hair. "Happy with the selection?"

Betty nodded. "Yeah, the clothes here are a lot more stylish than I'd always heard maternity clothes were."

The clerk smiled back and raised her eyebrow. "You haven't shopped for maternity clothes until now?" It was obvious from Betty's attempt to use a baggy coat to make up for her lack of shirt covering the front slope of her belly. Betty blushed and nodded. "Well, that's okay. It's important to look good and feel good in the last trimester." The clerk came from behind the counter and pulled one, bright red outfit off of a nearby rack. "And if you'd like, we have a nice selection of maternity lingerie. I've heard some very good reviews."

Betty bit her lip and imagined what she must look like in a skimpy red satin and a big belly. "Nicole, what do you think?"

Nicole was looking through her own selection of clothes, trying to secretly find the largest outfits they had. Not knowing much about pregnancy herself, Nicole just let her imagination run wild with how big her quadruplet belly would look. "Uh, yeah, looks good. You should get a couple," she said, not paying attention to Betty's conversation. "I'll get one too."

Betty giggled. "Well...okay!" She waddled to the front and rung up all the clothes with her parent's credit card, wondering what their reaction would be when they saw the charges. Nicole found her own collection of clothes and bought it as well, not knowing that the clerk included some lingerie at Nicole's own absent-minded request. The two left the mall a little bit happier, Betty especially. "I can't believe how these outfits for pregnant women looked!" Betty buzzed. "People will lose their shit when they see us rocking these!"

"That's for sure," Nicole sighed, imagining her nine...no, ten month belly scaring some guy to death, worried she'd crush him in bed.

"Hey, let's try it out tonight!" Betty said. "There's a cool party tonight. It's in one of the smaller college houses, but it should be good. Plenty of guys. Besides I might as well lean into this." Betty jiggled her belly to emphasize "this." Nicole giggled and nodded.

"Sure," Nicole said. "That might cheer me up."

--- Hours Later ---

The pair showed up at the party, Betty in one of her new maternity dresses. It accentuated all of her new curves and showed off plenty of her new, clump cleavage. The pair turned heads immediately, pushing their way forcefully into the center of the party.

"Who wants to dance?" Betty beamed, doing her best to accept her situation. To both of their surprise, a few chuckling guys agreed, grinding and shaking their hips toward the two.

"Oh. My God," a familiar voice said, walking into the middle of the party, facing Nicole and Betty. "What is happening here?"

"Hello Claire," Nicole said coldly, looking at the woman joining Claire. "...Jenny?"

"Nicole?" Jenny said, her eyes darting between her cousin and her friend('s belly). "Wow...your ex was right."

"What do you mean? Why were you talking to Chris?" Nicole said, raising her voice. Someone turned down the music so the four could argue and entertain everyone there.

"You mean about the pregnancy?" Claire giggled, pointing to Nicole's belly, even bigger since she'd last spread the rumor. "Looks like your friend confirms it."

"Are they right?" Jenny said, her lips curling into a grin that she was trying to suppress. "Are you pregnant?"

Nicole wanted so badly to scream the same line out that she'd done the past four days. That she wasn't pregnant. Then she could tear Jenny apart and storm out. But...now it was true and there was no way out. Jenny was family and could tell anyone.

"Nicole?" Another voice said. All four turned as Marcus walked toward them. "You're pregnant?"

"No, I'm not...I mean, I am, but...but..."

"Hey, if you'd like, you can try and get my friend and me pregnant," Claire drunkely giggled, reaching out to Marcus. Nicole's whole body clenched with anger.

Good emotions...flip me!

Nicole reached into her pocket and grabbed the coin, flipping it and looking right at Claire.
14533112112221111211112212211.title: Jenny goes with Claire

choices: See what another character did that night
145331121122211112111122122112.content:
Claire continued laughing before stopping abruptly and letting out a sound like a burp.

"Ooh...I feel..." Claire said, putting her hands on her stomach, which began to swell immensely. In no time, Claire's revealing outfit revealed a whole lot more as her belly pushed past the fabric, round and glowing.

Time seemed to stop around her as Claire noticed the new addition to her womb and touched it gingerly. The party was too dark and the music was too loud so not many people noticed. But Claire certainly did and so did Nicole. She gripped the coin eagerly, her look of anger turning to a furious glee as she watched her nemesis become pregnant.

Not enough Nicole said, preparing to flip the coin again.

Yes! Good! Flip me!

Nicole didn't need the coin to tell her so. Nicole flipped and got tails again. Claire let out another groan and her belly continued to swell, growing far beyond any pregnant belly Nicole had ever seen. Jenny and Betty began noticing, their eyes growing as well.

"Nicole, oh my god! It's happening to her too!" Betty tried to tell her friend.

"More!" Nicole breathed excitedly.

"What are you talking about?" Betty asked, shaking Nicole's arm.

As Nicole was shaken out of her angry daze, Claire pushed past both of them in a blur of impressive speed, given her new size. She had Jenny by the arm and the two were out the door quickly, running down the street. They didn't get too far and Claire stopped to catch her breath and cradle her belly.

"Claire, what is-"

"I don't know what the fuck is happening but I need to get home," Claire gasped, looking at Jenny intensely. "Before anyone sees me like this!"

Jenny nodded and walked Claire quickly down the street, relying on her new companion for directions to Claire's home.

Back at the party, Betty was guiding Nicole outside, with Marcus close behind.

"You saw that, didn't you? It was just...just like what happened to me," Betty said, with fear in her voice.

"Uh huh," Nicole mumbled, unsure of what just happened or what came over her. For a moment, it felt like someone else, or something else, was inside her head, telling her what to do. Did that have something to do with Claire's sudden pregnancy? Maybe it had something to do with Betty and her own mother and...maybe Nicole herself.

Give in to your anger more. Now you have the power to spread chaos Nicole!

"What?" Nicole gasped, looking around.

"Nicole? Are you okay?" Marcus said, standing beside the pair.

"O-oh, yeah," Nicole said, rubbing one of her temples, her face immediately turning red when she turned back to Marcus.

"Is it true what that girl said in there? You're pregnant?"

Nicole's face turned a few shades redder as she stammered. "Uh...uh...I've...I've got to go!" Nicole grabbed Betty's wrist and ran to her car. "Sorry!" She shouted as she opened the door, jumping in as Betty panted and climbed inside. In no time, they sped off, back toward Nicole's house.

"Nicole?" Betty said softly, looking over at her friend. Nicole didn't say anything. "Nicole?" Nicole bit her lip and focused on the road. "That was Marcus that you told me about, huh?"

"Mmhmm," Nicole said, nodding her head, feeling tears well up.

"I'm...sorry, Nicole. I really am," Betty said, wrapping her hands around her own belly. Nicole stopped at a stop light and started cursing and hitting her steering wheel.

"That goddamn whore! Saying that about me! Who the fuck does she think she is?" Nicole screamed. "Now she's the one who's a fucking fat preggo, not me!"

"Nicole, hey, chill out some," Betty said. "You make it sound like you caused her to be pregnant."

Nicole paused at these words and put her hands back on the steering wheel, just as the light turned green. "R-right...right, sorry. It's just been a stressful day."

"Well don't worry about what Claire Reynolds says or does. You're the hottest and baddest chick I know and she's got nothing on you."

Nicole chuckled a little. "Thanks, Betty. You're pretty cool yourself."

Betty laughed too and looked down at her belly. "Thanks...well, I guess I'm not the biggest one at school now, if Claire sticks around."

Nicole grinned evily and didn't say anything as her home came up on the next turn. "Want to stay for a bit before I take you back home?"

"Actually," Betty said slowly, "I was thinking I could...stay over tonight? It's been a crazy day for both of us and maybe it would be better if we had some company."

"Aww," Nicole smiled, reaching over and hugging Betty. "You're a good friend. Sure, you can spend the night here."

---Claire and Jenny---

Jenny helped Claire up the steps of her swanky home and into her bedroom, Claire grumbling and rubbing her new belly the whole time.

"There's moving inside here," she said. "I'm really pregnant."

"Oh, come on now. You aren't pregnant. That's impossible," Jenny said, trying to comfort her new friend and ignore the obvious reality. One second, Claire had a trim, model's figure and now she had a pregnant belly the size of a beach ball. And helping her up the steps, Jenny had felt it. It was real.

"I know it's impossible but...but look!" Claire said, rolling up what little bit of her shirt was left and pointing at her swollen middle. "What else could it be?"

"I don't know but I'd call a doctor in the morning," Jenny said, yawning as she let Claire go so she could wander around her enormous bedroom. "Speaking of morning, I've got to go. I have work in the morning."

"For TV! Right!" Claire said. The coin's magic cleared the alcohol out of her system to prevent any harm to the babies it had created, but there was still a drunken residual effect, it seemed. "Oh, you're so cool, Jenny!"

"Thanks," Jenny smiled, unable to take her eyes off of Claire's new body as she walked around the room, slowly getting out of her shoes and taking off her jewelry. "Well...I've got to go. I'm parked back at the club, after all."

"No no no no! Stay here tonight!" Claire said frantically, grabbing Jenny's arm, pressing Claire's belly and equally-swollen breasts against her. "Please! I've never been pregnant before I need you here! What if something happens?"

She didn't make a terrible argument. Jenny thought it over. "Well...I really do have to get to work and get my car..."

"You can use my car! And I'll pay any tickets your car gets! I'm rich, I can get you anything, baby!" Claire reached over and kissed Jenny on the shoulder. Jenny blushed nervously, not sure what to make of that.

"Well...okay. Your water might break in the middle of the night and it would be better to have someone over," she said slowly.

"Yes!" Claire said excitedly, unzipping her outfit and crawling into bed in her underwear. "Now get in here."

"Oh...there's no other beds?"

"Get in here!" Claire yelled again, her eyes already closed as her head hit the pillow. Jenny scratched her head slowly. Claire had a bizarre persuasive energy.

"Alright, I'm here," Jenny said, slipping under the covers, her body immediately held in a tight, warm embrace by Claire.

"G'night, Janey," Claire slurred as she fell asleep.

"Goodnight, Claire," Jenny said quietly, trying to sleep as she felt Claire's belly pressed against her own. She could feel movements inside Claire's belly and briefly thought back to the own jeers and confusions about pregnancy she'd gotten hours earlier. "Glad I'm not pregnant," she breathed before closing her eyes. "Not like Nicole."

---Nicole and Betty---

Nicole had on a large white t-shirt, probably a leftover from an ex-boyfriend she'd forgotten about, and pulled back the covers for Betty, who also picked out an oversized shirt Nicole had lying around.

"Alright, sleep well," Nicole said, heading for the bedroom door.

"Wait a minute," Betty said with a confused smirk. "I thought you don't have any guest beds."

"I don't, I'll just take a couch."

Betty put her hands on her hips. "Nicole Winters, like it or not, you're pregnant too and I can't let you sleep on that couch. C'mon, we can share the bed. It's big enough for..." Betty started rubbing her belly self-consciously. "Well, it'll still be big enough for both of us."

"You sure?" Nicole asked.

"Absolutely, now come on," Betty said, getting into one side of the bed.

Nicole shrugged and got in the other side, turning off the lamp as she did.

"Turn so your belly doesn't knock me off the side," Nicole snickered, getting a pat on the arm from Betty.

"Shut up," Betty grinned, settling into bed. The two smiled and curled up in Nicole's queen-sized mattress. "Good night, Nicole."

"Good night, Betty," Nicole said, one hand going to her own belly. And good night to...however you four are.
145331121122211112111122122112.title: Tails - No Reality Shift

1453311211222111121111221221121.content:
The automatic alarm on Nicole's phone started buzzing and Nicole stirred awake, her hands scrambling around lazily. Slowly, her hands traced a wide, round, firm surface. It was warm and soft to the touch like skin.

Mmm...that must be Betty, Nicole thought, gradually remembering that they'd shared the bed that night. Then, horrifyingly, Nicole came to a realization. She could feel hands on her own stomach...which could only mean...

"Holy shit!" Nicole said frantically, sitting up in bed. It was her own belly! She looked like she was pregnant full term. The t-shirt she'd put on before was now totally unsuited to conceal her baby-filled womb, still smooth and blemish-free. As Nicole traced her curves with her hands, she started to feel movement inside her, like tickles moving across the wideness.

"What's up?" Betty said lazily, lifting her head and looking around. As her eyes adjusted, she saw Nicole's belly and her jaw dropped. Betty was speechless.

Nicole started rubbing her belly more, feeling her now-popped out belly button and the new weight of her body. "How the hell..."

Betty shook her head. "Something weird is happening. Me, your mom, now you...and the party...what the hell?"

Nicole nodded and tried to pull the shirt down over her belly. "This can't be happening...the doctor got something wrong or...it's some kind of disease or...aliens..."

"Nicole, calm down. This is...just a different version of what happened to me. We'll be okay, right?"

Nicole honestly didn't know. She continued to caress her belly, its size and shape totally foreign to her, as were the movements inside her. She might as well have been impregnated by some kind of alien. This was a different sensation than anything she'd ever felt, so who's to say?!

The two were interrupted by Nicole's phone buzzing again. She frantically picked it up and saw the text message from her father.

<Don't forget: interview today @ 11>

"Shit!" Nicole screamed, heaving herself out of bed and immediately stopping to grab her big belly. "I've got my job interview today! I've got to get there. If I tell my parents I missed my interview and tell them I'm pregnant with four grandkids on the same day, they'll write me out of the damn will!"

"Okay, how much time to we have?" Betty asked, slowly rolling (literally) herself out of bed. Betty's belly was still a bit bigger than Nicole's, but neither was in the mood to compare waist sizes now.

"Like an hour!"

"Well then, let's get you looking good," Betty said. "First thing, hop in the shower. I'll pick out some cute clothes."

Nicole waddled to her bathroom and stripped down, stepping into the shower and letting the warm water come down, giving a little yelp as the water touched her belly - now extremely sensitive. Showering with a big belly proved to be a challenge, as she couldn't see a lot of where she had to wash and turning was a complicated, tiring effort. She was just glad she didn't drop the soap bar. Bending or crouching down to get it was impossible. During her quick shower session, Nicole saw that her breasts had upped a few more sizes again. Another plus of this whole thing, I guess.

Out of the shower in much longer than expected, Nicole was presented with a few clothing options by Betty. "I...tried to combine our maternity clothing outfits to give you more variety," Betty apologized. "There's not a lot since I wasn't expecting you to get so...big so soon."

Nicole shook her head and picked up various parings. "Whatever, it doesn't matter. I've got to deal with what's here now." She found a nice black skirt and a polka dot blouse that managed to cover all of her belly. Unfortunately, it wasn't a baggy fit so it was still clear that Nicole was pregnant.

Betty brushed and styled Nicole's hair and she grunted and squeezed into her outfit, checking herself in a nearby mirror. "Anything else?"

"Yeah...I can't drive with this thing," Nicole said, holding her belly. "And I figure you can't either." Betty shook her head. "Damn."

"Well, who do we know who could drive us?" Betty asked. Nicole shook her head.

"I don't want anyone to see me...like this. But who's number do I have?"

"What about that guy you liked at the party? Marcus?"

Nicole got out her phone and cursed again. "I don't have his number yet...well, there's only two people who could maybe get me. Chris or my cousin Rachel."

Betty grimaced. "Two bad options."

"You're telling me...well, only one way to choose," Nicole said, getting out her coin. "Heads Chris, Tails Rachel?"

Flip me

"Wait, doesn't Chris live a block away? We don't have much time left. Just call him."

No, flip me!

Nicole let out a little groan and rubbed her temple.

"Nicole?"

"Ah, sorry...it's nothing, I'm fine," Nicole said, pocketing the coin and getting out her phone. The babies inside her started kicking frantically as she dialed. Ugh, what a weird sensation, she thought as she called her up ex-boyfriend. "Hey, it's...yeah it's me. Look, I need a ride...it's important...no. No! No! Fuck you! See you then."

---Jenny---

Jenny heard the chimes of her cell phone and rolled her shoulders a bit, feeling Claire's arms around her. "Nooo," Claire complained quietly as Jenny got up. She turned off her alarm and looked back at Claire, her new, heavily pregnant friend who insisted they share the bed for the night.

"Well, this was fun," Jenny laughed. "I'm sure I'll run into you again soon. But seriously, go to a doctor. That sudden pregnancy is...weird."

"What about yours?" Claire grumbled, rolling over. Jenny rolled her eyes and straightened her clothes.

She's fun, but she's so spoiled, Jenny thought, noticing the bulge from her own belly. She rubbed carefully and felt how firm it was. This was more than just fat.

"See, you're knocked up too, just like that cousin of yours," Claire laughed. "I'm not the only one! I'm not the only one!"

"Shut up!" Jenny yelled, running out of the room. "You'd better pay me back for the cab and my parking tickets. It wasn't my idea to sleep over here!"

Claire giggled. "Oh-kay, preggo. Have fun on the big, fancy local news." Claire's laughs turned to cackles as Jenny slammed the door.

"What a...ugh, nightmare of a girl," Jenny complained, walking (or slightly waddling) until she found a bus stop. She could at least take that near the club so she could get her car back. She started work soon! Jenny's phone buzzed again and she looked down. Two texts. One from Stacy, which was just a picture of her belly in her bathroom mirror with the caption <22 weeks!> Jenny smiled and laughed. It might have only been 22 weeks, but with triplets, Stacy looked plenty big. The second text was from Rachel. <We need to talk soon. Stacy too>

Jenny didn't know what to make of that but shrugged it off for the moment. Now, she was thinking about her new idea for a story. "Sudden pregnancies." Were they real? Were they happening here in town? And what people needed to know about it. Her grin spread. This would put her on the map and give her plenty of screen time.
1453311211222111121111221221121.title: The next morning (Nicole Day 5/Cousins Day 4)

14533112112221111211112212211212.content:
Jenny retrieved her car from the club and drove home, realizing that she had time to make breakfast, and change into something that would be more suitable for the news. She entered her bathroom, removing her clothes.

Stepping into the shower, she noticed that her belly was much larger than it was yesterday, maybe close to eight months. When she ran her hands over her belly, she was surprised at how sensitive it was. Jenny began to feel a light fluttering in her belly. "What the-" she let out, feeling all around her rounding middle. But, as soon as the movement began, it had ceased. Weird she thought to herself.

Getting dressed took some effort. She tried to put on a blouse, but her stomach had gotten too large. Instead, she put on a black shirt and an orange blazer. The black shirt did a good job of concealing her belly, and she hoped that none of the viewers would notice.

Hungrier than usual, Jenny cooked a large breakfast of eggs, bacon, and pancakes. While she ate, she felt the fluttering from before, and had to rub her large belly in order to calm the movement down. "Hmm, maybe I should give Dr. Anderson a call. This is kinda weird," she said out loud. She decided to call the doctor's office, labeling the appointment as a "check-up", in case any creep was listening in. The appointment was scheduled at 7:30 that night, and she would have to hurry to it after finishing the 6:00 news. After finishing her meal, she drove off to the news station.

At the station, called PRGNT, Jenny was the lone woman anchor, while there were a few female weathermen. The other co-anchor, John Maroon, was a slightly sexist, dumb man. In fact, Jenny believed that the only reason he still had a job was because of his luscious mustache and hair, combined with his suave way of talking. Their boss, Frank Terry, was a man in his early 60s who considered Jenny to be her apprentice. Jenny was sure that she would be able to get the "sudden pregnancy" off the ground.

Jenny entered his office, as Frank was talking to John. "-you can't just read every thing you see off the teleprompter! Does "Neighborhood Black Party" really make sense, John? Does it? I don't think it does." John sat there, twiddling his fingers. "Mr. Terry, can I have a word? Alone?" Jenny asked. "Sure you can. John, may we?" Frank gestured. "What, are you guys gonna do it in the office?" he asked.

"No, we're not, that's disgusting. I was going to talk about a possible news report. I believe that there's a sudden pregnancy epidemic going around this town. I mean, it's effected my cousin...her friend-" "You?" John interrupted. "I'M NOT PREGNANT!" she shouted, while it seemed she was avoiding the inevitable. "John, get out of here!" Frank shouted. John obliged this time, leaving the office. "Sorry about that, Jenny. He's an asshole. I like the idea. If you can, get it done by 5:30 so it can make your shift, but it's okay if you can't.

With that, Jenny left Frank's office, walking--or waddling--to her desk, trying to get to the bottom of these "sudden pregnancies."
14533112112221111211112212211212.title: Jenny goes to work

choices: Check in with someone else in the Winters family
145331121122211112111122122112121.content:
Jenny made it to her desk, letting out a small sigh of exhaustion and put her hands on her hips. She really needed to go to the gym more often and get in some exercise. Looking down, Jenny tried to pull down her clothes to further conceal her belly. "It's just fat," Jenny said to herself quietly, over and over again, like a spell that could make everything turn out alright.

As she heaved herself into her seat, Jenny prepared for her report and started to get worried again. How could she be so blind? Her story was on sudden pregnancies! So if it could happen to Claire, why couldn't it happen to her?

Of course, Jenny shook her head at that. She took her birth control pills regularly, she had her partners wear protection, and she'd been to the doctor in the last month and there was nothing there. Jenny gulped. "The same's probably true for Claire too."

As she opened a file on her office computer, Jenny realized that her journey to find a story on sudden pregnancies was no longer just about getting a good scoop for work. It might be a lead in getting information about her own medical condition too! Jenny checked to see what information Claire had left her. Luckily, in her drunkenness, Claire had given Jenny her phone number and had even written it coherently. Jenny dialed the number and cupped the phone close to her so no one else could hear the conversation.

"Hello, who is this?" A very prim and proper voice said on the other end.

"This is Jenny Winters. Is this Cla-" Jenny started to say, before an excited voice interrupted her.

"Jenny! Oh my gawwwwd! I was not expecting to hear from you so soon," Claire said, her tone changing from proper to sultry. "Sooooo, what's up? Bored at that flashy job already?"

"Hi Claire," Jenny laughed, Claire's charm and charisma still working even through the phone. "Actually, I was hoping to talk to you for a story."

Claire paused. "Oh. Okay, what do you need to know?"

Jenny cleared her throat. "It's about your...pregnancy. How it came out of the blue and-"

"Oh no! No no no!" Claire said excitedly. "I don't even want to think about it and I'm the one who's pregnant!"

"Claire, I know this is uncomfortable for you, but if there's some kind of...sudden pregnancy going around, people need to know about it," Jenny said. "And if it gets on the air, some doctors might see and be able to...do something about it. It's worth a shot."

"People would see me on TV with a big pregnant belly," Claire groaned. On the other end, she was already standing up and examining herself in the mirror. "Although I do make it look good, don't I Jenny?"

"Mmhmm," Jenny said, not really paying attention as she sorted papers around on her desk, trying to see what cameraman she could get a hold of for some footage now.

"Jenny," Claire said in an intense tone. "Tell me I look good pregnant."

"O-oh," Jenny said, stopping momentarily. "You looked very good pregnant. I'll...um...bet you don't look pregnant from behind."

Claire's face beamed. "Oh Jenny, thank you so much! I'll do your news show, sure. But I'll expect something from you in return."

Jenny grinned. Everyone always told her at the station to be careful about bribes and mixing friends and acquaintances with stories, but she did it all the time and look how far it had gotten her! And now it was going to get her another slam dunk story...if it all turned out to be true, of course.

"No problem," Jenny said. "I'll come over in about an hour. Are you in classes or still at home."

"At home, of course," Claire said, nearly shocked. "I can't let anyone see me like this. Not yet, at least." She brushed a lock of hair out of her eyes neatly. "I need the appropriate wardrobe."

"Well, what will you wear on camera?" Jenny asked, thinking about the hoops she had to jump through to not appear so pregnant at work today with her own outfit.

"Oh, I'll just wear a tank top or something to show off plenty of belly. You want people to see that I'm really pregnant, don't you?"

Jenny's jaw almost dropped at this incredible film opportunity. "Yes, of course. G-good thinking. See you in about an hour," Jenny said. After hanging up, Jenny's grin kept growing. This story was turning out pretty well and it would definitely show up that idiot John. Jenny envied the people at the competing news station who had that smart, gorgeous Mia Vasquez. She'd rather share a desk with her instead of John...

She still needed to talk to a doctor for the story, but it wouldn't be too hard to snag one. But if she had another woman with a spontaneous pregnancy, that would really clinch things. Jenny accidentally brushed one hand against her belly and stood up straight. Not her. She was not part of this story. She was not pregnant!

Jenny headed for the news van, writing her notes as she did so. On the way over, she got out her cell phone and made a call to the hospital. And just her luck: she got Dr. Anderson's office again. "Hello, this is Jenny Winters with PRGNT. I'm trying to get an interview with someone in the OB/GYN department about...what appear to be sudden pregnancies. Is anyone available to talk on camera?"

The receptionist paused. "I'm not even going to ask what that's about. But I've seen you on the TV a few times, you seem like a professional. Sure, Dr. Georgia Myers will talk to you at 1:30. Just be here, and maybe bring one of these magically pregnant women with you for an examination."

"Thank you," Jenny said sweetly. "And I appreciate your watching!" The receptionist hung up before Jenny finished, but it didn't matter. She didn't mean it anyway. Jenny loved the fame but didn't care too much about the fans.

Now, where could Jenny find another suddenly pregnant woman? She did know a few other pregnant women. Her sister, her aunt. And, according to Claire, her cousin. Jenny sighed and decided to check in with Nicole. She doubted it was a "sudden" pregnancy for her spoiled cousin. Nicole always chased guys and she didn't seem practical enough to always use protection. Still, a lead's a lead.

Jenny's cameraman, a tough-looking woman in her 40s named Barbara, joined her and the two got into the news van. "Now then," Jenny said, checking her make-up in the mirror. "Let's go get that story!"
145331121122211112111122122112121.title: Stay with Jenny!

choices: Nicole gets a call from the office
Jenny goes to her doctor's appointment
1453311211222111121111221221121211.content:
Jenny cleared her throat as Barbara set up the lighting for the interview, neither of them addressing the obvious, awkward element to the interview. Not that it was about a woman suddenly becoming heavily pregnant, but she'd never had anyone...exactly like Claire on the news. They were sitting in Dr. Myers' office, after convincing Claire to join them there so they could confirm her pregnancy as well. While Dr. Myers was in typical doctor attire - a white coat with a light blue shirt underneath, Claire opted for a button-up half shirt that was only half buttoned up, so her cleavage and belly were on total display. She also had on a short, lacy black skirt and elegant white pumps on her feet.
"Ready yet?" Claire mused, checking her lipstick in her makeup mirror, applying and reapplying it.
"Not quite yet," Jenny said, looking over at Barbara. "You seem to be feeling a lot better about this than I expected."
Claire closed the mirror and purred a little laugh. "Well, I figure it's not the worst thing that can happen. I'll just give them up for adoption or whatever. I don't like kids."

Dr. Myers, Barbara, and even Jenny reeled a bit at that. "W-well, you're also much...more free with your pregnant body too."
Claire laughed again, adjusting her top and accentuating her breasts once again. "I look pretty good pregnant though, don't I? You said so. I might as well show off how good I look pregnant."
"Ready to go," Barbara said, putting the camera on all three of them.
"So, Claire, tell me in your own words, what happened with this pregnancy," Jenny said, immediately shifting into her shmoozy, anchor persona.
"I was at a party, it was crowded and dark, but I felt this strange warmth inside me," Claire said, rubbing one hand on her belly carefully. "And then I felt myself swelling and my skin getting tighter. In no time, I had this round mound right here and I could feel kicking inside."
"And when was this?"
"Last night, around 10 or 11 PM."

Jenny turned to Dr. Myers. "Doctor, have you ever heard of something like this happening?"
Dr. Myers adjusted her glasses. "Not exactly. There are a few different explanations. She could have already been pregnant but the fetus was not 'in' the proper place and it later got into position."
"Is it possible that you were already pregnant?" Jenny asked Claire.
Claire rolled her eyes. "No, I use birth control and I've been to the doctor in the past nine months."
"Were you sexually active eight or nine months ago?" Dr. Myers asked.
A smile crept across Claire's face. "Well, of course. Look at me. I get many interested men after me." Claire turned her gaze a little, now toward Jenny. "Of course, I'm always open to more."
Jenny and Claire met eyes and both stayed there for a few moments. Just as Jenny thought she saw Claire wink at her, she shook her head and turned back toward Dr. Myers.

"A-and doctor, what else could be the cause?"
"Without much other information, it is possible that Ms. Reynolds is...lying, but you both seem quite adamant that that is not the case."
"No, it is not," Claire scoffed. Jenny decided not to chime in, lest her "impartiality" be questioned.
"Well then, doctor, Claire, would you mind proceeding to the ultrasound?" Jenny asked. Both nodded and Claire laid down on the doctor's bed as Dr. Myers ran her wand over Claire's big belly.
"Barbara, make sure you get the screen," Jenny said, standing up for a better view. "And my face. Get plenty of b-roll of me nodding and looking interested," Claire whispered to Barbara.
"Hmm, I don't see anything that might indicate an atypical pregnancy," Dr. Myers said. "If there are other cases of this 'sudden pregnancy,' like you said, then this could be a new medical phenomena. And it...yes, it looks like twins. If you had an atypical pregnancy with twins that just got corrected, you wouldn't be as healthy as you look now."
"Twins?" Claire asked, raising an eyebrow. "Great, birthing two crying kids is definitely going to mess me up down there."

---Nicole---
In another part of town, Nicole was sitting in front of three employees at the company her father recommended her too, each taking notes and looking at her occasionally. Nicole was sitting down, thanking the fact that she had a desk to cover up her pregnancy during the interview.
"So you...do not have any college experience, is that correct?" one of the interviewers, the head of administrations, said. He and the manager were both typical, stuffy, old men.
"That's correct," Nicole said, acting catty and casual. She figured it helped her get what she wants from her father, it should help her here. And it also helped that Nicole's maternity outfit had a fairly low collar that gave a good glimpse of her cleavage when she bent forward. Which she made a point to do. "I feel that going to college would just have diverted me from looking at the world and picking out what I want to do."
"Good business mindset," the manager said quietly, the head of administrations nodding along.
The head of HR, a woman in her 50s, sighed and looked down the sheet. She was already planning on quitting the job and working somewhere else. This company had more sexual harassment complains made than anywhere she'd ever worked and none of them went anywhere. She almost felt bad for Nicole for potentially entering such an environment, if Nicole wasn't such a blatantly repulsive, spoiled, and unqualified woman.

"What kind of extracurricular work did you do in high school, then?" the head of HR asked.
"Cheerleading. Well, cheerleading for two years. It was already so much work and the other girls treated me like bitches. It's because all cheerleaders have flat chests and I was naturally gifted with full breasts."
"Faced discrimination and still came out proud," the head of administration said again, getting a nod from the manager. The head of HR just rolled her eyes, overhearing everything they were saying.
"And what would you say is your work ethic?" the head of administration asked.
"Oh, I can do all kids of work. I do whatever it takes to please," Nicole purred. The head of HR buried her head in her hands.
"Thank you, we'll let you know later today about our decision," the manager said. Nicole thanked them and walked out. "I feel good about her," the manager said.
"I agree," the head of administratons said. "A little pudgy, but nothing wrong with that."
"You are horrible men," the head of HR said.

As she left the office, Nicole felt her phone buzz. And she was not happy about the caller I.D. "Jenny?"
"Hey Nikki!" Jenny said, sitting back in the news van. "I'll be quick, uncle Roger told me you've got that big, important interview today for a secretary job." Jenny, of course, said "big, important interview" in the most sarcastic tone she could. "You know your friend who came with you to that party? Betty?"
"Yeah, what about her?"
"Well, she looked like she had a bun in the oven!" Jenny chuckled. As long as Nicole and Jenny had lived near each other, Jenny had known Betty as well. She never liked Betty. "But I hadn't heard anything about it before. It wasn't, oh I dunno, sudden, was it? Like with that other girl at the party?"
Nicole hesitated. "What do you know about that?"
"Nothing, nothing. It's for the news. I think this is something people need to know about," Jenny smiled. She felt her stomach gurgle strangely and shifted in her seat. Maybe teasing was bad for her digestion. "Anyway, do you think you could give me Betty's contact info?"
Nicole sighed. "I guess. It's up to her if she'll talk to you or not."
"Great," Jenny said. "Great. And speaking of being pregnant, do you have something to tell me? And did you tell aunt Lucille and uncle Roger yet?"
Nicole scowled. She wished she hadn't just texted Jenny Betty's number. "I'm not the family member you need to be asking about a hidden pregnancy," Nicole said with a furious smile.
"Who, Stacy?" Jenny said, rolling her eyes.
"Nope," Nicole said, hanging up. She continued to smile while panting with fury. Rachel always treated her like garbage, just like Stacy and Jenny. What did she owe her?

And later that evening...

dunn-dun-da-da! Evening News on PRGNT, with your hosts John Maroon and Jenny Winters.
"Good evening, I'm John Maroon. We start tonight with a story about a possible health emergency in the city. Our own Jenny Winters reports."
"That's right, John," Jenny said, turning to the camera. "I spoke with two different women in the city who said they had pregnancies appear out of nowhere and their claims were confirmed by doctors."
Jenny turned as the camera switched the package she put together earlier in the day. Snippets of Claire and Dr. Myers' interview played, with Jenny's own narration. Then it cut to Betty, or at least, the neck-down of Betty. She gave her name but didn't want her face to show. That was fine with Jenny: she got to focus the camera right on that huge belly.
The clip ended and Jenny turned back to the camera. "If you have similar reports of sudden or unexplainable pregnancy, please contact a doctor," Jenny said.
"And after the break, what the mayor isn't telling you about that stain on his pants," John said, as the director called out the break.
"Jenny, that was great!" Frank said with a big smile. The phones are lighting up.
"Maybe you should have talked about your own babies," John grumbled, nodding at Jenny's belly.
"I'm not preg-"
"John, shut up. I've already seen your mayor story. It's lousy but we've got nothing else," Frank said. "Back on in one minute."
Jenny turned back to the camera, smiling brightly. Fame, fame, fame, here she comes. Again.
1453311211222111121111221221121211.title: Interviews all around

choices: Skip to the next day!  (Nicole Day 6/Cousins Day 5)
What are the other characters doing?
14533112112221111211112212211212112.content:
The remainder of the broadcast blew by, and Jenny found herself waddling out of the station and into her car. Squeezing into the driver's seat, she noticed that she had 30 minutes to spare. Her round belly gave a loud grumble.

God, I'm hungry. Do I have time to get something to eat? she thought to herself. The fluttering in her belly returned, and she could swear that it completely shifted. "Yup, I definitely have time." she said, rubbing her belly in an attempt to calm it down.

Jenny drove to the town's diner, where she got a discount due to being a local celebrity, and made her way to a booth. Jenny's regular waitress, Kate, was an attractive woman in her early 40s, but due to her inability to have children, she never married. "The usual, Ms Winters?" she asked. "Actually, could you double it?" Jenny asked, "I'm just REALLY hungry." "Sure thing!" Kate replied, walking back to the kitchen. Should I congratulate her on the pregnancy? Probably not...she thought as she gave the cook the order.

Minutes later, the food arrived, and Jenny ate ravenously. As she ate, the movement increased. She finished within minutes. Suddenly, she felt a sharp jab from inside her belly. She looked down, and was shocked to see that her shirt had begun to ride up, exposing a sizable sliver of rounding flesh. Jenny heaved herself out of the booth and booked it, forgetting to pay. She figured she'd come back another time, so she could pay then. Still in shock, she drove as fast as she could to the doctor's office.

"Jesus Christ, Jenny! You too?" Dr. Anderson said, exasperated. "Let's just get this over with," Jenny pouted, rolling her shirt up. Dr. Anderson applied the cool gel to Jenny's large stomach, which was shaking with movement. He moved the wand around her belly for a few moments.

"Well, this seems to be the most so far..." he said, staring at the monitor. "What? What do you see?!?" she asked, her eyes widening.

"I see five babies. You're having quintuplets, Jenny."

Jenny buried her face in her palms and began to sob. She was perhaps less prepared to be a mother than Nicole.

And five babies? Jenny definitely wasn't prepared for that.
14533112112221111211112212211212112.title: Jenny goes to her doctor's appointment

145331121122211112111122122112121122.content:
Nicole was riding in the car to her parent's house, hands sadly on her bulging belly, worried about the news she'd have to drop on her parents. Stacy was driving her, her face smiling and giddy.

"Well I don't care what Uncle and Aunty say, I think it's great having a cousin go through pregnancy with me!" Stacy beamed. Nicole looked out the window and rolled her eyes. Of course she did. Stacy was the oldest of the three horror cousins and rarely thought about anyone but herself. Nicole could only imagine what it would be like at Stacy's job when she got really pregnant. She would waddle around giggling, bumping her belly against people, taking company time for maternity clothes shopping. It would be a nightmare for them.

"Thanks," Nicole grumbled, still rubbing her belly, feeling it with her palms. Every now and then, she thought she could feel some movement inside her now-occupied womb, but was never sure what it actually was. Nicole didn't exact have someone to talk about the experiences of pregnancy with. Except for Betty, of course, but Betty didn't know what it was like to have the babies actually...grow inside her. One second, Betty just went BLAM - pregnant.

"But I can't believe you kept it secret for so long," Stacy snickered. "I mean, I don't have to tell you this, but you're big! I can't believe it's only been a few months. You look like you've got two more, tops."

"Yeah," Nicole said, still miserable. She wished she could say something catty back to Stacy but she looked...fit. Sure, she might be a little wider around the waist, but it still looked tight and fit. You couldn't have told she was pregnant. But Stacy brought up a concern that Nicole had. Just how pregnant was she? Having four babies definitely fiddled with her size, but she shouldn't be this big so soon! How far along did the doctor say she looked?

Nicole's head started spinning as she felt her phone buzz in her pocket. "Hello?" Nicole mumbled, not checking to see who called. "Yes...yes...oh my god! Thank you. Yes, I can be there tomorrow, thank you." Nicole hung up, a big smile now on her face. "Well, at least I'll have some good news to soften the blow now."

"What?" Stacy said with patently fake excitement. She didn't even glance over. And it wasn't out of concern for safety.

"I got hired. I got the job," Nicole smiled. I guess I'll need it if I'm going to take care of four little bastards.

"Neat," Stacy said, not even trying this time as she pulled into the Winters household. "Jenny isn't coming to dinner tonight and Rachel's car is already in the driveway. Maybe she brought Chris too." Nicole noticed that Stacy's smile grew a little when she mentioned Chris' name but didn't think much about it.

The two cousins knocked on the door, with Lucille Winters' huge twin-filled belly greeting them. "Hello Stacy! And Nicole, glad you made it on time today."

"Hello mother," Nicole spat, walking in, trying to conceal as much of her belly with her jacket as she could. It was embarrassing, but Nicole felt like she had to tell her parents now. If the past nights were any clue, her belly was going to keep getting bigger each day and it didn't seem like it would just keep going forever. One day, she'd wake up and have four screaming babies to take care of. And if she wanted her parents' help at all, she needed to get in front of this thing.

"Hello girls," Roger said, smiling politely as he walked to the door. "Stacy, how are you feeling?"

"Great," Stacy beamed. "I have some news when we get to the dinner table."

You and me both, Nicole scoffed in her head. And if we want to make dinner any more of a circus, Rachel too.

Rachel and her fiancé Chris were already seated at the main dinner table. "You sure you don't want any wine?" Chris asked. Rachel just shook her head bashfully.

"Well, let's all sit down and eat," Roger smiled. "Stacy, we can't wait to hear your news."

Stacy nodded and smiled. "Yes, we'll all tell our new stories!" Nicole turned to her furiously, her face turning red.

"All of us?" Lucille said, raising an eyebrow and she rubbed her belly. As everyone else joined Rachel and Chris at the table, Lucille waddled over, slowly lowering herself into her seat. "What do you mean by that, dear? Nicole, do you have something to share?"

"Wait, you first sis," Rachel said, bringing her traditional bullshit Winters smile back.

Stacy stood up at the table, taking in a big breath with an even bigger smile. "So, I was at the doctor today and...it's triplets!" Stacy started cupping and rubbing her still relatively flat belly. "I'm going to have triplets!"

Lucille and Roger both gasped with big smiles, while Rachel and Nicole both looked away awkwardly. I guess it's genetic, they both thought. Chris just turned pale, his eyes bugging out. Stacy giggled as she surveyed the rooms faces and sat down.

"Well?" Lucille said, turning to Nicole. "Did you have something?"

Nicole sighed and stood up, shaking some. Stacy looked at her, still with a huge smile. "Um, y-yeah. I just got a call and I got the job."

Lucille took a long sip of water while Roger smiled proudly. "Oh, baby, that's fantastic! Really fantastic. You'll love it, I'm sure."

"Oh, right, you told me that too," Stacy said casually, drinking her water. Nicole gripped her fists tightly, unable to believe the shade her cousin - her dumb preggo cousin - just threw at her. Roger and Lucille both turned back to Nicole, looking inquisitive.

"There's more?" Lucille said shocked. If Nicole announced that she had gotten some kind of accommodation at her interview, the surprise might have caused Lucille to go into labor right there.

Nicole bit her lip and opened her jacket slowly. "Mom, Daddy...I'm pregnant."

The room went silent.

"You what?" Lucille almost screamed. "Nicole Winters, of all the..."

Roger rubbed his napkin on his forehead, looking at Nicole's now-clearly pregnant belly. "When did this happen?"

"I-I don't know when or...how it happened," Nicole said.

"Of course you don't," Lucille scoffed, resting back in her chair, arms crossed and resting on her own pregnancy. "How far along are you? You look pretty big."

"I'm not sure. The doctor didn't give me a really precise estimate," Nicole said, now turning bright red. "And that's not all. It's...it's quadruplets."

Now it was Rachel's turn to have her eyes bug out. "R-really?"

Chris crossed his arms and looked around the room. I guess it's genetic, he thought worried.

Roger held his head in his hands. "We...we will have to talk about this later. What are you planning to do?"

"I don't know," Nicole said meekly. Worriedly, she turned to Rachel, giving her impassioned eyes, asking for help. If Rachel announced her pregnancy too, that would at least take the pressure off of Nicole. Rachel met Nicole's eyes for a few seconds, then looked away. Nicole gripped her fists so tightly, her knuckles cracked. You bitch...I'll get you for this.

"Well, let's...let's just finish our dinner for now," Lucille said, dabbing her lips with her napkin. "At least I'll have another child before I have a grandmother."
145331121122211112111122122112121122.title: Nicole drops the bomb

choices: Jenny goes home, nervously calls Claire up
Nicole finishes out the night with her parents and cousins
1453311211222111121111221221121211222.content:
Betty sat on her couch, arms around her bulge, watching Jenny sign off the news before switching the TV off. There it was: her pregnancy was on the nightly news for anyone to see. She didn't show her face, but she felt deep down that someone would recognize her. They'd see her familiar lower body, her familiar voice, see that the reporter referred to her as "Betty" and put the pieces together. Besides, it wouldn't be much longer until Betty would have to go back to class and the belly would give itself away.

"People will come up to me and ask what it's like to have a 'spontaneous pregnancy,'" Betty groaned, rubbing her belly up and down. "I shouldn't have done this."

Betty's other fear was plenty strong: would her parents see? Parents always seem to be able to tell their child, even without their face showing. Any second now, Betty expected her phone to start ringing and hear her mother crying, her father screaming. Probably a nasty comment or two from her bratty little brother too. She moaned and rolled up her shirt, filling her hands with her roundness, feeling the warmth and tightness of her skin. It felt as real as ever and Betty knew there was no undoing this.

As Betty looked at her belly (which she'd grown more...accustomed to over the past few days. Originally, she thought it made her look fat and ugly but she saw its charm at times, even if she didn't like to admit it), she was reminded of the other startling part of the report. It seems like this instant pregnancy was affecting people other than her. Claire Reynolds from the same school was on the news too, showing off her belly instead of hiding it. That almost made Betty want to go back to campus: seeing all the attention she would get over her pregnancy. A little grin went across Betty's face. She'd probably be tormented even more than Betty.

Still, that wasn't nearly enough of a concession. Claire being made fun of wouldn't make the babies in Betty's belly any less real. Or make them take any longer to be born. And by the looks of Betty, her twins would be coming into the world any day now. Betty sighed and heaved herself up, hands on her belly, groaning as her little ones shifted to the front of her belly along with her, increasing her discomfort. And moving around seemed to upset them as well, as shortly after, her womb was filled with a row of kicking and squirming.

"Hey, hey, calm down," Betty said, one hand on the small of her back and the other on the front of her belly, belly button between her fingers, "I ordered some food so you're going to be fed soon, okay?"

Betty paced around the room, rubbing her belly and moaning softly. Pregnant. She couldn't think about anything else. She was pregnant. And she didn't even get there the fun way. Come to think of it, Betty hadn't had sex in a while. It was definitely a longer dry spell than Betty was comfortable with. As she thought about it, the twins shifted into her pelvis again and she let out a little moan.

"Why does this keep happening?" she whined. Ever since becoming pregnant (so for the past few days), Betty couldn't stop thinking about sex and now she was heating up even more. Her hands across her swollen skin, the weight in her lap, the sultry news report that Claire gave. But Betty knew she wouldn't be getting any action looking like this.

The doorbell rang and Betty waddled over quickly, the pizza delivery guy standing there in his blue work shirt and baseball cap, holding her pizza out.

"...delivery for Oak Lane, 111," the delivery guy said. Betty could see his eyes obviously not meeting hers. Looking down, she traced his gaze to her belly, exposed thanks to her shirt that she forgot to roll back down. Betty looked up at him, her face burning and bright red.

"Look, I know I'm pregnant and huge, but I need to get laid," Betty sputtered out. "You up?"

Now it was the delivery guy's turn to blush. "Uh...sure."

"Good, leave the pizza on the table and follow me," Betty said, her voice taking on a bizarre sudden confidence even as the rest of her shuddered. She marched to her bedroom, taking off her new maternity clothes as she did, sitting on the bed in just her underwear. The delivery guy followed, clumsily taking off his own clothes, but deciding to go full-nude.

"How do we do this?" he asked, motioning to Betty's belly.

"Don't know, don't care," Betty said, removing her bra, sweat sticking to her cleavage. "Get over here and do whatever you can."
1453311211222111121111221221121211222.title: Betty mulls her condition
