145332111.content:
Right before her eyes Audrey watched in rapt fascination and horror as Alison's formerly pencil-thin stomach ballooned outwards, expanding until it was almost the size of a beachball. Odd enough, Alison's clothing didn't change at all from her new size. Instead, her shirt did stretch out a bit, enough to cover a small portion of Alison's new belly, but it was no match. Her belly was massive; she had to be the size of an overdue pregnant woman!

But most surprisingly of all was Alison didn't even notice the changes. She nonchalantly stood, staring at her stomach with a smile, as if nothing had happened at all. The blonde rubbed her huge belly and grinned, "Hey Audrey, look! The babies are kicking again!" She exclaimed in delight.

"B-babies? I...Wha?" Audrey sputtered, trying to find her tongue. She couldn't quite articulate what had just happened; her mind was doing somersaults and she couldn't think right.

Alison chuckled; even through she was the size of a heavily expecting woman she still had her saucy, sexy figure. "Oh Audrey, I already told you months ago! You do realize that I'm having triplets, right?" She beamed.

Sweat beaded down the sides of Audrey's face. Alison was definitely not pregnant just a few minutes ago, she was sure of that. And now she was? And she didn't even notice the change? She was acting like this was a normal thing. Audrey looked at the coin in her hands, squeezing it instinctively. Could this odd coin have caused this?

"Oh man, I'm hungry." Alison said, patting her large stomach. "What do you say we get outta here and get something to eat? I'm starved!"

"Uh...yeah...sure," Audrey mumbled, following her waddling friend towards the exit. As they approached the car, Audrey looked back down at the coin. "What are you?" She whispered.
145332111.title: Alison's belly begins to grow. (Instant Exp...

1453321112.content:
The Colorful Mug was a full, bustling cauldron of activity and hungry patriots, abuzz with waiters and waitresses rushing around serving customers at their booths and tables. It was a generic family-friendly restaurant, although the menu did have a variety of beers and alcoholic drinks for the adult audiences.

Audrey and Alison walked into the main entryway; well, Alison mostly waddled, her curved hips swinging from side to side as she strutted around, donning her maternal figure. Audrey blinked, trying to clear her mind as it was still flooded with questions. How could her friend suddenly...grow pregnant?

A waitress in her early twenties, perhaps twenty-three or so, approached the two women, sporting a rather jaded smile on her face, as if she was forcing herself to grin in front of the customers. She sighed, “Hello, and welcome to the Colorful Mug. My name is Connie and I’ll be your server today. Would you like a table or a booth?”

"A booth, please. I want my babies and my best friend to be as comfortable as possible." Alison proclaimed, proudly jutting out her belly as she rubbed its gravid surface in a way to calm the kicking babies within.

Connie nodded and made a gesture with her hand, "Follow me then." They obliged and were soon seated at a small booth, enough to fit three to four occupants. Connie handed them both their own menus and smiled again, this time much more genuinely as she eyed Alison's belly. "Can I get you both something to drink?" She smirked.

"I'll have a small water, simple as that." Alison said.

"I...I'll just have a diet Coke, please." Audrey stuttered.

"Okay then. I'll be back in a while with your drinks. Until then, take your time with ordering. There's no rush." Connie said quietly. Audrey couldn't help but notice that she was staring intently at her friend's pregnant belly, even as she walked away. She snickered, wondering what the girl was actually thinking.

"So, what are you getting?" Alison spoke.

"Oh! Um...I haven't looked yet." Audrey replied, quickly peeking into the menu. While Alison was focused on her menu, Audrey peered over the edge and took a glance at Alison's belly. Underneath the fabric of her sweatshirt she could faintly see tiny bumps and prods visible through the fabric. She couldn't imagine what it felt like to be pregnant, especially with triplets.

A few minutes later their meals were decided and so the waitress returned. Audrey had decided on a simple salad and a side dish of chicken ravioli along with a small diet Coke, while Alison ordered a fried chicken basket complete with fries, a Cesar salad, and her water. Connie nodded and walked away to prepare their orders. Suddenly Audrey felt a rustling in her pocket, as if something inside was moving.

She dug the coin out of her pocket, her eyes knitting into a frown. "That was weird," She commented to herself.

Flip me. The same voice from earlier boomed in her mind.

"Flip you? Again?" Audrey retorted internally. "No. I don't want to."

Flip me, now. The voice demanded, sounding much more intimidating than before. Audrey sighed and decided to give in. Her eyes locked on Connie as she promptly flicked the coin into the air, swiftly and deftly catching it as gravity got to it. When she looked down to see the results she saw...
1453321112.title: They head over to a restaurant.

14533211122.content:
The moment her hand touched the cool metal of the coin, Audrey shut her eyes, brow furrowed. Her hand gripped the coin like a vice, fingers beginning to turn white around its edges.

"Audrey?" Concern filled her friend's voice, "Audrey are you okay?"

"I'm-I'm fine. Cramps. Time of the month." She hated lying to Alison, but how could she possibly explain herself?

"Heheh, I feel like it's been years since I've had cramps. Cravings on the other hand..."

A chuckle forced itself from her lips, the noise sounding hollow and fake.

The last time I flipped the coin, I was looking at Alison. Maybe if I keep my eyes shut maybe it won't effect anyone...

FAT CHANCE The voiced filled her head, every corridor of her mind rang with its voice. A moment later a scream followed by a series of crashes pierced through the static; Audrey's eyes snapped open. Her mouth dropped in horror at what she saw.

Their waitress stood mouth agape, her hands clutching her swollen belly. Advancing against her simple black blouse, her belly seemed to repel any and all clothing. The slack provided by her growing stomach was immediately filled by her breasts, and then some. Buttons rocketed off the shirt, revealing a bra overflowing with their owner.

*SNAP*

The defeated garment fell to the floor, breasts continuing their advance. Her lower half was not to be ignored. Widening hips and fattening bottom proved too much for her skin-tight skirt, rips forming up her thigh revealing panties ready to burst from her body. The pale dome of her belly, while challenged by her breasts, dominated her figure a gargantuan sphere of maternity even bigger than Alison. Just when it seemed she would burst; the growth stopped.

The normally bustling restaurant was silent. The only sound was the frantic breathing of Connie.

"Oh...My...GOD"

Audrey felt her eyes well up, This...it's all my fau-

"YESSSSSSSSSSSS"

Previously motionless, Connie's hands began shameless exploring her new body. Breasts bigger than her head were fondled, nipples tweaked. Great sweeping arcs made over her belly. She even spared a shake or two for her behind. Completely entranced by the spectacle, no one moved. At once the staff of the Colorful Mug sprang into action. A waiter grabbed a tablecloth off of an unoccupied table. The sound of glass shattering was ignored. The manager could be heard frantically apologizing to other patrons. A frantic phone call to 911 could be heard on the opposite side of the room.

Just before Connie was ushered away, she backed her way to Audrey and Alison's table.

Between pants, Connie managed to utter a husky "Sorry...about your...lunch." Tearing her eyes away from Connie's frontage, Audrey noticed the billion-watt grin plastered on her reddened face. There was not an ounce of regret. A flash of white, and Connie was again decent. The wait staff formed a circle around her and disappeared.

"What. the hell. just happened?"

Audrey got to her feet and offered a hand, "Come on, we need to get out of here."

Audrey quickly left her waddling friend behind as she found their car. Ripping the door open, she slammed it into the car beside her. She didn't care. A thousand thoughts ran through her mind, but one was front and center.

What are you?

Audrey caught her eye in the rear-view mirror and quickly looked away. A second later she twisted it toward herself. Her skin was pale, sweat beading on her forehead, pupils large and shifty. She looked terrible.

"Audrey!" She could barely hear her name being called. She scanned the row of cars before she found Audrey squeezing through a couple of sedans.

"Audrey, what the hell? You just leave your hugely pregnant bff so she can get caught by the pregnancy ghost and blown up even bigger?" Audrey gave a half-hearted wave.

Flip Me

Oh god, no, please. She's big enough.

FLIP ME

She felt her thumb flick the coin into the air, Alison coming closer into view. Her eyes darted back to the rear-view. She looked back at Alison, almost in front of the car now. As she caught the coin, her eyes locked on...

145332222222.title: Anyone else

choices: His reflection in the window - Himself
Someone who just walked through the door - Roommate
1453322222221.content:
It had started off as a really good day for Collin. The young man had finished all of his classes of the day, and while most college kids usually spent Fridays celebrating the end of the week by partying with their friends, Collin refused to share in such celebrations. After all, one had to first acquire friends in order to party, and Collin had neither the time nor the willingness to be social more than he was already required.

In fact, on most days, he curled up in his room, locked away reading some lesser-known novel or perhaps some dark poetry. Well, either that or studying; but even he, the walking definition of a bookworm, grew weary of such a solitary life every once and a while. So today, he went on a rare adventure into town.

It had been raining all day, but he seemed to be the only one walking the streets who appeared not to mind the dreary weather. It reminds me of home, the brunette thought as he splashed his way through the puddles everyone else save for some adventurous schoolboys up ahead seemed so eager to avoid. He hated to admit it, but he really was feeling homesick; after all, a handful of months away from home would do that to anyone with a heart.

As he meandered through the surprisingly quiet streets with no real destination, he wondered what Mummy was up to and if anyone was missing him too terribly back home. Probably not. After all, being one of thirteen children in a household and having no accomplishments to speak of, he didn't figure he was particularly high up on the list of favorites.

Snapping out of his melancholic state before he grew too upset, he stopped in his tracks as her surveyed his unfamiliar surroundings. Where in the world was he? He began to formulate a plan to find his way back to his apartment when his chocolate eyes landed on something glimmering on the ground a little ways ahead of him. His eyes normally would have overlooked it if it had not been for the color of the coin: bright yellow, a color that caught the few rays of sunshine that fought through the rain clouds. He moved closer, entranced.

Pick me up, Collin a strange albeit soothing voice echoed in his mind as he drew near to the object, and he did not need to be told twice. Collecting coins was one of the few pastimes that still brought him joy, and this would be just perfect to add to his collection! He wiped the coin off carefully and studied it. The images depicted on the front and backside of the coin were strange to say the least, a pregnant woman... and a pregnant man?

He was quite puzzled but didn't really have time to give it thought as a loud roll of thunder boomed all around him. Getting his priorities straight, he pocketed the coin without hesitation and hailed a taxi. He could research the strange object later, but for now, he simply wanted to get back home.

It didn't take long to get back to his apartment building, surprisingly. He eagerly clambered up the stairs of his nearly empty building, excited to simply rest and do some research on the oddest contribution to his coin collection yet. He fingered the thing anxiously in his pocket as he unlocked the door and hurried inside.

Flip me, Collin the coin seemed to call to him, and for some reason or other, Collin isn't perplexed by this at all. Shrugging off his coat and kicking off his shoes, he collapsed into his chair that faced one of the few windows in the apartment. While he was normally content to watch the rain drizzle down outside, a phantom voice was calling him and he was eager to obey.

Pulling what he now coined (pun intended) the Pregnancy Coin out of his jeans pocket, he unconsciously flipped it into the air. Little did he know that this little coin flip would flip his entire life. The coin landed, and he closed his palm around it.

Look at someone, Collin the voice commands, and Collin sees none other than...
1453322222221.title: Yay!

choices: Tails - No Reality change for Lune
14533222222212.content:
The sound of the door opening and closing caught Collin's attention, shaking him out of whatever stupor he was just in. He turned around in his chair and was greeted by the eager grin of his roommate, Lune Dubois. The Englishman sighed and wondered for the umpteenth time how he got stuck with such a perky roomie.

The two were extreme opposites of one another: Lune was always optimistic, charismatic, easy going, and so social that he was rarely ever in the apartment. The only thing the two had in common was that they were both exchange students (Lune being from France, though, and not Great Britain) which was the only reason why they had become roommates to begin with. Collin thought that perhaps living with someone in the same boat as him would ease the pressure of moving to a new country, but it really had only succeeded in him being stuck with a too-energetic roomie who Collin couldn't muster the heart to leave behind.

The French man tossed down his shopping bags and hung up his coat, whistling a little tune to himself as though he had not noticed Collin sitting in the living room. While pulling his messy blonde hair into a small bun, Lune turned and finally caught sight of his roommate. He was surprised for a moment to see Collin out of his room for once, but his look of surprise almost immediately snapped back into a pleasant grin.

"Ah, bonjour, Collin! Although, this late in the day, I suppose bonsoir would be a bit more appropriate," Lune beamed, accent flaring, talking a mile a minute while searching the cabinets in the conjoined kitchen. Collin's eyes never left the tanned man, and while normally he was polite enough to at least greet his somewhat estranged roommate, he had other things on his mind currently.

Reveal it: heads or tails?

His hand curled tighter around the coin for a moment before he unclenched it entirely. Lune, now realizing how quiet his roommate was being, turned and gave a puzzled look. "Are you all right?" he asked as Collin looked down at the coin which had landed on...
14533222222212.title: Someone who just walked through the door - Room...

choices: Fast Pregnancy - Lune has some exciting news to share with his roomie
Pregnant Expansion - When did Lune get so... large?
145332222222121.content:
Reality change it is! the voice rung out, and Collin was more than a little perplexed. He felt a cold draft enter the room, pressure weighing down on him. If he had been more conscious, he would have noticed the nervous feeling that overtook the room. Instead, he simply stared down at the coin in his hand blankly, wondering what this all meant.

"Are you with me, mon ami? You didn't eat any of those brownies the neighbors have been offering you, did you?" Lune's voice called out, but Collin wasn't really listening at the moment.
145332222222121.title: Heads - Reality change for Lune

1453322222221212.content:
The pressure in the room seemed to grow more and more intense, and when Collin thought he could bear it no longer, it vanished entirely. No longer feeling compelled by some outside force to hold the coin, it disappeared back into his pants pocket. He wondered for a moment why he felt so anxious, but something simply seemed... off.

He did not have to wonder about what was bothering him for very long as the question was immediately answered when he turned his attention back over to his roommate who had been staring at him with a genuinely worried gaze for some time now. Collin's jaw fell to the floor as he took in the unexpected sight, trying and failing over and over to say something. Lune stared at him in confusion until the Englishman finally managed to get some utterance out of himself.

"When did you get so bloody huge?"

Maybe those weren't the right words to use, although they were fair. Lune's previously only somewhat pudgy stomach had transformed into a heavily rounded belly that threatened to peak out from underneath his huge sweater. His hands rested on the globe, stroking it as if attempting to calm something or someone within.

When Collin's comment registered, Lune's face fell, and he appeared to be offended. "Oh!" he huffed indignantly as he rubbed his belly, "You are so cruel to me, mon ami!" When this response only succeeded to confuse Collin more, Lune lost his agitation and grew worried again. "Have you hit your head since last we met? I am six months pregnant with twins; I am supposed to be huge!"

As Lune laughed at his roommate, Collin's eyes widened and seemed to bulge out of his skull. "Pregnant?" he cried, "What sort of joke are you playing on me here?" He didn't mean to sound so accusing, but he wanted to get to the bottom of this. With hesitant steps, he approached the blonde, chocolate eyes never once leaving the mammoth belly.

Lune, upon realizing that his stomach was being stared at, blushed at the newfound attention. He grew shyer as Collin drew closer and was too confused by the situation to formulate a response. Thankfully, he didn't have to.

"Lift up your shirt," Collin commanded without considering decency, and Lune's blush only darkened a shade. To think that his secret crush was suddenly paying so much attention to him and his children; why, it was enough to make him swoon! He did as instructed, head turning away so he did not have to stare at Collin.

Collin, in turn, was shocked at what he saw. The French man's stomach was inflated, looking like he had swallowed a basketball. His belly button was popped out and his skin, despite being pulled over the large space, showed no stretch marks of any sort. Wildly intrigued and no longer thinking clearly, Collin put his hand on the belly without permission. A moan rose in Lune's throat which he bit back into a whimper at the touch. It did not take long for the baby closest to Collin's hand to kick out, surprising the brunette in the process. He moved his hand away as Lune hissed in discomfort, and they both watched as the children grew noticeably restless, both fighting for space in the cramped confines of their mother's womb.

"I had just gotten them to sleep, too," Lune grumbled as he attempted to soothe his children to no avail. "At least they know who their papa is, non?"

Collin's eyes widened even more (if that was possible) at Lune's suggestive comment. "I-I'm not...!"

The French man laughed without cruelty, eyes gleaming and blush finally starting to fade. "Non, you are not, you know that." But life would be so much simpler if you were, Lune wanted to add, but he kept that to himself.

The father of the babies in Lune's belly, if Collin was to be completely honest, was the least of his worries at the moment. What he really wanted to know was how the kiddos got there in the first place. It was then that unfamiliar memories came flooding back to him: he remembered comforting Lune after his nasty breakup with that asshole-who-shall-not-be-named, growing a closer friendship with his roommate, being there when his friend was told he was up the duff, comforting Lune through all the morning sickness and mood swings...

These memories came to him in an instant, and as foreign as they were, they felt real all the same. Should he believe these new memories? or should he get to the bottom of all of this?
1453322222221212.title: Pregnant Expansion - When did Lune get so... la...

"Are you with me, mon ami? You didn't eat any of those brownies the neighbors have been offering you, did you?" Lune's voice called out, but Collin isn't really listening at the moment.
145332222222122.title: Tails - No Reality change for Lune

choices: Take care of the situation himself
1453322222221221.content:
Fast it is the coin whispered into Collin's ear, but he didn't have time to process what that meant when Lune cried out, this time in pain. Collin was shaken out of his stupor, the weird coin disappearing into his pocket once more as he hurried over to his roommate.

Lune had doubled over, arms wrapped protectively around his doughy midsection, crystal blue eyes closed tight as he attempted to combat the sharp white pain in his stomach. He felt a hand on his arm and attempted to stand up straight to ensure his worried roomie that he was okay even though he wasn't.

"Are you all right?" Collin finally spoke up, echoing Lune's own question from before. The pain subsided, and Lune ran a shaking hand through his hair. "O-oui, mon ami, je vais bien," the blonde managed out just before he passed out. Collin was lucky to catch the poor man in time, and that was when panic really began to set in. He couldn't lose the closest thing he had to a friend! What should he do, what should he do?!
1453322222221221.title: Fast Pregnancy - Lune will experience some stra...

1453322222221222.content:
Collin heard his roommate begin to speak again, but it turned into a sharp gasp that was enough to knock Collin out of his odd trancelike state. The mysterious coin was slipped back into his pocket as he jumped up from his chair and rushed over to the only person he could call a friend.

Lune had dropped a bag of groceries, its contents spilling out all over the floor, but Collin ignored this completely as he trampled over everything to get to his roomie's side. It was plain to see that the French man was in pain, his petite hands clutching his stomach through his oversized sweater.

"Are you all right?" Collin questioned, echoing the other's question from earlier, hand drifting to rest on the small of the taller man's back where he had begun rubbing gentle circles, something his Mummy always did when his stomach was aching.

"Je vais bien," Lune panted in response, and thankfully, Collin had taken enough basic French courses online to understand. It was plain to see, though, that Lune was far from fine and instead looked to be in a great deal of pain.

"Go to the couch," Collin instructed, his posh accent flaring as he grew more nervous, "and I'll find you something that might help." Lune didn't object and walked the short distance to said couch, collapsing on it as Collin rummaged the medicine cabinet for something that might help. Lune gave a louder yelp, and Collin gave up on the medicine idea. "If-if you're in that much pain, maybe we better take you to the hospital."

A moment of silence, and then, "I... I think I am okay."

True to this statement, Lune was no longer making sounds of pain or discomfort. Collin closed the medicine cabinet, puzzled beyond belief. "I... think I have a bigger problem, though..." Lune spoke again, sounding himself quite confused and panicked as well.

Feeling a sense of dread wash over him, Collin slowly walked back into the living room and circled around the couch. Lune sat up carefully with his slender arms wrapped around his midsection. That was where Collin's eyes were immediately drawn, and the sight that awaited him was the strangest he had ever seen.

Lune was already a somewhat pudgy man, but his belly was hugely swollen, filling up the entirety of his lap. His sweater had risen up, exposed skin proving that this was not some sort of peculiar prank. Lune ran his fingers across his globe-like middle, laughing more out of shock than anything else.

"I think I might be enceinte," Lune murmured, and it didn't take much time for Collin to realize what that word meant. The blonde laughed once again with his blue eyes flicking between Collin's blank face and his own pregnant dome. "I never paid much attention in sex ed, but I really do not think this is how babies are made." This little joke sent the shocked and now heavily pregnant man into a fit of hysterical laughter, and Collin...
1453322222221222.title: Pregnant Expansion - Lune's belly's loo...

14533222222212221.content:
...began to panic.

"How did this happen?" Collin snapped aloud to no one in particular as he paced back and forth in front of the couch. "This sort of thing... this sort of thing doesn't just happen!" He continued murmuring curses and possible explanations to himself, and Lune watched anxiously as Collin grew more and more unstable. After a moment, Collin suddenly snapped his fingers and grinned, surprising the knocked up man on the couch.

"I got it," he beamed with a grand gusto; Lune eyed him carefully, desperate for some explanation...

"I must be dreaming!"

Lune groaned at this and hid his face in his hands. If only it were that simple! Though he was still very much shaken and almost nearly lacking a sense of reality, he still had enough sense to know that this was indeed real, as odd as it was. As Collin went about trying to get himself to wake up from a nonexistent dream, Lune carefully stood up, wobbling as he adjusted to having such a large weight in his middle. He walked (well, it was more of a waddle, really) the short distance to Collin and placed a shaking albeit soothing hand upon the shorter man's shoulder.

"I really do not think this is a dream, mon ami," he spoke gently, and Collin attempted to consider this possibility, eyes flicking down once more to gaze at the other's bulging belly.

"Suppose," he swallowed nervously, "Suppose that this is real. How do you know for sure that you're... you're, um...?"

Without hesitation, Lune grabbed Collin's warm hand and placed it upon his stomach. Immediately, they both felt a sharp kick causing Lune to whimper in discomfort and Collin's breath to hitch in his throat. There really was no denying it, then: it couldn't get much more real than that. Collin knew he should be mortified at the idea of his roommate genuinely being heavily pregnant, but, if he were to be honest, he was very much intrigued by the idea. He brought his other hand to Lune's large abdomen and was greeted by two more swift jabs. Lune frowned and blushed deeply but didn't otherwise complain.

"I suppose he knows who his papa is, non?"

Collin's head snapped up to meet Lune's suggestive gaze. "I-I'm not...!"

The French man laughed in return. "I know. I am only teasing you." Collin wondered how someone could be so calm in a situation like this, but then he noticed the glazed panic in his roommate's eyes: Lune was only trying to stay calm for Collin's sake. Now calm, intrigued, and confused, Collin moved his hands away and began pacing again, this time in a more thinking manner rather than panicky. Lune took this opportunity to sit back down on the couch as his ankles were already starting to ache from the pain of supporting the weight of another human being.

"Do you have any idea what could have caused this? I mean, obviously we aren't dealing with the natural laws of nature as men can't even get pregnant, let alone so quickly," Collin rambled thoughtfully, "so maybe we're dealing with supernatural forces?"

"Super... natural?" Lune echoed in confusion whilst simultaneously wincing from a new onset of kicks and jabs from his surprisingly energetic child, "as in ghosts and goblins?"

"Well, there's more to it than that," Collin replied. He began to think harder. Was this a result of some sort of potion? or a spell? He was well-versed in the ways of ancient magic, even though he didn't really believe in any of the nonsense. Now, he wasn't so sure what to believe anymore. "Was there anything you did today that was abnormal in any way? Anything you ate or drank, perhaps? Anything you did that seemed odd in any way?"

"You were the one acting étrange today. When I walked in, you were being so silencieux and would not stop staring à moi," Lune pointed an accusing finger at Collin, and it was then that everything became clear. The brunette knew now that this all had something to do with the coin sitting idly in his pocket.

He was prepared to spill the beans on the strange object, but he stopped himself. If he told Lune about the coin, Lune would surely blame him for knocking him up, and Collin would get in all kinds of trouble. Did he really want his roommate to resent him for this? What should he do?
14533222222212221.title: Began to panic

15.content: Sister Mary Ruth knelt on the floor of her small cell, hands folded and head bowed in prayer. The bed was neatly made, if somewhat uncomfortable. The long black folds of her robe did little to cushion her tender knees against the hard wooden floor. Head bowed and hands folded, she offered up her voice to the Almighty. She finished her daily conversation with god and crossed herself, and put her hands to the bed to push herself up to a standing position. As she did so, a metallic glint caught her eyes. Creaking old knees protested as she moved to inspect the source. A coin, a gold coin with a young couple embossed on its surface smiled up at her. Wondering at the curiosity, she picked it up and headed out to....

151.content: Sister Mary Ruth goes to talk with Father Daglio to talk with him about what she has found. As she headed to the rectory she started noticing that she was getting nauseous. 152.content:
"What nonsense is this?"
The nun held the coin in her hand, looking down onto its design. There was a man and woman imprinted on the coin, both bearing grins. Further perplexing were that both figures were holding rather distended middles where there stomachs were.
Mary squinted her eyes. She turned over the coin to see something similar. The man and woman were both still with more than bloated stomachs; both appeared worried and nervous.
"I don't remember getting some..., fetishy trinket like this." said Mary. She was the oldest nun through was about in her early 60's. Her body was tall and looked with her age, her hair having mostly faded into whiteness, yet overall, she looked composed and mature. Her face had little to no wrinkles.
"I'll have to inquire to the others about this..." Mary pocketed the coin, " ...Honestly, what kind of currency has this?" Mary put aside these thoughts as she left her room and headed to Sunday sermon.

The halls bellowed with sounds of the nuns singing. Humming of the sermon countiued on, going on with a somber melody. A row of three nuns opposote to each other were holding the Holy Bible. Then, in tune, the song stopped. Each of the nuns clised their books. Slowly, the nuns began to leave.

"Sister Mary Ruth!" Mary turned around to see another sister approaching. "Why, hello Sister Ann." said Mary. The pair was walking through the convent. In the middle of it was a large patch of grass with a foundtain, being the courtyard.
"Right now I'm headed to the library. You know studying up everything abourt our Lord Jesus." You should try too Mary.." Mary interrupted " Actually Sister, Sister Ann.". "Gotcha, Sorry Sister Mary Ruth." Mary responded, " As for your offer, I'd have to say no for now. My responsibility for the abby now is a role
. A role that should be fulfilled as much as possiable." Sister Ann sighed, "I guess making candles does make us alot of money. " The two parted ways after awhile as the two walked to where Mary was going. It was just a simple, wooden door. Mary went inside; It was an even simpler work space, with a table and candles stacked on the side. Mary cracked her fingers, "Alright, its time for some work..."

Mary was rubbing her back, on top of her bed. Across from her was her mirror, where she looking at. It was night, and while she was preoccupied, she remembered something key. " Ahh, I forgot the coin." Mary took out the piece, " What a werid little...". Mary Ruth blanked out a minute. She felt numb and just all around tired. Then, in curosity, she flipped the coin upward. The fragment landed on her hand and read...

1521.title: Heads (Reality Change)

choices: Fast pregnancy ( Pregnancy happens over 9 days)
15211.content: The nun's eyes briefly looked at the mirror before a unexpected change occurs...
15211.title: Herself in the mirror

152112.content:
Starring into the mirror, Mary Ruth suddenly bent forward. "Ahhhhh" the nun blurted out. A new feeling was overtaking her. It wasn't painful, per say, but rather a feeling of lightness.
That did not stop fear that Sister Mary Ruth had come to see.
What's happening.... to me..?
Then, the realization became clearer to the Mary. The nun felt the need to lay back on her bed. When she did, she felt a heavy gravity on top of her, like a prescience near her stomach. The nun moved her hand onto it only to find it much farther from her than it should. Only then she saw that her belly was growing.
"Oh my God, Oh my God, OH MY GOD"
Mary's belly was only growing more rapidly. Her silky, black garb she wore as a nun grew more tight, and more so.


When it finally stopped, Mary attempted to get up. She stumbled off her bed, grabbing a hold of the bed post. Hoisting herself up she waddled to the mirror. The woman looked into the mirror. Her figure now had a large belly. Mary Ruth tried to strech out her hand around the big lump, but could barely touch her belly button. She did feel that her button was now protruding outward. Closing her eyes, she lifted her dress upward.
The orb attached to her had become wrinkle-free, though heavy on the nun. The nun then plastered her hands on her nude belly. A different feeling has overcome her. Her orb of a stomach felt warm to the touch.
"I couldn't be.. no, a miracle such as this has only happened to fertile woman who have... who have..."
Sister Mary Ruth stood pondering and shaking
152112.title: Pregnant expansion (Mary's belly expands)

1521122.content:
Sister Mary Ruth released her robe, letting it go to cover the big bump of her stomach. Mary Ruth once again observed her body.
I just need to sit down
The sister moved her feet towards her bed, waddling at a slow pace. Sitting down, the thoughts inevitably began flooding into her mind.
This has to be some kind of dream.
Mary Ruth's old hands glided over her stretched robe, feeling the mass below. There was a slight bump that Mary felt however, a little, immeasurable kick. A kick felt for a fraction of a second, only for the movement to sporadically stop and then start on its own.
The nun was trying to calm her belly.
"I wonder if this is how the Virgin Mary felt." whispered Mary Ruth.
The restlessness in her tummy reminded Sister Mary Ruth on a memory. The memory, in particular, was when she was a little girl many years ago, in Catholic school. She remembered going to class, studying the Bible she held dear. The many stories within the book most fascinated her.
In a lesson one day, young Mary once read about the birth of Jesus. The Immaculate Conception or the story of the Virgin Mary stuck out to her. In it, a woman named Mary was once visited by an angel of God, Gabriel, who told her of becoming pregnant with the son of God without having, well, "intimate relations" with a lover, therefore convincing while a virgin.

But Mary Ruth shook her head. No angel came to her to bless her with a child, nor did she recall the Virgin Mary ballooning up with child as soon as she knew of it (and looking a few months overdue as well.).
Then Mary Ruth's attention turned to the coin she left. Her eyes honed in on the object, lying on a dresser next to the mirror.
"This little thing..., there has to be a way to reverse..."
Mary Ruth was just in reach of the coin when something hit her. It was the kicking, but there was something different about it. It felt much more aggressive. The nun grunted. She squatted to the ground before catching herself. Her belly had become more active.
"Thisss, is nnot a dream."
Mary Ruth realized, she was having contractions. A fear swept her mind, here was a older woman, all alone to suddenly become swollen with apparently a baby and could possibly be having it in the same night.
1521122.title: Stay in room

15211221.content:
Mary Ruth got up and sped to the bed. She was grunting, disturbed by the contractions. The old woman tried heaving her body onto the bed. She plopped onto the furniture, and sprawling across. Her head on a pillow and on her back, the bed creaked underneath her, the weight of the baby bump pressuring it. Layering on her bed, the nun looked especially big, her large pregnant belly distending above.
Let me try and wait this out thought the nun

Then the worst happened.
Mary Ruth's water broke, spilling out on the bed. The nun was initially surprised.
"N...n.no" stuttered Mary Ruth
" I'm..m going to have ... a baby."
"A..AAhhhh" shouted the nun.
Another contraction hit her. The nun pulled back her black gown, exposed her skin and started skimming over the taunt steretch. The action was somewhat calming to the storm of action her bump was making, yet it still kicked on.
Mary Ruth's forehead was sweating, coming down in drops. The nun was breathing in and out, her big belly moving in time with it. She was trying to hold her belly which was dropping. She pressed her head against the pillow and screamed "AAAhhhhhhh...".
Sister Mary Ruth bent forward, pushing with all her might. Falling back, the nun kept in tune, trying to relieve in this pain.

Hours later....
The night hours were silent. A quiet ambiance developed, no stirrings or noise. The moon had emerged, brightening the dark sky.
Inside Mary Ruth's room, the nun laid on her bed. Tired, the woman was still in bed; her stomach had resided. In her arms was what was in her stomach, a child. The baby was human, alive with vigor, crying.
Mary Ruth looked toward her window and smilied.
"Perhaps the Lord does work in mysterious ways."
15211221.title: Lay down in bed

info.brief_description: A pregnancy causing coin in the hands of everyday people. New Chapters! 80,000 Views!
info.description:
What if legend spoke of a coin? A coin forged by the devious hand of a being with a twisted sense of humor. A coin, that when flipped, caused a pregnancy in whomever was unlucky enough to be looked at by the person flipping the coin? What if this coin, this bizarre practical joke by some twisted mind, was lost among time, after leaving a wake of expanded bellies in it's path?

And what if this coin was accidentally found? And what if it landed in the hands of an everyday person?

Heads or Tails?

OCTOBER 2020 UPDATE:

Yeah, it's been a while hasn't it? Welcome to Versions 2.0 of Heads or Tails!

So what's new?

I've cut-down on some of the plots that were dead-ends or went nowhere. I've reduced some of the characters, updated the thanks, and....

Added a new Holiday path!

This is something that I've always wanted to do since the inception of 1.0, but didn't have the time or desire. With everything going on right now, this seemed like the time to do something about it.

So what happens now?

I've added a branch that allows you access to new characters, new locations based around holidays! So far we've got Halloween, Christmas, Valentine's Day and USA 4th of July. There will be plenty of time to add more holidays as this work of fiction matures.

OVER 80,000 VIEWS! WOW! THANKS EVERYONE! Over 720 Chapters! I don't know what to say other than thank you!

Huge props to NotABot for the continued work on Jack Jr's storyline, as well as Nicole's storyline. Keep up the great work!

Also huge thanks go to Blast Hardcheese for his work on the "Jade" storyline.

Also, a huge Thank You goes out to kamenrider for his work throughout the story! Keep up the great work!

I would like to officially name "a" as the offical co-author of this story for his work on the Samantha storyline.

Also, I'm going to add "Ghan" as an official co-author of this story for his work on Erica's storyline, with thanks to "a" on Erica's story as well.

Our contributors. Seriously, thank you everyone. Keep up the writing!

If I'm forgetting someone please, please please let me know.

Keep up the great work everyone!

New Character Options Added! Four new character await you on "More Characters". So get adding!

GET ADDING CHAPTERS. I KNOW PEOPLE ARE LOOKING AT THIS STORY, SO GET ADDING!
GP per good add! PUT SOME EFFORT INTO IT! GOOD WORK IS REWARDED, BAD WORK WILL BE DELETED OR EDITED!

It's come to my attention that there may be people out there with great ideas for the story, who may not want to write chapters. So, send me your ideas and I'll do my best to translate them into chapters for you!

GP given for reviews and decent added chapters! Feel free to add!

The Rules:

Welcome to my interactive story! Let's put do some ground rules:

I. Pregnancy/MPREG.
II. No Characters Under The Age Of 18.
III. Keep It PG-13. You can get a little crazy with this, but come on, use some common sense.
IV: Always keep two story paths open. Can't think of another option? Just write "Something Else"
V: No one-line adds. Add at least a paragraph, even if it isn't a great paragraph.
VI: Any chapter can be edited by story creator if fails to meet any of the story guidelines, (I will contact you first)
VII: Don't worry about spelling and grammar. We all make mistakes, just try your best!
VIII: Multiple POV's allowed AND ENCOURAGED. Let's see other people's thought on the goings-on from their frame of mind.
IX: The ability to rewrite reality affects the person affected, and the people around them, not the coin holder.
X: Pregnancies are caused by flipping a coin (on purpose or inadvertently) and looking at a person (male or female) when the coin lands.
NOTE: If a character catches sight of themselves in a mirror or reflection and flip the coin, they WILL become pregnant.

Rules Of The Coin:

The coin works two ways: (Your choice)
It can either create a brand-new FAST PREGNANCY:
- A FAST PREGNANCY lasts 9 days, each day being a month of pregnancy. (Be sure to include symptoms! Morning sickness, cravings, weight gain)
OR
It can expand a person to a certain month of pregnancy, bypassing the other months and getting right to a specific month of pregnancy, and having the pregnancy continue on as normal.

Additionally, and the reason why it's called HEADS or TAILS;
HEADS; (as depicted on the coin a pregnant man and woman with a smile on their face) REWRITES reality, so that the person affected by the pregnancy either accepts the pregnancy, always thinks they were pregnant, etc.
TAILS: (as depicted on the coin a pregnant man and woman with a panic look on their face) does NOT REWRITE reality, meaning that the person affected by the pregnancy, will truly be surprised, and probably a little panicked.

Oh yeah, did I mention the fact that I'm giving out a lot of GP for new chapters! Get writing!


So, pull a chair, have a seat, and get reading (and adding)!
